Author: "Graves, Andrea"
Title: "Sir Graham Liggins"
description: "Pays tribute to the world-renowned NZ scientist and doctor."

Author: "Barnett, Sarah"
Title: "Between a rock and a green place"
description: "Considers that, with substantial financial gains to be made through tackling environmental issues, NZ could benefit immensely from cleaning up its act. Talks to Phillip Mills, founding member of the 100% Plan, a group of NZ business leaders pushing a message that NZ can be rich and clean - and that these two factors are not only mutually exclusive, but could also be inextricably linked. Looks at countries such as Denmark as potential role models."

Author: "Marshall, Owen,"
Title: "Dear Dad ..."
description: "Includes writings by a number of high-profile NZers, in story or letter-form, to their fathers, as Father's Day 2010 approaches."

Author: "McIntosh, Clare"
Title: "Maori myths under a spell"
description: "Reviews the collection of 13 short stories."

Author: "Burgess, Malcolm"
Title: "Water under the brush"
description: "Reviews the latest exhibition at the New Dowse entitled 'Liquid dreams: a contemporary take on watercolour', featuring works by 6 up-and-coming NZ practitioners, and with the goal of reclaiming watermedia from the 'sentimentality of colonial landscapes, classrooms and hobbyism'."

Author: "Edmond, Frances"
Title: "That sinking feeling"
description: "Reviews a performance of Samuel Beckett's 'Happy days', at Auckland's Silo Theatre, featuring Robyn Malcolm in the role of Winnie."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "On your own head"
description: "Stresses the importance of wearing a protective helmet on the ski field."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "One person's poison"
description: "Discusses the difference between food intolerance and food allergy, in answer to a reader's question on the subject."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "The brain gain"
description: "Reports on a discovery made in 2003 by NZ scientists, that the human brain tries to repair itself."

Author: "Hartevelt, John"
Title: "Eyes on the cup"
description: "Counting down to the World Cup and the author notes the organisers are confident but has 'uncovered evidence the country has signed up to little more than a very expensive party'. Takes a look at the figures about how much NZ is going to make hosting the Rugby World Cup. Mentions an early report that suggests NZ will earn $507 million over the 45 days of the rugby tournament. Looks at a PhD written by Sam Richardson, an economics lecturer at Massey University, which finds that big sports events consistently fail to generate much, if any, of the promised economic rewards. Comments the lion's share of the profit generated from broadcasting rights, merchandising and advertising will go to the IRB (International Rugby Board) with NZ's profit coming from the ticket sales. Examines the risk factors in holding the World Rugby Cup such as crime, over consumption of alcohol and its consequences, failure of transportation during events and the money put into sports stadiums."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Bowing to the inevitable"
description: "Meets the South African cellist who is now the William Evans executant lecturer in cello at the University of Otago. Describes her upbringing in a musical family and the significance of the cello she plays. Provides details of her inaugural recital, Marama Hall, Dunedin, 11 Sep 2010 and a concert on 12 Oct 2010 as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Contemporary traditions : Dunedin and Otaru celebrate 30 years', various artists, Otago Museum, Dunedin. Reviews 'Coast and beyond' by Angela Burns, Gallery on Blueskin, Dunedin. Reviews 'The real, the unreal, and the surreal' by Sherryl McCammon, Ro Bradshaw and Anna Majboroda, The Artist's Room, Dunedin."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "True Kiwi paddler on a crest"
description: "Reports that the former Wanaka resident and triathlete, now living in London, has taken up the new sport of stand-up paddleboarding (SUP). Discusses her entry into the sport, and informs that she finished second in two events at a world cup event in Hamburg, Germany, Aug 2010."

Author: "Blundell, Kay"
Title: "Coast is clear for changing the guard"
description: "Looks at the mayoral and local council candidates for the Kapiti Coast and the Horowhenua district in the coming local body elections. Examines the key issues for these areas, water and location of road building for the Kapiti Coast and tourism, sewerage upgrade, community centres for Horowhenua. Summarises the views of candidates and why they want to be elected and their main focus for the region."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Out to map Te Papa's future; The man who wants to unlock our national memories"
description: "Looks at the first non-NZer, Mike Houlihan, who will head Te Papa, NZs national museum and who has initially stated he is not 'coming here with a vision, because the vision is already here'. Reports the chairman of Te Papa, John Judge, wants a 'review of what the museum does well and where it must improve'. Notes this must be done in an environment in which the permanent exhibitions are twelve years old, government funding is static and the national museum's reputation for innovation must be maintained. Examines the issue of an 'outsider' managing a national museum and the experience he has in this field by leading the national museums of Wales and Northern Ireland."

Author: "Scott, Tom,"
Title: "Do you know this man"
description: "Backgrounds the present prime ministers origins and chronicles his career working the trading desk at Merrill Lynch's London office and then on to Singapore to take charge of the global operation. Includes comments from Paul Martin who worked with John Key at Merrill Lynch and describes how John Key was head hunted by senior members of the National Party. Notes there is no subterfuge with John Key, what you see is what you get and he chairs Cabinet with polite and brisk efficiency and expects ministers to run their own portfolio. Speculates on John Key's future, with his popularity still running high, what will he do next."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "'He's the best con artist NZ has ever seen'; The man who fooled everyone"
description: "Profiles the Greek-Australian gambler and businessman who swindled millions of dollars from NZers, including former All Black Jonah Lomu and former Christchurch Casino CEO Stephen Lyttelton, through his fraudulent dealings in the SkyCity and Christchurch casinos. Focuses on the scam to engineer a fake takeover bid of SkyCity Casino, leading to charges being laid with the Serious Fraud Office (SFO). Discusses his extradition to Australia in Apr 2008, where he is yet to stand trial."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Te Aro"
description: "Details what has happened or is happening to the villas that were relocated to allow the construction of Wellington's inner-city bypass and how this physical changed has affected the social fabric of the Te Aro community. Notes there certainly has been a change in the community with the houses being removed 'But Te Aro's identity has been irrevocably changed, as more upmarket housing has pushed out cheap-living bohemian types ... There's still a community here and we feel a part of that'. Looks at some the newcomers to the area and describes the nature of their business and why they bought into the area. Reflects on the benefits that were touted in favour of constructing the city by-pass."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "One bloody expensive car smash"
description: "Chronicles a two-vehicle automobile crash on 14 Nov 1998 that seriously injured the man and the woman who was then his wife. Focuses on the ongoing financial, emotional and physical toll of the crash on the pair. Tallies the cost to society for the imprisonment of the man who stole a car and injured the pair, as well as the costs of treating the four passengers in the stolen car."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Student loan becomes $250,000 nightmare"
description: "Reports on how the burden of unpaid student loans are deterring some people from coming back to NZ. Talks to a man who took out a $7000 loan 20 years ago, which he estimates has risen to about $250,000 today. Includes advice to borrowers from the Inland Revenue Department."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Auckland cop's effort saves Afghan toddler"
description: "Talks to the NZ Police senior sergeant about his experiences in Afghanistan. Focuses on his successful efforts to arrange life-saving cleft palate surgery for an three-year-old Afghan boy named Tamim. Discusses the difficult circumstances the family faced, including the death of Tamim's father from cancer a month after the boy's operation. Touches on the efforts of the policeman to ensure that the village of Soughdar had clean water."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Dame Cath Tizard"
description: "Interviews the former Governor-General and her daughter, a former Crown minister in the Fifth Labour Government. Touches on her love life, the 'vicious' comments made by US travel writer Paul Theroux, and rumours that both she and her daughter had an affair with former prime minister Helen Clark. Mentions her soon-to-be-published memoir, 'Cat among the pigeons'."

Author: "McCrystal, John"
Title: "Strait shooter"
description: "Looks at what will happen when 22-year-old Emma Aitken who has been in training to swim the Cook Strait gets the phone call to say 'Today's the day'. Describes the best time to attempt the crossing as during neap tide that only occurs seven or eight times during a season. Mentions the team that accompany the swimmer along with Philip Rush who has his own credential as a long distance swimmer. Emma Aitken voices her opinion as to why she wants to swim the Cook Straight and says she is more frightened of kelp than the possibility of encountering sharks. Outlines how she organises her life, fitting in study for year four of a double degree in economics and chemistry, working Sunday mornings as a swim coach, part-time work, fundraising and training. Notes the training programme will increase in intensity leading up to the time of a possible attempt."

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "A good, keen literary man"
description: "Meets the man behind the Going West Books & Writers Festival, Tirirangi War Memorial Hall, 10-12 Sep 2010. Recalls some of the people he has met and friends he has made during his long career as a bookseller. Informs that the 2010 event is his 15th (and likely his last) festival."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Diversity of pleasures and puzzles"
description: "Reviews works by Walters Prize 2010 finalists Dan Arps, Fiona Connor, Saskia Leek and Alex Monteith, Auckland Art Gallery, until 31 Oct 2010."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "History lessons of love"
description: "Talks to the actor, director and writer about his project 'Songs for Guy', Aotea Centre, Auckland, 7-11 Sep 2010. Discusses the original production, which combines classic stage, screen and pop culture anthems that have been slightly reworded to make them more relevant to gay men. Touches on his previous award-winning production 'Apollo 13 : mission control'."

Author: "Barnett, Shaun"
Title: "Adventure Island"
description: "Recalls a visit to Mana Island with his two young children, Tom and Lee on a tree planting trip organised by the Dept. of Conservation. Gives the island's origin from the MaÃÑori perspective as well as that given in Bob Maysmor's book 'Mana Island'. Describes attempts to encourage gannets to nest without success but notes the existence of other native birds, takahe, shore plovers, on this scientific reserve."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "The man who tried to fix it"
description: "Profiles the New York City-born man whose efforts and reputation as NZ's best corporate fixer was not enough to save the finance company from receivership. Overviews his career in NZ and overseas."

Title: "Ex-lover likens Smail to adulterous Woods"
description: "Ex-lover likens Smail to adulterous Woods"

Title: "Aussies insist NZ nurse pass English-skills test"
description: "Aussies insist NZ nurse pass English-skills test"

Author: "Young, Audrey"
Title: "Sir Edmund cites 'public interest'"
description: "Sir Edmund cites 'public interest'"

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "One step at a time ends in a miracle"
description: "One step at a time ends in a miracle"

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "Daredevils set to defy laws of gravity"
description: "Daredevils set to defy laws of gravity"

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "Urban adventure sure to bring out the most amazing racers"
description: "Urban adventure sure to bring out the most amazing racers"

Author: "Thompson, Eric"
Title: "Drivers hop into carts to benefit injured van der Drift"
description: "Drivers hop into carts to benefit injured van der Drift"

Author: "Leggat, David"
Title: "Overlooked 'Olympic' team recognised after 30 years"
description: "Overlooked 'Olympic' team recognised after 30 years"

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "Friendship fused in fashion savvy"
description: "Friendship fused in fashion savvy"

Author: "McCarthy, Angela"
Title: "Sympathy needed to create a lasting legacy"
description: "Sympathy needed to create a lasting legacy"

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Museum's hidden treasures"
description: "Examines the issue of accessibility and the display of Te Papa's collections which have over 1.8 million objects. Reports Te Papa staff take about 200 groups on back-of-house tours through the collection stores each year and are in the process to make more of the collections available to the public at any one time through the internet. Recounts although there has been planning of exhibitions there needs to be a master plan which looks at 'What do we want this museum to be?', 'What is a sequence in which we need to develop these exhibitions?' Comments on the criticism of Te Papa's display of its art collection and looks at how the 'wet collection' is managed. Explores the issues associated with storage and conservation of the collections and increasing accessioning of objects into the collections and touches on the process of 'deaccessioning'."

Author: "Scott, Tom,"
Title: "Do you know this man"
description: "Backgrounds the present prime ministers origins and chronicles his career working the trading desk at Merrill Lynch's London office and then on to Singapore to take charge of the global operation. Includes comments from Paul Martin who worked with John Key at Merrill Lynch and describes how John Key was head hunted by senior members of the National Party. Notes there is no subterfuge with John Key, what you see is what you get and he chairs Cabinet with polite and brisk efficiency and expects ministers to run their own portfolio. Speculates on John Key's future, with his popularity still running high, what will he do next."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Spy game"
description: "Looks at private investigators in Christchurch and the sort of work they are involved. Reports they are mainly cases of suspected infidelity. Describes the way the private investigators go about their work and the way they reveal their findings to their clients."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Author (detailed): "Ruth Laugesen, Rebecca MacFie and Joanne Black"
Title: "10 things you need to know about New Zealand's 'grumpy' economy"
description: "Discusses the state of the NZ economy two years after the global financial system went into crisis. Asks ten questions that look at the prospects of the NZ economy, changing consumer spending patterns, companies that are doing well and sectors that are suffering, unemployment levels and areas of job growth, some emerging foreign economies, the possibility of the Chinese economic bubble bursting, the level of government debt and spending, NZ's foreign debt levels, and the housing market."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "The worst of years"
description: "Looks at the global financial collapse through the eyes of Reserve Bank governor, Alan Bollard, as detailed in his new book. Talks about some of the lessons he has learnt from post-collapse discussions and developments."

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "Go with the flow"
description: "Talks to the Craig Potton, renowned wilderness landscape photographer, conservationist, and the presenter of the new five-part documentary series 'Rivers', about the series and the growing concern for the future of NZ's rivers."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Callous circumstances of suicide still hurtful"
description: "Examines the circumstances of the suicide of a Christchurch young man, Ben Dowdell. Indicates many of his friends knew of his intention to kill himself but they either did not take it seriously or did nothing about it. Talks about how his closest friends helped him organise the equipment in order to kill himself and then left him alone. Includes comments from his mother and father as well as the Police."

Author: "Hartevelt, John"
Title: "Half a billion bucks : or a hospital pass"
description: "Counting down to the World Cup and the author notes the organisers are confident but has 'uncovered evidence the country has signed up to little more than a very expensive party'. Takes a look at the figures about how much NZ is going to make hosting the Rugby World Cup. Mentions an early report that suggests NZ will earn $507 million over the 45 days of the rugby tournament. Looks at a PhD written by Sam Richardson, an economics lecturer at Massey University, which finds that big sports events consistently fail to generate much, if any, of the promised economic rewards. Comments the lion's share of the profit generated from broadcasting rights, merchandising and advertising will go to the IRB (International Rugby Board) with NZ's profit coming from the ticket sales. Examines the risk factors in holding the World Rugby Cup such as crime, over consumption of alcohol and its consequences, failure of transportation during events and the money put into sports stadiums."

Author: "Clark, Walter C."
Title: "Ruining our sweet waters"
description: "Looks at the development of the natural environment in NZ and how dairy effluent is polluting the waterways."

Author: "O'Sullivan, Vincent"
Title: "Katherine and the flying wheel"
description: "Reviews the new biography of Katherine Mansfield and her husband John Middleton Murry."

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "Juggling act"
description: "Reviews the recent publication of poetry by Murray Edmonds."

Author: "Sandys, Elspeth"
Title: "A dab of colour"
description: "Reviews a performance of Pulitzer Prize winner Donald Margulies's 'Shipwrecked!', directed by Peter Hambleton at Circa Two in Wellington."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "The P-addict next door; P is for addiction"
description: "Talks to Pete, a Christchurch man, and an  ex-P user and how it has affected his and his family's life. Indicates he had a family, a regular job while being a P user but as his behaviour changed so much his wife and sons had to leave him. Describes his life long relationship with drugs and goes into the reasons he started using drugs."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Like a bolt from the blue"
description: "Examines the causes of the global financial crisis and why regulators like Reserve Bank governor Alan Bollard did not see it coming. Chronicles the events leading up to the financial crisis. Notes the repeal of the US's Glass-Steagall Act in 1999 which dissolved the division between high street banks and merchant/investment banks followed by the Commodity Futures Modernisation Act in 2000 which removed all controls on futures and other trading derivatives. Notes this created an investment environment where 'greed is good' and comments the economic establishment had not realised private trading had built up an interlocking web of bets that since proved to have totalled a thousand trillion dollars (quadrillion). Warns as fast as one game gets closed down another (emission trading credits) starts up."

Author: "Alvarado, Leonel"
Title: "Advantages of moving the TV to the bedroom; Disadvantages of moving the TV to the bedroom"
description: "Advantages of moving the TV to the bedroom; Disadvantages of moving the TV to the bedroom"

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Not so dozy"
description: "Looks at how taking power naps can have many benefits. Uses the performance of Opposition leader Tony Abbott during the recent Australian elections to illustrate the idea."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Vegging out"
description: "Talks about buying seasonal produce to reduce supermarket vegetable spending. Touches on why NZers still don't consume the recommended intake of fruits and vegetables."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Life with the other half"
description: "Talks to five NZers about what it is like to work for the rich and famous."

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "Over the bridge and far away"
description: "Asks if life on the Shore is really as warmer, sunnier and better as it makes out to be. Talks to residents and different Aucklanders about their opinions of it as a place to live."

Author: "Russell, James"
Title: "Art of flying saucers"
description: "Discusses the frisbee-based sport of disc golf and how it is gaining popularity in some of NZ's best parks. Outlines what you need to get started and highlights the Auckland Disc Golf Champs."

Author: "Peka, June"
Title: "A new outlook"
description: "Tells the story of David Ellison, when in 1995 the 62 year old had a stroke. Notes this event changed his life dramatically as he decided to put his investments into a charitable trust for the benefit of people in need. Describes a some of the recipients of the trust both in NZ and overseas. Relates he also supports the Christchurch Cathedral Choir Society adding the trust is his main focus in life now and that it makes him very happy."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Granite hands and a heart of gold"
description: "Describes some of Jim Morris's life and how he has had a life long interest in reading and writing poetry. Notes all his book's profits have gone to the Cancer Society. Reveals how the creative process works when he is creating poetry and indicates he takes inspiration from the landscape in which he works, Ben Nevis Station up the Ahuriri River."

Author: "Campbell, John"
Title: "One of the city's last foundrymen"
description: "One of the city's last foundrymen"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Linwood champion was independent, principled"
description: "Linwood champion was independent, principled"

Author: "Bruce, David"
Title: "Mother left with 'black hole'"
description: "Talks to the woman whose son was murdered while working undercover for the police. Discusses the difficult time she has had over the past two years coping with the aftermath of the murder. Talks about some of the aspects of her son's career."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Industry facing difficult few years; Central recovering after early pain"
description: "Focuses on the financial difficulties being endured by the NZ wine industry as a result of the global economic crisis. Informs that overproduction of grapes and plummeting asset values will lead to further pain in the industry. Talks to Deloitte corporate finance partner Paul Munro about the results of a survey in conjunction with NZ Winegrowers. Seeks comment from NZ Winegrowers chairman Stuart Smith. Sums up key indicators in the industry, major NZ vineyard areas and major wine varieties being produced. Talks to Alistair King of WHK about the improvement in fortunes for the Central Otago wine industry."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Emeritus professor recalls last 100 years"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-born centenarian about his memories of the University of Otago, where he was the foundation head of the National School of Surveying. Recalls his time as a prisoner of war, which forms part of his autobiography."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Guilty of caring"
description: "Focuses on the 'Storybook Dads' programme at the Otago Corrections Facility, Milburn. Talks to programmes manager Dorothy Crofts and practice leader Charles Pearce about the role of the programme in connecting more than 160 prisoners with their children and improving prisoners' literacy skills. Seeks comment from tutors Stuart Porter, Jan Bain and an inmate who is participating in the programme."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Unchain their hearts; Unchaining the hearts"
description: "Talks about the views of Celia Lashlie on keeping men out of prison. Describes her opinion as outlined in 'The power of mothers: releasing our children'. Describes the number of people in NZ prisons and the reasons many of them are in there. Expresses Celia Lashlie's views on the NZ Government and CYF (NZ Child Youth & Family), Corrections Department, politicians and the bureaucrats and their role in the growing prison population. Celia Lashlie argues that women hold the solution to keeping their children from growing up and going to prison by helping women who are currently in prison."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "No more haze; 'Gift from God'"
description: "Focuses on the possible role of the crustacean Daphnia pulex in controlling algal blooms on the much-photographed lake near Queenstown. Talks to University of Otago zoologist Dr Marc Schallenberg about the crustacean, first identified in NZ in Dec 2008, which appears to be inhibiting the microscopic organism Ceratium hirundinella from causing the algal blooms. Seeks comment from Friends of Lake Hayes Society chairman Kerry Dunlop."

Author: "Riddell, Oliver"
Title: "Weighty tome, beautifully produced; Bookmarks"
description: "Weighty tome, beautifully produced; Bookmarks"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Pioneers of Maori sound; Unsung heroes; Waiata awards"
description: "Showcases the new 13-episode series on MaÃÑori Television, focusing on the achievements of generations of high-achieving but little-known MaÃÑori musicians. Talks to producer Phil Crown about his idea for the series, and some of the musicians and bands that are featured. Briefly profiles a few of the best unsung MaÃÑori musicians. Informs of the third annual Waiata Maori Awards, Hawke's Bay Opera House, Hastings, 10 Sep 2010."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Naked ambition"
description: "Talks to Thom Powers and Aaron Short of the Auckland-based band about their soon-to-be-released debut album. Discusses their chart-topping single 'Young Blood' and the metamorphosis of the band into a quintet."

Author: "Fox, Rebecca"
Title: "A perfect science : 'There are no lows'"
description: "Interviews the food sensory science lecturer at the University of Otago about his work."

Author: "Butterfield, Tania"
Title: "Sense of disbelief in wake of night-time devastation; Shaky sense of disbelief"
description: "Reports on her tour of the city in the aftermath of the destructive earthquake in Canterbury on 4 Sep 2010. Talks to local residents and family members about their experiences."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Prison farm lifting inmates' skills, confidence"
description: "Showcases the Otago Corrections Milton prison dairy farm, a commercial venture and training facility for prisoners before their release. Talks to Corrections Inmate Employment (CIE) southern farms manager Allan Gorton about the award-winning farm and its benefits to inmates."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Stroke does not mean end of good life; Limerick"
description: "Talks to the man who had a massive brainstem stroke two years ago. Describes the progress he has made in rehabilitating and some of the setbacks he has encountered. Includes a limerick he wrote. Describes four key symptoms of stroke, and informs that this week is national Stroke Awareness Week."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Rivers : a turn for the worse?"
description: "Talks to the well-known photographer and conservationist about his new television series on Prime that celebrates five of NZ's rivers."

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "Kiwis who survived 9/11"
description: "Listens to NZers Mikhaila Nola, Ricardo Simich, Rae Lamb and Lauren Quaintance tell their firsthand experiences of the 11 Sep 2001 New York World Trade Center terrorist attacks."

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "Porirua : a city in transition seeking a cleaner, brighter future"
description: "Provides details and statistics for Porirua. Discusses with outgoing mayor Jenny Brash how the city has changed in the 12 years since she took office. Looks at the mayoral and local council candidates for the coming local body elections. Examines the key issues for these areas: sewerage pipe replacement, increasing wastewater treatment capacity, revitalising the central business district, and rates increases. Mentions the views of Chamber of Commerce executive director Simon Calvert about the city's perception issues.  Summarises the views of the nine candidates, their reasons for standing and their main focus for the city."

Author: "Kay, Martin"
Title: "Last of the class warriors has his own take on cancer"
description: "Interviews the unionist and political strategist about his current experience dealing with cancer. Reflects on a violent childhood, heading the Unite union, working for the Alliance party, and splitting with Jim Anderton. Relays his acceptance of his uncompromising, 'hardball' reputation."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Big changes and big decisions on the horizon"
description: "Sets out Environment Minister Nick Smith's views on the need for the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), established in June this year, noting the recent approval of the Buller District Council for an 85-metre-high dam on the Mokihinui River. Discusses his vision for a stronger role for the EPA in regional councils performance, and a new role for the Environment Ministry. Presents also his views on environmental regulation of the Exclusive Economic Zone. Mentions other functions slated for the EPA."

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Talented piano teacher and performer"
description: "Talented piano teacher and performer"

Author: "Beaumont, Nathan"
Title: "Brace yourselves, Wellington; High time for Wellingtonians to brace themselves"
description: "Reminds that the capital city is considered overdue for a large earthquake, explaining the three fault lines that lie below it. Presents risk modelling estimates, and a possible scenario, for an earthquake of the magnitude that struck Christchurch. Describes the Wellington Earthquake National Initial Response Plan and illustrates the estimated time taken for recovery of services. Details damage caused by the 1942 earthquake centred over Masterton. Alludes to the general unpreparedness of city residents."

Author: "Calman, Matt"
Title: "Shake-up for older capital sites"
description: "Relates the earthquake-preparedness of Wellington heritage buildings, identifying those that need strengthening, and who is responsible for the work. Defines earthquake-prone buildings, reasons for their being below standard, and consequences for owners who do not fix problems. Lists and illustrates earthquake-resistant technology and construction methods designed in NZ."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Touch-up"
description: "Discusses the issues of photo retouching and excessively thin models in the fashion industry. Touches on the voluntary guidelines for the fashion and publishing industries in Australia, which are designed to promote healthy body images by disclosing when images have been retouched, using models aged 16 or older, and not using very thin models or male models that are too muscular. Talks to people in the NZ fashion industry and philosophy professor Denis Dutton about their views on the issues. Looks at the manipulation of news images overseas and the role of the NZ Press Council."

Author: "Coddington, Deborah"
Title: "The two Rons : MP to wannabe mayor"
description: "Talks to the 2010 Carterton mayoralty candidate about his time in Parliament, his campaign, and the possibility of Wairarapa becoming part of a Wellington super city."

Author: "Calman, Matt"
Title: "A grand lady bids farewell to the harbour"
description: "Reports on the Wellington Police Maritime Unit's replacement of the Lady Elizabeth III launch with the Lady Elizabeth IV. Describes the work of the unit, and details rescues, such as that of diver Rob Hewitt and Lara the labrador, and losses, such as that of two officers in 1986. Illustrates and describes the Lady Elizabeth, and Lady Elizabeth II and III."

Author: "Barratt, Joseph"
Title: "Over the top and indefensible"
description: "Reports on Stevan Eldred-Grigg's new book which challenges the existing perceptions of NZ's involvement in World War One. Touches on some reasons NZ went to war and the conduct of NZ soldiers after the occupation of German Samoa and in Egypt."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Ice pics"
description: "Talks to environmental scientist Grant Redvers about leading a scientific expedition in the Arctic on the yacht Tara, accompanied by French photographer Vincent Hilaire, whose work is now being exhibited under the title Polar Night, Museum of Wellington City and Sea, till 17 October."

Author: "Alderson, Andrew"
Title: "The podium beckons; A change of gear for former rower"
description: "Looks at the chances of the NZ cyclists at the 2010 Commonwealth Games in Delhi. Talks to Sam Bewley and former rower Jamie Nielsen about their preparations."

Author: "Lewis, Paul,"
Title: "Full speed ahead"
description: "Looks at World and Olympic shot put champion Valerie Adams' performance after changing coaches and the break-up of her marriage. Talks about trying to change her from a strength shot putter to more of a speed shot putter."

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "First choice stalls so what now?"
description: "First choice stalls so what now?"

Author: "Cone, Deborah Hill"
Title: "The end is nigh"
description: "Reviews the first episode of the new series of 'How the other half lives' hosted by Marc Ellis."

Author: "Madelin, Jacqui"
Title: "Blast from the past"
description: "Suggests some attractions to visit while in Invercargill for the annual week-long Burt Munro Challenge."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "The myth of Wellywood"
description: "Questions the sustainability of the film industry in Wellington, gauging the effect of moves to Auckland by TVNZ and such production houses as Flying Fish. Enumerates the capital's dwindling screen industry business, with observations by a local film crew about work scarcity, and comments by Wingnut Films' Sir PeterJackson on the global downturn in production. Notes that companies such as Gibson Group have diversified into overseas markets, with director Dave Gibson emphasising the necessity for entrepreneurship, competition, and worker flexibility. Seeks comments from film director Duncan Sarkies about the need for financial investment in the industry, and outlines contributions by Wellington City Council's Film Wellington and the Greater Wellington regional council."

Author: "Pellegrino, Nicky"
Title: "First edition"
description: "Talks to Alison Wong about her 2010 NZ Post Book Awards winning novel."

Author: "Calder, Peter"
Title: "The early sitting"
description: "Talks to former New Yorker Perrin Rowland about NZ's restaurant history as documented in her new book."

Author: "Coursey, Michelle"
Title: "Man made"
description: "Talks to Steve Joll about his new recipe book and the similarities between baking and DIY. Includes a recipe for beer bread."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Mixing and matching"
description: "Assesses the huge variety of mixers, processors and blenders on the  NZ market. Seeks advice from Julie Feaver of Total Food Equipment, Dunedin."

Author: "Reid, Holly"
Title: "New buzz about much-loved toy"
description: "Looks at the efforts of Auckland entertainment development company, Lion Rock, to launch the Buzzy Bee toy onto the international market starting with the television programme 'Buzzy Bee & friends'."

Author: "Enting, Carolyn"
Title: "10 years"
description: "Chronicles NZ Fashion Week on its tenth anniversary, noting the scepticism at its inception, the designers who have succeeded and failed, the work of founder/organiser Pieter Stewart, and the event's fostering of a NZ celebrity culture."

Author: "Davis, Joanna"
Title: "Murder in a spectacular setting"
description: "Murder in a spectacular setting"

Author: "Lewis, Rebecca"
Title: "Feathered friend needs our help"
description: "Reports on the falling numbers of kiwi. Talks to Bruce Jarvis, a trustee of the Whakaangi Landcare Trust which works to ensure the safety of North Island brown kiwi found on private land in Northland."

Author: "Coursey, Michelle"
Title: "Kiwiana at heart of town"
description: "Visits the rural Waikato town which has branded itself as 'Kiwiana Town' by decorating the lampposts, shops, public toilets, and the Ed Hillary Walkway with Kiwiana icons."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Gumboot not so humble any more"
description: "Looks at the turning of the gumboot into a fashion statement. Talks to Perry Allen of Skellerup and Tessa Jones of Gummies."

Author: "Vine, Gillian"
Title: "A growing enthusiasm"
description: "Talks to the gardener and author about his new book 'Grow it yourself : vegetables'."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Making a scene"
description: "Talks to Stephen Robinson, director of the Dunedin Operatic production of 'Miss Saigon', Regent Theatre, 16-25 Sep 2010."

Author: "Driessen, Erin"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Family' by Patrick Hartigan, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin. Reviews 'Pieces of India' by Kirsten Baldwin, Moray Gallery, Dunedin, until 17 Sep 2010. Reviews 'Seven signs' by Trevor Byron and 'Water' by Annabel Menzies-Joyce, Quadrant Gallery, Dunedin, until 11 Sep 2010."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "When will it stop?; Canterbury tales; 'If I'm going to die I want to die with Jo'"
description: "Traces the week after the Canterbury earthquake for Christchurch residents. Talks to a number of people about their experiences. Provides a graph to illustrate the number of aftershocks that hit the region in the week. Presents columnist Paul Holmes' personal narrative about his visit to Christchurch after the quake, and Christchurch mayor Bob Parker's experience."

Author: "Gillies, Jude"
Title: "Tough pitch to wipe the smile from Tim's face"
description: "Talks to singer Suzanne Prentice about her career and challenging Tim Shadbolt to become mayor of Invercargill in 2010."

Author: "Alderson, Andrew"
Title: "Raising the bar; Pair a genuine shot at Delhi Games gold"
description: "Looks at the prospects for the NZ gymnastic team and the two NZ archers at the 2010 Commonwealth Games in Delhi. Explains how archery matches work."

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "F1 gun; Teen motorsport sensation has right formula"
description: "Looks at why Formula One driver Mark Webber is mentoring Mitch Evans, a 16-year-old schoolboy at Auckland's St Kentigern College. Talks about Mitch Evans' achievements so far, coping with school life, and his plans for the future. Gives Mark Webber's opinion on Mitch Evans' chances of reaching the top of motorsport."

Author: "Cone, Deborah Hill"
Title: "Shaky ground"
description: "Looks at how NZ's two main television networks, TVNZ and TV3, covered the Canterbury earthquake. Talks to TV3's Mark Jennings, long-time television journalist Janet Wilson, and journalism professor Jim Tully for their opinions about the coverage."

Author: "Lang, Sarah"
Title: "Rivers run through it"
description: "Reviews the new documentary series about NZ's rivers hosted by leading landscape photographer Craig Potton."

Author: "Rush, Paul"
Title: "Delta dawn"
description: "Relates a kayaking expedition taken by the author through the Waikato River delta."

Author: "Lewis, Rebecca"
Title: "Pint-sized pet that's full of fun"
description: "Talks to Peta Van Zyl of the Rat Club and Rachel Prince of NZ Rat Rescue about keeping rats as pets. Touches on the neglect of pet rats, the monthly cost of keeping a rat, and some rat illnesses."

Author: "Yousef, Robyn"
Title: "The fastest friend you'll ever make"
description: "Talks to Lynda Sharp of Greyhounds for Pets (GAP) about the charity that finds homes for greyhounds that are no longer able to race. Touches on the nature of GAP greyhounds, their adaptability, and how much food and exercise they need."

Author: "Yousef, Robyn"
Title: "Fleecy and sweet with a protective streak"
description: "Talks to Kay O'Dea of Ridgedale Alpacas in Katikati about keeping alpacas as pets and how to care for them."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Aftershocked"
description: "Looks at the chances of another magnitude 7 or more earthquake hitting NZ after the Canterbury earthquake and the possibility of predicting earthquakes. Touches on preparing for a big earthquake for the public and local authorities. Provides a map showing 10 years of shallow earthquakes in NZ."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "A law unto himself"
description: "Traces the fall of South Canterbury Finance (SCF) and the role the chairman and controlling shareholder, Allan Hubbard, may have played."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Morning retort"
description: "Talks to the former co-host of Radio NZ National's Morning Report about his motivation for quitting, plans for the future, his employment case against Radio NZ, self-censorship for the media, and his interview style."

Author: "Woodley, Keith"
Title: "Cleared for landing"
description: "The author of a new book on bar-tailed godwits talks about the birds and their annual migration marathon between Alaska and NZ. Touches on godwits being one of NZ's cultural totems."

Author: "Mora, Jim"
Title: "The power & the passion"
description: "Jim Mora talks about his experiences on the South Island leg of filming the television series 'Volunteer power' for TVNZ. Touches on volunteers being neglected by the media, the annual TrustPower Community Awards, and the decline in society's voluntary organisations."

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "Nurse gifts $800,000 house to charlty"
description: "Nurse gifts $800,000 house to charlty"

Author: "Bourke, Chris"
Title: "A bigger purpose"
description: "Looks at jazz pianist Mike Nock's 50-year career as documented in a new biography written by Norman Meehan."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Rock 'n' roll birth for wee Dianthe"
description: "Rock 'n' roll birth for wee Dianthe"

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Neighbourhood sewage overwhelms award-winning garderner of the year"
description: "Neighbourhood sewage overwhelms award-winning garderner of the year"

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "When tomorrow came"
description: "Presents the author's personal experience of the Canterbury earthquake."

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "'Run for your lives!'"
description: "Recalls the aftermath of the 1968 Inangahua earthquake and talks to some of the survivors who also experienced the Canterbury earthquake (4 September 2010). Touches on the Modified Mercalli (MM) intensity scale and how it has been applied to major NZ earthquakes."

Author: "Walker, Steve"
Title: "Who's the traitor?"
description: "Reviews the debut novel by Stephen Daisley."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Quake a virtual reality"
description: "Reports on how news of the earthquake in Canterbury was reported in NZ and throughout the world via text messages, blogs, Internet news sites and other social networking media."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "These foolish things"
description: "Talks to members of the BackLit dance company about their exploration of consumer culture with their short works and two full-length works, their upcoming production 'The hungry attic', and running the company."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "The day of reckoning; Amazing response"
description: "Reflects on the events of the past week since the magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck the region at 4.35 am on Saturday, 4 Sep 2010. Comments on the terror of the event and the multiple aftershocks, and the miracle that no one was killed and very few people were seriously injured despite the severity of the quake. Praises the rapid response of the population and emergency services and the relatively quick recovery of infrastructure and most businesses. Talks to people about how they are coping in the aftermath of the event, and describes the damage to homes and some historic buildings. Touches on future priorities for the region."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Wrestling with change"
description: "Talks to contemporary dancer Anna Bates about the American professional wrestling inspiration behind her new work, 'Pro posing', which is part of a double-bill programme, 'Universal drive', for Tempo."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Singer's baby helping family deal with grief"
description: "Singer's baby helping family deal with grief"

Author: "Lewis, Rebecca"
Title: "Why this smiling girl wouldn't be alive without her cord blood"
description: "Why this smiling girl wouldn't be alive without her cord blood"

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "Poisonous eye candy"
description: "Reviews Richard Orjis's photography exhibition, 'The garden', at Milford Galleries Dunedin."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Focus on self-help best answer"
description: "Reports on the psychological effects of the 4 Sep earthquake for residents of the region, and the adjustments they will need to make in the coming weeks and months to cope with the aftermath. Talks to several psychologists and to residents Marge Straw and Peter Straw, to Bishop of Christchurch Victoria Matthews and Burwood-Pegasus community board chairman David East."

Author: "Grunwell, Rachel"
Title: "Tick tock of our late NZ biological clocks"
description: "Tick tock of our late NZ biological clocks"

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Undressed for success; Lawdy, lawdy, lawdy, Ms Miller"
description: "Reviews the new album by the Naked and Famous and the debut album by Erica Miller."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Already struggling, some businesses won't survive"
description: "Concentrates on the economic impact of the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake on the business community, particularly on the Christchurch central business district. Informs that there may be some economic gains in the medium term in the construction and related industries."

Author: "Poole, Marian"
Title: "The sun sets, the sun rises"
description: "Reviews the performance of Alexander L'Estrange's new work 'Zimbe! African folk art with a jazz twist' by the City of Dunedin Choir and others under the direction of David Burchell."

Author: "Enting, Carolyn"
Title: "10 years"
description: "Chronicles NZ Fashion Week on its tenth anniversary, noting the scepticism at its inception, the designers who have succeeded and failed, the work of organiser Pieter Stewart, and the event's fostering of a NZ celebrity culture."

Author: "Monahan, Kate"
Title: "Giant of a man"
description: "Talks to the former All Black and his wife about how they deal with the constant attention of being a living legend. Describes his busy schedule."

Author: "Henning, Christopher"
Title: "Brave new world"
description: "Assesses the aftermath of the Islamic terrorism attacks in the US on 11 Sep 2001. Touches on changes in NZ attitudes and legislation in the wake of the attacks."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Palace of dreams"
description: "Looks at the development of a process to capture CO2 (carbon dioxide) from the flue gas of coal-burning power stations by physicist Robert Holt and his team at Industrial Research Limited (IRL) in Lower Hutt."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Shock tactics"
description: "Talks to Christian Livingstone of the rock quartet about their decision to continue with their upcoming concert despite the recent earthquake, AL's Bar, Christchurch, 16 Sep 2010."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Old school"
description: "Focuses on the popularity of vintage homewares, such as old school chairs and factory lights. Talks to designers and design store owners about the trend. Advises on how to create a vintage look."

Author: "Davis, Joanna"
Title: "Murder in a spectacular setting"
description: "Murder in a spectacular setting"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Fine art of dirty tricks"
description: "Describes NZ's art market as flourishing, despite the financial downturn, though some investors may be  disappointed. Talks to artist Dick Frizzell about cashing in on art, the backlash associated with his appropriation of the Mr Four Square image, and other nostalgic characters that will be marketed by Icon Images' Carolann Plamus."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "That bites"
description: "Looks at how NZ led the world in tooth loss for most of the 20th century and the resulting use of false teeth. Talks about the trend towards more people entering old age with their own teeth and the associated dental care requirements and costs. Gives suggestions on how to keep your teeth as you get older."

Author: "Lovell-Smith, Mary"
Title: "The forgotten suburb"
description: "Reports on the damage to gardens in the suburb of Dallington following the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake. Talks to residents Shaun Lyons and David Chambers."

Author: "Easton, B. H."
Title: "Reserve Bank to the rescue"
description: "Reviews the new book by the governor of the Reserve Bank, Alan Bollard."

Author: "Kairua, Leanna"
Title: "How the hospital failed my daugher"
description: "Recounts what her daughter had to go through when suffering from abdominal pain, waiting to get admitted to North Shore Hospital, and finally being operated on. Includes the mother's observations of the failings of the hospital in looking after patients."

Author: "Warner, Kirsten"
Title: "NZ Fashion Week : getting the money shot"
description: "Looks at the event on its tenth anniversary, noting it now lacks a name sponsor. Wonders if an increase in ticketed public events is a result of financial pressures. Describes some of the jobs that can be picked up at the show, lists some of the main guests, and profiles three NZers - Yasmin Bidois, Chris Langdon, and Ella Verberne - who are now modelling after being approached by talent spotters. Talks to World's Denise L'Estrange-Corbet about staging her collections."

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "McKay recalls early southern career"
description: "McKay recalls early southern career"

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Winter's wise counsel will be missed"
description: "Winter's wise counsel will be missed"

Title: "Top skier blazing through competition"
description: "Top skier blazing through competition"

Title: "City designer all 'go, go, go' after winning award"
description: "City designer all 'go, go, go' after winning award"

Author: "Crayton- Brown, Kimberley"
Title: "Music and art united for exhibit"
description: "Music and art united for exhibit"

Author: "Chilton, Chris"
Title: "Music unleashes passion to build recording studio"
description: "Music unleashes passion to build recording studio"

Author: "Murray, Danielle"
Title: "Ministry nervous as slimy threat slithers ever closer"
description: "Describes the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry's increasing fight to keep snakes out of NZ. Notes the restrictions on snake imports and the possible effects on native wildlife. Discusses the international market for illegally traded animals, and details the pests that have been introduced to NZ."

Author: "McCrystal, John"
Title: "Vietnam : tales of a war repressed; Author disputes Vietnam 'mythology'"
description: "Reports that a book by Ian McGibbon on the Vietnam War finally gives official recognition to NZ's involvement. Identifies why Vietnam can be called our 'repressed military memory.' Summarises and comments on the book's coverage of NZ's involvement. Notes McGibbon's point of view on veterans' claims that the NZ Government treated them badly."

Author: "Yeoman, Paula"
Title: "Setting the record straight"
description: "Previews the band's new studio album, their group dynamics after 22 years together, and how they have managed to remain an Australasian favourite."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "What people want in the new Auckland; Hard times in paradise; A melting pot culture to cherish"
description: "Presents the results of the 'Super City: one man poll' which interviewed 300 Aucklanders about want they want most from the new Auckland Super City. Talks about the multi-cultural nature of Auckland and the fears people have about it becoming too segregated."

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "War hero 'victim of VC quota system'"
description: "War hero 'victim of VC quota system'"

Author: "Bennett, Adam"
Title: "The life and times of Red Ken"
description: "Talks with socialist and current Porirua City Councillor Ken Douglas about his life, including his leadership of the Combined Trade Unions (CTU) and the biography by David Grant."

Title: "Kiwi Vietnam War hero loses cancer fight"
description: "Kiwi Vietnam War hero loses cancer fight"

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Blood will have blood"
description: "Talks with director Tim Albery about the staging of NBR New Zealand Opera's Macbeth by Verdi at the Aotea Centre, September 18 to 21, 2010."

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Tempo frenetic as dancers strut stuff"
description: "Previews the programme for Auckland's Tempo Dance Festival, held September 15 to October 31 2010."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "See the world : a step at a time"
description: "Talks with ultramarathon runner Lisa Tamati about the challenges she's faced, her motivation, and competing in the Racing The Planet series."

Author: "Stretton, Annah,"
Title: "From Morrinsville to Manhattan ..."
description: "The NZ designer and businesswoman reflects on opening a store in Auckland's High Street in 1998 and the business lessons she's learnt from it and other failures."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Farmers connect with Kiwi ingenuity; Cables beam future to our companies"
description: "Looks at how some farmers in NZ have put in their own fibre-optic cabling resulting in broadband speeds of 100 megabits per second (Mbps) compared to the national average of 3Mbps. Talks to Opto Network's and founder of FX Networks Roger De Salis to see how easily it can be done, and to some of the farmers who have made the connection. Touches on the creation of community networks. Provides a map of NZ to show the location of major fibre networks and a list of other companies providing fibre networks. Briefly contrasts fibre-optic cables with copper telephone wires."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "When it doesn't pay to care"
description: "Talks to some of the families who won their Human Rights Tribunal case to be paid as carers of their disabled children about the Crown's appeal of the case, currently before the Auckland High Court."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Bradley Fenner"
description: "Interviews the headmaster of King's College in Auckland, touching on the death of three pupils since he became headmaster in April 2009, the school, his background, and family life."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "When plates collide; what lies beneath"
description: "Talks to Kelvin Berryman, manager of the Geological and Nuclear Sciences (GNS) Natural Hazards Research Platform, about the geological background to NZ's earthquake and why the size of a fault line determines earthquake magnitude. Notes the international interest in the quake and the facts on which seismologists agree and disagree. Discusses the Alpine Fault and relays the likelihood of a follow-up to the 7.1 Darfield quake. Illustrates four earthquake wave types."

Author: "Macky, Peter"
Title: "Our disappearing heritage"
description: "Asks what the new Auckland Super City will mean for the heritage assets and urban design future of the region. Touches on the failure of successive councils and institutions to recognise heritage value with the example of the demolition of the Remuera Road home 'Coolangatta' in 2006. Looks at some recent developments the author believes have be poorly designed including two downtown supermarkets, a Ponsonby police station and Heard Park in Parnell."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "On desolation row"
description: "Talks to Sydenham Heritage Trust members about the damage to the area's heritage buildings. Notes that strengthening has saved the Sydenham Methodist Church. Gives a brief history of the church and other buildings, such as Sydenham School."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Nothing - and everything"
description: "Talks to Peter Elliott about directing his good friend Oliver Driver in the solo show 'Thom Pain (based on nothing)' by Will Eno at the Herald Theatre in late September 2010."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Black market in white gold"
description: "Looks at the market in raw, unpasteurised milk, noting the legal requirements and penalties associated with its sale. Talks anonymously to a Mid-Canterbury farmer about the power of Fonterra and the NZ Food Safety Authority (NZFSA), the clandestine operation he runs, and the health benefits claimed by customers. Interviews Winton farmers Glenys Williams and Peter Williams about their operation being closed by NZFSA. Discusses foundation foods and the Weston A. Price food movement with Kieran Whelan."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Exposing the family for all to see"
description: "Talks to Miranda Harcourt about the documentary theatre production written by her husband, Stuart McKenzie, based on the events of their marriage. Touches on how she became interested in documentary theatre."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "A voice from the past"
description: "Talks to director Paul Gittins and actor Edward Newborn about reviving the Samuel Beckett classic 'Krapp's last tape' 25 years after they first staged it and how they are using the recordings of that production in the current one for the 2010 Auckland Heritage Festival."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Strewn objects betray scattered thoughts"
description: "Reviews three installation exhibitions in Auckland including Sean Kerr's 'Bruce danced if Victoria sang, and Victoria sang: so Bruce danced' at the Gus Fisher Gallery and Kenneth Myers Centre, 'Modern Arrangements' by Dan Arps and the Estate of L. Budd and 'The weight of the sun' by Steve Carr at the Michael Lett Gallery, and 'Reading between the lines' by Kathy Barber at the Orexart."

Author: "Gates, Charlie"
Title: "Mastering the reel life"
description: "Talks to the film aficionado and distributor about building his independent cinema business in Christchurch, his tussles with the cinema chain monopolies, and censorship. Reveals who sewed the arthouse theatres' waterfall curtains, affirms the high and low brow tastes of his shows, and mentions his home theatrette. Details the earthquake damage sustained by movie theatres in Christchurch."

Title: "Putting music to pictures offers magical possibilities"
description: "Talks to the composer and current Chief Executive Officer of the Department of Labour about the upcoming performance by the Auckland Chamber Orchestra of his complete 'Northland panels', which are four orchestral responses to the images of Robin Morrison published in the 1994 photographic essay 'A journey'."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "The naked truth"
description: "Speaks to Thom Powers and Alisa Xayalith about the success of the Auckland group's latest album and how they became a quintet. Mentions their coming tour with Kids of 88."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "Ultimate race fitting tribute to legend; Marathon on Wiki's bucket list"
description: "Looks at the running of the Lydiard Legend Marathon and Arthur's Half Marathon which follow, as closely as possible, the Waiatarua routes that Arthur Lydiard used to train his runners. Talks to the creator of 'The Legend' run, Ian Winson, and the close friend and biographer of Arthur Lydiard, Garth Gilmour. Explains why the former captain of the NZ Rugby League team, Ruben Wiki, is attempting the marathon in 2010."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Rebuilding answers lie in the soil"
description: "Explores the phenomenon of liquefaction. Examines earthquake-damaged houses in Kaiapoi, and a subdivision in Bexley wetlands originally opposed by the Christchurch City Council, which were affected by liquefying soil. Notes international interest by scientists and geotechnical engineers in the effects of the process. Talks to specialists about the susceptibility of soft soil areas, the contribution of this year's high water table, and the success of soil compaction techniques carried out at the new Pegasus Town near Woodend."

Author: "Leggat, David"
Title: "Wrestler grabs his chance for glory"
description: "Wrestler grabs his chance for glory"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Tree spirit"
description: "Speaks to the aborist about his love of trees and his work at the Wellington Botanic Gardens."

Author: "Gaynor, Brian"
Title: "Economic lessons from earthquake repairs"
description: "Looks at the likely impact of the Canterbury earthquake on the NZ economy and overall Gross Domestic Product (GDP) by using the economic situation in Chile after a magnitude 8.8 earthquake struck the southwest of that country on 27 February 2010."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Rugby, racing & beer"
description: "Describes three aspects that once defined NZ culture and how they have changed as NZ society has become more diverse. Notes how the beer industry has been changed through alcohol-sale laws and increased wine consumption; rugby has given ground to football and 'rugby fatigue'; and horse racing faces competition from alternative gambling venues, changes in how horses are bred and trained, and the increase in choice of cultural activities."

Author: "Bradley, Grant"
Title: "Heat on retailers to find the right price; Icecream firm trying to stay under $20 lid; More to think about than just raising price tag"
description: "Looks at how some retailers plan to respond to the 1 October GST increase. Compares the current consumer response to the impending increase with those of the initial GST introduction in 1986 and the other 2.5 per cent rise in 1989. Briefly talks about the impact of the 1 October 2010 tax cuts. Talks to Greg Hall, the founder of the Kohu Road Ice Cream Company, about the pricing of a one-litre tub after the GST rise. Provides some advice for retailers."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "A passionate people"
description: "Speaks to winners of the Copyright Licensing Limited Writing Award for non-fiction. Details journalist Steve Braunias' forthcoming book on NZer identity (NZ: the biography) and his intention to balance past portrayals of a passionless people with descriptions of Kiwi humour and a sense of belonging to where one lives. Talks to writer and publisher Dame Christine Cole Catley about writing the first instalment of an autobiography trilogy(Getting ready), her dictum of compassionate truth, the downturn in publishing, and her relationship with literary NZ."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "In the business of creating a winner; Persistent and tenacious"
description: "Profiles the Invercargill-born tourism industry pioneer and leader, who recently retired from the board of the company after chairing it for 33 years. Talks to him about his entry into the tourism business and the growth of the successful company. Seeks views of his colleagues. Provides information about his education, family and directorships."

Author: "Dunlop, Emma"
Title: "Ready, set..."
description: "Talks to model Tia Woods, reporter Samantha Hayes, buyer Ruban Bryant, designer James Dobson, and stylist Zara Mirkin about NZ Fashion Week."

Author: "Roughan, Greg"
Title: "A fallen icon"
description: "Details the origins of the now earthquake-damaged Repertory Theatre built by Thomas Edmonds in 1929 to house the Radiant Health Club. Describes the establishment and tenets of the Radiant Living movement and some of its adherents, such as Sir Edmund Hillary's family. Chronicles the history of another movement, Havelock Work, guided by Robert Felkin. Previews an exhibition by artist Louise Menzies (Letters to students of the Radiant Life), and accompanying short film based on the Radiant Living manual (Peloha), one of four in the Designs for living exhibition, Adam Art Gallery, Wellington, from 22 October to 18 December."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "A tale of two cities"
description: "Examines the nature of the relationship between the two largest cities in the South Island, taking into account the aftermath of the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake in Christchurch. Seeks views of health professionals, city councillors, civil defence authorities and businesspeople about the often unseen business, social and other interactions between the two cities."

Author: "Parry, Gordon"
Title: "Passing the torch"
description: "Focuses on local events planned by the Brevet Club of Otago to commemorate the 70th anniversary of the Battle of Britain, Dunedin, 12 Sep 2010. Informs that this will be the final commemoration organised by the club, comprising veterans of the RNZAF and Women's RAF Volunteer Reserve. Describes the history and administration of the club and briefly profiles its surviving members. Provides a timeline of the Battle of Britain, 1940 and an excerpt of the speech given by British Prime Minister Winston Churchill to the British parliament, 21 Aug 1940."

Title: "No innocent Butler"
description: "Previews the presentation of the visually striking and provocative comedy circus 'The Butler', The Regent, Dunedin, 15-16 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts. Talks to the writer and the director about their long-term friendship that led to their collaboration on the project, which has also toured London."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Author (detailed): "Lawrence Jones, Gerard O'Brien and Clarke Isaacs"
Title: "The story of Mansfield; An eye for a character; Lesser known heroes of Antarctic endeavour"
description: "The story of Mansfield; An eye for a character; Lesser known heroes of Antarctic endeavour"

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "Electorate epitomises slice of Kiwi life"
description: "Ascertains changes in the Mana electorate, formerly known as Porirua, as it heads into a by-election to replace Minister of Parliament Winnie Laban. Describes how the biggest Pacific island centre outside of Auckland is changing from a working class to a wealthier population. Speaks to residents and elected officials about the area's history, diversity, violence, unemployment, and income disparities."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "War and peace"
description: "Talks to the singer-songwriter about the process of recording her latest album. Discusses her tour of NZ and onwards to Europe."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Sometimes a girl just has to manage"
description: "Talks to the singer about her eventful year touring the US. Touches on her latest album, which is a finalist in five categories in the NZ Music Awards (Tuis). Informs that she is performing at the Regent Theatre, Dunedin, 17 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts."

Author: "L'Estrange Corbet, Denise"
Title: "Backstage pass"
description: "Muses on the importance of NZ Fashion week as viewed by the author, World fashion brand co-founder Denise L'Estrange-Corbet. Talks about the birth of NZ Fashion Week in 2001, its problems, and World's first show there."

Author: "Scherer, Jule"
Title: "Getting back to their roots"
description: "Talks to the trio about their decision to reunite after five years to release a live album and a documentary. Discusses their successful earlier album and mentions other projects in which they have been involved. Provides tour dates in Christchurch, Wellington and Auckland"

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "Mayor sees city on rebound, but rivals see a vital need for change"
description: "Talks to incumbent Wayne Guppy and contenders Adrian Sparrow and Hellen Swales about their election platforms. Discusses the influence on the city of Rimutaka Prison, the Defence Force and the bypass. Identifies the main points in the election. Mentions issues of retail leakage, the state of the Main Street shopping area, and  the city's dependence on government decisions."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Calm at the heart of daily storm"
description: "Talks to the ambulance paramedic about his career in intensive medicine, the rewards of his work and his imminent retirement."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "[Local body elections 2010]"
description: "Asks all of the nominees for councils across Otago to answer two questions: how they would keep rates down while retaining essential services, and their goals and perceived priorities for their council. Overviews the mayoral campaigns in Dunedin, Central Otago, Mackenzie district, Waimate, Timaru, Clutha, Invercargill, Southland and Gore. Comments on the challenges facing each of the councils and local district health boards."

Author: "Dunlop, Emma"
Title: "All keyed up about fashion"
description: "Looks at the changing nature of fashion reporting with the rise of self-styled fashion commentators and bloggers as a result of the growth of the Internet. Talks to fashion writer Zoe Walker, Anjali Stewart of the 'twenty-seven names' label, bloggers Isaac Hindin-Miller and Emma Gleason, and associate editor of GQ magazine Robert Johnson. Touches on the beginning of NZ fashion blogging with the now-defunct Runway Reporter and the backlash against bloggers by the traditional fashion media."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Pair make it cool to pick up rubbish"
description: "Chats to Felicity Warren and Philippa Arapoff about their Collect Our Own Litter (COOL) campaign to tidy up rubbish in the Wairarapa and the community support they have received."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Explore the dark side"
description: "Talks to the jeweller about her latest exhibition inspired by neckwear,  Lure, Dunedin, 6-21 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts."

Author: "Larsen, Michael"
Title: "Anecdotal gems from great writing minds"
description: "Reviews the new book of interviews with 15 NZ authors compiled by Siobhan Harvey."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Family twice has had neurosurgery crisis"
description: "Talks to the veteran health services campaigner and her husband about his recent brain bleed and the difficulties they experienced in the neurosurgical ward at Christchurch Hospital. Informs that his aneurysm occurred on the 20th anniversary of the motor vehicle accident which left her sister with a severe head injury. Describes their strong support for the retention of neurosurgery services in Dunedin."

Author: "Burgess, Dave"
Title: "A capital job in the balance"
description: "Identifies issues in the Wellington mayoral race around resources, arts infrastructure, and financial and transport problems. Profiles the six mayoral candidates and their key policies. Reviews the main problems and achievements of the current council."

Author: "Chapman, Katie"
Title: "Trains on track to be a reliable option"
description: "Describes the state of Wellington's rail network, the age of some equipment and trains, and the three years of upgrade work on the entire rail system, including a new, third line into Wellington Railway Station. Anticipates the introduction of the new Matangi units, expected improvements in rail reliability, and ongoing work on customer communication."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Turning point for opera"
description: "Talks to University of Otago professor John Drummond and musical director Matthew Leese about the Opera Otago production of L'Orfeo by Claudio Monteverdi, Mayfair Theatre, Dunedin, 10-15 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Anatomy of a serious knee injury"
description: "Anatomy of a serious knee injury"

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Momento' by Jan Ingram and Leila Ataya, The Artist's Room, Dunedin. Reviews 'Small works' by various artists, Milford Galleries, Dunedin, until 6 Oct 2010. Reviews 'Introduced birds' by the anonymous artist collective ffffff, Blue Oyster Gallery, Dunedin, until 2 Oct 2010."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "West End boy makes history for Samoa"
description: "West End boy makes history for Samoa"

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "A splash of colour"
description: "Focuses on how to paint rooms in your home and when to hire a professional painter. Seeks advice of Gavin Mead, president of the Otago branch of Master Painters NZ, and Dulux Paints training manager Bevan Tutty. Provides information about quantities to buy and how to ensure that you have the right tools for the job."

Author: "Oldham, Stu"
Title: "I will listen to advice : Dwyer"
description: "I will listen to advice : Dwyer"

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "Campaigning on behalf of 'underdog'"
description: "Campaigning on behalf of 'underdog'"

Title: "A man who gave much more than he took"
description: "A man who gave much more than he took"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Rooney aiming for golden returns in India"
description: "Rooney aiming for golden returns in India"

Author: "Parsons, Wayne"
Title: "Wilson cleans up two tournaments"
description: "Wilson cleans up two tournaments"

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "Need for more inclusive leadership : Cull"
description: "Need for more inclusive leadership : Cull"

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Reinventing the wheel"
description: "Reports on a number of NZ inventions that some experts believe have been a waste of time and money because they have duplicated existing research or reinvented something already in existence. Looks at the examples of Rex the robotic exoskeleton, the Martin Jetpack, and the Aquada (a boat/car hybrid). Talks to intellectual property consultant Kristian Slack and investor Gareth Morgan about the problem of reinvention."

Author: "Alexander, Miriyana"
Title: "The race that stops two nations"
description: "Talks to the NZ historian who is tracing the families of winning Melbourne Cup owners, trainers and jockeys for the Victorian Racing Club, to mark the 150th anniversary of the race, about her research. Provides some facts and figures about the Melbourne Cup."

Author: "Driver, Oliver"
Title: "In the driver's seat"
description: "The actor, director, radio host, and voiceover person (among other things) interviews himself about why he has changed jobs so many times and about his first solo show 'Thom Pain' at the Herald Theatre in Auckland on September 24 2010."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Return to sin city"
description: "Looks back at Auckland during the pre-stock market crash time in the 1980s. Talks to those who were part of the over-indulgent consumption boom when confidence was high. Recounts the excesses of the nightclub scene."

Author: "Ellin, Abby"
Title: "Coulda been a contender"
description: "Looks at how to escape 'aspirational limbo' and change your mindset of gauging success against that of others."

Author: "McLauchlan, Gordon"
Title: "Tome of letters reveals touching relationship"
description: "Reviews the correspondence between Janet Frame and Charles Brasch, as selected and edited by Pamela Gordon and Denis Harold."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Murder they rode"
description: "Talks to members of the Wheel Blacks, NZ's world-class national wheelchair rugby (aka Murderball) team, at their final camp before the world championships in Canada, about the state of the sport and their injuries. Provides a brief guide to the game."

Author: "Warner, Kirsten"
Title: "Introducing paddle power"
description: "Introduces the new watersport of stand-up paddling. Talks to Mark Houghton about taking up the sport. Gives tips on getting started."

Author: "Smither, Elizabeth,"
Title: "Dipping plate"
description: "Reviews the new book of NZ verse that also talks to poets about their work."

Author: "Newcombe, Justin"
Title: "No crying over onions"
description: "Gives tips on growing and harvesting onions."

Author: "Hamilton, Janna"
Title: "Wilderness at the top of its game"
description: "Recounts attending a Ready for the Wild weekend hosted by Al Brown at the Poronui wilderness retreat. Gives some information on getting to Poronui, accomodation, things to do and coming events."

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "Life in the fast lane"
description: "Recounts going to a driver training day at the Hampton Downs circuit, driving a Porsche 911 Cabriolet, and receiving training from Kiwi race star Emma Gilmour."

Author: "Wright, Matthew,"
Title: "Official historian sets record straight on baby eaters and war victims"
description: "Reviews 'New Zealand's Vietnam War' which is the second official volume about NZ's involvement in the Vietnam War."

Author: "O'Neill, Rob"
Title: "Hysteria drives sales on one-day websites"
description: "Talks about the growth of one-day deal websites both globally and locally. Talks to local entrepreneures Dinesh Kaku of Dealaday.co.nz and Dave Healy of Dailydo.co.nz about the online phenomenon."

Author: "Hart, Anna"
Title: "Not buying it"
description: "Presents a personal narrative about the experience of not shopping for six months. Talks about her emotional shopping and the lessons she learnt about her relationship with clothes. Briefly talks about the psychology of emotional shopping."

Author: "Miller, Isaac Hindin"
Title: "Dirty work"
description: "Looks at the reality of male modelling behind the glamorous facade. Talks to NZ male models, including Bruce Raubenheimer and Michael Whittaker, about their overseas modelling experiences and what the pressure of the industry can do to young models."

Author: "Smithies, Grant"
Title: "Bass cadet"
description: "Explains why the author loves bass. Presents the views of Ronald LaPread, the former bass player for The Commodores, on bass and bass players."

Author: "Roughan, Greg"
Title: "Wing nut"
description: "Talks to Rob Jones, a lepidopterist [butterfly collector or enthusiast] turned conservationist, about the decline of native NZ butterflies due to the destruction of their food sources and the introduction of Pteromalus puparum and Echthromorpha intricatoria wasps. Talks about the importance of nettles for Red and Yellow Admiral butterflies. Provides advice on how to attract butterflies to a garden."

Author: "Donaldson, Michael"
Title: "Fligth of fancy"
description: "Presents a personal narrative of a tour around the Marlborough region. Visits some of the attractions the area has to offer including the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre, Highfield Estate, and Auntsfield vineyard."

Author: "Pepperell, Susan"
Title: "Teacher convicted of assaulting own kids"
description: "Teacher convicted of assaulting own kids"

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Family stoked to be back on production line"
description: "Family stoked to be back on production line"

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Fractured earth, broken hearts"
description: "Talks to residents of various Christchurch suburbs, including Brooklands, about the aftermath of the Canterbury earthquake. Briefly discusses using drama as therapy for children traumatised by the earthquake. Portrays the earthquake through the viewpoint of two young girls.
