Provides a personal narrative about the week after the earthquake and the impact on a poultry farm."

Author: "Reid, Nicholas,"
Title: "For king and country?"
description: "Reviews the new book about NZ's role in World War One. Argues that there are some major problems with the book."

Author: "Marriner, Maureen"
Title: "Danger lurks in exotic resort"
description: "Reviews the Bulgarian-born author's new novel."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Many cloudy returns"
description: "Talks about the party held in Auckland to celebrate the 25th anniversary of Blenheim winery Cloudy Bay that was attended by 25 famous NZers."

Author: "Stock, Rob"
Title: "Bollard : arrogant banks humbled"
description: "Reveals details from the latest book by the Reserve Bank governor. Talks about how out-of-touch the major Australian banks were from the NZ public during the recent global financial crisis. Looks at how Dr Bollard dealt with the crisis on a personal level."

Author: "Linklater, David"
Title: "Auto motives"
description: "Debunks the view that NZers no longer favour large cars. Looks at engineering and efficiency standards of Australian car manufacturing and the continued popularity of Holden and Ford cars in NZ. Examines the state of the market for and the best sellers among small and medium cars. Mentions briefly the hybrid as a niche market, crossover sport utility vehicles (SUV), and the potential growth in Chinese-manufactured cars. Notes turning points in the NZ automotive industry. Enumerates market share in 2005 and today, and describes strategies of the top brand for the past 25 years, Toyota NZ."

Author: "Little, Jennifer"
Title: "You want salsa with that?"
description: "Talks with Greydis Montero and Vivio Ramos, aka The Cuban Groove, about their salsa classes as well as teaching Latin American and Afro Cuban dance styles in NZ."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "The glass half full"
description: "Presents the case that NZers are moderate alcohol consumers and that anti-liquor campaigners have overstated the problem. Describes tactics and anti-business tone of anti-liquor activism. Notes the effect of laws on alcohol consumption, noting a slight decrease in overall consumption in 2009. Imagines a scenario of stricter liquor control and makes a case for personal responsibility."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "More than words"
description: "Talks to the playwright and satirist about his personality, his childhood, his split from reporter Samantha Hayes, and his love of words and theatre."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Labour of love"
description: "Looks at the exploitation of unpaid interns. Talks to Murray Bevan, director of Auckland fashion PR agency Showroom 22, and former intern Tim Yates about the problem."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "After a fashion"
description: "Talks to Starfish fashion designer Laurie Foon who is opening the 10th NZ Fashion Week. Notes which designers are not showing this year and the general decline of the fashion industry. Discusses the tensions in eco fashion, and whether environmental and ethical values fit with fashion manufacture and consumption. Considers the success of Starfish's ethical fashion branding and the use of environmentally friendly fabrics. Talks to Fashion Week founder Pieter Stewart and Fashion Industry NZ chairman Paul Blomfield about the event and the successes and future of NZ's fashion industry."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Mirrors with a memory"
description: "Talks to the world leading daguerreotypist about his work making the potentially dangerous form of 19th century photography on glass, and the highly sort-after daguerreotype cases and passe-partout (glass mounts) he also makes."

Author: "Potton, Craig"
Title: "Rivers run through it; Water world"
description: "Presents a personal narrative of the 'Rivers' television series host Craig Potton about his love of and fears for NZ's rivers. Provides a brief overview of the five rivers looked at in the series."

Author: "Ineson, Lisa"
Title: "Cook books"
description: "Reviews the new cookbook by the NZ born chef."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Architectural Alzheimer's?"
description: "Conveys concern that the restoration or demolition of Christchurch buildings after the Darfield earthquake may erase the city's architectural history. Discusses the main issues in post-earthquake restoration: cost, the decisions of private heritage building owners, and controversy over architectural design. Describes the work of the Christchurch Heritage Trust and its successes with heritage building owners."

Author: "Carey, Peta"
Title: "Not your typical collector"
description: "Talks to art collectors David Teplitzky and Peggy Scott about their art collection 'roundabout' showing at City Gallery Wellington, 25 September to 16 January. Discusses their modest beginnings, their modus operandi, the ethos underpinning the works, and the power of art objects. Quotes some NZ artists whose works feature in the collection. Speaks to City Gallery director Paula Savage about controversy surrounding the hosting of private collections."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "The man from the Tate"
description: "Interviews Vicente TodoliÃÅ, Spanish art historian and former director of London's Tate Modern Gallery, and judge of the Walters Prize announced on 8 October. Talks about his career in museum and gallery work, his work at the Tate, and how he measures success."

Author: "Edmond, Frances"
Title: "Modern family - an alternative view"
description: "Reviews August: Osage county, by Tracy Letts and directed by Colin McColl, Auckland Theatre Company, Maidment Theatre, until 25 September."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Don't let 'em bite"
description: "Warns of a recent resurgence of bed bugs, notably in the US, that has prompted the Motel Association of NZ to educate moteliers about the insect. Informs of how to identify the bugs, how they operate, the results of being bitten, and measures to eradicate them."

Author: "Chapman, Katie"
Title: "Baby joy for murdered farmer's widow"
description: "Baby joy for murdered farmer's widow"

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Ageing pains"
description: "Answers a question about osteoarthritis, detailing its causes, symptoms, and dietary, exercise and supplement recommendations."

Title: "MP wore fake glasses and dyed his hair for passport photo"
description: "MP wore fake glasses and dyed his hair for passport photo"

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Way back when"
description: "Describes a photograph of the actor as a four year old with a broken leg sitting on a fire engine. Talks about how he broke his leg, the birth of his sister around that time, and wanting to be a fireman."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Way back when"
description: "Recalls some memories for the lead guitarist of The Datsuns around the time a photograph was taken of him as a five year old in Cambridge."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Lessons from suicide; Callous circumsatnces of suicide still hurtful"
description: "Lessons from suicide; Callous circumsatnces of suicide still hurtful"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Sport and farming hard man respected"
description: "Sport and farming hard man respected"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Promoter of culture a strong family man"
description: "Promoter of culture a strong family man"

Author: "Preece, Sophie"
Title: "Over and out : familiar voice signs off in the Sounds"
description: "Over and out : familiar voice signs off in the Sounds"

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "People not voting for many reasons"
description: "Investigates why local government election turnout dropped in 2007, and how the problem can be fixed for the 2010 election and beyond. Seeks comment from University of Otago researcher Dr Jacky Zvulun, Local Government NZ governance manager Mike Reid and Minister for Local Government Rodney Hide."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Waimate 50's revival great for town"
description: "Focuses on the revival of the Waimate 50, 23-24 Oct 2010.  Talks to retailers and organisers about what the motorsport event will mean for the small South Canterbury town."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Jetpack needs $5 million to take off"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-born inventor of the Martin Jetpack, a jet propulsion unit which is attached to the pilot's back. Discusses his search for $5 million in capital investment to turn his dream into a commercial reality. Provides information about the inventor and his invention."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Quaking in our boots; Standing up to the test; The last good shake; City stands ready; Built upon the sand; Old timers could get wobbly"
description: "Focuses on the recent magnitude 7.1 earthquake in Canterbury on 4 Sep 2010. Asks seismologists and others whether the Dunedin and the Otago region are likely to experience an earthquake of a similar magnitude and if so, how prepared the city is to cope. Focuses on civil defence preparations, discusses the possibility of soil liquefaction in low-lying areas and describes the characteristics of earthquake-prone buildings."

Title: "Love in a colder climate; Penguin part of love triangle"
description: "Talks to the playwright about the inspiration for her latest work, set in Antarctica. Seeks comment from Prof Spencer Davis, who has spent time there as a research fellow. Informs that the play will be performed at the Otago Settlers Museum Theatre, Dunedin, 13-16 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts. Speaks to the actor who portrays an emperor penguin in the play about how he prepared for the role."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Author (detailed): "Lawrence Jones, Ian Williams and Bryan James"
Title: "Novel blurs the line between fiction and history; Labour of love restores Spitfire; Governor-General years highlight of memoirs"
description: "Novel blurs the line between fiction and history; Labour of love restores Spitfire; Governor-General years highlight of memoirs"

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "A high-flying career - literally"
description: "Interviews the guide for Ziptrek Ecotours about her work."

Author: "Ramsay, Don"
Title: "Down to the waters' edge"
description: "Explores a walking track leading to an old gold-mining settlement located at Butchers Point, Lake Roxburgh."

Author: "Gibson, Damion"
Title: "Home game"
description: "Recounts the experience of swapping roles with his wife and becoming the main caregiver.  Reflects on what it means to be a 21st century housedad looking after his three children."

Author: "Shepheard, Nicola"
Title: "Tell tale"
description: "Investigates the trend to online self-disclosure, including lifecasting: individuals using the internet and cellphones to broadcast internal monologues and daily life to friends and strangers. Discusses the use of social networking sites such as Twitter, looking at both positive and negative aspects. Talks with those who are part of online communities and gains their perspective."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Driver quizzed over woman's death"
description: "Driver quizzed over woman's death"

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Book claims dead cop killed Crewes"
description: "Review the book which revisits the murders in 1970 of Jeanette Crewe and Harvey Crewe. Names a new suspect, detective sergeant Len Johnston. Notes criticism of the work by police personnel."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Art arose from miner miracle"
description: "Talks to Patrick Davies about the plot of 'The Pitman painters', a play he is directing at the Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, 1-23 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts. Informs that the award-winning play by Lee Hall opens on Broadway in New York City at the same time as its Australasian premiere."

Author: "Powley, Kathryn"
Title: "Thousands hit by winds, power cuts"
description: "Surveys the damage sustained by NZ in the wake of what was characterised as 'biggest storm in the world'. Summarises the power failures, winds and flooding, and damage to buildings, kiwifruit and avocado orchards and sheep farms."

Author: "Body, Ralph"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Black and white' by Robert West, Moray Gallery, Dunedin, until 2 Oct 2010. Reviews 'The Garden' by Richard Orjis, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 6 Oct 2010. Reviews 'Portraits' by Frances Hodgkins, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until Apr 2011."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Uncertainty for student leaders"
description: "Investigates whether the two tertiary student associations would survive without receiving mandatory revenue from its members. Backgrounds the private member's Bill sponsored by ACT NZ MPs Heather Roy and Sir Roger Douglas, which proposes that membership of tertiary student associations should be voluntary rather than compulsory. Seeks comment from Harriet Geoghegan and Meegan Cloughley, presidents of the two associations."

Author: "Chapman, Katie"
Title: "There's a lot riding on the new council"
description: "Investigates the issues facing the new Greater Wellington regional council. Presents information about the region and names the candidates contesting the election."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Our precious birds that never really take off"
description: "Features the annual 'bird of the year' competition run by NZ Forest & Bird. Talks to conservation advocate Nicola Vallance about the competition, in which well-known people act as 'campaign managers' to promote a particular bird. Describes some of NZ's lesser-known birds that struggle to garner votes in the contest. Informs that voting for the bird of the year closes on 13 Oct 2010."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Reflecting on NZ film's heady mix of colonial can-do and romance"
description: "Interviews the chief executive of the Film Archive."

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Sex for tea"
description: "Investigates a complaint made by Gerhard Sundborn and upheld by the Broadcasting Standards Authority (BSA) regarding sexual material screened in the G-time band.  Presents TVNZ's Andy Shaw's views on generational changes in storytelling, business demands, and parental responsibility. Quotes therapist Diane Levy who agrees with parents calling for stricter time controls on adult content and alerts to the disconnect between television portrayal and real life. Lists programmes dating from 1967 that have shown controversial content."

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "Racist? Not us, mate; A race relations haven, or a country simmering with racism?"
description: "Investigates whether racism is an issue in NZ, and its manifestations and effects. Cites comment from Victoria University Professor James Liu from the Centre for Applied Cross-Cultural Research, Office of Ethnic Affairs director Mervin Singham, Euroasia director Kenneth Leong, the senior research fellow for the Centre for Asian and Migrant Health Research, author Malcolm Mulholland and Wellington Chinese Assn spokesman Steven Young. Presents data about Asians and Pacific people in NZ. Seeks the views of comedian Oscar Kightley, Race Relations Commissioner Joris de Bres and immigration consultant David Cooper"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "The ideas man, not the enforcer; Athfield the young rebel now 'that learned go-to guy'"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-born veteran architect about his selection by the NZ Institute of Architects to serve as an 'architectural ambassador'. Talks about his decision to donate some of his time over the next six weeks to help his hometown recover from the earthquake. Describes some of the iconic buildings he has created in Wellington and his influence on the capital and NZ."

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "KiwiRail survival plan is 'on track'; Plan to revive New Zealand's rail system hailed, flailed"
description: "Investigates reaction to the $4.6 billion 'turnaround' plan to revive NZ's rail freight network. Talks to supporters and detractors of the plan, which would be supported by both Government and private industry. Asks where the money will come from, and why a 10-year plan is needed."

Author: "Johns, Bryce"
Title: "Wild ride lives on in our psyche"
description: "Chats with Contiki bus tours founder John Anderson about his book on the tourism company. Discusses the initial idea for the trip through Europe, the loss of the entire business, some memories of Contiki participants, and the business lessons learned. Includes an extract from his book."

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "Golden opportunity to revitalise Christchurch"
description: "Focuses on opportunities to revitalise the city centre following the Christchurch earthquake. Sums up a presentation in Wellington by Hamish Doig and Evan Harris of Colliers International Christchurch."

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "Marrying cultures"
description: "Biographical material. Informs of the exhibition 'Nga Kahahu : change & exchange - costumes by Jo Torr and cloaks by Roka Ngarimu-Cameron, Pataka, Porirua, until Feb 2011."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Giving it all away; Charitable thoughts"
description: "Talks to philanthropists about their motives for donating large portions of their wealth before they die. Seeks comment from Robyn Scott of Philanthropy NZ about changes to donation practices. Informs that Chris Finlayson, Minister for Arts, Culture and Heritage, has established a taskforce to encourage wealthy people to contribute to the arts. Discusses some of the benefits NZ has gained from US philanthropists."

Author: "Monahan, Kate"
Title: "The gender test"
description: "Investigates the increasingly popular practice amongst parents to have antenatal ultrasound scanning to ascertain the gender of their unborn child. Talks to several mothers about their experiences, including  situations where the scan incorrectly indicated the gender of their children, and to a mother who prefers not to know her child's gender until it is born. Talks to radiographer Diane Somerville and sonographer Karen Lissington of Hamilton Radiology about the technology they use to determine gender. Seeks comment from University of Waikato psychology professor Jane Ritchie about whether parents are placing gender expectations on babies before they are born. The author reveals her own decision about her unborn child."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "The artful Roger"
description: "Talks to the MP and founder of the ACT party about its recent troubles and his career in politics and business. Comments on the Labour Party reforms in the 1980s, his falling out with then-prime minister David Lange and his political views."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Space craft"
description: "Talks to Arindan Sen and Sam Martin of Foundation Architects and to award-winning architect Gerald Parsonson about how they reused existing layouts to renovate two Wellington homes."

Author: "Zwartz, Hannah"
Title: "Growing a good square-metre meal"
description: "Focuses on how to grow food in a small garden. Includes a book review."

Author: "Mirfin, Zane"
Title: "Into the wild"
description: "Discusses his experience of fishing the large and wild river north of Westport. Describes the recent battle between conservationists and others over the plan by Meridian Energy to build a dam in the lower gorge that will flood 14km of inaccessible river wilderness. Seeks views of the fishing author and Nelson fly fishing guide Tony Entwistle about the plan to dam the river."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Our moment of war madness"
description: "Talks to the author about NZ's role in the Great War and its effects on the nation. Asserts that NZ made a mistake in entering the war, and acted criminally in attacking countries that had not attacked NZ."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "When will the next one hit?"
description: "Talks to Robert Yates, professor emeritus in geoscience at Oregon State University, about his work and that of other geoscientists to improve the ability to predict earthquakes. Comments on the comparisons between the Canterbury and Haiti earthquakes, and expresses concern for other parts of NZ that have significant geological faults. Includes a map of the Alpine Fault."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Demise of democracy?"
description: "Reports on the passage of the CERRA and other legislation that gives Government sweeping legal authority and extraordinary powers until Apr 2012 to rebuild the city. Seeks comment from constitutional law specialists Dean Knight and Andrew Geddis, and from ministers and politicians who reside in the affected areas about whether the legislation breaches civil liberties."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "The right architect for this job?"
description: "Asks if the Christchurch-born and raised architect, appointed by Christchurch Mayor Bob Parker as the 'architectural ambassador' for the city, is the most appropriate person for the task of providing advice in the wake of the earthquake. Overviews his career and seeks views of Christchurch architects Peter Beaven and Wellington urban historian Ben Schrader."

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Winter war games"
description: "The journalism student reports on her experiences of accompanying the Queen Alexandra's Mounted Rifles (QAMR) soldiers to winter manoeuvres at Tekapo Military Camp and Waiouru Military Camp."

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "Plan to revive railway hailed, flailed; Railway plan hailed, flailed; China leads the way in rail renaissance"
description: "Investigates reaction to the $4.6 billion 'turnaround' plan to revive NZ's rail freight network. Talks to supporters and detractors of the plan, which would be supported by both Government and private industry. Asks where the money will come from, and why a 10-year plan is needed."

Author: "Monahan, Kate"
Title: "The gender test; Life put into perspective"
description: "Investigates the increasingly popular practice amongst parents to have antenatal ultrasound scanning to ascertain the gender of their unborn child. Talks to several mothers about their experiences, including  situations where the scan incorrectly indicated the gender of their children, and to a mother who prefers not to know her child's gender until it is born. Talks to radiographer Diane Somerville and sonographer Karen Lissington of Hamilton Radiology about the technology they use to determine gender. Seeks comment from University of Waikato psychology professor Jane Ritchie about whether parents are placing gender expectations on babies before they are born. Talks to the mother who was in the midst of giving birth to her daughter during the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake in Canterbury."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Giving it all away; Charitable thoughts"
description: "Talks to philanthropists about their motives for donating large portions of their wealth before they die. Seeks comment from Robyn Scott of Philanthropy NZ about changes to donation practices. Informs that Chris Finlayson, Minister for Arts, Culture and Heritage, has established a taskforce to encourage wealthy people to contribute to the arts. Discusses some of the benefits NZ has gained from US philanthropists."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Space craft"
description: "Talks to Arindan Sen and Sam Martin of Foundation Architects and to award-winning architect Gerald Parsonson about how they reused existing layouts to renovate two Wellington homes."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Our moment of war madness"
description: "Talks to the author about NZ's role in the Great War and its effects on the nation. Asserts that NZ made a mistake in entering the war, and acted criminally in attacking countries that had not attacked NZ."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Is pay parity a pipe-dream?"
description: "Investigates the drive for NZ to reach pay parity with Australia as recommended by the 2025 Taskforce set up by the NZ Government. Talks to various political and economic leaders about their views on the issue. Presents Sir Roger Douglas' solution to deliver the productivity growth necessary for NZ to close the Trans-Tasman wage gap. Lists the members of the 2025 Taskforce panel."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Quake upstages SCF aftershocks"
description: "Provides a general report on the impact of the Canterbury earthquake with an emphasis on property in Christchurch. Notes the recent payout to South Canterbury Finance (SFC) investors by the government deposit guarantee scheme. Provides Standard & Poor's Rating Services view on the financial impact of the earthquake."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "When NZ dollars aren't enough"
description: "Offers advice on foreign currency accounts (forex accounts). Talks about why someone would want an account in a foreign currency, how to open one, and the likely fees."

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "Charity begins at home, reform begins in Wellington"
description: "Reports on the changes registered charities will have to make because of upcoming reforms. Looks at how the reforms will apply to some Christian investment funds. Talks to Grant Hope, chief executive of Anglican-owned Trust Investment Management (TIM) about the changes."

Title: "Commission absorbs cost shock"
description: "Looks at how the Earthquake Commission (EQC) will fund the claims from the Canterbury earthquake. Provides information on the claims process for homeowners with earthquake (or aftershock) damaged properties, and the customer assistance bank packages available in the Canterbury region from ASB and ANZ National."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "A timely reminder about councils"
description: "Backgrounds the Whakatane District Council v Bay of Plenty Region Council [2010] NZ Court of Appeal 346 case about the location of the head office of Environment Bay of Plenty (EBOP)."

Author: "Masters Catherine"
Title: "Tax changes mix give and take"
description: "Considers how the Government's tax cuts, coupled with the rise of GST to 15%, will affect average NZers. Talks to a number of people sporting differing opinions about the tax changes. Includes tables outlining the differences, and refers to a website where you can calculate your income and determine how the changes will affect you individually."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "DIY butter substitute better bet for adults"
description: "Decodes and analyses the ingredients in butter substitutes. Points out the essential differences between butter and table spread, and what makes their ingredients more or less healthy, depending on your being a child or an adult. Gives a basic guide to how to make your own butter, incorporating olive oil."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Samoa's survivors pick up their shattered lives"
description: "Investigates the state of the tsunami-ravaged island and its people, one year on from the catastrophe."

Author: "King, David"
Title: "Bitter mood in Hubbard's town as the Beetle runs out of gas"
description: "Reports on how Timaru feels after the collapse of South Canterbury Finance (SCF). Comments on Finance Minister Bill English misjudging what it meant to the region. Notes the role Allan Hubbard and SCF play in the community. Backgrounds the rise and fall of Hubbard and SCF, and identifies who and what people are blamed for the collapse."

Author: "Alexander, Mike"
Title: "Teenage terrier is stymied by NZRU"
description: "Teenage terrier is stymied by NZRU"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "The chase is still on"
description: "Reports on the renewed high-level pressure on police bosses to review pursuit policy, in the wake of sixteen people having recently died as a result of vehicle pursuits by police."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Cup of unity"
description: "Talks to Rugby World Cup (RWC) boss Martin Snedden, focussing on the myth that we are a stadium of four million, and how many in NZ are disinterested in, or dislike, rugby. Talks about ways to get people to buy in to the cup and to attend RWC matches. Backgrounds his association with previous unpopular tours, including his brother Pat's involvement in protests against the '81 Springbok tour. Discusses the political aspects of cup preparations, including altering the school terms and special cup liquor licences."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Party planner"
description: "Talks to Rugby World Cup (RWC) Festival director Briony Ellis about creating an experience that will lure visitors back to NZ. Discusses the planning and ideas behind the festival and how it will work, as well as the make-up of those visiting NZ during the cup."

Author: "Rapson, Bevan"
Title: "Games fears hyping 'sense of crisis'"
description: "Looks at the attitudes of some of the NZ competitors in the upcoming Commonwealth Games in Delhi, given the sense of rising concern over the facilities not being ready and alleged security risks. Discusses hype and speculation within the context of such events."

Author: "Blundell, Kay"
Title: "Glider pilot's crash landing was his second"
description: "Glider pilot's crash landing was his second"

Title: "Accused denied bail in fatal pursuit cases"
description: "Accused denied bail in fatal pursuit cases"

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Ricardo Simich"
description: "Talks to the professional public relations host, involved in NZ Fashion Week as being in charge of seating the VIPs in the front two rows."

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Man admitted killing stepson, court told"
description: "Man admitted killing stepson, court told"

Title: "Judge cautions man who left baby in car"
description: "Judge cautions man who left baby in car"

Author: "Torrie, Bronwyn"
Title: "Neighbours heard screams as 99-year-old attacked"
description: "Neighbours heard screams as 99-year-old attacked"

Title: "Misconduct midwife quits profession"
description: "Misconduct midwife quits profession"

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "Let's raise the curtain again"
description: "Laments the fact that Auckland, once a city rich in live theatre, has just two historic ones remaining, and makes a special plea for the revival of the Mercury Theatre."

Title: "Smoke, sweat and tears as farriers hone their skills"
description: "Smoke, sweat and tears as farriers hone their skills"

Title: "Girls' terror tactics 'appalling'"
description: "Girls' terror tactics 'appalling'"

Author: "Ash, Julie"
Title: "Sir Archie Taiaroa dies after stroke"
description: "Sir Archie Taiaroa dies after stroke"

Author: "Oliver, Stacey"
Title: "Ex-partner charged as police search for dismembered body"
description: "Ex-partner charged as police search for dismembered body"

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Celebrating masculinity in dance"
description: "Profiles the annual Tempo dance festival, this year celebrating the male dancer. Talks to Douglas Wright, the festival's celebrated choreographer. Lists the performers, dates and venues of the festival."

Title: "German visit builds on Kiwi hero's compassion"
description: "German visit builds on Kiwi hero's compassion"

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Family believe killer had 'crush' on victim"
description: "Family believe killer had 'crush' on victim"

Author: "Rotherham, Fiona"
Title: "Risk-taker Taylor rides out 'perfect storm'"
description: "Risk-taker Taylor rides out 'perfect storm'"

Author: "Williamson, Cameron"
Title: "Invigorating side-effects of a jolly good ride; Spinning the wheels"
description: "Invigorating side-effects of a jolly good ride; Spinning the wheels"

Author: "Bidwell, Hamish"
Title: "It's a tall order being tagged as the new Irene"
description: "It's a tall order being tagged as the new Irene"

Author: "Gifford, Adam"
Title: "The best kind of speed camera"
description: "Discusses the latest exhibition by Alex Monteith, at the Govett-Brewster Gallery, which documents the passion fuelling those who live life in the fast lane."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "Breaking the eight-hour barrier"
description: "Talks to NZ athlete Terenzo Bozzone, about his ambition to be NZ's first 'King of Kona', breaking the record for completing Hawai'i's peak ironman event."

Author: "Parker, Tamsyn"
Title: "KiwiSaver turns 3; Cautious early steps paying off; Automatic enrolment boon for first-home buyer"
description: "Looks at the history of KiwiSaver on its third anniversary. Scrutinises how well it is working, and why the author is cashing up, given that more than 1.5 million NZers have $6 billion tied up in the scheme. Outlines some experts' views on the scheme."

Author: "Gill South"
Title: "In her shoes"
description: "Talks to four women about their love of beautiful footwear, and gains tips on how to indulge."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "The wrong stuff"
description: "Discusses what appear to be political errors in NZ history, in the context of Kathryn Schulz's book, Being wrong: adventures in the margin of error, which questions the way mistakes are viewed. Gives short descriptions of some blunders, including Act's cover-up of David Garrett's criminal actions, Robert Muldoon's Think Big projects, Arnold Nordmeyer's black budget, and David Lange and Jim Bolger's inadvertent promises for electoral reform. Contends some of these may not qualify on account of their positive outcomes."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Disappearing Act?"
description: "Considers the fallout of the exit from the Act party of David Garrett. Suggests and describes a variety of scenarios: the demise (or reinvention) of the Act party, Act MPs joining National or New Zealand First, the strengthening of a Labour coalition, or the creation of a new right-wing party along the lines of the US Tea Party."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "A cheeky little number ..."
description: "Investigates the rise of the pinot noir grape as the new celebrity NZ wine, overtaking sauvignon blanc in popularity. Talks to pinot expert John Saker to find out how the winemaker's wine has become NZ's new international champion. Lists Saker's 5 unforgettable NZ pinots."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Death becomes her"
description: "Talks to the full-time Auckland coroner and part-time opera singer with the NZ Opera Company, about the unusual, yet not completely incongruous juxtaposition of her two careers."

Author: "Green, Paula,"
Author (detailed): "Paula Green, Craig Sisterson and Graham Hepburn"
Title: "Travel strains stranger in fiction; A capital crime novel; Picture books"
description: "Book reviews of recent releases."

Author: "Middleton, Julie"
Title: "Who's scared of India?"
description: "Warns that NZ businesses are too centred on China and not focused enough on India. Notes potential areas for trade, perceived barriers, some successful NZ export companies, and NZers' ineffective attitudes and negotiation skills, including inexperience with 'facilitation payments'. Advises of the bodies and programmes available to support Kiwi businesses. Quotes Victoria University associate professor in marketing and international business Val Lindsay's advice and reasons for optimism. Touches on NZers' experiences of travelling to India, a profile of a middle-class Indian family, Indian immigration to NZ, and comparisons of doing business in China and India."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Wheel within wheels"
description: "Talks to John Anderson, founder of Contiki Holidays, about his self-published book on the vicissitudes of his career, including the loss of the entire tourism business. Discusses business advice, dramatic stories of tours in Europe, admissions of controlling behaviour, and his plans for baby boomer tours to South America."

Author: "Somerset, Guy"
Title: "The dawn chorus"
description: "Talks to the writer and radio producer Chris Bourke about his book on NZ popular music from 1918 to 1964. Discusses some of the genres covered - dance bands, jazz, and Maori music. Notes the book's sources, and documents other works on NZ music history. Chats about which music and musicians attracted international attention (including the song 'Blue smoke'), how cultural snobbery and protectionist record companies were subverted, and the liveliness of the live venues."

Author: "White, Helen Watson"
Title: "NZ poetry 101"
description: "Reviews the book by poets Paula Green and Harry Ricketts that aims to make NZ poetry accessible to a wide audience."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Playing favourites"
description: "Reviews Verses, a series of new dances by choreographer Neil Ieremia, performed by Black Grace, Maidment Theatre, 15 to 25 September, and part of Tempo: NZ's Festival of Dance, until 31 October."

Author: "Sandys, Elspeth"
Title: "Serious laughter"
description: "Reviews the latest work by the Indian Ink Theatre Company, played by Jacob Rajan and directed by Justin Lewis. Plays at the Downstage Theatre, Wellington until 2 October; Meteor Theatre, Hamilton, 5 to 10 October; and Century Theatre, Napier, 13 to 16 October."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Attack of the killer sandflies"
description: "Describes leishmaniasis, a disease caused by a type of sandfly and the world's second largest parasitic killer. Notes the forms taken by the disease and the reasons for its obscurity. Reports on a drug developed by University of Auckland's Auckland Cancer Society Research Centre and the royalty-free licensing agreement arranged for its development. Talks to  Centre director Professor Bill Denny about the development, efficacy, and funding of the drug."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Hype or tripe?"
description: "Explains ways to read labels and information about food without being confused by messages that are misleading or lack credibility. Notes the protection afforded by Dietary Supplement Regulations and Supplemented Food Standards, yet advises consumers to remain diligent."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Making census"
description: "Describes the Census of Marine Life, a ten-year initiative to assess and explain the diversity, distribution and abundance of marine life in the oceans. Looks at National Institute of Water & Atmospheric Research (Niwa) contributions to the Census: CenSeam, which is studying marine life on underwater mountains; the study of ecosystems based on chemical not solar energy (chemosynthetic ecosystems) such as hydrothermal vents, whale falls, and wood falls; and a 2008 voyage by the research vessel Tangaroa to the Ross Sea for a collaborative collection of Antarctic habitat samples. Notes the Census finale that is taking place in London, October 2010, at which will be announced the estimate of all known marine species."

Author: "Wood, Stacey"
Title: "Former model still has that wow factor"
description: "Former model still has that wow factor"

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Kiwi novelist short-listed for lucrative British prize"
description: "Kiwi novelist short-listed for lucrative British prize"

Title: "Stuntman who broke neck fails to get compo increased"
description: "Stuntman who broke neck fails to get compo increased"

Title: "Shirts with a loud and clear message"
description: "Shirts with a loud and clear message"

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "Wanted Petherick takes another blow to the wallet"
description: "Wanted Petherick takes another blow to the wallet"

Author: "Watson, MIke"
Title: "Anchor watch might have saved crew of grounded fishing boad"
description: "Anchor watch might have saved crew of grounded fishing boad"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Surplus food 'a treat' for the needy"
description: "Surplus food 'a treat' for the needy"

Title: "Spitfire salutes 'one of finest military sons'"
description: "Spitfire salutes 'one of finest military sons'"

Author: "Watson, MIke"
Title: "Schoolteacher guilty of downloading child porn"
description: "Schoolteacher guilty of downloading child porn"

Author: "Geenty, Mark"
Title: "'Little' Kiwi ready to grapple with the giants"
description: "'Little' Kiwi ready to grapple with the giants"

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "Debt to society"
description: "Talks to financial journalist Bernard Hickey about his fascination with debt, citizen journalism and setting up the site www.interest.co.nz. Backgrounds his career."

Author: "Coughlan, Kate"
Title: "Not one for this world"
description: "Recalls her relationship with the Bassett Rd murderer Ronald Jorgensen. Covers his conviction, jail time in Mt Eden's maximum security wing and Addington Prison. Recounts an interview with him in Kaikoura after being released, talking about his painting and writing. Ponders whether Jorgensen died in the 1984 car crash or whether he engineered his escape."

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "Sins of the fathers"
description: "Reviews the book Settlers' Creek by Carl Nixon."

Author: "Oram, Rod"
Title: "The harsh truth on Hubbard"
description: "Considers the circumstances surrounding the failure of South Canterbury Finance and the repercussions."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "New chief reshaping technology provider"
description: "Reports on the activities of the information technology company which distributes Apple products. Talks to its chief executive, who was appointed to the role in Jan 2010. Focuses on his vision for the firm to become a world leading supplier of IT services."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Middle aged dread"
description: "Examines the effects of reaching middle age, focusing on the physiological aspects occurring from the mid-thirties onward. Seeks comment from Phil Sheard, senior lecturer in physiology at the University of Otago School of Medicine. Touches on the psychology of aging and the financial health of people aged between 40 and 60."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Called upon to Act"
description: "Interviews the lawyer and mother of three who became the newest ACT list MP after the resignation of David Garrett. Describes her first involvement in politics and her right-leaning views. Comments on her business interests and her support of party leader Rodney Hide."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Builders of a city; The Naylor story; The Love story; Together as one"
description: "Commemorates the centenary of the firm, now NZ's fourth-largest construction company. Talks to Rosemarie Patterson, who has written the centennial history of the company, about its history, including the merger of W H Naylor and Love Construction (formerly Love Brothers) in 1969. Asks current managing director Trevor Kempton for his opinion of the most significant buildings erected by the company over its past 10 decades."

Author: "Gavin McLean"
Title: "Something novel for the historian; Interpreting handwritten clues to her Latvian family; Noted; Young adults"
description: "Something novel for the historian; Interpreting handwritten clues to her Latvian family; Noted; Young adults"

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Stream of consciousness"
description: "Talks to the Invercargill-born, Luggate-raised singer-songwriter about the motivation for her award-winning song 'Mr H‚ÇÇO', written to promote the non-profit organisation Global Clean Water (GCW). Informs that her upcoming solo LP album 'Einey Meiny Miney Mo' will be released in Oct 2010."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Former lawyer pays high price for habit"
description: "Former lawyer pays high price for habit"

Author: "Lang, Sarah"
Title: "Andy Whitfield and the fight of his life"
description: "Talks to the Auckland-based actor who has stood down from the hit show after a recurrence of non-Hodgkins lymphoma."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "The hole in your pocket"
description: "Reports on the impact of the 1 October 2010 tax cuts and the rise in GST for different jobs. Talks to three families earning low, middle and high incomes about their expectations and what they plan to do with the extra money. Tables the results of an Auckland Chamber of Commerce study into the pay rates for various jobs between 2003 and 2010."

Author: "Hathaway, Jude"
Title: "Mark of Nom*D"
description: "Talks to designer Margarita Robertson about the presentation of its 2011 winter collection 'Danse Macabre', NZ Fashion Week, Auckland, Sep 2010. Mentions other Dunedin designers who showed their collections at the 10th anniversary event."

Author: "Hartevelt, John"
Title: "Land grab"
description: "Reports on the amount of NZ land being sold to foreign investors. Reveals how much of the sold land is in sheep, beef, cattle and viticulture. Explains how some foreign buyers are rumoured to use local contacts to set up a NZ company that makes the land purchase on their behalf. Looks also at the current rules for purchasing land in NZ and how these will change in December."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Out of hardship, love"
description: "Talks to director Louise Petherbridge about directing the world premiere of play by the octogenarian NZer, Globe Theatre, 8-17 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts"

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "The Hobbit's little people revolt"
description: "Uncovers The Hobbit disputes over pay, conditions and contracts between Peter Jackson and actors' unions."

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "Police fear violence if All Blacks fail at cup"
description: "Envisages domestic violence levels will go up if the All Blacks lose next year's Rugby World Cup. Compares figures with sporting events around the world."

Title: "A spiritual homecoming"
description: "Previews 'Taonga : dust, water, wind', by the Atamira Dance Company, Kings and Queens Performing Arts Centre, Dunedin, 15-16 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts. Talks to the Dunedin-born and bred choreographer and dancer about the production, inspired by the memories of her aunt, who grew up at Kaka Point."

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Air force high-flier aiming for shot at top defence job"
description: "Profiles Air Vice-Marshal Graham Lintott, the boss of the RNZAF, he works in Defence headquarters in Wellington. Looks back at his former civilian life and how he got into the Air force. Talks about his interesting career, life in the RNZAF and comments on the forthcoming arrival of eight NH90s and five Agusta 109 helicopters."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Harbour' by Inge Doesburg, The Artist's Room, Dunedin. Reviews works by Tony Fomison, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin. Reviews 'Surfscapes' by eight local surfers/artists, Green Island Gallery, Dunedin, until 31 Oct 2010."

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "Mixed prognosis for new health boards"
description: "Comments on the changes taking place with the Capital & Coast and Hutt Valley District Health Boards and the financial deficits facing both organizations. Reveals information about child health, older people's health, board governance and paediatric oncology."

Author: "Katterns, Tanya"
Title: "One district but three distinct towns"
description: "Contemplates the district of South Wairarapa and the recent controversies concerning the council there. Discusses some previous proposals such as Le Cordon Bleu Institute cooking school, a wind farm by Meridian Energy and a multimillion-dollar upgrade of Greytown town hall."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Ecological crown jewels lack protection"
description: "Calls for the protection and conservation of lands that are recognised for their high ecological values, as they may be vulnerable to mining applications. Highlights the local government and environment select committee hearing due to take place next month as a forum to discuss whether certain protected areas should be added to Schedule 4."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Dear friend ..."
description: "Listens to old school friends of 40 years Janice Marriott and Virginia Pawsey authors of The common table, a tale of two kitchens. Discusses their emailing relationship and the book."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "An epic production"
description: "Reports on the race against time to save ageing films at the NZ film archive. Explains how the material of the old films (i.e. cellulose nitrate) is causing their imminent decay. Uncovers the conservation processors. Talks to staff at the archives about the material needing preserving."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "For the love of kids"
description: "Chats with NZ's oldest mum, Lyn Mason, now 61 and husband Ian, 62 about how they cope with their two young children and other people's curiosity. Speaks of the years of infertility, IVF treatment and miscarriages."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "House proud"
description: "Reflects on some moments in history connected with Government House. Traces back to when it was first built and occupied by Lord Islington and his wife."

Author: "Zwartz, Hannah"
Title: "Gardener's little helper"
description: "Divulges useful information about selecting and keeping chickens for laying eggs and benefiting your garden."

Author: "Torrie, Bronwyn"
Title: "Sex-abusing ex-principal sent to jail"
description: "Sex-abusing ex-principal sent to jail"

Author: "Howe, Jonathon"
Title: "Months on the run from the Gestapo"
description: "Months on the run from the Gestapo"

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Quiz junkies"
description: "Delves into the world of pub quiz nights. Talks to several pub quiz hosts about why they are so popular."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "For the love of kids"
description: "Chats with NZ's oldest mum, Lyn Mason, now 61 and husband Ian, 62 about how they cope with their two young children and other people's curiosity. Speaks of the years of infertility, IVF treatment and miscarriages."

Title: "Masterful study of Akaroa's history"
description: "Masterful study of Akaroa's history"

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "Division bells ring in basin"
description: "Talks to Mackenzie Basin farmer Dan Thomas about the new challenges of farming on that land. Mentions cubicle dairy farming and how this might affect the land."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Smarter painting; Be aware of the dangers of lead"
description: "Advises on the potential dangers of painting the walls of your home, particularly if the paint contains volatile organic compounds (VOCs). Describes new paint formulations which are more environmentally friendly and less toxic to consumers. Talks to spokespersons from the Otago Regional Council and the Dunedin City Council about how to dispose of paint in an environmentally responsible manner. Lists tips for cleaning paintbrushes and other equipment. Warns of the dangers of lead-based paint used in old houses, and how to remove it safely."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Triathlete living the dream; Seven keys to success"
description: "Talks to the triathlete about her new coaching business, Sweat7. Expounds on her seven keys to success. Informs that she will soon be competing at the world 70.3 (half Ironman) championships, Florida, USA."

Author: "Todd, Rebecca"
Title: "Split hurts the brain"
description: "Debates the status of Dunedin's Hospital in light of the DHB's proposal for neurosurgery services to be based in Christchurch. Argues the case for and against the changes."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "The quake files"
description: "Takes an interesting look at whether there is any connection between whale beachings, unusual animal behaviours, tidal forces, chemtrails, mining and oil drilling and more with earthquakes."

Author: "Gillingham, Marianne"
Title: "Singing mayor strays off key in campaign"
description: "Looks at the local body career of the current mayor of Gisborne and his 2010 mayoralty campaign. Talks about his family background."

Author: "Taylor, Mark"
Title: "Mikey Havoc"
description: "Interviews the TV and radio presenter Mikey Havoc who has recently completed the ‚ÄúAre you my tribe‚Äù programmes. Considers how much he has learnt about different iwi and about the background to making the series."

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "The toll of leading a city's recovery"
description: "Speaks to the Christchurch mayor about his personal and practical response to the Darfield earthquake. Evaluates his odds in the upcoming mayoral election and conveys his changed attitude to politics."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Lie of the land"
description: "Discusses the issues around the one in five dairy farmers who are battling to overcome debt accumulated during the long dairy land price boom that came to a crashing halt with the recession two years ago. Airs also the arguments for and against overseas land sales."

Author: "Lewis, Paul,"
Title: "Canoeing crisis Sparcs row; A case of bully-boy tactics; Minister singles out Ferg"
description: "Reports on the power struggles, splits and personality clashes within Canoe Racing NZ and the role Sparc and the Minister of Sport, Murray McGully, may have played in undermining the national canoeing coaches Paul MacDonald and Ian Ferguson. Talks to Paul MacDonald, Ian Ferguson, and Canoe Racing NZ board member Alan Thompson about the problems."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Five years, is that all we've got?"
description: "Warns that New Zealand and its farmers need to start cleaning up its act as far as global warming issues are concerned. Speaks with Australian climate change crusader Tim Flannery about how the rest of the world, USA and China in particular are working towards reducing carbon emissions."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "It's just not British"
description: "Considers the relevance of today's Commonwealth games and the benefits of belonging to the Commonwealth."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Second sight"
description: "Reports on a trip to Malomedi, South Africa, to cover the work of the global OneSight Foundation that provides eye care and eyewear to people who cannot afford it. Talks to Auckland optometrist Anna Maitland about her work with OneSight and relays the story of a Malomedi woman now wearing glasses originally purchased in Greymouth."

Author: "Alderson, Andrew"
Title: "Elderly Papatoetoe duo line up for Falklands"
description: "Elderly Papatoetoe duo line up for Falklands"

Author: "Lang, Sarah"
Title: "When worlds collide"
description: "Talks to Rawiri Paratene about his role in the film adaptation of Mike Riddell's novel 'The insatiable moon' set in the Auckland suburb of Ponsonby."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Hooked on storytelling"
description: "Speaks to NZ's biggest-selling author about her latest work (a memoir) and discusses her contribution to children's reading in NZ and abroad, and her international writing workshops. Covers also the highs and lows of her life, her retreat house in Fish Bay, Marlborough Sounds, and her uncanny connection to the journalist."

Author: "Yeoman, Paula"
Title: "First ladies of rock"
description: "Looks at the recent trend for women to dominate the music charts and awards ceremonies in NZ and worldwide. Talks to musicians Sharon O'Neill, Gin Wigmore, Anika Moa, and Hollie Smith, and the head of Sony NZ, Kim Boshier, about the trend."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Captain perfect"
description: "Profiles the ex All Blacks captain, Sir Wilson Whineray and talks about his biography ‚ÄúA perfect gentleman‚Äù. Shares some sporting memories."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Captain perfect"
description: "Profiles the ex All Blacks captain, Sir Wilson Whineray and talks about his biography 'A perfect gentleman'. Shares some sporting memories."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "At her majesty's service"
description: "Interviews the Governor-General in his final year of office, revealing the meaning of his name, his views on formality, his support for MMP, the fundamentals of his role, and the three themes on which he prefers to speak publicly."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Dining in the dark"
description: "Appraises the forthcoming the Blind Dining Experience that will be held in Wellington on October 4th, 11th and 12th. Explains how this is billed as a ‚Äúsensory adventure‚Äù to raise awareness of World Sight Day on October 14th."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Pick or mix"
description: "Refers to various published guidelines for children and adolescents in recommending how much tea and coffee they should drink, also how and when in order to maximise nutritional value."

Author: "Whelan, Arthur"
Title: "Kick-arts"
description: "Describes several NZ branches of Dr Sketchy, a New-York originated anti-art school movement that features drawing classes (and performances) with character-driven themes. Notes its growing popularity, its success in a NZ prison, and the NZ preference for pop culture over burlesque themes."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Outside the square"
description: "Praises the new innovative design and construction of commercial buildings using radiate pine, which is earthquake resistant, greener, cheaper and quicker to build."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Features a home-kill butcher from Gordonton, sketching out his typical work day and explaining how slaughtering is carried out."

Author: "Hart, Anna"
Title: "For the love of dog"
description: "Discovers that NZers' affinity for pets is creating a luxury pet market, verified by dog kennel owners Rob Ellis and Carole Ellis. Covers statistics on NZ pet ownership, the roles animals play in human lives, and day-care centres for dogs."

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "Stand by me"
description: "Talks to Amanda Colquhoun and members of her family and support group about how they dealt with, and helped with, her experience of breast cancer."

Author: "Bryant, Grant"
Title: "Experienced and talented skydive pilot named"
description: "Experienced and talented skydive pilot named"

Author: "Lamont, Sarah,"
Title: "Heart recipient can't wait to get driver's licence"
description: "Heart recipient can't wait to get driver's licence"

Author: "Baker, Che"
Title: "Museum exhibit will pay tribute to philanthropist"
description: "Museum exhibit will pay tribute to philanthropist"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "The fat of the land"
description: "Reports on a new study that reveals the food animals consume on NZ farms makes its way to us as trans fats and may play a part in cardiovascular disease. Reveals the findings from an observational study led by Dr. Jocelyne Benatar at the Cardiovascular Research Unit of Auckland City Hospital. Shows the palm kernel-based trans fat (palmitelaidic acid) does not originate from processed food but comes from our dairy food. Postulates what our cows are being fed is coming up through the food chain, 'the ruminant bacteria in cows' stomachs are making it into trans fat and that trans fat we get'. Indicates the possibility that natural trans fats may play a part in polyvascular disease which Dr. Benatar wants to investigate further. Includes some basic facts associated with trans fats 'The basic fats of the matter' that has been adapted from Food Standards Australia New Zealand and New Zealand Food and Safety Authority information sheets."

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "Prices put faith in future of harness racing with buy"
description: "Prices put faith in future of harness racing with buy"

Author: "Savory, Logan"
Title: "Wiegersma keeps mission in focus"
description: "Wiegersma keeps mission in focus"

Title: "Talented young players heading for Australia"
description: "Talented young players heading for Australia"

Author: "Crayton-Brown, Kimberley"
Title: "Designer looks forward to Melbourne photo shoot for collection"
description: "Designer looks forward to Melbourne photo shoot for collection"

Author: "Johnston, Chris"
Title: "My time to shine : Wanaka photogher gets recognition"
description: "My time to shine : Wanaka photogher gets recognition"

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "Hazlett calls time on fine career"
description: "Hazlett calls time on fine career"

Title: "Life changing diagnosis prompted career move"
description: "Life changing diagnosis prompted career move"

Author: "Johnston, Chris"
Title: "Brok's flying the South Island flag"
description: "Brok's flying the South Island flag"

Title: "A love for children shown in lifetime of good works"
description: "A love for children shown in lifetime of good works"

Author: "Egan, Brendon"
Title: "Southern shooter ready to take on world at Delhi Games"
description: "Southern shooter ready to take on world at Delhi Games"

Author: "Crayton- Brown, Kimberley"
Title: "Five Rivers artist to exhibit in New York"
description: "Five Rivers artist to exhibit in New York"

Author: "Chilton, Chris"
Title: "Southern photographers snap up New Zealand awards"
description: "Southern photographers snap up New Zealand awards"

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Is Auckland's 'urban village' ideal straying off course?"
description: "Evaluates the Britomart urban development project. Suggests from an urban design and public amenity viewpoint there are signs that Britomart is veering off track. Notes a flashpoint has come with the private plan change allowing developers to build a high rise luxury hotel on the sailors' home/Schooner Tavern site on Quay Street. Mentions the difficulty in imaging how Britomart will end up looking like particularly with the project having a long gestation."

Author: "Jamieson, Debbie"
Title: "Crash report pleases pilot's brother"
description: "Crash report pleases pilot's brother"

Author: "Burdon, Nathan"
Title: "Sharks player guilty of assault"
description: "Sharks player guilty of assault"

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Battling actors have a hobbit on their side"
description: "Talks to Ian Mune about the ongoing dispute between actors and Peter Jackson, the NZ director, about the employment arrangements in the making of the film called the Hobbit. Outlines the protagonists in the dispute and the part they are playing, the point they are trying to make and attempts to evaluate the effect this is having on NZ's film industry and reputation."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Unusual bedfellows fight against P"
description: "Describes the alliance between Salvation Army and Mongrel Mob to help get gang members away from drugs. Reports a rehabilitation centre was found in Kakahi, near Taumarunui, where those being treated, including family, could be isolated. Comments the programme included drug and alcohol education, problem solving skills, behavioural techniques, classes on healthy eating and exercise, relationship skills and parenting and a big MaÃÑori language and cultural component provided by Francis Te Maari. Includes 'Gang leader paid by trust to help addicts'."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Sir Colin Meads"
description: "Interviews Sir Colin Meads and broaches the topic of books that have been written about him. Intimates that he cannot understand what all the fuss is about and why he is considered a celebrity. Points out all the speaking engagements he is invited to and his ability to tell good stories."

Author: "Wells, Peter"
Title: "Some terrible obliteration"
description: "States how a city rebuilds its lost architecture, whether through war or natural disaster, is vital for its future. Compares what happened post-World War II in Europe where the author notes 'citizens of the city were comforted by a return of an architecture they knew and felt affection for' and what NZ's approach has been to the past. Recounts the rebuilding of Napier after the 1931 earthquake was constrained by the desire of the public wanting very strong buildings (reinforced concrete) and without high parapets. Designers had the example of Santa Barbara in California, which was rebuilt after a disastrous earthquake in 1925. Suggest Christchurch is entirely different, noting the destruction is in pockets and both historic and contemporary buildings have been damaged. Asks the question how will these Victorian and Edwardian buildings be rebuilt and asserts that Christchurch should."

Author: "Killeen, Richard"
Title: "Off the computer and on the wall"
description: "Extract from the book Artists @ work written by Richard Wolfe and photograher Stephen Robinson. Talks about Auckland artist Richard Killeen and his dislike of paint and discusses what he sees as one of his most useful tools, the computer."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "More than a touch of strangeness"
description: "Reviews some photographs by Yvonne Todd at Ivan Anthony, including photographs called 'Greasy harpist', 'Gunter', 'Mauve structures'; Reviews the work of Siavash Momeny at Artis Gallery; Reviews the sculpture of Toby Twiss in the Jonathan Grant Gallery; Reviews Mellomania by Paul Martinson at the Sanderson Contemporary Art; Reviews work of Johanna Pegler showing at Anna Miles Gallery."

Author: "McAllister, Janet"
Title: "Contemporary dance tutu weird for ballet brigade"
description: "Talks about NZ contemporary dance with Kristian Larsen. Discusses Kristian Larsen's own work, 'Nest' and other dancer's works."

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Professor of anarchy"
description: "Talks to Liz Aggiss who will present 'Hijinx' at Tapac Western Springs, October 7 at 6pm, October 8 at 8pm and 'Forward motion', Film Festival from the British Council, Tapac, October 9-10."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Secondhand book rummage inspires stirring play about colonial discovery"
description: "Previews the plays which make up 'The Next stage' at Musgrove Studio Maidment Theatre on October 12-16. Includes 'Our MaÃÑoris' by Arthur Meek, 'Village people' by Victor Rodger and Stephen Sinclair's 'What to do about Dad'."

Author: "Falconer, Phoebe"
Title: "Love of Polynesia curator's guide"
description: "Love of Polynesia curator's guide"

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "Divorce New Zealand style"
description: "Talks to experts and those who have been through divorce to find out how they dealt with the breakup of their marriage. Indicates the sorts of behaviours that indicate the relationship is not healthy and ways to talk through these difficulties. Considers the legal support required when going through a divorce and the application of current law to the break up of a marriage including coming to an agreement if there are children involved."

Author: "John, Emma"
Title: "The point of the exercise"
description: "Focuses on recent research coming out of Britain and the United States that seems to indicate that exercise has a negligible impact on weight loss. Reports to lose weight an exercise schedule needs to be more strenuous than previously thought. Recounts an experiment carried out at the University of Louisiana, led by Dr. Timothy Church, which found no significant difference in weight loss between those who had exercised and those who had not. Asserts this isolated the problem of 'compensation', if you exercise more, you eat more. Other experts think we have confused cause and effect, with Terry Wilkin, professor of endocrinology and metabolism at the Peninsula Medical School in Plymouth having written a book entitled 'Fatness leads to inactivity, but inactivity does not lead to fatness'."

Author: "Tiffen, Rachel"
Title: "'Miracle survivor' Rongo beats bus"
description: "'Miracle survivor' Rongo beats bus"

Author: "Dart William"
Title: "American virtuoso workouts for orchestra"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's concert on Thursday at the Auckland Town Hall."

Author: "Blundell, Kay"
Title: "Family relief after police recover body of slain man"
description: "Family relief after police recover body of slain man"

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "Top adviser on climate change dies"
description: "Top adviser on climate change dies"

Title: "Life a better guide than piece of paper"
description: "Life a better guide than piece of paper"

Title: "Police officer fined for drink-driving"
description: "Police officer fined for drink-driving"

Title: "Boss pays price for man's death"
description: "Boss pays price for man's death"

Author: "Boyer, Seamus"
Title: "Drummer sets himself a busy beat"
description: "Drummer sets himself a busy beat"

Title: "Shaw still in two minds over Delhi"
description: "Shaw still in two minds over Delhi"

Title: "Career prospects bright for hotel management graduate"
description: "Career prospects bright for hotel management graduate"

Title: "Wine student earning while learning"
description: "Wine student earning while learning"

Title: "Another New Zealand film school student wins Kodak competition"
description: "Another New Zealand film school student wins Kodak competition"

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "The debatable humanity of mercy killing"
description: "Reports on the issues involved in assisted suicide leading up to the first open national conference on the subject involving lawyers, medical workers and researchers. Describes the situation in Belgium where assisted suicide has been legal since 2002 and Jan Bernheim, from the medicine faculty of Vrije Universiteit Brussel will discuss the assisted-dying law as it functions in Belgium. Reports Greg King, a criminal lawyer will outline NZ law as it presently stands with regard to assisted suicide. Presents the views of the NZ Catholic Bioethics Centre (Nathaniel Cenre) via John Kleinsman and the NZ Medical Association. Indicates a Hospice NZ discussion paper believes that improving access to hospice and palliative care services should be the first priority for government."

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "Tumbledown railway station now the pride of Plimmerton"
description: "Follows the story of the Plimmerton Residents Association restoring their railway station when they heard that it was going to be knocked down. Chronicles some of the stories associated with the station, stationmasters and residents of Plimmerton who used the train."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Future shock"
description: "Explains the concept of 'disintermediation' as the ability of technology through its capacity to connect, will squeeze out the middleman and it is a force that favours the very large businesses and pushes everything else to the margins. Explores the implications of this new business model for the traditional way of doing business and accessing consumer goods, getting information, etc. Indicates this trend will accelerate with the increasing speed with which digital technology is able to work."

Author: "McNabb, Denise"
Title: "Watson : out of the frying pan into fire?; Eric Watson : out of the frying pan into the fire?; Assembling a fortune, deal after deal"
description: "Focuses on the latest venture of the businessman, a dairy and beef farming operation in the US state of Georgia, using NZ-style farm management practices. Describes the problems that have eventuated with the special-purpose acquisition company (spac) and his investment company that are threatening his business reputation, two years after the collapse of Hanover Finance. Presents a timeline of his various investments."

Author: "Rumbelow, Helen"
Title: "The book is dead, long live reading"
description: "Introduces this year's Frankfurt Book Fair where the author suggests the big players in the book and internet worlds decided ebooks are the future. Notes the competition between Google, Amazon and Apple along with the question about who is going to set the price of a book. Reports the role of agents, publishers and retailers is up for grabs and the issue of pricing and royalties from ebooks is unresolved."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "POW one of life's true survivors"
description: "POW one of life's true survivors"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Bringing down the curtain"
description: "Talks to the founding director of the Otago Festival of the Arts, who is leaving after 12 years in the role. Overviews his career in arts management. Cites the views of Otago Festival of the Arts Trust chairman Paul Dallimore and Dunedin arts commentator Peter Entwisle about his contribution."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Checking the mail; Central Otago township a special case; The response"
description: "Tests the delivery performance of the postal service. Describes the results of 155 envelopes posted to destinations across NZ in terms of postal times and the percentage that reached their proper destination. Explains why Lake Hawea township emerged as a special case. Includes the response from NZ Post, via Dunedin Mail Centre leader Murray Rei."

Author: "Kearns, Diana"
Title: "Lost in history"
description: "The baby boomer recollects and enumerates 48 sounds of the city that are seldom heard, if ever, in recent times."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Reaching for the moon"
description: "Talks to the director of the film 'The Insatiable moon' about the process of making the film, which she adapted from the eponymous novel written by her husband in 1997. Overviews her career as an actor, director, family law specialist and now a district court judge."

Author: "Riddell, Oliver"
Title: "Life of leading trade unionist no bed of roses; Young adults"
description: "Life of leading trade unionist no bed of roses; Young adults"

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Getting sleepy ... and being helped"
description: "Interviews the hypnotherapist about the nature of his work."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Fruits of going veg; Why go vegetarian?; Vegetarianism - a history"
description: "Focuses on the benefits of a vegetarian lifestyle, to mark World Vegetarian Day. Talks to Nicky Owers, spokeswoman for the NZ Vegetarian Society, to University of Otago professor Jim Mann about the health and other advantages of vegetarianism. Mentions three vegetarian cookbooks and one vegan cookbook. Describes environmental arguments supporting a vegetarian lifestyle. Suggests wine pairings for vegetarian dishes. Talks to Jan Mitchell of the University of Otago about the history of vegetarianism in NZ."

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "The other killers on the road; New Zealand presents its own deadly hazards"
description: "Looks into the causes of road accidents other than those due to alcohol, drugs and speed. Notes that alcohol, drugs and speed contribute to half of the fatalities of the road toll. Examines causes such as fatigue, inattention, distraction, unsafe following distances, not driving to the prevailing conditions. Gives two examples where the driver went to sleep at the wheel with fatal results. A study has shown that 80% of crashes and 65% of near misses, drivers had their eyes off the road for 3 seconds before collisions. Canvasses the views of the AA, a driving instructor on how NZers can improve their driving skills."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Delving into her depths"
description: "Meets the autodidactic artist. Discusses the motivation for her latest multimedia exhibition 'Impassioned eye', at the former Mornington Presbyterian Church, 33 Brunel Street, Mornington, Dunedin, opening 29 Oct 2010."

Author: "Driessen, Erin"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Huia's lament' by Jo Ogier, The Artist's Room, Dunedin. Reviews 'Ush' by John Ward Knox, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 20 Feb 2011. Reviews 'Street photography' by Steven Ting, Nectar Espresso Bar + CafeÃÅ, Dunedin, until 8 Nov 2010."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Hill country man"
description: "Profiles the 90-year-old stockman, describing how he ran the Waitohi Downs sheep and beef farm with his wife Edith O'Carroll from 1947. Talks about his farming background, how he purchased the farm, and the livestock he ran. Touches on his love of horses which he rides still. Mentions his contributions to the Hawarden community. Talks to Lawrie O'Carroll (son) and Jenny O'Carroll, who now run the farm, about farming deer, their horse trekking  business Alpine Horse Safaris, and their 90-year-old farmhand."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Hold on tight as we spin forward"
description: "Explains the concept of 'disintermediation' as the ability of technology to connect and therefore squeeze out the middleman, becoming a force that favours very large businesses and pushes everything else to the margins. Explores the implications of this new business model on traditional ways of doing business and accessing consumer goods, obtaining information, etc. Implies that people will increasingly use applications such as iPhones to source information and that many jobs will become unnecessary. Indicates this trend will accelerate with the increasing speed with which digital technology is able to work. Points out the opportunities provided by disintermediation, such as education, agricultural technology, and water management."

Author: "Cook, Gayle"
Title: "Lyttelton's bad Friday"
description: "Looks back at a storm that hit Lyttelton Friday 13 October, 2000, and reports on the boats that were salvaged or written off, and which survived. Describes also how the event changed boat owners' lives."

Title: "Distinguished rugby player learned from hardened vets"
description: "Distinguished rugby player learned from hardened vets"

Author: "Vance, Andrea"
Title: "Putting in the hard yards"
description: "Talks to the three candidates Hekia Parata (National Party), Kris Faafoi (Labour Party) and Jan Logie (Green Party) who are vying in the by-election for the Mana electorate seat vacated by Winnie Laban. Gives their background and credentials for standing in the seat of Mana and their knowledge of local issues. Includes their answers to curly questions about the Mana electorate and specifically questions about Porirua, education, health, water, tax and transport."

Author: "Turner, Anna"
Title: "Project falcon"
description: "Interviews New Yorker Sara Kross about her PhD research into the endangered NZ falcon (karearea) and her involvement in the Marlborough Falcon Conservation Trust 'Falcons for Grapes project, designed to increase falcon numbers and decrease vineyard bird pests, which has involved translocating some birds. Lists facts about the birds of prey."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Scientist of the future"
description: "Profiles John Watt who within the last year has won the Young Scientist of the Year, the Prime Minister's MacDiarmid Emerging Scientist Prize and is fronting a TV programme, 'Ever wondered?' presenting science and technology in NZ. Indicates he worked with Richard Tilley in the School of Chemical and Physical Sciences at Victoria University of Wellington where he completed his PhD."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Pen to paper"
description: "Looks at the decline of the written letter and its replacement by electonic media such as emails, chats, texts, tweets, Facebook messages, and blogs. Talks to some inveterate letter writers. Speaks to Jay Buzenberg and David Colquhoun at the Alexander Turnbull Library about the National Digital Heritage Archive, and the acquisition and archiving of written and digital documents. Notes the library has access to Sue Bradford's entire electronic correspondence while at Parliament.  Advises on how to store electronic correspondence. Mentions NZ Post's new, online-to-mailbox, Send a Card system."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Sneaker feelings"
description: "Reports on sneakers as a new collectors' item. Talks to footwear collector Jamie Turner (aka Blinga)  about the size and content of his collection. Speaks to sneaker designer and breakdancer Andrew Henry about his brand, YOURS."

Title: "The accidental film star"
description: "Reprints an interview (from the Guardian) with Flight of the Conchords star Jemaine Clement about his career, comedy in NZ, an appearance in The Simpsons, and his new movie, Dinner for Schmucks."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Bach made in heaven"
description: "Profiles a Victoria University team of architecture students who have entered their solar-powered house in the US-run Solar Decathlon award. Talks to student Nick Officer about the award's stipulations and their bach-inspired design."

Author: "Luke, Peter"
Title: "'Commo' Ken a pragmatist at heart"
