description: "'Commo' Ken a pragmatist at heart"

Author: "Vos, Inger"
Title: "Hive mentality"
description: "Passes on tips from beekeeper Marcia Meehan, Waikato Domestic Beekeeping Association president, about setting a simple top -bar beehive in the garden as a way to boost the bee population and collect honey."

Author: "Vine, Gillian"
Title: "Trees of curious character"
description: "Previews one of the six gardens on show at the biennial Waikouaiti Presbyterian Garden Day, 9 Oct 2010. Talks to the homeowner about the history of the property and the development of the garden over the years."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Silicon Welly"
description: "Gives three examples of successful web developers who have chosen Wellington as their base and highlights Wellington as having a web savvy community and features that support its development. David ten Have, Brian Calhoun and Melissa Clark-Reynolds give their reasons for relocating to Wellington and notes the establishment of 'Webstock' an annual conference that has been running since 2006 based on the theme of web and technology development."

Author: "Hume, Tim,"
Title: "Gone but not forgotten; Timeline of the Kahui case"
description: "Reports on the dramatic first week of the inquest before coroner Garry Evans into the murders of the three-month-old babies in Jun 2006. Focuses on the conflicting and inconsistent evidence presented by the twins' parents. Presents a timeline of the case from the twins' premature birth on 20 Mar 2006 until Oct 2010."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "The case against the Pope; The scandal in New Zealand"
description: "Talks to Australian-born human rights lawyer Geoffrey Robertson about the international uproar created by his book 'The Case of the Pope : Vatican accountability for human rights abuse'. Describes instances of child-molestation scandals in NZ over the past decade. Seeks comment from Ken Clearwater, manager of Male Survivors of Sexual Abuse, former Police Commissioner John Jamieson and Lyndsay Freer of Catholic Communications."

Author: "Ineson, Lisa"
Title: "Cook books"
description: "Book review of 'MasterChef New Zealand : the cookbook : volume one'."

Author: "Holmes, Stephanie"
Title: "Blowing its top; Get ready"
description: "Talks to actor Mark Michinson about his role as maverick vulcanologist Clive de Roo in the upcoming TV3 dramatisation about the five days preceding a volcanic eruption in Auckland, 13 Oct 2010. Provides information about Get Ready Week 2010 for people living in volcanic areas."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Super-city takes centre stage"
description: "Garners the views of University of Canterbury School of Social and Political Sciences lecturer Jean Drage about the broader political issues of the upcoming local elections. Covers the following aspects: level of voter participation; the increasing influence of mayors, particularly that of Auckland; the growing corporate role of councils and consequent influence on councillor governance rather than representation; typical candidate profile; and future challenges to the regional council model. Summarises Drage's predictions for the mayoral races in Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch, and Dunedin."

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "Fibre buring bright"
description: "Looks at the implications of the Government's roll out of UFB (ultra fast broadband) and predicts what sort of functions it will enable us to carry out using this digital technology. Points to the functions within the home, business, healthcare sector, etc., where fibre optical cables will be used to carry the necessary data. Raises the question whether the public is ready to pay for 'fibre-to-home'. States that UFB is not about fibre, it's about infrastructure, it's about what the fibre will, would, could or might allow in the future."

Author: "Smithies, Grant"
Title: "No place like home"
description: "Reviews the vinyl EP by the Auckland-based hip-hop nine-piece band Home Brew. Talks to rapper Tom Scott and EP promoter John Baker."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Pen to paper"
description: "Looks at the decline of the written letter and its replacement by electonic media such as emails, chats, texts, tweets, Facebook messages, and blogs. Talks to some inveterate letter writers. Speaks to Jay Buzenberg and David Colquhoun at the Alexander Turnbull Library about the National Digital Heritage Archive, and the acquisition and archiving of written and digital documents. Notes the library has access to Sue Bradford's entire electronic correspondence while at Parliament.  Advises on how to store electronic correspondence. Mentions NZ Post's new, online-to-mailbox, Send a Card system."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Bach made in heaven"
description: "Profiles a Victoria University team of architecture students who have entered their solar-powered house in the US-run Solar Decathlon award. Talks to student Nick Officer about the award's stipulations and their bach-inspired design."

Author: "Brown, Kester,"
Title: "Rock stars"
description: "Declares the suitability of Baring Head rocks located at the southern end of Wainuiomata Valley for rock climbing. Details the author's climb of the Seaward Boulder Arete."

Author: "Fawcett, Stephanie"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Talks to the proprietor of Eirever Pets Garden of Remembrance, Albany about what constitutes a typical day on the job."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Being fourteen; Havelock North High School teens on what it feels like to be 14"
description: "Asks why being a 14-year-old appears to be so difficult. Points to the sudden upsurge in risk-taking behaviour statistics for 14-year-olds, and asks education, science and health professionals to explain. Seeks views of Devin Farmery, Kat Field, Paige Kaye, Hugo Remmerswall, Alice Gee and Nikita, all pupils at Havelock North High School, about what it feels like to be 14."

Author: "Hart, Anna"
Title: "A man's world"
description: "Talks to single NZers to ascertain their perceptions and experiences of the current shortage of men, which is particularly acute in NZ cities and in the South Island. Contrasts the experiences of men and women. Speaks to business analyst and demographer Bernard Salt about the findings of research for his book 'Man drought'."

Author: "Braunias, Steve"
Title: "Fancy seeing you here"
description: "Talks to the Canterbury-raised diving legend who created the Internet discussion site 'Divers Discussion Forum' as one means of sharing his amazing knowledge, enthusiasm and wisdom about NZ's underwater world. Comments on six photographs of underwater creatures that are posted on the site."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Hunters and gatherers"
description: "Examines the renewed popularity of garage sales.  Shares her experiences of how to discover more valuable items."

Title: "Sister of murder victim wins council seat"
description: "Sister of murder victim wins council seat"

Title: "Special powers in quake response"
description: "Outlines the Chapman Tripp response to Parliament's passing of the Canterbury Earthquake Response and Recovery Act (CERRA), focusing on the Acts three mechanisms: the Recovery Commission, Orders in Council, and protections from liability for certain acts or omissions. Cautions that implementation of the Act be monitored, given its significant and unusual powers."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Economy takes toll on sales"
description: "Documents falls in commercial and industrial property investment sales in 2010. Seeks analysis from CB Richard Ellis head of research, Zoltan Moricz, on office, industrial, and retail sales; the growing withdrawal of overseas investor activity; mortgagee sales; and concerns over tax changes in the 2010 budget."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Tick tock shock jock"
description: "Contemplates the phenomenon of radio and television announcers who purposely attempt to shock their audience.  Discusses the recent brouhaha over the comments by TV1 Breakfast Show host Paul Henry regarding Governor-General Sir Anand Satyanand.  In that regard, canvasses random people about what a 'Kiwi-born' face looks like.  Acknowledges other shock jocks and some of their better known outbursts here and abroad.  Commentator Paul Holmes adds his opinions on the situation."

Title: "An uncomfortable reality"
description: "Examines possible ramifications of the Act's suspension of the penalty regime for processing resource consents. Notes similar emergency legislation has been enacted only twice before in NZ history. Ponders the possible results for the 3000-odd homes and businesses that have been assessed uninhabitable and for neighbourhoods that are awaiting announcements on whether they should be rebuilt or abandoned."

Author: "Wood, Stacey"
Title: "A girl's need to dance gets her family on the move"
description: "A girl's need to dance gets her family on the move"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Author (detailed): "Frances Morton, Oscar Kightley, and Kieran Nash"
Title: "Brown's town just got bigger; Brown is the new blue and white in Auckland; It is unlucky 13 for John Banks this time"
description: "Acknowledges the new supercity mayoralty of election winner Len Brown.  Speculates on how he will manage Australasia's largest council.  Recognises the influence of the Pacific vote in his win.  Witnesses the defeat of now outgoing mayor John Banks."

Title: "Worker feels let down after voting for National; Are you better off?"
description: "Worker feels let down after voting for National; Are you better off?"

Author: "Ash, Julie"
Title: "NZ farewell for Kiwi killed in Budapest"
description: "NZ farewell for Kiwi killed in Budapest"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Old school the new cool; Stretching things out part of everyday life"
description: "Backgrounds the new book about the wisdom and whimsy of the older generation imparted to Generations X and Y readers.  Talks to old-timers former Wellington builder Jack Warren and former publican Neville Barker about their new respective pastimes of housepainting and home brewing.  Gets advice from shoe repair specialist Kevin Lethbridge on choosing, caring for, and polishing shoes."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Act now, repent at leisure?"
description: "Ponders the legal consequences for post-earthquake Christchurch residents taking action regarding their property in the face of aftershocks, civil defence emergency requirements, heritage building issues, and other property complications. Questions the effectiveness of Canterbury Earthquake Response and Recovery Act (CERRA), and compares it to previous cover-all legislation, the Public Safety Conservation Act 1932 (PSCA)."

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "Fastnet may be fast track back to Ferns"
description: "Fastnet may be fast track back to Ferns"

Author: "Bradley, Antonio"
Title: "Anzac Day survivor adds his thanks to awards"
description: "Anzac Day survivor adds his thanks to awards"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Headstones of British officers finally found"
description: "Headstones of British officers finally found"

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Rocky Horror coming back to life - and to capital"
description: "Rocky Horror coming back to life - and to capital"

Author: "Yeoman, Paula"
Title: "Brooke breezes back into the charts"
description: "Chats to the singer-songwriter about her new album."

Title: "Drug-smuggling doctor forged letters to cover up time in prison"
description: "Drug-smuggling doctor forged letters to cover up time in prison"

Title: "Threats disregarded says killer"
description: "Threats disregarded says killer"

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "Care for homeless alcoholics recognised"
description: "Care for homeless alcoholics recognised"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Missionary's diary and convict ship logs give insights into climate science"
description: "Missionary's diary and convict ship logs give insights into climate science"

Title: "Kiwi eyes top spot on UK Apprentice"
description: "Kiwi eyes top spot on UK Apprentice"

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "'My knight in shining green boardies'"
description: "'My knight in shining green boardies'"

Author: "Feek, Belinda"
Title: "Family select coastal resting place for wife and mother killed by tsunami"
description: "Family select coastal resting place for wife and mother killed by tsunami"

Author: "Luke, Peter"
Title: "'Commo' Ken a pragmatist at heart"
description: "'Commo' Ken a pragmatist at heart"

Title: "Man admits defrauding migrants in ironing franchise"
description: "Man admits defrauding migrants in ironing franchise"

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Family can't forgive as father jailed for five-week-old's death"
description: "Family can't forgive as father jailed for five-week-old's death"

Author: "Joyce, Diane"
Title: "Kiwi-born children face deportation"
description: "Kiwi-born children face deportation"

Author: "Waller, John"
Title: "Eden Park grand open day"
description: "Celebrates the unveiling of the revamped stadium.  Chats to former All Black Grant Fox about his strongest memories of the Park.  Spotlights the tekoteko that grace the park entrance.  Reports on the auctioning of the historic park goalposts originally donated by rugby legend Noel 'Baldy' Morgan 50 years ago.   Details the Park's technological overhaul.  Revisits top 10 favourite sporting moments at 'The Park' since 1950.  Briefly overviews the major elements of the redevelopment.  Notes today's event is the first official political gig for new Auckland supercity mayor Len Brown.  Anticipates Rugby World Cup (RWC) 2011.   Touches on public transport availability.  Previews a new book by Lindsay Knight and John McCrystal about the Park's history."

Author: "Walls, Alex"
Title: "Auctioneers, the modern-day treasure hunters"
description: "Auctioneers, the modern-day treasure hunters"

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Mood malady"
description: "Explores the condition of bipolar disorder, describing symptoms and typical medication. Delves into the experiences of NZers with the condition, voicing the frustration at the lack of parental support and the expectations of patient self-management. Notes the frequent attendance of drug and alcohol problems, difficulty of diagnosis, and patients who suicide or end up in prison. Describes a relapse-management plan that is acknowledged to be impractical. Notes there is a growing body of information and support available, such as Balance NZ. Quotes University of Otago associate professor of psychological medicine Marie Crowe as recommending long-term, coordinated, continuous care."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Experience preferred"
description: "Contends that previous work experience and even unpaid internships may be more helpful in finding employment than an actual degree. Tempers this with statistics that show higher degrees equate to higher pay. Shows which fields of study and which institutions lead to higher earnings.  Describes the practice of some NZ educational institutions' of partnering study with work experience. Looks at a future of performance-linked government funding, possibly accompanied by performance league tables. Notes the debate about simply linking degrees to earnings rather than to the wider benefit to society, touching on a university-versus-polytechnic tension. Ponders whether workplaces are making full use of graduates' skills. Provides tips on how to become a work-ready, employer-attractive job seeker. Talks to a building science graduate about her long path to finding a job."

Author: "Coddington, Deborah"
Title: "Lessons in poverty"
description: "Talks to Newcastle University (UK) professor of education policy James Tooley about his findings on low-cost private schools established by parents in developing countries. Notes their almost businesslike arrangements, which keep teachers accountable, and their outperforming of state equivalents. Criticises aid agencies that fail to acknowledge such schools. Questions whether there is a role for government in education and for the voucher system. Describes the NZ example of the initially unfunded Kura Kaupapa MaÃÑori o Hoani Waititi. Considers the inspiration that can be derived from parents not accepting mediocrity."

Author: "Rowe, Lucy Elizabeth"
Title: "Making things right"
description: "Documents the discovery of southern right whales breeding off the Auckland Islands. Speaks to University of Otago Department of Marine Science researcher Will Rayment about the issues around the endangered species recolonising NZ shores. Describes a scientific expedition to the Auckland Islands where researchers found a large population of whales, enjoyed getting up close to the curious creatures, and established a unique method of identifying whale individuals. Discusses Rayment's study of whale population and their movements using photographic evidence. Recounts the depletion and recovery of endangered NZ sea lion populations."

Author: "Somerset, Guy"
Title: "Seduced & seduced again"
description: "Discusses the Auckland Art Gallery curator's new book. Asks about her art selection, the discovery of narratives behind the works, the question of art attribution, and the influence of early European art on NZ artists such as Colin McCahon."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Slacker-rapper confessions"
description: "Reviews the Wellington rapper's (real name Tom Young) first album. Reviews the Auckland group's seven-track blue vinyl edition of their first EP, featuring MC, Tom Scott."

Author: "Chinn, Anna"
Title: "At art's coal face"
description: "Reviews the play directed by Patrick Davies, Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, until 23 October 2010."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Choke breakers"
description: "Discusses the work of a Chicago psychologist on choking, or the inability to work well under pressure. Cites her recommendations to prevent this malfunctioning of the brain's prefrontal cortex, including singing, whistling and meditating. Suggests these activities may increase one's ability to perform at important moments such as at work, or on the sports field, with specific reference to the All Blacks."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Protecting the prostate"
description: "Answers a question about healthy eating for men who have prostate cancer, with particular reference to vitamin K, lycopene, selenium, and long-chain omega-3 fats."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Rising signs"
description: "Details the latest evidence of net loss from the world's ice sheets, which is one of three ways that global warming is causing the sea level to rise. Talks to Victoria University's Antarctic Research Centre's Dan Zwartz about satellite gravity, a new method of measuring ice-sheet mass. Describes the melting effect of warming oceans on the West Antarctic Ice Sheet, and the effect of 'collapse' where certain physical processes become self-repeating. Mentions the Antarctic Drilling Project, which aims to improve understanding of the link between ice-sheet behaviour and sea-level response by retrieving sediment from below the Ross Ice Shelf."

Author: "Joyce, Diane"
Title: "Deported parents' terrible choice : leave kids in NZ or take them to slum"
description: "Deported parents' terrible choice : leave kids in NZ or take them to slum"

Title: "Wife on kill charge 'had had enough'"
description: "Contains biographical material."

Author: "Ash, Julie"
Title: "Traumatised Gran quits one quake zone for another"
description: "Traumatised Gran quits one quake zone for another"

Title: "Student convicted of body-in-suitcase death"
description: "Student convicted of body-in-suitcase death"

Title: "Vicki Harwood : animal control officer"
description: "Vicki Harwood : animal control officer"

Title: "Napier car accident ends couple's 55-year romance"
description: "Napier car accident ends couple's 55-year romance"

description: "King's College pupil often very drunk inquest told"

Title: "Piper murderer's 175 convictions"
description: "Piper murderer's 175 convictions"

Title: "Grave of Wellington's slain officer gets revamp"
description: "Grave of Wellington's slain officer gets revamp"

Title: "Murderer's son likely to walk free"
description: "Murderer's son likely to walk free"

Title: "Inquest told of death after weight loss surgery"
description: "Inquest told of death after weight loss surgery"

Author: "Forbes, Michael"
Title: "Health groups may sue to recover stolen cash"
description: "Health groups may sue to recover stolen cash"

Title: "Gun review urged after youth kills mate"
description: "Gun review urged after youth kills mate"

Title: "Ex-policeman jailed for perjury"
description: "Ex-policeman jailed for perjury"

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "Tongan king to sell $10m Auckland home"
description: "Tongan king to sell $10m Auckland home"

Author: "Watson, MIke"
Title: "Get out of the Koru lounge, leaders told at Glassie inquest"
description: "Get out of the Koru lounge, leaders told at Glassie inquest"

Author: "Katterns, Tanya"
Title: "Sculptor to remake Dietrict and mend a broken heart"
description: "Sculptor to remake Dietrict and mend a broken heart"

Title: "Victim's family not allowed to speak at hearing"
description: "Victim's family not allowed to speak at hearing"

Author: "Walls, Alex"
Title: "Mulching queen banishes lowly weeds"
description: "Mulching queen banishes lowly weeds"

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "Director believes in making a difference"
description: "Director believes in making a difference"

Author: "Wood, Stacey"
Title: "Sickness takes back seat to award"
description: "Sickness takes back seat to award"

Title: "Youngster optimistic after attending Black Sox camp"
description: "Youngster optimistic after attending Black Sox camp"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Mental health unit 'failed teen' ; Disappointed mother questions value of coroner's findings"
description: "Mental health unit 'failed teen' ; Disappointed mother questions value of coroner's findings"

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "Welcome to the whanau ... Aboriginal rugby star finds Maori roots"
description: "Welcome to the whanau ... Aboriginal rugby star finds Maori roots"

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "A tale of two cities"
description: "Looks at how the Super City election results could either unite or further divide the current gulf between rich and poor in Auckland."

Author: "Eames, David"
Title: "Aucklanders to be spread far and wide"
description: "Considers what the concept of Super City means to some of those residents as far north as Te Hana and as far south as Mercer, who will be all brought together under one council."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "25 flavour enhancers mimic Nana's roast"
description: "Scrutinises the ingredients that go into Eta Kettles Roast Lamb and Mint potato chips."

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Thomas' ex-wife adds her voice to Crew daughter's call for new look at case; Clouds of suspicion; Barrister : ambitious detectives go too far"
description: "Looks at the 1970 murder of Harvey Crewe and Jeanette Crewe as their daughter, Rochelle Crewe, urges police to re-investigate the case. Examines a list of possible suspects in the homicides. Talks about the troubled police career of John Hughes, a detective on the Crewe case."

Author: "Meurant, Ross"
Title: "Too many loose ends to ignore Crewe case"
description: "Argues that the unsolved Crewe murder case be reopened, even though it might be costly for some reputations. Comments on conclusions made in Ian Wishart's book 'Arthur Allan Thomas: the inside story'."

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "The faces of New Zealand"
description: "Meets a variety of NZers, of different ethnic origins, in light of the remarks made by broadcaster Paul Henry about Governor-General Sir Anand Satyanand. Asks them what they believe a typical NZer should look and sound like, and whether they consider themselves to be 'Kiwi'."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Plan to chase leavers as school ends; Chance meeting opens way to a bright future"
description: "Discusses a new national transition service which aims to make sure all 16- and 17-year-old school leavers are working or in further training, and the current situation for school leavers in Auckland. Talks to a user of youth transition services."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Out on the big stage : and it's world class"
description: "Reviews the performances of Kids of 88 and the Naked and Famous at Auckland's Powerstation."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Enthusiastic audience thrills to music's power"
description: "Reviews the Thursday concert of the Auckland Philharmonica Orchestra conducted by Otto Reviews at the Auckland Town Hall."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Fish stocks on rise : but there's a catch"
description: "Reports on the Ministry of Fisheries decision to increase catches of orange roughy and hoki despite a decline in stocks and heightened international consumer interest in sustainable food supply."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Dining in the dark"
description: "Appraises the forthcoming the Blind Dining Experience that will be held in Wellington on October 4th, 11th and 12th. Explains how this is billed as a 'sensory adventure' to raise awareness of World Sight Day on October 14th."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "A call to duty"
description: "Considers the cost of attending a trial as a jury member, and why NZers would seem to be keen to avoid having to go through the process, while still keen to fulfill their  civic duty. Outlines jury fees and expenses."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "A blessing on both sides; God's chosen ones"
description: "Talks about the life of Mary MacKillop (after canonisation 'St Mary of The Cross'), her visits to NZ, and the concept of sainthood."

Author: "Roughan, John"
Title: "Long ago, but important today"
description: "Pays tribute to the former farmer, teacher, and author."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Gin Wigmore"
description: "Talks to the singer about her image as a 'rock chick'."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Penny Hulse"
description: "Talks to the deputy mayor of Waitakere City Council and soon-to-be deputy mayor of the Auckland Super City about the role of a deputy mayor, her background, and her interests."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Minding others' business; Access provider has confidence in association"
description: "Features a group of five young entrepreneurs who have founded 'The Distiller', an independent non-profit project focusing primarily on technology-related, pre-seed enterpreneurial ventures. Talks to spokesman Jason Leong about the project, which aims to retain the city's best and brightest residents. Speaks to the owner of wireless internet company WIC about his decision to provide free internet services to the project."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "Bold plans for new centres fail to get off ground; Where Albany money went"
description: "Looks at the various building projects that had been planned for the wider Auckland region which, though originally highly ambitious, have now been either downsized or abandonned completely. Briefly outlines 5 of these projects. Talks to Kevin Podmore, chairman of the failed Albany City Property Investments, about the project's losses."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Kiwi as; The very model ..."
description: "Delves into the remarks made by TV One 'Breakfast' host Paul Henry about Governor-General Sir Anand Satyanand, in which he asked Prime Minister John Key if Sir Anand was a NZer. Seeks opinions of '8 Tribes' author Jill Caldwell and former Dunedin mayor Dame Sukhi Turner as to whether the host's comments were simply 'shock jock' entertainment, or the tip of an ugly racist iceberg. Briefly profiles the 10 governors-general since 1962. Discusses the features that would distinguish a modern NZ governor-general as a NZer in a crowd of his or her international peers. Includes statistics about the increasing ethnic diversity within NZ."

Author: "McRae, Margot"
Title: "We refused to give up on the old girl"
description: "Discusses the fate of two Devonport heritage buildings, the Victoria Picture Palace and Theatre, and the Masonic Hotel. Talks about the role of the Environment Court and councils in retaining heritage sites and buildings, and why the 'Vic' has been protected and the Masonic Hotel will only retain a facade."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Money business"
description: "Recounts the 13-year history of the monkey house at the Dunedin Botanic Garden, starting with the introduction of two 'bonnet' monkeys in 1953. Describes the political machinations by Dunedin City Councillor Chas Hayward, who instigated the idea of the monkey house, and his unsuccessful run for mayor in Nov 1953. Lists other animal attractions formerly at the botanic garden, and speaks to Avis Hunter, who has just written a book for children focusing on the history of the monkey house."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "An audacious manifesto"
description: "Reviews the collection of essays, photographs, plans and drawings about the Group Architects."

Title: "Nock, Houstoun and all that jazz"
description: "Speaks to the jazz and classical pianists, respectively, about their joint recital, St Paul's Cathedral, Dunedin, 15 Oct 2010, and their solo concerts at the same venue on 13 and 15 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts."

Title: "'Hell duo' back for festival frolic"
description: "Talks to the singer and the pianist about their latest collaboration 'Hotel', Glenroy Auditorium, Dunedin, 14-16 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Old and new blend with swooping power"
description: "Reviews four art exhibitions in Auckland including Paul Dibble's 'Bird's eye view' at the Gow Langsford Gallery; Michael Shepherd's 'Scrabble with Janet' at Jane Sanders Art; Gareth Price's 'Suburban fantasy' at the Pierre Peeters Gallery; and Stanley Palmer's work at the Anna Bibby Gallery."

Author: "Riddell, Oliver"
Title: "A blinkered view of New Zealand's role in WW1; A cracking adventure; Cliff's shorts 'zip' right along; Author's autobiography a powerful page-turner"
description: "A blinkered view of New Zealand's role in WW1; A cracking adventure; Cliff's shorts 'zip' right along; Author's autobiography a powerful page-turner"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "These chicks rock"
description: "Talks to the University of Otago music lecturer and pop culture specialist about his new book, featuring 54 NZ women musicians drawn from a 50-year period. Describes the process of selecting the women and some of the themes and insights in the book."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Sweetly barbed"
description: "Talks to the eldest of the three musician siblings about her upcoming performance at The Club, Dunedin, 11 Oct 2010, as part of the Otago Festival of the Arts. Discusses her 'sarcastic pop' stylings, her upbringing and career to date."

Title: "Filling a gap in the tourism market"
description: "Interviews the operator for Sea Port Tours and Port Chalmers heritage and environment tours about the nature of his work."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Gaining strength from masterworks"
description: "Previews the programmes of the major concert-giving organisations (in Auckland) by examining their current brochures. Talks about the NZ Symphony Orchestra (NZSO), the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, Chamber Music NZ, and the NBR NZ Opera."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Classic CDs"
description: "Reviews the performances of Sibelius' Symphonies Nos. 1 and 3 by the NZ Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Pietari Inkinen."

Author: "Rycroft, Alice"
Title: "Fashion Week round-up 2010"
description: "Showcases the highlights of this year's fashion extravaganza."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Author (detailed): "Chris Barton, Deborah Montgomerie and Carroll du Chateau"
Title: "Demolition disaster and a hall of shame; Put on trial and found wanting; Golden romance true to history"
description: "Demolition disaster and a hall of shame; Put on trial and found wanting; Golden romance true to history"

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "iPad for work and play"
description: "Talks to the client manager for Gen-i about his use of the Apple iPad for both business and leisure."

Author: "Rose, Mike"
Title: "Preparation is key to safe bar crossing"
description: "Talks about how to safely cross a harbour or river bar in a boat."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "It's time for a new Big One champion"
description: "It's time for a new Big One champion"

Author: "Thompson, Eric"
Title: "Young guns owe much to elite academy"
description: "Young guns owe much to elite academy"

Author: "Leggat, David"
Title: "Value for money : how they performed"
description: "Assesses the achievements of the various NZ teams/sports at the 2010 Commonwealth Games in New Delhi. Notes the amount of funding each sport received from Sparc."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Catch us if you can' by Gary Waldrom, Milford Galleries, Dunedin, until 3 Nov 2010. Reviews 'Theatre works' by Marie Strauss, Temple Gallery, Dunedin. Reviews 'Notes from grey city' by James Kerr and John Z. Robinson, Moray Gallery, Dunedin, until 23 Oct 2010."

Author: "Leveson, Val"
Title: "Top staff flock to firms that care"
description: "Talks about why it is important for employers and recruiters to provide good job candidate care in order to maintain a good image."

Author: "Kane, Dave"
Title: "Charities inspire leap to solo career"
description: "Charities inspire leap to solo career"

Author: "McIntyre, Donna"
Title: "Team player stays sharp to guide planes home"
description: "Team player stays sharp to guide planes home"

Author: "Seconi, Adrian"
Title: "Sport in shooter Selby-Rickit's blood"
description: "Sport in shooter Selby-Rickit's blood"

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "Teetotalled"
description: "Reports on research findings (Charles Holahan, University of Texas) that moderate drinkers tend to be happier and live longer, possibly due to social interaction."

Title: "'Creative, compassionate, charming, generous"
description: "'Creative, compassionate, charming, generous"

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Bringing it back to basics; Rhododendron Festival events"
description: "Talks to the garden designer from the TV One programme 'Mucking in'. Provides advice on keeping a garden manageable. Informs that he will be giving a lecture and a workshop at the Dunedin Rhododendron Festival, 17-23 Oct 2010. Lists other events in the festival."

Title: "A "Golden Ace' who loved his music"
description: "A "Golden Ace' who loved his music"

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Nominee enjoys living gently on this earth"
description: "Nominee enjoys living gently on this earth"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Munificence and a fine sense of fun"
description: "Munificence and a fine sense of fun"

Title: "McArthur first-rate racing knowledge"
description: "McArthur first-rate racing knowledge"

Author: "Fox, Rebecca"
Title: "Peninsula is HQ for her campaigns"
description: "Peninsula is HQ for her campaigns"

Author: "Fox, Rebecca"
Title: "Possible ORC first with arrival of councillor's baby"
description: "Possible ORC first with arrival of councillor's baby"

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Power, privilege in public service"
description: "Profiles the young men from two of the city's richest families, both of whom have been elected to the Christchurch City Council representing the Fendalton-Waimairi and Hagley-Ferrymead wards, respectively. Asks them about their backgrounds and experience and what they plan to do as councillors."

Author: "De Lore, Clare"
Title: "A visionary Kiwi"
description: "Profiles eye surgeon Howard Harper. Gives his background, and recounts his career, including his ties with Asia as a school leaver, marriage to a nurse, and starting up a family while working in Iran. Looks at the work he has done in Afghanistan, bringing much needed eye surgery to the country, and recounting his impressions of the nation and the Afghan people. Describes his trust and relationship with the Afghan people, living conditions, and personal security. Looks at his personal finances and his efforts to finance the Noor Eye Hospital and other eye clinics in Afghanistan. Talks to Hamish McMaster of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, discussing Harper's low profile and huge contribution to improving the lives of Afghans, and notes Harper's return to Afghanistan in 2002 after the defeat of the Taleban. Gives Harper's comments on the future of the country. Gives a historical timeline for Afghanistan."

Author: "Falconer, Phoebe"
Title: "Photographer captured top brass, soldiers and PMs"
description: "Presents an obituary for the former official 2NZEF war photographer."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Lessons learned; Seismic lessons"
description: "Focuses on the likely effects of the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake on future building design. Talks to civil engineer John Hare, NZ Institute of Architects chairman Jasper van der Lingen and University of Canterbury professor of civil engineering professor Andy Buchanan about earthquake design over the years and lessons learnt from past major earthquakes and the most recent one."

Author: "Monin, Lydia"
Title: "A woman not to be forgotten"
description: "Relates the story of the first 'It Girl', a barmaid at Coker's Hotel, Christchurch, who caught the eye of British author Rudyard Kipling during a brief visit in 1891. Informs that the barmaid inspired his 1904 short story 'Mrs Bathurst'."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Chance to change"
description: "Talks to architect Ian Athfield about the opportunity to reinvent Christchurch offered by the Canterbury earthquake. Looks at the pattern of destruction left by the quake, different from that of the 1931 Napier earthquake, and gives Athfield's comments on developing inner-city living, fitting new buildings in among the old, and how buildings and people interact. Discusses the earthquake strengthening work of earthquake engineers which helped save many old buildings, and the economic effects on businesses of the damage. Examines the problems in some Christchurch suburbs affected by liquefaction of the land."

Author: "Campbell, Scott"
Title: "Dying days"
description: "Relays the campaign manager's account of the Auckland mayoral campaign of John Banks, starting in January 2010 and ending with the candidate's defeat in October."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Life in the middle ages"
description: "Examines the effects of reaching middle age, focusing on the physiological aspects occurring from the mid-thirties onward. Seeks comment from Phil Sheard, senior lecturer in physiology at the University of Otago School of Medicine. Touches on the psychology of aging and the financial health of people aged between 40 and 60."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Mainland monitor : rebuild managers appointed"
description: "Examines progress toward rebuilding the region, six weeks after the magnitude 7.1 earthquake. Seeks comment from spokespersons from the insurance and construction sectors and from the Earthquake Commission (EQC)."

Author: "Slade, Maria"
Title: "Film deal in the works"
description: "Announces that Film Auckland has signed a memorandum of understanding with its industry equivalent in Pusan, South Korea.  Comments on the assistance provided by the sister cities' relationship, council support, and a NZ-South Korea co-production treaty signed in 2008. Defines what constitutes a co-production film."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Grin and bare it"
description: "Interviews Dame Christine Cole Catley. Profiles her background as a groundbreaking NZ woman journalist, teacher of journalism, social activist and literary figure (just stepping down as chairwoman of the Frank Sargeson Trust). Notes her current work on her autobiography and discusses her encounters with politicians, NZ literary figures and her personal life. Looks at her current publishing activities and some of the books she has been involved in."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Writing home"
description: "Talks to the English author about her new novel that draws on her childhood experiences in NZ and the influence of kehua (mischievous MaÃÑori ghosts)."

Author: "Herrick, Linda"
Title: "Fighting that small core of fear"
description: "Talks to the poet, children's book writer, and book reviewer about her new collection of poetry, 'Slip Stream', which charts her experiences with cancer and having a partial mastectomy."

Author: "Lang, Sarah"
Title: "New to the Street"
description: "Talks about her experience as the daughter of a famous NZ musician, singing for Bandicoot, modeling, and acting on Shortland Street."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Family fury at ACC's 'arrogance'"
description: "Family fury at ACC's 'arrogance'"

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "On the trail of bankrupt's treasure"
description: "On the trail of bankrupt's treasure"

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "A mosaic of our words"
description: "Reviews the book by poets Paula Green and Harry Ricketts."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Home alone"
description: "Explores the divisive issue of parents leaving children under 14 home alone, contrary to the provisions of the Summary Offences Act. Mentions some high-profile cases and talks to parents about whether the practice is acceptable under some circumstances. Seeks comment from Snr Sgt John Robinson, Canterbury youth services district co-ordinator, Child, Youth and Family northern regional director Grant Bennett and psychologist Sara Chatwin."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Ye gods"
description: "Meets two women who are organising Cauldrons Paganfest 2010, Eyre Lodge, Eyreton, Labour Weekend 2010. Observes one of their coven rituals at Godley Head. Talks to them about the misconceptions of paganism and some of their practices."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Zen and the art of roly-poly; Finding balance in Bali"
description: "Relates the experience of a meditation course in Ponsonby after being inspired by Elizabeth Gilbert's novel 'Eat pray love'. Talks to NZer Janine Hall, about leaving the corporate world to open her own wellbeing retreat in Bali."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Oh, the horror"
description: "Interviews the NZ-raised, London-based creator of The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Discusses his desire to retire in NZ and his upcoming stage shows of the production in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. Comments on the continued financial success of the film over the past 30 years, and his small cut of the profits."

Author: "Gates, Charlie"
Title: "Gentle treatment of issue close to hearts"
description: "Reviews the documentary 'Water whisperers : Tangaroa', directed by Kathleen Gallagher"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Author (detailed): "Phil Taylor, Jeremy Rees and Russell Baillie"
Title: "The ride of your life"
description: "Presents tips on how to complete the Lake Taupo Cycle Challenge successfully. Talks about the experience of completing the race as a relay team, and on the parallel mountain bike event, the Huka MTB Challenge."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Room with a visionary view; Dream home design"
description: "Talks to architect Geoff Lentz about the process of designing a dream home at Lake Rotokauri for clients Ron Jackways and Stephanie Treacher. Informs that it is a Gold Reserve finalist in one of the sustainable new homes categories in the Registered Master Builders 2010 House of the Year. Explains how to create a dream home without breaking your budget or the planet."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Straight from the heart"
description: "Talks to the singer about the motivation behind her debut album of Elvis cover songs."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Austen translation"
description: "Talks about the improvised theatre production 'Austen found : the undiscovered musicals of Jane Austen' as performed by Auckland's ConArtists improvisation troupe."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Hip hop off the old block"
description: "Meets the hip-hop teacher/dancer who is studying design at Natcoll Design Technology. Informs that he has taken groups to the world hip-hop championships three times, and mentions his participation in the Hip Hop Xposure showcase, Opera House, Wellington, 16 Oct 2010."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "The fight for truth"
description: "Focuses on the landmark claim brought by Ngapuhi to the Waitangi Tribunal, arguing that the iwi never ceded sovereignty when it signed the Treaty of Waitangi in 1840. Cites remarks by presiding judge Craig Coxhead that the Northland enquiry (Te Paparahi O Te Raki) is the most difficult to date for the tribunal, with potential consequences for all NZers. Describes some of the aspects of the claim and its significance"

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Home alone"
description: "Explores the divisive issue of parents leaving children under 14 home alone, contrary to the provisions of the Summary Offences Act. Mentions some high-profile cases and talks to parents about whether the practice is acceptable under some circumstances. Seeks comment from Snr Sgt John Robinson, Canterbury youth services district co-ordinator, Child, Youth and Family northern regional director Grant Bennett and psychologist Sara Chatwin."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Stellar cast for Miller classic"
description: "Talks to director Jesse Peach about his production of Arthur Miller's 'A view form the bridge' in Auckland."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Summer love songs"
description: "Celebrates the imminent return to NZ of overseas musicians from yesteryear. Recalls earlier tours by Bon Jovi, Leonard Cohen, Sting, Toni Childs, Chrissie Hynde, Simply Red and Robin Gibb. Provides concert dates in Wellington."

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Stirring the pot"
description: "Looks at moves towards decriminalising marijuana overseas in California. Discusses pressure towards such moves in NZ, looking at a consultation document from the Law Commission and a proposal from the New Zealand Drug Federation (NZDF) to copy a scheme introduced in Western Australia. Looks at the comments of New York lawyer and journalist Glenn Greenwald about the effects of decriminalisation in Portugal, and US activist Jack Cole about a scheme from Switzerland to treat heroin addiction as a medical issue.  Notes a call from the NZDF for debate on the issue within NZ."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Room with a visionary view; Dream home design"
description: "Talks to architect Geoff Lentz about the process of designing a dream home at Lake Rotokauri for clients Ron Jackways and Stephanie Treacher. Informs that it is a Gold Reserve finalist in one of the sustainable new homes categories in the Registered Master Builders 2010 House of the Year. Explains how to create a dream home without breaking your budget or the planet."

Author: "Lamers, Chris"
Title: "Love the weather"
description: "Describes the elation of windsurfing in a solid southerly, and concludes that the weather defines the city."

Author: "Saker, Nicola"
Title: "Katherine the great"
description: "Describes the influence of the Wellington-born writer on her life."

Author: "Lambly, Annette"
Title: "North business pioneer dies, 103"
description: "North business pioneer dies, 103"

Author: "Roberts, Rosemary"
Title: "Sea dramas part of eventful life"
description: "Sea dramas part of eventful life"

Author: "Dinsdale, Mike"
Title: "Dancing couple in step for 60 years"
description: "Dancing couple in step for 60 years"

Author: "Piddock, Gerald"
Title: "He's kept the plant going for 21 years"
description: "He's kept the plant going for 21 years"

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "The Kaimai miracle"
description: "Describes the collapse of the Kaimai Tunnel near Tauranga, 24 Feb 1970. Describes how five of the miners trapped inside rescued two of their colleagues, how contact was established, and how the men were finally rescued after 80 hours."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Tears, tantrums & triumphs"
description: "Talks to Londoner Gary Harris, who has recently resigned as the artistic director for the Royal New Zealand Ballet. Notes his contributions to the troupe and backgrounds his career in dance. Discusses his goals in expanding the ballet company's repertoire and improving technical standards. Notes his future plans."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Tribute to an inspired teacher"
description: "Looks at a touring dance and acting production, 'Lily', intended as a tribute to a legendary Dunedin ballet teacher. Biographical details."

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "History in the language of Truth"
description: "History in the language of Truth"

Author: "Nichols, Lane"
Title: "Just how green will we go under Citizen Celia?; How Team Wade-Brown pulled off the upset"
description: "Outlines the policies and leadership style of the newly elected mayor of Wellington, the first Green Party mayor elected in the capital.  Investigates the tactics behind her successful campaign as an independent candidate, and talks to her campaign manager. Provides facts about her life."

Author: "Shaw, Peter,"
Title: "Roy the rover"
description: "Discusses the appointment of international conductor Roy Goodman as principal guest conductor for the Auckland Philharmonia until 2012. Backgrounds Goodman's career, including with the Bach piece 'St Matthew Passion', set to be performed by the orchestra at the Auckland Town Hall, 28 Oct 2010."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Brainstorm"
description: "Discusses epilepsy. Looks at what it is, and the various types of epilepsy.  Notes research from Lynette Sadeir of the University of Otago to track genetics in NZ families, talking to her about the damage caused by the condition. Discusses the lack of evidence on which drugs (anti-seizure drugs such as levetiracetam) work on which patients, noting an international database project (EpiNet) to conduct trials on treatment."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "Henry reveals cracks in public service broadcasting"
description: "Focuses on the aftermath of the firing of TV One 'Breakfast' host Paul Henry for making inappropriate remarks about the Fiji-Indian heritage of Governor-General Sir Anand Satyanand. Explores the question of whether the state broadcaster has gone too far in its drive for ratings, and asks whether it is time for a new flagship public broadcaster. Seeks comments from former TVNZ chief executive Ian Fraser, former broadcaster Brian Edwards and Minister of Broadcasting Dr Jonathan Coleman."

Author: "Murdoch, Helen"
Title: "Never a dull moment in writer's rich life"
description: "Never a dull moment in writer's rich life"

Title: "Mountaineer kept grounded by strong social conscience"
description: "Mountaineer kept grounded by strong social conscience"

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "The sun conundrum"
description: "Looks at research by Pamela Von Hurst, Massey University, on how sun avoidance in NZ is affecting vitamin D levels. Notes that 84% of South Asian women studied, with generally darker skins, have inadequate vitamin D levels, and discusses the health effects of low vitamin D, calcium absorption, and low physical activity in these women and the risk and prevalence of osteoporosis. Notes new guidelines about vitamin D synthesis for NZers with darker skins, and a possible need for supplementation."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Royal tour man known for diplomacy and discretion"
description: "Royal tour man known for diplomacy and discretion"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Maoridom mourns great statesman"
description: "Maoridom mourns great statesman"

Author: "Round, Derek,"
Title: "Top NZ spy led life of danger and intrigue"
description: "Top NZ spy led life of danger and intrigue"

Title: "Fighter pilot part of D-Day invasion"
description: "Fighter pilot part of D-Day invasion"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Australian mine planned on NZ conservation land"
description: "Reports that the Overseas Investment Office has approved a planning application by Australian-based Bathurst Investments to develop an opencast coal mine next to the Solid Energy Stockton site, West Coast. Informs that the land sought by the company includes the Mt Rochford Conservation Area, under which the Dept of Conservation has stewardship. Talks to DOC staff about the proposal.  Seeks comment from Bathurst Resources managing director Hamish Bohannan about its plans to minimise the environmental footprint of mining operations, including effects on endangered powellphanta augusta snails and other wildlife."

Author: "Gates, Charlie"
Title: "'Loser' guilty of manslaughter : Whanau not giving up on Bannan : Pursuits vital to stop 'lawlessness'"
description: "'Loser' guilty of manslaughter : Whanau not giving up on Bannan : Pursuits vital to stop 'lawlessness'"

Author: "Gerken, Sonia"
Title: "Gore High celebrates as its Youth Olympics hero Aaron returns"
description: "Gore High celebrates as its Youth Olympics hero Aaron returns"

Author: "Fea, Sue"
Title: "Legendary Qtown hotel hostess dies"
description: "Legendary Qtown hotel hostess dies"

Title: "Man sentenced to two years' jail for arson"
description: "Man sentenced to two years' jail for arson"

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Showing concern for others 'rewarding'"
description: "Showing concern for others 'rewarding'"

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "The curse of taking up the chase"
description: "Investigates whether new rules to make police pursuits safer will be sufficient to reduce the number of people killed and injured during police chases. Talks to relatives of family members who have died during recent police pursuits. Compares NZ's record of fatalities during pursuits  with that of several other nations. Seeks comment from chief coroner Neil MacLean and others. Lists 13 serious police pursuits investigated by the Independent Police Complaints Authority (IPCA) investigative team since 2007. Describes the circumstances of pursuits during 2010 in which 14 people have died. Explains how a police pursuit works."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Perfect match or unholy alliance?"
description: "Sums up the themes of a speech by Dept of Conservation chief executive Al Morrison about the future of NZ's natural environment. Asks five key business figures whether they consider economic growth and environmental protection to be mutually exclusive. Cites the views of Sir George Fistonich of Villa Maria Estate, Kelvin Wickham of Fonterra, Richard Manaton of Progressive Enterprises, Geoff Ross of 42Below vodka and Rob Fenwick of Living Earth."

Author: "Mace, William"
Title: "The big business of being fabulous; Fashion Week building business"
description: "Reports on the economic clout generated by New Zealand Fashion Week, and its benefits to sponsors and designers."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "The sun conundrum"
description: "Looks at research by Pamela Von Hurst, Massey University, on how sun avoidance in NZ is affecting vitamin D levels. Notes that 84% of South Asian women studied, with generally darker skins, have inadequate vitamin D levels, and discusses the health effects of low vitamin D, calcium absorption, and low physical activity in these women and the risk and prevalence of osteoporosis. Notes new guidelines about vitamin D synthesis for NZs with darker skins, and a possible need for supplementation."

Author: "Thomas, Paul"
Title: "Real Kiwis"
description: "Discusses criticism in the British media of Polynesian players in the All Blacks, pointing out factual errors in claims that NZ recruits players from Pacific countries such as Fiji, Samoa or Tonga. Notes a double standard with several English or Scottish players being immigrants from elsewhere."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "The Hubbard enigma"
description: "Discusses the financial irregularities uncovered by statutory managers reporting on investment funds run by Allan Hubbard (Aorangi Securities, Hubbard Management Funds). Describes high risk investments such as loans to farms made with little accountability to investors."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Saint to be praised; The side of the angels; Progress of the pilgrimage"
description: "Talks about the life of Mary MacKillop (after canonisation 'St Mary of The Cross'), her visits to NZ, and the concept of sainthood."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "A chain and a city"
description: "Profiles the Invercargill-born mayor-elect of Dunedin. Outlines his policies and discusses the challenges facing the council. Presents facts about his life and leisure interests."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "The fat of the land"
description: "Reports on a new study that reveals the food animals consume on NZ farms makes its way to us as trans fats and may play a part in cardiovascular disease. Reveals the findings from an observational study led by Dr. Jocelyne Benatar at the Cardiovascular Research Unit of Auckland City Hospital. Shows the palm kernel-based trans fat (palmitelaidic acid) does not originate from processed food but comes from our dairy food. Postulates what our cows are being fed is coming up through the food chain, 'the ruminant bacteria in cows' stomachs are making it into trans fat and that trans fat we get'. Indicates the possibility that natural trans fats may play a part in polyvascular disease which Dr. Benatar wants to investigate further. Includes some basic facts associated with trans fats 'The basic fats of the matter' that has been adapted from Food Standards Australia New Zealand and New Zealand Food and Safety Authority information sheets."

Title: "Still passionate after 23 years in job"
description: "Interviews the beauty colour and style consultant who is also a bra and shapewear fitter. Discusses the nature of her work and how she became interested in her job."

Author: "Bradley, Antonio"
Title: "A love story till the end : couple die just six hours apart"
description: "A love story till the end : couple die just six hours apart"

Author: "Richens, Matt"
Title: "Mate against mate for gold : that sounds appealing"
description: "Mate against mate for gold : that sounds appealing"

Author: "Richens, Matt"
Title: "Nervous van Dyk keeps flag flying"
description: "Nervous van Dyk keeps flag flying"

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "Green swing tipped to unseat mayor"
description: "Green swing tipped to unseat mayor"

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "Young victor proud to lead diverse group"
description: "Young victor proud to lead diverse group"

Title: "Navy conscript says he doesn't deserve medal"
description: "Navy conscript says he doesn't deserve medal"

Author: "Ford, Greg"
Title: "Late mother 'was there with me'"
description: "Late mother 'was there with me'"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Fight not over : victim; 'They believed I was innocent : former police officer 'a broken man'"
description: "Fight not over : victim; 'They believed I was innocent : former police officer 'a broken man'"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Parents still seek answers over son's death"
description: "Parents still seek answers over son's death"

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "Hospitality pioneer ahead of her time"
description: "Hospitality pioneer ahead of her time"

Author: "Seconi, Adrian"
Title: "Opportunity knocks for country side"
description: "Opportunity knocks for country side"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Veteran still enjoys karting 50 years on"
description: "Veteran still enjoys karting 50 years on"

Title: "Tragic crash will 'haunt' driver for life"
description: "Tragic crash will 'haunt' driver for life"

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "VE Day engagement leads couple to 65 years of marriage"
description: "VE Day engagement leads couple to 65 years of marriage"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Concerns noted before fatal crash"
description: "Concerns noted before fatal crash"

Author: "Somerville, Philip,"
Title: "Politically charged actions and prose"
description: "Politically charged actions and prose"

Title: "Pioneer of ecotourism on Otago Peninsula"
description: "Pioneer of ecotourism on Otago Peninsula"

Author: "Gilhooly, Daniel"
Title: "Ali's Delhi Gold; Family elated at gold win"
description: "Ali's Delhi Gold; Family elated at gold win"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "From sea to shining sea"
description: "Talks to members of the Great Harbour Way group which is advocating the construction of a 60-kilometre combined cycleway and walkway around Wellington Harbour from Pencarrow to Red Rocks. Describes the scoping studies and lobbying carried out since 2003, noting that new mayor Celia Wade-Brown is a founding member. Cites comments from NZ Transport Agency (NZTA) that it is considering the shared-use path as part of its future state highway planning. Considers the possibilities for cycling tourism. Advises that NZTA and local council approval and funding are needed for implementation."

Title: "Sign up and make us safer"
description: "Encourages readers to join up to the newspaper initiated campaign for road users to moderate their drinking by signing up to 'Two drinks max'. Investigates NZers' attitudes towards drinking alcohol and driving and includes well known NZers who support the campaign. Reports the Government's position on drink driving which the newspaper believes is not progressive enough. Includes the views of an insurance industry representative and a photographer's personal experience of the consequences of drink driving."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "I may not know much about art ..."
description: "Discusses the uproar over the artist Tao Wells and his The Beneficiary's Office. Reveals the actual amount funded by Creative NZ for the project, noting it came from the Contestable Funding Programme. Contrasts the delight at the media attention by the work's curators, Mark Amery and Sophie Jerram, with CNZ's reaction. Seeks comments from CNZ's Cath Cardiff about application and funding processes, stricter accountability for artists receiving contestable funding, and recent CNZ-funded successes, such as the Indian Ink Theatre productions (Krishnan's Dairy, The Guru of Chai)."

Author: "Harvey, Helen"
Title: "Kiwi artist comes to full bloom in royal garden book"
description: "Chats to the botanical artist about her three rhododendron watercolours included in Prince Charles' two-volume set Highgrove Florilegium. Follows her career, including her participating in a botanical illustration course in England, painting stamps for NZ Post, and exhibiting her work. Explains her meticulous illustration process, notes the importance of recording flowers, and shares anecdotes about working with Prince Charles."

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Unhappy campers"
description: "Outlines that many imported second-hand caravans have been stolen or water damaged before arriving in NZ. Focuses on those used caravans originating from the UK and the need to check on the caravan's history via the VIN (Vehicle Identification Number) that is recorded on the UK's CRIS (Caravan Registration and Indentification Scheme) and can be accessed on www.hpicheck.com."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Small, wrinkly and worth waiting for"
description: "Reports on the breeding of 'wild blood line' tuatara at Wellington Zoo. Announces the resulting incubation, hatching and care of seven tuatara at Victoria University working in tandem with the Department of Conservation (DoC). Provides a fact sheet about the reptiles."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Author (detailed): "Frances Morton and Leigh van der Stoep"
Title: "Sign up : 'Two drinks max'; Boy grieves for his mum"
description: "Notes to date the Government has resisted making a change to the legal limit of 80mg of alcohol per 100ml of blood to 50mg per 100ml of blood, instead it has ordered a two year research project into crashes caused by drivers with blood-alcohol levels between 50mg per 100ml of blood and the current of 80mg of alcohol per 100ml of blood. Looks at research and current data available to propose a lowering of the current legal limit. Includes some well known personalities who have pledged their support for the 'Two drinks max' campaign."

Author: "Coddington, Deborah"
Title: "Exclusive : Justice Wilson speaks out"
description: "Talks to Bill Wilson QC about his resignation this week over allegations of conflict of interest. The Supreme Court judge puts his side of the story responding to allegations of bias."

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "Fresh faces on the chain gang"
description: "Profiles the new mayors of Porirua and Lower Hutt. Speaks to Nick Leggett (Porirua) about an early interest in politics, his connection to Mike Moore, his Labour affiliation, and his aspirations to erase Porirua's reputation for crime and poverty, vitalise the city shopping centre, and replace an aging sewerage system. Talks to Ray Wallace about his early political activity, his stints with Labour and National, his personal health goals, and his desire to upgrade Lower Hutt from underrated to vibrant. Lists and describes briefly the members of the Porirua City Council and Hutt City Council."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "The boffin in the Beehive : driving the smart economy beyond No 8 wire"
description: "Talks to the Prime Minister's chief science adviser about his role and sphere of influence. Discusses the level of science and research in the NZ economy and how it compares to other countries. Conveys the opinion that NZ is anti-intellectual and underestimates its scientific developments. Presents some biographical details. Notes four areas in which he has been involved: risky youth behaviour, climate change, research funding, and over-the-counter sales of cold and flu medicine."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Lost"
description: "Retraces the July 2009 tramp in the Tararua ranges on which Seddon Bennington and Rosie (Marcella) Jackson died trying to reach Kime Hut. Discusses the pair's equipment, fitness, experience, and the area's reputation for inadequate weather forecasting and limited clear weather. Documents the actions of other trampers on the crossing, the coroner's conclusions, and the search and rescue operation. Mentions the mystery of the hut door being left open."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Welcome to the parlour"
description: "Visits the 1906 Napier villa of design writer Douglas Lloyd Jenkins. Looks inside and describes how he has decorated his house, noting his switch from mid-century modernist to Victorian style pieces. Lists some decorating tips. Mentions his new book due out next week."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Illuminating tales of a nameless soul"
description: "Illuminating tales of a nameless soul"

Author: "Harvey, Siobhan,"
Title: "Fearnley back to her strengths in a rich read"
description: "Fearnley back to her strengths in a rich read"

Author: "Lafraie, Hashmat"
Title: "Family flight from terrors of Taliban"
description: "Recounts his family's journey out of Afghanistan, escaping from the Taliban. Hashmat indicates he was five at the time and his father was a former foreign minister of Afghanistan after the Soviet invasion. Focuses on the moment when they were apprehended by the Tailban before their final release."

Author: "Kilty, Robyn"
Title: "Flaxmere a work of art"
description: "Visits and describes the three-hectare Hawarden garden of Penny Zino, as she prepares for the Art in a Garden exhibition."

Author: "Bond, Sarah"
Title: "Opening a frontier"
description: "Recounts the history of the Haast Pass, from its beginnings as a MaÃÑori greenstone route, Tioripatea, to the 25-year construction of the road connecting Otago and the West Coast. Notes an event taking place 6 November 2010 near Haast Aerodrome to commemorate the road's 50th anniversary."

Author: "Knowler, Richard"
Title: "Elsom a star back, who loved up front"
description: "Elsom a star back, who loved up front"

Title: "Cartoonist with a unique slant on world history"
description: "Cartoonist with a unique slant on world history"

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Lesson from the past"
description: "Revisits the 5.6 earthquake that shook Newcastle, Australia, on 28 December 1989, teasing out lessons for  post-quake Christchurch. Gleans information about the opportunities for urban renewal and civic building, the dangers of demolishing and rebuilding too soon, the pitfalls in moving from disaster to recovery, and the juncture of when to remember and forget the event. Cites advice by Australian consultant Brian Eastoe on how to coordinate post-quake interests to avoid disputes. Ponders Newcastle's unreadiness, given the area's history of tremors every 60 to 70 years. Chronicles the saving from demolition of the Christ Church Cathedral by architect Barney Collins, detailing the preservation technology utilised."

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "Tip the balance"
description: "Identifies nine behavioural factors that can help men live longer."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Size matters"
description: "Talks to Wellington artist and sculptor Elizabeth Thomson about her artwork and construction methods necessitating a large studio, about reconfiguring works differently for different exhibitions, and the creative of husband, Warwick. Notes the book featuring her studio and 23 others."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Cardiac Arrest : who ya gonna call?"
description: "Recognises the contribution that having widespread, publicly available automated external defibrillators (AED), and education and training in using them, would make to reducing the incidence of deaths from cardiac arrest in NZ.  Talks to medical professionals about the need to provide more defibrillators in public buildings as well as a database of information as to their whereabouts.  Offers brief case studies of cardiac arrest victims whose lives were saved by a defibrillator.  Outlines how to perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation.  Lists some places around NZ that have defibrillators."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Who ya gonna call?"
description: "Recognises the contribution that having widespread, publicly available automated external defibrillators (AED), and education and training in using them, would make to reducing the incidence of deaths from cardiac arrest in NZ.  Talks to medical professionals about the need to provide more defibrillators in public buildings as well as a database of information as to their whereabouts.  Offers brief case studies of cardiac arrest victims whose lives were saved by a defibrillator.  Outlines how to perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation.  Lists some places around NZ that have defibrillators."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Lost"
description: "Retraces the July 2009 tramp in the Tararua ranges on which Seddon Bennington and Rosie (Marcella) Jackson died trying to reach Kime Hut. Discusses the pair's equipment, fitness, experience, and the area's reputation for inadequate weather forecasting and limited clear weather. Documents the actions of other trampers on the crossing, the coroner's conclusions, and the search and rescue operation. Mentions the mystery of the hut door being left open."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "The fat in the feed"
description: "Speaks to Auckland City Hospital Cardiovascular Research Unit senior researcher Dr Jocelyne Benatar about her research into the possible links between the palmitelaidic acid found in palm kernel expeller (PKE) contained in cattle feed and the incidence of coronary heart disease in NZers.  Relays the doubts expressed on the issue by other scientists.  Observes the debate between Greenpeace and the agriculture industry over the use of PKE as a supplementary food for livestock."

Author: "Cooper, Michael,"
Title: "Cheap thrills"
description: "Exposes the flaws in recently touted research by University of Otago Wellington Department of Public Health researchers Nick Wilson and Fiona Imlach Gunasekara claiming that alcohol is cheaper than bottled water.  Criticises the media for promulgating the study."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Wellington's easy rider"
description: "Profiles the city's newly elected mayor. Speaks to her about her personal and professional background, lifestyle, and making good her campaign promises."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Wellington's easy rider"
description: "Profiles the city's newly elected mayor.   Speaks to her about her personal and professional background, lifestyle, and making good her campaign promises."

Author: "Longmore, Mary"
Title: "Home, sweet home"
description: "Witnesses improved relations between refugee immigration advocacy groups, led by the National Refugee Network, and the Immigration Profiling Group (IPG) whose responsibility is to screen migrants from high-risk countries, following an overhaul of the latter.  Backgrounds the inefficiencies with the service in dealing with assessing and processing refugee families for reunification under the Immigration NZ Family Support category, then describes how issues were resolved.  Talks to immigrants whose families had been split between NZ and their troubled homelands about their experiences with immigration and reunification."

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "Customary outrages"
description: "Comments on the reaction to the warning by Te Papa advising pregnant or menstruating women not to attend a tour of the museum's storage areas to which regional staff were recently invited, because of the taonga contained in those areas."

Author: "Ireland, Peter"
Title: "Out of the pigeonhole"
description: "Reviews 'Ann Verdcourt : ceramics', Te Manawa, Palmerston North, and Sarjeant Gallery, Whanganui, until 5 Dec 2010."

Author: "Cunliffe, Simon"
Title: "Strangers in the house"
description: "Reviews three plays from the just concluded Otago Festival of the Arts."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Shade in a bottle?"
description: "Warns of the false sense of security that new extra-powerful sunscreens with sun protection factors (SPF) as high as 100 might give to sun worshippers.  Advises how, and how often, to apply sunscreen."

Author: "Diamond, Paul"
Title: "They shot him down"
description: "Investigates the life of the Whanganui mayor (Charles Mackay) who shot and wounded Walter D'Arcy Cresswell.  Notes the episode's place in New Zealand literary and criminal history, documenting the attempts to erase Mackay from local history. Traces the lives of both men following the shooting, including  Mackay's death in Berlin during a clash between German police and Communist protesters. Suggests motives for D'Arcy Cresswell's attempt to blackmail Evans."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Let them eat cake"
description: "Advises dieters how to resist the pressure to indulge in unhealthy food offered to them in social situations such as at a friend's home or a morning tea break at the office."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Building a solar future"
description: "Showcases the solar-powered house designed by FirstLight NZ, the team of Victoria University School of Architecture postgraduate students Nick Officer, Ben Jagersma, Anna Farrow and Eli Nuttall, and being entered into the US Department of Energy Solar Decathlon design competition."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Sunny side up"
description: "Showcases the solar-powered house designed by FirstLight NZ, the team of Victoria University School of Architecture postgraduate students Nick Officer, Ben Jagersma, Anna Farrow and Eli Nuttall, and being entered into the US Department of Energy Solar Decathlon design competition."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Welcome to the parlour"
description: "Visits the 1906 Napier villa of design writer Douglas Lloyd Jenkins. Looks inside and describes how he has decorated his house, noting his switch from mid-century modernist to Victorian style pieces. Lists some decorating tips. Mentions his new book due out next week."

Author: "Easton, B. H."
Title: "Flatter and flatter"
description: "Speculates on whether the current recession will stagnate and extend into a long one.  Compares to past recessions.  Considers whether there is too much optimism at the moment."

Author: "Zwartz, Hannah"
Title: "Landscaping that lasts"
description: "Visits and describes the Masterton garden, Parera, one of the few remaining examples of works by garden designer Alfred Buxton. Talks to owner Mark Allen about the original cost of the garden, and its current preparation for the Wairarapa Bird and Garden tour."

Author: "Brown, Kester,"
Title: "Quest for the perfect break point"
description: "Talks to surfer and journalist Paul Hersey about his recently released book about NZ surf culture. Describes a surfing experience with his subject at New Brighton, Christchurch."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Illuminating tales of a nameless soul"
description: "Illuminating tales of a nameless soul"

Author: "Harvey, Siobhan,"
Title: "Fearnley back to her strengths in a rich read"
description: "Fearnley back to her strengths in a rich read"

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Under the mountain"
description: "Admires two of Taranaki's most beautiful gardens : Tikorangi, the Waitara garden of Mark Jury, and Te Kainga Marire, the inner-city garden of Valda Poletti and David Clarkson."

Author: "Hewson, Laura"
Title: "Bend it like Bikram"
description: "Explores the growing popularity of Bikram yoga.  Discusses its methods and health benefits with teacher and owner of Bikram Yoga Dunedin, Donna Wikio.  Chats to local devotees about what they get out of it.    Backgrounds its origins by founder Bikram Choudhury.   Outlines what you need to know before, during, and after a Bikram class."

Author: "Duthie, Dot"
Title: "Taking music to the people"
description: "Reminisces about working with Chamber Music NZ, now celebrating its 60th anniversary, organising its Dunedin concerts in the late 1990s and early 2000s. Relays anecdotes about audiences, personalised seating arrangements, the frustration of dealing with centralised organisation and the  occasional need to run under 'tartan rules', and musicians' appreciation of her fruitcake."

Author: "Gale, Alex M."
Title: "Our forebears built on solid foundations, and so should we"
description: "The new minister of the Valley Baptist Church, Northeast Valley, contemplates the city's foundations, both physical and spiritual."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Too much of a good thing..."
description: "Investigates how the surplus of grapes has forced the NZ wine industry to make some serious adjustments."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "Downsizing ... MCs first"
description: "Criticises the use of management consultants (MCs) and how the advice they give can be the downfall of a company or a service."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Port finds property a winner; Syndicates active"
description: "Discusses the increase of CentrePort's property developments on the waterfront. Looks at how some of the few commercial property deals being consummated in the current market are by syndicators."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "A confusing transaction"
description: "Comments on the case of 'Westpac New Zealand Ltd v MAP & Associates Ltd [2010] (NZCA 404)', which involved a Bolivian bank, a Hamilton accountancy firm and Westpac NZ."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Something old, something new ..."
description: "Ponders on the varieties of wine in NZ and which will take the public's fancy."

Title: "Fair trading breach by building firm directors"
