Notes its racism and harassment of various public figures (such as outing Marilyn Waring as a lesbian) and descent into sleazier material prior to its demise in 2009."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "The whole Truth"
description: "Talks to historian Redmer Yska, author of a new book on the history of tabloid newspaper Truth. Examines the newspaper's editorial biases and the details behind the journalism on the high profile 1970s stories about a conspiracy involving Norman Kirk and Bill Sutch to socialise NZ. Gives an overview of the newspaper's history, including its working class stance, sensationalism, and editorial direction under board chairman James Dunn. Notes its racism and harassment of various public figures (such as outing Marilyn Waring as a lesbian) and descent into sleazier material prior to its demise in 2009."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Ultimate questions of life and everything"
description: "Talks to molecular biologist Warren Tate (University of Otago), winner of the 2010 Rutherford Medal. Discusses his current research, exploring the origins of genetic coding via DNA and RNA through a model of development from glycine transfer RNA (tRNA) early in Earth's history.  Profiles Tate's education and career, noting his research into translational frame shifting in DNA replication as well as involvement in the development of drugs to treat Alzheimer's disease (sAPP alpha). Notes his working life as a research scientist and pride in fostering graduate students."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "A thought for the future"
description: "Talks to Debbie Versey, who works for Ryman Healthcare based in Christchurch about, the changing face of the retirement industry. Mentions official government policy supports 'ageing in place' a packaged deal of a retirement village, with ready-made community designed around old people."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Fonterra eyes future in thriving China"
description: "Tells of Fonterra's move to China in order to start a business in a foreign land. Talks with Fonterra China managing director Philip Turner, a former diplomat, about business in China even after Fonterra's involvement with Chinese dairy company SanLu and the infant formula scandal."

Author: "Shute, Gareth,"
Title: "Birds of a feather"
description: "Talks to Christchurch musician Dudley Benson about his new album, following up from his first 'The Awakening'. Shows his musical development and interest in waiata by songwriter Hirini Melbourne. Describes the development of the album, an a cappella collection of these waiata combined with native birdsong and collaborations with other musicians. Reviews the album."

Author: "Shute, Gareth,"
Title: "Birds of a feather"
description: "Talks to Christchurch musician Dudley benson about his new album, following up from his first 'The Awakening'. Shows his musical development and interest in waiata by songwriter hirini Melbourne. Describes the development of the album, an a cappella collection of these waiata combined with native birdsong and collaborations with other musicians. Reviews the album."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "'For me it was survival of the ego'"
description: "Talks to Auckland painter Mary McIntyre, subject of a new biography.  Discusses how she developed from a farmer's wife into a talented artist, at the expense of her marriage and her continuing involvement in art and teaching art despite being in her 80s."

Author: "Brookbanks, Rhys,"
Title: "Device of deception"
description: "Looks at the gaming industry and whether it needs further regulating. Shows Lynette Whale, a 51 yr old recovering gambling addict. Mentions the People Before Pokies Bill, currently getting a reading in Parliament."

Author: "Sands, Elspeth"
Title: "That elusive magic"
description: "Review of a play by Greg McGee, directed by Conrad Newport, Circa Theatre, Wellington, until 4 Dec 2010."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Stone-age thinking"
description: "Discusses widespread depression as unique to western lifestyles, and notes a theory by American psychologist Steve Ilardi tying this to our evolution as hunter-gatherers. Examines the use of antidepressants and the usefulness of cognitive behaviour therapy. Looks at  Ilardi's six step guidelines to overcoming depression."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Weighs and means"
description: "Looks at the rising number of obese and overweight NZers, and the association between self-weighing and weight maintenance and weight loss. Mentions criticism from the Eating Difficulties Education Network (Eden) about using scales at home, pointing out normal daily weight fluctuation and problems with a focus on weight or the body mass index (BMI) as an indicator of health. Notes that assessment of babies and toddlers, and of the elderly, focuses on a wider number of factors than just weight and discusses the social reasons for this focus and other lifestyle and health indicators to take into account."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Hobbitual abuse"
description: "Discusses the 'Hobbit clause', legislation passed under urgency in 2010 to clarify employment law and encourage Warner Bros to make the film 'the Hobbit' in NZ. Looks at the common law case involving James Bryson that prompted the change and questions the need to write a law affecting the entire film industry without public debate."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "SIS officer was also a keen bandsman"
description: "SIS officer was also a keen bandsman"

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "Women on top at taxi firm"
description: "Tells of Christchurch first CarboNZero-certified taxi fleet, First Direct, owned and managed by Pam Jackman."

Author: "Rush, Paul"
Title: "Voyaging back in time"
description: "Relates his journey in a jet boat down the Wairaurahiri River from Lake Hauroko to the sea through the Fiordland National Park. Talks to the skipper of the jet, Johan Groters and other characters associated with the area."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Class clown on the hop"
description: "Talks to Savage (Demetrius Savelio) about teaching hip-hop to pupils at Otago Boys' and Otago Girls' High Schools with the grand prize of a trip to New York to perform for some record company executives."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Adventures in the back of beyond"
description: "Reports on the reunion of a group of men who worked on the Haast Pass Road, commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Haast-Otago Road, 6 Nov 2010. Talks to some of the men, including Sonny Yates, Andy Benington, Brian McCarthy, Martin Gugich and brothers Pat Stewart and Dave Stewart about their experiences and memories. Informs that Waikanae author Dave Grantham has just written a book on the making of the road, and that the book was launched in Haast, 5 Nov 2010."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Book learning"
description: "Talks to the emeritus professor of politics at the University of Otago about his soon-to-be-published book, subtitled 'Around the world in 200 books'. Describes his aim to persuade people to read great works of literature, and suggests five books to start with. Mentions that he intends that the book will be the first of a trilogy aimed at providing people with a breadth of knowledge. Touches on his international expertise in the field of intelligence."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Something amiss; A woman's lot"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin City Council councillor about why she feels she has been sidelined from full participation in the council after being slighted for the chair of the planning and environment committee. Discusses the under-representation of women and other groups on the council. Seeks views of University of Otago political studies lecturer Dr Janine Hayward and University of Canterbury lecturer Dr Jean Drage, both of whom have researched women's under-representation in local government. Asks other Dunedin City Councillors to comment on gender imbalance."

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Tried and tweed"
description: "Highlights an upcoming climbing expedition to Aoraki-Mt Cook by the duo to re-enact the experience of past explorers. Talks to the Coast-to-Coast champion (who will be using modern equipment) and the commercial flower grower and adventure racing competitor (who will be attired in historic gear). Describes previous attempts in the 19th century by those seeking to be the first to reach the summit of Aoraki, focusing on the many attempts made by the North Canterbury pair. Mentions other retro-style climbing expeditions in NZ and overseas."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "In tune for Christmas"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-raised songwriter about the motivation for her latest album, a collection of Christmas covers by NZ artists. Comments on her career."

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "This job's a pane - or two"
description: "Interviews the glass specialist, co-owner of Wanaka Euroglass, about the nature of his work."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Bard is the word"
description: "Features the launch by the Dunedin Public Library of the Robert Burns poetry competition, 20 Nov 2010-10 Jan 2011. Talks to Professor Liam McIlvanney of the Centre for Irish and Scottish Studies, University of Otago, about the influence of the poet on poets and society. Provides information about the competition and how to enter it."

Author: "Driessen, Erin"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Woven tapestries 1976-2010' by Margery Blackman, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin. Reviews 'New prints and paintings' by Stanley Palmer, Milford Galleries, Dunedin, until 24 Dec 2010."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Help pours in as girl, 12, fights for her life"
description: "Help pours in as girl, 12, fights for her life"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Bank chief parties like it's 1989"
description: "Bank chief parties like it's 1989"

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Surgeons rejoin pulverised hand"
description: "Surgeons rejoin pulverised hand"

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Law finds room for homeless"
description: "Backgrounds a special new court for the homeless of Auckland. Portrays the various goings-on during the first sitting of the court."

Author: "Irvine, Katherine"
Title: "Taking themselves on in a test of character"
description: "Taking themselves on in a test of character"

Author: "McManus, Jenni"
Title: "Fantasy gone; hello reality"
description: "Reports on the NZ economy and the recession. Mentions that business profitability is deteriorating, this may weigh on investors and hiring, which are drivers of medium term growth. Includes articles on housing and a feel-less bad recovery in NZ."

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "Sweet success for first cowgirl Milkybar Kid"
description: "Sweet success for first cowgirl Milkybar Kid"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Top recognition for young Pacific talent"
description: "Top recognition for young Pacific talent"

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "The living canvas"
description: "Talks to tattoo artist Manu Edwin about how he came into the tattooing industry, ahead of the NZ Tattoo and Art Festival to be held at the TBS Stadium, Wellington, 27-28 November."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Green growth"
description: "Examines the future of the Green Party now that Keith Locke is the only remaining original member. Discusses the new co-leadership of Russel Norman and Metiria Turei. Notes the party's stability compared to other minority parties. Profiles Young Greens co-leader Holly Walker. Indicates dissent over the Christchurch (Darfield) earthquake vote, and asks whether this shows a trend toward pragmatism over principles.  Talks to current and former Party members about whether there is a trend toward diversification versus activism. Ponders how the party will position itself at the next election, and whether the party policies are becoming mainstream."

Title: "A perfect attitude"
description: "Tells of Brad Webster winning the national honours at the annual FITEC awards dinner held in Rotorua, having completed a three-year apprenticeship as a timber machinist at Dannevirke's Kiwi Lumber yard."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Out of the cold"
description: "Reports on travels to Antarctica courtesy of Antarctica NZ, taking visual artists, writers and poets, and how these trips are changing the way we perceive the cold ice. Tells of artist Raewyn Atkinson and her Antarctic-inspired work."

Author: "Bearup, Greg"
Title: "Dick Smith and the planet of doom"
description: "Interviews the electronics retailer and millionaire from Australia. Notes his multiple exploits as publisher, pilot, anti-smoking activist, food retailer, car rally organiser, planet saver, and critic of capitalism. Talks about his family, his short attention span and high-energy levels, and the reasons he regards 'growth' as a false god. Discusses his views on over-population and the fallout from his stance on this issue. Details his setting up of the Wilberforce Award, a $1 million prize for an under-30 advocate of prosperity without growth."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Facebook shows its ugly side"
description: "Looks at the growth of ex-relationship harassment via social networking sites. Discusses the movie 'The social network', which is based on the invention of Facebook, and how it portrays founder Mark Zuckerman and his creation of a vicious website called Facemash which ranked female students at Harvard University. Touches on the conviction of Wellington man Joshua Ashby for distributing indecent matter about his former girlfriend via Facebook. Provides tips from Netsafe's Sean Lyons about how to stay safe online."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Wayne Shelford"
description: "Interviews the rugby coach and former All Black. Talks about his dumping for the All Blacks in 1990."

Author: "Lancashire, Rebecca"
Title: "Game on"
description: "Talks to the American game designer and professor of design and technology Katie Salen about the importance of play in engaging students and communities. Discusses her involvement in the Big Urban Game (BUG) and the success of the free public school Quest to Learn, which engages students through 'missions' and 'quests'. Mentions her participation in the 7th Australasian Conference on Interactive Entertainment 2010, Massey University, Wellington, 22-23 November."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Works dull or delight as tradition revisited"
description: "Reviews 'Orewa' by Campbell Patterson at the Michael Lett Gallery; 'Attempts' by Richard Maloy at the Sue Crockford Gallery; 'States of peace and calm w. personal touch' by Martin Basher at Starkwhite; 'Probability cloud' by Chiara Corbelletto at the Bath Street Gallery; and 'Earthworks' by Russell Jackson at the Nkb Gallery."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Kim Gruschow"
description: "Interviews the bookseller, publisher and chick metal band member (Natural Glow) about her role in planning the Wellington Zinefest 2010."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Old Masters from our own collections"
description: "Reviews the book about European art held in NZ public collections."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Classic CDs"
description: "Reviews the NZ-Irish collaboration of works by Ireland's premier contemporary flautist."

Title: "Mining disaster"
description: "Notifies of a gas explosion at the Pike River mine at Atarau, West Coast, on 19 November 2010, and that 27 coalminers are missing. Details the area and some of the missing men."

Author: "Crowley, John"
Title: "Pair escape by climbing up air vent"
description: "Touches on the escape of two coalminers from the Pike River mine after a gas explosion occurred on 19 November, 2010, following a shift change. Talks to miner Ron Boddy who was on leave that day."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "NZ's worst mining disaster took 43 lives in 1914"
description: "Details six mining disasters in NZ's history, focusing on the 1914 blast at Ralph's Mine, Huntly. Supplies details on the Pike River coalmine, where a gas explosion took place Friday 19 November, 2010."

Title: "Pike River's 'complex geology' requires workers to use flameproof equipment"
description: "Discusses, with Pike River mine chief executive Peter Whitall, the unusual features of the coalmining venture caused by the mine's geological features. Mentions the level of methane gas in the mine and earlier problems with a ventilation shaft."

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "Paddon maintains his focus in drive to reach top of rallying world"
description: "Paddon maintains his focus in drive to reach top of rallying world"

Author: "Wood, Stacey"
Title: "A toast to another vine day in paradise"
description: "Features the 18th Toast Martinborough annual festival of food, drink and music. Lists the vineyards taking part and what they offer. Provides a map of the area, and suggests tips on how to make the experience fun and comfortable. Notes the benefits to the area of holding the annual event."

Author: "Harding, Evan"
Title: "Flying farmer had one speed only - flat out"
description: "Flying farmer had one speed only - flat out"

Author: "Egan, Brendon"
Title: "Grit, determination, power athlete"
description: "Grit, determination, power athlete"

Author: "Harding, Evan"
Title: "Pilot showed achieving dreams possible : elder"
description: "Pilot showed achieving dreams possible : elder"

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Pupils honour lifetime of teaching music"
description: "Pupils honour lifetime of teaching music"

Title: "Cockle count to check on wildlife inlet's health"
description: "Announces the three-yearly cockle survey at Pauatahanui Inlet, in which volunteers belonging to the Guardians of Pauatahanui Inlet collect cockles to assist the National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research (NIWA) determine the ecological health of the lower North Island's only remaining wetland. Notes the tidal wetland is home to a variety of birds, fish, sea creatures and native plants."

Title: "Jonathan finds his feet in podiatry"
description: "Jonathan finds his feet in podiatry"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Meridian project still winding residents up"
description: "Reports that three years after state-owned energy company Meridian publicised plans for the Project Mill Creek wind farm in Wellington's Ohariu Valley, a court battle is still continuing. Lists the benefits of the project. Discusses the reasons for residents' opposition to the project. Notes the experience of residents living close to Meridian's  West Wind project turbines at Makara."

Author: "Burdon, Nathan"
Title: "Hardcore coverage - thanks Barry"
description: "Hardcore coverage - thanks Barry"

Author: "Egan, Brendon"
Title: "Chalaev on target to perform in the London Olympics"
description: "Chalaev on target to perform in the London Olympics"

Title: "Cartoonist wih a unique slant on world history"
description: "Cartoonist wih a unique slant on world history"

Author: "Brown, Giles"
Title: "Speed, alcohol factors in girl's death - police"
description: "Speed, alcohol factors in girl's death - police"

Author: "Brown, Giles"
Title: "A family forgives : boy's mother hugs killer; 'A part of all of us died that day'"
description: "A family forgives : boy's mother hugs killer; 'A part of all of us died that day'"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Cancer claims war hero : Vietnam veteran"
description: "Cancer claims war hero : Vietnam veteran"

Author: "Arnold, Naomi"
Title: "Hundreds celebrate teacher and soulmate's life : shooting death"
description: "Hundreds celebrate teacher and soulmate's life : shooting death"

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "Former CYF care found guilty of abusing girls in his care"
description: "Former CYF care found guilty of abusing girls in his care"

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Murder a tragedy in many ways"
description: "Reports on the events leading up to the brutal killing of the Huntsbury Hill resident by the man convicted of her murder. Talks to his mother and former girlfriend about his troubled and self-destructive life, which included addiction to homebake and suicidal tendencies. Describes the family history of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) which contributed to the death of his father and his own mental state at the time of the murder."

Author: "Chapman, Katie"
Title: "Fighting like cats and dogs"
description: "Reports on plans for the SPCA to move to new premises on Wellington's Mt Victoria which may be jeopardised by the resignations of Board members and by a weak financial position. Gives 2010 statistics for animals brought in and adopted out, outlines the costs of animal care, and details the current and proposed Board. Talks to former board members, including Theresa Gattung, about forming a new Board and the rehousing issue."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "What lies beneath; What lies broken beneath"
description: "Investigates the unseen damage to sewers in the city as a result of the 4 Sep earthquake. Talks to residents regarding the impact of the damage in their neighbourhoods and to Christchurch City Council water and waste unit manager Mark Christison about the preparations required to undertake repairs."

Author: "Conway, Glenn"
Title: "Motherly traits a plus for new council"
description: "Profiles the councillor for Shirley-Papanui who is the newly elected deputy mayor of Christchurch. Discusses her upbringing and family life and early interest in politics. Seeks comment from other councillors about her administrative style."

Author: "Sargent, Ewan"
Title: "The invisible commuter"
description: "Offers his impressions of commuting to Christchurch on his bicycle intermittently over a two-year period."

Author: "Hallett, Adelia"
Title: "What treasure lies under the quake rubble?"
description: "Talks to the professional conservator and archaeologist about the opportunity created by the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake to explore the rubble underneath historic buildings. Discusses her past experience working at British sites for the British television programme 'Time Team', and informs that an approach is being made for funding for a similar programme in NZ to explore sites under damaged Christchurch buildings. Speaks to Frank van der Heijden, Canterbury and West Coast regional archaeologist for the Historic Places Trust, about the history of the city and its stance on old buildings damaged by the earthquake."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Cashing in on Ka Mate"
description: "Examines a new application by Ngati Toa to trademark key phrases in the Ka Mate Haka.  Describes previous controversies that used the haka for marketing or mockery purposes.  Chronicles the history of Ka Mate being used by the All Blacks before rugby matches. Touches on public reaction to the alternative Kapa o Pango haka.  Quotes comments by intellectual property expert Theodore Doucas on the issue of trademarking songs or phrases from songs, the associated costs, and the implications on the item's cultural and spiritual significance."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "United they stand; Marac merger hinges on key meetings; New local bank might be born in merger"
description: "Examines the proposal to merge the operations of the establishment firm with the two building societies and the finance company, which is about to come to the vote. Describes the challenges to the merger and informs that a new locally owned NZ bank may arise from the merger."

Author: "Bearup, Greg"
Title: "Dick Smith and the planet of doom"
description: "Interviews the electronics retailer and millionaire from Australia. Notes his multiple exploits as publisher, pilot, anti-smoking activist, food retailer, car rally organiser, planet saver, and critic of capitalism. Talks about his family, his short attention span and high-energy levels, and the reasons he regards 'growth' as a false god. Discusses his views on over-population and the fallout from his stance on this issue. Details his setting up of the Wilberforce Award, a $1 million prize for an under-30 advocate of prosperity without growth."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "A dip into decadence"
description: "Explores behind-the-scenes preparations for the upcoming production of 'Cabaret', Court Theatre, Christchurch, until 12 Feb 2010. Talks to veteran director Sandra Rasmussen about casting and rehearsals and to costume designer Elizabeth Whiting."

Author: "Brookbanks, Rhys,"
Title: "Arise Nafanua; Taking poetry to the streets"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-born Pasifika writer and performance poet about her work. Discusses her current post as Ursula Bethell writer-in-residence at the University of Canterbury and divulges that she is working on her first novel. Talks to Jim Wilson of postering organisation Phantom Billstickers, who is putting up posters in Washington, DC of NZ poets, including a poem by Tusiata Avia."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Billy T James"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-born comedian about his memories of working with the late comedian, which he has captured in the release of a new DVD. Informs that he will perform at the Christchurch Art Gallery, 27 Nov 2010, to raise money for the earthquake relief fund."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Giving history an overhaul"
description: "Talks to Wellington architect Sam Kebbell. Describes the award-winning bespoke house which he transformed with now-retired architect John Daish to evoke the Arts and Crafts movement. Touches on his collaboration with Gisborne-born artist Peter Adsett to build a house for Adsett in Victoria, Australia. Includes his design tips."

Author: "Davidson, Meg"
Title: "Inlets easy on the eye and the legs"
description: "Reports on her bicycle tour of Hoopers Inlet and Papanui Inlet, Otago Peninsula. Describes the features of the area, how to get there, the nature of the track and other attractions."

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "ANZ's bonus from lottery bonds"
description: "Comments on the performance of the ANZ Investment Services-administered Bonus Bonds scheme over the past year. Touches on the operation of the government-run British model and observes that the NZ scheme could do with some additional publicity."

Author: "De Lacy, Hugh"
Title: "The China connection; World Expo 2010; Kiwi central"
description: "Reports on his trip to the World Expo 2010, Shanghai, China.  Interviews Phillip Gibson, NZ's commissioner to the expo, about the effect of the free trade agreement (FTE) with China and the future opportunities for NZ business. Comments on the NZ pavilion at the expo and the message presented to the 4 million Chinese who visited it. Talks to the expatriate NZer who has spent 14 years doing business in China. Speaks to Liz Te Amo of NZ Trade and Enterprise (NZTE), who manages New Zealand Central, a meeting, event and function centre for NZ businesspeople who seek to enter the Chinese market."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Keeping it light at Xmas"
description: "Examines the cost of sending parcels overseas whether they are being sent before or after the deadline. Details the dimensions, weights and the postage that applies including items that have been banned from being sent through the postal system. Includes comments from two people about what they send overseas and why."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "A resounding debacle; Marine Bill views sought"
description: "Focuses on the repercussions of last-minute negotiations between Warner Brothers and Government to keep 'The Hobbit' films in NZ after union action threatened to derail the project. Cites opinion that the issue was mishandled by all parties, and reflects on government reaction to past industrial disputes. Sums up results of a 'food miles' survey of British shoppers by University of Otago researchers. Reports on the status of the Marine and Coastal Area (Takutai Moana) Bill, the Dairy Industry Restructuring (New Sunset Provisions) Amendment Bill and other bills before select committees."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Sell-off raises eyebrows"
description: "Comments on the surprise sale of some Pernod Ricard wine properties and brands to the consortium led by the former NZ beer-based company, announced in Oct 2010."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Retail developers grasp the nettle; Breakdown of housing costs"
description: "Reports on retail development projects either under way or planned in Auckland, the Wellington region and Queenstown. Sums up findings of a new Dept of Building and Housing study into housing and land costs."

Title: "Focus on construction 'cover pricing'; What is 'cover pricing'?"
description: "Concentrates on the practice of 'cover pricing' of construction projects, and the legal risks involved when tenderers collaborate to invent a 'believable but not genuine' bid for a job. Talks to Kate Morrison, general manager of enforcement for the Commerce Commission, about its research into the issue. Lists 'cover pricing' scenarios and describes penalties under the Commerce Act for breaches."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Interpreting an Act's meaning"
description: "Reports and comments on 'Sheehan and others t/a Otahuhu Joint Venture Partnership v Watson and another [2010] NZCA 454, regarding who should pay for damage caused by a fire in premises owned by the joint venture partnership."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Scourge of the superbug"
description: "Discusses the superbugs VRE (Vancomycin-resistant enterococcus), ESBL (Extended-spectrum beta lactamase), C. diff (Clostridium difficile), NDM-1 (New Delhi metallo-beta-lactamase) and MRSA (Methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus) that are finding their way into NZ medical facilities. Indicates a discussion of superbugs includes either bacteria or enzymes. Notes the begining of the Superbugs Symposium at the University of Auckland, hosted by the Maurice Wilkins Centre for Molecular Biodiscovery, to consider the threat facing NZ and what can be done about it. Includes two stories of patients who contracted a long standing infection and its after effects."

Author: "Harris, Mitch"
Title: "Kiwi battler's last stand"
description: "Looks at what Matt McCarten is doing after a diagnosis of liver cancer. Reports on his reasons for standing in the Mana by-election with no prospect of winning, and describes some of his childhood circumstances and experiences that affects what he values and motivates him."

Author: "Light, Liz"
Title: "Spring's great gift"
description: "Describes Atiu Creek Regional Park and the author's walk on the track."

Author: "Grunwell, Rachel"
Title: "Childcare centres to hike fees; Couple hit by childcare costs"
description: "Childcare centres to hike fees; Couple hit by childcare costs"

Author: "Smith, Cullen"
Title: "Ellen reaches world milestone going at 105 ..."
description: "Ellen reaches world milestone going at 105 ..."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Not working"
description: "Examines the issue of welfare dependency and the growth of child poverty within NZ. Indicates the Welfare Working Group chair, Paula Rebstock, believes the benefit system needs an overhaul. Sees the problem areas as the increasing numbers of elderly who will qualify for the pension in conjunction with and those people who are drawing the Sickness, Invalids' and Domestic Purposes Benefit where less emphasis is placed on obtaining work rather than those who are on the Unemployment Benefit. Investigates the way in which ACC (Accident Compensation Corporation) are dealing with their long-term claimants to facilitate recovery. Includes an article entitled 'A loving shove' in which Adrian Robert's comments about his company's (In-Work) involvement in assisting beneficiaries back into work."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Does counselling really help?"
description: "Reflects on the response of the Government, aid agencies and counselling services in the wake of the Canterbury's earthquake to offer counselling to Cantabrians. Asks whether counselling is needed after a disaster without loss of life. Suggests of more value is social support and practical assistance. Reports the best form of support was the restoring of power and telecommunications, assisting with insurance claims and resolving water and sanitation issues. Indicates the need to watch out for those who may need counselling rather than making a blanket assumption about the need for counselling for all."

Title: "The trauma of war"
description: "Describes the evolvement of understanding of what is now understood to be PTSD (Post-traumatic stress disorder). Previously known as shell shock, 'war neurosis' in the years following WWI and 'anxiety neurosis' or BC (battle casualty) after WWII. Indicates many of the symptoms did not appear until 20-30 years after the war and the Vietnam War prompted the first serious research into PTSD. Describes today's awareness and both preventative and responsive procedures present in the NZ Armed Services that are available. Talks to Canterbury RSA's president about the treatment received by Vietnam veterans when they returned to NZ indicating the medical check focused on the physical without investigating the mental."

Title: "Veteran pilot's sterling service"
description: "Highlights the career of the World War Two bomber pilot."

Author: "Pickmere, Arnold,"
Title: "Gardening guru earned Rutherford Gold Medal"
description: "Pays tribute to the soil scientist and gardening guru."

Title: "Privy councillor and knight"
description: "Presents a brief obituary for the former NZ Court of Appeal judge and Privy Council member."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Get the boot in for fast fitness"
description: "Presents the author's experience of a military-style boot camp fitness workout."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Tonight, I'm going to be ..."
description: "Explores the world of rock star impersonators and tribute bands. Talks to four devoted musicians about their acts."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "The art of optimism"
description: "Talks to Auckland Arts Festival director David Malacari about the event, his career, and Auckland's importance as a cultural centre."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "NZ turbines headed for Scottish fields"
description: "Reports that the Christchurch-based wind turbine manufacturer has launched a renounceable rights issue, aimed at raising about $5.4 million to fund growth. Focuses on a breakthrough to sell the NZ-made turbines in the UK. Talks to the chief executive about the 20-year deal from the UK government."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Not bitter - a battler; Not bitter"
description: "Talks to the former resident of Oamaru, now residing in the North Island, about the fight waged by his mother to keep him out of an institution after he was born with thalidomide-induced birth defects. Describes his own long and determined battle as part of a group of Australian and NZ survivors to win compensation from the German manufacturer of thalidomide, resulting in a recently negotiated settlement. Describes his other work on behalf of people with disabilities. Seeks comment from his mother. Provides information about the use of thalidomide in the 1950s as a sedative and treatment for morning sickness, and its use today for multiple myeloma and erythema nodosum leprosum."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Leaving without a care"
description: "Reports on the family of Anne (Eileen) Harper who filed a complaint about the level of care the 100-year-old woman received from a Tauranga rest home, Cedar Manor.  Cites comments from Green MP Sue Kedgley about her concerns over staff shortages in the aged care sector. Considers the vagueness of General Standards for rest homes. Reviews the health care given and notes the difficulty in diagnosing scabies. Provides statistics on aged care in NZ."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "The thrust of Parry"
description: "Talks to the veteran columnist for the 'Otago Daily Times'. Focuses on his new self-published book, his 35th publication, chronicling his 90 years of life and 65 years in the media. Includes an excerpt from the book."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Title: "Hut-builder a hard man to read; Wife's-eye depiction of artist; Fiction; Enjoyable look at NZ rural life via tales of mixed lot"
description: "Hut-builder a hard man to read; Wife's-eye depiction of artist; Fiction; Enjoyable look at NZ rural life via tales of mixed lot"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Still the Chills"
description: "Talks to the founder of the group, which has been making music on and off for the past 30 years. Discusses his career and the evolution of the group. Speaks to music commentator and journalist Graham Reid, Flying Nun Records founder Roger Shepherd and media commentator Russell Brown about the influence of the group in NZ and overseas. Informs of its 30th anniversary show, Coronation Hall, Dunedin, 27 Nov 2010."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Writing like crazy"
description: "Talks to the former Aucklander, now residing in Los Angeles, about the production and themes of his newly released ninth studio album. Includes a discography."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Hunter and gatherer of crime evidence"
description: "Interviews the scene of crime officer (Soco) with the NZ Police. Describes the nature of his work."

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "Sights of the sound"
description: "Reports on the official relaunch of the Southern Discoveries Milford Discovery Centre and Milford Deep Underwater Observatory, Nov 2010. Describes the upgrade to the discovery centre, based on the experience of the observatory."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Correct time for adapting with geeks"
description: "Talks to Joe Caccioppoli, head of mobility for Gen-i, about the need for businesses to adapt to the challenges of new technology."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Admitting abuse first step to real happiness"
description: "Talks to the woman who was in an abusive relationship with her partner for eight years. Describes the effects on her, her daughter, Grace Ryan, and her family before she left him. Provides contact information about family violence protection and support agencies."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "'He virtually dragged me down to nothing'"
description: "Speaks to the elderly woman who was financially abused by her son."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "New beginning for trio"
description: "Features TriOtago, the newly reconstituted University of Otago piano trio comprising pianist Prof Terrence Dennis, violinist Tessa Petersen and cellist Heleen Du Plessis. Talks to them about the dynamics of a chamber music ensemble, and informs of their inaugural concert, Marama Hall, Dunedin, 28 Nov 2010."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Pieces of eight', various artists, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 30 Jan 2010. Reviews 'Three lights' by Sam Foley, Thomas Elliott and Olav Nielsen, The Artist's Room, Dunedin. Reviews 'The Artist's companion' by Nic Dempster, Gallery De Novo, Dunedin, until 2 Dec 2010."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Romance began at the picture house"
description: "Romance began at the picture house"

Author: "Parsons, Wayne"
Title: "New York marathon a family affair"
description: "New York marathon a family affair"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "No keeping felled farrier from show"
description: "No keeping felled farrier from show"

Author: "Williscroft, Colin"
Title: "Exercise still important at 100"
description: "Exercise still important at 100"

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Oh brother! Family's second UK scholarship"
description: "Oh brother! Family's second UK scholarship"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Decorated navy man was 'exceptional leader'"
description: "Decorated navy man was 'exceptional leader'"

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Hard-working character loved a party"
description: "Hard-working character loved a party"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Sterling service to family and community"
description: "Sterling service to family and community"

Title: "Sense of social responsibility born of childhood hardship"
description: "Sense of social responsibility born of childhood hardship"

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Glamour model swears it's not P but fake snow"
description: "Glamour model swears it's not P but fake snow"

Title: "NZer's cartoons gave unique slant on history"
description: "NZer's cartoons gave unique slant on history"

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Old Golds giving Zampach new zeal"
description: "Old Golds giving Zampach new zeal"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Author (detailed): "Phil Taylor, additional reporting by Grant Bradley and Catherine Masters"
Title: "Peter Whittall - man of the moment for miners"
description: "Profiles the Pike River Coal chief executive officer, describing his career, his family, and his handling of the mining explosion near Reefton. Gives anecdotal impressions from local residents of Greymouth and why they consider him an honorary Coaster."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Old folks miss out on food; Angry families afraid of repercussions"
description: "Discusses the findings of various investigations, including an Otago University report, into the quality and quantity of food served at rest homes. Briefly touches on the problems some rest home residents' families have had with food."

Author: "Vass, Beck"
Title: "Hard veneer helps police get the tough jobs done"
description: "Describes the career of Superintendent Gary Knowles, of Tasman district. Focuses on his management of the aftermath of the Pike River coal mine explosion, contrasting his public persona with that of Pike River Coal Mine chief executive Peter Whittall."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "River of tears"
description: "Talks to Greymouth local residents about the recent Pike River coal mine explosion. Uncovers criticism about the 'green' considerations that prevented the mine being open cast. Looks into the history of mining and explosions in the Reefton-Brunner area. Describes the events as they occurred following the blast, describing reaction to the public announcements and to the presence of the media."

Author: "Hart, Leigh"
Title: "Loss of innocence"
description: "Relates the author's reaction to the incident/tragedy at the Pike River Coal Company coal mine in relation to his father's experience of surviving the Strongman coal mine disaster in 1967 and growing up in Runanga."

Author: "Davison, Isaac"
Author (detailed): "Isaac Davison, additional reporting by Hayden Donnell"
Title: "Gush of gas may be behind blast"
description: "Cites the comments of mining experts on the role played by methane gas in the Pike River coalmine explosion. Explains the operation of gas monitoring devices in coalmines. Discusses international differences in methane-draining requirements."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Bells toll for Pike River 29"
description: "Describes a ceremony at St Patrick's Catholic Church, Greymouth, held for the 29 coalminers caught in the Pike River coalmining explosion and for the community grieving for them."

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Teacher who wouldn't play the game"
description: "Discusses the case of South African accountancy tutor Judy Kraidy and her experience of losing her job after failing overseas students at the NZ Institute of Commerce, Auckland. Investigates another case of an English language school, Oxford International Academy, whose overseas students were deemed by Massey University to have inadequate language skills."

Author: "Haines, Leah"
Title: "Modern man adrift from ancient skills; Blokes can do anything : but the cooking may be a bit dodgy"
description: "Investigates the apparent decline in traditional handyman skills among men. Includes a list of 25 skills every man should know, as according to the American DIY magazine 'Popular mechanics'. Talks to some NZ men about their ability to fix and build things"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Science guru's other first prize - life"
description: "Announces the winners of the 2010 Prime Minister's Science Prize. Talks to the group's leader about his cancer and the importance of staying detached. Discusses his work in 'squishy physics', the creation of the Magritek technology company, and his philosophy on science paying its way."

Author: "Thomas, Geoff"
Title: "How to snare a snapper"
description: "Focuses on the NZ snapper (a member of the bream family). Talks about snapper spawning, how they grow, and what they eat. Provides some tips on catching snapper."

Author: "Thomas, Geoff"
Title: "Be a mate and learn about blackouts"
description: "Talks about how to recognise the symptoms for shallow water blackout while spearfishing and what to do when someone experiences one."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Look how we've changed - New Zealand 38 years on"
description: "Reports on two studies of human development, one started in Dundedin in the 1970s and the other in Auckland earlier this year. Explores the influences of a changed economy, working mothers, education levels, and family mobility. Features a table comparing social and family changes in NZ in 1972 and 2010. Profiles four families who are examples of multi-ethnicity, solo parenting, double-earning households, and the use of fertility treatment (the Maertzschink, King, Taouma and Gaoa, and Gibbon families)."

Author: "Yeoman, Paula"
Title: "Spell bound"
description: "Talks to the singer-songwriter about her debut album."

Author: "Young, Audrey"
Title: "Power to the people"
description: "Examines the results of the recent elections in Tonga. Documents the move to democracy, the role of King George Tupou V, and citizen's expectations for reforms and change. Cites comments on Tonga's new system by High Commissioner Jonathan Austin."

Author: "Broun, Britton"
Title: "A  bus lane runs through it"
description: "Reports on the opening of the controversial new Manners Mall bus route, 28 Nov 2010. Speaks to Wellington City Council staff about its intention to create a world-class public transport system. Seeks views of local shopkeepers about the adverse impact of roadworks on their businesses, and to others who are hopeful for the future now that the project has been completed. Chats to local musician Robbie Ellis about his tongue-in-cheek song 'Manners Mall emo song', and to 'political busker' Benjamin Easton, a vocal opponent of the changes. Includes a timeline of the project."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Will Martin"
description: "Interviews the singer about his recording contract with Universal Records, his 'nice boy' image, and how he feels about his mother mortgaging her house to finance the release of his latest album. Discusses his penchant for old-fashioned music and his irrepressible optimism."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Nats head for election year with Lucky John still holding the aces"
description: "Assesses the high and low points for the Government during its first two years in office. Ranks the performance of nine MPs, including Prime Minister John Key. Touches on five 'casualties' and four backbenchers on the rise."

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "'A blot on the landscape'; it's like the cuckoo's nest, say patients"
description: "Reports that the dilapidated building housing the mental health unit may be replaced within a few years, due to improvements in the financial situation of the Hawke's Bay District Health Board. Talks to DHB clinical director of mental health Dr Simon Shaw, chief executive Kevin Snee, Mental Health Commissioner Bice Awan, mental health consumer adviser Andrea Southee and consumer advocate Michelle Maggin about the drawbacks of the current facility and the importance of constructing a new building."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Taboo subjects provide fertile ground for funnyman"
description: "Taboo subjects provide fertile ground for funnyman"

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Clara cracks the nut"
description: "Reviews the Royal NZ Ballet performance of The nutcracker, Civic Theatre (1-5 December) and Bruce Mason Theatre (8-9 December). Talks to artistic director Gary Harris about the ballet's cartoonesque overtones, his plans for when leaves the company and returns to London, and why he likes Invercargill. Also touches on dance injuries, with lead dancer Adriana Harper."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Magic in tension of dramatic works"
description: "Reviews New sculpture, figure sculpture by Sam Harrison, Jensen Gallery, Auckland, to 18 December.   Reviews Dowsing and drowning, fish sculpture and drawings by Bing Dawe, Jane Sanders Art, Auckland, to 11 December.  Reviews Te taniwha, photographs by Joyce Campbell, Two Rooms, Auckland, to 23 December.  Reviews I want something terrible to happen, family photographs by Jennifer Mason, at Orexart, Auckland, to 4 December."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Rock bottom - the blast that shook a nation; True Coaster gave his all"
description: "Reports on the aftermath of the second explosion at the Pike River Coal mine, Greymouth, 24 Nov 2010, five days after the initial explosion that trapped 29 miners. Describes the anguish of families, townspeople and the country when it became apparent that the miners could not have survived the second explosion. Recounts the events leading up to the first explosion and the importance of mining to the economy and psyche of the West Coast. Profiles the Grey District Mayor and discusses his role during the tragic events. Presents a chronology of events from 19-26 Nov 2010."

Author: "Gifford, Adam"
Title: "Working class man"
description: "Speaks to the Christchurch sculptor about his work, his work ethic, and his woodcuts. Also talks about from where he draws inspiration and why he has never written a proposal. Notes his exhibition Sculpture, Paper, at Jensen Gallery until 18 December."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Explosive show hopes to blow away apathy"
description: "Talks to actor and now director Gareth Reeves about the Scottish-Russian background to the play, and the reason for the production's unconventional venue. Plays at Gargarin Way Garage, Hobson Street, Auckland, 1-11 December."

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "Digging deep; Digging deep into stresses facing troubled coalmine; Commercial impacts of disaster unknown; The road to Pike River : timeline"
description: "Chronicles the financial and other difficulties facing the coal company prior to the series of explosions beginning on 19 Nov 2010 that killed 29 miners. Comments on the potential commercial implications for the mine. Includes a timeline of coal mining operations in the region from the 1940s to the present day."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Revolving cast creates unique toy story"
description: "Preview the plays Toys, The Basement, Auckland, 2-18 December, and Christ almighty, Bats Theatre, Wellington (December). Talks to some of the revolving cast of 40 actors who will feature in the Christmas comedies written by Natalie Medlock and Dan Musgrove."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Ring master"
description: "Meets the award-winning German-born contemporary jeweller, married to award-winning NZ contemporary jeweller Lisa Walker. Discusses his work and informs of recent exhibitions, including his new show 'Karl Fritsch : scenes from the Munich Diamond Disaster, City Gallery, Wellington, from 26 Nov 2010."

Author: "Bradley, Grant"
Title: "Under the mountain"
description: "Recaps the history of the Pike River coalmine, from the visibility of coal seams in the Paparoa Range in 1940 to the start of tunnelling in 2006. Notes local support, environmental issues, geologic challenges, and financial problems. Details the demand for the mine's hard coking coal. Questions if the company will survive the mine explosion and consequent 29 coalminer deaths of 19 November 2010."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Stolen memories"
description: "Reports on the impact of dementia on society, particularly on people with dementia, their families and caregivers. Talks to several people with dementia and to their families about their experiences. Seeks comment from university researchers and geriatricians and to others in the health sector about caring for people with dementia and research on drugs to improve cognitive function."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Rest and be thankful"
description: "Talks to the author, a keen tramper, about his new book 'Huts - untold stories from back-country New Zealand'."

Title: "Life lessons : Robyn Kippenberger"
description: "Life lessons : Robyn Kippenberger"

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "A leap of faith"
description: "Talks to the engineering student and aspiring Catholic priest, and the West Coast-raised young nun about their decision to train for the profession.  Seeks comment from the priest who is also vocations director of the Catholic diocese in Christchurch, and to the Whangarei-raised nun who made her first vows nearly 20 years ago."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Potted history"
description: "Talks to the founder of Morris & James Pottery about his career. Informs that he has co-written a book with Nick Charlton and Barbara Reardon on the history of the pottery firm."

Author: "Frances, Helen"
Title: "At home in the country"
description: "Visits 'Totarabank' at Te Whiti, Wairarapa. Talks to the expatriate British couple about their decision to move to NZ and create an unobtrusive, potentially self-sustaining community. Focuses on the sustainable home they built themselves."

Author: "Hansford, Dave"
Title: "Hang on a minute"
description: "Reports on his day-long experience of being part of a Dept of Conservation 'human sling' team to control the untrammelled growth of Pinus contorta (wilding pines)."

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Perfect performance on the page"
description: "Book review of 'Mune : an autobiography'."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "A week from hell; Heart of darkness; Holding on tight amid a media maelstrom; Pike River perhaps too ambitious; Miner's mayor"
description: "Reports on the aftermath of the second explosion at the Pike River Coal mine, Greymouth, 24 Nov 2010, five days after the initial explosion that trapped 29 miners. Describes the anguish of families, townspeople and the country when it became apparent that the miners could not have survived the second explosion. Recounts the events leading up to the first explosion and the importance of mining to the economy and psyche of the West Coast. Profiles the Grey District Mayor and discusses his role during the tragic events. Includes additional reporting from 'Press' West Coast reporter Amy Glass, who describes the depth of pain in the community, and what it was like when the world's media descended on her normally sleepy region. Includes a report from 'Press' business editor Marta Steeman, who visited the coal mine in Jan 2007 when its ambitious plans were first launched. Lists the 29 men who died."

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "Pike River documents described the dangers; Documents talked about dangers"
description: "Chronicles the financial and other difficulties facing the coal company prior to the series of explosions beginning on 19 Nov 2010 that killed 29 miners. Comments on the potential commercial implications for the mine."

Author: "Cottrell, Anna"
Title: "Climb every mountain"
description: "Tells of the story of Freda du Faur, the first woman to climb Aoraki Mount Cook 100 years ago, briefly giving details of her childhood and the barriers she faced in her attempt to climb the mountain. Notes Du Faur published collected articles entitled The conquest of Mount Cook and other climbs in 1915 by Allen & Unwin which will be adapted (The conquest of Mt Cook by Freda Du Faur) by Radio NZ and read on air the week before the 100 year celebrations. Mentions the production of an Australian/NZ television documentary is under way, part of which involves re-enacting Du Faur's climb."

Author: "Milsom, Viv"
Title: "Adventuress led the way"
description: "Reports on the 100th anniversary of the first woman to climb Aoraki/Mt Cook, which will be marked by celebrations at Mt Cook Village during the first weekend of Dec 2010. Profiles the Sydney-born woman who became the first woman to reach the summit, and examines the legacy she left for other women climbers to tackle mountains in NZ and overseas. Talks to three of them about the influence of Freda du Faur and other aspects of women in mountaineering."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "A leap of faith"
description: "Talks to the engineering student and aspiring Catholic priest, and the West Coast-raised young nun about their decision to train for the profession.  Seeks comment from the priest who is also vocations director of the Catholic diocese in Christchurch, and to the Whangarei-raised nun who made her first vows nearly 20 years ago."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Rest and be thankful"
description: "Talks to the author, a keen tramper, about his new book 'Huts - untold stories from back-country New Zealand'."

Author: "O'Brien, Gregory,"
Title: "Artist of the unsteady earth"
description: "Examines the work of Euan Macleod, a Christchurch born artist now resident in Sydney since 1981. Describes the motifs and themes the author and others see in the artist's works. Refers to a book written by the author, 'Euan Macleod : the painter in the painting', published by Piper Press available through Craig Potton Publishing."

Author: "Vance, Michael"
Title: "Vessel on a southern mission"
description: "Revisits reportage by 'The Press' from 30 Nov 1901 on the voyage of the 'SS Discovery', which was then carrying Captain Robert Falcon Scott to his first expedition to the Antarctic. Touches on the reaction of people in Christchurch and Lyttelton when the ship arrived in their ports."

Author: "Frances, Helen"
Title: "At home in the country"
description: "Visits 'Totarabank' at Te Whiti, Wairarapa. Talks to the expatriate British couple about their decision to move to NZ and create an unobtrusive, potentially self-sustaining community. Focuses on the sustainable home they built themselves."

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Perfect performance on the page"
description: "Book review of 'Mune : an autobiography'."

Author: "Somerset, Guy"
Title: "Crime wave"
description: "Examines the genre of crime writing in NZ and the imminent awarding of the inaugural Ngaio Marsh Award for Best Crime Novel. Notes comments from two finalists and the way crime fiction is portrayed against other genres."

Author: "Campbell, Bill"
Title: "Farmers in touch with the times"
description: "Farmers in touch with the times"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Proof of the power to change"
description: "Talks to the former Murupara resident about his recovery from experiencing and perpetrating family violence. Credits MaÃÑori and other violence prevention programmes for helping him turn his life around and helping him to reclaim his MaÃÑoridom."

Author: "Easther, Elisabeth"
Title: "Hey Jude/Judith"
description: "Reviews a play written and directed by Sam Shore called The Idea of America put on by the Good Company Theatre Company, Tapac, Auckland, Nov. 10-14; Art Works Theatre, Waiheke, Dec. 3-4."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Flame goes out for retiring chief"
description: "Flame goes out for retiring chief"

Author: "Ensor, Blair"
Title: "Paralysed skier intent on recovery"
description: "Paralysed skier intent on recovery"

Author: "Wardle, Penny"
Title: "A long haul back from brain injury"
description: "A long haul back from brain injury"

Author: "Wardle, Penny"
Title: "Working way up from the 'flax roots"
description: "Working way up from the 'flax roots"

Author: "Ensor, Blair"
Title: "Back for another bite of the Big Apple"
description: "Back for another bite of the Big Apple"

Author: "Van Der Heide, Maike"
Title: "Stallholder 'the voice of the people'"
description: "Stallholder 'the voice of the people'"

Author: "Butterfield, Tania"
Title: "Blindness no handicap for winner"
description: "Blindness no handicap for winner"

Author: "Wilson, Clay"
Title: "Diamanti decides family comes first"
description: "Diamanti decides family comes first"

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "Small frame contained a full and colourful life"
description: "Small frame contained a full and colourful life"

Title: "The prof dies overlooking beloved garden"
description: "The prof dies overlooking beloved garden"

Title: "Kiwi knight and appeal judge dies aged 91"
description: "Kiwi knight and appeal judge dies aged 91"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Integrity hallmark of soldier and veteran's campaigner"
description: "Integrity hallmark of soldier and veteran's campaigner"

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "PSA leader clashed with Muldoon govt"
description: "PSA leader clashed with Muldoon govt"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "'Honorary' Maori a strong role model"
description: "'Honorary' Maori a strong role model"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Love of film, family proved enduring"
description: "Love of film, family proved enduring"

Title: "'I haven't bought a vege since 1957'"
description: "'I haven't bought a vege since 1957'"

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "Entranced by the sound of music"
description: "Entranced by the sound of music"

Title: "Artist pointed his pen at British politics"
description: "Artist pointed his pen at British politics"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Commitment to learning opportunities for Maori"
description: "Commitment to learning opportunities for Maori"

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Torment & tears"
description: "Details the Pike River coal mine explosion of 19 November 2010 that killed 29 coal miners.  Discusses questions and reactions to the hope of a rescue attempt.  Explains the procedures around methane gas level measurement.  Describes the daily family and media briefings led by chief executive Peter Whittall, and sometimes by Police Superintendent Gary Knowles.  Touches on the resilience of the local community. Indicates the mine was in financial trouble and suggests it may not reopen.  Recaps the Strongman mine explosion of 1967, recounting one rescue team member's experience, and relaying another's criticism of the National Government's decision in the late 1990s to remove the requirement for independent mine inspectors."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "The methane in the mine"
description: "Explores the issue of methane gas in the Pike River coal mine. Describes how levels are graded. Quotes geologist Murry Cave on his dispute of the mine's safety level. Speaks to other mine safety experts about the difficulty of pre-draining methane from mines in mountainous locations and Pike's non-use of gas monitoring 'tube bundles'. Hints that the company's small size may be a factor in the explosion. Recaps development, production, and financial issues besetting the Pike River operation."

Title: "All the lost men & boys"
description: "Recounts and describes coal mining accidents at opencast and underground mines at Kaitangata (1879), Brunner (1896), Huntly (1914), Strongman (1967), and others."

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "The treasure keeper"
description: "Describes the Wellington collector of children's literature and her collection of some 21,000 books. Delves into her bookish background, as the daughter of author Beverley Randell and author and publisher (the late) Hugh Price, and the titles and authors she prefers to stock. Notes her library is the subject of a book being written by Kate De Goldi. Touches on her ill-health (polyarteritis nodosa) and her appreciation of life."

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "The 50 best children's books of 2010"
description: "Lists the author's picks for the best children's books published in the last year in the genres of young adult fiction, intermediate fiction, picture books, and non-fiction."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Banner day"
description: "Reviews allbums by Bannerman, Robert Scott, Barry Saunders, and Emma Paki."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "This land is whose land?"
description: "Reports on how the current debate over foreign investment and ownership of land and business in NZ is turning into a critical pre-election issue."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "The cupboard was bare"
description: "Revisits the collapse of South Canterbury Finance (SCF) and critically examines the thesis of the book by Virginia Green, Allan Hubbard : a man out of time, that the company was the victim of Government interference. Examines the role of the Government, the Reserve Bank, and former SCF employees in the business failure."

Author: "Hattaway, Peter"
Title: "Lessons form the courtroom"
description: "Suggests that creditors who are negotiating payment with debtors can take a lesson from the way lawyers are trained to persuade."

Author: "Power, J.  F."
Title: "Earthquake damages cashflows too"
description: "Talks about the case of a tradesman in Christchurch who cannot continue fixing earthquake-damaged chimneys and roofs because he is owed more than $160,000 for the work he has already completed. Suggestions what the tradesman did wrong."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Not so squeaky clean"
description: "Suggests that the notion that politics is an honourable profession in NZ has taken a knock in recent times."

Title: "What you should know about FSPA registration"
description: "Outlines who will need to register under the Financial Service Providers (Registration and Dispute Resolution) Act (FSPA) and what it will entail. Talks about some common misconceptions surrounding the Act."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Damages claim succeeds in the end"
description: "Backgrounds the Brouwers v Street [2010] NZ Court of Appeal (463) case about the damages to Mr Brouwers' property from a landslip that mostly occurred within the property of Mr Street."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Pike River disaster : the longest time; Issues for an enquiry; Miner will go back down; Mine's once bright future in jeopardy"
description: "Talks to Rachelle Weaver about the day she lost her partner. Highlights some of the possible answers to a series of questions surrounding the events that led to the death of 29 miners. Talks to Greymouth miner Harold Gibbins about his attitude towards mining after the disaster. Highlights some number-based facts about Pike River Coal. Includes biographical material."

Author: "Robinson, Victoria"
Title: "Sadness becomes a fundraising force"
description: "Sadness becomes a fundraising force"

Author: "Hinton, Marc"
Title: "Mister Big"
description: "Profiles the Wellington basketballer who has the NBA in his sights."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Guilty until proven innocent? : 'It was almost like we were on trial'; Battle of the experts"
description: "Investigates claims that the Starship hospital's child protection unit has become a police station treating good parents like criminals, and why there is concern at some of the expert evidence Starship doctors are giving in court. Talks to NZ's first health and disability commissioner, Robyn Stent. Shares the stories of two families who were accused of causing harm."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Maybe baby"
description: "Looks at how Kiwi's who have struggled to concieve are up in arms over the ASB bank's new advertisement offering loans for IVF treatment."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Saviour of the seas"
description: "Tells the story of the surf life saver who could be NZ's greatest ever hero."

Author: "Ninness, Greg"
Title: "Brothel bro's empire worth $100m"
description: "Profiles the brothers and their property investment firm which is celebrating its 11th year in business."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Profiles the specialist transfusions nurse at Dunedin Hospital."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Dead tasty"
description: "Investigates the phenomenon of carrion, or roadkill, cuisine - finding a dead animal on the road and cooking it for a meal."

Author: "Jarvie, Catherine"
Title: "London's new brew"
description: "Looks at the growing obsession with Kiwi-style cafes and talks to the owners of Caravan and Sacred Cafe about how they are making their mark on the London scene."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Emerson Brewing supreme at awards; Businessman honoured for contribution to city"
description: "Talks to Richard Emerson, founder of the company which won the Supreme Business Excellence Award in the 2010 Westpac Otago Chamber of Commerce Business Excellence Awards, Dunedin, 26 Nov 2010. Presents a brief profile of each of the category winners in manufacturing/primary, non-profit, retail, service, tourism, emerging business, ethics, sustainability, design, international trader, ACC workplace safety, research and innovation sectors, respectively. Names the man who won the future business leader award. Profiles the businessman who was honoured for his contribution to the city."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Growing for gold; Growing for gold in Central"
description: "Reports on research into new late-season apple and apricot varieties under the auspices of Plant & Food Research Ltd, Central Otago. Talks to scientists and growers about the potential for developing new cultivars that would supply the current gap in the market from early Jan to late Feb each year. Reports on the discovery in Aug 2010 that scientists from Plant & Food Research Ltd had sequenced the DNA comprising the apple genome. Touches on growers' concerns that the Australian summerfruit industry is applying to bring their product into NZ."

Author: "Kelley, Chris"
Title: "On the island beat"
description: "Provides an insight into policing 'the Friendly Isles' from his perspective as the first palagi commander of the Tonga Police. Talks about his decision to take the position in 2008 after 42 years with the NZ Police, and describes the focus on community policing in the islands. Describes the response of the police to the 'Princess Ashika' disaster in Aug 2009."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "When social is antisocial"
description: "Looks at the growth of ex-relationship harassment via social networking sites. Discusses the movie 'The social network', which is based on the invention of Facebook, and how it portrays founder Mark Zuckerman and his creation of a vicious website called Facemash which ranked female students at Harvard University. Touches on the conviction of Wellington man Joshua Ashby for distributing indecent matter about his former girlfriend via Facebook. Provides tips from Netsafe's Sean Lyons about how to stay safe online."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Title: "Voice, imagination, to fore in densely woven novel; Photographs like relics souvenired from Antarctic"
description: "Voice, imagination, to fore in densely woven novel; Photographs like relics souvenired from Antarctic"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Strong arm and steady hand a good mix"
description: "Interviews the pastry chef and owner of Peninsula Pantry about the nature of her work."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Early Byrds catch mood"
description: "Talks to members of the eight-piece group that celebrates early music and other aspects of medieval and renaissance life. Discusses their instruments and the development of their performance repetoire since their formation two years ago. Informs of their Christmas Revel and Ball, St John's Church hall, Dunedin, 3 Dec 2010."

Author: "Driessen, Erin"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'The Green green grass of home' by Tony Bishop, Milford  Galleries Dunedin, until 18 Dec 2010. Reviews 'The Strange case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde' by Jason Greig, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin, until 16 Dec 2010. Reviews 'Belligerence and bubblegum' by Andy McCready and Sam Ovens, Rocda Gallery, Dunedin, until 4 Dec 2010."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "All we want for Christmas"
description: "Chats to children at Miramar Central School about their Christmas wishes. Notes the gifts they want, their methods of obtaining them, and what they might give others. Lists five toys deemed by a toy retailer to be most popular items for 2010. Touches on the trend in people trying to onsell unwanted gifts on Trade Me. Introduces two children chosen by toymaker Mattel to review a box of toys each month in 2011."

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "Big boy's sport all about technique"
description: "Big boy's sport all about technique"

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "The art treasures hidden in Te Papa's attic"
description: "Highlights the art works by NZ artists that might be displayed if a new national art gallery mooted by Te Papa board members is built. Details works currently in storage by Michael Stevenson, Ralph Hotere, Marti Friedlander, Colin McCahon, Tom Roberts, Frances Hodgkins, Don Binney, and Robin White. Notes opposing comments by art critic Hamish Keith, who has a different soluction."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "A new slant on living the life of Riley"
description: "Profiles Woodville dairy farmers Kim Riley and Keith Riley, whose farm borders the Manawatu River. Discusses their belief in environmentally sustainable farming and outlines the changes and savings they have made, especially with their effluent pond system."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Meet the new police chief; From crocs and robbers to top job"
description: "Talks to the current Police Commissioner of the Solomon Islands about his newly appointed role as NZ's Police Commissioner."

Author: "McManus, Jenni"
Title: "The business end of politics"
description: "Examines campaign-financing rules before and after the 2007 Electoral Finance Act and its new disclosure regime came into being. Heralds possible changes in the proposed Electoral (Finance Reform and Advance Voting) Amendment Bill. Charts the decline in corporate campaign financing. Details the biggest donors in 2007 and in the 2008-2010 period. Questions what corporate donors might receive for their gifts. Names businesses and individuals who are still donating to political parties."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "You can't hide from prying eyes"
description: "Reports on the new powers of the Search and Surveillance Bill and the fear that the law changes will increase the opportunities for abuses by police and other agencies."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Mike Lee"
description: "Talks to Mike Lee, the former Chairman of the Auckland Regional Council (ARC) and the current transport chairman of the new Auckland Council, about his dealings with the media and his job."

Title: "$3500 'lesson' that turned into a murder mystery"
description: "Details the murder of Paraparaumu man Raymond Piper by Ainsley Anderson, who was hired by members of Piper's girlfriend's family.  Discusses contract killings that have taken place in NZ."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "All a-flutter over love"
description: "Talks to Morag Magnolia Brownlie about her cabaret burlesque comedy 'Birds of paradise' being performed at Tapac, Western Springs, December 8-18 2010."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Fables, illusions and hard rock"
description: "Reviews 'Silverfish' by Brendon Wilkinson at the Ivan Anthony Gallery (to 23 December 2010); '20 years of painted illusion' by Mervyn Williams at the Artis Gallery (to 11 December 2010); 'No dilemma' by Haneui Kim at the Warwick Henderson Gallery (to 10 December 2010); and 'Sculpture' by Martin Selman at Sanderson Contemporary Art (to 10 December 2010)."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Soprano caps year of living diversely"
description: "Talks to the winner of the 2009 Lexus Song Quest about her love of music and caring for her voice."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Thinking and writing about war"
description: "Reviews the new book about the poets of the Great War (World War One)."

Author: "Knight, Lindsay,"
Title: "Dark diagnosis leads to success"
description: "Dark diagnosis leads to success"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Journey around my art"
description: "Reviews the multimedia exhibition A New Zealand history, Walrus Gallery, Wellington, until 23 December 2010. Talks to the artist about her daytime job as a tour guide, her MaÃÑori heritage and interest in MaÃÑori and NZ history, and the effects of traveling in South America."

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "'I still can't wait to get hold of the microphone'"
description: "Talks to the radio and television sports presenter about the various aspects of his job including the bust-ups he has had on air."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Training to clients' needs pays off"
description: "Talks to the former Dunedin resident who is currently the general manager of Fitec Australia, one of the largest forestry industry training organisations in that country. Describes the challenges of his industry."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "Publish and be wowed"
description: "Talks to the head of Gecko Press about her role publishing foreign childrens' books in English for NZers and overseas audiences. Discusses her various careers and how she launched and built up her business despite industry pessimism of its chances. Mentions her supporters and her success in the 2008 NZ Post Book awards."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Presents of mind"
description: "Proffers gift ideas for Christmas that are inexpensive and/or eco-friendly."

Author: "Jacobson, Julie"
Title: "The happy castaway"
description: "Chats to Yorkshire chef Peter Blakeway about his first cookbook showcasing ingredients and dishes particular to NZ localities and seasons. Discusses what he thinks about growing bananas in his Tauranga backyard, and about plans to relaunch an in-house cooking school at his restaurant, Devonport Deli. Mentions also that NZ needs to focus more on regional food specialities."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Coming clean; The perils of complacency"
description: "Talks to two members of Alcoholics Anonymous about the difficulties of maintaining sobriety."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Decades on, Brake shots beautiful but dated"
description: "Decades on, Brake shots beautiful but dated"

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Standing up for heritage; Aussie architects view quake damage"
description: "Meets South Dakotan Donovan Rypkema, an advocate for heritage buildings and their place in the 21st century. Talks to Australian heritage architects Barney Collis and Edward Clode, who visited the city recently to advise on what to do about heritage buildings that were damaged in the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake, and to learn about how to prepare for the next earthquake in Newcastle."

Author: "Worthington, Philip"
Title: "Celebrating grand old ladies of the sea"
description: "Celebrating grand old ladies of the sea"

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "The secrets of long life"
description: "Discusses the growing awareness of what it takes to live long and well in NZ. Looks at the Lilacs NZ (Life and living in advanced age) longitudinal study being conducted by researchers from the University of Auckland, which aims to interview 600 MaÃÑori aged 80-90 and 600 non-Maori aged 85 from the Bay of Plenty, to learn how and why some NZers live longer than others. Talks to study participants Ina Benbow, Betty McPherson, and 80-year-old Don Morrison, about their philosophy for life. Touches on how much money is needed to enjoy retirement."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "'Lights would have started flashing red'"
description: "Speaks to Pike River mine chief executive Peter Whittall about the Pike River mine explosion on 19 November 2010.
