Asks about the issue of dealing with coal mine methane, what happened after the first explosion, and why the death toll was lower than it might have been. Describes how the company lowered gas levels in the mine, how it defined gas levels, possible reasons for ignition, and the monitoring system."

Author: "Herrick, Linda"
Title: "Say it with a book"
description: "Presents a selection of books suitable to give as Christmas presents."

Title: "Highly amusing"
description: "Names the top ten NZ entertainers of 2010."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Read all about it!"
description: "Chronicles some of the family news and secrets that have come to light since the National Library's Papers Past website starting digitising some 60 newspapers dating from 1839. Comments on the system's shortcomings and expands on some of the more curious stories uncovered. Indicates the benefits to early NZ history and genealogical research. Touches on the cost of the project, its use of an Indian IT firm for the digitisation process, and the opportunities it has opened up for the NZ website developer, DL Consulting."

Author: "White, Geraldine"
Title: "Talking freely"
description: "Interviews the UK professor and moral philosopher about her September 2010 lecture series in NZ at the invitation of the Royal Society.  Discusses her views on freedom of speech and whether such freedom requires regulation; trustworthiness; assisted suicide; responsible journalism, in reference to the WikiLeaks releases and the Jyllands-Posten cartoons of Muhammed; and the benefits of second language learning."

Title: "The 100 best books of 2010"
description: "Reviews a selection of books chosen to be the best of 2010 publications.  Highlights the following 10 NZ authors' and publishers and their personal picks; James McNeish, Alison Wong, Joy Cowley, Alan Bollard, Tim Wilson, Mary Kisler, Bill Manhire, Annabel Langbein, Dylan Horrocks, and Bridget  Williams."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Don't blame the jelly babies"
description: "Exposes the top 20 mistaken beliefs about cancer, gleaned from a recent UK survey of British teenagers. Mentions the role of the internet in promoting myths about the causes and treatability of cancer."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Berry, berry unclear"
description: "Responds to a question about the health benefits of acai berries. Discusses the antioxidant levels of the South American berry, the clinical trials that have been conducted so far, the argument for fresh fruit over dietary supplements, and equivalent fruits that are known to be beneficial to health."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Tree of life"
description: "Speaks with University of Canterbury Biomathematics Research Centre Mike Steel about how biology is benefiting from advances in computing and statistical methodology. Describes the usefulness of the 'molecular clock', devised by NZ-born Allan Wilson, in determining genetic relationships between species, including that between humans and chimpanzees. Notes the clock works well for recent evolutionary questions, but mathematics is needed for older events. Describes Steel's involvement in the multinational Human Cell Lineage Flagship Initiative, which aims to trace each human cell back to the moment of conception."

Author: "Rae, Fiona,"
Title: "Four go to Fiordland"
description: "Reviews the television documentary that compares the work of 18th-century painter William Hodges, the artist on board Captain James Cook's Resolution, to works created by four current NZ artists visiting the same areas in Fiordland: Melvin 'Pat' Day, Gerda Leenards, Nigel Brown, and Renaud Maire."

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "Hens still down the pecking order"
description: "Looks at the system of chicken egg production known as 'barn hen farming' that allows hens to roam free within the barn but not outside. Notes the Layer Hen Welfare Code, which came into effect in 2004, is currently under review by the National Animal Welfare Advisory Committee, a government body and the review is expected to come up for public consultation before the end of the year. Includes comments from Hans Kriek, director of national animal rights organisation, Safe, and Robyn Kippenberger, SPCA national chief executive about the option of 'enriched cages'. Notes the codes of practice operating within some European countries and Australia."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "The comeback king"
description: "Interviews Winston Peters about the possibility of him returning to national politics. Questions him on his political history and future including how he thinks the country is being run by the present government. Includes comments about  present members of parliament and the policies they are implementing."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "'All hell broke loose'; Helping other 'traumatised' families"
description: "Outlines the response to last week's Focus investigation about parents who took sick children to Starship Children's Hospital, only to be suspected of abuse. Tells of the story of Karen and Ron Hawkless who took their adopted baby into Taumarunui and Waikato Hospital and eventually to Starship with a swollen, bulging fontanelle 'where all hell broke loose'. Includes comments from Tuapeka Pilato, manager of the Taumarunui CYF office and Scott Macfarlane, acting head of child health at the Auckland Health Board. Illustrates feedback by reprinting two letters from readers who have been investigated for abuse at Starship and other hospitals. Notes the existence  of a publication of guidelines for parents being investigated for abuse."

Author: "Starr, Julie"
Title: "When tragedy hits home"
description: "Asks why the media can't treat death with less surprise and more respect. Recounts how her brother was shot dead and within a very short time the media arrived wanting details and asking if the family wanted to talk about his death. Suggests a moratorium for the media on asking people about the death of a loved one."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Author (detailed): "Holly Millar as told to Sarah Murray"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Talks to beauty therapist at Waxnlaser in Hamilton about the beauty business. She lives in Thames with her partner Matt."

Author: "Monk, Felicity"
Title: "Piece by piece"
description: "Talks to jewelery designer, Jessica McCormack, who is two and a half years into establishing jewelery design business. Jessica is Christchurch born and Clerkenwell (East London) based. Briefly describes the workshop/exhibition/salon space where she designs and creates all her jewelery. Initially starting out as an intern at Sotherby's in London but then deciding she wanted to do her own thing. Comment she just wants to create pieces that will become future heirlooms for people and their families."

Author: "Greive, Duncan"
Title: "No laughing matter"
description: "Comedians share their 'war stories' with the author indicating although corporate functions can pay well, they don't always go to plan. Talks to Michelle A'Court, Ewen Gilmour illustrate how some of their onstage shows have gone."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Many happy returns?"
description: "Laments the lack of common courtesy of reply in NZ when sending out invitation cards for an appointment, social gathering, party, etc., that needs a RSVP (i.e. reÃÅpondez s'il vous plaiÃÇt, French for 'please let me know if you can make it')."

Author: "McManus, Jenni"
Title: "Show us the money"
description: "Investigates the effect of tough new electoral rules enacted in 2007 on corporate donations to political parties. Talks to company directors, former Labour Party president Mike Williams and donors about the impact of the strict disclosure regime. Lists the largest donors and overviews donation rules before and after the Act was passed. Summarises the provisions of the Electoral (Finance Reform and Advance Voting) Amendment Bill."

Author: "Stevenson, Rebecca"
Title: "Black, chewy goodness"
description: "Interviews the founder of the licorice company."

Author: "Stewart, Tamlyn"
Title: "Back to basics proves winning strategy"
description: "Talks to owner and technical director Milton Bloomfield of the supreme small business winner in the 2010 Champion Canterbury business awards. Describes its achievements in producing bicycles ridden by NZ's top cyclists, its role in the creation of the Martin Jetpack, and the eco-friendly foldable electric Yike bike."

Author: "Hunter, Tim"
Title: "Action arguably aided GPG; Activism could have been boon for GPG"
description: "Backgrounds the Securities Commission inquiry into the listed company after chairman Sir Ron Brierley met with institutional shareholders in Aug 2010 over its restructuring. Seeks views of former Shareholders Assn chairman Bruce Sheppard and others about the inquiry into shareholder activism at the meeting. Overviews the growth of the company and concerns that its wide-ranging business interests were becoming unworkable."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "Publish and be wowed"
description: "Talks to the head of Gecko Press about her role publishing foreign childrens' books in English for NZers and overseas audiences. Discusses her various careers and how she launched and built up her business despite industry pessimism of its chances. Mentions her supporters and her success in the 2008 NZ Post Book awards."

Author: "Callaghan, Paul T."
Title: "Dreaming of a green Christmas"
description: "Offers advice for celebrating Christmas in an environmentally friendly manner. Covers hosting a family get-together, supplying home-grown food and sustainable presents."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Presents of mind"
description: "Proffers gift ideas for Christmas that are inexpensive and/or eco-friendly."

Author: "Shiels, Rosa"
Title: "We can rebuild it"
description: "Talks to the architect who is part of a group working with  Wellington architect Ian Athfield to rebuild Christchurch following the earthquake. Explores his style, and lists some of his design tips."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Decades on, Brake shots beautiful but dated"
description: "Decades on, Brake shots beautiful but dated"

Author: "Worthington, Philip"
Title: "Celebrating grand old ladies of the sea"
description: "Celebrating grand old ladies of the sea"

Author: "Kilty, Robyn"
Title: "Morning glory"
description: "Visits the garden of a colleague, who also hails from Southland and writes about gardens."

Author: "Haldane, Vivienne"
Title: "Shelling out on snails"
description: "Visits the Hawke's Bay woman who may be the only commercial snail farmer in NZ. Includes facts about snails."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Mad, passionate devotion to cause"
description: "Talks to the British-born marathon charity runner. Details his efforts on behalf of the Leukemia and Blood Foundation over the past two years. Describes his current '7 in 7 Challenge', comprising seven back-country runs totalling 360km in seven days. Lists his seven top moments."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Good buys, without leaving home; Wooden it be patriotic; Art of good buys"
description: "Considers whether it would be patriotic to buy NZ-made gifts for Christmas, particularly considering NZ's balance-of-payments deficit. Talks to University of Otago economist Dr Alan King, who considers that buying NZ-made products is one of the most effective ways to reduce the national debt. Seeks views of others, including the office of Minister of Finance Bill English, NZ Retailers Assn chief executive John Albertson and Buy New Zealand Made spokeswoman Trina Snow. Speaks to Christchurch journalism student Sarah Marquet about her experiment to live for a year by buying solely NZ-made goods. Talks to Neil Garden of Gepetto Toy Craft, Alexandra and Norman Wood of Plastics EPI, Dunedin, the only two toy manufacturers in Otago."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Playing hard"
description: "Talks about the growing competiveness of indoor netball where the intention is to play social netball but according to the author unintentional and intentional injuries are commonplace. Indicates there are some players who go out there to win and forget about the social side of the game."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "'Fantastic compromise' saves day; Sargoods' gallery gift in memory of Gallipoli sacrifice; When the world came to Dunedin"
description: "Focuses on the planned refurbishment of the former Logan Park art gallery, Dunedin. Talks to Queenstown conservation architect Jackie Gillies about the plans to demolish parts of the building and refurbish others. Speaks to Dunedin City Council community life manager Graeme Hall about the role of the council in the decision. Seeks views of John Blennerhasset, a great-grandson of the late couple who donated the gallery to the city in memory of their son, Lt Cedric Rolfe Sargood, who went missing in action at Chunuk Bair in Aug 1915. Describes the life of the Melbourne-born man who was knighted in 1935. Provides a history of the gallery, the sole surviving building of the 1925-1926 NZ and South Seas Exhibition, and mentions the man who was the driving force behind the event."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Hard luck and squishy science"
description: "Announces the winners of the 2010 Prime Minister's Science Prize. Talks to the group's leader about his cancer and the importance of staying detached. Discusses his work in 'squishy physics', the creation of the Magritek technology company, and his philosophy on science paying its way."

Author: "Cherry, Caitlin"
Title: "Gayer days"
description: "Talks about the changes in attitude of children over time where children have been raised by lesbian couples."

Author: "Crowl, Mike,"
Title: "Musician elusive, despite the detail; New Sargeson mix has 13 rare stories; Non-fiction; Fiction"
description: "Musician elusive, despite the detail; New Sargeson mix has 13 rare stories; Non-fiction; Fiction"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Best friends forever"
description: "Meets the twin sisters who became household names when they were contestants on the hit TV3 show. Describes their experience of being twins and of competing in the show."

Author: "Marriner, Maureen"
Title: "Mellow yellow"
description: "Tells of the places to travel to and see, the activities available to be enjoyed, the food and wine to be experienced while holidaying in Queenstown."

Title: "Managing environmental-public interface"
description: "Talks to the community relations ranger for the Dept of Conservation (DoC) about her job."

Author: "Alvi, Naeem"
Title: "Dream on track; The Gibbston River Trail from start to finish"
description: "Accompanies Gibbston Valley Association chairwoman Susan Stevens on a walk along the new Gibbston River Trail. Describes her six-year effort to make the trail a reality, and describes each of its sections. Touches on future developments to the trail."

Title: "Sky the limit for best of Otago youngsters"
description: "Names and briefly profiles the 10 leading achievers in secondary school sport. Names the next 12 achievers, high achievers and teams that excelled during 2010."

Author: "Backhouse, Matthew"
Title: "Gordon whistling up help in Cambodia"
description: "Talks to the former television presenter of 'A dog's show'. Focuses on how the Southlander is working with Volunteer Service Abroad and using his broadcasting skills to improve the lives of impoverished Cambodian farmers."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "A life set to music; Honor McKellar : a life set to music"
description: "Meets the stalwart of Dunedin musical and theatrical groups for the past 40 years. Discusses her still-active life and hobbies, and recalls her upbringing and training. Lists facts about her professional life."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'A Museum of obsessions', various artists, Blue Oyster Gallery, Dunedin, until 24 Dec 2010.  Reviews 'Two's company' by Julie Greig and John Toomer, The Artist's Room, Dunedin. Reviews 'A Round Christmas', various artists, Gallery De Novo, Dunedin."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Spirit of forgiveness; Emma Woods"
description: "Announces the mother of 4-year-old Nayan Woods, who was killed by an out-of-control car, as the 2010 NZ Herald NZer of the Year. Talks about her act of forgiveness towards the driver of the car."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Future (oil) shock; Breaking with consumerism, a few small steps at a time"
description: "Focuses on the slowing of economic growth and consequent effects on consumerism as a result of peak oil, climate change and over-population. Cites research findings by academics including Dr Susan Krumdieck, professor of engineering at the University of Canterbury, Frank Scrimgeour, dean of the University of Waikato School of Management and Jonathan Boston of the Institute of Policy Studies into the links between energy use and GDP and the biophysical limits on growth. Describes local initiatives discussed at the 'Signs of Change' e-conference organised by Dr Krumdieck."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "End of consumerism; Small acts make a big difference"
description: "Focuses on the slowing of economic growth and consequent effects on consumerism as a result of peak oil, climate change and over-population. Cites research findings by academics including Dr Susan Krumdieck, professor of engineering at the University of Canterbury, Frank Scrimgeour, dean of the University of Waikato School of Management and Jonathan Boston of the Institute of Policy Studies into the links between energy use and GDP and the biophysical limits on growth. Describes local initiatives discussed at the 'Signs of Change' e-conference organised by Dr Krumdieck."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Another hung jury prolongs agony"
description: "Another hung jury prolongs agony"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "A yearly dance with death"
description: "Focuses on the annual whale hunting expedition by Japanese whalers and the response planned by the conservation group. Talks to Foreign Minister Murray McCully about the increasingly bellicose encounters between whaling ships and the protesters and his appeal to both sides to put safety above all else. Cites comment from Mike Donoghue, Government scientific adviser at the International Whaling Commission and Paul Watson, skipper of the Steve Irwin protest vessel. Reports that the NZer will not be participating in this year's protest in the Southern Ocean."

Author: "Gay, Edward"
Title: "Ambulance officer's call changed everything; Woman's guilt for Good Samaritan death"
description: "Ambulance officer's call changed everything; Woman's guilt for Good Samaritan death"

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "When love turns sour; Broken hearts lie behind most cases; Family Court judge takes death threats in his stride"
description: "Spotlights the work of the court. Reports on a proceeding in Napier adjudicated by the longest-serving fulltime Family Court judge in NZ. Seeks views of Hastings doctor Viv Roberts about the difficulties arising from lengthy waiting times for a court date due to ever-increasing demand. Informs that the solution to waiting times promulgated in the Family Courts Matters Bill passed by Parliament has not been fully implemented. Speaks to Principal Family Court Judge Peter Boshier about the delays and other problems with the present system. Talks to family lawyer Caroline Hannan about the family dynamics underlying most cases that are heard by the court.  Speaks to the longest-serving judge about why he loves his work despite the difficulties. Lists current statistics for waiting times in various centres, the busiest Family Courts in NZ and the 19 Acts dealt with by the Family Court."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "A breath of life for Waitangirua"
description: "Celebrates the opening of the Waitangirua Community Park, Porirua, 11 Dec 2010. Backgrounds its development and the contribution of local residents and the Porirua City Council. Talks to the former teacher aide who has been at the helm of the project for the past three years about her vision to bring the various ethnic groups together."

Author: "Falconer, Phoebe"
Title: "Readers' choice : New Zealander of the Year"
description: "Readers' choice : New Zealander of the Year"

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "The enforcer"
description: "Reports on the select committee hearings into the legislation establishing the new Financial Markets Authority (FMA) to act as a watchdog and regulator. Informs of opposing views expressed by Government and business and financial sector interests as to how much regulation will be needed. Muses whether the FMA will have sufficient enforcement powers when the Bill is passed."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "From toy soldiers to the real deal"
description: "From toy soldiers to the real deal"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Cover versions"
description: "Talks to the senior lecturer with the School of Languages and Cultures at Victoria University. Focuses on his research into the creative process of book cover design and the impact of cover images on readers. Informs that he has devised a competition asking people to make up a title and a storyline to fit with a book cover which has only an image to assist his research."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "A few questions, but lots of sparkle"
description: "Reviews the recent performance of 'American classics' by expatriate flautist Marya Martin and pianist Rosemary Barnes at the University of Auckland Music Theatre."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "The push to make welfare work"
description: "Looks at the debate surrounding the review of NZ's welfare system by the Welfare Working Group chaired by Paula Rebstock. Talks about the founding principles of the 1938 Social Security Act, the recommendations made by the Welfare Working Group, and the views of an alternative welfare working group set up by beneficiary advocates and the social justice arms of the Anglican and Catholic churches."

Author: "Risk, Louise"
Title: "Growing concerns"
description: "Meets two of the 7000 familes involved in the 'Growing up in New Zealand' study, a 21-year project aimed at eliminating inequalities among children. Seeks views of project associate director Polly Atatoa Carr of the University of Auckland, which is leading the research. Lists key findings of the first research results, called 'Before we are born'."

Author: "Risk, Louise"
Title: "Growing concerns"
description: "Meets two of the 7000 familes involved in the 'Growing up in New Zealand' study, a 21-year project aimed at eliminating inequalities among children. Seeks views of project associate director Polly Atatoa Carr of the University of Auckland, which is leading the research. Lists key findings of the first research results, called 'Before we are born'."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Mike King"
description: "Talks to the comedian about his quest to get his life back in order after struggling with drugs and depression."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "The power to move : out of thin air"
description: "The power to move : out of thin air"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "In with the mob"
description: "Meets the 'Monday Mumzys', a group of mothers in Waitangirua who are either married or partnered to patched members of the Mongrel Mob. Discusses the origins of the group. Describes some of their activities that haven't been done in the mob community before, such as the event in Jul 2010 to commemorate the lives of 78 mob men, women and children who have died in the past three decades from drugs, alcohol and violence. Informs of the support for the group by Mongrel Mob members and the changes the group has made to create better opportunities for themselves and their whanau."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Giving it up for charity"
description: "Talks to some NZers who prefer giving gifts to charities at Christmas rather than to their relatives. Describes some of the charities that are benefitting from their altruism. Seeks comment from Keith Ramsay of the Tear Fund."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Giving it up for charity"
description: "Talks to some NZers who prefer giving gifts to charities at Christmas rather than to their relatives. Describes some of the charities that are benefitting from their altruism. Seeks comment from Keith Ramsay of the Tear Fund."

Author: "Herrick, Linda"
Title: "Generous heart finds an open home"
description: "Announces the Auckland art patron as the 2010 NZ Herald NZer of the Year (arts). Includes a number of other nominees worthy of an honourable mention."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Outer space"
description: "Features two landscape design projects from the portfolio of Hamish Moorhead and Mark Newdick."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Outer space"
description: "Features two landscape design projects from the portfolio of Hamish Moorhead and Mark Newdick."

Author: "Heine, Conrad"
Title: "Dame Judith Mayhew Jonas"
description: "Catches up with NZer Dame Judith Mayhew Jonas in London where she resides. Covers some of her current work and activities including the development of diagonal pedestrian crossings in the middle of London. Talks also of her work with London Mayor Boris Johnson."

Author: "Strange, Glyn"
Title: "Choice new dictionary of Kiwi-speak"
description: "Choice new dictionary of Kiwi-speak"

Author: "Strange, Glyn"
Title: "Choice new dictionary of Kiwi-speak"
description: "Choice new dictionary of Kiwi-speak"

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Chris Liddell"
description: "Profiles Chris Liddell, originally from Matamata but now residing in Detroit with the role of chief financial officer and vice chairman to General Motors. Reflects on his working style."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Nation's essence shines in symbolic work"
description: "Reviews 'The meaning of nowhere' by John Reynolds at the Sue Crockford Gallery (to 23 December 2010), 'The seven ages of man' by Pat Hanly at the Gus Fisher Gallery (to 8 January 2011), and 'Short lives of birds' by Nigel Brown at the Whitespace (to December 24 2010)."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Sex trade preys on wayward teens"
description: "Ascertains how two teenagers ended up working for the Atami Bath House, considered to be one of the seediest strip clubs in Christchurch. Informs that the operator of the strip club was sentenced on 10 Dec 2010 on two charges of receiving payments for employing the teenagers."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Mark D'Arcy"
description: "Talks to Mark D'Arcy who was raised in Auckland and now lives in New York where he is president of Time Warner Global, and senior vice-president, Time Warner Media Group. Mentions the negotiations that he was involved in with the NZ government and other movie business people with the Hobbit movie issues. Backgrounds also his early life and career."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Tragi-comedy recalls the ghosts of Christmas past"
description: "Talks to the actor about her one-women show 'Silent night' that pays tribute to the elderly."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Greens' new colour"
description: "Examines the future of the Green Party now that Keith Locke is the only remaining original member. Discusses the new co-leadership of Russel Norman and Metiria Turei. Notes the party's stability compared to other minority parties. Profiles Young Greens co-leader Holly Walker. Indicates dissent over the Christchurch (Darfield) earthquake vote, and asks whether this shows a trend toward pragmatism over principles.  Talks to current and former Party members about whether there is a trend toward diversification versus activism. Ponders how the party will position itself at the next election, and whether the party policies are becoming mainstream."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "On course to make splash of his own"
description: "On course to make splash of his own"

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "What a champion does on her day off"
description: "What a champion does on her day off"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Dr Jilly Evans"
description: "Profiles Dr Jilly Evans originally from Hawke's Bay, and now a world-leading research biologist residing in San Diego. Covers her early years in NZ including education. Mentions women in science and her current work with Amira."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Coming out of the dark woods"
description: "Talks to several people whose stories feature in the new book on bipolar affective disorder. Seeks comment from University of Canterbury media and communication lecturer Sue Tait about a cover story in the 'Listener' that she considers irresponsible journalism."

Author: "Johannsen, Dana"
Title: "Barry's mission to bridge the gulf in quality"
description: "Barry's mission to bridge the gulf in quality"

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "The enforcer; The new financial watchdog's enforcer"
description: "Reports on the select committee hearings into the legislation establishing the new Financial Markets Authority (FMA) to act as a watchdog and regulator. Informs of opposing views expressed by Government and business and financial sector interests as to how much regulation will be needed. Muses whether the FMA will have sufficient enforcement powers when the Bill is passed."

Author: "Cartwright, Garth"
Title: "Zane Lowe"
description: "Profiles the Auckland-born former rapper who now works in London as a Radio One DJ. Discusses his background and his career, how his NZ accent is received, his 'babe-magnet' status, and his work with MTV."

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Author (detailed): "Chris Rattue, Winston Aldworth and Chris Allen"
Title: "The moments that counted; Picking a winner from a field of sporting excellence; Ryan Nelsen"
description: "Talks to All Whites captain Ryan Nelsen about the games NZ played at the 2010 Football World Cup. Backgrounds the achievements of the nominees for the 2010 NZ Herald Sportsperson of the Year. Announces Ryan Nelsen as the 2010 NZ Herald Sportsperson of the Year. Talks about the past winners of the NZ Herald Sportsperson of the Year."

Author: "Lagan, Bernard"
Title: "Sarah Robb O'Hagan"
description: "Backgrounds NZ born Sarah Robb O'Hagan who works as head of marketing for Gatorade in Chicago. Looks back at her earlier career in the airline business. Discusses her life in the USA and NZ."

Author: "Dann, Liam"
Title: "Chris Liddell : chief financial officer for General Motors"
description: "Announces the chief financial officer for General Motors as the 2010 NZ Herald Business Leader of the Year. Talks briefly about the past winners of the award and the nominations made by the newspapers readers."

Title: "Spurred on by desire to achieve"
description: "Spurred on by desire to achieve"

Author: "Falconer, Phoebe"
Title: "Protector of Maori tradition"
description: "Pays tribute to Te Aue Davis, a key figure in the renaissance of the MaÃÑori weaving movement."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Regan Cameron"
description: "Looks at the life to date of Regan Cameron who grew up in One Tree Hill and now works as a photographer living in New York. Reveals how he became a successful photographer to the stars. Backgrounds also how he learnt his craft."

Author: "Hay, Natasha"
Title: "The intricate art of actually succeeding"
description: "Profiles 22 year-old Eli Kent who has recently received the Bruce Mason Playwriting Award. Backgrounds his career to-date and his plays. Mentions his family background and upbringing and how it has shaped him."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "At home with the Wests"
description: "Announces the Outrageous Fortune exhibition showing at the Auckland Museum 15 Dec 2010 to 1 May 2011, based on the TV series. Highlights what will be shown. Discusses possible reasons why the series was so popular."

Author: "Green, Paula,"
Title: "Magic volumes to dip in and out of"
description: "Reviews a selection of new poetry collections, including the following split volumes: Broken architecture/Salt away, by Sam Sampson and Andrew Grace; I hear a boat/Two dreams in which things are taken, by Emily Toder and Joan Fleming; and Pocket money/Against gravity, by Dora Malech and James Brown."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "The voice of versatility"
description: "Provides an insight into singer Anna Leese's family background and upbringing. Uncovers her musical training and awards won. Reflects on her current soprano soloist role in the Tudor consort performance of Bach's Christmas Oratorio to start 18 Dec 2010, Wellington Town Hall."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Warts and all"
description: "Reports on recent research statistics on the effectiveness of the HPV vaccination programme. Informs of the disease and who it is most likely to affect."

Author: "Hager, Nicky"
Title: "Beans spilled on US ties"
description: "Reveals some of the 1490 WikiLeaks cables sent from the American embassy in NZ.  Focuses on information concerning the restoration of NZ collaboration with US intelligence agencies since the restrictions imposed in the 1980s because of NZ's nuclear-free policy. Includes specific details on cables relating to John Key, Helen Clark, the Australia-NZ relationship, the SAS, Waihopai, foreign policy, and visits by US government officials."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Salt of the earth"
description: "Discusses the need for sodium and chloride in our diets. Looks at sources of these minerals, how salt is needed for our health and what the recommended daily amounts are."

Author: "Marshall, Jonathan"
Title: "Local media entities tracked"
description: "Explains how the US embassy's selects NZ journalists for its International Visitor Leadership Program, and the qualities it looks for. Lists some of the journalists selected since 2001(Guyon Espiner, Ali Ikram, Cliff Joiner, and Kathryn Ryan) and gauges some of their reactions to possible influences on their work."

Author: "Hager, Nicky"
Title: "US tried to change nukes stand in 2005"
description: "Discusses the revelation via WikiLeaks that American ambassador Charles Swindell regarded the 2005 NZ election as a prime time to pressure NZ into changing its nuclear-free policy."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Author (detailed): "/ interviews by Adam Dudding and Megan Nicol Reed"
Title: "This year I learnt ..."
description: "Hears from seven NZers about the notable events in their lives in 2010, and what they think they may have learnt."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Above and beyond"
description: "Shares his experience of running the 60-kilometre Kepler Challenge ultra-marathon in Fiordland. Describes the event's local management, the benefits to the Te Anau economy, and the concern that the race's growing international reputation may be of concern."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Bush-clad tributes to working-class sweat"
description: "Bush-clad tributes to working-class sweat"

Author: "Rankin, Janine"
Title: "Society loses a dedicated supporter"
description: "Society loses a dedicated supporter"

Author: "Matthews, Lee"
Title: "Revealing all in the name of Movember"
description: "Revealing all in the name of Movember"

Author: "Matthews, Lee"
Title: "A good-humoured policing stalwart"
description: "A good-humoured policing stalwart"

Author: "Matthews, Lee"
Title: "On the crest of a wave of change"
description: "On the crest of a wave of change"

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Mysteries of our time"
description: "Meets the German scientist at Auckland's Massey University campus to discuss his work at the university's Institute for Advanced Study on theoretical physics and chemistry. Mentions his being awarded the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation prize. Discusses his work on computational chemical reactions at the level of individual atoms and discusses why such pure research is valuable. Describes some of the practical uses to which such fundamental discoveries can be made. Details the professor's work on chirality (nature's preference for 'right-handed' or 'left-handed molecules) and high pressure physics."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Chats with Richard Gray about his annual job as Father Christmas in Porirua's North City Mall."

Author: "Greive, Duncan"
Title: "Knightly news"
description: "Talks to Joram Van Essen and Jeremy 'Jezz' Smith about the sport and cultural activity of jousting. Discusses how they aim to experience an ancient way of life by using authentic materials, even to the extent of employing a squire (Antonia Davies) to provide target practice for the two 'knights'. Describes the differences in British and American jousting, and explains some of the equipment used."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Once bitten"
description: "Documents  a recent resurgence in bed bugs and relates her own experience of being bitten.  Relates facts about the bugs, and when they are most likely to strike. Mentions her methods of eradication."

Author: "Gillies, Abby"
Title: "All she wants for Christmas is a smile"
description: "Talks to the family of a 4-year-old girl with the rare neurological disorder Moebius/MoÃàbius syndrome that causes facial paralysis about having surgery to gain some facial expression."

Author: "Nash, Kieran"
Title: "Meatworkers try to pick up the pieces"
description: "Visits Te Aroha to see how people are coping nine days after the town's Silver Fern Farms meatworks burnt down putting the livelihoods of 350 workers in jeopardy. Talks to a number of the former workers and two sisters gathering food parcels and donations for the families."

Author: "Jackson, Kerri"
Title: "Review"
description: "Reviews the latest novel from the England-based writer about kehua (spirits of the departed who circle the living members of their whanau)."

Author: "Meng-Yee, Carolyne"
Title: "Birthday greetings for Pike River 'sunshine'"
description: "Birthday greetings for Pike River 'sunshine'"

Author: "Nash, Kieran"
Title: "Works blaze rips through community; Fire-hit town fears for future"
description: "Works blaze rips through community; Fire-hit town fears for future"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Celebmania"
description: "Asks if some recent incidents of kowtowing to visiting celebrities such as Beyonce, Justin Bieber and Tyra Banks is evidence that the egalitarian nature of NZ is changing. Talks to historian Jock Phillips and photographer Bruce Jarvis about the reaction of NZers to visiting celebrities in the past."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Kiwi's drug cartel tale heads for the silver screen; Kiwi spills tale of drug lords, crooked deals and death"
description: "Talks to the crooked bank financier, who laundered millions of dollars for Mexican drug cartels, about his life and the book he has written about his experiences that looks set to be made into a movie with the help of the NZ Film Commission."

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "Legend of Kiwi Kim brought to the fore"
description: "Talks to the author of a new book about the little-known NZ mechanic who came second in the 1973 500cc Grand Prix motorcycle championship and the impact he made."

Author: "Light, Liz"

description: "Talks about 'The heart of the great alone' exhibition at the Robert McDougall Gallery (Canterbury Museum) that showcases historical images of Antarctica by photographers Herbert Ponting and Frank Hurley held in the Royal Collection. Notes that the exhibition ends on the 20th of February 2010."

Author: "Pellegrino, Nicky"
Title: "Crime on the rise"
description: "Talks to the creator of the inaugural Ngaio Marsh Award for Best Crime Novel about the NZ tradition of crime writing."

Author: "Cone, Deborah Hill"
Title: "Living by her rules"
description: "Reviews the new documentary about singer-songwriter Anika Moa."

Author: "Dodgshun, Joe"

description: "Talks to the new British High Commissioner. Discusses her desire to use her own Asian ancestry to build on NZ's position in Asia, which in turn would help the UK."

description: "Focuses on NZ-wide activities to improve water safety and teach swimming skills, particularly to children. Informs that drowning is the third-leading cause of unintentional death in NZ. Speaks to swim coaches at the Central Swim School, funded by the Central Otago District Council for the past five years. Seeks comment from Water Safety NZ general manager Matt Claridge about the situation and a national project in association with Sealord to improve children's swimming ability. Provides facts about drowning and swimming skills in NZ."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Front of the line"
description: "Talks to the current Police Commissioner of the Solomon Islands about his newly appointed role as NZ's Police Commissioner."

Author: "Dowden, Peter"
Title: "Kiwi huts : beloved and now uncovered; Poetry"
description: "Kiwi huts : beloved and now uncovered; Poetry"

description: "Talks to the University of Otago associate professor about his work as a geneticist."

description: "Advises that shares of the Wellington-based steel company provide a way to tap into the recovery from the global financial crisis. Overviews its performance over the past several years, as well as the performance of Australian majority owner OneSteel."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "A year of crisis management; Steady hand on the tiller; Key legislation in 2010"
description: "Reviews the year in politics, including the performance of the political parties. Makes observations and predictions about the Government economic programme. Mentions key legislation passed during 2010."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Lessons to be learnt from Mana"
description: "Reflects on the recent by-election in Mana, and the implications of a modest win by Labour Party candidate Kris Faafoi over National Party candidate and current list MP Hekia Parata. Mentions criticisms by Sir Geoffrey Palmer of the performance of the NZ media."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Bills, bills, bills ..."
description: "Overviews new legislation before Parliament."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Industry or romance?"
description: "Explains that the value of wine lies primarily in the brands rather than in the vineyards in which the wines are made. Comments on sales of recent brands overseas and in NZ."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Commercial hard hit, houses steady"
description: "Comments on the current situation in the commercial property investment market in Nelson."

Title: "Court deals blow to cash strapped businesses; Court summary of the case"
description: "Reports on the decision of the Supreme Court in the GST case involving inbound tour operator Contract Pacific and the Commissioner of Inland Revenue. Seeks comment from Ernst & Young about the wider implications of the case for businesses. Includes the summary of the case by the Supreme Court."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "A challenge to the rules"
description: "Reviews and comments on Sanders v Hepatitis C Support (NZ) Group Inc [2010] CIV 2010-404-3560, High Court, Auckland, Keane J, regarding governance and membership subscription issues in the incorporated society."

description: "Meets the Antarctic veteran and internationally qualified mountain guide. Focuses on his work in preparing for his fourth year as part of the NASA and US National Science Foundation-funded programme Antarctic Search for Meteorites (Ansmet)."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Teach me to swim"
description: "Speaks to Swimtastic owner Mark Bone about the popularity of the swim school's lessons. Informs that drowning is the third-leading cause of unintentional death in NZ. Laments the lack of swimming skills of many NZ children. Speculates about education funding affecting pool closures and children's swimming lessons. Supplies advice on how to rescue a drowning person. Details drowning rates and drownings by region and water body."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "A text by any other name ..."
description: "Features the new exhibition 'Faces of authorship : constructing the author in medieval and early modern books', University of Otago Central Library, de Beer Gallery, from 17 Dec 2010 to 25 Mar 2011. Talks to curator Dr Simone Celine Marshall about the exhibition."

Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Driver '71-'75' by Don Driver, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 30 Jan 2011. Reviews 'Black watercolour 2010', Big Wall, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 17 Apr 2011.  Reviews 'Let there be light : celebrating the Bible in English', Reed Gallery, Dunedin City Library, until 20 Feb 2011."

description: "Describes the toffee-icecream sweet, touches on its history and possible origin of its name, and explains why it qualifies as kiwiana. Includes a recipe for hokey pokey toffee."

Title: "Wired for ingenuity"
description: "Backgrounds the term "No 8 wire", noting the myths and social history debate that surrounds it."

Author: "Kean, Judy"
Title: "Traditional bach holidays back on track"
description: "Depicts a typical holiday home, or bach. Describes example of baches selling for under $600,000, and passes on real estate advice about buying holiday homes."

Author: "Yousef, Robyn"
Title: "Classic gift that keeps on giving"
description: "States that the Edmonds Cookery Book is 102 years old and still regularly tops non-fiction bestseller lists. Shares two of the cook book's most popular recipes, banana cake and afghan biscuits."

Author: "White, Greer"
Title: "For the love of sheep"
description: "Touches on the contribution of sheep to jokes about NZers, to lists of kiwiana, and to NZ agriculture."

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "No, not the Brothel Brothers; Brothers in search of respectability; Brothels the source of Chows' wealth, says ex-employee"
description: "Profiles the media-shy brothers who are becoming major property investors in the city. Discusses some of the properties in their portfolio, including brothels and other 'adult entertainment' businesses. Touches on their ill-fated attempts to expand their business holdings into Auckland and South Korea. Seeks comment from their lawyer, Max Tait. Speaks to former employees Phiona Baskett and Lorna Dunn about their business practices. Asks NZ Prostitutes' Collective national co-ordinator Catherine Healy for comment about the practice of requiring sex workers to pay bonds. Provides a timeline of significant events in the lives of the brothers."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Local action created a lasting legacy"
description: "Recaps the action by Pakiri Beach locals in 1983 to restrict access to Pakiri Beach. Talks to Ngatiwai Trust chairman Laly Haddon about the decision and its ramifications. Touches on the debate over the Marine and Coastal Area Bill."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Author (detailed): "Tracy Watkins, Vernon Small and Martin Kay"
Title: "[Insight]"
description: "Anticipates the 2011 general election, focusing on the performance of and the important considerations for the National, ACT, Maori, Labour and Green parties. Touches on the 'five big themes for 2011'."

Author: "Harris, Catherine"
Title: "Over a barrel"
description: "Investigates why the once-buoyant NZ wine industry is losing significant sums of money, and what is planned to address the situation. Refers to a recent report on the industry by Deloitte, and talks to Grant Jerrold of its Christchurch office. Seeks views of industry commentators including Renwick grape grower Willie Crosse, New Zealand Winegrowers president Stuart Smith and Spring Creek Vintners managing director Ian Wiffin."

Author: "Lancashire, Rebecca"
Title: "Kapiti's growing reputation"
description: "Visits some of the many small artisan food producers along the Kapiti-Horowhenua coast. Talks to some of them, including producers of wine, olives and lavender oil. Informs that the Kapiti Coast District Council has commissioned a report from Landcare Research into the changing nature of land use in the area."

Author: "Jacobson, Julie"
Title: "For all to see"
description: "Features examples of outdoor art in the city. Asks six Wellingtonians to comment on their favourite piece of outdoor art."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Suzy's place"
description: "Profiles the pioneering former owner of Suzy's coffee bar, which she ran from 1964 to 1987. Informs of the new book 'Suzy's : a coffee house history'. Describes her move from the Netherlands to Wellington and her entry into the hospitality business. Touches on her activities since retiring, including becoming a NZ citizen after 50 years here."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Indulge"
description: "Talks to the general manager of Nada Bakery, Johnsonville."

Author: "Hansford, Dave"
Title: "Board games"
description: "Takes a surfing lesson with the former NZ representative surfer and teacher. Includes information about his business Kiwi Surf Schools, and directions to Castlepoint."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Humble abode"
description: "Showcases a holiday home at Lake Tekapo designed by Christchurch architect Charlie Nott. Talks to owners Susanna Izard and Richie Smith about their design brief for a rustic farm shed."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Humble abode"
description: "Showcases a holiday home at Lake Tekapo designed by Christchurch architect Charlie Nott. Talks to owners Susanna Izard and Richie Smith about their design brief for a rustic farm shed."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Claus encounters"
description: "Challenges the 'single Santa' concept by taking two three-year-old children, Brooke Marsh and Johan Lammers, to visit as many Santas as they can handle in one morning at various malls in Christchurch."

Author: "Peka, June"
Title: "Apartment gardening"
description: "Visits the artist, focusing on her small indoor garden in her two-level urban industrial apartment."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "A high-stakes game"
description: "Investigates shady dealings including an elaborate scam and a murder plot at the casino, prompting the resignation of two senior staff and a government inquiry into its business practices. Traces the series of events from 2007 to the present and the people involved in or taken in by the scam."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Paradise lost?"
description: "Explores the implications of the decision by government in the 1990s to introduce tenure review under the Crown Pastoral Land Act as a 'win-win' system for dividing high-country land into productive land and protected land. Talks to several critics of the tenure review system, who consider that NZ will eventually regret the secretive series of sales of vast tracts public land to farmers. Seeks views of the  American Fulbright Scholar who wrote a book on the subject. Describes changes made to the policy by the Labour Government in 2007 to ban lakefront stations from sale, and the decision by the National Government in Jul 2009 to rescind the ban. Informs of significant recent events that could provide greater oversight of tenure review. Seeks views of farmers."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Author (detailed): "Tracy Watkins, Vernon Small and Martin Kay"
Title: "Party time : MPs eye election year"
description: "Anticipates the 2011 general election, focusing on the performance of and the important considerations for the National, ACT, Maori, Labour and Green parties."

Author: "Hall, Laura"
Title: "Long way to the top"
description: "Talks to the former land surveyor who walked the length of NZ, starting in Bluff in Nov 2009 and arriving at Cape Reinga eight months later. Describes his philosophy of saying yes to nearly everything offered to him."

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "A calm port in any storm"
description: "Talks to the chief executive of Lyttelton Port of Christchurch (LPC). Describes some of the challenges of his seven years in the job, including the recent decision to terminate the proposed merger of LPC and Port Otago. Overviews his career and the long association of his family with Canterbury. Speaks about his optimism for the region."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Pioneer of farming, technology, politics"
description: "Pioneer of farming, technology, politics"

Author: "Taylor, Rachel"
Title: "'I never go into anything to lose'"
description: "'I never go into anything to lose'"

Title: "Unusually strong character, drive"
description: "Unusually strong character, drive"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Clipping in confidence for 60 years"
description: "Clipping in confidence for 60 years"

Author: "Williscroft, Colin"
Title: "Historian captivated by gold-mimg"
description: "Historian captivated by gold-mimg"

Title: "Bravery in Vietnam war recognised"
description: "Bravery in Vietnam war recognised"

Author: "Cannan, Dave"
Title: "A man who forged his own track through life"
description: "A man who forged his own track through life"

Title: "Super City candidate and MMP referendum campaigner"
description: "Super City candidate and MMP referendum campaigner"

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "A bit rich"
description: "Speaks to comments by Will Hutton in his book (Them and us) on the unfairness of contemporary capitalism, noting the public outrage in the Britain and the US toward executive salaries. Talks to experts about whether such a trend is beginning in NZ, exemplified by the salary package of Westpac's George Franzis. Discusses NZ and Australian corporate salaries, the perceived  inefficiency of short-term bonuses for CEOs, disgruntled employees,  a NZ penchant for egalitarianism, and whether salary disclosure is helpful. Provides figures for the earnings of top CEOs in NZ."

Author: "Neal, Tracy"
Title: "Because they asked : a fourth bid to be mayor"
description: "Because they asked : a fourth bid to be mayor"

Author: "Cowdrey, Alice"
Title: "Greenie shaking up 'old, white males'"
description: "Greenie shaking up 'old, white males'"

Title: "Boy racer caused own death, says accused"
description: "Boy racer caused own death, says accused"

Author: "Basham, Laura"
Title: "Air ace recalls battle that stopped Hitler"
description: "Air ace recalls battle that stopped Hitler"

Author: "Collett, Geoff"
Title: "Reese eyes role as first woman mayor"
description: "Reese eyes role as first woman mayor"

Author: "Neal, Tracy"
Title: "Nelson's mayor has unfinished business"
description: "Nelson's mayor has unfinished business"

Author: "Neal, Tracy"
Title: "Shake-up promised for council executive"
description: "Shake-up promised for council executive"

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Finding your happy place"
description: "Interviews US author Dan Buettner about his National Geographic-commissioned study of happiness (and anxiety).   Cites Buettner's comments about Tall Poppy syndrome possibly contributing to happiness, noting the example of Denmark.  Defines happiness, names the four happiest places in the world, and discusses the correlation of economic happiness and freedom with happiness. Considers NZ's place in the happiness rankings, discussing them with two NZ founders of a new publication (the International Journal of Well-being). Quotes a poem from a Mexican journalist that shares his secret for happiness."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Anna Hansen"
description: "Talks to the expatriate and NZer of the Year (UK) winner about Modern Pantry, a London cafe/restaurant of which she is chef and co-owner. Maps out her career, from failing to enter teachers' training college to ending up  working with NZ chef Peter Gordon. Discusses her 'evolutionary' style of cooking, her upcoming cookbook, and what she will do on her day off on 25 December."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Dean Brettschneider"
description: "Talks to the baker about his beginnings in Waikuku, his sporting achievements and his understanding of marketing. Discusses his expertise in baked goods, his ambition, his cookbooks, and his Global Baker brand. Describe his constant travelling companion, his artisan bakeries in Shanghai and Auckland, and his need, or desire, to keep moving. Includes a recipe for raspberry macaroon tart with raspberry cream."

Author: "Burgess, Malcolm"
Title: "Postcards from the edge"
description: "Reviews the Sightseeing travelling exhibition at the Dowse Art Museum, Lower Hutt, until 6 Feb, 2011, featuring the work of 15 NZ and Germany-based photographic artists."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Bugs that suck"
description: "Gives a brief history of early European explorers' experiences of the sandfly. Describes the sandflies biting habits. Warns of the harm caused by mosquitoes and sandflies, despite their not being carriers of diseases. Advises how to avoid skin infections, increasingly prevalent in children in summer. Give tips on preventing insect bites and stings."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Scientifically gifted"
description: "Canvasses NZ scientists and educators about their favourite gifts and activities to inspire children's interest in science. Includes a list of useful websites of science activities and resources."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "The oil in coconut"
description: "Discusses the health benefits of coconut oil, advising of official information on the nut's high saturated fat content compared to that found on websites selling coconut products. Presents details on medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs). Advises caution when extrapolating data on the diets and health of one population group to that of another."

Author: "Cropp, Amanda,"
Title: "Risky business"
description: "Reports on the increasingly heated debate over quad bike safety issues, given that accidents involving the bikes have claimed 45 lives and caused more than 17,000 injuries in the last decade among farm workers and recreational users. Points out the difference between what quad bikes and all terrain vehicles, or ATVs, can do. Includes an at-a-glance list of facts on quad bikes and quad bike accidents in NZ each year, as well as brief profiles of some of the safety options available."

Author: "Hager, Nicky"
Title: "Secret service"
description: "Describes how the author came to secure the NZ WikiLeaks cables, and offers a peek inside the mind of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "Spanish influence"
description: "Previews the first reunion on NZ soil, to be held in Gisborne, between NZ and Spanish descendants of an adventurous 19th-century trader called Manuel Jose. Talks to the Jose whanau about his enduring legacy, particularly Edda McCabe, a great-great grand-daughter of Manuel Jose, and one of the key organisers of the Jose family in NZ."

Author: "Broatch, Mark"
Title: "What we read in 2010"
description: "Lists the most popular books in NZ for 2010, in the categories of General, Fiction, Children, NZ fiction, Non-fiction, and Food & drink."

Author: "White, Helen Watson"
Title: "A different reflection; Early MaÃÑori leader's worries pointer to current battles"
description: "A different reflection; Early MaÃÑori leader's worries pointer to current battles"

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Talks to the Auckland arborist and student about his chosen profession."

Author: "Greive, Duncan"
Title: "Beautiful collision"
description: "Explores the inner workings of a new musical partnership between Bic Runga, perceived as the epitome of NZ's musical establishment, and Kody Nielson, the erstwhile singer for art-punk band The Mint Chicks. Interviews the pair about their musical collaboration and the differences and similarities in their respective styles."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Way back when"
description: "Reminisces about a photo of the singer taken at Whanagmata when he was 11 years old."

Author: "Moore, Bill"
Title: "Gentleman Jim : the common touch"
description: "Gentleman Jim : the common touch"

Author: "Gale, Hayley"
Title: "Grant to explore A-bomb illnesses"
description: "Grant to explore A-bomb illnesses"

Author: "Paulin, Alastair"
Title: "Flying skills led to war heroics"
description: "Flying skills led to war heroics"

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Special day heightens pain of mine loss"
description: "Special day heightens pain of mine loss"

Title: "Leading NZ anti-apartheid campaigner dies at 84"
description: "Leading NZ anti-apartheid campaigner dies at 84"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Tragedy on an ordinary day"
description: "Speaks to Roger Wolfe, the husband of Kay Wolfe, one of three people, the others being Willy Muller and Mark Ferguson, who were killed in a cycling accident involving a car. Tells of a group of social cyclists named 'The cream of the country' in the Morrinsville area who would go out for a Sunday cycle for the enjoyment. Includes a list of cyclists involved in fatal accidents."

Author: "Krotoski, Aleks"
Title: "Revolutionary tools bring power to the people"
description: "Examines the internet being hailed as a means to solve the world's problems but suggests the usefulness of tools such as previous inventions like the printing press and telegraph, depends on the people using them. Charts the progress of the development of the Internet and its social and political effects. Features examples of where authorities in two countries have tried to hold the flow of information over electronic networks. Profiles eight young radicals who use the internet to further their causes: Christopher 'moot' Poole (4chan), Ory Okolloh (Ushahidi), Peter Sunde (the Private Bay), Han Han (blogger), Jody McIntyre (Life on Wheels) and Walid Al-Saqaf (Yemen Portal)."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Students pay high price for freedom"
description: "Investigates the issue of voluntary unionism in NZ universities since the government in 1999 allowed students how to choose whether to belong to their union or not. Today the government is about to pass the Education (Freedom of Association) Amendment Bill outlawing universal membership and forcing all tertiary institutions to follow Auckland's lead. Studies the effects of voluntary membership on the student union's financial health and their ability to supply services to their members. Includes a list of tertiary institutions and the level of student levy and/or membership fee and arguments for and against voluntary membership."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Just a few questions please"
description: "Talks about the locations she has gone arrived at to interview her guests and some of the lighter moments that occurred during  interviewing. Mentions Dame Cath Tizard, Sir Colin Meads, Ian Mune, Ravi Shankar, Gin Wigmore, Duncan Garner, Cameron Slater and Richard O'Brien."

Author: "McAllister, Janet"
Title: "Theatre that reflects our day and age"
description: "Reviews the year of theatre in Auckland in 2010. Two critics cast an eye over what has been a range of theatre in Auckland."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Reflections on a rich and varied year"
description: "Considers Auckland to have been treated to a wide range of art over the last year creating a climate of questioning but according to the author with few answers. Mentions Susan Philipz winning the prestigious Turner prize in Britain and the winner of our own lavish Walters Prize by Dan Arps. Mentions numerous exhibitions within Auckland city: Local revolutionaries : art and change 1965-1986 at the Auckland Art Gallery; Last flight in hot air balloon; art work by Andrew Barber at Hopkinson Cundy in Cross Street; Raw attempts by Richard Maloy and a portrait of Francis Upritchard by Liz Maw at Artspace; the works of Fiona Pardington, Yvonne Todd, Megan Jenkinson, Daniel von Sturmer, Roger Mortimer, Ruben Paterson and Andrew McLeod as part of the exhibition called Top ten at the Gus Fisher Gallery."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Deaf disadvantaged at school?; Call for change in teaching regime"
description: "Talks to two local parents who are frustrated by the lack of learning opportunities for their deaf children. Seeks comment from Dr Rachel McKee of Victoria University School of Linguistics and Applied Language Studies, and Dr Gill Rutherford of the University of Otago School of Education, about the inadequacies of NZ mainstream schools in aiding the education of deaf children and what needs to be done to remedy the problems. Talks to Ministry of Education special education deputy secretary Nicholas Pole about the situation."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Hillside - a tale of changing fortune; Bright future was seen for workshops; Bright future was seen for Hillside"
description: "Investigates the impact on the train carriage manufacturing workshops to the decision to award a lucrative manufacturing contract to a Chinese company. Cites sources indicating that KiwiRail chief executive Jim Quinn is not intending to close the workshops. Reports on the bright future foreseen for the engineering group earlier this decade, and overviews its history."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Sharing the secret of success"
description: "Talks to the co-founder of the information management company. Describes her business model that allows organisations to share the services her company provides."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Moving out of the past"
description: "Profiles the former chairwoman of the trust board about her reaction to not having been reappointed to the board. Discusses her time on the board, her management practices that have attracted criticism from some staffers, and her contention that the museum is unfairly treated by Government. Praises current museum director Shimrath Paul."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "By way of illustrations"
description: "Talks to the award-winning illustrator, focusing on his latest collaboration with Canterbury writer Margaret Mahy on a children's book. Overviews his career."

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Stint with British club an eye-opener for teen"
description: "Stint with British club an eye-opener for teen"

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Different styles gave us plenty to dance about"
description: "Reviews: the Royal New Zealand Ballet's triple bill programme, From here to there performed in Auckland with presentation of works by two English choreographers ( Christopher Hampson and David Dawson) and one New Zealander (Andrew Simmons); the performance in early September of Black Grace who performed Verses; New York's Complexions Contemporary Ballet who performed Rise in late September; the highlight of the Tempo Dance Festival, Hijinx by Liz Aggiss."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Less is more : the joys of being a minimalist"
description: "Talks to a number of NZers who are living with less and perhaps leading to greater fulfillment whether it be for environmental, personal, social or spiritual reasons."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "The fair cop"
description: "Talks to NZs top traffic police officer, Superintendent Paula Rose, outlining how she came to her present career and position. Notes the lack of top-ranked women in the Police and her dedication to reducing the death toll on NZ roads. Includes a list of survival tips for road users and what Police will do for us and what road users can do for the Police."

Title: "Framing reality"
description: "Illustrates with photographs events of significance and not so significant that occurred in NZ over the last year."

Author: "Fleming, Donna"
Title: "The great Christmas con"
description: "Tells of the difficulty the author has in perpetuating the myth that Santa Claus is real to her 8 year-old daughters. Considers how her daughter will eventually find out that Santa is not real and notes the author shares equally the enjoyment her daughter has for Santa."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Christmas : a guide to surviving the stress"
description: "Looks at the scenarios that trigger stress at Christmas time. Proffers advice from Lynley Lane, Waikato clinical leader for Relationship Services, Hilary Smith, counsellor for Wellington Relationship Services and Bronwen King, public health nutritionist. Suggests situations around money and alcohol can cause stress, including arrangements associated with who is going to be where at Christmas if the parents have separated. Notes that various foods and drinks may affect peoples' moods."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Coming to a beach near you"
description: "Looks at the behaviour of jellyfish and suggests that some of them will arrive on our beaches this summer. Notes what can be done if you are stung by a jellyfish. Describes the main types of jellyfish found in NZ waters, moon jellyfish, spotted jellyfish and lion's mane."

Author: "Blundell, Kay"
Title: "Historian, lobbyist and original good samaritan"
description: "Historian, lobbyist and original good samaritan"

Author: "Hughes, Alistair"
Title: "Dark side of the sun"
description: "Describes as an immigrant from Scotland how he was eventually attracted to the sun, spending much time outdoors during the summer months. Notes the short-term benefits of the sun before the long-term negative effects were known. After many years of being in the sun in NZ and Scotland where he returned for sometime he was diagnosed as having basal cell carcinoma."

Author: "Norris, Joanna"
Title: "Foodie paradise over the hill"
description: "Encourages Wellingtonians to drive over the Rimutaka Hill to the Wairarapa to taste some of their food, wine and coffee and even some of their chocolate. Mentions locations such as Matinborough, Greytown and Featherston as places where these products can be found."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Author (detailed): "Rebecca Palmer, Nikki Macdonald, Diana Dekker, Tom Fitzsimons"
Title: "It's been a great year because ..."
description: "Tells the story of some NZers who will remember 2010 because something positive happened to them during the year. Simon Gilbertson was given a heart transplant. Virginia Woolf left Nelson and ended up taking photographs in Papua New Guinea after taking a risk and following her dreams. Petra Haliciopoulos will start study for a history or classics degree after moving back home with her partner to live with her mother. Svetlana Sabitova, originally from Kyrgyzstan, passed her driving test though being initially very nervous. University Bombers football team won the Masters 4 grade, the first time they had topped their division in two decades."

Author: "Hansford, Dave"
Title: "In the world of the gannet"
description: "Describes the gannet colony and the gannets at Cape Kidnappers, Hawke's Bay, 12 kilometres from Clifton Beach. Indicates things to take and be aware of if you decide to walk to the colony from Scotsman's Point (near Clifton Beach)."

Author: "Todd, Rebecca"
Title: "Experiencing a first Kiwi Christmas"
description: "Relates when the author first met up with three refugee families in Nepal in February and now revisits them nine months later after their resettlement in Christchurch and discusses their Christmas plans. Describes their experience of living in a new country getting used to the climate, language and social customs and Christmas."

Author: "Mathewson, Nicole"
Title: "Honouring December 25 in their own way"
description: "Reports that most NZers grow up with a Christmas Day tradition based on the birth of Jesus and the arrival of Santa Claus but for many others Christmas has no place in their beliefs. Talks to members of the Jewish, Hare Krishna and Muslim communities to see how they view the Christian holiday of Christmas and what special celebrations are present in their own religions."

Title: "Hero; Going above and beyond"
description: "Chooses a number of NZers who have stepped forward to comfort, support and inspire the rest of us."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Christmas burn-out"
description: "Looks at the scenarios that trigger stress at Christmas time. Proffers advice from Lynley Lane, Waikato clinical leader for Relationship Services, Hilary Smith, counsellor for Wellington Relationship Services and Bronwen King, public health nutritionist. Suggests situations around money and alcohol can cause stress, including arrangements associated with who is going to be where at Christmas if the parents have separated. Notes that various foods and drinks may affect peoples' moods."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Great stories of small creatures"
description: "Recall some weird and wonderful animal stories for 2010. Involves stories of a bichon-frise puppy being stuck in a pipe, a bull-mastiff puppy with a tea-pot stuck on its head, a 16 year-old labrador who survived for 8 weeks on melted snow while trapped in a disused tunnel house, a cat who awoke its owner to their house fire, etc."

Author: "Dixon, Alana"
Title: "Double party for Ruth's 100th birthday"
description: "Double party for Ruth's 100th birthday"

Title: "Kiwi speedster chases F1 racing dream"
description: "Kiwi speedster chases F1 racing dream"

Author: "Egan, Brendon"
Title: "Steel co-captains set big goals for 2011"
description: "Steel co-captains set big goals for 2011"

Title: "Jury judges father guilty in rail crash"
description: "Jury judges father guilty in rail crash"

description: "City man region's top Kiwi Battler"

Title: "Karate kid seeks gold at Oceania"
description: "Karate kid seeks gold at Oceania"

Title: "Waikato workers helping homeless"

Title: "A place for children to have a ball"
description: "A place for children to have a ball"

Title: "Walker finds fresh motivation to return career to former glory"
description: "Walker finds fresh motivation to return career to former glory"

Title: "Waitomo gunman gives police slip"
description: "Waitomo gunman gives police slip"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Pakeha passionate over iwi role"
description: "Pakeha passionate over iwi role"

Author: "Longley, Geoff"
Title: "Stewart's trimmer, fitter and keener"
description: "Stewart's trimmer, fitter and keener"

Author: "Anderson, Ian"
Title: "Styris shuffles off to join bowlers' rehab classes"
description: "Styris shuffles off to join bowlers' rehab classes"
