description: "Talks to Black Grace Dance Company artistic director Neil Ieremia about the 2011 Auckland Arts Festival production of 'Who are you: Black Grace presents Urban Youth Movement NZ', created and preformed by a company of young people from the city's high schools, technical colleges and streets."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Young girl gets her reward after longest, scariest day"
description: "Recalls the experiences of the reporter and her daughter during and after the magnitude-6.3 earthquake."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Insane jealousy and lots of laughs; Handel put heart into opera"
description: "Talks to director Roger Hodgman about his approach to the NBR NZ Opera's performance of Handel's 'Xerxes' for the 2011 Auckland Arts Festival."

Author: "Glionna, John M."
Title: "Uncle Bob, he's the everywhere mayor"
description: "Looks at the actions of the Christchurch mayor before and after the Feb 2011 earthquake, noting praise and criticism from NZers. Evaluates the effect of his work as a television host.  Touches on the earthquake's role in the city's mayoral race of 2010."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Dude, you've been an inspiration"
description: "Speaks to producer Charlotte Yates about the 'Ihimaera' project for the 2011 Auckland Arts Festival, which features the lyrics of Witi Ihimaera set to the music of a dozen NZ musicians."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Landscapes given a twist in digital age"
description: "Reviews 'Deep water' by Phil Dadson at Starkwhite (to 5 March 2011), 'Domain' by Sam Foley at Whitespace (to 5 March 2011) and 'New paintings' by Bridget Bidwill at the Artis Gallery (to 5 March 2011)."

Title: "Pioneer of aerial topdressing"
description: "Presents an obituary for the former RNZAF and pioneering aerial topdressing pilot."

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "Saviour holds Ann's hand in crushed bus"
description: "Saviour holds Ann's hand in crushed bus"

Author: "Bowron, Jane,"
Title: "To-ing and fro-ing must be done before curfew"
description: "Describes the experience of the author of living in the cordon set up within four avenues in the city centre."

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "Mother clings to happy memories"
description: "Mother clings to happy memories"

Author: "Gaynor, Brian"
Title: "Quake wake-up call for disaster insurer"
description: "Looks at the impact the Canterbury/Christchurch earthquakes may have on the Earthquake Commission (EQC) and its ability to insure future natural disasters."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Movement of the people"
description: "Previews the Hullapoloi dance performance, 1-2 March 2011, the Opera House. Talks to creators and childhood friends Kate McIntosh and Jo Randerson about how they came to collaborate, the themes they address - the environment and consumerism - and the responsibilities of middle-aged people."

Author: "Williams, Bronwyn"
Title: "New kids on the block"
description: "Profiles new fashion labels and the young designers behind them: Twenty-Seven Names, Juliette Hogan, Ruby, Blak, and Lela Jacobs.  Talks to fashion industry experts about the similarities and differences between upcoming designers and those of the 1990s."

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Moving Wright along"
description: "Talks to the master choreographer, author, poet and NZ Arts Laureate as he prepares for his new work 'rapt', commissioned for the 2011 Auckland Arts Festival."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Proving the young can do it"
description: "Meets Sam Scott, the founder of Massive Company (formerly the Maidment Youth Theatre). Talks to some of the performers about why they keep returning to the youth theatre company. Touches on the company's latest production 'Havoc in the garden', one of the headline acts in the Auckland Festival 2011."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "A vocal ambition"
description: "Talks to the NZ opera singer about her drive to perform around the world and her role as Amastre in the NZ Opera and Victorian Opera co-production of Handel's 'Xerxes' as part of the 2011 Auckland Arts Festival."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "A good book"
description: "Highlights independent publishers in Wellington, naming successful titles they have produced and examining their niche market approach. Talks to Fergus Barrowman of Victoria University Press (VUP) about the role of university funding; Mary Varnham of Awa Press about encouraging authors and seeking Creative New Zealand support; Julia Marshall of Gecko Press about partnership relationships with large publishing houses; Brian Bargh of Huia Press about promoting MaÃÑori writers and MaÃÑori language; Bridget Williams about books that influence the country's view of its history; Grant Sheehan of Phantom Books about his unexpected success in photographic books on cafes and hotels; and Roger Steele of Steele Robertson about publishing poetry and the works of Jackie Baxter and Hone Tuwhare. Solicits the publishers' views on e-books and their relationships with each other and with multinationals."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Fire power"
description: "Visits the Christchurch Pistol Club to ascertain the difficulty and the attraction of pistol shooting. Defines practical pistol shooting, noting exponents need to have athletic ability. Explains the need for member anonymity and strict screening procedures. Describes the social aspects of belonging to a shooting club. Tries his hand(s) at western action shooting, describing the weapons involved."

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Author (detailed): "Chris Morris, Peter Donaldson and David Loughrey"
Title: "Working through a tangle of red tape; Dream for Dandie Dinmont's future a labour of love; Inside view : more help needed if city wants its historic buildings saved"
description: "Continues the series on the future of the city's industrial and commercial buildings. Talks to property investor Laurie Forbes about why he believes the Dunedin City Council's planning rules hinder smaller retail developments of historic commercial buildings. Looks at the attempts to restore the 'Dandie Dinmont', better known as the 'White House', built for William Larnach in 1880 as a hotel. Learns why property developer Mark Wallace does not want to rebuild any more historic commercial buildings in the city. Elizabeth Kerr, a Dunedin building environment consultant, and Michael Findlay, professional practice fellow at the University of Otago, talk about their favourite commercial buildings."

Author: "Balham, David"
Title: "Canvas on ice"
description: "Describes a camping field trip at Windless Bight over Christmas 2010 as part of a Canterbury University summer Antarctic Studies programme. Evaluates the polar tent, explains how to make an ice cave, verbally sketches closeby Mt Erebus and comments on weather and cooking. Notes earlier visits to the area, including that of Cherry-Garrard, and of his biologist father Ron Balham in 1957."

Author: "Fraser, Kate"
Title: "Astute balance of plot, place, and pace"
description: "Astute balance of plot, place, and pace"

Author: "Cone, Deborah Hill"
Title: "Taming a teenager?"
description: "Talks to the clinical psychologist, author and TV host about his new eight-part TV series and accompanying book, a follow-up to 'The politically incorrect guide to parenting'."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "'Quite simple solutions' available; Council looking for ways to push building reuse"
description: "Reveals what work is being carried out by the newly established (January 2010) Dunedin City Council, Heritage Buildings Economic Reuse Steering Committee whose purpose is to find out what barriers stand in the way of the city's heritage buildings being saved and reused."

Author: "Bruce, David"
Title: "Trust's action brought historic precinct back to life"
description: "Asks whether Oamaru's success in retaining its historic buildings and redeveloping them for re-use provide a guide for Dunedin? Recounts the process Oamaru Whitestone Civic Trust went through in order to initially preserve what was called the Harbour-Tyne St. Historic Precinct. Notes the scope of the preservation work has been widened to include Victorian architecture outside the confines of the Precinct. Briefly notes what other councils in the lower South Island are doing to protect their heritage buildings."

Author: "Williscroft, Colin"
Title: "Scholarship artist hopes to become vet"
description: "Scholarship artist hopes to become vet"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Feeding the whaÃÑnau"
description: "Talks to a number of NgaÃÑi Tahu about their stories of food gathering and the tastes of the kaimoana (seafood).  Includes a recipe for tuaki fritters (cockles)."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Fired by father's brigade connection"
description: "Fired by father's brigade connection"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Earliest MaÃÑori diet quite different"
description: "Talks to Professor Helen Leach (editor of From kai to Kiwi kitchen, Otago University Press 2010) who states that MaÃÑori living in southern NZ had few plant foods before the introduction of potatoes and other European foods. Discusses the issues associated with a high protein diet, namely the necessity of adding the correct proportion of fat to the food intake."

Author: "Bruce, David"
Title: "Project turns tide on lagoon's future"
description: "Describes a project aimed at protecting the Wainono Lagoon and wetlands, noting its recognition  under the Canterbury Water Management Strategy, 2010. Details funding and allocation for the project. Lists the main organisations involved in restoration activities, and the various owners. Explains the lagoon's environmental and cultural significance, wildlife, and main threats."

Author: "Williscroft, Colin"
Title: "Military training scheme recalled"
description: "Talks to president Jock Braidwood about the formation, membership and activities of the Central Otago Compulsory Military Training (CMT) and National Service Personnel group."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "More progress likely in NZ recovery"
description: "Interviews ASB chief economist Nick Tuffley about how the 2011 NZ economy fare in comparison to previous years. Discusses the outlook for tourism, housing, business, the labour market, inflation, interest rates, and the currency."

Author: "Thomas, Gillian"
Title: "Waving the flag"
description: "Records the singers recent successes. Outlines her schedule of singing and training that includes singing for three to four hours,  two hours of pronounciation of foreign words, two hours of administration associated with singing engagements and physical exercise in order to be a top opera singer in Europe. Intimates what may be her future engagements."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Upper Waitaki township loses its 'glue'"
description: "Upper Waitaki township loses its 'glue'"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Lyttelton's community unbowed"
description: "Surveys the damage visited upon Lyttelton by the 24th February 2011 earthquake and talks to Lytteltonians about their experience of the event."

Author: "Somerville, Philip,"
Title: "Great speaker gave encouragement without criticism"
description: "Great speaker gave encouragement without criticism"

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Creatively on the job for 51 years"
description: "Creatively on the job for 51 years"

Title: "Threatened mohua transferred to Pomona Island"
description: "Details the relocation of 40 mohua (yellowhead) to predator-free Pomona Island, in an attempt to build another viable population."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Teeth may hold information"
description: "Reveals the potential use of mineralised plaque on teeth to conduct DNA testing that could help link geographically separate historical communities. Introduces University of Otago dentistry student Joseph Foster who is researching the new analytical method on an Otago Medical Research Foundation scholarship."

Author: "Poole, Marian"
Title: "Kooky concert provides simple togetherness"
description: "Reviews performances in the Last Night of the Proms, 25 Feb 2011, Dunedin Town Hall, including a piece by Mayor Dave Cull and songs sung in recognition of the Feb 22 Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Contentious body-donation film wins major award"
description: "Backgrounds a film on body donation at the Otago Medical School, directed by Dr Paul Trotman.  Notes the award it won at the Edge Film Festival Awards in Auckland, and the controversy over screening of the television documentary on TV3, Nov 2009."

Author: "Dodgshun, Joe"
Title: "Searching for a little piece of Mars in the Antarctic"
description: "Talks to mountain guide about his recent trip to the Antarctic working for the US National Science Foundation-funded programme Antarctic Search for Meteorites (Ansmet). Mentions the possibly Martian rock he found. Previews his next trip to Mt Arapiles, Australia."

Author: "Keast, John"
Title: "All for one, one for all"
description: "Recounts the experiences of residents of the suburb of Shirley during and after the earthquake, focusing on the lack of water, the need to make temporary toilets, and the experience of community solidarity. Summarises some of the optimism and pessimism of affected residents."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Waste not wanted"
description: "Examines the issue of urban waste removal, previewing a new kerbside recycling system beginning in Dunedin and advising which items to include or exclude in the new wheelie bins. Looks at the landfill diversion schemes of Raglan (Xtreme Waste) and Wanaka (Wanaka Wastebusters). Seeks an explanation of 'product stewardship' from Wanaka's Sue Coutts. Illustrates examples of good and bad packaging, advising of a Wanaka-led campaign to educate consumers about packaging. Talks to Packaging Council executive director Paul Curtis about the packaging paradox."

Author: "Isaacs, Clarke"
Title: "Diminutive Dunedin detective shines brightly"
description: "Diminutive Dunedin detective shines brightly"

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "Readable history brings Castlepoint community alive"
description: "Readable history brings Castlepoint community alive"

Author: "Cook, Majorie"
Title: "She should be so lucky"
description: "Profiles the South Island singer, following her career since she started singing in Wanaka. Touches on her contract with Gray Bartlett, her assistance from Trelise Cooper, and singing at Branches Station in Cardrona Valley. Discusses her songwriting, working the Wanaka musicians Rob Caig and Bernie Rillstone-Caig, and the prospect of an album."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Art deco crowds respond to quake"
description: "Reports on the 11th Art Deco festival, held in Ranfurly Feb 2011, noting the special fundraising events held to assist people affected by the Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Stewart, Matt"
Title: "Devil's Staircase crash victim named"
description: "Devil's Staircase crash victim named"

Author: "Stewart, Matt"
Title: "Church hall officially open"
description: "Announces the opening of the new  hall of the St John Presbyterian church in Arrowtown, comparing its updated features to those of the original 139-year-old wooden hall."

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "'Quaky cat' being reprinted"
description: "Reports on plans to reprint the title by the Caitlin-based author that describes a cat's experience of an earthquake and is aimed at raising funds for the September 4 2010 and now the February 22 2011 earthquakes in the Christchurch region."

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Title: "Confusion complicates recycling change"
description: "Reports on teething problems with Dunedin's new kerbside collection service which began 28 Feb 2011. Gauges the reaction of City Council solid waste manager Ian Featherston to the new operation."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Descendants celebrate Cromwell link"
description: "Descendants celebrate Cromwell link"

Author: "Bradford, Bev"
Title: "Away from it all"
description: "Narrates a tramping trip up to the Mueller Hut, starting on the Kea Point Track, conveying the hardships and rewards of the hike."

Author: "Hutchinson, Dan"
Title: "Friends join city woman for 100th birthday"
description: "Friends join city woman for 100th birthday"

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Energetic efforts to help women"
description: "Energetic efforts to help women"

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Adding year to age changed fate"
description: "Adding year to age changed fate"

Title: "True Southland gent loved piping, vintage cars"
description: "True Southland gent loved piping, vintage cars"

Title: "Pamela Hall-Jones : a talented Scot"
description: "Pamela Hall-Jones : a talented Scot"

Author: "Fea, Sue"
Title: "Talented artist's works being snapped up"
description: "Talented artist's works being snapped up"

Author: "Johnston, Cris"
Title: "Wanaka racer zips down hills - and zips up world rankings"
description: "Wanaka racer zips down hills - and zips up world rankings"

Title: "Tributes flow for Outrageous actor"
description: "Tributes flow for Outrageous actor"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The price of knowledge"
description: "Reflects on the wisdom finishing an arts degree just when free tertiary education ended. Talks to the following six successful NZers about choosing to go to university, their degrees and the perceived benefits of higher education: actor Tandi Wright; manager of the Elected Members Liaison Unit at Auckland Transport, Roger Wilson; artist Sara Hughes; writer Finlay MacDonald; head of documentaries, ABC TV Documentaries, Alan Erson; and chef and university lecturer Ray McVinnie."

Author: "Wright, Matthew,"
Title: "Histories without end"
description: "Reviews the two historical books, prefaced by a look at how history writing in NZ has changed to a more revisionist slant."

Title: "A month of reading"
description: "Announces that NZ Book Month will be in March in 2011. Details the nationwide list of events arranged to celebrate authors and reading."

Author: "Cowley, Joy"
Title: "Love child"
description: "Discusses writing books for children. Emphasises the influence of the School Journal and the stipulation declared by Dr Clarence Beeby in 1933. Chronicles the history of the publishing of children's books in NZ, explaining why it reads like a classic fairy tale."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Dress circle"
description: "Consults television presenter Petra Bagust for tips on dressing up for the theatre, on the eve of the art and fringe festivals commencing in Auckland."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Follicle follies"
description: "Interviews the following eight artists, performing in the March 2011 Auckland Fringe Festival, about fringes: Genevieve McClean, Nisha Madhan, Grae Burton, Anders Falstie-Jensen, Alexa Wilson, Zanni Yeah, Gypsy Kauta, and Gus Simonovic."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "No barrier to bliss"
description: "Visits the island in the Hauraki Gulf by ferry and shares three days spent enjoying dolphins, Glenfield sanctuary and other highlights. Provides a fact file on accommodation, transport, and activities."

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Nightcaps service to honour Pike River miner"
description: "Nightcaps service to honour Pike River miner"

Title: "Jury finds Invercargill man guilty of raping 17-year-old"
description: "Jury finds Invercargill man guilty of raping 17-year-old"

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "In the name of justice"
description: "Interviews the founder of the Sensible Sentencing Trust (SST). Talks about the Mohaka River, his new book about speaking up for crime victims, and what prompted him to set up the Trust in 2001. Furnishes his reply to accusations of vigilantism and private financing. Discusses the Trust's database, home invasion policies, and finding a successor for the organisation."

Author: "Ford, Greg"
Title: "How to rebuild sports' heart and soul"
description: "Itemises the sports venues affected by the earthquake, as well as those under threat. Details the case of the Wilding Park tennis courts rebuilt after the Sept 22 2010 earthquake."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Tearful farewell to a southern mate"
description: "Tearful farewell to a southern mate"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "The Clean wins time in studio"
description: "Announces the NZ Music Industry Centre Recording Award won by the Dunedin indie rock band. Details the band lineup, their recordings and their touring history."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Country singer on fast track to fame"
description: "Country singer on fast track to fame"

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Hunt on for new Fonterra chief as Ferrier announces resignation"
description: "Hunt on for new Fonterra chief as Ferrier announces resignation"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Inspired by the incidental"
description: "Talks to Dutch design student Marielle van de Ven about her award and the inspiration for her upcoming collection for the iD Dunedin Fashion Week, April 2011. Ascertains the reasons that Otago Polytechnic offers the scholarship to oversea designers."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Gel deal to benefit university"
description: "Highlights the involvement of the University of Otago in the commercialisation of a gel that heals wounds after sinus surgery. Talks to Emeritus Professor Brian Robinson about the derivatives of the medical gel; the patent purchaser, US-based Medtronic; the team that created the product; and  the impetus for developing the substance."

Title: "Safety lapses led to worker's death on roof, coroner says"
description: "Safety lapses led to worker's death on roof, coroner says"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "All aboard at the boatshed"
description: "Features Dunedin artist Rod Eales at her studio refashioned from an old torpedo boatshed at Deborah Bay. Chats about the shed's history and her main artistic interests. Notes her exhibition spaces and her studio open hours."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Getting under a uniform skin"
description: "Talks to Brussels-based performance artist Kate McIntosh about the dance performance she created for Footnote Dance Company with writer Jo Randerson, which will feature in the Dunedin Fringe Festival. Discusses the dancers' bodysuit costumes, the show's main theme (the human condition), and the acceptance in Europe of the professional artist."

Author: "Body, Ralph"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews  'A-Z of saints', by Frank Gordon, Gallery de Novo, Dunedin, until Mar 10 2011.  Reviews 'Impressions of North Otago', by Russell Cundall, Forrester Gallery, Oamaru, until 6 Mar 2011. Reviews 'Shunga : Japanese erotic prints', Brett McDowell Gallery."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "As good as it gets"
description: "Comments on inevitable emotional outbursts by public figures following the earthquake. Posits homelessness as the major issue facing the Government, recapping the cover provided by most house insurance policies. Describes the process that must be followed before insurance companies can make payouts. Notes the unusual step that the Government may take regarding post-earthquake land restoration. Warns of the difficulty of governmental plans to spur growth while meeting the needs of people in Canterbury."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Hope and despair"
description: "Shares her experience of the earthquake and seeing the destruction of and around her home of 17 years. Visits the CBD and other parts of the city reporting on the sights and smells of post-earthquake Christchurch, including the good and humorous things that are also happening. Relays the issues of rebuilding, unemployment, and the possible lack of doctors to care for crush victims. Looks to the need for a sensible vision for the city for those who are destined to stay there."

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Motorist dies in arms of his wife"
description: "Motorist dies in arms of his wife"

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Mourners remember teen's generous spirit"
description: "Mourners remember teen's generous spirit"

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Past tense"
description: "Discusses the debate on heritage versus safety in NZ, in the wake of buildings crumbling in the Canterbury earthquakes. Indicates how older and more recently built structures fared in the Feb 22 earthquake, including the Pyne Gould building and the ChristChurch Cathedral. Examines the purpose of earthquake strengthening and the requirements of the 2004 Building Act. Notes the safety status of post-earthquake buildings in Napier. Laments the cautiousness of authorities regarding earthquake-prone buildings. Speaks to councillors and heritage experts about the building code strength of structures in Wellington. Notes the number of unreinforced masonry buildings in NZ. Cites heritage specialists regarding the tradeoff between saftey, cost and heritage."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Lessons from Kobe"
description: "Talks to University of British Columbia geography professor David Edgington about his research into reconstruction following the 1995 earthquake in Kobe, Japan, highlighting contrasts with and lessons for Christchurch. Advises of the need for speed and to provide long-term confidence for private sector rebuilding.  [Print exclusive]"

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Grand plans"
description: "Talks to Kevin McCloud, host of the UK television programme Grand Designs, featured on TV3, about the show's slant toward environmental awareness, his property development company Hab, and his interest in low energy structures and resource sharing. Notes the effect of the 2007 financial situation on the programme and its participants. Relays his admiration of the age and design of old buildings in the UK and notes his preference for houses that are built from local materials. Discusses the content of his book 'Kevin McCloud's 43 principles of home : enjoying life in the 21st century. Shares his top six home design tips."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Our bravest"
description: "Talks to members of the Sumner Volunteer Fire Brigade about how they responded to the needs of their community after the devastating earthquake."

Author: "Meng-Yee, Carolyne"
Title: "Strength to lead city in the eye of a storm"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch mayoress about the response of the mayoral couple to the devastating earthquake."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Plans for Nigel"
description: "Interviews the parenting advisor about his role as a spokesperson for sensible behaviour. Discusses punishment, pragmatism, political correctness, and Paul Henry. Solicits his views on smacking children, Sue Bradford, and compares books and television with the press media as means for communication. Asks how he deals with public success and why he is a qualified optimist."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Help from all directions [part 1]; Mayor to hold public meetings"
description: "Focuses on the effects of the earthquake on residents and businesses in the eastern suburbs. Informs that Mayor Bob Parker will address four open-air meeting in various parts of the eastern suburbs, 6 Mar 2011."

Author: "Morgan, Gareth"
Title: "Great southern landing"
description: "Describes a tour of Scott Base and the Dry Valleys, Jan 2011, in anticipation of a 2010 expedition to these locations of scientists and commentators to explore issues facing Antarctica and the southern hemisphere. Comments on the NZ-built wind farm, historic huts and other buildings, differences in US and NZ facilities, and US-NZ cooperation."

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "Strength born of adversity and faith"
description: "Showcases the work being done by four of the front-line staff who are coordinating the relief and recovery operation and preparing the city to move forward after the devastating earthquake. Speaks to Christchurch City Council operations manager Peter McDonald, emergency operations centre manager Murray Sinclair, Christchurch City Council building evaluation manager Steve McCarthy and welfare team member Annette Purvis."

Author: "Knowsley, Jo"
Title: "Inflated to bursting point"
description: "Investigates the rising rate of inflation, which hit its second-highest level in the past 20 years this month. Talks about the results of a survey that measured the average price of 70 basic household items from the Consumer Price and Food price indices. Compares the current rate of inflation to the days of high inflation in the 1980s. Speaks to consumers about the impact of rising food prices on their household finances."

Author: "Mann, Charley"
Title: "Soldiering on in southern suburbs [part 2]"
description: "Visits the Spreydon-Heathcote ward in the southern suburbs. Talks to several residents about how the earthquake affected their homes and businesses. Provides facts about the suburb, including the current situation after the earthquake."

Author: "Chapman, Kate"
Title: "City weighs what should rise out of rubble"
description: "Considers the challenges that lie ahead as the city looks to rebuild after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks to earthquake engineer Richard Sharpe, IRBA Geosciences managing director Ian Brown, conservation architect Ian Bowman and an urban design and planning expert."

Author: "Dye, Stuart"
Title: "Four deaths in hotel suspicious, says father"
description: "Four deaths in hotel suspicious, says father"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "On a mission for marriage"
description: "Highlights the research conducted by Paul Callister and Zoe Lawton (Institute of Policy Studies) into the growth of mail order brides in NZ. Suggests that well-educated NZ women tend to 'marry up', leaving a growing number of unskilled men who struggle to find partners locally. Talks to 'Win a wife' contest winner Greg Morgan about why he is willing to travel to the Ukraine to find a wife. Speaks to a NZ-Thai couple about why NZ men are sought after by Thai women."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Signs of civil unrest"
description: "Concentrates on how grassroots organisations are beginning to make their presence felt in post-earthquake Christchurch. Talks to various community organisers about the potential for a grassroots approach to change the nature of local politics and community decision making."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Going, going ..."
description: "Discusses the background and possible consequences of China's New Hope Group, and specifically its smaller Agria Corporation, taking control of the agricultural services company PGG Wrightson. Background the two Chinese entities and evaluates the Chinese share offer. Conveys concerns over changes in NZ-focused pastoral research. Talks to Grasslanz Technology chief executive John Caradus about loss of intellectual property and the future of NZ seed technology. Questions Agria's intentions for the PGG Wrightson's NZ wool industry holdings. Solicits comment from Federated Farmers on NZ company ownership."

Author: "Moore, Chris"
Title: "Simple steps to heal the mental scars"
description: "Offers advice to assist Cantabrians to recover from the psychological damage of the earthquakes. Seeks comment from Cerina Altenburg, team leader of the General Practice Mental Health Liaison Service, Christchurch."

Author: "Nichol, Ruth"
Title: "The winters of discontent"
description: "Talks to US author Annie Proulx about her memoirs of building her dream home in Bird cloud : a memoir, what she thinks of reviewers, her plans to visit NZ in March 2011, and planned research in Northland kauri forests for her next novel."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Dreams gone in a moment"
description: "Reports on conditions in the area around his home in the city suburb of Beckenham. Describes the loss of two historic churches, both of which had been cordoned off since the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake. Accompanies six-year-old Isla Hindin to view the effects of the earthquake on Beckenham School and other areas of the suburb."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "How to mend a shattered city from the ground up"
description: "Considers some of the factors to be taken into account when planning the reconstruction of Christchurch city, including being cautious about multi-storey buildings. Asserts that the experts need to understand why some areas and structures were harder hit than others. Looks at the issues that will form the basis of expert consideration on Christchurch's future, including siesmic gaps, lifelines, liquefaction and slips. Touches on domestic and commercial building types that fared better during the quake."

Author: "Millen, Julia"
Title: "Nazis 'murdered to the best music'"
description: "Nazis 'murdered to the best music'"

Author: "Holmes, Paul,"
Title: "Interpreter's magic hands speak to thousands"
description: "Praises the directive to have news coverage of the Christchurch earthquake translated into sign language, NZ's third official language. Extols the talents of Jeremy Borland, who has done much of the interpreting during television news items."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Heritage casualties will break many locals' hearts"
description: "Speaks to the owner of City Salvage Contractors, who has lost his historic home (Linwood House, built in 1856) and his business site, at the old Pump House, after the earthquake. Accompanies him on his rounds of the city and in Lyttelton. Talks to Christian Carruthers, owner of a Lyttelton home originally built as a convent for the Sisters of Mercy in 1934, which is now considered unsalvageable."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Tariana Turia"
description: "Talks to the admired minister about her public persona, the media, and dealing with Hone Harawira."

Author: "Davy, Ray"
Title: "One size doesn't fit all"
description: "Asserts that people who do not wish to remain in the city after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake should have the option to do so. Comments on the challenges of rebuilding homes and remediating property and the policy approach that Government, the Christchurch City Council and the Earthquake Commission (EQC) should be taking to address these challenges."

Author: "Morey, Kelly Ana,"
Title: "From under the overcoat [over coat]"
description: "From under the overcoat [over coat]"

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Getting back to business"
description: "Reports on the flight of business enterprises to the fringes of the city and to the suburbs after the earthquake damaged much of the central business district on 22 Feb 2011. Describes the challenges they face to keep their businesses running, and talks to several business executives about their current situation and plans."

Author: "McDonald, Barney"
Title: "Tall order"
description: "Talks to the 'Go girls' actor about his career and his role in the new film 'My wedding and other secrets'."

Author: "Lusk, Jon"
Title: "Run that vodou down"
description: "Previews the acts playing the Womad festival, Brooklands Park, New Plymouth, 18-20 Mar 2011, specifically talking to the founder and artistic director of the Creole Choir of Cuba, Emilia DiÃÅaz ChaÃÅvez.  Previews other names, including NZ's Maisey Rika, Lawrence Arabia, Carolina Moon, Will Crummer, the Topp Twins, and the Patea Maori Club."

Author: "Yeoman, Paula"
Title: "Full deck of moods"
description: "Talks to the Black Seeds musician about his debut solo album."

Author: "Van den Bergh, Roeland"
Title: "All Kiwis counting the cost of quake with bigger premiums"
description: "Focuses on the role of insurance companies in rebuilding the commercial heart of the city and its residential suburbs after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Seeks comment from Chris Ryan, chief executive of the Insurance Council, and others. Provides facts about the role and functions of the commission."

Author: "Sandys, Elspeth"
Title: "A spoof too far"
description: "Reviews the stage play adapted from the Graeme Greene novel by Clive Francis and directed by Ross Jolly,  Circa One, Wellington, until 26 Mar 2011."

Author: "Stewart, Tamlyn"
Title: "Retailers regroup to open doors and resume trading"
description: "Reports on the situation of nine large retailers after the devastating Feb earthquake damaged much of the central business district."

Author: "Sandys, Elspeth"
Title: "Our Man in Havana"
description: "Reviews the stage play adapted from the Graeme Greene novel by Clive Francis and directed by Ross Jolly,  Circa One, Wellington, until 26 Mar 2011."

Author: "White, Helen Watson"
Title: "Guided tour of sex"
description: "Reviews the Patrick Barlow play directed by Lisa Warrington at Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, until 12 Mar 2011. [Print exclusive]"

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Comeback shows reveal eccentric vision"
description: "Reviews two art exhibitions at Auckland galleries: 'Diodic', by Nick Wall, at Warwick Henderson Gallery in Parnell; and 'That's life' by Mike Morgan at Pierre Peeters Gallery, Parnell."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Toy boy"
description: "Reviews the NZ Royal Ballet performances of Pinocchio and Verdi Variations, which constitute their six-week nationwide Tutus on Tour programme showing until 3 April 2011."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "Elite along for the ride at Kona event"
description: "Highlights the Coromandel's Kona Colville Connection mountain bike race, celebrating its 10th year and with some top national riders competing, including Karen Hanlen and Carl Jones."

Author: "Newman, Liz"
Author (detailed): "/ as told to Liz Newman [and others]"
Title: "Kids' quake"
description: "Interviews six-year-old twins Grace Newman and Thomas Newman, sisters Lauren Sargent and Anna Sargent and brothers Timothy Cornell and Benjamin Cornell about their experiences of the earthquake, which struck while all were at school."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "With a little help from our friends"
description: "Focuses on the residents of the eastern suburbs of Christchurch and what they are doing to help each other and the help that has arrived to improve their living conditions after the Christchurch February earthquake amongst which are lack of electricity, water, toilets and the problems associated with flooding and liquefaction."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Different strokes"
description: "Summarises the use of conventional and complementary medicine in NZ. Announces the launch of HealthSearch, a website with a single directory that informs Otago residents of conventional or alternative healthcare practitioners. Details the site's origins, quality control, and practitioner profiles. Talks to Dr Monika Clark-Grill of Otago University about the healthcare tool. Notes the Governmental appointment three years ago of a chief adviser on integrative care, Dr David St George."

Author: "Carr, Rose"
Title: "Start me up"
description: "Explains the link between 'breaking the fast' and body weight, diet quality and brain function. Discusses the role of metabolic rates, the circadian rhythm, and the importance of the nutrient composition of breakfast."

Author: "Hembry, Owen"
Title: "Rebuilding Brand NZ; Urgent task to rebuild Brand NZ"
description: "Reports on the stress felt by the tourism industryas it tries to combat the inevitable negative effects of the Christchurch earthquake on tourism in NZ in the short term."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "All hands to the pumps"
description: "Recounts his experience of unexpectedly assisting the Diamond Harbour Volunteer Fire Brigade by manning its station switchboard after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake."

Author: "Croot, James"
Title: "Remembering CTV"
description: "Pays tribute to the staff of the regional television station whose offices were destroyed in the earthquake, resulting in deaths of many of its staff including the ebullient producer and presenter. Recalls their last meeting on the day of the earthquake."

Author: "Gorman, Paul,"
Title: "Far from home"
description: "Describes his horror of being in London when the earthquake struck the city."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Light years away"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-raised musician about being apart from the Christchurch-based members of his family on the day of the earthquake. Discusses the process of making his new album, to be released at the Homegrown music festival, Wellington, 5 Mar 2011."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "The clear necessities of life"
description: "Offers advice for coping at home in post-quake Christchurch, where potable water is scarce and toilets may be located outdoors."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Keep our kereru, keep our forests"
description: "Explains how keeping and maintaining the kereru population helps to regenerate NZ native forest.  'Kereru are one of the only surviving mainland native species able to swallow the fruit of some of the key forest trees, including miro, tawa, rimu and matai'. Relates that some seeds need to pass through the gut of the kereru to germinate, meaning the health of the forests is dependent on the birds. Reports Monica Awasthy is in the final stages of completing her postgraduate degree at Victoria University, which has involved an extensive monitoring programme of kereru in Wellington. Indicates the next part of the project is to get people to plant kereru friendly food like kowhai and other fruit trees and controlling cats and dogs."

Title: "Statesman dogged by controversy"
description: "Statesman dogged by controversy"

Author: "Lovell-Smith, Mary"
Title: "A green city wish"
description: "Presents her impressions of the city and its gardens after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Expresses hope that the city will become the finest eco-city in the world and that its title of 'garden city' will be truly warranted."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Heartland constable was a man for all seasons"
description: "Heartland constable was a man for all seasons"

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Power of the picture"
description: "Comments on domestic and overseas television news coverage of the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake."

Author: "Shennan, Jennifer"
Title: "Lithe and lovely dancer key player in country's ballet history"
description: "Lithe and lovely dancer key player in country's ballet history"

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Where there's a will..."
description: "Talks to three NZers who have had the determination to make their dreams come true: Doron Hickey, who is set on helping people with inherited eye disease; Helen Dorresteyn, who farms buffalo to make mozzarella; and Alan Hopping, who converted his Whitianga holiday park and former schoolhouse into The Lost Springs Thermal Pool and Day Spa. Outlines some of the key factors that go towards achievng success."

Title: "Family pays tribute to boy who missed birthday"
description: "Family pays tribute to boy who missed birthday"

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "Locals step up in the hour of need"
description: "Locals step up in the hour of need"

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Cleaning up New York"
description: "Talks to the Clean's drummer, now resident in New York for some 20 years, about his life in the Big Apple and how he remains true to NZ."

Author: "Murphy, Janice"
Title: "Japanese flower power; About ikebana"
description: "Talks to Charlotte Morris, director of the Dunedin branch of the Sogetsu Teacher Association, about ikebana, the Japanese art of flower arranging. Provides information about the traditional art and where classes are held in Dunedin."

Author: "Pepperell, Susan"
Title: "A community discovers true grit"
description: "Reports on the progress that Kaiapoi had been making since the 4 September 2010 earthquake, soliciting residents' reactions to their situation. Summarises the number of premises marked for demolition, including the fate of the 139-year-old Smith & Caughey department store. Details the work of the Waimakariri District Council, including the setting up of  The Hub, housing all those responsible for the rebuilding process."

Author: "McCammon, Belinda"
Title: "Mum's faith guided me to finish line"
description: "Mum's faith guided me to finish line"

Author: "Hill, David"
Title: "Legend and poem mingle; Evolving well-connected tales; Fossicking in the past"
description: "Legend and poem mingle; Evolving well-connected tales; Fossicking in the past"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Home will never be home again; Homes away from home"
description: "Looks at some people who have moved to another location outside Christchurch after experiencing the second earthquake in February 2011 and have decided not to return to Christchurch to live. Gauges the effect of this move, whether permanent or temporary on South Island towns who are accommodating the influx of people. Notes the short term influx of people is stretching housing, education, health and welfare services."

Author: "Bearup, Greg"
Title: "Uneasy rider"
description: "Describes a mountain bike trip in the Dunstan Ranges guided by Fat Tyre's Greg McIntyre, relaying humorously his experience of cycling out of his comfort zone. Describes six other suggestions for extreme holiday activities in NZ: Tongariro crossing, Black water rafting, TECT All Terrain Park, the North West Circuit, snowkiteing at Queenstown, and ice climbing at Franz Josef Glacier."

Title: "Bernard Beckett"
description: "Interviews the author of young adult fiction about his latest book for adults."

Author: "Stock, Rob"
Title: "Whey to go"
description: "Tests his cheesemaking skills guided by Shannon O'Dowda of iMake, which sells cheesemaking kits. Describes the resulting mozzarella and haloumi. Backgrounds iMake and its origins in home brewing. Summarises the cheesemaking kits and supplies available. Sets out the basic steps of making cheese."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "Master of informality"
description: "Interviews the TV chef and cookbook author. Describes his home and unadorned test kitchen in Lyall Bay and savours a plate of homemade warehou fish cakes. Conveys the cook's informal style, the revelation of his birth parents, and the moment of his cooking epiphany. Chronicles his culinary career, his partnership with Steve Logan, and the plans for a new restaurant, Depot, in Auckland."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "When nine lives collide"
description: "Describes the experience of nine overseas backpackers during and after the 22 Feb earthquake and the offer of Aucklander Alix Whittaker to provide the visitors a home in her housebus."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Influx of earthquakes refugees tests Timaru's resources"
description: "Reports that Timaru's population has swelled by 20%, from 27,000 to 33,000 with a flood of 6,000 Christchurch residents getting out of their shaken city. Questions how long will these people stay indicating it makes it difficult to plan in terms of school rolls, housing/accommodation and infrastructure."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Shockwaves will roll on"
description: "Examines the gamut of emotional, behavioural, physical and cognitive responses to emergency situations such as the 22 February earthquake, including the author's own experience as an Aucklander and ex-Christchurch resident. Provides advice from Auckland University associate professor of clinical psychology Ian Lambie."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Quake rebuilding costs a big stretch in tough times"
description: "Considers how NZ will pay for the reconstruction of Christchurch when the estimated cost is $20 billion, particularly in hard financial times. Looks at forecasts from NZIER (New Zealand Institute of Economic Research) which indicate 'virtually no economic growth' and the closing of NZers wallets' to reduce debt. Forecasts higher costs for individuals and businesses along with a spike in unemployment. Notes in the short term there will be an injection of cash into the economy with money being released by EQC (Earthquake Commission) and overseas insurers along with an expected cut in the OCR (official cash rate) by 25 basis points. Includes an outline of where the author thinks the money is coming from and who is paying."

Author: "Chapman, Kate"
Title: "The rebuild : getting it right"
description: "Examines the issue of whether to turn Christchurch CBD into a flat, structureless green park and the businesses moved elsewhere. Notes in the last 200 years or so it has been rare for central governments to let their cities die. Discusses factors such as building practices, rebuilding of heritage buildings, stability of the ground and the materials that will be used if the decision is to reconstruct Christchurch. Includes the evolution of building standards."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Rebels with a cause"
description: "Notifies of the Rebels Motorcycle Club of Australia entering NZ and the switching (patching over) to the Club of members from other clubs. Inquires into the Club's history of criminal activity and involvement in the methamphetamine business. Notes police concerns, and relays counterclaims over the gang's international standing by Arthur Veno, professor of psychology at Victoria University in Australia. Looks at the efficacy of legislating against gangs. Profiles Tribesman northern executive Jay Hepi and Rebels boss Alex Vella, and talks to Tribesman Peter Hunt of southern Bay of Plenty about 'patching over'."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "The invisible stars of MasterChef"
description: "Goes behind the scenes of the television cooking show, talking to the people who coordinate, manage, direct and produce the show. Asks them about their work experience, favourite foods and favourite restaurants."

Author: "Van den Bergh, Roeland"
Title: "Quake set to hit premiums; Scale of destruction means many will suffer because of long rebuild time"
description: "Examines the issue of insurance and earthquakes and the financial consequences for insurance companies and their reinsurers that have arisen as a result of the two catastrophic earthquakes that have severely damaged Christchurch and parts of Canterbury. Notes Chris Ryan (Insurance Council chief executive) is of the view that because reinsurance makes up a large part of insurance companies' costs he expects the increases in reinsurance prices will be passed on to customers through higher premiums. Notes the issue of people and corporations who are under insured and the consequences of having to wait a long time for houses and business premises to be rebuilt."

Author: "Ninness, Greg"
Title: "Auckland's quake fix go-slow"
description: "Examines the safety of Auckland buildings in the wake of the recent earthquake in Christchurch. Notifies of delays in risk assessment due to the super city amalgamation. Outlines the city's Earthquake Prone Buildings Policy. Compares the differing building policies of councils depending on the earthquake risk of the area they control. Notes the number of buildings considered by Auckland City Council to be at risk."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "In her father's den"
description: "Reports Olivia McLeavey has become the manager of her father's Peter McLeavey's Cuba Street Art Gallery. Explains Peter McLeavey's view of his Gallery. Olivia recounts being surrounded by art and artists in her childhood and eventually travelling overseas, working in various positions (marketing dept. of a publisher of romance novels, selling advertising for glossy magazines, working part-time in an art gallery)."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Philanthropist taking art to children"
description: "Talks to the former glasscast artist and art philanthropist who formed the Real Art Road Show Charitable Trust to share her art works with schools throughout NZ."

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "A feather in his cap"
description: "Talks to the Queenstown-born man who became an internationally sought-after fashion designer and master milliner. Informs of his double retrospective exhibition 'Lindsay Kennett : A life in art and fashion', Lakes District Museum and Gallery, Queenstown, until 18 Apr 2011, featuring his fashion illustrations and hat collection. Overviews his career."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Girl meets boy"
description: "Chats to the Auckland film-maker about  her romantic comedy film premiering on 17 March 2011, her documentaries on stereotypes of Asian women, cross-cultural relationships, and the cultural values of her Hong Kong parents. Discusses childrearing and the reason her next film might be about life after life."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Honey, I shrunk the yard"
description: "Notes the decline of the large section that homes were built on in the past. Reflects that houses sold now with large sections are often subdivided with another house or houses being built on the vacant land. Indicates more modern suburbs are becoming 'compacted'. Comments that some councils are promoting 'medium density housing' (dwellings that are not quite apartments, but not quite stand-alone houses). Proffers the possible social consequences of this type of suburban development. Questions the quality of some of the development, that is out of character with the suburb and the need for space to park the car means less space for greenery and trees. Highlights Johnsonville (north of Wellington) as an example where there is a 'battle of the backyard'. Relates some of the social aspects to having a large backyard where children were able to play and laments the taking away of this choice."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "For crying out loud"
description: "Recounts the author's experience of mountain biking on the trail in Eskdale Park. Gives instructions on how to get there, what to bring and who to contact."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Short-term forecast for much more cloud"
description: "Sums up a recent presentation on cloud computing by Microsoft New Zealand general manager Paul Muckleston, given to a Cloud Summit, Auckland. Focuses on the slow uptake of cloud computing in NZ, which is likely to change when the Government switches to cloud storage in Sep 2011. Includes comments from Gartner principal analyst Errol Rasit to the summit."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Second time around; How it was"
description: "Examines plans to turn the former Dunedin chief post office into a hotel. Informs that similar proposals have been floated for the past 17 years. Talks to associates of the current owner about whether this latest proposal is likely to come to fruition. Describes his refurbishment of the Distinction Luxmore Hotel, Te Anau, and other hotels he owns. Includes a timeline of transactions since NZ Post first sold the property on 4 Jul 1995, and a series of photos of the interior of the former post office, taken in 1997."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Cavalcade keeps them coming"
description: "Accompanies some of the riders along the Tussock Creek light wagon trail as part of the Otago Goldfields Heritage Trust annual cavalcade. Talks to long-time trail boss Chris Bayne and other riders about their experiences. Informs that the cavalcade arrives today for the finale at the Oamaru Racecourse."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "All hands to the pump"
description: "Chronicles the circumstances leading to the founding of the Dunedin Fire Brigade, now celebrating 150 years of existence under various names. Talks to brigade historian John Ingram, co-author of the book on the brigade, about the need for its services given that 90% of Dunedin buildings were constructed of wood or canvas. Describes the role of the 'Otago Daily Times', also founded in 1861, in re-establishing the brigade in 1862. Includes a list of significant dates in the history of fire brigades in the city."

Author: "James, Bryan"
Title: "Room for opinion in a divided house"
description: "Room for opinion in a divided house"

Title: "Playing part in ecological planning"
description: "Interviews the Central South Island Fish and Game resource officer about the nature of her job."

Author: "Head, Warren"
Title: "Disaster strikes at recovery"
description: "Assesses the current economic situation, given the likelihood of a 'double-dip' recession, the Pike River Mine and Christchurch earthquakes disasters and other economic factors. Seeks comment from several economists and economic analysts about whether the economy is improving or getting worse."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "The bumpy road to recovery"
description: "Focuses on the volatile state of the economy, characterised by persistent high employment figures and the loss of NZers to Australia. Cites comments from Minister of Finance Bill English about initiatives to create jobs and cut government spending."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Company costs targeted"
description: "Explains the provisions of the Bill, currently before the Commerce Select Committee, an omnibus measure aimed at reducing compliance costs for businesses. Mentions a change to the Films, Videos and Publications Classification Act 1993 to modernise labelling requirements. Touches on the status of two other Bills."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "Get going on marketing"
description: "Explains the importance of marketing your small business, and how to maximise value for money by developing a marketing strategy and plan."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Look on the bright side!"
description: "Comments on the possible implications for the NZ wine industry of a potentially large grape harvest in 2011. Discusses lessons that can be learned from overseas markets, including the recovery of the Champagne sector after a bumper crop triggered a 'crisis' in 2009."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Property vehicles tout benefits"
description: "Assesses current conditions in the residential property market. Seeks comment from BNZ chief economist Tony Alexander and investment adviser Martin Hawes, who hold contrasting views over prospects for recovery from the historically low sales figures. Reports on investor briefings by the Kiwi Income Property Trust (KIPT) to promote the benefits of investing in properties listed on the NZ stock exchange. Talks to AMP NZ Office Trust (ANZO) new chief executive Scott Pritchard and Goldman Sachs analyst Buffy Gill about the ANZO interim profit results. Overviews the financial results of industrial investments by GPT and Property for Industry."

Author: "Hincey, Luke"
Title: "2011 : a spatial odyssey"
description: "Overviews the Auckland Spatial Plan, currently in its early developmental stages, which will govern planning and resource management decisions in the 'super city' over the next several decades. Urges the business sector to engage in the process as soon as possible. Describes the rationale for the plan and cites a report listing some of what it is meant to achieve. Comments on the plan from a legal perspective. Gives a proposed timeline for implementation."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Earthquake law - the debate continues; Earthquake update"
description: "Comments further on the current law being used to deal with the effects of the earthquake on 4 Sep 2010. Cites concern expressed by the Auckland District Law Society and other lawyers that the powers granted in the Act (CERRA) go further than any previous legislation, including the Public Safety Conservation Act 1932. Includes an update noting that this column was written before the more destructive earthquake of 22 Feb 2011."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Symposium honours work of Prof Skegg"
description: "Reports on a symposium honouring the former head of the University of Otago Dept of Preventive and Social Medicine, which is also celebrating its 125th anniversary. Recalls his decision to become an epidemiologist and shares memories of heading the dept from 1980-2004, when he became the University's vice-chancellor."

Author: "Eagles, Jim"
Title: "Bird-lover's delight"
description: "Reports on his visit to the Tiritiri Matangi bird sanctuary, developed largely by volunteers from farmland over the course of 25 years. Talks to volunteer guide Donald Snook about some of its attractions."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Two-way TV for youth"
description: "Reports on the soon-to-be-launched channel U, a digital channel run by Television New Zealand on Freeview, aimed at the 15 to 24-year-old market. Seeks comment from TVNZ head of digital media Eric Kearley."

Author: "Miller, Grant"
Title: "Bill's wheels keep on turning..."
description: "Bill's wheels keep on turning..."

Author: "Galloway, Jill"
Title: "New president steps into breach"
description: "New president steps into breach"

Author: "Matthews, Lee"
Title: "City identity drew community together"
description: "City identity drew community together"

Author: "Ireland, Kieran"
Author (detailed): "Kieran Ireland, Alex Lister and Brooke Roberts"
Title: "[Secondary scene : East Otago High School]; Martinborough moods a feast for the senses; Christchurch casualties not forgotten; A dark day"
description: "Features creative writing and art from four East Otago High School pupils, including observations of a visit to Martinborough, a report and a poem on the Christchurch earthquake, and artwork by Sarah Law about her holiday from Dunback to Wellington in early 2010."

Author: "Vass, Beck"
Title: "Running on empty; Price hikes will fuel customer ire; What a weekend costs you in petrol"
description: "Talks to Sree Swami, an insurance administrator, Noel Rielly, an Auckland bus driver, and economist Shamubeel Eaqub, about how soaring petrol prices are affecting their households and the warning that worse is to come. Looks at how the overall tax take on petrol will decline as customers try to conserve fuel or switch to public transport. Gives four examples of what a weekend trip away cost last year and today."

Author: "Gilbert, Jo"
Title: "Top scholar in just about everything"
description: "Top scholar in just about everything"

Author: "Lynch, Keith"
Title: "Guards foretold danger killer posed; "A piece of my heart lies with Vanessa'; Devoted mother's life meets violent end; Killer's history of crime"
description: "Guards foretold danger killer posed; "A piece of my heart lies with Vanessa'; Devoted mother's life meets violent end; Killer's history of crime"

Author: "Brown, Giles"
Title: "Killed teen's father bears no malice"
description: "Killed teen's father bears no malice"

Title: "Family and friends gather to farewell Doris Mackintosh : 109-year-old dies"
description: "Family and friends gather to farewell Doris Mackintosh : 109-year-old dies"

Title: "'Low-life' sent to jail for attack on 87-year-old"
description: "'Low-life' sent to jail for attack on 87-year-old"

Author: "Lynch, Keith"
Title: "Extradited fraudster sent to jail"
description: "Extradited fraudster sent to jail"

Author: "Orsman, Bernard"
Title: "A monumental gift of history for Gulf's future; The island of second chances"
description: "Highlights the generous offering of Rotoroa Island to the people of Auckland by Neal and Annette Plowman. Talks to trustee and project director John Gow about the development of the island from a Salvation Army drug and alcohol recovery centre to a public recreation area including an artists in residency programme. Includes public transport options to and from the island. Looks at the history of the island as a "certified inebriates home". Talks to a long-term resident and former patient of the center who now works as a handyman on the island."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Dressed for success"
description: "Showcases the national 'Tutus on Tour' featuring a double bill of 'Verdi variations' and 'Pinocchio', Royal New Zealand Ballet, various locations in the lower South Island, Mar 2011. Talks to production manager Drew Lees and wardrobe manager Andrew Pfeiffer about aspects of the production. Discusses renovations currently under way at the Regent Theatre, Dunedin, and the production of 'The Sleeping beauty' to be staged there at the end of 2011."

Author: "Young, Audrey"
Title: "Man of the people"
description: "Profiles the next Governor-General by talking to some of the people and officials who have known him over the years. Includes biographical information."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Suspensions' by Manu Berry and Peter Gregory, Manu Berry Gallery, Dunedin, until 16 Mar 2011.  Reviews 'Various distances apart' by Garry Currin, Milford Galleries Dunedin, 12-30 Mar 2011.  Reviews 'On location' by Christine Thacker, Milford Galleries Dunedin, 12-30 Mar 2011."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Chris Liddell"
description: "Talks to the departing chief financial officer of General Motors."

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "I cannot tell a lie - RNZB's Pinocchio is a dazzling joy"
description: "Reviews the Royal NZ Ballet performance of Pinocchio, a feature of the biannual nationwide Tutus on Tour, Bruce Mason Centre, Auckland, until 12 Mar 2011, highlighting the costuming by Toby Behan."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Vein of grotesque runs in festival offerings"
description: "Reviews four art exhibitions at Auckland galleries: Methusalem by Francis Upritchard at Ivan Anthony, Karangahape Road; NUDS by Sarah Lucas at Two Rooms in Newton; Pakeha by Liam Barr at John Leech Gallery, cnr Kitchener and Wellesley Streets; and Danse by Niki Hastings-Field at Artstation in Ponsonby."

Title: "Right to express opinion upheld"
description: "Presents the Press Council's rejection of a complaint from former Feltex director Peter Thomas about a column by Brian Gaynor in the NZ Herald 7 August 2010, relating to lack of accuracy, fairness and balance. Sets out the complaint, the newspaper's response, and the subsequent discussion and decision."

Author: "Hembry, Owen"
Title: "One Kiwi replaces another at GM"
description: "Announces the replacement of NZer Chris Liddell as finance chief at the US General Motors car company by the expatriate former University of Waikato graduate. Overviews his career since graduation."

Author: "Pickmere, Arnold,"
Title: "Ahead of his time on environment"
description: "Ahead of his time on environment"

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Whatever happened to ..."
description: "Follows up on the lives of nine fellow contestants from the final of the It's Academic 1981 television programme that tested the knowledge of NZ high school students from Onslow College, St Paul's High School and Otahuhu College."

Author: "Reid, Graham,"
Title: "The shape of things to come"
description: "Interviews the young adult fiction author. Discusses the writing process, the dystopian themes of his novels Genesis and August, and his upcoming book, Lullaby."

Author: "Francis, Clio"
Title: "Into the breach"
description: "Profiles six people who have key roles in the aftermath of the earthquake. Talks to the coroner, the chief executive of energy company Orion NZ Ltd, the NZ Police Superintendent and night commander, the director of special operations for the Fire Service, the Civil Defence national controller and the Labour MP for Christchurch Central."

Author: "Coleman, Ewen"
Title: "Messed up family's powerful portrayal painful to watch"
description: "Reviews the play 'The idea of America', written and directed by Sam Shore for the Good Company, being performed at Bats Theatre (until 19 March)."

Author: "Francis, Clio"
Title: "Broad shoulders to carry city forward"
description: "Profiles six people who have key roles in the aftermath of the earthquake. Talks to the coroner, the chief executive of energy company Orion NZ Ltd, the NZ Police Superintendent and night commander, the director of special operations for the Fire Service, the Civil Defence national controller and the Labour MP for Christchurch Central."

Author: "Sachdeva, Sam"
Title: "Haven busy with influx from devastated areas [part 3]"
description: "Visits the Riccarton-Wigram ward in the western suburbs, which sustained only minor damage after the earthquake. Talks to several residents about their fortunate situation, how they are opening their homes to an influx of earthquake refugees, and effects on businesses. Provides facts about the suburb."

Author: "Burgess, Dave"
Title: "Shuddering in Wellington; The Cuba St Quarter"
description: "Focuses on the concern surrounding the city's earthquake-prone buildings in light of the deadly 22 February 2011 Christchurch Earthquake. Talks to Wellington Mayor Celia Wade-Brown about the restrengthening timeframes for the city's earthquake-prone buildings. Looks at what makes a building earthquake-prone and what buildings are required to withstand. Presents a map of the earthquake-prone buildings in the Cuba Street area."

Author: "Todd, Rebecca"
Title: "Health service ready to help mentally scarred"
description: "Reports that health professionals in the region are preparing for an influx of people who will need help to cope with the trauma of the earthquakes. Seeks comment from Prof Mark Creamer, director of the Australian Centre for Post-Traumatic Mental Health, about the range of responses people have to disastrous events, and the importance of having fun to improve wellbeing. Cites remarks from Canterbury District Health Board chief of psychiatry Sue Nightingale. Talks to some people who survived the earthquake about how they are faring. Speaks to pharmacist Don Sache about the increase in demand for tranquillisers or sleeping pills."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "A country of living dangerously"
description: "Talks to GNS vulcanologist Graham Leonard, GNS seismologist Mark Stirling, and Niwa meteorologist Mike Revell about where to live in NZ without being at risk of a flood, cyclone, earthquake, tsunami or volcanic eruption."

Author: "Krause, Nick"
Title: "Jailbirds cooped up at home"
description: "Looks at whether home detention is a soft option for offenders. Explains how the community-based sentence works. Talks to an unnamed businessman, who was sentenced to one year of home detention in 2009 for tax evasion, about his home detention experience."

Author: "Plummer, Matthew"
Title: "A building weakened by red tape"
description: "Talks to the owner of the Octagon Live restaurant, a H1 heritage building that was badly damaged in both the Sep 2010 and Feb 2011 earthquakes. Recounts purchasing the former Trinity Congregational Church and renovating it over a 13-year period before opening the restaurant in 2006. Explains why he considers that the stance taken by the Historic Places Trust contributed to the damage or destruction of many heritage buildings. Advocates for a radical new approach to saving historic buildings."

Author: "Robson, Toby"
Title: "Fitter, faster and getting smarter"
description: "Speaks to Steve Symonds, the Hurricanes' professional development manager, about helping players prepare for life after rugby."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Designs on art"
description: "Talks to the prop and model designer from Izzat Design about his varied career. Mentions that he is the son of renowned artist John Drawbridge and sculptor Tanya Ashken."

Author: "Gorman, Paul,"
Title: "What's next?; Ring predictions play on fears"
description: "Asks earthquake experts for their assessment of whether a third big earthquake is likely, particularly given the existence of a previously hidden fault that ruptured on 26 Dec 2010, causing a magnitude 4.9 earthquake that caused significant damage to or weakening of buildings in the central business district. Notes the ethical and political difficulties for scientists in determining what information to impart and when. Talks to GNS Science natural hazards manager Dr Kelvin Berryman, visiting Pennsylvania State University geologist Prof Kevin Furlong and University of Canterbury geological sciences Prof Jarg Pettinga. Cites comment from Christchurch Mayor Bob Parker about the need for a thorough survey of geological hazards before considering a multibillion-dollar rebuild. Asks some of these people to comment on the prediction by Auckland weather forecaster Ken Ring of another major earthquake in the region on 20 Mar 2011."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Sharing and caring"
description: "Investigates concerns surrounding the trend towards separated parents sharing the custody of their children, increasingly striking 50-50, week-about arrangements. Speaks to Auckland barrister Alex Ashmore, Chief Family Court Judge Peter Boshier and psychologist Glen Stenhouse about their views on the issue. Talks to two Auckland sisters, Camille and Isabella Jameson, about their experience of shared custody, which has seen them move between their parents' homes every Friday."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Family ties face strain"
description: "Spends time with three families whose lives have been disrupted by the earthquake, but who are learning to cope. Describes how they are banding together to support extended family and friends, and dealing with damaged homes, the exodus of family members to other parts of NZ and Australia, lack of basic services and funds, and frayed nerves."

Author: "De Bueger, John"
Title: "Lessons of hindsight in rebuild"
description: "Comments on the lessons that should be learned in rebuilding the central business district (CBD) of the city following the latest large earthquake on 22 Feb 2011. Recalls a reprint of an old colonial drawing showing the  landscape of the Canterbury Plains in the early 1850s, depicting low-lying swampland that later became the CBD. Notes that the areas worst affected by the earthquake are located in these old marshes. Offers advice to town planners in the city. Cautions that Hamilton and Whanganui also have similar landscapes so building codes should be updated."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Oh, Futuna"
description: "Reflects on the neglect and abuse of Futuna, the city's former Catholic retreat in Karori, as it celebrates its 50th anniversary. Speaks to Brother Joseph Kelly, one of six priests who built the John Scott designed building which has been described as one of NZ's greatest pieces of 20th century architecture, about the building project."

Author: "Wood, Andrew Paul,"
Title: "Restore city heart with cathedral"
description: "Advocates the reconstruction of the cathedral, which is not only the iconic symbol and heart of the city but a priceless taonga. Backgrounds its design and construction beginning in 1864. Informs of past earthquake damage in the 19th century and in 1901. Describes three comparable cathedral reconstruction projects in England and Germany."

Author: "Frances, Helen"
Title: "What dreams may come"
description: "Talks to Susan Krumdieck, Associate Professor of mechanical engineering at Canterbury University, about her thoughts on the reconstruction of a new, viable Christchurch."

Author: "Williamson, Cameron"
Title: "I knocked it off"
description: "Describes climbing Mount Egmont/Taranaki."

Title: "Liddell quits as CFO of GM"
description: "Speaks to the Matamata-born engineer who has led global finance operations at General Motors, Detroit since Jan 2010. Asks about his future employment plans when he leaves his current position on 1 Apr 2011. Overviews his career and management style."

Author: "Stewart, Tamlyn"
Title: "Tech firm brushes off quake"
description: "Showcases the visual-simulation specialist firm that is continuing to hire staff despite having to abandon its leased premises in the cordoned-off section of the central business district after the 22 Sep 2011 earthquake. Talks to company founder Sam Chaffey about its business activities in NZ and overseas."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Businesses conquer the chaos"
description: "Talks to several business in the eastern suburbs of the city that are in the early stages of recovery after the big earthquake on 22 Feb 2011. Features the laser technology and engineering business. Seeks comment from staff at B&D Doors, Red Furniture, Switch Espresso and Burwood Bakery."

Author: "Gadd, David"
Title: "Jo flees NZ quake for ordeal in Japan"
description: "Jo flees NZ quake for ordeal in Japan"

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Forgotten people are forgotten again"
description: "Follows the plight of Bexley residents in Seabreeze Close since September, the time of the first major earthquake to hit Christchurch. Reports they continue to live like refugees in ruined homes a full five months after the Canterbury earthquake liquified their street. Stresses the growing anger at the lack of action over thier plight."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Royal envoy relic of colonialism"
description: "Comments on the recent selection of Lieutenant General Jerry Mateparae, a former military chief, as NZs governor-general designate and looks at the way the governor-general is selected to the position. Raises questions about protocol associated with the position of governor-general, and the seemingly growing importance of the position in promoting NZs position in the world."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Christchurch 2016; Beginner's guide to rebuilding; Welcome to our Christchurch; Voices from abroad"
description: "Looks at how Christchurch city is going to rebuild and recounts what happen in the case of Napier after the 1931 earthquake flattened the city. Notes the debate about the realities of knocking down buildings, whether repair is possible for some heritage buildings is growing and a decision about whether to build high or low also has to be made. Features comment from Norman Foster (British architect), Hank Dittmar (chief executive of Prince Charles's conservation minded Foundation for the Built Environment) and Simon Jenkins (UK journalist). Includes interviews of ten prominent NZers who give a wide range of personal views about what shape the city of Christchurch should take."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Take this tablet"
description: "Investigates claims about the health benefits of a daily dose of aspirin. Looks at research and discussion from experts on the pros and cons of aspirin, including its use in lowering the risks of heart attack and stroke, and its role in reducing death rates from cancer, specifically adenocarcinomas (colon, pancreas, some lung cancers). Records discussion on the precautionary effects of aspirin as a daily prescription, including the Cancer Society's position. Traces the history of aspirin, including its use in dealing with heart attacks and as a cancer preventative."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Hyper reality"
description: "Advises ADHD (attention deficit hyperactive disorder) is typically seen as a children's disorder but asks the question what is it like for adults living with ADHD. Takes the example of Alex who was only diagnosed as having ADHD when he was 42 years old. Notes the 2001 report published by the Ministry of Health on the assessment and treatment of ADHD that lists certain criteria in order for a diagnosis to be made. Includes a fact file with a reference and link for more information."

Author: "Manhire, Toby"
Title: "You say you want a revolution"
description: "Interviews Pakistani-born historian, author and commentator Tariq Ali, in NZ during Mar 2011 to lecture at the University of Auckland. Backgrounds Ali, including his move to the UK as a student and prominance in the Left there. Discusses the string of Middle Eastern democratic uprisings (Tunisia, Egypt, Libya), their parallels in European history and their relevance to the current situation in Europe and the USA. Records his criticism of Barack Obama as a continuation of the George W. Bush Presidency, and comments on the Commonwealth, Australia and NZ. Notes Ali's ties to John Lennon and other pop figures."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "What I do"
