description: "Talks to fish filleter, Dave Hancox of Nelson, about his work with fish mentioning ways the company tries to improve production and a certain mental approach that is required."

Author: "Wallace, Danny"
Title: "Travel by Tweet"
description: "Outlines the story of an English journalist who took a tour of NZ guided only by Twitter."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Sarah Billinghurst"
description: "Interviews an expatriate Kiwi, now assistant manager, artistic, for the New York Metropolitan Opera (the Met). Backgrounds Billinghurst and her duties with the Opera, and shows her career starting as a volunteer for the San Francisco Opera. Looks at the audience and economics for the Met's productions, and her excitement in working in opera."

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "A failure of leadership"
description: "Criticises the decisions to demolish some buildings and hence the contents within and asks where were the people and organisations who are vested with the responsibility to look after the country's culture."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "'We are just shattered'"
description: "Portrays life in Christchurch two weeks after the big quake hit it. Shows residents such as Brian Frisken (74, Bexley) and Barbara Kerr (Aranui) coping with living in the aftermath, and describes community support and efforts to recover. Discusses the problem of temporary housing with winter approaching."

Author: "Nicoll, Janina"
Title: "Sounds of discord"
description: "Discusses concern over a Creative New Zealand (CNZ) funding overhaul and changes in policy. Notes fears by regional orchestras such as the Vector Wellington Orchestra (VWO), Christchurch Symphony Orchestra (CSO) and Southern Sinfonia that they might lose funding, and looks at discussions between the Ministery for Culture and Heritage and CNZ about funding and the place of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra (NZSO) and regional orchestras. Talks to CNZ CEO Stephen Wainwright about arts funding, and to members of the VWO, Sinfonia and CSO about the effects of the uncertainty."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "Dampened delights"
description: "Reviews the NBR New Zealand Opera presentation of 'Xerxes' by Handel, Civic Theatre Auckland, 2-6 Mar 2011, and St James Theatre, Wellington, 15-19 Mar 2011."

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "Exiled from childhood"
description: "Book reviews. Backgrounds the subject of one of these books, Graham Percy."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "It's a rapt"
description: "Talks to choreographer Douglas Wright about his latest full-length work, 'rapt', commissioned by the Auckland Arts Festival, discussing its themes and inspiration. Outlines his career since being forced to leave dancing, noting the effects of illness."

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "Keep in touch"
description: "Looks at the connection between mind and body in the treatment of physical and psychological disease. Discusses research (University of California, Berkeley) comparing the awareness of internal response of dancers and of meditators. Discusses other research on mind-body connections, including gene expression and rehabilitation from physical injury."

Author: "Carr, Rose"
Title: "Back to basics"
description: "Reviews the basics of safe water and nutritionally adequate food in a disaster kit. Gives advice on storing and cleaning drinking water, and on stocking up with a balanced range of food items."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Aftershock zone"
description: "Discusses the state of earthquake prediction.  Looks at a Geonet model used by Matt Gerstenberger of GNS Science to show earthquake and aftershock probabilities in Canterbury, describing their use in wake of the recent pair of earthquakes and the possibility of the Alpine Fault triggering an even larger earthquake. Looks at the possible use of warning time given by an early warning system."

Author: "Easton, B. H."
Title: "Quakenomics"
description: "Discusses the pitfalls of the idea of 'GDP' (gross domestic product), looking at the effects of the Christchurch earthquake as an example."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "New shoots"
description: "Gives a personal account of being caught up in the earthquake in Christchurch while being involved with the Ellerslie Flower Show. Draws inspiration from Christchurch's image as a garden city."

Author: "Rae, Fiona,"
Title: "From Saturday March 19"
description: "Reviews a NZ drama, originally online."

Author: "Rae, Fiona,"
Title: "My other life"
description: "Reviews a NZ drama, originally online."

Author: "Brunton, Fiona"
Title: "School report"
description: "Presents more personal accounts and drawings from young Cantabrians who experienced the Feb 2011 earthquake."

Author: "Ardagh, Michael"
Title: "Starting over"
description: "Presents four poems about the Feb 2011 earthquake: 'Family of kings' by Michael Ardagh, 'A Glimpse of grief' by Benn McKnight, 'No defeat' by Kiely Wallace and 'After the earthquake' by Bob Beresford."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "The Max factor"
description: "Talks to the expatriate artist, currently visiting Christchurch to hand over 208 works on paper to the Christchurch Art Gallery. Discusses the influences on his art over his long career."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Past meets future"
description: "Meets several local residents who are exponents of 'steampunk' culture, a sub-genre of science fantasy that imagines a 'fantastical Victorian era that never was'. Talks to them about their decision to make their town the NZ capital of steampunk, complete with clubrooms in a heritage building dubbed 'Steampunk HQ'. Describes their connection to Weta Workshop."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Big little girl band"
description: "Talks to Lisa Blatchford, bassist and vocalist for the Auckland-based trio that started in Christchurch as 'Starlett'. Backgrounds the work that has gone into their debut album, recorded in Los Angeles. Mentions what happened to her family after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake."

Author: "Frances, Helen"
Title: "What dreams may come"
description: "Talks to Susan Krumdieck, Associate Professor of mechanical engineering at Canterbury University, about her thoughts on the reconstruction of a new, viable Christchurch."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Taking the lead"
description: "Talks to the actor, writer and producer about how he has juggled his various roles in front off and behind the camera. Touches on his new role playing a Norse god in 'The almighty Johnsons'."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "iDentifying local design"
description: "Talks to four local designers who will be participating in the 2011 iD International Emerging Designer Awards, Lion Foundation Arena, Dunedin, 7 Apr 2011."

Author: "Jopp, Jenny"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Arytipidal' by Andy Lelesi'uao, Blue Oyster Art Project Space, Dunedin, until 16 Apr 2011.  Reviews 'At once we are rootless and harbouring, floating on an inland sea' by Clare Fleming, and 'The Fullness of empty pockets' by Colleen Altagracia, Blue Oyster Art Project Space, Dunedin, until 16 Apr 2011.  Reviews 'Repertoire' by Stephen Martyn Welch, The Artist's Room, Dunedin."

Author: "McKnight, Sam"
Title: "Community farewells 'a great bloke'"
description: "Community farewells 'a great bloke'"

Title: "Man jailed for indecent assault on children at pool"
description: "Man jailed for indecent assault on children at pool"

Author: "Hutchinson, Don"
Title: "Philip McDonald popular guy who was 'into everything' : sister"
description: "Philip McDonald popular guy who was 'into everything' : sister"

Author: "MacKay, Scot"
Title: "Dad thankful for daughter's survival"
description: "Dad thankful for daughter's survival"

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "A life involved with racing on a variety of levels"
description: "A life involved with racing on a variety of levels"

Title: "Convicted sex offender cries as a mother describes impact"
description: "Convicted sex offender cries as a mother describes impact"

Author: "Vance, Andrea"
Title: "Children's story has no happy ending"
description: "Reports on NZ's scandalous record of child abuse. Backgrounds some cases over the past few years that have shocked the nation. Talks to Child Matters chief executive Anthea Simcock, Minister of Social Development Paula Bennett, Labour deputy leader Annette King and Children's Commissioner John Angus about measures that will need to be taken to change attitudes and reduce child abuse, and some initiatives that have been put in place. Mentions that Cabinet will consider a new 'failing to protect' law in Apr 2011. Presents a timeline of significant events between 20 Mar 2006 and 17 Feb 2011. Lists statistics about the scope of the problem."

Author: "Forbes, Michael"
Title: "The pain never goes away; Unsolved cases"
description: "Talks to Bryan Guy and Jo Guy, parents of the farmer who was murdered on 8 Jul 2010 by an unknown assailant, and to Charlotte Lipp, the mother of the young man who went missing on 24 Jan 2010. Discusses how they are coping. Seeks comment from Detective Inspector Greg Williams, who is in charge of two other unsolved murders. Updates the status of the four unsolved cases."

Author: "Harris, Catherine"
Title: "Skilled in action; Firms look overseas amid looming skills shortage"
description: "Looks at the current skills shortage in NZ and what is being done to address it. Talks to the former world champion discus thrower, now the chief executive of Best Pasifika Leadership Academy, about her own  upskilling plan and the focus of the Academy. Seeks comment from others in the building, engineering, hospitality and IT sectors, as well as spokespersons from the recruitment and industry training sectors and ANZ chief economist Cameron Bagrie. Informs that construction and infrastructure firms are likely to form alliances with international companies to provide the skilled labour necessary to rebuild Christchurch."

Title: "Remembering the heady days of working at Downing St"
description: "Talks to the digital consultant who worked for then Prime Minister Gordon Brown when she lived in London. Talks about her career and her current job as a digital consultant for Wellington-based public relations company Ideas Shop."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Leading light"
description: "Showcases the Institute at Victoria University, founded 10 years ago as an outgrowth of the creative writing course taught in various forms by the celebrated poet since 1975. Describes his influence on Wellington writers, and talks to some of them about their experiences. Informs that he is retiring this year, and talks to pro-vice chancellor Deborah Willis and lecturer Damien Wilkins about who might be the next director of the Institute."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "C-bomb"
description: "Assesses the attitudes of NZers and overseas about the use of the 'c-word' in public, including in the media. Includes the history of the word."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Kiwi pride"
description: "Talks to several NZ designers and artists about the influence of MaÃÑori art and culture on their work. Seeks comment from Vicky Thomas, manager of Kura Gallery, Auckland."

Author: "Ash, Julie"
Title: "Cop beating adds fuel to gun debate"
description: "Cop beating adds fuel to gun debate"

Author: "Rilkoff, Matt"
Title: "Traversing Taranaki"
description: "Relates his rafting trip with photographer Cameron Burnett on the Patea and Waitara rivers, retracing an ancient MaÃÑori route for 160 kilometres. Talks to locals who housed and fed them during the 12-day trip."

Author: "Leaman, Aaron"
Title: "Multi-skilled judge off to the islands"
description: "Multi-skilled judge off to the islands"

Title: "Knee injury set to rule Paston out"
description: "Knee injury set to rule Paston out"

Author: "Williscroft, Colin"
Title: "Beekeepers preparing for mite spread"
description: "Reports on the spread of the varroa mite into the region, and its implications for beekeepers in Central Otago and beyond. Seeks comment from New Zealand Honey Specialists chairman and Hawea Flat beekeeper Peter Ward, Earnscleugh beekeeper Reece Adamson and National Beekeepers' Association president Frans Laas, of Mosgiel. Lists facts about the varroa mite."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Central tourism business with legs"
description: "Showcases the Central Otago tourism business which was named the tourism award winner in the 2010 Otago Chamber of Commerce Business Excellence Awards. Talks to managing director Neville Grubb about the growth of the firm, which started as an adjunct to his Alexandra cycle business and has catered for cyclists riding the Otago Central Rail Trail since 2004."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Gold in them thar tills; There's gold in them thar tills; Slaking a miner's thirst"
description: "Chronicles the discovery of gold in the region in 1861 by Tasmanian Gabriel Read, for whom 'Gabriel's Gully' is named. Talks to fourth-generation Lawrence farmer Peter Cummings about some of the businessmen and gold miners involved in the development of the area. Informs that he has been involved in writing a series of plaques explaining the historical significance of many of the buildings in Lawrence in time for the Gabriel's Gully 150th anniversary celebrations, 18-21 Mar 2011. Speaks to Kim Murtagh about the former gold-mining shantytown of Wetherstons, 'the fun capital of the goldfields', and the fame achieved by the beer brewed at the Black Horse Brewery in the 1880s. Lists details of anniversary events."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Finding solid ground"
description: "Speaks to two families who have been displaced by the Christchurch earthquake about their plans for the future. Notes that the region has 'quietly absorbed' hundreds, and possibly thousands, of Christchurch residents, some of whom are likely to remain in Otago."

Author: "Trotman, Clive"
Title: "Creation of ancient New Zealand tragically topical; Focus on an artist with a fascination for the small"
description: "Creation of ancient New Zealand tragically topical; Focus on an artist with a fascination for the small"

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Flying solo, flying high"
description: "Visits the Christchurch-raised singer-songwriter at his farm at Woodhill, south of Auckland. Focuses on the material in his new second album. Describes his work to assist Shihad frontman Jon Toogood on his debut solo album. Talks about his next project, compiling a posthumous album of material by Pauly Fuemana of OMC. Describes his career since leaving Salmonella Dub in 2007 to pursue a solo career."

Author: "Harford, Jeff"
Title: "Why Dobbyn resides in the subconscious"
description: "Reviews and reconsiders the 1998 album."

Author: "Baser, Darryl"
Title: "Classical take on pop"
description: "Talks to the Mosgiel-raised songwriter, composer and multi-instrumentalist about his debut album, a pop-folk fusion described as 'chamber-pop'. Discusses his musical influences and career. Informs of his gig at Chick's Hotel, Port Chalmers, 19 Mar 2011."

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Japanese in NZ desperate to extend visas"
description: "Japanese in NZ desperate to extend visas"

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Anxious parents waiting to make contact with son caught up in the chaos"
description: "Anxious parents waiting to make contact with son caught up in the chaos"

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "City unites on day of healing"
description: "Describes the service held in Hagley Park in memory of the February 22 2011 earthquake, featuring parts of speeches given by Mayor Bob Parker, Ngai Tahu elder Henare Rakiihia, and Prince William. Relays the experience of some of the families of those killed in the earthquake."

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "New book brings taonga long lost to NZ out into the light"
description: "Reviews a book that catalogues over 2300 MaÃÑori treasures collected during the voyages to NZ of James Cook and held by the British Museum. Describes some of the items and relays comments on the collection by Te Papa director of Matauranga MaÃÑori, Arapata Hakiwai."

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Sea rescuer eases back on throttle"
description: "Sea rescuer eases back on throttle"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Building on shaky ground"
description: "Explores the options being considered for rebuilding Christchurch after its two earthquakes. Describes the damage, the most prominent weaknesses, and restoration efforts, as they relate to the city's affected suburbs, hills, and CBD area. Raises questions about the destruction, restoration or rebuilding of heritage and central city buildings. Quotes the views of Compusoft Engineering director Barry Davidson on seismic engineering, lack of political will to enforce building standards, and the need to check engineer's designs. Illustrates a model of a resilient house designed by Copeland Associates Architects."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Crisis"
description: "Discusses the failure of the cooling systems at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant, Japan following the recent earthquake. Looks at the possible outcomes of the disaster ranging from localised radioactive contamination to a complete meltdown of one or more of the reactor cores. Explains what this will mean for the health of locals and people living further a field."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Siddell book charts lifetime in painting"
description: "Reviews the book showcasing the work of the Auckland artist, discussing his popularity and the subjects and tone of his landscape art."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Waves of fear"
description: "Looks at the possibilities of tsunamis around NZ's coastal areas. Speaks to professor James Goss, co-director of the Australian Tsunami Research Centre about past and future scenarios."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Moving image dominates in festival works"
description: "Reviews 'Video life' by Ko Nakajima and Kentaro Taki at AUT, St Paul Gallery (to 25 March); 'Incompatible elements' by Josephine Starrs and Leon Cmielewski at MIC Toi Rerehiko (to 2 April); Jim Allen: Contact 2011at Artspace (to 21 April); Alicia Frankovich, Laresa Kosloff and Ruth Proctor at Artspace (to 20 March); and, 'Stillness in movement' by Daniel Crooks at Two Rooms, Newton, (to 9 April)."

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "Force majeure"
description: "Summarises major world tsunami disasters recorded over history."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Jeffrey Archer"
description: "Talks to the British author who is visiting NZ to promote his latest book, The Clifton chronicles."

Title: "Our turbulent shores"
description: "Summaries the history of recorded and suspected tsunamis that have affected NZ."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "New hope for left-wing crusader"
description: "Interviews the Pakistan-born political commentator and relays his advice to NZ, in the March 2011 Sir Douglas Robb Lectures delivered in Auckland  under the theme 'Empire and its future.'"

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Fighting back"
description: "Talks to Niki Harre, associate professor in psychology at the University of Auckland. Discusses in the aftermath of recent natural disasters, how people can avoid being overwhelmed by with anxiety and post-traumatic stress. Suggests a number of things people to can do to reduce their fears."

Author: "Pickmere, Arnold,"
Title: "NZ's oldest woman survived fragile infancy"
description: "NZ's oldest woman survived fragile infancy"

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "Friends with-out benefits"
description: "Discusses whether women and men can have platonic relationships, meeting people who enjoy such friendships or whose relationship became intimate. Relays advice from Auckland psychologist Sara Chatwin about nurturing platonic relationships, and the benefits they can confer."

Author: "Hayman, Kamala"
Title: "Twin deaths the last chapter of love story"
description: "Twin deaths the last chapter of love story"

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Soul survivor"
description: "Speaks with Oxford professor and Christian evangelist John Lennox about his thoughts on whether there is a God."

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "PR world applauds Kiwi high-flier"
description: "PR world applauds Kiwi high-flier"

Author: "Boniface, Linley"
Title: "The 3:1 rule"
description: "Presents Dr Barbara Fredrickson, professor of psychology, University of North Carolina who will be visiting NZ to ‚Äúelevate the standing of positive psychology in NZ‚Äù. Portrays Dr Barbara Fredrickson's message about negative and positive emotions and getting the ratio right in order to flourish."

Author: "Carr, Rose"
Title: "Drink to that"
description: "Advocates the importance of drinking plenty of water in order to keep hydrated and healthy. Covers the effects of drinking tea and coffee and getting liquids from other sources."

Title: "'Kind' crime kingpin lived his life in style"
description: "'Kind' crime kingpin lived his life in style"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "A lifetime of service has ended"
description: "A lifetime of service has ended"

Title: "NZ pilot shone in defence of Malta"
description: "NZ pilot shone in defence of Malta"

Title: "Renowned academic was a visionary 'tweeter'"
description: "Renowned academic was a visionary 'tweeter'"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Family farewell bubbly daughter"
description: "Family farewell bubbly daughter"

Author: "Brennan-Tupara, Nicola"
Title: "Farmworker victim was 'a bit of a character'"
description: "Farmworker victim was 'a bit of a character'"

Title: "Farming leader believes in being involved"
description: "Farming leader believes in being involved"

Author: "Rodey, Aidan"
Title: "Bean relishing having Sir Patrick as his mentor"
description: "Bean relishing having Sir Patrick as his mentor"

Title: "Change of direction has Ainsley Downs on the up"
description: "Change of direction has Ainsley Downs on the up"

Author: "Bridson, Angelique"
Title: "Popular Schick still caring for Windsor Park"
description: "Popular Schick still caring for Windsor Park"

Author: "Neale, Imogen"
Title: "Rewriting the history of Moriori"
description: "Documents a visit to the Chatham Islands by Education Minister Anne Tolley to present a new series of 'School Journal' representing a differing account of the history of the Polynesian. Describes the reaction to the presentation of Hokotehi Moriori Trust general manager Maui Solomon."

Author: "Pepperell, Susan"
Title: "The rise of the cake-stall nation"
description: "Talks to the head of the Christchurch Earthquake Appeal Mark Weldon about the funds raised so far. Touches on the effect of the earthquake and tsunami in Japan.  Names the three main funds to which people can contribute, and outlines what the money is being spent on."

Author: "Pepperell, Susan"
Title: "I'll have my protein shake in a cone"
description: "I'll have my protein shake in a cone"

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Harawira burns big tobacco"
description: "Sets out the parts played by former MaÃÑori Party MP Hone Harawira and the MaÃÑori Party in boosting cigarette prices and introducing a bill to banning shop displays of cigarettes. Considers the role of the extremist in NZ politics."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "The long road ahead"
description: "Talks to the detective inspector of Samoan heritage about her strategies for investigating the murder of Scott Guy, her recent motorbike trip in the South Island, and the main mysteries and rumours around  the case."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Joy, hope and a girl called Emma"
description: "Talks to Joanne Watson about her toddler who is the public face of the 2011 Child Cancer Foundation fundraising appeal, detailing the treatment and the effect the T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukaemia has had on her child."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Power struggle"
description: "Profiles the CEO of Orion about his role in restoring electricity to Christchurch after its earthquakes. Talks about his hero status in the city and his career in the electricity sector. Touches on his salary, famous family members and why he is an energy-conscious person."

Author: "Robinson, Victoria"
Title: "The truth is out there"
description: "Seeks an explanation of why people eschew science for unscientific predictions, using as an example the recent case of the earthquake warning given by weather forecaster Ken Ring."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "What I do : zoo keeper"
description: "Talks to the keeper of native fauna at Auckland Zoo about her daily routine, discussing how she keeps animals fed and stimulated, and what a 27 year old kaka smells like."

Author: "Moore, Johnny"
Title: "Black Tuesday"
description: "Provides a diary of his days following the earthquake, starting at the Goodbye Blue Monday live music venue in Christchurch that he co-owns with his parents and siblings."

Author: "Smithies, Grant"
Title: "Music & lyrics by ..."
description: "Reports on music licensing and the income and exposure it could provide for NZ musicians. Names NZ music that has featured on overseas television programmes. Talks to Chris Gough, managing director of Native Tongue, about licensing, and placing clients' music in feature films, television series, and commercials worldwide."

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Spitfire pilot had courage under fire"
description: "Spitfire pilot had courage under fire"

Author: "Evans, Ryan"
Title: "Sunil won't be doing any waiting for the others"
description: "Sunil won't be doing any waiting for the others"

Author: "Thompson, Wayne"
Title: "Happy reunion for long-lost cousins"
description: "Happy reunion for long-lost cousins"

Author: "Twose, Helen"
Title: "Apetite for change led to tough chance"
description: "Apetite for change led to tough chance"

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "How $5.1m worth of 'exclusions' became included"
description: "Reports on a contentious meeting of the finance, strategy and development committee of the Dunedin City Council, which considered a report on further base building requirements for the new Forsyth Barr Stadium. Explores why the council decided to provide an additional $5.1 million for the stadium, focusing on a list of five items to be 'excluded' from the guaranteed minimum price (GMP)."

Author: "Bruce, David"
Title: "Water companies pool resources; Manager has eye to the future"
description: "Announces the formation of the new Waitaki Irrigators' Collective Ltd, aimed at pooling the financial resources and knowledge of five irrigation companies representing interests on both sides of the lower Waitaki River. Talks to independent chairman Fraser McKenzie about the rationale for the collective. Profiles its Dunedin-born and educated policy manager."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Interim 'villages' of units planned; Logistics of rehousing Christchurch will be daunting"
description: "Examines the tender document proposal from the Dept of Building and Housing for 'imminent' temporary accommodation in the city following the two earthquakes. Describes the three stages being assessed. Talks to Dunedin builders and Dunedin City Council economic development manager Peter Harris about the logistical difficulties of housing displaced Christchurch residents."

Author: "Hathaway, Jude"
Title: "Well-dressed dreams"
description: "Talks to Australian fashion curator and author Charlotte Smith, who will be a special guest at the iD Dunedin Fashion Week, Apr 2011. Talks to her about her career and her curation of the Darnell Collection, Australia's largest private collection of vintage clothing. Informs of opportunities for the public to meet her."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "A ring of truth?"
description: "Focuses on the prediction by Auckland weather forecaster Ken Ring that Christchurch would experience another large earthquake on 20 Mar 2011. Talks to him about public reaction to his prediction, including death threats. Seeks comment from ACC Minister Nick Smith and several scientists who refute his methods and dismiss his predictions as misguided and irresponsible. Speaks to Victoria University psychologist Assoc Prof Marc Wilson about the results of his 2008 study into beliefs. Includes other tried but unproven ways of predicting the future."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "26 days later ..."
description: "Talks to local residents in Christchurch and Lyttelton to see how they are faring after the second major earthquake since 4 Sep 2010. Sums up the situation."

Author: "Isaacs, Clarke"
Title: "Institution provided no reason to go straight"
description: "Institution provided no reason to go straight"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "In Eastern country"
description: "Talks to the frontman of the Lyttleton-based country-folk band. Discusses the process of making their second album. Talks about their diligent work habits and their decision to be a full-time band. Informs of their earthquake relief benefit concert and sales of a compilation album, Glenroy Auditorium, Dunedin, 19 Mar 2011."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Defying genre"
description: "Talks to Dunedin Fringe Festival organiser Peter Stapleton about 'Lines of flight', an experimental music and film experience now in its sixth year. Lists dates and venues."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Comprehending love when worlds collide"
description: "Talks to the Chinese-NZ director about the process of making her debut feature film. Observes that as with her documentary, the film also recounts her own true love story of falling in love with her now-husband Stephen Harris, and the reaction of her Hong Kong immigrant parents."

Author: "Powley, Christine"
Title: "No glib solutions in wedding film"
description: "No glib solutions in wedding film"

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Compassion essential part of job"
description: "Interviews the manager of the Mosgiel Salvation Army Store about her work."

Title: "Price pain is biting"
description: "Looks at the rising cost of living in NZ. Presents the results of a Herald on Sunday-Nielsen online survey, indicating respondents are paying more for transport, Council rates, power and gas bills and cutting back on clothes, footwear, social outings and some had abandoned holidays. Includes an example of Linda Holmes who broke her wrist and unable to work and the bills she faced for medical care."

Author: "Grunwell, Rachel"
Title: "Triple childcare trouble"
description: "Examines the law over the number of children centres can care for. Indicates day care centres for children can be licensed to care for between 50 to 150 children. Looks at the issues faced by parents when placing their children in day care. Cites an example of a parent who considered some day care centres to have either too many or too little children at their centres when considering the most appropriate environment for her child."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Beefing up smartphone protection"
description: "Examines security options for smartphones. Talks to Symantec Asia-Pacific products manager David Hall about security programmes and applications to avoid."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "One person's rubbish is another person's art"
description: "Speaks to the artist, the 2010 Frances Hodgkins Fellow, about her fellowship exhibition 'Honey in the rock', Hocken Gallery, Dunedin, until 4 Apr 2011. Discusses her career to date and some of the themes in her multi-media exhibition."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Watchdog red-flags GM food"
description: "Indicates Greenpeace Australia have questioned the controls on dairy farms run by an Australian firm in which Fonterra have a controlling stake and have subsequenlty put a red flag against Fonterra in its True Food Guide 2011. Notes other companies and food stuffs with which it has concerns over regarding genetically modified food."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'As it is on Earth' by Peter Nicholls, Temple Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Venn diagram with tears and onion' by Violet Faigan, Rice and Beans Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Pattern and paradox' by Jenny Longstaff, Gallery on Blueskin, Dunedin, until 27 Mar 2011."

Author: "Knowsley, Jo"
Title: "Lamb chopped"
description: "Examines how shoppers have changed their purchase choices when they are shopping for food. Reports a survey by the Herald on Sunday of 750 price checks reveals a 5 per cent increase over the last year. Notes Kiwis are spending less on discretionary items and portrays the views of consumers about their shopping habits and spending patterns."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Booze and bad behaviour"
description: "Notes anecdotal evidence of how alcohol affects behaviour of people on the street late at night. Reveals some of the findings of two recent scientific studies showing how 'getting boozed may lead to bad behaviour'. Reveals police are partnering with other agencies to improve safety and behaviour in Auckland's entertainment zones."

Title: "Back down south"
description: "Outlines some recreational and holiday activities to participate in to support the Canterbury economy. Locations include Akaroa, Waimakariri, Hanmer Springs, Kaikoura and McKenzie Country."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Trip of a lifetime ends in prison"
description: "Trip of a lifetime ends in prison"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Rabbit-proof fence : when cash and conservation clash"
description: "Inquires into the management issues surrounding wildlife sanctuaries, focusing on the Maungatautari Reserve, Waikato. Describes the controversy over changes in the Reserve's governance structure. Outlines common difficulties with funding sanctuaries and with striking a balance between conservation priorities, economic benefit, and stakeholders interests. Cites comments by Gareth Morgan about partnering conservation and private enterprise. Also touches on the Zelandia (Wellington) and the Sinbad Sanctuary (Fiordland)."

Author: "Warner, Kirsten"
Title: "Taking schools to remotest of kids"
description: "Outlines the philanthropic work of the brothers who both work in advertising, setting up schools in north Laos through their Bridging the Gap Mekong Trust. Describes how their motorbiking holidays in Asia kickstarted their desire to help and notes they count investment adviser Gareth Morgan among their helpers."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Three seconds of danger and excitement"
description: "Three seconds of danger and excitement"

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "Financing the rebuild"
description: "Looks at ways in which Christchurch can help pay its share of the bill for the February 22 earthquake."

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "What Napier can teach Christchurch about rebuilding; Need for haste balanced with the need for preservation"
description: "Focuses on three lessons that Christchurch can learn from Napier, which recovered quickly after their city was ruined in a 7.9 magnitude earthquake, 3 Feb 1931. Cites an 1997 paper by economist Simon Chapple, estimating the economic impact of the Napier quake. Seeks comment on this paper from NZ Institute of Economic Research principal economist Shamubeel Eaqub, who emphasises the relevance of these findings to Christchurch. Speaks to Hawke's Bay museum and art gallery programmes leader Eloise Taylor, curator of an exhibition on the rebuilding of Napier. Talks to the retired architect who lived through the Feb 1931 earthquake, who comments on the situation and the parallels between the cities."

Author: "Slade, Maria"
Title: "Textiles world first"
description: "Showcases a wool fabric technology developed by AgResearch that features a dyeing process allowing various effects to be printed on wool.  Describes the apparel company that is commercialising the technology. Notes other innovative fabrics developed by the Canterbury research institute."

Author: "Jackson, Kerri"
Title: "The second course"
description: "Talks to the first winner of the Masterchef television cooking programme, Brett McGregor, about his experience of the Christchurch earthquakes and his first cookbook."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "Everybody needs good neighbours ..."
description: "Explores the extent to which Wellingtonians and other NZers know their neighbours, prompted by 'Neighbours Day', 26 Mar 2011. Talks to residents in inner-city Wellington, Ngaio and Christchurch about their experiences. Cites findings from 'The State of our neighbourhoods', a 2008 survey by Colmar Brunton. Informs that 'Neighbours Day' started in Auckland and became an official NZ-wide day in 2010."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Turning on to turn off"
description: "Looks at what activities NZers are planning to observe Earth Hour, 26 Mar 2011. Informs that organisers from WWF New Zealand are asking people to do more to take action on climate change."

Title: "Back at home not planning his retirement - but first a royal wedding"
description: "Interviews the Governor-General about the refit of Government House, his plans after stepping down from the role in Aug 2011, his upcoming attendance at the wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton, and other aspects of his tenure."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "Down but not out"
description: "Stresses the importance for businesses to have a backup plan. Talks about cloud computing, which allows you to upload all your material onto an online server."

Author: "FitzSimons, Peter"
Title: "Game on!"
description: "Recalls highlights from the Rugby World Cup tournaments of 1987 (Australia and NZ), 1991 (England), 1995 (South Africa), 1999 (England), 2003 (Australia and NZ), and 2007 (France)."

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "We can't get enough of Lotto; All about getting a lot of people to spend a little bit; How big jackpots more than pay for themselves; Winners advised to take it slowly, step by step"
description: "Examines the continued popularity of Lotto, which is experiencing record ticket sales despite the economic downturn. Talks to a woman who won over $5 million two years ago about how the win has changed her life. Seeks comment from Problem Gambling NZ chief executive Graeme Ramsay, who is concerned about the role of Lotto in its current format, and NZ Lotteries chief executive Todd McLeay, who defends the company. Includes facts about the lottery and lists excerpts from the NZ Lotteries winners' handbook, provided to first division winners, about how to proceed."

Author: "Farr-Jones, Nick"
Title: "Don't look at the mountain"
description: "Backgrounds the history of the Rugby World Cup. Comments on the Cup being hosted by NZ in 2011. Recalls, as the former Wallabies captain, advice he received from Sir Edmund Hillary about facing challenges, and offers it to the All Blacks before the 7th tournament in Auckland 2011."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Rebirth of the Roxy"
description: "Features the opulent new Roxy Cinema in the heart of Miramar. Informs of its opening on 30 Mar 2011, nearly 50 years after it last functioned as a cinema. Talks to co-owners Jamie Selkirk and Tania Rodger about their decision to purchase the building in 2003 and refurbish the old Capitol Theatre, which now boasts two cinemas, a restaurant and a cocktail bar. Names other investors involved in the venture. Seeks comment from Paramount Cinemas operations manager Kate Larkindale."

Author: "Kirk, David,"
Title: "Faithful pilgrims"
description: "Recounts his experience as captain of a Rugby World Cup winning team and as a family man of each of the rugby football tournaments since 1987."

Author: "Van der Bergh, Roeland"
Title: "Food town; Singapore is food town"
description: "Focuses on the potential economic benefits to the NZ food industry of exporting to Singapore, which has a vibrant hospitality sector. Talks to spokespersons from several NZ food and wine companies that are already operating there. Discusses the challenges and opportunities of breaking into the market."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "A tale of two cities for business; Effect on business owners"
description: "Reports on the status of businesses in the city as a result of the earthquake, based on a poll quoted this week by business leaders. Signals that the Government payroll and job loss subsidies package would be winding up. Talks to the owners of Switch Espresso, Pastel Shoe Dyers and Red Furniture about their situation."

Author: "Thomas, Paul"
Title: "Into the unknown"
description: "Considers the prospects of the All Blacks at the 2011 Rugby World Cup. Touches on the team's form, experience, class, coaching/management team, leadership and home advantage.  Looks also at the factors of injury, refereeing, attitude, and sheer luck. [Print exclusive]"

Author: "Hattaway, Peter"
Title: "For the sake of $3 ..."
description: "Looks at how security agreements (such as a retention of title clause) and registration on the Personal Property Securities Register (PPSR) can save businesses."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "A stage they're going through"
description: "Talks to the couple, both playwrights, about their first joint effort, written while their 20-month-old daughter was napping. Discusses other aspects of their James Bond spoof 'The Spy who wouldn't die again', Downstage Theatre, Wellington, 31 Mar-23 Apr 2011."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Blast those barricades"
description: "Portrays the frustration of Christchurch business owners whose CBD buildings have been barred by Civil Defence authorities, though journalists and dignitaries can participate in inner city guided tours. Talks to business owners - Gerald Westenra, David Collins, Joe Arts and Nicky Arts and Andrew Wheeley and Adele Wheeley - about how the ban has affected their businesses. Conveys criticism of and praise for the Canterbury Business Recovery service. Outlines plans for the central business district that are similar to those carried out in Napier after the 1931 earthquake."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "DeÃÅjaÃÄ vu with a vengeance"
description: "Discusses the damaged caused to Christchurch after the Feb 2011 earthquake and estimates the cost to rebuild."

Title: "What might happen in future trusts legislation?"
description: "Looks at the current options being considered by the Law Commission as they embark on a lengthy review of trust law in NZ. Briefly outlines mandatory provisions in the USA uniform trust code."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "When sleep is work"
description: "Highlights the court decision in the case of 'Idea Services Ltd v Dickson' [2011] NZCA 12, in which the plaintiff questioned the amount he was paid when doing a sleepover."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Ian Foster"
description: "Profiles the IT scientist and NZer, now director of the Computation Institute of the Argonne National Laboratory and the University of Chicago, about the democratisation of computing and his co-development of the Globus Toolkit. Follows his career since his graduation from Canterbury University in 1980. Discusses the advances of computers from the use of punchcards to grid computing, and the perils inherent in the speed of change in technology."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Flying the flag"
description: "Profiles the IT scientist and NZer, now director of the Computation Institute of the Argonne National Laboratory and the University of Chicago, about the democratisation of computing and his co-development of the Globus Toolkit. Follows his career since his graduation from Canterbury University in 1980. Discusses the advances of computers from the use of punchcards to grid computing, and the perils inherent in the speed of change in technology."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "The book of life"
description: "Presents entries from the Facebook page of the late Peruvian-born NZer who was the director of studies at King's Education language academy, located on the third floor of the CTV building that collapsed in the 6.3 magnitude earthquake, 22 Feb 2011. Comments on each of the entries to chronicle her life, family, friends and interests. Informs that her body had not yet been identified at 26 Mar 2011."

Author: "Gay, Edward"
Title: "Quad bikes claim another farmer"
description: "Quad bikes claim another farmer"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Eastern promise"
description: "Visits the eastern suburb, charting its transformation over the past decade from a primarily industrial area to the heart of the film industry after Sir Peter Jackson began to invest in the suburb. Talks to designer Gary Stewart, who has been contracted by the Miramar Enterprise Trust to rebrand the area to focus on its history and tourist attractions as well as its creative business enterprises. Seeks views of Trust chairman and local veterinarian Allan Probert, Port Nicholson Block Settlement Trust chairman Sir Ngatata Love, Oscar winner Jamie Selkirk and Valentina Dias, co-owners of the soon-to-be-opened Roxy Cinema, about further development of the peninsula. Speaks to business owners, real estate agents and local residents about changes to the suburb."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Cliff plunge ends dream: Shattered family members tell of dead teenager's pro sport goal"
description: "Cliff plunge ends dream: Shattered family members tell of dead teenager's pro sport goal"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Autumn fling"
description: "Suggests activities of interest in the capital and the region during autumn."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "A wonderful journey"
description: "Reviews the dance theatre work by choreographer Douglas Wright, at the Civic Theatre, Auckland, 16-19 Mar 2011, as part of the Auckland Arts Festival. [Print exclusive]"

Author: "Dearnaley, Mathew"
Title: "Illness claims war veteran bashed up in car heist"
description: "Illness claims war veteran bashed up in car heist"

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Lifeguard's adventrue worries Mum"
description: "Lifeguard's adventrue worries Mum"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "The lad who fell out of his house as the earth heaved"
description: "The lad who fell out of his house as the earth heaved"

Author: "Bourke, Chris"
Title: "The Pasifika Social Club"
description: "Reviews the Rarotongan born singer's album created 50 years after his first two albums. Traces his singing roots to his birthplace in Turangi and follows his career in Auckland, his hiatus, and his comeback, assisted by his daughter Annie Crummer. Describes why he has been called the 'Pacific Roy Orbison.'"

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Right where you need it"
description: "Discusses community mindedness and the value of real communities, talking to a Christchurch dairy owner and retailer award winner, an author and advocate of the New Urbanist movement, and a hairdresser who provides free hugs and tea."

Author: "Leggat, David"
Title: "Twaddle makes way for the youngsters"
description: "Twaddle makes way for the youngsters"

Author: "Griffin, Michelle"
Title: "Rookies on the trail"
description: "Describes a four-day walk she took with her husband and daughter along the Queen Charlotte Track."

Author: "Shiels, Rosa"
Title: "From Nazi hell to freedom in NZ; Welcome to the world of Bu"
description: "From Nazi hell to freedom in NZ; Welcome to the world of Bu"

Author: "Easther, Elisabeth"
Title: "What more can a 'Poor Boy' do?"
description: "Reviews the Matt Cameron and Tim Finn play directed by Raymond Hawthorne, Auckland Theatre Company, Maidment Theatre, until 9 April 2011."

Author: "Carr, Rose"
Title: "Good food builds good kids"
description: "Comments on the National Party's revoking of the guidelines requiring only healthy foods be sold in schools, stressing the importance of healthy food given that 21% of NZ children are overweight. Notes the work of the Heart Foundation in supporting schools to emphasise nutritional food choices. Documents work with food retailers located close to schools to provide good eating options for school children."

Author: "Hartley, Simon"
Title: "Dynamite diatomite fertiliser launched"
description: "Reports on the launch of a multimillion dollar fertiliser export business based on the Taieri Plain, owned by Sydney-based private company Featherston Resources Ltd. Talks to chief executive Emma Weston about its research and development investment for commercialising a large diatomite deposit in Middlemarch, and constructing a processing plant near Mosgiel. Presents facts about the company and names its two NZ directors. Describes diatomite and lists the Crown Minerals permits granted to the company in Otago."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "'Silly game' in pool costs teen his life"
description: "'Silly game' in pool costs teen his life"

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "My life in sport: Graeme Crosby"
description: "My life in sport: Graeme Crosby"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Sharing and caring"
description: "Examines the pros and cons of separated parents sharing childrearing arrangements. Talks to Auckland barrister Alex Ashmore about a tendency toward equal shared care becoming the norm, leaving a question mark over the practical benefits to the children involved. Notes the increasing number of custody cases coming to court and requiring longer to settle. Cites the comments of a psychologist about the right age to move children between two houses. Profiles two families and their shared care plans."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Mum who lost family in quake wants to help"
description: "Mum who lost family in quake wants to help"

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Quiet man of letters"
description: "Profiles the winner of the Storylines' Betty Gilderdale Award for services to children's literature and literacy. Describes the School for Young Writers he set up in 1993 to nurture young writers and notes its publications, Write On and Re-Draft. Cites comments by Tessa Duder about this 'unsung hero'. Talks to four young writers whose work features in the publications."

Author: "Cardy, Tom"
Title: "The secret's out"
description: "Speaks to the Malaysian born NZ actor about her career, her current work in the US and her role as a Chinese NZer in the NZ romantic comedy written and directed by Roseanne Liang."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Right where you need it"
description: "Discusses community mindedness and the value of real communities, talking to a Christchurch dairy owner and retailer award winner, an author and advocate of the New Urbanist movement, and a hairdresser who provides free hugs and tea."

Author: "Shiels, Rosa"
Title: "From Nazi hell to freedom in NZ; welcome to the world of Bu"
description: "From Nazi hell to freedom in NZ; welcome to the world of Bu"

Author: "Todd, Rebecca"
Title: "Couple to wed and return to city"
description: "Couple to wed and return to city"

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Ultimate makeover"
description: "Looks at earthquake damage in Christchurch. Assesses potential future hazards and design principles, including ideas about precincts, low rise blocks, parks, land ownership, car parking and urban villages.  Reveals University of Canterbury Vice-Chancellor Rod Carr's suggestion for developing Christchurch central. Emphasises the need for consultation on masterplans for rebuilding. Presents a debate over ways to stimulate commercial activity in the CBD, focusing on rent levels."

Author: "Neale, Imogen"
Title: "Life easy for bullies say parents"
description: "Reports on the issue of bullying in schools. Speaks to Education Minister Anne Tolley, Principals Federation president Peter Simpson and former Education Minister Trevor Mallard about how schools are dealing with the widespread problem. Touches on a number of high profile bullying cases. Talks to Auckland parent De Wet Blaauw whose daughter was bullied so badly he took her out of school."

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "From wig and robe to polka-dot bikini"
description: "From wig and robe to polka-dot bikini"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Bruise brothers want to be Warriors together"
description: "Bruise brothers want to be Warriors together"

Author: "Mathewson, Nicole"
Title: "'It's definitely home' even if home is damaged; Street party to get Sumner rocking again"
description: "Visits Lyttelton and the bays to canvass the views of residents on the future of their communities following the earthquake. Describes the damage sustained to homes and businesses. Talks to Urban Surf owner Jo Hockham, who is organising a street party in Sumner on 26 Mar 2011 to celebrate their resilience and welcome back residents who were displaced after the quake."

Author: "Stylianou, Georgina"
Title: "Good humour to the fore on the east side; Couple 'alone' on deserted street"
description: "Visits Bexley, Dallington and New Brighton, three suburbs that were particularly hard-hit by the earthquake. Asks residents how they are faring and seeks their views about the future of their communities. Talks to Lorna Tonkin and Gary Tonkin, a couple who are among the last remaining residents of Orari St., Bexley."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Earth Hour plea to act"
description: "Looks at what activities NZers are planning to observe Earth Hour, 26 Mar 2011. Informs that organisers from WWF New Zealand are asking people to do more to take action on climate change."

Author: "Alexander, Miriyana"
Title: "In the line of duty"
description: "Profiles the former police officer and current chief security officer for Kuwait-based Agility Logistics who is contesting the National Party candidacy for Rodney. Talks about his varied career. Speaks to his fianceÃÅe Peggy Bourne, the widow of rally driver Possum Bourne, about his political ambitions."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Treasured through the written word"
description: "Reflects on the role of writers in capturing memories of parts of the city that have been lost after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Sums up a Kim Hill with the Christchurch-born and -raised author about 'the solace of art and literature', referring to several books about the city and the poems 'Pause' and 'Response' by Mary Ursula Bethell. Describes other books that have their settings in Christchurch after a telephone conversation with the author."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "'Parole declined!'"
description: "Describes a day of parole hearings at Auckland Prison (Paremoremo) for some of the country's most notorious prisoners afflicted with mental illness, brain injury or intellectual disability. Talks to psychiatrist Dr Phillip Brinded, one of four members of the NZ Parole Board's 'extended' panel, about who should take responsibility for mentally ill prisoners. Explains what the NZ Parole Board does. Includes statistics from the most recent census of the Ministry of Health's 'forensic' mental health services in 2005."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Act of God?"
description: "Investigates the devastating impact of the 4 Sep 2010 and 22 Feb 2011 earthquakes on churches in the city, and the questions and challenges now faced by clergy and congregations.  Speaks to Anglican Bishop of Christchurch Victoria Matthews, The Rev Lynda Patterson, Catholic Bishop of Christchurch Barry Jones and The Rev Martin Stewart."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Realism in the wake of the earthquake"
description: "Suggests, now that most services are running again in Christchurch, it may be time to focus on  achievements made since the earthquakes. Considers the effects of not holding World Cup rugby games in the city. Notes the differing ways in which community links are severed."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Men dealing to stress"
description: "Visits a course held recently in Kaiapoi, aimed at helping men to deal with the stress of the earthquakes through cognitive behaviour therapy. Talks to group facilitator Keith Jacques about the techniques he teaches to help men deal with and 'to' stress, as well as to better understand the place of men in modern society."

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "Arresting times"
description: "Speaks to 1981 Springbok Tour protester and current Green Party spokesman for the Rugby World Cup about his lifetime of campaigning."

Author: "Moore, Chris"
Title: "Smarting"
description: "Stocktakes the damage sustained by Christchurch's art galleries and performing arts venues, lamenting some art works may be lost as buildings are demolished. Notes the role being played by the online forum Artbash. Highlights comments by some of the city's arts community. Informs of two city  galleries that are still functioning."

Author: "Laing, Sahera"
Title: "Tame the internal beast"
description: "Offers practical advice to Cantabrians on methods of getting the body back in balance to cope with the stress of the earthquakes and the constant aftershocks. Explains the role of adrenalin, serotonin, dopamine and endophins."

Author: "McCarthy, Angela"
Title: "Lifeline for callers on the brink"
description: "Lifeline for callers on the brink"

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Bully attacks after girl's plea for help; To fight or not to fight?; Why it's okay to tell"
description: "Looks at two examples of pupils being bullied at school and recounts the attack in which Robin de Jong suffered a severe beating and kicking at Wanganui Girls College. Presents the results of an unscientific survey carried out on the Herald's website which had 19,000 respondents. Cites the example of Auckland's Mt Roskill Grammar School who has implemented the Peace Foundation's 'Cool Schools' peer mediation programme in 1995."

Author: "Stevenson, Rebecca"
Title: "Sky's the limit for jetpack boss"
description: "Profiles the chief executive of Martin Jetpack. Overviews his career. Asks him whether he is an entrepreneur, and to describe the obstacles to running the company and what he has learned. Offers tips for budding entrepreneurs."

Author: "Vass, Beck"
Title: "From bus driver to team trouble shooter"
description: "From bus driver to team trouble shooter"

Author: "Rossie, Liza"
Title: "Lessons from port history"
description: "Recounts, from her viewpoint as a local historian, the history of the decisions made and materials used in the construction of the port town's buildings. Highlights the life-saving move made by the Education Board following the Napier quake of 1931. Ponders what constitutes the heart and soul of a community and recommends what direction the town's rebuilding should take."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Quake a tale of two cities for business; Message to business; How does the end of the subsidy affect your business?"
description: "Reports on the status of businesses in the city as a result of the earthquake, based on a poll quoted this week by business leaders. Signals that the Government payroll and job loss subsidies package would be winding up. Lists key points made by Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee, Acting Minister of Economic Development David Carter, and Canterbury Employers Chamber of Commerce chief executive Peter Townsend. Talks to the owners of Switch Espresso, Pastel Shoe Dyers and Red Furniture about their situation."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Regional TV 'deprived of its lifeblood'"
description: "Regional TV 'deprived of its lifeblood'"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "'Mr Show Business' made lifelong friends of stars"
description: "'Mr Show Business' made lifelong friends of stars"

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Our own house physician"
description: "Talks to medical consultant Phillippa Poole who describes how she manages to find out what is wrong with patients and how to go about making difficult diagnoses. Includes three questions, sourced from the book How doctors think by Jerome Groopman, you should ask your doctor if there is difficulty in diagnosing a patient's illness. Illustrates with examples with complex diagnoses and their outcome."

Author: "Russell, Nicola"
Title: "Echo chamber"
description: "Talks to the 'chamber pop' musician and brother of Phil Keoghan, the presenter of 'The amazing race', about his experiments with a nineteenth-century violin."

Author: "Harrison, Debbie"
Title: "Driving instructor"
description: "Talks to the driving instructor for Triple 'A' Driving School in Wellington about a typical workday in his job and some bad habits of learner drivers."

Author: "Harris, Catherine"
Title: "Skilled in action; Firms look overseas for skills"
description: "Looks at the current skills shortage in NZ and what is being done to address it. Talks to the former world champion discus thrower Beatrice Faumuina, now the chief executive of Best Pasifika Leadership Academy, about her own upskilling plan and the focus of the Academy. Seeks comment from others in the building, engineering, hospitality and IT sectors, as well as spokespersons from the recruitment and industry training sectors and ANZ chief economist Cameron Bagrie. Informs that construction and infrastructure firms are likely to form alliances with international companies to provide the skilled labour necessary to rebuild Christchurch."

Author: "Hart, Anna"
Title: "Playing it straight"
description: "Focuses on why there are few publicly gay actors in Hollywood. Points out that an openly gay actor, male or female, has yet to be cast as the lead in a big-budget Hollywood movie and that there has been a lack of gay actors in gay roles. Argues that the conventional wisdom in Hollywood remains steadfast: an out male actor cannot be a leading man because straight women will not be able to fantasise about him and straight men will not be able to relate. Talks about the experience of comedian Ellen DeGeneres after she announced she was gay. Talks to NZ radio host Mike Puru about his experience of coming out."

Author: "Stewart, Tamlyn"
Title: "Business frustration grows in the red zone"
description: "Portrays the frustration of CBD business owners at not being able to access their premises or make business decisions. Talks to four business owners about relocation, dealing with business interruption insurance, and consideration of working jointly."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Fire power"
description: "Visits the Christchurch Pistol Club to ascertain the difficulty and the attraction of pistol shooting. Defines practical pistol shooting, noting exponents need to have athletic ability. Explains the need for member anonymity and strict screening procedures. Describes the social aspects of belonging to a shooting club. Tries his hand(s) at western action shooting, describing the weapons involved."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "C-bomb"
description: "Assesses the attitudes of NZers and overseas about the use of the 'c-word' in public, including in the media. Includes the history of the word."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Kiwi pride"
description: "Talks to several NZ designers and artists about the influence of MaÃÑori art and culture on their work. Seeks comment from Vicky Thomas, manager of Kura Gallery, Auckland."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "John Hawkesby"
description: "Talks to a former television and radio personality and his wife about life after work and the sort of person he is."

Author: "Monk, Felicity"
Title: "Based on a true story"
description: "Talks to the London-based NZ director of a short film inspired by the murder of Navtej Singh, who was shot behind the counter of his South Auckland liquor store during an armed robbery in June 2008."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Unleashing the darkness"
description: "Previews Frankenstein at the National Theatre, Rialto Newmarket & Bridgeway, Northcote that will be staged from March 31."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Sculpture comes alive"
description: "Reviews: 'Playing with fire' at the Gus Fisher Gallery, showing work by three ceramicists, Peter Hawkesby, Dennis O'Connor and Graeme Storm to April 30; '10,000 objects' by Alexander Bartleet at Warwick Henderson Gallery to April 9; 'N.O.W. (No other way)' by Will Handley at Sanderson Contemporary Art to March 27; 'In the shadow of the mount' by John Blackburn at Artis Gallery to April 2; 'Sculpture and drawings' by Lisa Roet at Gow Langsford Gallery to March 26."

Author: "McAllister, Janet"
Title: "Culture fest with competitive twist"
description: "Talks to Hiva Moetaua about judging the Cook Island stage at Polyfest. Touches on technical aspects of the drumming, singing, dancing, tua peu tupuna (myths and legends) sections. Notes the competitive spirit that exists between Sir Edmund Hillary Collegiate and Mangere College who at the moment dominate the Cook Island stage."

Author: "Reid, Graham,"
Title: "Illustrator's art whimisical but sometimes dark"
description: "Illustrator's art whimisical but sometimes dark"

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Essayists add intrigue to Stichbury's scintillating images"
description: "Essayists add intrigue to Stichbury's scintillating images"

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "Manhattan project"
description: "Describes how the NZ born musician has made his home in New York since 2008 and is trying to break into the music world in America. Hopes his latest album, 'Four-letter word' will be enough o establish firmer footholds in both America and NZ. Sketches the atmosphere of the music business in New York and how Simon has changed. Comments on how his family has partially supported him once he gave up his studies in post-graduate finance to follow his music career and notes 'connections' are an important factor whether success is gained or not."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry."
Title: "A slice of the Big Apple's pie"
description: "Talks to the NZ owner of Dub Pie Shop, located in New York, Gareth Hughes, who focuses on the food and drink that is familiar to NZers and Australians. Finds that most of his customers are New Yorkers and indicates he has had to educate his them about Antipodean cuisine, that he wasn't selling apple, cherry or pumpkin pies but meat pies and needed to explain the composition of a flat white."

Author: "Smith, Catherine"
Title: "Modern twist on treasure seekers"
description: "Explains a game where the players use their GPS (Global Positioning System) to find hidden secrets and then share their experiences online, through a highly active website, geocaching.com."

Author: "Warner, Kirsten"
Title: "Close to heaven"
description: "Visits and describes the author experience of Great Barrier Island."

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "They've got a ticket to ride"
description: "Describes what it takes to start pony riding and to own a pony. Includes three pony club in the Auckland area giving their details jouning fees and grazing cost."

Author: "Trevett, Claire"
Title: "Battle of port-a-loos in dusty suburbs"
description: "Battle of port-a-loos in dusty suburbs"

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Battered survivor's heart with lost family"
description: "Battered survivor's heart with lost family"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Emotional farewell to baby Jayden"
description: "Emotional farewell to baby Jayden"

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "Identification delays prolong agony for US visitor's family"
description: "Identification delays prolong agony for US visitor's family"

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Disaster turns immigrant families into refugees a second terrifying time"
description: "Disaster turns immigrant families into refugees a second terrifying time"

Title: "Breakers win some special new fans"
description: "Breakers win some special new fans"

Author: "Morgan, Jared"
Title: "Many poignant tributes for a 'born performer'"
description: "Many poignant tributes for a 'born performer'"

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "Baby trust marks loss of infant"
description: "Baby trust marks loss of infant"

Author: "Dally, Joelle"
Title: "Tragic face of quake to be laid to rest; Baker who predicted shake a 'great guy' - colleague"
description: "Tragic face of quake to be laid to rest; Baker who predicted shake a 'great guy' - colleague"

Author: "Robinson, Victoria"
Title: "Driver's selfless actions recalled"
description: "Driver's selfless actions recalled"

Author: "Ensor, Blair"
Title: "Family lays 'face of the quake' to rest"
description: "Family lays 'face of the quake' to rest"

Author: "Robinson, Victoria"
Title: "NZ couple farewell Thai 'daughter'"
description: "NZ couple farewell Thai 'daughter'"

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "Family farewell 'wonderful' dad"
description: "Family farewell 'wonderful' dad"

Author: "McKnight, Sam"
Title: "Emotional farewell to a loving mother"
description: "Emotional farewell to a loving mother"

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Inferno hero : you just do it ..."
description: "Inferno hero : you just do it ..."

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Doubts over student qualifications; Talented design students feel like failures"
description: "Focuses on the investigation of Tasman International Academies by the NZ Qualifications Authority for suppling reference letters and reports cards for work done at another school (API Institute of Education). Talks to two Korean students, Ben Baek and Christina Huh, who were given report cards containing pass marks by Tasman International Academies for design course projects originally failed at API."

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Author (detailed): "Elizabeth Binning, Isaac Davison and Jarrod Booker"
Title: "Heroes of our time; School's guiding light in a time of tragedy; The good Samaritan who paid a terrible price; Courage in the line of fire"
description: "Profiles the 31 people honoured in a Special Honours List for their heroism and bravery during a number of recent high profile tragic events. Talks to some of the recipients and their families, including Elim Christian College principal Murray Burton, the family of 'Good Samaritan' Austin Hemmings, and Napier siege survivor Lenny Holmwood, about their experiences."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Brilliance and magic inspire audience"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's Thursday performance of Dvorak's Cello Concerto and Rimsky-Korsakov's 'Scheherazade'."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Coke and Pepsi face-off an even match"
description: "Analyses and compares the ingredients of Coca-Cola and Pepsi. Highlights concerns surrounding the use of the colour Caramel IV (150d) or sulphite ammonia caramel."

Author: "Quin, Phil"
Title: "The anatomy of a failed Labour coup"
description: "Offers an insider's account of a failed party coup against Labour leader Helen Clark mounted by her eventual successor Phil Goff in May 1996."

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "A 'jolly, fat' man with the brightest of futures"
description: "Profiles the Wellington Central Member of Parliament who has been touted as a future leader of the Labour Party."

Author: "Trevett, Claire"
Title: "Quietly ambitious MP bides his time"
description: "Profiles the Labour list Member of Parliament. Talks about his potential as a future leader of the Labour Party."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Dick Scott"
description: "Talks to the historian, former journalist and communist who donated a Don Binney painting ('Kotare over the Ratana Church') to the Christchurch earthquake recovery, and which was subsequently actioned for $270,000, about his generosity and his writing."

Author: "Hartley, Simon"
Title: "Harbour plans dredge up opposition; Opponents concerned at effects of disposal; Regional council supportive, but with specific conditions; Harbour application dredges up opposition"
description: "Backgrounds the controversial 'Project Next Generation' proposal by the port company to widen and deepen 13 kilometres of the shipping channel from Port Chalmers to Taiaroa Head. Sums up arguments advanced by opponents, who will present their views to the Otago Regional Council (ORC) at a three-week resource consent hearing in Dunedin, beginning 4 Apr 2011. Summarises the staff report from the ORC, which favours granting resource consents for the proposal, subject to conditions."

Author: "McNeilly, Hamish"
Title: "Poisons centre to the rescue"
description: "Illuminates the role of the Dunedin-based poisons centre. Talks to office manager Lucy Shieffelbien and director Dr Wayne Temple about the nature of some of the 35,000 calls and Internet inquiries made to the centre each year. Lists other facts about the centre, and presents a table listing the types of calls received in various categories."

Author: "Gifford, Adam"
Title: "Where danger always lurks"
description: "Focuses on the exhibitions of two 'southern gothic' Lyttelton artists, 'Phantogram' by Jason Greig and 'Wishboneash: urns & burners' by Bill Hammond, at the Ivan Anthony Gallery until 23 April 2011. Talks to Jason Greig about his work and why he is drawn to darkness."

Author: "Knowsley, Jo"
Title: "Surf wars"
description: "Recounts recent television footage of a confrontation between a surf coach and lifesaver at Piha, raising questions about how the scene came to be filmed and broadcast on two NZ television networks. Questions the accuracy of the events that factual entertainment TV portrays. Seeks comment from Julie Christie, Graham Bell, and Sue Woodfield about unscripted entertainment, product placement, and artificial creation of drama. Quotes AUT University journalism associate professor Martin Hirst on viewers' appetites for reality televison and changes in news coverage."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Darkness and power beyond the camera"
description: "Reviews 'Nga hau e wha: The four winds' by Leilani Kake at the Fresh Gallery until 16 April, 'Smasher' by Miranda Parkes at the Antoinette Godkin Gallery until 9 April, 'Empire of idols' by James Brown at Orexart until 19 April and 'The pink book' by Jee-young Kim at the Bath Street Gallery until 16 April."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Another way of living"
description: "Examines rest home options in the Otago-Southland regions. Talks to Redroofs manager Nina Lunn about changes she has witnessed in her 25 years of working in aged care, most notably the increase in frail residents. Seeks comment from Abbeyfield chairman J.B. Munro, Chatsford village chief executive Malcolm Hendry and Massey University health psychology PhD student Barbara Horrell. Talks to several residents of rest homes about their experiences."

Author: "Bradley, Lisa"
Title: "Bright lights, uncaring city"
description: "Considers whether Auckland has been less supportive than other areas of appeals to assist Christchurch after the latest  earthquake. Talks to John Paul Moss about his failed attempt to organise a charity concert in Auckland. Seeks comment from Christchurch comedian Gary McCormick about his views on assistance given to the city."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Cleaning up the streets"
description: "Talks to business owners of a South Auckland area, Hunters Corner, who want prostitutes removed from the district. Canvasses the views of street prostitutes and notes the monitoring work carried out by NZ Prostitutes Collective regional manager Annah Pickering. Charts the progress of the Auckland Council (Regulation of Prostitution in Specified Places ) Bill and considers the impact of the decriminalisation of prostitution in 2003. Presents statistics on where most sex workers work in NZ."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Counting the cost of care; The sum of the parts; The steps to residential care; Check list for choosing a rest-home"
description: "Focuses on rest homes in Dunedin and NZ, including quality of care and the costs of moving into aged care. Reports on findings of a rest-home investigation by the Labour Party, the Green Party and Grey Power during 2010. Talks to the NZ Nurses Organisation and two rest home administrators about standards. Includes the steps involved in determining whether a person needs residential care and how to pay for it. Provides a checklist for choosing a rest home facility."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Vodka stimulates a creative cocktail"
description: "Talks to Silo Theatre artistic director Shane Bosher and director Oliver Driver about 'Did I believe it?', a play about vodka created in collaboration with 42Below, being performed at a downtown bar, 1885, 9-30 April."

Author: "Peat, Neville"
Title: "Life and death of sanctuary kiwi expressed in beeps"
description: "Talks to one of the leading volunteers at the Orokonui Sanctuary about monitoring the wild kiwi and Haast tokoeka populations there."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Everything to hope for"
description: "Interviews the Pakistan-born political commentator and relays his advice to NZ, in the March 2011 Sir Douglas Robb Lectures delivered in Auckland under the theme 'Empire and its future.'"

Author: "Fielding, J. R."
Title: "Wildman story holds up the mirror; Hungarian Holocaust tale follows path to Antipodes"
description: "Wildman story holds up the mirror; Hungarian Holocaust tale follows path to Antipodes"

Author: "Calder, Peter"
Title: "Teutonic traction"
description: "Visits Golden Bay, describing the strong German links to the area. Takes a walk in the Abel Tasman National Park, and trips over to Takaka and Wharariki Beach."

Author: "Drinnan, John"
Title: "Off the rader with wacky look"
description: "Argues Air NZ's recent 'wacky' marketing campaigns, such as the 'nothing to hide' commercials which featured staff in body paint and G-strings, may be a cost-effective way of getting noticed but they are at odds with its traditional brand values."

Author: "Hathaway, Jude"
Title: "Boys are back in town"
description: "Talks to the two designers who have returned for the id Dunedin Fashion Show, 8-9 Apr 2011. Informs that since graduating from Otago Polytechnic fashion course in the late 1990s, both designers have received national recognition for their distinctive work."

Author: "Dillon, Mike"
Title: "Rugby, racing and ... er, wine"
description: "Presents an obituary for the rugby player/coach, wine producer and racing identity."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Friendship with strings; Leap of faith brought violinist back to musical roots"
description: "Talks to University of Otago executant music lecturers Tessa Petersen and Heleen du Plessis about their upcoming performance of Brahms' 'Concerto for violin and cello', accompanied by the Southern Sinfonia, Dunedin Town Hall, 2 Apr 2011. Describes the nature of the concerto. Talks to the violinist about her decision to return to Dunedin after living and working in the United States for 13 years. Describes her musical training."

Author: "Body, Ralph"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Te Putahitanga o Rehua' by Reuben Paterson, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 10 Jul 2011.  Reviews 'Paper work', by Phillip James Frost, A Gallery, Dunedin, until 9 Apr 2011.  Reviews 'Life spirit' by Llew Summers and Emma Milburn, The Artist's Room, Dunedin."

Author: "Pickmere, Arnold"
Title: "Pianist had sixth sense when tuning in with singers"
description: "Pianist had sixth sense when tuning in with singers"

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Call unites refugee with his lost family"
description: "Call unites refugee with his lost family"

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Dog triallist enjoys the teamwork"
description: "Profiles the dog triallist who, with her five-year-old dog Ghost, won the 2010-11 Tux New Zealand yarding challenge."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Relishing life in the high country but North Shore is still home"
description: "Talks to the Auckland entrepreneurs who in 2008 purchased their first farm, Lake McKay Station, on land directly opposite Wanaka Airport.
