Explains why they decided to purchase such an unforgiving, barren and rabbit-plagued property. Discusses his background in dairy farming in Taranaki. Describes their farming vision."

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Morrice: I plan to quit this year"
description: "Morrice: I plan to quit this year"

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Songs of my father"
description: "Talks to the Auckland singer, and father of singer Annie Crummer, about the inspiration behind his new album 'Shoebox love songs: the Rarotongan Music of Will Crummer', a collection of romantic songs, party tunes and traditional Cook Island favourites complied from the remembered lyrics he wrote down and stored in a shoebox when he left Rarotonga in the early 1960s."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Made by hand"
description: "Talks to five Auckland women who have started their own creative cottage industries, including fashion designing sisters Gua and Nilla Loheni (LewLew), ginger beer brewer Rebekah Hay (Hakanoa Handmade Ginger Beer), wall decorator Brigitte Smits (Wallflower) and vegan food developer Alice Leonard (Angel Food)."

Author: "Robertson, Stephanie"
Title: "Training key, farmer says"
description: "Talks to the dairy farmer about why he encourages farm trainees to train through the Agricultural Industry Training Organisation (AgITO). Describes benefits to the farm as a whole, and discusses the training courses he is currently taking with AgITO."

Author: "Vine, Gillian"
Title: "Producer made lavender machines"
description: "Producer made lavender machines"

Author: "Dodgshun, Joe"
Title: "'In sync'; Burying the cow's horn"
description: "Features the award-winning Bannockburn-based winery. Talks to the viticulturalist about its certified biodynamic operations based on the principles of the late German philosopher Rudolf Steiner. Explains the significance of burying cows' horns in the soil."

Author: "Hartevelt, John"
Title: "Democracy sidelined under Cera"
description: "Details the powers that the Cabinet has agreed to invest in the chief executive of Cera (Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority). Considers the effect of this relinquishing of control coming on the heels of the Government's sacking of Environment Canterbury in 2010.  Describes the development of an inner city earthquake recovery plan, led by the City Council, to which Christchurch residents will be able to contribute, as well a community forum, noting these fora will act as checks on Cera's power."

Author: "Lancashire, John"
Title: "Free trade presents risk to biosecurity"
description: "Comments on concerns expressed by agricultural and primary producers about biosecurity and the provisions of the Bill. Suggests that free trade and other agricultural policies are behind the Government stance to relax import controls on honey and raw pig meat."

Author: "Carville, Olivia"
Title: "The art of staying upbeat and dancing to a winner"
description: "The art of staying upbeat and dancing to a winner"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Forest's need for native forests proven"
description: "Reports on research by University of Canterbury and Landcare Research that prove that falling populations of the native wood pigeon (kereru) are impacting seed dispersal, especially for taraire and karaka trees."

Title: "Dyed in the wool : handler's 50-year interest"
description: "Profiles the woolhandler and wool classer who is the president of the NZ Merino Shearing Society. Informs that the society celebrates its 50th anniversary on 31 Sep-1 Oct 2011."

Title: "Manager enjoys working with range of operations"
description: "Profiles the extension manager for the central South Island for the beef and lamb enterprise formerly known as Meat and Wool NZ. Describes its operations and regional delivery plan. Informs of a field day at Millers Flat, 7 Apr 2011."

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "Big country, big money"
description: "Investigates whether NZers are better off moving to Australia, profiling two NZ couples who now live there. Seeks comment from BNZ chief economist Tony Alexander on factors that make Australia an attractive destination. Gives a list of wage comparisons in the following industries: mining, manufacturing, construction, finance and insurance services, and arts, recreation and other services."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Bumpy ride for insurance"
description: "Documents cases where insurance companies have disputed or failed yet to pay on earthquake related claims. Describes the scale of the task facing the Earthquake Commission, outlining its procedures and mistakes corrected after the 4 Sept 2010 earthquake. Seeks comment from Chris Ryan, chief executive of the Insurance Council on the response from private insurers."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Get away!; showing 'em how"
description: "Goes mustering on Tinline Downs (Waiau, North Canterbury), owned by Kara Lynn and Steve Palmer, relaying how a 'townie' fares as he joins other musterers to round up perendale sheep from the ridges of the high country station."

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "Toxic suburb; Homeowners slip into a suburban nightmare"
description: "Focuses on the health implications for residents of 125 properties in Onekawa Park, a Napier suburb built on top of a former landfill site that was closed in the late 1950s. Reveals results of tests of waste toxicity tests that found lead, arsenic and cadmium levels above acceptable residential levels. Talks to residents and Napier City Council chief executive Neil Taylor about the findings. Includes a timeline of events from pre-1932 to 29 Mar 2011."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "A passionate athlete and a dedicated teacher"
description: "A passionate athlete and a dedicated teacher"

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "How ever shall I get that stain out?"
description: "Reviews the Victorian guide to domestic life, Enquire within upon everything (1856), for advice on a curry stained carpet, and finds some arresting items among the 2300-plus tips."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "Toy story"
description: "Overviews the toy manufacturing industry, looking at the type, amount, short life span and variety of toys today. Notes comments by historian Gary Cross in his 'Kid's stuff : toys and the changing world of American childhood' about toys that ignorechildren's and parent's needs. Covers the Toy Toy toy museum in Nelson, talking to owner Paul Hargreaves. Looks at educational toys, 'green' toys, role play toys, and pet rocks."

Author: "Fisher, Amanda"
Title: "[Bravery awards]"
description: "Reports on the recipients of the New Zealand Bravery Awards conferred on 31 individuals, including some posthumously, 2 Apr 2011. Describes the circumstances leading to the awards, including the Napier siege of 2009, the Mangatepopo Gorge tragedy in 2008 and the explosion at the Tamahere Icepak Coolstore, Waikato, 2008. Talks to some of the recipients about their reaction to the awards or citations they received. Includes a report on the honorary NZ Bravery Awards given to American sailors Maurice Conti and Sophie Conti, who rescued three people, including Southland woman Alison Timms, from the yacht 'Timella' on 13 Oct 2008."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Altar ego"
description: "Reconstructs the transformation of the 1863 St Mary of the Assumption Catholic church into a restaurant and function venue  by Karen Sandler and husband Paul Hill, noting the church's history and describing its current sacred and opulent features."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Warning of she'll-be-right climate change attitude"
description: "Reports on the recent Climate Futures Forum, organised by the Climate Change Institute at Victoria University of Wellington. Talks to visiting British expert Dr Fred Pearce, who generated controversy in 2009 when he accused NZ of greenwashing in a column he wrote for the 'Guardian'. Asserts that industrialised nations risk becoming apathetic about climate change after the failure of the Copenhagen talks. Sums up presentations to the forum by Dr Pearce, Climate Change Institute founding director Prof Martin Manning and Environment Minister Nick Smith."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "The misfortunes of David Vann"
description: "Talks to the Alaskan-born author about his latest book, 'Caribou Island', and discusses suicide, the dark side of marriage, and the transformative power of writing. Notes his teaching stint at the Victoria University International Institute of Modern Letters and his other connections to New Zealand."

Author: "Curry, Joan"
Title: "From sanctuary to prison for lost boys"
description: "From sanctuary to prison for lost boys"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Student stuck in riot-torn Tunisia"
description: "Student stuck in riot-torn Tunisia"

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Terminal outpost; A vibrant Paraparaumu Airport 'the golden goose' for Kapiti; Who is Sir Noel?"
description: "Talks to the entrepreneur and philanthropist behind the proposed redevelopment of the airport, including a new terminal and a business park. Discusses his family link to the Kapiti Coast and overviews his career, beginning as a cadet at Fisher & Paykel, then owned by his uncle, Sir Woolf Fisher, before founding Robinson Industries. Touches on his development projects in Auckland Focuses on the planned development in Paraparaumu that would provide a major economic boost to the area. Seeks comment from others including Kapiti Mayor Jenny Rowan and former Manukau mayor Sir Barry Curtis, as well as from those who have opposed the Kapiti Coast development."

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "Chasing the Australian dream"
description: "Explores whether expatriate NZers are better off living in Australia, despite earning higher wages across the Tasman. Profiles three couples and the hotel management trainee about their experiences and the differences in wages and benefits. Seeks comment from BNZ chief economist Tony Alexander and Marc Burrager, NZ general manager of recruiting company Hudsons, about the cost of living in Australia and the likelihood of further flight across the Tasman. Includes wage comparisons between the two countries for various occupations."

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Be careful, begs grieving dad: Hibiscus Coast rugby league club farewells second player this month"
description: "Be careful, begs grieving dad: Hibiscus Coast rugby league club farewells second player this month"

Author: "Harris, Catherine"
Title: "A policy of no tears after calamity; Beware of cheap insurance policies without first checking for 'fishhooks'"
description: "Investigates whether people can afford to be without insurance cover after the Christchurch earthquake. Talks to the Wairarapa woman whose rented house was destroyed by fire in 2006. Seeks views of Insurance Council chief executive Chris Ryan, Kapiti financial adviser Liz Koh, business development manager Terri Carrick and Insurance and Savings Ombudsman Karen Stevens. Discusses the relatively common practice among celebrities to insure body parts. Speaks to a specialist broker about the dearth of 'personal accident' insurance in NZ. Estimates 'multi-policy' insurance premiums for a hypothetical family of four living in Johnsonville."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Altar ego"
description: "Reconstructs the transformation of the 1863 St Mary of the Assumption Catholic church into a restaurant and function venue  by Karen Sandler and husband Paul Hill, noting the church's history and describing its current sacred and opulent features."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "Toy story"
description: "Overviews the toy manufacturing industry, looking at the type, amount, short life span and variety of toys today. Notes comments by historian Gary Cross in his 'Kid's stuff : toys and the changing world of American childhood' about toys that ignorechildren's and parent's needs. Covers the Toy Toy toy museum in Nelson, talking to owner Paul Hargreaves. Looks at educational toys, 'green' toys, role play toys, and pet rocks."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "How ever shall I get that stain out?"
description: "Reviews the Victorian guide to domestic life, Enquire within upon everything (1856), for advice on a curry stained carpet, and finds some arresting items among the 2300-plus tips."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "The misfortunes of David Vann"
description: "Talks to the Alaskan-born author about his latest book, 'Caribou Island', and discusses suicide, the dark side of marriage, and the transformative power of writing. Notes his teaching stint at the Victoria University International Institute of Modern Letters and his other connections to New Zealand."

Author: "Curry, Joan"
Title: "From sanctuary to prison for lost boys"
description: "From sanctuary to prison for lost boys"

Author: "Galuszka, Jono"
Title: "A shot at the title"
description: "Meets the young barista who has been in the industry since he was 15 years old. Discusses his career to date and informs that he now owns the Memphis Belle Coffee House. Shares his philosophy of coffee brewing. Mentions that he is competting in the Wellington heats of the New Zealand Barista Championship, 2 Apr 2011."

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Burnt mother's misery: international manhunt for husband and pair's son, 4"
description: "Burnt mother's misery: international manhunt for husband and pair's son, 4"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "I was a right plum, says Devlin"
description: "I was a right plum, says Devlin"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Runner-up aims to go one better"
description: "Runner-up aims to go one better"

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Burnt-alive suspect expected to be a priest"
description: "Burnt-alive suspect expected to be a priest"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Golden days"
description: "Talks to the retired journalist and public relations specialist about his recollections of growing up in Wellington in the 1950s, as captured in his new memoir."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Indulge"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-born, Southland-raised curator of MaÃÑori and indigenous art at Te Papa about her career, indulgences, leisure interests and her passion for travel."

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "Slavery at sea; NZ caught in fishing brutality"
description: "Investigates abysmal working conditions on foreign-crewed fishing vessels hired by NZ companies and operating in NZ waters. Reveals findings of papers released under the Official Information Act, Divulges that Government has known for some time about exploitation of workers on foreign charter vessels, hired by NZ companies to catch quota allocated to Maori under Treaty of Waitangi settlements. Details working conditions including violence and neglect, and discusses the sinking of two vessels with the loss of 28 lives. Seeks comment from Peter Talley, chief executive of Talley's Fisheries, and acting Immigration NZ head Stephen Dunstan."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "An independent heart"
description: "Talks to the founder of NZ's first ethnic women's refuge. Focuses on her new autobiography that covers her arranged marriage that took her from her native Bangladesh to Iraq, her decision to leave her husband, her feminism and her ongoing compromises to reconcile Western and Islamic cultures. Touches on the complex issue of underage marriage and discusses the role of Shakti."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "High hopes, broken promises"
description: "Investigates the efficacy of a radical social housing experiment by Housing NZ (HNZ) and the Auckland City Council to invest $50 million to transform a socially deprived East Auckland suburb into an attractive, safe community. Talks to residents of Talbot Park, Glen Innes, about whether this expenditure has altered their living conditions or is merely window dressing. Seeks views of former HNZ project manager Stuart Bracey, former Talbot Park tenancy manager Jess Denholm and others about why the project has not worked. Informs that if successful, the 'community renewal' experiment was meant to be replicated in other parts of NZ."

Author: "Fox, Derek"
Title: "Feeding the forgotten; A lot of Mana"
description: "Relates the experience of helping to set up and take part in a Te Puna Kokiri project ('Team Tunutunu') to help the people of the city's eastern suburbs (Aranui, Bexley, Wainoni) eleven days after the devesting earthquake. Argues that the official earthquake relief effort, and the attention of the media, was focused on the CBD (central business district), which left the people of the poorer eastern suburbs feeling like 'forgotten people'. Mentions that Mana magazine will publish its 100th issue, Jun 2011."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Letting his camera do the talking"
description: "Letting his camera do the talking"

Author: "Oram, Rod"
Title: "Our own point of difference"
description: "Focuses on two new initiatives that are looking towards international success by applying pioneering business models that draw some of their inspiration from sport. Talks to PureBlack Racing founders Greg Cross and Carl Williams about the team's plans to compete in the 2015 Tour de France. Speaks to Mike Chunn about his Enterprising Music Competition for secondary school students."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Brand Brown"
description: "Talks to the new mother about the DVD of the second and final series of her TV3 show. Discusses motherhood and upcoming projects, including a 'funny and honest' book she is writing about pregnancy, and a new series to be filmed with TV1."

Author: "Wood, Andrew Paul,"
Title: "The generosity of crowds; Success stories"
description: "Suggests that cash-hungry arts organisations could tap into large online communities to gain additional funding. Explains the concept of  'crowdfunding', in which members of online communities provide small donations towards the funding of creative and other ventures. Asks Creative New Zealand chief executive Stephen Wainwright, Arts  Foundation head Simon Bowden, Ministry of Culture and Heritage chief executive Lewis Holden and other about the feasibility of the concept to solve arts funding shortfalls. Speaks to West Coast singer Katie Thompson about using crowdfunding to fund her album, and looks at other overseas artists who have used the concept successfully. Provides facts about arts funding by source."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "A different tune; The men of Go Girls"
description: "Talks to the actor about his new role as taxi driver/musician Joel in the popular drama programme. Contrasts this romantic role with his former role as serial killer Joey Henderson on 'Shortland Street'. Briefly profiles four other male actors on 'Go Girls'."

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "Holy cow! Moo-ving stories of our four-legged superheroes"
description: "Holy cow! Moo-ving stories of our four-legged superheroes"

Author: "Jones, Bridget"
Title: "Sports body wants vetting for all kids' coaches"
description: "Sports body wants vetting for all kids' coaches"

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "Breakages turned into objects of beauty"
description: "Breakages turned into objects of beauty"

Title: "Ballet star steps up to make The Pledge"
description: "Ballet star steps up to make The Pledge"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "New mum dies after farewell to daughter"
description: "New mum dies after farewell to daughter"

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Parking warden"
description: "Talks to the West Auckland parking warden about her job."

Author: "Greive, Duncan"
Title: "An embarrassment of riches"
description: "Talks to the pop musician about her new album. Responds to criticisms that her achievements are attributable to being the daughter of Sir Michael Fay, and that she should not have received a $70,000 grant from NZ On Air to fund her album. Discusses some aspects of her upbringing and the double-edged sword of being wealthy."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Rest home confidential"
description: "Talks to population researcher Liz Kiata-Holland about some of the results of her doctoral study of people born between 1903 and 1939 who reside in Auckland and Christchurch rest homes. Discusses residents' attitudes towards living in a rest home, their interests and activities, and their relationships with others."

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Man who almost got away with murder"
description: "Man who almost got away with murder"

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "The agony and the ecstasy"
description: "Focuses on the difficulties of breastfeeding and some of the things that women are not told about this 'natural' practice. Assures women that breastfeeding does get easier with time."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Friend tells of wife's ultimatum before murder"
description: "Friend tells of wife's ultimatum before murder"

Title: "Life support shut down, then crash victim gets better"
description: "Life support shut down, then crash victim gets better"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Injured schoolgirl's parents reassure distraught driver"
description: "Injured schoolgirl's parents reassure distraught driver"

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Mass cycle tragedy : Mum loses fight for life"
description: "Mass cycle tragedy : Mum loses fight for life"

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Hunter 'terrified' of going to jail"
description: "Hunter 'terrified' of going to jail"

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Life-saver searches for hero who saved him 35 years ago"
description: "Life-saver searches for hero who saved him 35 years ago"

Title: "Polar pilot stands up for Sir Ed"
description: "Polar pilot stands up for Sir Ed"

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Title: "'Love carrots' auction to aid family"
description: "'Love carrots' auction to aid family"

Author: "Morgan, Jon"
Title: "Ex-AB prop winning wine battle up front"
description: "Ex-AB prop winning wine battle up front"

Author: "Feek, Belinda"
Title: "Kiwis caught up in Tunisia violence"
description: "Kiwis caught up in Tunisia violence"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Pilot could dance with the clouds"
description: "Pilot could dance with the clouds"

Author: "Evans, Ryan"
Title: "Waldrom tackles Chiefs' challenge"
description: "Waldrom tackles Chiefs' challenge"

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Sth Waikato music lovers in for flights of fantasy"
description: "Sth Waikato music lovers in for flights of fantasy"

Author: "Risk, Louise"
Title: "Racing legend back behind the wheel"
description: "Racing legend back behind the wheel"

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "Cutting mealtime break eats into fun"
description: "Cutting mealtime break eats into fun"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Missing swimmer found safe on land"
description: "Missing swimmer found safe on land"

Author: "De Lacy, Hugh"
Title: "Quake rocks retail revival"
description: "Assesses the effect on the retail trade of the 22 Feb earthquake in Christchurch. Seeks comment from Retailers Association chief executive John Albertson on his outlook for the retail sector.  Celebrates the rise in prices enjoyed in the dairy, wool and lamb sectors, and anticipates benefits for retail and hospitality sectors associated with the Football World Cup starting on 9 Sept."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Challenge to an all-embracing bylaw"
description: "Reviews and considers the wider implications of Schubert v Wanganui District Council [2011] NZHC 48, asking whether the city council had the power or authority to make a bylaw banning gang members from wearing patches (insignia) in the city's public places."

Author: "Kelly, Greg"
Title: "What happens when gift duty goes?"
description: "Considers the implications of the Government abolishing gift duty from 1 Oct 2011, describing how it will affect the administration of trusts. Explains the process of transferring assets to a trust after 1 Oct."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Troubled properties still overhang market"
description: "Notes the confidence levels of property investors in Queenstown, Auckland and Christchurch, noting cool responses to development sales in Queenstown. Looks also at nationwide mortgagee sales of rural properties and recent sales in the corporate office sector."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Brotherly love"
description: "Traces the history of the Mission Estate winery, Taradale, from its beginnings in an error on the part of the founding Marist Brothers. Covers the change in management in the early 1970s, the now discontinued Fontanella sparkling wine, and the annual Mission concert."

Author: "McMilllan, Neale"
Title: "Quality of regulations to be tested"
description: "Sets out the three components of a Regulatory Standards Bill aimed at improving the quality of regulation making and accountability of regulation makers, noting the measure is based on a report by former Treasury secretary Graham Scott. Advises of the Bill's effect on local regulations."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "Rising from the ashes"
description: "Continues advice to businesses on the need to plan for disaster recovery and business continuity. Outlines the main steps to take regarding staff, records, insurance, and cash levels. Warns also of the effects of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)."

Author: "Withington, Barbara"
Title: "Fun-loving mentor will be missed"
description: "Fun-loving mentor will be missed"

Author: "Johnston, Cris"
Title: "Performance dedicated to late playwright"
description: "Performance dedicated to late playwright"

Author: "Harding, Evan"
Title: "Have mid-life crisis, will build own car"
description: "Have mid-life crisis, will build own car"

Author: "Hutchinson, Dan"
Title: "Auction building closing : 56 years in business and no regrets"
description: "Auction building closing : 56 years in business and no regrets"

Author: "Gerken, Sonia"
Title: "Vigil promotes true meaning of Easter"
description: "Vigil promotes true meaning of Easter"

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "MacDonald still taking a keen interest in racing"
description: "MacDonald still taking a keen interest in racing"

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Kylee 'devastated and relieved'"
description: "Kylee 'devastated and relieved'"

Title: "Witness to changes in the country's justice system"
description: "Witness to changes in the country's justice system"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Graduating despite harrowing two years"
description: "Graduating despite harrowing two years"

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Boarding house horrors"
description: "Investigates the conditions in which some families are living, particularly those in boarding houses in Auckland. Recounts the stories of people who live in the boarding housesand their wish to get into state housing accommodation. Notes the agency created to ensure every Kiwi is housed is discouraging people who are seeking help from formally registering their need."

Title: "Engineer's passion was for swift motorcycles"
description: "Engineer's passion was for swift motorcycles"

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Shooting death shades town; Friendly, lively and much-loved"
description: "Shooting death shades town; Friendly, lively and much-loved"

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Crawford claims 16th centre title"
description: "Crawford claims 16th centre title"

Title: "Ziele respected in charity, business"
description: "Ziele respected in charity, business"

Title: "Parish priest's kindness recalled"
description: "Parish priest's kindness recalled"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Saddle bronc stays on top as champion"
description: "Saddle bronc stays on top as champion"

Author: "Nash, Kieran"
Title: "Bus pledge just 'hot air'"
description: "Recounts opinions and travel experiences from bus commuter of Auckland city's bus transportation system with accusations of it being overcrowded and over priced."

Author: "Gillies, Abby"
Title: "Tourists taken for a ride"
description: "Recounts the situation an English couple, Angela and Alan Stephenson, found themselves in when their rental car broke down in Motueka 6 weeks into a 10 week trip. Includes a list of what to do if you have a problem with rental car problems."

Author: "Johannsen, Dana"
Title: "Junior van Dyk set for on-screen debut"
description: "Junior van Dyk set for on-screen debut"

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "The bordello brothers"
description: "Profiles the Hong Kong born brothers, describing their sex trade business in Wellington and outlining their plans to build a 10 storey brothel in Auckland. Highlights controversy over council demolition of the 1886 Palace Hotel originally occupying the brothel site. Touches on criticism of sex worker conditions. Describes the brothers' entry into the adult entertainment business and their experience as immigrants."

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Students can't  speak English : teachers; diploma holder says qualification worthless"
description: "Voices the concerns of former employees over Auckland Cornell Institute of Business and Technology accepting and graduating international students with low English ability. Cites a reply to the criticisms by Institute owner Andrew Do. Notes the resignation of former employee Nicky Van der Bergh and reminds of a similar case involving Judy Kraidy who resigned from the NZ Institute of Commerce. Talks to former student Shelley Dean about being misled about the status of her business qualification."

Author: "Eriksen, Alanah"
Title: "'Naff' royal love film good fun, says NZ star"
description: "'Naff' royal love film good fun, says NZ star"

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "The kiwi and the dragon"
description: "Overviews the impact of China on the NZ economy and culture, supplying statistics on Chinese immigrants, international students, tourists, investment, and imports and exports. Distinguishes patterns of settlement of Chinese migrants in NZ. Notes the influence of migrant investors on Auckland real estate. Points out the effect of Chinese migrants on local student achievement and use of public transport. Looks at the prominence of Chinese migrants in medicine, the arts and politics."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Louisa Wall"
description: "Talks to the Labour Party MP about the prospect of replacing former MP Darren Hughes. Discusses her national representative netball and rugby union player career and whether confidence is an issue for her."

Author: "Herrick, Linda"
Title: "Greater than knowledge"
description: "Talks to the Taranaki artist about the trauma behind his artistic inspiration, the narrative element and unconscious dimension in his painting, and why he gave up teaching to paint. Details his exhibition The Farmer, showing at the Artis Gallery, Parnell, to 30 April 2011."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "All fun and no shushing"
description: "Previews four school holiday theatre shows for the family: The lighthouse keeper's lunch, The Pumphouse, Takapuna, 16-30 April; Pollyhood in Mumuland, Mangere Arts Centre, 16-30 April; Cinderella, Bruce Mason Centre, Takapuna, 26 April-1May; and Boxes, Herald Theatre, 16-21 April."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Avalon fades into legend"
description: "Charts the rise and fall of TVNZ's Avalon Studios in Lower Hutt, the former hub of NZ television, which is to be wound down and sold by 2013 as a result of TVNZ's move away from studio-based broadcasting and its centralisation in Auckland. Speaks to actor Ray Henwood, former current affairs interviewer and TVNZ chief executive Ian Fraser, media commentator Brian Edwards, Rimutaka MP Chris Hipkins, 'Fair go' presenter Kevin Milne and 'Dancing with the stars' host Jason Gunn about their memories of Avalon and its demise. Reminisces about some memorable television moments filmed at Avalon. Lists the television shows made at the studios. Speculates on the future of the facilities."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Experiment with light lets energy shine through"
description: "Previews three exhibitions at Auckland galleries: Lucifer: bring the light!, by Judy Millar, at Gow Langsford Gallery, to 22 April; One and the other, by Cruz Jimenez, Sanderson Contemporary Art, Parnell, to 10 April; and The music of change, by Simon Esling, at Melanie Roger Gallery, Herne Bay to 16 April."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "We've got to get out of this place"
description: "Previews the play Flightless Birds written by Sam Berkley and performed by Catalyst Theatre, Musgrove Studio, Maidment Theatre, 13-21 April. Previews Boy's Life, Basement Theatre, 13-23 April."

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "''Mid-life epiphany' leads TV host to healing career"
description: "''Mid-life epiphany' leads TV host to healing career"

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Bad sports"
description: "Declares a range of educational options available to children has become dependent upon the parent's ability to pay for additional classes. Notes the different between high and low decile schools in terms of the additional extra-curricula activity classes available or not available and the finance required to fund these activities. Focuses on the costs of engaging children in sport whether it be via the school or a sporting club. Asserts these additional classes are essential for turning out well-rounded children."

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "Learning to live with loss of a limb"
description: "Focuses on the relatively common procedure of limb amputation. Finds that every year nearly 400 people lose limbs, mainly because of vascular problems or diabetes. Talks about the physical and emotional impact of the loss on amputees with experts such as Karen Michalanney, a field officer for the Amputee Society of Wellington, and Philippa Williams, a physiotherapist at the Wellington Artificial Limb Centre. Speaks to double-amputee Ben Hekenui about how his life changed after losing his legs in a baling machine. Briefly explains how a lower leg is amputated. Mentions the case of Brian Coker who had both legs amputated to free him from rubble after the 22 February 2011 Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Francis, Clio"
Title: "Seeking to shed light on a dark time"
description: "Focuses on the new documentary 'Operation 8: deep in the forest', which looks at the aftermath of the 2007 Urewera (Ruatoki) antiterrorism police raids on those arrested for suspected terrorism activities. Talks to documentary makers Errol Wright and Abi King-Jones about why they made the film. Includes a timeline of events associated with the raids."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "Patron saint"
description: "Profiles the high-profile owner of some of Wellington's most popular drinking establishments who is also the patron/owner of the professional basketball team the Wellington Saints. Talks about his career in the hospitality industry, which started at the Grand Hotel when he was a 15-year-old Tawa College pupil."

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "The hole truth"
description: "Looks at various pieces of social research and the conclusions they draw. Discovers an article in the New York Times that indicates 'dental cavities are contagious'. Indicates people who go to the doctor and are prescribed blood pressure medication often don't have the condition (37%) and living in an urban environment instead of a rural setting is much better for your health. Discusses the recent results of a survey which indicated 16% of managers and employees in Australia and NZ hate their jobs and another 48% don't care where they work."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Daring dairies"
description: "Meets dairy owners who are prepared to adapt in order to survive the demise of the traditional corner store. Speaks to David Whitfield from the Wainui Store in Gisborne, Mike Pickett from the Renall Street Store in Masterton and Arun Patel from the Choc Fizz dairy in Wellington about how they have been able to survive. Looks at the various reasons behind the demise of dairies. Talks to diary owner Naginbhai (Neil) Patel about his concerns surrounding the Alcohol Reform Bill, which will mean dairies and convenience stores will no longer be able to sell alcohol. Explains the origins of the word 'dairy'."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Dog tucker"
description: "Asserts if the question 'Do you support your leader?' needs to be asked "voters get a mental picture of the leader in a hospital gown, trailing a saline drip, and with emergency plasma packs already on the back-order". Examines who the front-runners are for the leader of the Labour Party. Assesses the performance of Phil Goff on how he has handled the Darren Hughes incident and recounts other Labour Party members' responses to Goff's handling of the case. Includes a list of the author's selected contenders with a short assessment: Andrew Little, David Cunliffe, Trevor Mallard, Grant Robertson, David Parker, David Shearer, Shane Jones, Maryann Street and Ruth Dyson."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "His way and the highway"
description: "Talks to the architect David Melling about the urban enclave he has created in Abel Smith Street next to the inner-city bypass."

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Suspended animation"
description: "Talks to the author and Hutt Valley High School teacher about his new novel aimed at teenagers 'August' and the success of his eighth novel 'Genesis'."

Author: "Moore, Carla"
Title: "Reaching the heart of the horse world"
description: "Reviews 'The horse in New Zealand: attitude & heart'."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "A looming crisis"
description: "Considers the expected rapid rise in numbers of dementia patients in NZ. Focuses on the case of Kate Clark, a former trade unionist and wife of Al Morrison, driector-general of DoC, who has the illness. States that demetia experts and advocates are calling for a more compassionate, 'person-centred' approach to care that tries to resolve dementia's associated behavioural problems by making sufferers more contented, instead of prescribing antipsychotic drugs. Talks to American Richard Taylor, a former psychology professor and dementia consumer advocate who has had the illness for nearly a decade, about how to interact with a family member who has dementia. Looks at a controversial new British approach for supporting dementia sufferers that is gaining followers here in NZ."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Home sweeter home"
description: "Examines where the money is being spent on residential dwellings. Indicates an increasing proportion is being spent on renovation rather than creating new homes in these economic hard times. Notes also as an example, not only the amount of money spent on a refit is being pared back but the size of the refit is being reconsidered (i.e. smaller). Points out that new garages are the most popular addition (30% of consent work) with decks, bedrooms and bathrooms tied in second place making up 12% of consent work. Includes comment in the sub-article 'Do it now' from the building industry and economists indicating it is a good time to carry out renovations in terms of price of materials and availability of tradesmen."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Treasure hunt"
description: "Investigates the story of how three significant NZ artifacts, gifted to a British museum, ended up for sale in a London antique shop. Asserts the value of taonga that lie in the possession of overseas collections, and stresses the importance of having a clear history of provenance and transparent deaccessioning. [Print exclusive]"

Author: "Fenwick, Mary"
Title: "Gillian Greer : a successful New Zealander flying the flag overseas"
description: "Profiles the career paths of Gillian Greer, now Director Genral, International Planned Parenthood Federation (a provider of sexual and reproductive health services), being named as one of the 100 stand-out people who have delivered for women globally. Notes her personal views of women in society and the need to give women, especially young women, a voice about having children."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Frustration grows"
description: "Criticises the government's response to the Christchurch earthquakes. Alleges that the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority demonstrates a good example of how not to run a recovery. Stresses the need for the organisation to be flexible, open and capable of engaging with local community leaders. Highlights the plight of residents in the badly-hit eastern suburbs, some of whom are still waiting for running water to be restored."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Visions of Joanna"
description: "Follows one of Britain's best best-selling authors as she tours NZ. Reviews her new book 'Daughters-in-law'."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "'Daughters-in-law' by Joanna Trollope"
description: "Follows one of Britain's best best-selling authors as she tours NZ. Reviews her new book 'Daughters-in-law'."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "Let's play house"
description: "Reviews Frances Walsh's history of the NZ housewife, suggesting there is too much reliance on old magazines, with not enough historical content."

Author: "Heine, Conrad"
Title: "John Buchanan"
description: "Profiles John Buchanan who has been on the executive board as chief financial officer of British Petroleum (BP) and now having retired is chair of Smith & Nephew and is a Vodafone and BHP-Billiton director. Traces his career path within the BP organisation in the UK and also in NZ and indicates how being a NZer has its advantages when working in the UK. Recounts what has happened to BP since he left the organisation."

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "[Rural health]"
description: "Focuses on various aspects of how health services are provided in Otago and Southland by the Southern District Health Board, and changes that are being proposed by the DHB. Reports on the proposed integrated family health centre. Seeks comment from health services chiefs in Clutha, Dunstan, the Waitaki District and Wanaka about local needs and initiatives. Provides information about existing Southern DHB services."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "SkyCity : RWC build on the menu"
description: "Examines the work being done by the listed casino owner to benefit from the Rugby World Cup to be held in NZ later this year, including the construction of three new signature restaurants and bars."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Beating the violence; Beating the violence - and keeping yourself safe"
description: "Focuses on a self-defence course run by Geoff Todd to help people keep safe on city streets. Talks to a man who was attacked three years ago in the early morning on Princes St., and who has participated in the course. Speaks to Inspector Alastair Dickie about the self-defence provisions in sections 48 and 62 of the Crimes Act. Advises on what people can do to avoid becoming a victim of violent assaults."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Driven to change; Pedal power; Time to consider diesel?"
description: "Explores the implications of increased fuel prices and the rise in GST on domestic travel. Cites findings from the Domestic Travel Survey undertaken by the Ministry of Economic Development in 2008 and 2010, which showed a reduction in both overnight and day trips. Quotes other research on oil demand, including research commissioned by the Dunedin City Council. Seeks comment from Shamubeel Eaqub, principal economist at the NZ Institute of Economic Research, and Sarah Todd, pro-vice-chancellor at the University of Otago, and Green Party transport spokesman Gareth Hughes. Asks three Dunedin residents about their car usage.  Talks to University of Otago marketing senior lecturer - and keen cyclist - Ben Williscroft about his 2007 survey on ways to improve conditions for cyclists. Asks ODT motoring writer David Thomson about diesel cars and other alternatives to petrol."

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Our own house physician"
description: "Talks to medical consultant Phillippa Poole who describes how she manages to find out what is wrong with patients and how to go about making difficult diagnoses. Includes three questions, sourced from the book How doctors think by Jerome Groopman, you should ask your doctor if there is difficulty in diagnosing a patient's illness. Illustrates with examples with complex diagnoses and their outcome."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Bringing people together"
description: "Talks to the professional conference organiser about her work."

Title: "Posthumous awards among honours list; Bravery award recipients"
description: "Reports on the recipients of the New Zealand Bravery Awards, which were issued on 2 Apr 2011 as the 2011 Special Honours List. Names each of the winners, including some posthumous awards, and describes their acts of heroism. Includes additional information about those who won the New Zealand Bravery Star for their actions in the Mangatepopo Gorge tragedy and the Napier siege."

Author: "Gregg, Stacy"
Title: "Once were workers"
description: "Reviews the new publication by Carolyn Mincham which traces the history of the horse in NZ, from the hard-working colonial model to the present-day eventing thoroughbred."

Author: "Gregg, Stacy"
Title: "The horse in New Zealand : attitude & heart by Carolyn Mincham"
description: "Reviews the new publication by Carolyn Mincham which traces the history of the horse in NZ, from the hard-working colonial model to the present-day eventing thoroughbred."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Relishing director's role; The actors"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-raised artistic director and the two young actors who play the lead roles in 'Riverside Drive', written by the late Graeme Tetley. Informs that the production is part of the Wanaka Festival of Colour, Hawea Flat Hall, 12-16 Apr 2011."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Shades of blue and clear' by Galia Amsel, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 27 Apr 2011.  Reviews 'An Alternative history' by Ben Cauchi, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Seat assignment' by Nina Katchadourian, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 17 Jul 2011."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Rock stars"
description: "Reports on the country's first rock art centre, situated in Timaru, which has been some $3 million and eight years  in the making. Emphasises the importance of the 'world's oldest art galleries', as the Centre provides an innovative overview of NZ's most valuable and overlooked art collection. Suggests a library or reference section would be a welcome addition to the experience, for those wanting to learn more."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Te Ana Rock Art Centre"
description: "Reports on the country's first rock art centre, situated in Timaru, which has been some $3 million and eight years  in the making. Emphasises the importance of the 'world's oldest art galleries', as the Centre provides an innovative overview of NZ's most valuable and overlooked art collection. Suggests a library or reference section would be a welcome addition to the experience, for those wanting to learn more."

Author: "Sandys, Elspeth"
Title: "Licensed to spoof"
description: "Reviews 'The spy who wouldn't die again', by Tim Spite and Gabe McDonnell, playing at the Downstage Theatre in Wellington, April 2011."

Title: "British cricketer left his mark on NZ game"
description: "British cricketer left his mark on NZ game"

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "Reality bites"
description: "Previews the show Did I believe it?, directed by Oliver Driver and showing at 1885, Britomart, until 30 Apr 2011. Talks to the ex-Shortland Street actress in the show about the difficulties of making a living as an actor in NZ, how she feels about celebrity, mental illness, and being herself."

Author: "Milsom, Viv"
Title: "'Christchurch needs a festival'"
description: "Asks the question 'Can he make the Christchurch Arts Festival work in 2011?' Having the experience of organising the Southern Lakes Festival of Colour for the past 15 years, Philip Tremewan, says 'Christchurch needs a festival now, more than ever'. Describes the option now facing the organisers with Christchurch being in an altered and damaged state after the September and February earthquakes. Indicates although the venues, final programme and timing will all remain up in the air, what seems certain is that Christchurch will have an arts festival in 2011."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Raising the bar"
description: "Explores the business ventures of university dropouts and friends Richard McLeod and James Arnott, who now employ over 200 people in pubs and licensed Velvet Burgers outlets with the help of George Eason and Andrew Roborgh. Document their beginnings buying a flat and then the Captain Cook Tavern in Dunedin. Examines their aggressive approach to business and how it is they now operate in the Auckland CBD."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Wired for sound"
description: "Reports researchers at the Centre for Brain Research (CBR) at the University of Auckland are looking at the therapeutic power of music for its usefulness in the rehabilitation of broken or damaged brains. Appears that one part of the brain is wired for speech but several parts are wired for music, so it's possible music could be used to remediate impaired neural processes and neural connections by activating and linking up different parts of the brain."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Music and neurological disorders"
description: "Reports researchers at the Centre for Brain Research (CBR) at the University of Auckland are looking at the therapeutic power of music for its usefulness in the rehabilitation of broken or damaged brains. Appears that one part of the brain is wired for speech but several parts are wired for music, so it's possible music could be used to remediate impaired neural processes and neural connections by activating and linking up different parts of the brain."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Blood sample store subject of debate"
description: "Reports on debate about the storage of cards from the national newborm metabolic screening programme. Informs that Government decided in 2010 to retain millions of 'Guthrie cards' containing droplets of newborns' blood, but did not publicise the decision. Discusses the consultation process undertaken by the Ministry of Health on its draft operational protocols and governance arrangements for the cards. Seeks comment from consumer organisations, Privacy Commissioner Marie Shroff and health professionals."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Whiter than white"
description: "Warns against the dangers of teeth-whitening procedures for those with problematic teeth and gums, especially relating to the DIY-style kits that can be bought across the counter in pharmacies and supermarkets. Highlights the growth in popularity of these products, culminating in the establishment of the NZ Teeth Whitening Associaltion. Points out that because teeth whitening is a cosmetic procedure, as opposed to a dental or health procedure, there is no compensation facility in place if something goes wrong."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Tooth-whitening procedures"
description: "Warns against the dangers of teeth-whitening procedures for those with problematic teeth and gums, especially relating to the DIY-style kits that can be bought across the counter in pharmacies and supermarkets. Highlights the growth in popularity of these products, culminating in the establishment of the NZ Teeth Whitening Associaltion. Points out that because teeth whitening is a cosmetic procedure, as opposed to a dental or health procedure, there is no compensation facility in place if something goes wrong."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Just passing through; Just passing - or ghosting - through Dunedin"
description: "Reveals that tens of thousands of cruise ship tourists are not being counted in government tourism statistics. Talks to CruiseNZ chief executive Craig Harris about the statistical anomaly that renders these tourists 'ghosts'. Seeks comment from Markus Landbogt of the Ministry of Economic Development. Talks to four couples from Australia, Thailand and Denmark about their countries and their experiences of visiting NZ."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Fuelled by fossils"
description: "Profiles the England-born dinosaur collector, whose family emigrated to NZ nine years ago and set up its wholesale and import business. Talks to him about some of the specimens he has collected with his partner, Georgia Barber, and some of the dealers and museums he works with. Asks GNS Science senior scientist Dr Hamish Campbell and collections manager John E. Simes about aspects of the commercialisation of fossil collecting. Mentions the late NZer who discovered a dinosaur bone in the northern Hawke's Bay in 1975."

Author: "James, Bryan"
Title: "An uncommonly fine collection; Local-boy-made-good memoir just too detailed"
description: "An uncommonly fine collection; Local-boy-made-good memoir just too detailed"

Author: "Scherer, Jule"
Title: "Giving love to the people"
description: "Talks to the musician whose solo project, Avalanche City, has yielded the chart-topping single 'Love, Love, Love' on iTunes and a successful video on YouTube."

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "Highs beat lows in job with prospects"
description: "Interviews the general duties constable for the Queenstown police about the nature of his work."

Author: "Hathaway, Jude"
Title: "Style, sophistication and whimsy"
description: "Reports on iD Dunedin Fashion Week and the 12th iD Dunedin Fashion Show, Dunedin Railway Station, 8-9 Apr 2011. Reviews the collections and describes the show.  Includes multiple photographs of the collections and the participating designers."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "The dirt on dirt"
description: "Advises on how to get the best from your soil by caring for it as you would a pet. Claims the build-up of blood and bone, compost, chicken manure, seaweed and mulches will help grow a beautiful garden over time."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Caring for your soil"
description: "Advises on how to get the best from your soil by caring for it as you would a pet. Claims the build-up of blood and bone, compost, chicken manure, seaweed and mulches will help grow a beautiful garden over time."

Author: "Brennan-Tupara, Nicola"
Title: "Boyfriend's fault, finds coroner"
description: "Boyfriend's fault, finds coroner"

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "SIS spying on mosques revealed; NZ mosque faces terror claims"
description: "Tells the story of Muslim convert Charles Wardle, who trained to be a terrorist in Pakistan before being recruited by the SIS (Security Intelligence Service) to spy on an Auckland mosque (Masjid At-Taqwa)."

Author: "Shadwell, Talia"
Title: "Africa expedition aims for sum and summit"
description: "Africa expedition aims for sum and summit"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Dinosaur is not yet ready to be extinct"
description: "Dinosaur is not yet ready to be extinct"

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Look who's talking"
description: "Talks to the broadcaster about his return to radio and television after his resignation from TVNZ in October 2010 after he insulted the Governor-General Sir Anand Satyanand."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "Treasures for all time"
description: "Goes behind-the-scenes at Archives NZ (National Archives) in Wellington to find some unusual and quirky relics. Talks about the restoration of the 'Country lads', a nine-minute 1941 film about NZ soldiers heading off to World War Two, and the first film made by the former National Film Unit."

Author: "Longstaff, Lesley"
Title: "Rocking, rolling, riding"
description: "Takes a scenic rail tour of NZ using the Tranz Scenic services. Travels from Auckland to Wellington on the Overlander, Picton to Christchurch on the TranzCoastal, and from Christchurch to Greymouth on the TranzAlpine."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Game for a laugh"
description: "Talks to the London-based, Dunedin-born entertainer/comedian about his act and his career."

Author: "Harrison, Debbie"
Title: "Actor"
description: "Talks to the actor about her current job working at the Spookers haunted house attraction. Notes that she also works as a typesetter at a community newspaper."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Women's work"
description: "Speaks to the author about her new book 'Inside stories: a history of the New Zealand housewife 1890-1975', which examines 21 NZ women's magazines published between 1890 and 1975 to gain an insight into the evolution of the NZ housewife."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Return of a Shore girl"
description: "Speaks to the actor who is back for the third season of the television programme after filming the thriller 'Cabin in the woods' in Canada. Talks about some of the other projects she is working on in Australia."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "A golden and bountiful season"
description: "Celebrates the arrival of autumn with three recipes: pear, blue cheese and walnut salad; pumpkin and mushroom pangratto; and eggplant medallions. Advises of vegetables, fruits and other foods in season."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Mezzo gives voice to abiding passion; Virtually perfect"
description: "Talks to the mezzo-soprano about her career. Informs of her performance of Bach's 'Mass in B minor' with the City of Dunedin Choir, supported by the Southern Sinfonia and conducted by David Burchell, Dunedin Town Hall, 16 Apr 2011. Mentions 'The Virtual Choir 2.0', an Internet-based project in which two members of the City of Dunedin Choir have participated."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Artist in the terminal' by Maria Kemp, Dunedin International Airport.  Reviews works by Brian Strong, Susan Webb and J.K. Reed. The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Honey in the rock' by Joanna Langford, Hocken Gallery, Dunedin, until 30 Apr 2011."

Author: "De Graaf, Peter"
Title: "Lady of the waves charted a new course"
description: "Lady of the waves charted a new course"

Author: "Galloway, Jill"
Title: "Canine helper is money well spent"
description: "Canine helper is money well spent"

Author: "Matthews, Lee"
Title: "Leith's a star of the city's RSA"
description: "Leith's a star of the city's RSA"

Author: "Crean, MIke"
Title: "'Mr Riccarton' champion of borough's identity"
description: "'Mr Riccarton' champion of borough's identity"

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Eminent firefighter given full honours"
description: "Eminent firefighter given full honours"

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Frontier attitude helped develop Lake Hawea destination"
description: "Frontier attitude helped develop Lake Hawea destination"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Champion power-boater dedicated to RSA"
description: "Champion power-boater dedicated to RSA"

Author: "Stone, Andrew"
Title: "China flexes its muscles; Beijing's embrace spreads irresistibly across the Pacific"
description: "Explores aspects of the relationship between China and NZ, primarily the implications of the size of the Chinese military budget and its belligerent enforcement of sea claim disputes. Seeks comment from strategic analysts about China's growth as a superpower, the nature of its ambitions, and the delicate balance of NZ's relationships with China and the US. Describes some of the weapons available to its defence forces. Speaks to China-watchers about its growing influence in the Pacific with regard to diplomatic posts and foreign aid."

Author: "Johnston, Brian"
Title: "Two heads of the dragon"
description: "Presents two perspectives on the relationship between China and NZ, offered by the NZ teacher working in Jiangsu province and the Chinese NZer who is the former senior journalist at the 'Herald'."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Crying over milk prices; Fighting talk over the farm gate"
description: "Backgrounds the issues that are prompting the Commerce Commission to consider an inquiry into the price of milk, following complaints from rivals that the dairy monopoly is 'setting a notional milk price' which is anti-competitive. Looks at factors influencing the rise in dairy prices. Seeks comment from Fonterra Trade and Operations managing director Gary Romano and Fonterra Brands Peter McClure, who explain why the complaints are without foundation."

Author: "Calder, Peter"
Title: "Fear and loathing deep in the forest"
description: "Speaks to Errol Wright and Abi King-Jones, co-directors of the documentary that looks at the 'anti-terror' raids conducted by NZ Police in the Urewera ranges on 15 Oct 2007. Asks if their film is dispassionate or activist, and what they hope to achieve from its production. Lists screening times in Wellington and Auckland as part of the World Cinema Showcase."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Kate Sylvester"
description: "Talks to the fashion designer about her honorary doctorate from Massey University. Reveals her love of the monarchy and her obsessions with stripes, lingerie and the Mitford sisters. Comments on what it is like to be a brand."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Don't get caught with egg on your face"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of the creme egg manufactured by Cadbury."

Author: "Emmerson, Rod"
Title: "A message from the heartland"
description: "Reviews and comments on the exhibition 'Ngai Tuhoe - Te Urewera : The People and the land are one', Whakatane District Museum and Gallery, until Jul 2011."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Meaning hides in game of ironical banality"
description: "Reviews two art exhibitions by NZ artists at Auckland galleries: 'The House with the mezzanine' by Richard Frater, Sue Crockford Gallery, until 23 Apr 2011; and 'Transactional series' by Billy Apple, Minter Ellison Rudd Watts, 88 Shortland St, until 3 Jun 2011."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Freelancing cellist finds home with NZSO"
description: "Profiles the new principal cellist with the NZ Symphony Orchestra. Informs of his upcoming performance of Bach Musica as part of the Puertas Quartet, University of Auckland Music Theatre, 1 May 2011."

Author: "Gray, Jamie"
Title: "Kiwi in sweet-spot behind Aussie"
description: "Examines the strength of the NZ dollar. Seeks comment from  economists and currency strategists about why the NZ dollar is strong against currencies such as the US dollar and the pound, yet weak against the Australian dollar."

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Exporter targets transtasman currency gap"
description: "Talks to Jared Vaughan, general manager of the Napier-based food display cabinet manufacturer, about the benefits to the business of the strong NZ dollar. Informs that NZ's export sales to Australia have become competitive and profitable."

Author: "Thomson, JoeÃàlle"
Title: "Conquering the slippery slopes"
description: "Reports on her experience of learning to ski at Snowplanet, north of Auckland. Briefly profiles her instructor."

Author: "Smith, Catherine"
Title: "My Auckland : Grafton"
description: "Talks to the singer-songwriter about why she lives in and loves Grafton. Lists some of her favourite places and activities."

Title: "Off the beaten track; 5 of the best climbing walls"
description: "Suggests weekend and day trips for Easter and the autumn school holidays. Provides information about five climbing walls suitable for children."

Author: "Evetts, Virgil"
Title: "Trawling Auckland's historic treasure troves"
description: "Showcases five less well-known museums: The Royal New Zealand Navy Museum, the George Grey Special Collection at Auckland Central City Library, Ewelme Cottage, Devonport Museum and Highwic. Mentions other hidden treasures, including Frank Sargeson's cottage, Howick Historical Village and the TSB Bank Wallace Arts Centre, Pah Homestead."

Author: "Baillie, Russell"
Title: "A mountain of talent on catchy debut"
description: "A mountain of talent on catchy debut"

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "A real buzz killer"
description: "Talks to the director of the eco-documentary about his latest film, focusing on the alarming demise of bees worldwide. Discusses reaction to the film in his hometown of Portland, Oregon."

Title: "Helped establish first marine reserve"
description: "Helped establish first marine reserve"

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "State house tenant with $250,000 cars"
description: "State house tenant with $250,000 cars"

Author: "Stewart, Matt"
Title: "Wakatipu will miss 'pioneer mother'"
description: "Wakatipu will miss 'pioneer mother'"

Title: "One of NZ's leading scriptwriters helped others find their voice"
description: "One of NZ's leading scriptwriters helped others find their voice"

Author: "McMurran Alistair"
Title: "Father finally follows in daughter's footsteps"
description: "Father finally follows in daughter's footsteps"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Double crash kills elderly couple on Desert Road"
description: "Double crash kills elderly couple on Desert Road"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Student heads for glittering spires"
description: "Student heads for glittering spires"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Retiring dog handler farewelled by minister"
description: "Retiring dog handler farewelled by minister"

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Locals stunned as family man now murder accused"
description: "Locals stunned as family man now murder accused"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Wringing out her swimsuit for the winter"
description: "Wringing out her swimsuit for the winter"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Beachlands farewells 'Plumb Crazy' community stalwart"
description: "Beachlands farewells 'Plumb Crazy' community stalwart"

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Tenacious, determined Brown set out to reach goals"
description: "Tenacious, determined Brown set out to reach goals"

Author: "KItchin, Peter"
Title: "Irrepressible broadcasting pioneer"
description: "Irrepressible broadcasting pioneer"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Whistle for last stop on journey of invention in basements and sheds"
description: "Whistle for last stop on journey of invention in basements and sheds"

Author: "Round, Derek,"
Title: "Last of the White Rajah dynasty"
description: "Last of the White Rajah dynasty"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Soldier's debt of gratitude finally repaid"
description: "Soldier's debt of gratitude finally repaid"

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Happy to be half the man he was"
description: "Happy to be half the man he was"

Author: "Crean, MIke"
Title: "Till : a consummate home-grown pianist whose talents were acknowledged worldwide"
description: "Till : a consummate home-grown pianist whose talents were acknowledged worldwide"

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "Railways man and cancer fundraiser"
description: "Railways man and cancer fundraiser"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Conservationist who saved black robin terminally ill"
description: "Conservationist who saved black robin terminally ill"

Author: "Carpenter, Bernard"
Title: "Ngati Kahungunu mourning death of its No 1 speaker"
description: "Ngati Kahungunu mourning death of its No 1 speaker"

Author: "Hensley, Gerald"
Title: "Diplomat had abiding love for NZ"
description: "Diplomat had abiding love for NZ"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "A Post Office man who developed a particular skill in charity fundraising"
description: "A Post Office man who developed a particular skill in charity fundraising"

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Revelling in a little moonlighting"
description: "Revelling in a little moonlighting"

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "Law change attracts more to real estate"
description: "Law change attracts more to real estate"

Author: "McCarthy, Angela"
Title: "Valuable blend of IT and psychology skills"
description: "Valuable blend of IT and psychology skills"

Author: "Falconer, Phoebe"
Title: "Lasting legacy for rare-bird saviour"
description: "Lasting legacy for rare-bird saviour"

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Putting roots down for the future; Learn from the experts; Bonus for biodiversity"
description: "Features community revegetation projects being undertaken by Otago Polytechnic students studying for the national certificate in horticulture. Talks to senior lecturer Lisa Burton about the increasingly popular sustainable horticulture module, and some projects over the 15 years of the revegetation programme. Seeks comment from Dunedin Amenities Society member Paul Pope about the students' work at the Craigieburn Reserve, Leith Valley. Encourages people to increase native plants in home gardens to improve biodiversity. Informs of the series of free 'Hort Talk' monthly lectures at the Dunedin Botanic Garden and lists topics and dates for the remainder of 2011."

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "The party poppers just won't go away"
description: "Notes although BZP (benzylpiperazine) has been reclassified as an illegal substance there are now pills of all shapes and colours. Investigates what they are and who is behind them. Relates that BZP has now been replaced by DMAA (dimethylamylamine) a derivative of geranium oil. Includes comments from people involved in the party pill industry. Includes an article, Synthetic joints fill the void left by BZP and calls it a new fad."

Author: "Eriksen, Alanah"
Title: "Passenger gives bus driver a message over motorway texts"
description: "Passenger gives bus driver a message over motorway texts"

Author: "Eriksen, Alanah"
Title: "Kiwi saddles up for wedding escort duties"
description: "Kiwi saddles up for wedding escort duties"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "US backing for parents' website on Thai danger"
description: "US backing for parents' website on Thai danger"

Author: "Morris, Deborah"
Title: "Introducing the public defender"
description: "Introduces Wellington region's head of the Public Defence Service, which provides in-house lawyers for defendants. Talks about her childhood desire to become a lawyer at a time when not many women were practicing law and some of her role models. Gives her views on work she has carried out during her career and the new position she has taken up."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Kiwis help expedition net first of new breed of storm petrel"
description: "Relates the story of Karen Baird who became the first person to catch the tiny Puerto Montt storm petrel. British seabird expert, Peter Harrison, asked Karen Baird and her husband Chris Gaskin to be involved in the capture of the storm petrel off the Chilean coast as they had also been involved in the capture and rediscovery of the NZ storm petrel in 2008."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "A life full of politics and husbands"
description: "A life full of politics and husbands"

Author: "Burgess, Dave"
Title: "The pros and cons of Celia's reign"
description: "Looks at the first six months of Celia Wade-Browns new style of local politics and asks some key player to rate her performance. Views vary on her style of open communication and inclusiveness."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Fresh start"
description: "Profiles Edmond Weicherding, executive chef for InterContinental Wellington's Chameleon Restaurant who indicates he learned about fresh food and fruit tarts from his European grandmother. Follows his career as a chef starting out in Luxembourg, where he was born, through to Germany and England (London). Describes his current menu and the origin of the food."

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "Going for broke"
description: "Comments on the decline in NZ wealth relative to Australia, blaming this on objecters blocking such activity as mining on conservation land, oil and gas exploration, new energy projects, and transport infrastructure."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Worth the weight"
description: "Examines in depth diets and dieting in light of results from the pan-European Diogenes obesity research project. Looks at what the project suggests is a winning diet for weight-loss, and how this compares with official advice. Notes Government policy in anti-obesity programmes, and talks to experts about exercise and dieting. Examines findings from the UK Medical Research Council on promising results on exercise and weight-loss. Looks at the phenomenon of normal-weight obesity, or hidden fat reserves in people of apparently normal weight. Outlines the Diogenes study, comparing diets based on protein and glycaemic index. Describes some fad diets and practices."

Author: "Williams, Bronwyn"
Title: "Wellington style"
description: "Chooses thirteen people from around Wellington who the author considers display "individuality and flair and have fun with fashion"."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Taking it in his stride"
description: "Profiles Roger Robinson who has had a significant academic career and his running has gained him world titles. Notes a festschrift has been written in his honour, (includes memoirs, tributes, poems, running essays and literary essays) 'Running writing Robinson' by over 50 people who have known him in various capacities. Indicates he still has an active writing career."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "World view"
description: "Profiles Jenny Clad and describes her efforts put into organising The Climate Project (TCP), the international grassroots organisation that Al Gore established in the wake of the film's success to train people to spread the message on climate change. Indicates Jenny Clad spent her formative years in NZ, being schooled in Hamilton and studying arts and law at Victoria University of Wellington. Describes how the organisation (TCP) came into being and was maintained. Comments on the organisation's future with The Climate Project being merged with Gore's other non-profit lobby organisation, the Washington based Alliance for Climate Protection last year."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "From farm to forest"
description: "Notes the changes that have occurred on Matiu/Somes Island, from "pasture land, bare and blasted by strong winds, with a few macrocarpa and pine trees" ... "into a lush, green, bush-covered jewel that welcomes visitors". Explains the work has been carried out by the Lower Hutt Branch of Forest and Bird volunteers and their work has been documented in the book A new cloak for Matiu : the restoration of an island ecology by Janet Hector."

Author: "Gilbert, Jo"
Title: "Quake refugees find haven in resort; Wanaka enchants Chch quake refugees"
description: "Covers the role Wanaka has played in settling families displaced by the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake, noting the effects on the town's resources and schools. Gives statistics for post-earthquake enrolment of Christchurch pupils in schools nationwide. Describes the experience of the Fitzgerald and Hanson families and asks if they will return to Christchurch."

Author: "Hill, Marika"
Title: "Origin of languages theory stirs debate"
description: "Reports on the work of the Auckland researcher who used computer modelling to trace language origins to Africa. Notes both criticism and support of his work published in the magazine Science."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Sam the man; Read all about it"
description: "Talks to Sam Johnson, the motivating force behind the Student Volunteer Army. Gives his background, noting his early leadership talent. Shows how he kicked off a student volunteer clean-up following the first Christchurch earthquake, 4 Sep 2010, including the ad-hoc organisation needed to deal with unexpected numbers. Relates his standing for local politics, setting the Student Volunteer Army (SVA) up on Facebook, and his immediate reaction to the 22 Feb 2011 quake. Looks at how the SVA organised itself with IT and texting and handled a better management structure, and looks at him being recruited to help in Japan. Describes how the Hyde family of Redcliff created the 'Redcliff InfoPoint' social media and information service in the wake of the Feb 2011 earthquake to help their community."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Can we fix it?"
description: "Delves into the issue of whether land in suburbs damaged by the 22 February 2011 earthquake is worth rebuilding on. Describes the geotechnical work being undertaken, and what will happen when the information is reported in mid-May. Notes the complicating factor of increased flood risk in certain areas.  Talks to Canterbury University expert Misko Cubrinski about liquefaction and lateral spreading. Itemises the questions on land remediation facing the Government once the geotechnical report is complete."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Landlord playing a high-risk game"
description: "Talks to property investor Miles Middelton about the fate of his buildings, including the Westpac Tower in Cashell Mall, his experience of the 22 February earthquake, and his options regarding rebuilding, salvaging, or abandoning buildings. Touches on debt servicing, attracting tenants back into the CBD area, and the architecture of post earthquake construction."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Web of sorrow and suffering"
description: "Explains the Hungarian origins of the notion of people being 'six degrees of separation' apart. Explores this theory in relation to the 22 February 2011 earthquake, asking two questions of the author's family and acquaintances."

Author: "Annison, Vicki"
Title: "Bid to save details of memorials"
description: "Reports on the Hunting Kiwis project to record and preserve information from smashed rural cemeteries in Canterbury. Talks to Darfield writer Helen Leggatt about the popularity here and abroad of a website documenting the gravestone research. Discusses the extent of the damage, her interest in genealogy, and some of her interesting discoveries about Canterbury history."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Storm over Waikato"
description: "Looks at the conflict over the Maungatautari Ecological Island Trust (MEIT), a community project to establish a mainland conservation sanctuary centered around Mount Maungatautari in the Waikato.  Describes the views of dissident members of MEIT, David Wallace, Fiona Judd, Peter Holmes, and Gareth Morgan, that governance structures have been the subject of an undemocratic bid for control by the local iwi, Ngati Koroki Kahukura. Looks at the history of the trust and the views of other trustees, and the conflicts between iwi, the community, landowners, and dissidents such as Wallace and Morgan. Gives MaÃÑori views on the project, which incorporates much of their tribal land. Looks at continuing support for the project by volunteers as it succeeds in regenerating native birdlife. Discusses threats to funding and access through landowners."

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Naked ambitions"
description: "Interviews Kiwi band the Naked and Famous as they start to break in Europe and the USA, catching up with them at the Southwest music festival in Austin, Texas. Looks at Kiwi bands (Street Chant, King Kapisi) at the influential festival (SXSW, South by Southwest), talking to Gary Fortune of the New Zealand Music Commission about success in America."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Fearless NZ authority on freshwater fish"
description: "Fearless NZ authority on freshwater fish"

Author: "Zanker, Graham"
Title: "Historian also remembered for generosity"
description: "Historian also remembered for generosity"

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "World view"
description: "Profiles Jenny Clad and describes her efforts put into organising The Climate Project (TCP), the international grassroots organisation that Al Gore established in the wake of the film's success to train people to spread the message on climate change. Indicates Jenny Clad was schooled in Hamilton and at Victoria University of Wellington. Describes how the organisation (TCP) came into being and was maintained.
