Comments on the organisation's future with The Climate Project being merged with Gore's other non-profit lobby organisation, the Washington based Alliance for Climate Protection last year."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Taking it in his stride"
description: "Profiles Roger Robinson who has had a significant academic career and has won world titles for running. Notes a festschrift has been written in his honour, (includes memoirs, tributes, poems, running essays and literary essays) 'Running writing Robinson' by over 50 people who have known him in various capacities. Indicates he still has an active writing career."

Author: "Wright, Matthew,"
Title: "Books for children and adults about both world wars mark Anzac Day"
description: "Reviews several books marking the World Wars and Anzac Day."

Author: "Wright, Matthew,"
Title: "A lens on the hard truths"
description: "Reviews several books marking the World Wars and Anzac Day."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Arctic tales divide by Andrew Keoghan"
description: "Arctic tales divide by Andrew Keoghan"

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "Voodoo economics"
description: "Looks at the financing of the arts and sports, suggesting that the arts are both more popular and give better returns than their image."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Cheesed off"
description: "Reports on the experience of micro-cheesemaker Biddy Fraser-Davies of Cwmglyn Farmhouse Cheeses near Eketahuna, keeping three cows, dealing with bureaucratic food safety rules designed for farms with thousands of cows."

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "All change yet none, that is the Point"
description: "Explores Kaka Point, a seaside township in South Otago. Talks to local residents Bruce Murray, Bill Falconer, Rosa MacPherson and Irene Sutton about its enduring popularity."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Students use imagination for better world"
description: "Reports on the competition for the Microsoft Imagine Cup, contested by 20 teams of university students who used technology to solve some of the world's toughest problems, Auckland, 12 Apr 2011. Focuses on the work the top four teams, including winning team Team OneBuzz from the University of Auckland. Seeks comment from team members, head judge Brett O'Reilly and Scott Wylie from Microsoft New Zealand."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Stand-up guy prefers paddle board to surfboard"
description: "Profiles the Melbourne-raised dean of the University of Otago School of Physical Education, focusing on his status as 'the only regular stand-up paddle board surfer in Dunedin'. Describes some of his experiences during the 41 years he has been surfing. Presents details about his latest book 'Surfing : The Ultimate guide'."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Web of friendships"
description: "Talks to the Jack Somerville Lecturer in Pastoral Theology in the Department of Theology and Religion, University of Otago. Describes the themes of her new book 'Friending : Real friendships in a virtual world'. Comments on the connections between the Easter story and the nature of friendship."

Title: "Online offerings"
description: "Talks to University of Otago PhD student Sam Stevens about his research to document internet production values among contemporary Christian groups."

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "Jolly bright future"
description: "Profiles the Wellington Central Member of Parliament who has been touted as a future leader of the Labour Party."

Author: "Thwaites, Patricia"
Author (detailed): "Patricia Thwaites, Ian Williams and Kathy Young"
Title: "Absorbing account of little-known slice of NZ history; Sensible Sentencing founder speaks his mind; Profound and engaging dialogue"
description: "Absorbing account of little-known slice of NZ history; Sensible Sentencing founder speaks his mind; Profound and engaging dialogue"

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Helping people is the biggest thrill"
description: "Interviews the co-ordinator of Dunedin Search and Rescue (SAR) about the demands of his job and the skills required for rescue work."

Author: "McLean, Rachael"
Title: "Heart of the matter"
description: "Discusses the relationship between blood pressure and salt in the diet, noting the risks of 'normal' blood pressure ranges, adjusting to a reduced salt intake, and assessing salt intake."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "Duelling smartphones"
description: "Looks at the growing popularity of smartphones running Google Android, capturing market share from the Apple iPhone. Compares the two, noting the different apps (applications) available and differing app stores, and the more diverse range of phones using Android."

Author: "Rae, Fiona,"
Title: "High-flyer"
description: "Looks at a documentary on the first airman to win the Victoria Cross for wartime bravery, William Rhodes-Moorhouse, and his MaÃÑori ancestory."

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Waikato students stoked at top marks"
description: "Waikato students stoked at top marks"

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Hunter's actions leave pain and anger"
description: "Hunter's actions leave pain and anger"

Author: "Takimoana, Brooke"
Title: "'It was her eyes that made him weep'"
description: "'It was her eyes that made him weep'"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Carnage at the Fortune"
description: "Meets the new artistic director at the Fortune Theatre. Discusses 'God of carnage', the first of her productions for the theatre, 29 Apr-21 May 2011. Talks about her upbringing in Palmerston North and about aspects of her career."

Author: "Body, Ralph"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'The Heat of winter' by Michael Harrison, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Remembrance' by Janet de Wagt, Gallery De Novo, Dunedin, until 28 Apr 2011.  Reviews '6% forced unemployment, Stops wages rising. Fakes job competition' by Laura Shepard and Tao Wells, Rice and Beans Gallery, Dunedin."

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Agricultural scientist had many talents"
description: "Agricultural scientist had many talents"

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Fight to save national taonga"
description: "Asks whether NZ can risk the extinction of the MaÃÑori language. Discusses a plan produced recently by a group of experts aimed at reviving and preserving the use of te reo MaÃÑori, one of NZ's official languages. Comments on the difficulty of reviving minority languages, using the experience of Wales as an example."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Sylvia's story"
description: "Profiles the expatriate Englishwoman who married the RNZAF flying ace and Rangiora resident in 1945. Describes the difficult circumstances by which she and 400 war brides arrived in NZ, and the lack of government support for returning soldiers and war brides. Informs that her stories and those of other women are the subject of the exhibition 'Mr Jones' wives : War brides of New Zealand servicemen', Auckland Museum Pictorial Gallery, until 4 Sep 2011."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Tapu taboos; Your say : offensive or overreaction?"
description: "Investigates the origin of the taboo prevalent in both MaÃÑori and Pakeha culture about not sitting on cooking benches. Notes criticism from MaÃÑori academic Dr Ranginui Walker of contestants on the television show MasterChef New Zealand, some of whom have been sitting on surfaces associated with food preparation or eating. Discusses other MaÃÑori cultural practices associated with hygiene. Seeks comment from the accountant, AUT professor Paul Moon, University of Auckland professor Margaret Mutu and Victoria University professor Marc Wilson. Publishes a selection of emails from readers, representing a range of opinion about whether sitting on a table is culturally offensive or not."

Author: "Wenley, Sally"
Title: "Straight talker facing an epidemic"
description: "Talks to the new executive director of the Foundation. Comments on the reaction by the gay community, many of whom are upset that the Foundation appointed a heterosexual Christian. Discusses the challenge of addressing the HIV epidemic among NZ men, particularly among gay and bisexual men. Seeks comment from University of Auckland sociology lecturer Michael Stevens, counsellor Bill Logan, who is a founder of the Foundation, and Foundation board chairman Alastair Cameron."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "'It's going to cost the country a fortune'"
description: "Investigates whether NZ can afford to keep the retirement age at 65 given the growing number of baby boomers. Overviews recommendations in a report by Retirement Commissioner Diana Crossan, including raising the retirement age from 65 to 67. Cites reaction from Prime Minister John Key, who repeated his promise to resign rather than increase the qualifying age for NZ Superannuation. Seeks reaction from baby boomers, a retiree, economists, the business sector and others. Includes results of a readers' poll."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Animal homeopath"
description: "Talks to the Netherlands-born animal homeopath about the nature of her work."

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "A case for Te Papa North"
description: "Contends that the Tank Farm on Wynyard Point is an ideal site for a new building to house some of NZ's national museum collections."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "New Zealand on screen"
description: "Showcases Digital Publishing New Zealand, a not-for-profit company established by Copyright Licensing (CLL). Talks to CLL chief executive Paula Browning about its intention to convert NZ books to an e-book digital format, with co-funding from Creative New Zealand. Seeks comment from publishers about the new scheme."

Author: "Marshall, Jonathan"
Title: "Creditors call for ban on Inspired Ideas organiser; 'Worst case I have ever had' - accountant"
description: "Investigates the former bankrupt woman whose planned Apr 2010 home show, the Inspired Ideas Expo, was cancelled the day before it was due to open. Talks to lenders and other investors about the effect of the cancellation on their businesses, and to a woman who defends her motives. Seeks views of an unnamed accountant who has dealt with previous failed ventures."

Author: "Russell, Nicola"
Title: "Luck of the Irish save Stephen after balcony fall"
description: "Luck of the Irish save Stephen after balcony fall"

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Major first in city with new medic team"
description: "Major first in city with new medic team"

Author: "Pepperell, Susan"
Title: "Faces of the quake"
description: "Revisits Christchurch two months after the February earthquake and a number of people tell their story. Emma Howard and Chris Greenslade, Ray Rarere, Ian McLeod and Drina Sisarich, and Amo Perelini reveal how the earthquake affected them and what they have done since the 22nd February."

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "POW still bitter over executions"
description: "Recounts how 17, civilians, Post Office radio operators and unarmed soldiers , were executed on Betio in Tarawa on October 15 in 1942. Describes what happened according to John Jones,  now 91 years old and what he sees as the NZ government's inability to recognise what happened."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "The scientist, the secret lab and the plan to mine gold"
description: "Talks to Dr. Kerry Spackman about the 'Goldmine Project', a highly technical sports science programme backed by the government and the Warehouse millionaire Sir Stephen Tindall, which hopes to make a real change in our athletes Olympic efforts. Indicates his secret lab can tell him everything about how a bike, a boat, or a kayak travels in "absolute minute detail, in a way never done before". Indicates it will be able to use this information to improve athletes technique."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Soft side out"
description: "Talks to newspaper columnist Rosemary McLeod about her dollmaking hobby and her upcoming exhibition, Aunts, Bowen Galleries, 2-21 May 2011. Shares memories of growing up in an era of home sewing and avoiding school sewing classes. Touches on her textile collection and professed addiction."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Under the crust"
description: "Investigates what is in and the origin of hot cross buns. Includes some of the not so well known facts and ingredients of the hot cross bun."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "For God's sake"
description: "Talks to the following NZers about faith, prayer, God, and religion: physical sciences professor and NZer of the Year Sir Paul Callaghan, Little Bushman vocalist Warren Maxwell, real estate worker Lynley Webster, Wellington mayor Celia Wade-Brown, Catholic archbishop John Dew, track and field record holder Hamish Carson, Christchurch mayor Bob Parker, and office administrator Mary Denton."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Enter the taniwha"
description: "Investigates the reasons as to why director Taika Waititi has joined a group to stop oil exploration of NZ's east coast. Includes a timeline of exploration and protest in the Raukumara Basin and explains what is Petrobras and who are Te WhaÃÑnau aÃÑ Apanui."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Choices that changed lives"
description: "Talks to the author about the historical and family reasons she felt compelled to write about NZ airmen shot down over France in World War II, particularly that of pilot John Sanderson and his rescuer Emile Patris."

Author: "Neems, Jeff"
Title: "Aussie giving 'em taste of kiwi"
description: "Aussie giving 'em taste of kiwi"

Author: "Duggan, Patrick John"
Title: "A changing tide against war [extract]"
description: "Presents an extract from the book authored by the ex-Vietnam veteran  in which he shares his feelings, and NZ's changing views, about war."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Good things come in small packages"
description: "Highlights the cupcake business Tempt, and talks to owner Tamara Jane about food fashions and her books on the baked delicacy."

Author: "Bennett, Sarah,"
Title: "Underworld"
description: "Travels into caves on the South Island's West Coast with a Norwest Adventures guide, describing some of the subterranean  features."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Graphic scenes"
description: "Talks to Matt Elliott about his contribution to the graphic novel aimed at military buffs and teenagers and based on what he learned from the diary his grandfather Cyril Elliott kept as he fought in World War I."

Author: "Stevens, Ric"
Title: "Notable addition to a long list"
description: "Notable addition to a long list"

Author: "Williamson, Cameron"
Title: "Harrowing tales from a battlefield"
description: "Harrowing tales from a battlefield"

Title: "First in line"
description: "Discusses male primogeniture in the British monarchy and how it will affect Kate and William's children. Calls for this medieval rule on succession rights to be scrapped."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Untying the Windsor knot"
description: "Points out the 'normality' of Prince William and his relationship with Kate Middleton despite his life circumstances. Comments on the modern British monarchy and many of its members."

Author: "Cavendish, Camilla"
Title: "Accident or abuse?"
description: "Speaks to Dr. Waney Squier, who has given evidence in NZ, is one of three British pathologists who are challenging the science behind the shaken baby syndrome. Investigates their claims that they are victims of a concerted effort to keep them quiet. Recounts the treatment they have recieved from law enforcement authorities, the General Medical Council and comments from a High Court judge."

Author: "O'Neill, Robert John"
Title: "The forgotten Anzacs"
description: "Investigates the battle fought by Australian and New Zealand troops in the same gorges as the heroes of ancient Greece. Describes the 21 Battalion's defence and rearguard action at the Vale of Tempe in Greece, on April 18, 1941. Indicates Tempe was an engagement that delayed the Germans long enough for most of the 55,000 strong Allied forces to escape south through Larissa a few miles south. Quotes extensively from the 21st battalion's historian J.F. Cody."

Author: "Field, Catherine"
Title: "Double family tragedy on one day"
description: "Double family tragedy on one day"

Author: "Walker, Jacqueline"
Title: "Pick your Moniker"
description: "Researches into the popularity of first names given to boys and girls over time. Discovers patterns and influences."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Fallen-soldier records free to access over Easter"
description: "Fallen-soldier records free to access over Easter"

Title: "War secret revealed by daughter's dig in to past"
description: "War secret revealed by daughter's dig in to past"

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Chocolatier"
description: "Talks to Jo Coffey, a chocolatier, who lives in Berhampore, Wellington. Relates her daily routine and indicates she makes two sorts of chocolate, moulded and cut. Lists the flavours she incorporates into her chocolate and adds she makes her own hazelnut and macadamia nut praline. Other interests include a movie club, cards and some TV."

Author: "Coddington, Deborah"
Title: "Beware, the taxman cometh"
description: "Describes and compares with the past the different ways the IRD can now employ experts in forensic accounting to find out about peoples' spending. Sites some typical tax evasion cases. Meets the IRD's two top sleuths - national investigations manager assurance Tony Morris and Wellington legal and technical services manager assurance Colin Hutchins who talk about their work."

Author: "O'Connor, Kevin"
Title: "Swindling the swindlers"
description: "Details the Ponzi scheme fraud organised by Bill Papple and Margarite 'Lee' Papple, Rotorua, noting the involvement of Hanover finance group director Mark Hotchin. Describes investment schemes through which the couple themselves were defrauded: Foofedi, Lavoie, and the Vault & Monarch.  Outlines techniques used by confidence tricksters and tips to guard against them."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Mistaken identity"
description: "Relates the conclusions people come to when they see an older man going out with a younger woman. Describes how the author often goes out with her father socially. Notes other young women have found people jump to erroneous conclusions about the nature of their relationship."

Author: "Stanfield, Sydney"
Title: "A boy at war"
description: "Tells the author's moving story of his service in the NZ Army during WWI. Describes his somber memories of life as a soldier on the front line at Messines, Passchendaele and the second battle of the Somme."

Author: "Broatch, Mark"
Title: "A festival of ideas"
description: "Describes how the author attended a Pecha Kucha (presentation technique in which participants present 20 images and talk about each for 20 seconds) evening in Webb's art auction premises in Epsom. Notes its origin and explains how is it intended to be an opportunity for designers, film-maker, editors, scientists, musicians, etc., to take their ideas to an interested public."

Author: "Watt, Lawrence"
Title: "Remembering Crete"
description: "Reviews NZ involvement in the Battle for Crete, May 1941, as part of the Creforce, presenting historical background and statistics. Focuses on the battle for the airfield at Maleme, noting the controversy over the campaign and the key NZ players, and showing a timeline for the 12 day event."

Author: "Palmer, Geoff"
Title: "Beware of spear phishers"
description: "Notes that by opting out of marketing emails doesn't mean your data is safe. Reveals that on March 30 a little known marketing company called Epsilon announced an 'incident' had been detected whereby clients' customer data were exposed by an unauthorised entry into Epsilon's email system. Explains 'phishing' is a term applied to email messages that masquerade as well known companies encouraging you to log in and update your details via a convenient link embedded in the message itself. This inturn takes you to what looks like a geunine website and if you enter your user name, password and credit card details these can be recorded. Indicates this scatter gun approach can lead to more specific targeting (spear phishing) of you and the company you have business with."

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "The Kiwi 'Red Baron'"
description: "Provides an account of WWII fighter pilot Brian Carbury's service with the Royal Air Force who shot down 15 Messershmitt 109's and took part in the Battle of Britain."

Author: "Smithies, Grant"
Title: "The sound and the fury"
description: "Examines the classes of noise that people most detest with the advent of International Noise Awareness Day approaching on Wednesday. Suggests some solutions to where a little noise should be allowed."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "The horror of war lingered for a lifetime"
description: "Recalls the World War II experience, misgivings and post trauma stress of the Distinguished Service Cross recipient from the viewpoint of his son David White. Features some of his father's accounts of the war. Urges families to watch out for mental health issues as veterans age and lose family and close friends."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "The bookman & the pop stars"
description: "Tells the story of how a Masterton bookseller got involved with an English publishing company and became a valued partner in several ambitious publishing deals and went on to 'hob nob' with an elite circle of elder statesmen from the British pop scene."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "David Hedley & the pop stars"
description: "Tells the story of how a Masterton bookseller got involved with an English publishing company and became a valued partner in several ambitious publishing deals and went on to 'hob nob' with an elite circle of elder statesmen from the British pop scene."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Michael Barnett"
description: "Talks to the Auckland Regional Chamber of Commerce & Industry Chief executive about his role in promoting NZ business at The Cloud venue during the Rugby World Cup. Covers his physical and emotional reaction to throat cancer, his family and career background,"

Author: "Gifford, Adam"
Title: "Bulls and a piano lead the way to Venice; a grand restoration"
description: "Interviews Michael Parekowhai, selected by Creative NZ to exhibit at Venice Biennale, about carved pianos, a Steinway concert grand piano restoration, bronze bulls, and what he hopes to achieve through his piece On looking into Chapman's Homer, Grand Canal, Venice, 4 June to 27 November 2011."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The glass is half clear"
description: "Sets out many of the major research findings since 1992 concerning the risks involved in taking hormone replacement therapy. Tries to clarify the conclusions."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Moments fixed in time with still-life skills"
description: "Reviews the Auckland exhibitions The first post by Mark Wooller, Warwick Henderson Gallery, to 30 April; Glory by P. J. Paterson, Sanderson Contemporary Art, to 1 May; To whom Achilles... by Angela Brennan, and Shadows by David Weir, Orexart, to 30 April; and Needy by Iain Cheesman, FhE Project Gallery to 14 May."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Hormone replacement therapy"
description: "Sets out many of the major research findings since 1992 concerning the risks involved in taking hormone replacement therapy. Tries to clarify the conclusions."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Four years later, rom-com set for debut"
description: "Describes the genesis of the romantic comedy about film school lecturers written by screenwriting tutors Kathryn Burnett and Nick Ward, which will be staged as part of the NZ International Comedy Festival, Herald Theatre, 30 April to 7 May."

Author: "Skeaff, Sheila A."
Title: "Pass the iodine, please"
description: "Explains what iodine is needed for. Reveals the trend of consuming more processed food and sea salt and less iodised salt in the home means iodine deficiency is back. Looks back at how NZers in the past overcame iodine deficiency and what we can do today to include it in our diet."

Author: "Skeaff, Sheila A."
Title: "Pas[s] the iodine, please"
description: "Explains what iodine is needed for. Reveals the trend of consuming more processed food and sea salt and less iodised salt in the home means iodine deficiency is back. Looks back at how NZers in the past overcame iodine deficiency and what we can do today to include it in our diet."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "Flexing its muscle; Gym boss sweats to build empire"
description: "Flexing its muscle; Gym boss sweats to build empire"

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Great Scott"
description: "Explains the first NZ Antarctic science strategy, which was previously Antarctica NZ. Covers some of the research that will be carried out at Scott Base."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Antarctic science programme"
description: "Explains the first NZ Antarctic science strategy, which was previously Antarctica NZ. Covers some of the research that will be carried out at Scott Base."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Rock on!"
description: "Discusses the merits of stone gardens. Provides guidance for planning and designing a rock garden. Discusses different stones and where they are available."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Using stone in the garden"
description: "Discusses the merits of stone gardens. Provides guidance for planning and designing a rock garden. Discusses different stones and where they are available."

Title: "Dairy awards honour Waikato winners"
description: "Dairy awards honour Waikato winners"

Author: "Boswell, Anne"
Title: "Sheila preserves farming memories"
description: "Sheila preserves farming memories"

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Burgers keep Cat purring at 100"
description: "Burgers keep Cat purring at 100"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Bike cop handed out life lessons"
description: "Bike cop handed out life lessons"

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry"
Title: "Dangerous liaisons 2.0"
description: "Ponders whether the internet and cellphones have changed and facilitated infidelity. Seeks comments from private investigator and author Julia Hartley Moore as to whether cheating is on the increase and how men and women have different cheating patterns/courting etiquette. Discusses the Canadian matchmaking website that specifically helps attached people cheat."

Title: "Job search is a test of stamina"
description: "Job search is a test of stamina"

Author: "Hill, David"
Title: "Fight for our freedom"
description: "Reviews several books marking the World Wars and Anzac Day."

Author: "Smith, Tony"
Title: "First-timer in Coast to Coast leads day one"
description: "First-timer in Coast to Coast leads day one"

Author: "Harper, Glyn,"
Title: "Harrowing examination of an intertwined history"
description: "Harrowing examination of an intertwined history"

Title: "Celebrating chocolate"
description: "Book review. Includes chocolate cake recipe."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "It's (almost) all downhill"
description: "Cycles the Old Coach Road bicycle trail between Horopito and Ohakune, presenting information mainly on this outdoor attraction and briefly on other mountain biking tracks in the Park."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Above and beyond"
description: "Talks to director Julian Arahanga about filming the story of William Rhodes-Moorhouse, a man of MaÃÑori descent who was the first pilot awarded the Victoria Cross. Discusses the director's interest in war stories, his quest for historical authenticity and his use of Sir Peter Jackson's company Vintage Aviator. Notes the Anzac Day showing of the documentary on MaÃÑori television, 25 April 2011."

Title: "Teenager eyes France after NZ Grand Prix win"
description: "Teenager eyes France after NZ Grand Prix win"

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Spaghetti Westenra"
description: "Talks to the 'popera' singer about collaborating with Italian composer Ennio Morricone on her latest album."

Author: "Head, Warren"
Title: "Risk readiness rules OK"
description: "Advocates the need for businesses to have continuity plans in place for all kinds of natural disasters. Involves the findings from a survey, which reinforces the view that not enough businesses have the right insurances in place. Speaks to a number of large businesses that give advice on how to plan for disasters and what to include."

Title: "Work computers : user rights v owners' rights"
description: "Provides a reminder of the need to have a written and clearly understood workplace policy regarding the use of work computers and the employer's ability to search e-mails and Internet traffic. Examples a recent Ontario Court of Appeal decision, which recognised that employees can have privacy rights over personal information stored on work computers."

Title: "New workplace rules"
description: "Outlines the changes to employment law, which came into effect on 1 April 2011. Covers the 90-day trial period for new employees, the cashing up of leave, employment agreements and sick leave."

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Prince charming"
description: "Recalls some memories about the 1983 royal tour of NZ by the Prince and Princess of Wales and the then 10-month-old Prince William. Touches on the death of Princess Diana and the forthcoming marriage of Prince William and Catherine (Kate) Middleton. Talks to former Auckland Medical School lecturer Tord Kjellstrom about fitting a car seat for Prince William in the hope that it would set a good example. Notes that at the time only 10 percent of NZ parents were regularly using a proper child restraint."

Author: "Manson, Bess"
Title: "Dancer seizes glory with grace"
description: "Speaks to the Christchurch-raised, London-based ballerina who is being billed as NZ's answer to Margot Fonteyn. Talks about her career and winning the 2010 Critics' Circle Award."

Title: "Memories more sweet then bitter"
description: "Talks to former lead tracker John Kingi about his memories of a fateful patrol by members of the Victor 3 One Platoon in Vietnam on 22 June 1969. Notes that his recollections, along with five other members of the patrol unit, have been recorded in the documentary 'Victor 3: baptism by fire'."

Author: "Paul, Gregor,"
Title: "Blackened reputations"
description: "Looks back on some of the most publicly derided All Blacks, including Shayne Philpott, Reuben Thorne, Colin Farrell, Justin Marshall, Mark Carter, Stephen Donald, Bernie McCahill, Taine Randell, Allan Hewson and Caleb Ralph."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Gorge yourself"
description: "Recounts a weekend spent walking along the Karangahake Gorge Historic Walkway at the base of the Coromandel Range."

Author: "Cone, Deborah Hill"
Title: "The plain facts of war"
description: "Reviews 'Anzacs: in the face of war'."

Author: "Mathewson, Nicole"
Title: "Friends, family say their final goodbye"
description: "Friends, family say their final goodbye"

Author: "Glass, Amy"
Title: "Women tell of grief after man stabbed"
description: "Women tell of grief after man stabbed"

Author: "Brown, Giles"
Title: "Police and family saw Selway as a rock"
description: "Police and family saw Selway as a rock"

Author: "Brown, Giles"
Title: "Mother angry 'forever' : rape-case compensation"
description: "Mother angry 'forever' : rape-case compensation"

Author: "Coddington, Deborah"
Title: "Messiahs or madmen; The activist who rides like a rock star; The day the don died"
description: "Interviews Hone Harawira about the launching of his Mana Party and his seeking a new mandate in his Te Tai Tokerau electorate. Interviews Don Brash about his being affirmed a member of the Act Party following his taking the party leadership from Rodney Hide. Seeks comments from political experts about the effect of these events on the National Party's showing in the November election."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Kiwi farm boys kings of cuisine"
description: "Reports on the successes and plans of NZ chefs Josh Emett, most recently a judge of the Masterchef television programme, and Ben Shewry who runs the Attica restaurant in Melbourne. Notes the similarities in both men's family, educational and career backgrounds."

Author: "Gillies, Abby"
Title: "Fresh lives for pair after tragic conflict"
description: "Talks to Bosnian sisters Atka Reid and Hana Schofield, Auckland, about their escape from the war in their home country, the fate of their family, life in NZ, and the book they have written about their experience, Goodbye Sarajevo."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "An early start and long march can still be fun"
description: "An early start and long march can still be fun"

Author: "Barlow, Helen"
Title: "Going native"
description: "Talks to NZ actor Temuera Morrison about working with Ray Winstone in the movie shot in NZ and telling the story of a tracker and a MaÃÑori fugitive. Discusses some of Morrison's other movies, relationships, and a recent return to Rotorua."

Author: "Moore, Bill"
Title: "Grady had a nose for a good story"
description: "Grady had a nose for a good story"

Author: "Cowdrey, Alice"
Title: "A bird watcher with flair for painting"
description: "A bird watcher with flair for painting"

Author: "Pearson, Anna"
Title: "Memoirs detail joy of a life centred on Mapua"
description: "Memoirs detail joy of a life centred on Mapua"

Title: "Brandford Park killer 'disgusting'"
description: "Brandford Park killer 'disgusting'"

Author: "Wetere, Mere"
Title: "Plenty of knocks but a lot of spirit"
description: "Plenty of knocks but a lot of spirit"

Author: "Reich, Josh"
Title: "Decorated runner to pass on secrets"
description: "Decorated runner to pass on secrets"

Title: "Mount to defend more than 130 fraud charges"
description: "Mount to defend more than 130 fraud charges"

Author: "Kidson, Sally"
Title: "Insane attacker found not guilty"
description: "Insane attacker found not guilty"

Author: "Murdoch, Helen"
Title: "Rural community loses leading light"
description: "Rural community loses leading light"

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "50-year-old international success story; Lauder vital link in global network; 50th anniversary celebrations next week"
description: "Previews the 50th anniversary of the global climate research station, Lauder, Central Otago. Talks to NIWA principal scientist Richard McKenzie and chief scientist (atmosphere) Murray Poulter about its international reputation as one of five primary sites for the international Network for Detection of Atmospheric Composition Change. Overviews his history and its more commercial orientation in recent years. Notes that several staff from the early days of the station will attend the anniversary celebrations, 28-29 Apr 2011."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "NHNZ's gaming pitch pays; Fluttering into a friendlier game"
description: "Showcases the new online game 'Flutter', developed by the natural history firm. Talks to general manager John Crawford and Runaway Play director Tim Nixon about the costly process of developing the game  and its 'viral' popularity after Facebook accredited it. Discusses the key to making an online game successful."

Author: "Trevett, Claire"
Title: "The return of the frugal doctor"
description: "Discusses Don Brash's take-over as leader of the Act Party and the brand he is trying to create for the Party. Notes the possibility of a change in the deputy leadership of the Act Party as Heather Roy is understood to be considering a challenge."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Keep on trucking"
description: "Examines whether the stretch of road on State Highway 88 (SH88) through St Leonards is safe, given the number of hazards and the increased volume of trucks using the main transport arterial. Talks to the veteran logging trucker about his crash on a curve along SH88, 28 Mar 2011, resulting in his dismissal from the company. Speaks to logging trucker Calum McCreath of Dunedin Carrying about some of the hazards of the route. Provides information about the increase in big trucks using SH88."

Author: "Sortehaug, Paul"
Title: "Kiwi airmen fought for Crete"
description: "Chronicles the participation of NZ airmen who flew for the Royal Air Force (RAF) in support of ground and naval forces during the Battle for Crete. Informs that the 70th anniversary of the battle will be commemorated in May 2011."

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Brothers in arms"
description: "Commemorates Anzac Day by chronicling the stories of two of his uncles who served in the NZ Army. Informs that both were born in NZ but educated in China, residing with their grandparents, Koon Yol Wong and Yo Foon Wong, from 1930-1936 before moving to Dunedin. Tells of their upbringing in Christchurch and Invercargill before moving to China. Describes their army service and post-war work running the family fruit shop in Dunedin. Discusses their current activities."

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "Many lessons learnt, says post-quake boss"
description: "Learns the views of the Civil Defence national controller on his role and perceptions of his approach to the aftermath of the February 22 2011 earthquake in Christchurch. Covers his military career and how this background came to the fore in his control of the disaster. Shares lessons that other NZ councils and other countries could learn about disaster response."

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Fiance didn't kill baby, says family"
description: "Examines the case of a 6 month old baby dying of 'non-accidental injuries' that is now the subject of a murder inquiry."

Author: "Hamel, Rodney"
Title: "Lessons of war"
description: "Features some of the war memorials formerly or currently located at schools in the region. Discusses some of the architects and explains why some monuments were demolished. Comments on the rhetoric used on or about memorials."

Author: "Riddell, Oliver"
Author (detailed): "Oliver Riddell, Hayden Meikle and Raylene Myhill"
Title: "Narrative does forgotten men proud; 'Extraordinary' academic honoured; Recent fiction"
description: "Narrative does forgotten men proud; 'Extraordinary' academic honoured; Recent fiction"

Author: "Lynch, Keith"
Title: "Behind the lines"
description: "Describes the journalist's experience of reporting from within Christchurch's cordoned off area at Civil Defence headquarters after the February 22 2011 earthquake. Touches on the media briefings at the Art Gallery, the international media, bus tours of the city centre, the visit by Prince William, and other impressions of the earthquake affected central business district."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "Picking up the pieces left behind by a nation of losers"
description: "Delves into Wellington's various lost property piles. Talks to lost property officers at various locations around the city including James Cook Hotel executive housekeeper Denise Thornton, Wellington Central police station property team leader Sonia Viles, Wellington railway station customer liaison officer Teri Geldenhuis, and Westpac Stadium receptionist Annette Miller about some of the more unusual lost property items they have come across."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "One for the band"
description: "Talks to the singer-songwriter-guitarist about the process of making of his new album, again with the backing of his Dunedin group, the Heavy Eights. Comments on his busy year with The Clean."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "How a world of downloads killed Real Groovy"
description: "Meets the owner of Real Groovy Wellington to talk about his career in the retail trade and the reasons behind the demise of his music store. Lists his favourite albums, songs and films. Speaks to Slow Boat Records owner Dennis O'Brien about the future of his Cuba Street store."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "The town that cheers for Kiwis"
description: "Describes how the small French town of Le Quesnoy has been remembering the NZ soldiers who liberated the town after its being occupied by German forces for four years during World War One. Notes a number of NZers come to this town every year to be part of the remembrance services, and details the part two NZ soldiers, Colonel Laurence 'Curly' Blyth and Henry James Nicholas VC, played in the town's liberation. Includes a narrative of how soldiers with NZs Rifle Brigade stormed Le Quesnoy."

Title: "Contributing to patients' comfort"
description: "Interviews the enrolled nurse at Dunedin Hospital about her job."

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "Quake chief bows out : 'I think I've done my bit'"
description: "Learns the views of the Civil Defence national controller on his role and perceptions of his approach to the aftermath of the February 22 2011 earthquake in Christchurch. Covers his military career and how this background came to the fore in his control of the disaster. Shares lessons that other NZ councils and other countries could learn about disaster response."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Blueberries - pick of the crop"
description: "Talks to Prebbleton blueberry orchard owners Don Babe and Wendy Babe. Explains their reasons for choosing blueberries and for using the pick-your-own model. Mentions the mix of varieties they grow.  Touches on NZ Plant & Food Research inquiry  into the blueberry's reaction to high ultra-violet exposure in NZ. Notes the blueberry's antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities, and describes the work of the late Dr James Joseph into blueberries assisting cognitive performance."

Author: "Meikle, Hayden"
Title: "Lunch with heroes, one last time"
description: "Reports on the final reunion of the surviving members of the Otago Mounted Rifles, Taieri RSA, 2011. Informs that his grandfather is one of the few horsemen remaining of the men in the unit. Discusses his grandfather's experiences, which the author compiled into a book, 'From steed to steel', for the extended family."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Off with her head"
description: "Previews the play Mary Stuart by German playwright Friedrich Schiller at Maidment Theatre, May 5-28. The play brings together Elizabeth I and Mary Queen of Scots together as played by two of NZs leading ladies, Robyn Malcolm and Elizabeth Hawthorne"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Commander still loves Otago"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-born commander in the Royal NZ Navy about his work. Mentions his regular trips to Otago to visit family."

Author: "Van den Bergh, Roeland"
Title: "Red-hot fares for long haul"
description: "Focuses on the arrival of two new budget long-haul airlines (AirAisa X and Jetstar) flying between NZ and Southeast Asia, and the expected boon for the tourism industry. Examines how budget airlines can offer fares cheaper than the traditional full-service airlines."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "From simple beauty to hard truths"
description: "Reviews two exhibitions by Mary McIntyre, one at Pah Homestead to May 28 called Retrospective : Mary McIntyre, the other at Whitespace called Unease to May 7. Also reviews South by Nic Moon, Whitespace to May 7, Noh Time by Stephen Bambury and Recent work by Joachim Bandau at Two Rooms to May 14, Vernacular Painting by Matt Henry at Starkwhite Gallery to May 14."

Title: "'We remember our fallen'"
description: "Reports on Anzac Day services, parades and other commemorations in the region, 25 Apr 2011."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "More man than you can manage?"
description: "Examines television commercials for their recent potrayals of manliness, noting how Fonterra uses the concept to sell its Mammoth dairy products to men. Looks at advertisements that challenge the Code for Advertising Liquor ban on unduly masculine themes in alcohol ads. Seeks comment from television lecturer Daniel Chandler on continuing differences in advertisments aimed at men and women. Reviews recent decisions by the Advertising Standards Authority on complaints about sexism in ads in print, radio and television."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "The French connection"
description: "Talks to Aaron Kreisler and Robyn Notman, co-curators of the exhibition 'Frances Hodgkins : the French connection', Dunedin Public Art Gallery, 28 Apr 2011-15 Apr 2012. Explains that this exhibition looks at her paintings in the context of Intimism, a branch of French Impressionism."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Rising star"
description: "Tells how the Levin-raised newsreader became China's first foreign television news anchor. Talks about his career, which started with a three-year cadetship with the Levin 'Chronicle' in the late 1950s, and the sensitive nature of some of the stories he has had to read on CCTV's English-language channel. Mentions that a Hollywood film based on his life may be made."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'The Backlands' by Bruce Hunt, Milford Galleries Dunedin.  Reviews 'Nervous system' by Ben Pearce, 'Boy love - dummy heart' by Angela Lyon and 'Indigo blues' by Ana Terry and Don Hunter, Blue Oyster Gallery, Dunedin, until 28 May 2011."

Author: "Cameron, D. J."
Title: "Auckland cricket dynasty loses veteran player and broadcaster"
description: "Auckland cricket dynasty loses veteran player and broadcaster"

Author: "Hutchinson, Dan"
Title: "Meet South's longest married couple : special day is never forgotten"
description: "Meet South's longest married couple : special day is never forgotten"

Author: "MacKay, Scott"
Title: "Crash victim loved life on the water"
description: "Crash victim loved life on the water"

Author: "Hutchinson, Dan"
Title: "Hard work recognised - 66 years later"
description: "Hard work recognised - 66 years later"

Title: "Teenager gets custodial sentence"
description: "Teenager gets custodial sentence"

Author: "Hutchinson, Dan"
Title: "Peers salute battler who saved birds from extinction"
description: "Peers salute battler who saved birds from extinction"

Author: "Abercrombie, Nicola"
Title: "Back on his feet"
description: "Profiles the former elite basketballer and later Paralympian who, more than 30 years after a diving accident that confined him to a wheelchair, has the chance to walk again, thanks to his pair of Rex bionic legs, invented in NZ. Outlines the health benefits for MacCalman in being able to stand upright again."

Author: "Agnew, Margaret"
Title: "First resort"
description: "Visits Lake Tekapo and describes the accommodation, food, and sights to be seen in the Mackenzie Country location, highlighting a trip to the Mt John University observatory."

Title: "Southland heroes get stamp of approval"
description: "Southland heroes get stamp of approval"

Author: "Burdon, Nathan"
Title: "'I don't want to be part of the fix'"
description: "'I don't want to be part of the fix'"

Author: "Burdon, Nathan"
Title: "Tuineau to run on for Tonga at cup"
description: "Tuineau to run on for Tonga at cup"

Author: "Pokoney, Cassandra"
Title: "Verdict : guilty : stepdad 'slams tot's head'"
description: "Verdict : guilty : stepdad 'slams tot's head'"

Author: "Suckling, Lee"
Title: "Migration nation"
description: "Discusses the benefits of spending time living overseas with a number of NZers who have returned from their OE (overseas experience) in the United Kingdom."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Up for it [part 1]"
description: "Describes two Havelock North houses recognised in the 2011 NZ Architecture Awards, one designed by Stevens Lawson, the other by Warren and Mahoney."

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Wild, wild West"
description: "Recounts a seven-day, 40 kilometre tramp from Frew Stream to Toaroha River via Frew Saddle, Bluff Hutt and Toaroha Saddle."

Author: "Marshall, Jonathan"
Title: "Once seen, never forgotten"
description: "Chronicles the life of colourful character Margaret Hoffman, the 'patron saint' of Karangahape Rd, who has recently died."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Mother load"
description: "Describes the challenges of first time motherhood and all the conflicting advice and the occasional hurtful throw away line from nursing staff in the maternity ward leading to post-natal depression (PND) or perinatal distress. Relates how the author self-referred to a psychiatrist specialising in maternal mental health. Characterises PND and its prevalence and the support agencies that exist to help those mothers who are experiencing difficulties in coping with motherhood. Announces the newly create umbrella group for the support groups Perinatal Mental Health New Zealand Trust (PMHNZ). Relates a similar set of circumstances experienced by Ruth Holt and husband Andrew."

Author: "Suckling, Lee"
Title: "Migration nation"
description: "Discusses the benefits of spending time living overseas with a number of NZers who have returned from their OE (overseas experience) in the United Kingdom."

Author: "Green, Paula,"
Title: "Thinking person's beauty and the beast"
description: "Thinking person's beauty and the beast"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Up for it [part 1]"
description: "Describes two Havelock North houses recognised in the 2011 NZ Architecture Awards, one designed by Stevens Lawson, the other by Warren and Mahoney."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Making better babies"
description: "Considers the ongoing debate between scientists and naturopaths, about whether the secret to a healthy baby (and adult) starts with what their mother eats. Briefly profiles a couple who have been converted to naturopathic ideas, and outlines what naturopath Loula George considers good and bad for parental nutrition."

Author: "Dench, Alison"
Title: "Walking the Waitakere Ranges"
description: "Describes 6 walks from easy to hard in the Waitakere Ranges. Includes track length, walking time, track quality, difficulty, highlights and access. These are walks that are going to be added to their book called Walking the Waitakere Ranges"

Author: "Jones, Bridget"
Title: "Calling the tune"
description: "Talks to popular musician Shayne Carter on the eve of his latest tour, in which he will revisit his old songbooks, from his teenage outfits Bored Games and the Doublehappys through to the iconic Straitjacket Fits and Dimmer."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Talks to law student Carlo Salizzo about a typical day in his life."

Author: "Greive, Duncan"
Title: "Adult entertainment"
description: "Talks to Shihad frontman Jon Toogood, about starting from scratch with a new band, called the Adults."

Author: "Wade, Amelia"
Title: "Broadcaster loses cancer battle"
description: "Broadcaster loses cancer battle"

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "The time-off trap; Just the job"
description: "Warns against the dangers of taking too long to return to work after an illness or injury. Suggests that not getting back to work can eventually become a route to long-term benefit dependency, with all the associated detrimental effects on health, finances and lifestyle. Investigates a textbook-style case of getting back to work in Dylan Owen, a National Library of NZ employee, who returned to work after recovering from major heart surgery, primarily because he missed the work and social environment enough to feel a need to be back at work. Talks to various professionals about the importance of returning to work after a substantial break, and the 'psychosocial' implications attached."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Call for abuse claims commission"
description: "Call for abuse claims commission"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Will trade: big rock for clean state"
description: "Will trade: big rock for clean state"

Title: "Anzac of the year award goes to 'quintessential citizen-soldier'"
description: "Anzac of the year award goes to 'quintessential citizen-soldier'"

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Explain drink danger, parents told"
description: "Explain drink danger, parents told"

Author: "Ratuva, Steven"
Title: "The Chinese lake"
description: "Considers China's expanding influence in the Pacific, as Cold War rhetoric is rekindled and America's fears of increasing competition are played out."

Author: "Eriksen, Alanah"
Title: "'Denny and Gazza' on guest list for abbey"
description: "'Denny and Gazza' on guest list for abbey"

Title: "Brave brothers honoured for saving boy from fire"
description: "Brave brothers honoured for saving boy from fire"

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "One day at a time"
description: "Reports on Christchurch's continuing crisis post-earthquakes, emphasising vanishing jobs and massive skills shortages. Highlights how entire sectors, including the tourism and foreign education markets, are in free-fall, while the real estate market is barely alive. Talks about various projects being set up to rebuild the workforce in Christchurch, particularly in the construction industry."

Author: "Yska, Redmer"
Title: "Woodstock in tracksuits"
description: "Ponders whether imminent Rugby World Cup fever will match up to the most delirious sporting event NZ has ever hosted: the so-called Friendly Games, the 1974 Commonwealth Games."

Author: "Yska, Redmer"
Title: "1974 Christchurch Commonwealth Games"
description: "Ponders whether imminent Rugby World Cup fever will match up to the most delirious sporting event NZ has ever hosted: the so-called Friendly Games, the 1974 Commonwealth Games."

Author: "Watson White, Helen"
Title: "Harlots and hoons, Rita and Douglas"
description: "Reviews the late Greme Tetley's 'Riverside Drive', and 'Rita and Douglas', by Dave Armstrong, and starring Jennifer Ward-Lealand as Rita Angus, both of which premiered at the Southern Lakes Festival of Colour in April 2011."

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "Lessons from the Barbican"
description: "Wonders if Christchurch could use the elements of London's Barbican Centre as a template for a new performing arts centre. Notes that the Christchurch Polytechnic Institute of Technology, with the help of Creative NZ, will provide temporary housing for the city's major creative agencies on its Barbados St campus."

Author: "Trevett, Claire"
Title: "Brash character survives from past"
description: "Talks to the new leader of the ACT Party. Focuses on his personal frugality and his identification with the party brand."

Author: "Roxburgh, Tracey"
Title: "Airport issue to High Court; They said it"
description: "Reports that the controversial strategic allance between the two airport corporations will be the subject of a judicial review in the High Court, Queenstown, beginning 16 May 2011. Informs of the nature of the review and overviews the circumstances that have prompted it. Includes comment and opinion from various parties."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Juggling farm with family and business"
description: "Talks to the Otago-Southland entrant for the Enterprising Rural Woman Award sponsored by Rural Women New Zealand. Talks to her about how she juggles running a printing firm with raising three young children, as well as helping her husband Antony Robertson to run a sheep and beef cropping property."

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "Generator steams ahead"
description: "Considers the potential of Genesis Power (trading as Genesis Energy), the country's main thermal generator, as an investment option. Talks about its market position and resources. Highlights some of its risks."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Grasping the mettle; A cray fisherman's tale; Grasping the mettle - the Jamie Joseph philosophy"
description: "Speaks to the Blenheim-raised former lock/loose forward and current coach of the rugby union team. Focuses on his coaching philosophy and decision making about recruiting members and staff of the 2011 team. Touches on his playing days. Asks television star and former Otago player Marc Ellis to share some of his memories of Joseph."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "[200 days in office]; Seeing his way clear; Better to burn out than fade away; Cutting cloth to fit the future; Taking a measured approach; Confident in the district's future"
description: "Talks to the mayors of Dunedin, Clutha, Queenstown Lakes, Central Otago and Waitaki, respectively, about their experiences in their first 200 days in office. Touches on the high and low points of the office."

Author: "Margo White"
Title: "He is not his hormones"
description: "Considers myths surrounding the 'male menopause'. States that menopause is a sex-specific biological fact of female life, when oestrogen production drops dramatically; whereas men's testosterone levels drop slowly over decades and have nothing to do with their reproductive cycle, because they don't actually have one. Refers to claims that all the research being done on the subject is medicalising the everyday stuff of getting older. Notes that in the US testosterone treatment is soaring, mainly among men in their 40s and 50s."

Author: "Margo White"
Title: "Recognising the 'male menopause'"
description: "Considers myths surrounding the 'male menopause'. States that menopause is a sex-specific biological fact of female life, when oestrogen production drops dramatically; whereas men's testosterone levels drop slowly over decades and have nothing to do with their reproductive cycle, because they don't actually have one. Refers to claims that all the research being done on the subject is medicalising the everyday stuff of getting older. Notes that in the US testosterone treatment is soaring, mainly among men in their 40s and 50s."

Author: "Skeaff, Murray"
Title: "Folic folly"
description: "Stresses the importance of preventing further delays in deciding whether to add folic acid to bread, stating that, form a public health point of view, the decision to fortify is simple, as the cost benefit for preventing neural tube defects is enormous."

Author: "Dowden, Peter"
Author (detailed): "Peter Dowden, Bryan James and Oliver Riddell"
Title: "Contemplating world without cars; Some gaps filled in Maori contact history; A must-have for any library on Gallipoli campaign"
description: "Contemplating world without cars; Some gaps filled in Maori contact history; A must-have for any library on Gallipoli campaign"

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Disclosure for the judiciary?"
description: "Investigates the need for a register of pecuniary interests for judges. Talks to Green MP Kennedy Graham about his Register of Pecuniary Interest of Judges Bill. Considers the findings of the Law Commission's first issues paper 'Towards a new courts act', which analysed the issue as part of its review of the Judicature Act 1908. Looks at the debate surrounding the introduction of a register of pecuniary interests for MPs (members of Parliament) in 2005."

Title: "'We dye whitebait red or orange'"
description: "Interviews the consultant ecologist for Golder Associates about his work."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "When trust goes wrong"
description: "Relates the true story of a gross breach of trust concerning a power of attorney involving an aging mother and one of her three sons who stole her savings. Suggests that it is better to appoint two attorneys rather than one. Briefly explains the three different kinds of power of attorney in NZ."

Title: "Landlord and tenant issues : a guide to commercial leases"
description: "Looks at the obligations of a landlord when premises become either untenantable, compromised but tenantable, or undamaged but inaccessible after an event such as an earthquake."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "From city to farm to national finals"
description: "Profiles the couple who will represent Otago in the 2011 New Zealand Sharemilker/Equity Farmer of the Year Contest, Queenstown, 14 May 2011. Overviews their experience in dairying and mentions their previous job operating a gift and homeware shop in Wellington. Names the other regional finalists in the competition."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Perils of not getting the paperwork right"
description: "Reviews and comments on Henderson v Westpac Banking Corporation Ltd and others CIV 2010-404-1212 High Court Auckland, in relation to Mr Henderson, a property developer involved in developments in NZ and Australia, not properly serving two creditors when bankruptcy proceedings were initiated."

Title: "Useful steer to receivers"
description: "Comments on Justice Panckhurst's recent High Court decision in Taylor & Ors v Bank of NZ & Ors in relation to claims alleging breaches of duty by receivers."

Author: "Knowsley, Jo"
Title: "Dogs of law"
description: "Investigates the recent debate surrounding the granting of name suppression and the view that the rich and famous have been receiving special treatment from the courts. Talks to criminal lawyer Bill Nabney, blogger Cameron Slater, University of Auckland law professor Bill Hodge and Chief District Court Judge Russell Johnson about their views on the issue. Touches on a number of recent high profile cases including those of sports broadcaster Martin Devlin, former Tauranga doctor Lisa Catherine Edwards, barrister Sandra Anne Grant and childcare worker Sophia Bickerton."

Author: "Collett, Geoff"
Title: "Work, philanthrophy, and a bit of fun, too"
description: "Work, philanthrophy, and a bit of fun, too"

Author: "Arnold, Naomi"
Title: "Letting go of the festival reins"
description: "Letting go of the festival reins"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Apocalypse soon"
description: "Reports that some NZers are bracing for the end of the world, linking the global financial crisis, changing weather patterns, earthquakes and unrest in the Middle East to prophecies of Armageddon. Speaks to Harold Camping, an 89-year-old preacher form Oakland, California, who is convinced Judgement Day is coming on 21 May 2011 and to Jason Kerrison, from the rock band Opshop, who thinks 21 December 2012 'is the end of the great cycle'."

Author: "Howe, Jonathon"
Title: "Garrett's career in movies recognised"
description: "Garrett's career in movies recognised"

Author: "Wilson, Clay"
Title: "National Bowls title well worth the wait"
description: "National Bowls title well worth the wait"

Author: "Connell, Claire"
Title: "Aleisha takes a weight off her mind"
description: "Aleisha takes a weight off her mind"

Author: "Crean, MIke"
Title: "Journalist had a keen eye for good story"
description: "Journalist had a keen eye for good story"

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "Bound for glory"
description: "Reports on the role Outward Bound has been playing in NZ's sporting success. Talks to cycling champion Alison Shanks, swimmer Emily Thomas and rower David Mabbot about their experiences on the eight-day Outward Bound course in the Marlborough Sounds."

Author: "Wilson, Clay"
Title: "Kendra is just Dotty about horses"
description: "Kendra is just Dotty about horses"

Author: "Ensor, Blair"
Title: "Shane the baker finally laid to rest"
description: "Shane the baker finally laid to rest"

Author: "Orman, Tony,"
Title: "Staunch champion of the environment"
description: "Staunch champion of the environment"

Author: "Alexander, John"
Title: "Golden run for Renwick high achiever"
description: "Golden run for Renwick high achiever"

Author: "Howie, Cherie"
Title: "Eminent merino breeder and judge"
description: "Eminent merino breeder and judge"

Author: "Wilson, Clay"
Title: "Teen's a big hit on the court or course"
description: "Teen's a big hit on the court or course"

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "Football Fern aims for World Cup progress"
description: "Football Fern aims for World Cup progress"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Slow fast food is back; Pressure cooking is making a comeback"
description: "Talks to cookbook author Lisa Loveday about the revival of pressure cooking.  Discusses their advantages. Touches on the history of pressure cooking. Includes recipes for pea and ham risotto, sticky date and walnut pudding with caramel sauce, and chilli con carne."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Can't get enough"
description: "Talks to the musician about his return to live performance, chatting about his musical and academic careers and what he looks for in music today."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Children's new advocate has proud record of cutting abuse"
description: "Profiles the paediatrician who is the incoming Children's Commissioner. Describes the scheme he set up in the Hawke's Bay that has reduced statistics for child maltreatment in the area. Talks to local experts about his cross sectoral approach."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "One Square Meal a feat of food science"
description: "Decodes the ingredients in the packaged food bar, noting it was launched by Hamish Carter and that it provides a third of daily nutritional and energy requirements."

Author: "Roughan, John"
Title: "A bad night's sleep"
description: "Advises of the high incidence of sleep disturbed breathing. Describes the condition and points out the most vulnerable sectors of the population. Notes NZ's increased number of diagnostic laboratories catering to sleep disordered breathing. Discusses what sleeping pattern is considered normal. Informs of how the condition can be controlled. Sets out the argument for people with sleep apnoea being allowed to drive."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "The power of one"
description: "Considers the abilities and qualities of the man in charge of the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA) and the $8 billion rebuild of Christchurch. Looks back on his family background, childhood and career. Touches on his vision for how many of the city's icon heritage buildings should be restored."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Philip Duncan"
description: "Interviews the former radio advertiser who runs a private weather forecasting business. Portrays his passion for weather from a young age, presents his views of the governmental owned MetService, and sets out the type of weather information that should be available in NZ. Explains why he swapped Christianity for nature."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "The difference is in the fine details"
description: "Reviews exhibitions at three Auckland galleries. Appraises 'The Asian' by Heather Straka, 'Of gorse of course' by Regan Gentry, and 'WK: 422' by Bill Riley, at Te Tuhi Centre for the Arts; 'Light levels' by Bill Culbert, at Sue Crockford Gallery; and 'Radio painting' by Simon Ingram, at Gow Langsford Gallery."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Gimblett's inner sanctum on The Bowery"
description: "Gimblett's inner sanctum on The Bowery"

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Art's bright star"
description: "Talks to the associate professor at The University of Auckland's Elam School of Fine Arts about his extensive sculptural installation, 'On first looking into Chapman's Homer', which will represent NZ at the 2011 Venice Biennale. Looks back on his career."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Happy playing in your own backyard"
description: "Reviews three books on ceramics in NZ."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Michael Parekowhai"
description: "Talks to the associate professor at The University of Auckland's Elam School of Fine Arts about his extensive sculptural installation, 'On first looking into Chapman's Homer', which will represent NZ at the 2011 Venice Biennale. Looks back on his career."

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Guardian of a sense of place"
description: "Talks to the author about her first novel, 'Guardian of the dead', which is a finalist in this month's NZ Post Children's Book Awards."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "Low-cost Chinese housing about to hit Kiwi suburbs"
description: "Looks at modular style houses costing less than $100,000 that will be imported from China to help with the housing shortage in Christchurch. Looks at other firms supplying container style houses in NZ. Talks to  Anthony Deng Li of Plug In Construction, Mike TeReo of Connect Building Group, Rod Gibson of Habode, and Derek Jackson of BreezePod."

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Karen Healey"
description: "Talks to the author about her first novel, 'Guardian of the dead', which is a finalist in this month's NZ Post Children's Book Awards."

Author: "Ansley, Bruce"
Title: "For the Love of the Game : Grassroots Rugby in Heartland New Zealand by Gregor Paul and Gregory Crow"
description: "For the Love of the Game : Grassroots Rugby in Heartland New Zealand by Gregor Paul and Gregory Crow"

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Crisis in the family firm; downturn lingers for small firms"
description: "Examines the ongoing difficulties facing small businesses, often family run businesses, looking at the example of a fish and chip shop owner in Glen Innes, Auckland. Presents research by the Centre for SME (small-to-medium enterprises) Research, Massey University, on the performance of microfirms (five staff or fewer) and small companies (between 6 and 49 staff)."

Author: "Scott, Hanna"
Title: "The walls of perception"
description: "Speaks to the abstract artist about her large-scale wall paintings. Talks about her latest projects: 'Jeena Shin: stairwell project' at Auckland's Artspace and 'Fractus' at the Dunedin Public Art Gallery, 7 May to 30 Oct 2011."

Author: "Scott, Hanna"
Title: "Jeena Shin : Stairwell Project"
description: "Speaks to the abstract artist about her large-scale wall paintings. Talks about her latest projects: 'Jeena Shin: stairwell project' at Auckland's Artspace and 'Fractus' at the Dunedin Public Art Gallery, 7 May to 30 Oct 2011."

Author: "Webster, Sally"
Title: "Corporate whirlwind promotes inner peace"
description: "Corporate whirlwind promotes inner peace"

Author: "Pickmere, Arnold"
Title: "Royal piping high note for proud Kiwi"
description: "Royal piping high note for proud Kiwi"

Author: "Wong, Helene"
Title: "No clear answer"
description: "Reviews Alexander Roman's documentary about the Parker-Hulme murder case."

Author: "Wong, Helene"
Title: "Reflections of the past, directed by Alexander Roman"
description: "Reviews Alexander Roman's documentary about the Parker-Hulme murder case."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Mapping the human heart"
description: "Talks to Rod Jackson, professor of epidemiology at The University of Auckland, about the development of a software programme called 'PREDICT' that is helping doctors predict and treat cardiovascular disease."

Author: "Black, Katherine"
Title: "Winter fuel"
description: "Looks at the vital role nutrition plays for athletes during the colder months."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Deluge' by Lorraine Rastorfer, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 25 May 2011.  Reviews 'Hen's teeth' by Joanna Braithwaite, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 25 May 2011.  Reviews 'Fabrication' by Sandra Thomson, Monumental Gallery, Dunedin, until 10 Jun 2011."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Danger of lost art"
description: "Focuses on the imminent loss of a stand of kopi (karaka) trees that have rakau momori (dendroglyphs representing human and animal figures) carved into their living bark by early Chatham Islands Moriori. Talks about the efforts to protect and catalogue the trees."

Author: "Thomas, Paul"
Title: "Going, going ..."
description: "Reflects on the expected exodus of top rugby players to overseas clubs after the 2012 Rugby World Cup and the impact it will have on NZ rugby."

Author: "Thomas, Paul"
Title: "Rugby 2012 : going, going ..."
description: "Reflects on the expected exodus of top rugby players to overseas clubs after the 2012 Rugby World Cup and the impact it will have on NZ rugby."

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "'Blokes with tears down their faces'; Coastal communities count the cost"
description: "Reports on the aftermath of the storm that hit the region on 25-26 May 2011, resulting in significant damage to more than 50 farms. Visits station owners James Aitken, Bruce D'ath and Rob Eagles to discuss the damage they sustained. Speaks to Mike Barham of Rural Support East Coast about the farm damage he has developed. Sums up the toll taken by the storm on coastal communities."

Author: "Cooper, Michael,"
Title: "Red terraces"
description: "Talks to winemaker Gordon Russell of Villa Maria's Esk Valley winery, about the vineyard and 'The Terraces' (one of NZ's most expensive red wines)."

Author: "Cooper, Michael,"
Title: "Villa Maria : The Terraces"
description: "Talks to winemaker Gordon Russell of Villa Maria's Esk Valley winery, about the vineyard and 'The Terraces' (one of NZ's most expensive red wines)."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Plight of the world's most efficient pollinators"
description: "Reports on threats to the viability of the honey bee, particularly overseas, where reported bee losses have reached an unprecedented scale. Talks to National Beekeepers' Association (NBA) joint chief executives Daniel Paul and Pauline Downie about recent reports of significant bee losses in NZ. Informs of the NBA's intention to apply to the Environmental Risk Management Authority for reassessment of the uses of neonicotinoid pesticides. Cites views of several NZ beekeepers interviewed by US-NZ director Taggart Siegel in his new documentary. Lists ways that people can help honey bees."

Author: "Fox, Michael"
Title: "The beauty of pageants is performing"
description: "Interviews the Levin-raised woman recently crowned as Miss Universe New Zealand."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Branching out"
description: "Backgrounds and explains the art of espalier. Provides diagrams to show how to create a basic espalier."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Espaliers and archways"
description: "Backgrounds and explains the art of espalier."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "The land of the rising sea"
description: "Focuses on the international and local preparations being made for the predicted rise in sea levels and extreme weather conditions that will occur as a result of climate change. Talks about how the scientific uncertainty surrounding how high sea levels will go is causing problems for councils around the country when they map coastal hazard zones they believe will be at risk from inundation, erosion and storm surges over the next 50 to 100 years. Looks at what NZ is doing to cut emissions. Touches on some recent extreme weather events around the world. Speaks to James Hansen, a world-leading American climate scientist, about 'greenwashing' governments who talk green but do next to nothing and his latest assessment on how far sea levels might rise by 2100."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Citizens onside"
description: "Talks to Conal McFeely, who runs Creggan Enterprises (a community economic development organisation in one of Londonderry's poorest suburbs), about how the rebuilding of strife-torn Londonderry can hold lessons for quake-ravished Christchurch."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Christchurch citizens onside"
description: "Talks to Conal McFeely, who runs Creggan Enterprises (a community economic development organisation in one of Londonderry's poorest suburbs), about how the rebuilding of strife-torn Londonderry can hold lessons for quake-ravished Christchurch."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "How a quake-devastated community rebuilt itself; Rebuilding after the big one; Picking up and getting on with life [part 1]"
description: "Visits the California town devastated by the 6.9 Loma Prieta earthquake, 17 Oct 1989. Accompanies representatives of the Canterbury Chamber of Commerce to learn about how the town recovered over time, and lessons for NZ in the aftermath of the Canterbury earthquakes. Talks to several members of the business community, including a man whose two workmates died in the rubble of their coffee roasting business, and to a man whose independent bookshop was tagged as unsafe but whose business was saved by volunteer community labour. Speaks to the city planner and city manager about the rebuilding process. Talks to construction magnate Barry Swenson, who developed properties in Santa Cruz and who owns properties in NZ, including the earthquake-damaged Red Lion Hotel, Rangiora. Tells the stories of two women who were injured in the Santa Cruz earthquake. Briefly compares the California and 22 Feb 2011 Christchurch earthquakes. Includes a redevelopment timeline for the Santa Cruz community from 1989-1995."

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Portia eager to start at all-new school"
description: "Portia eager to start at all-new school"

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "The long run home - marathon man's mission"
description: "The long run home - marathon man's mission"

Author: "Rutherford, Hamish"
Title: "Steel yourself, it's Bernard Whimp"
description: "Backgrounds the upcoming High Court case in which the bankrupt property developer will face accusations of misleading shareholders in several major NZ companies. Reports on some of his associates who have been implicated in related finance company dealings."

Title: "The ABC of NZ skate: Chey Ataria"
description: "The ABC of NZ skate: Chey Ataria"

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "94-year-old lives dream to take flight"
description: "94-year-old lives dream to take flight"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Shot, home lost in quake but cop finds hope in hard times: six months after being attacked at a siege in Christchurch an officer has returned to work"
description: "Shot, home lost in quake but cop finds hope in hard times: six months after being attacked at a siege in Christchurch an officer has returned to work"

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "The mother load"
description: "Examines the impact of feminism on the lives of modern mothers. Looks at the challenges of finding work-life balance. Talks to several women about their experiences. Seeks views of sociologists Lesley Patterson and Kathy Stuart, author Gill South, Children's Commissioner John Angus, and ANZ human resources general manager Felicity Evans and former Women's Affairs Minister Dame Margaret Shields."

Author: "McIntyre, Donna"
Title: "Life of fun forging forest trails"
description: "Life of fun forging forest trails"

Author: "Clark, Victoria"
Title: "Wild life"
description: "Profiles the newest Court of Appeal judge. Focuses on his penchant for active pursuits such as skydiving, mountaineering and woodworking."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Allergic reaction"
description: "Speaks to the Dusseldorf-born printmaker and painter. Talks about the inspiration of landscapes and poetry on her work. Touches on her current focus on painting after developing an allergy to some printmaking materials. Informs of her latest exhibition 'Above water', Solander Works on Paper Gallery, Wellington, until 11 Jun 2011."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Taking the plunge in Italy"
description: "Profiles the couple, former owner-operators of Pravda cafe, who decided to leave Wellington to live near Milan, Italy. Informs that he now owns the rights to manufacture Rocket Milan Espresso machines. Describes the challenges for them and their son in settling into a new country, despite his Italian ancestry. Mentions the differences in eating and drinking culture compared with NZ."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Where dreams come true [part 2]"
description: "Features three homes on Waiheke Island, all of which were winners in the 'residential architecture - homes' category of the New Zealand Institute of Architecture Awards. Talks to architects David Mitchell, Andrew Patterson and Tim Hay about their creations."

Author: "Knowsley, Jo"
Title: "Knife nation"
description: "Focuses on the growth of knife crime in NZ. Explains that violent offences involving stabbing or cutting weapons have risen on average 3 per cent a year from 2000 to 2009 (or around 34 per cent in the past decade). Notes that the biggest increase was among teenagers.
