Touches on some recent high profile cases, including the stabbing of 16-year-old Marshall Daldry by a 14-year-old boy and the stabbing of dairy owner Shashikant Prema by a 17-year-old boy. Talks to Patrick Walsh, president of the Secondary Principals' Association, about the issue and the introduction of new powers that will allow teachers and principals to 'search and seize' knives and other weapons from students."

Author: "Long, Richard"
Title: "Story behind the news from Asia"
description: "Book review of 'Reporter : forty years covering Asia'."

Author: "Gay, Edward"
Title: "'She died in a needless, violent way': hunter jailed for two and a half years fo shooting teacher at campsite"
description: "'She died in a needless, violent way': hunter jailed for two and a half years fo shooting teacher at campsite"

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Charity ride sunk at sea; Stormy end to dream ride"
description: "Focuses on the failed 'Ultimate Ride' attempt by three NZers to jet ski from London to Auckland to raise awareness of cancer. Talks about the acrimony surrounding the failure."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "No worries... even at 15,000 feet"
description: "No worries... even at 15,000 feet"

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Killed on his 17th birthday; Collision kills student on 17th birthday"
description: "Killed on his 17th birthday; Collision kills student on 17th birthday"

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "Game breaker gives his team huge edge"
description: "Game breaker gives his team huge edge"

Author: "Cone, Deborah Hill"
Title: "Contrived counsel"
description: "Reviews a new reality programme about fixing family problems with the help of mediator Alia Simpson."

Author: "Hill, Marika"
Title: "Making a bee-line to save our crops"
description: "Talks about four Oturu School students from Kaitaia, who are competing in the World Problem Solving Competition in Wisconsin in June, and their efforts to increase local bee numbers by planting trees and creating information brochures. Mentions the phenomenon of bee colony collapse disorder and the importance of bee pollination to agriculture."

Author: "Neale, Imogen"
Title: "Boys-only classes create brighter future"
description: "Talks about the introduction of boys-only classes at Dawson Rd School, Otara, and Roslyn School, Palmerston North. Relates that boys had been falling behind girls in school performance and that boys-only classes for year 4, 5 and 6 boys had lifted performance and behaviour. Reports the opinions of respondents to a Sunday star times poll on boys-only classes."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Right to infuriate a flag we bear"
description: "Looks at the issue of flag burning after the Supreme Court ordered in favour of Valerie Morse who burned the NZ flag at an ANZAC day service. Talks about freedom of speech and expression and what actions should be permitted in a democratic society."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Stars in his eyes"
description: "Talks to David Hartnell about his life, homosexuality and his career, starting as a makeup artist and becoming a gossip columnist. Relates anecdotes of his experiences with stars. Mentions Hartnell's latest book 'Memoirs of a gossip columnist'."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Osama's decade"
description: "Talks about how the terrorist attacks led by Osama bin Laden on 11 Sep 2001 have had an impact on NZ society. Relates how the NZ government reacted to the attacks, the resulting NZ involvement in Afghanistan, and how this reaction affected NZ/US relations. Notes how the attacks prompted changes in NZ civil liberty laws and terrorism laws and talks about cases which were affected by new terrorism laws. Looks at changes in themes of films, TV and books in western culture since the attacks."

Author: "Selkirk, John"
Author (detailed): "/ photographs by John Selkirk, text by Adam Dudding"
Title: "Memories and music in Margaret's honour"
description: "Reports on the funeral of Margaret Hoffman, a well known street person who frequented Karangahape Rd, Auckland."

Author: "Hinton, Marc"
Title: "True grit"
description: "Talks to Thomas Abercrombie about his career and ambitions in basketball, and his career with the NZ Breakers basketball team."

Author: "Mace, William"
Title: "Anatomy of a collapse"
description: "Relates the background causes of the collapse of the finance company Nathans Finance. States that problems with the subsidiary Vending Technologies, or VTL, and their inability to repay loans put Nathans Finance in financial difficulty. Reports that Nathans Finance made inaccurate statements about its debt problems in its prospectus and directors have been accused of Securities Act breaches as a result."

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Tragic OE: woman dies of poisoning"
description: "Tragic OE: woman dies of poisoning"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Child of slain woman honours 'greatest hero'"
description: "Child of slain woman honours 'greatest hero'"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Offensive attack may be clue to murder"
description: "Offensive attack may be clue to murder"

Author: "De Graaf, Peter"
Title: "Iwi mourn 'architect' of claims"
description: "Iwi mourn 'architect' of claims"

Author: "Bradley, Grant"
Title: "Ex-coalminer to keep Red Sheds in black"
description: "Ex-coalminer to keep Red Sheds in black"

Title: "Life & death in the bay of pigs"
description: "Life & death in the bay of pigs"

Author: "Goodger, Karen"
Title: "Business adviser with a big heart"
description: "Business adviser with a big heart"

Title: "Rescue work something to be proud of"
description: "Rescue work something to be proud of"

Author: "Kidson, Sally"
Title: "Violent past of man who shot son"
description: "Violent past of man who shot son"

Title: "Rapist's actions 'premeditated'"
description: "Rapist's actions 'premeditated'"

Title: "Six years jail for knifepoint robbery"
description: "Six years jail for knifepoint robbery"

Author: "Lynch, Keith"
Title: "20-year minimum for killer; 'I hope Malcolm never gets to see the sun again'; Gift of gab, but violence for a middle name"
description: "20-year minimum for killer; 'I hope Malcolm never gets to see the sun again'; Gift of gab, but violence for a middle name"

Author: "Tollan, Jeff"
Title: "NZ's oldest soldier recalls haste to join up"
description: "NZ's oldest soldier recalls haste to join up"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Quake news too much for former journalist"
description: "Quake news too much for former journalist"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Innovative nun's focus on making a difference"
description: "Innovative nun's focus on making a difference"

Author: "Lynch, Keith"
Title: "Woman's fate remains a mystery : relatives have no sense of closure"
description: "Woman's fate remains a mystery : relatives have no sense of closure"

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Title: "[Annual plan hearings 2011-12]"
description: "Reports on day two of the public hearings on the annual plan for the city, Dunedin City Council, 5 May 2011. Focuses on transport, opposition to shark nets, project funding for reopening the Caversham and Chain Hills tunnels to cyclists, calls to reopen the scenic John Wilson Ocean Drive to traffic, 'props' used by the public to emphasise their opininons, and a proposal to employ an independent person to investigate ways to reduce the city's debt burden."

Title: "Hammering home the facts; Licensing system; Project checklist"
description: "Advises homeowners about the rights and responsibilities involved in building or renovating a home. Delineates three crucial steps. Informs that from Mar 2012, critical building work on homes must be carried out or supervised by a licensed building practitioner (LBP). (Author) Includes a 16-point checklist."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Cheese draws couple south"
description: "Talks to the former Aucklanders, both passionate foodies and award-winning cheesemakers, who have recently shifted to the Mainland to open Ben Ohau Road Cheese, a small artisan cheese factory. Describes their previous career experience and mentions that she was a finalist in 'MasterChef New Zealand' last year."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "[Annual plan hearings 2011-12]"
description: "Covers the third and final day of the public hearings on the 2011-2012 annual plan of the Dunedin City Council. Comments on the occasionally fiery exchanges between the public and the council. Reports on a call to change to the way the council handles consent applications, a proposal to fast-track earthquake strengthening of city buildings, a submission to make public playgrounds smokefree, a funding request by the Dunedin Gasworks Museum to complete refurbishment work, and advocacy by the Tsunami Action Group of an effective early warning system."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Dear Mum ..."
description: "Pays tribute to mothers on Mother's Day. Recalls memories of his own mother and seeks views of seven Otago children about what makes their mums special."

Author: "Roxburgh, Tracey"
Title: "Abuse without the bruises; Supporting the victims; Definitions of abuse"
description: "Focuses on the nature of psychological abuse. Relates the story of a young woman who took her older boyfriend to court after he subjected her to psychological and physical abuse. Lists examples of psychological or emotional abuse, and includes telephone numbers of agencies that can provide assistance. Talks to family lawyer and Queenstown crown prosecutor Michael Morris about his dealings with victims of abuse. Provides information from the NZ Police about definitions of abuse under the Domestic Violence Act 1995."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "On the frontline of history"
description: "Speaks to the former Dunedin resident who is now residing in Doha and working as a senior producer for television network Al Jazeera. Discusses the nature of his job with the network and overviews his career as a journalist."

Author: "Riddell, Oliver"
Title: "Filling the gaps of NZ military campaign histories; More about saving lives than winning prizes"
description: "Filling the gaps of NZ military campaign histories; More about saving lives than winning prizes"

Author: "McKinlay, Tom"
Title: "Interrogating the terror"
description: "Speaks to Errol Wright and Abi King-Jones, co-directors of the new documentary focusing on the NZ Police raids carried out in Ruatoki and elsewhere on 15 Oct 2007. Lists screening times in Dunedin as part of the World Cinema Showcase."

Title: "Busting that waste - creatively"
description: "Interviews the employee at Wanaka Wastebusters about her position as 'third fiddle in the Dept of Dreams and Ideas'."

Author: "Wootton, Sue"
Title: "Hallelujah on the presidential highway"
description: "Hallelujah on the presidential highway"

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Getting back to business after the big one"
description: "Speaks to Gen-i South Island sales manager Paul Deavoll about the aftermath of the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake on his business and staff. Describes his role in helping to keep Christchurch online."

Author: "Seconi, Adrian"
Title: "Sport saviour from demons of OCD"
description: "Talks to the Utah-born centre for the Otago Nuggets about growing up deaf in a Mormon family, and developing obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) as a teenager. Describes how playing basketball allowed him to channel his OCD and find a network of friends. Informs that he became the first legally deaf athlete to play in the US National Basketball Association."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Some kind of transcendence;  Art practice a kind of transcendence"
description: "Talks to the British-born artist now with the Dunedin School of Art about organising the new time-based exhibition 'Acutations, Akshuns and Live-Works', 7-20 May, 2011. Explains that the exhibition features his works and those of two former British colleagues, Andre Stitt and Alastair MacLennan. Describes his career, influences and views on the art world. Informs of his own exhibition 'AAA - detritus', Dunedin Art School Gallery, 23 May-3 Jun 2011. Provides information about lectures associated with both exhibitions."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Dracula, spooks and alley cats' by Ivan Hill, Gallery De Novo, Dunedin, until 19 May 2011.  Reviews 'Paperworks VII', various artists, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'The First city in history' by Fiona Amundsen, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 5 Jun 2011."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "For MaÃÑori the party's over"
description: "Opines on the place of MaÃÑori in the political arena since Hone Harawira's split from the MaÃÑori Party. Alleges that MMP has been good for MaÃÑori representation in government. Reminds us that all parties, even small ones, are coalitions of various interests, with the MaÃÑori party being no different, representing workers, businesspeople, pragmatists, nationalists, feminists, protesters and accountants."

Author: "Deane, Steve"
Title: "'Chief' growing into his nickname"
description: "'Chief' growing into his nickname"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Welcome to Kiwi Park High"
description: "Checks on a rugby league nursery at Keebra Park State High on the Gold Coast, to find out why it is a magnet for young NZers."

Author: "Wade, Amelia"
Title: "Outrageous Fortune star dies of cancer"
description: "Outrageous Fortune star dies of cancer"

Author: "Easton, Paul"
Title: "86-year-old pilot died on route he flew many times"
description: "86-year-old pilot died on route he flew many times"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Author (detailed): "Vaimoana Tapaleao, James Ihaka and Nicholas Jones"
Title: "OE Poisoning survivor to farewell friend"
description: "OE Poisoning survivor to farewell friend"

Author: "Udy Carly"
Title: "Injured crash cop: The surgeons are legends"
description: "Injured crash cop: The surgeons are legends"

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "High-flier in wartime - and peace"
description: "High-flier in wartime - and peace"

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Blood work"
description: "Features the work of English forensic scientist Anna Sandiford, currently an honorary research fellow at Auckland University, who was thrust into the public eye with her analysis of David Bain's bloody footprints. Mentions her recently-published book 'Expert witness', and her blog, through which she hopes to better educate people about forensic science."

Author: "Snedden, Pat"
Title: "Advocacy dominated life of 'troublesome priest'"
description: "Advocacy dominated life of 'troublesome priest'"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Manawatu's Roberts worked hard all her life and always kept her humour"
description: "Manawatu's Roberts worked hard all her life and always kept her humour"

Title: "Childhood passions led to broadcasting career"
description: "Childhood passions led to broadcasting career"

Author: "Millmow, Jonathan"
Title: "Shock as Olympian dies without times for goodbyes : 'Ultimate' team player and gifted coach"
description: "Shock as Olympian dies without times for goodbyes : 'Ultimate' team player and gifted coach"

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "The damage done"
description: "Reports on how Cantabrian woman Donna Moore has been on a one-woman crusade to change the mental health system, since the death of her husband, suicide of one son and imprisonment of the other. Describes the mental health issues affecting all her childern, as well as her first husband, due to the family history of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Polish concentration camp survivor remains true to European roots while embracing Kiwi life"
description: "Polish concentration camp survivor remains true to European roots while embracing Kiwi life"

Author: "Kay, Martin"
Title: "Treasury secretary at turning-point moment"
description: "Treasury secretary at turning-point moment"

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "A better balanced life after mayoralty"
description: "A better balanced life after mayoralty"

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "'So I danced with Molly instead'"
description: "'So I danced with Molly instead'"

Title: "Popular teacher drowns on Coromandel"
description: "Popular teacher drowns on Coromandel"

Title: "Leading force in economic thinking"
description: "Leading force in economic thinking"

Author: "Somerville, Philip,"
Title: "Saved at least two species from extinction"
description: "Saved at least two species from extinction"

Author: "Stock, Rob"
Title: "Heartbreak Motel"
description: "Reports on a close-knit group of families from the low-income Cook Island community of Mangare, who have been left with massive debts and are on the brink of losing their homes after buying into a speculative property scheme their lawyers say responsible banks should never have funded. Briefly quotes what the three banks involved have to say on the matter. Talks to property developer Glenn Cooper, who organised the scheme that was promoted within their church community and who is believed to be ultimately at fault, about what he believes went wrong."

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "Southern style"
description: "Highlights the pleasures of visiting Dunedin. Includes a fact file on where best to eat, shop and stay."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Talks to live-animal curator Brian Lawton, about a typical day doing his job of looking after the live animal exhibits at the Auckland Museum."

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "Army death may lead to review of driver skills"
description: "Army death may lead to review of driver skills"

Title: "Valentine's Day sunny for Tamati"
description: "Valentine's Day sunny for Tamati"

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Champion of Tuhoe brought history to life: tributes flow in for author Dame Judith Binney, revered as the foremost NZ historian of her day"
description: "Champion of Tuhoe brought history to life: tributes flow in for author Dame Judith Binney, revered as the foremost NZ historian of her day"

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "A quick word... : ... with actor Joel Tobeck who is shaping up as our most in-demand TV export with roles in new Australian drama Tangle, and will be seen later on Sons of Anarchy and Hawaii Five-O."
description: "A quick word... : ... with actor Joel Tobeck who is shaping up as our most in-demand TV export with roles in new Australian drama Tangle, and will be seen later on Sons of Anarchy and Hawaii Five-O."

Title: "Douglas to bow out of Parliament"
description: "Douglas to bow out of Parliament"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Army major collapses and dies at rehearsal"
description: "Army major collapses and dies at rehearsal"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Honey, you lost the house"
description: "Investigates the financial consequences of relationship breakups, noting that prenuptial agreements and trusts are no guarantee of security. Reports research showing  that the courts have overturned a third of prenuptial agreements and offers advice on such agreements. Presents two scenarios in which one partner was financially disadvantaged. Describes unclear areas of the Property (Relationships) Act in these situations. Maintains that trusts and their consequences are not well understood, presenting two main views on whether they work as they should. Talks to a 63-year-old woman about her experience, and lawyers and other legal experts about thinking financially as well as emotionally. Discloses the average costs for separation."

Author: "Orsman, Bernard"
Title: "Danger zones; Christchurch's experience shakes Auckland into action"
description: "Illustrates the main areas of Auckland City that have earthquake-prone pre-1940 unreinforced brick masonry buildings. Talks about the Auckland Council's move to establish an earthquake-prone building policy."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Checks on killer patient 'superficial'"
description: "Looks at the findings of a Health and Disability Commissioner inquiry into the circumstances that led to a schizophrenic patient who followed through on threats to kill being released from psychiatric care."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Moreish biscuits stand up well to scrutiny"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Griffin's Krispie biscuits, which have been produced in NZ since the 1950s."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "A test of character"
description: "Investigates the complacency surrounding the earthquake risk-management of older, unreinforced masonry buildings and the difficult questions the Canterbury earthquakes have raised for communities and councils around the country. Speaks to a number of engineers and heritage advocates about the issue and the various options for councils. Focuses on the situation in Auckland. Talks to building owners about their reaction to an incomplete Auckland Council list of around 400 pre-1940s buildings in the old Auckland City area which desktop analysis suggests may be below the 33 per cent of the design level threshold a new building must achieve to withstand a moderate earthquake. Discusses the option of retrofitting to strengthen at-risk older buildings, which is also recommended for reinforced concrete structures built from the 1940s to 1976."

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "Heading home from history"
description: "Focuses on the collection of toi moko (mummified tattooed MaÃÑori heads) in the 19th century and Te Papa's battle to return the ancestral remains to their iwi. Touches on how toi moko were made."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Dancer finds her inner goddess"
description: "Talks to the choreographer about her new work 'Shine lady', which is on at Leigh Hall in Western Springs (Auckland), 25-29 May 2011."

Author: "Webster, Sally"
Title: "Paintings give insight into troubled mind"
description: "Talks to the former radio talkback host and producer about his battle with mental illness and his first major solo exhibition 'New works by James King' at the Depot Artspace in Devonport (Auckland) until 19 May 2011."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Between geometric abstraction and realism"
description: "Reviews 'Valdrada' by Elliot Collins at the Tim Melville Gallery (until 4 June), 'Ghosting' by Barbara Tuck at the Anna Miles Gallery (until 28 May), 'New paintings' by Callum Innes at the Fox/Jensen Gallery (until 4 June), 'Lintel series' by Roy Good at the Artis Gallery (until 28 May), 'Time is a thief' by Evan Woodruffe at Orexart (until 21 May) and 'Conduct' by Jonathan Campbell also at Orexart (until 21 May)."

Author: "Green, Paula,"
Title: "Uncovering tenderness and wit of poetry"
description: "Reviews three poetry collections."

Author: "Deane, Steve"
Title: "Rookie 'different' for right reasons"
description: "Rookie 'different' for right reasons"

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "I did it my way"
description: "Questions the ex National Party leader now leading the Act Party about the issues he wants to focus on. Restates his belief in the market and in 'one law for all', and airs his scepticism of global warming. Reflects on his frustration with the Prime Minister John Key, his changed political leanings, and the cost of politics to his personal relationships."

Author: "Cropp, Amanda,"
Title: "Blessed are the cheesemakers; raw deal"
description: "Documents the increasing popularity of cheesemaking. Talks to cheese tutors, the founder of the NZ Cheese School, and  cheesemakers Paul Broughton and Lyn Haycock.  Explains how easy it is to make even gourmet cheeses. Informs of where and how cheesemakers can obtain milk supplies, with warnings attached about raw milk and legal issues around its supply."

Author: "Seconi, Adrian"
Title: "Dunedin proving more preferable to Bulgaria"
description: "Dunedin proving more preferable to Bulgaria"

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Lasting legacy in Otago Community Hospice"
description: "Lasting legacy in Otago Community Hospice"

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Better to burn out than fade away"
description: "Better to burn out than fade away"

Author: "Bruce, David"
Title: "Confident in the district's future"
description: "Confident in the district's future"

Author: "Maddaford, Terry"
Title: "Shining year for '90-minute man'"
description: "Shining year for '90-minute man'"

Author: "Roxburgh, Tracey"
Title: "Cutting cloth to fit the future"
description: "Cutting cloth to fit the future"

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "Fenella France"
description: "Talks to the Hawke's Bay born cultural heritage preservation scientist about her task of preserving  the original woollen Star-Spangled Banner. Discusses why she is still in the US eleven years later. Lists some of the delicate and ancient material she has worked on. Captures the moment she discovered the word Thomas Jefferson changed in the US Declaration of Independence."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "The little movie that did"
description: "Looks back on one of NZ's most memorable films. Talks to its writer, director and producer Roger Donaldson about the inspiration behind the 1981 movie, the casting of Bruno Lawrence and how close it came to not being made."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Music amid the whispers"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch writer based in Germany about her novel portraying the life of Dmitri Shostakovich. Discusses her enthusiasm for Berlin, the writing craft, and creative singlemindedness. Glimpses briefly at her novel in progress."

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "The defence rests"
description: "Reviews the new edition of photographs of MaÃÑori artefacts taken by Brian Brake. Examines the debate over whether the photographer's work misrepresents MaÃÑori, according to Damian Skinner, or reveals taonga tuku iho (heritage treasure), according to the writer of the book's introduction, Ngahuia Te Awekotuku."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "In poor form"
description: "Laments the high incidence of bacterial skin infections in NZ children and of infectious diseases among MaÃÑori and Pasifika children. Notes a University of Otago research that pinpoints the two main pathogens responsible. Warns that the lack of a public health national strategy targeting children will have costly repercussions and will increase health inequality."

Author: "Grant, Nick"
Title: "Crowning glory"
description: "Reviews the staging of the Friedrich Schiller play, directed by Colin McColl and performed by the Auckland Theatre Company, Maidment Theatre, until 28 May."

Author: "King, Caroline"
Title: "Mum's hate for predator"
description: "Relates the anguish of Raewyn Ford, whose son Peter Russell committed suicide after being dumped by his supposed girlfriend, later revealed as one of the fake online personas created by Natalia Burgess. Reveals that other people have been manipulated by the many fake personas created by Burgess to lure people into relationships, including Peter Russell's 16-year old brother. Reports Burgess' response to claims she caused Russell's suicide."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Last exit to garageland"
description: "Reports on changes to NZ on Air funding for musicians to a scheme called Making Tracks which will fund single tracks and videos instead of albums and assign 40 percent of funding to alternative radio and online production. Recounts that music producers fear the cut to album funding will send musicians back to homemade recording and cause a deterioration of music recording quality. Notes that music producers expect their revenue to decline under the scheme and that some may move overseas."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "The Killer Clown Fiends face trial"
description: "Outlines the Crown case against Mikhail Pandey-Johnson, Karl Nuku and Rhys Fournier, known as The Killer Clown Fiends, on trial for the murder of Dean Browne. Describes the relationship between Browne and the three accused, the Crown's assertion of events leading up to the murder, and the defence's response to the Crown's case."

Author: "Slade, Maria"
Title: "Lack of talent slows growth"
description: "Reports that lack of staff skilled in information technology is holding back growth for some companies. Relates the case of an Auckland-based company providing mobile banking services, M-Com, which has been unable to recruit enough skilled staff to support its growing operation, and may have to look at recruiting overseas."

Author: "Yousef, Robyn"
Title: "Backyard chooks making welcome breakfast addition"
description: "Looks at keeping chickens in urban backyards and the satisfaction it can bring. Outlines the feeding and housing needs, and the best laying breeds."

Author: "Cole, Dennis"
Title: "High tech homing signal a godsend"
description: "Reports that missing pets that are microchipped and registered with the National Companion Animal Register can be returned to owners faster, and more often than pets that are not chipped. Notes that 85 percent of chipped pets missing after the 22 February Christchurch earthquake were returned, compared with 20-25 percent of unchipped pets."

Author: "Wade, Pamela"
Title: "Scenic smorgasbord"
description: "Relates a one day return trip on the NZ TranzAlpine train service from Christchurch to Greymouth. Highlights the spectacular scenery and access to other tourist destinations."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Mum dies shielding daughter from attack"
description: "Mum dies shielding daughter from attack"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "A disaster's silver lining; Before complacency creeps in; Case study : bracing Berkeley; Liquefaction : when the ground turns to mush [part 3]"
description: "Looks at how the 6.9 magnitude Loma Prieta earthquake that struck San Francisco in 1989 provided the city with an unexpected opportunity to transform its disused waterfront, which had been cut off from the city by the double-decker Embarcadero Freeway. Focuses on San Francisco's efforts to improve diaster preparedness after the earthquake. Speaks to building inspector Laurence Kronfield who pioneered the coloured tag building system that was used in Christchurch after the Canterbury earthquakes. Mentions some of the recommendations from the Building Inspection Department's 'Community Action Plan for Seismic Safety' (CAPSS), which was set up to rank the most dangerous buildings and formulate a plan to make them safer. Spotlights the University of California's earthquake-strengthening project at its Berkeley campus. Talks about the liquefaction that occurred in San Francisco's Marina district during the earthquake. Touches on some ground improvement techniques to limit liquefaction risks."

Author: "Fletcher, Hamish"
Title: "Site with Kiwi input gets heavyweight backing"
description: "Site with Kiwi input gets heavyweight backing"

Title: "Comedian's wife dies from brain cancer"
description: "Comedian's wife dies from brain cancer"

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "Waiting for their medicine"
description: "Focuses on the recommendations of the Government's Welfare Working Group for reforming the welfare system and the likely impact on sickness beneficiaries. Briefly outlines what the sickness benefit is. Speaks to sickness beneficiaries Rodney Valvoi, Shane Barlow and former invalid's beneficiary Aleisha King about their experiences and fears about the possible changes."

Author: "Krause, Nick"
Title: "Private brands vying for shoppers"
description: "Looks at the rise of supermarket private (own/store/retailers) label brands, which a recent Rabobank report predicts will account for half of the global food retail market in 2025. Talks about the situation in NZ with representatives from Foodstuffs (New World, Pak 'n Save and Four Square) and Progressive Enterprises (Countdown, Foodtown and Woolworths). Compares the price difference between house brands and name brands for a number of products."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Bright idea"
description: "Talks to the artist about how he approached his new exhibition in Wellington's Courtenay Place lightboxes, which features 16 carictures of people he approached in Courtenay Place."

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "Maori Art : the Photography of Brian Brake"
description: "Reviews the new edition of photographs of MaÃÑori artefacts taken by Brian Brake. Examines the debate over whether the photographer's work misrepresents MaÃÑori, according to Damian Skinner, or reveal taonga tuku iho (heritage treasure), according to the writer of the book's introduction, Ngahuia Te Awekotuku."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Sarah Quigley"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch writer based in Germany about her novel portraying the life of Dmitri Shostakovich. Discusses her enthusiasm for Berlin, the writing craft, and creative singlemindedness. Glimpses briefly at her novel in progress."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Father figure"
description: "Speaks to the City Missioner on the eve of his retirement from the Wellington City Mission. Talks about his television and radio career, running Wellington's The Coachman restaurant, how he became an Anglican priest, and the support of his wife Lorraine."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Don Brash"
description: "Questions the ex National Party leader now leading the Act Party about the issues he wants to focus on. Restates his belief in the market and in 'one law for all', and airs his scepticism of global warming. Reflects on his frustration with the Prime Minister John Key, his changed political leanings, and the cost of politics to his personal relationships."

Author: "Philp, Matt,"
Title: "The truth about gluten"
description: "Investigates whether a gluten-free diet is a healthy choice or just another food fad. Looks at what is behind the growing preoccupation with gluten. Speaks to gastroenterologists and dieticians about the lack of medical justification for the majority of people who are following a gluten-free diet. Points out that many followers of a gluten-free diet have diagnosed themselves or have been counselled by a naturopath rather than been medically diagnosed with coeliac disease or dermatitis herpetiformis. Touches on the poor understanding of coeliac disease in the medical mainstream."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Divorce - can you afford it?"
description: "Investigates the financial consequences of relationship breakups, noting that prenuptial agreements and trusts are no guarantee of security. Reports research showing  that the courts have overturned a third of prenuptial agreements and offers advice on such agreements. Presents two scenarios in which one partner was financially disadvantaged. Describes unclear areas of the Property (Relationships) Act in these situations. Maintains that trusts and their consequences are not well understood, presenting two main views on whether they work as they should. Talks to a 63-year-old woman about her experience, and lawyers and other legal experts about thinking financially as well as emotionally. Discloses the average costs for separation."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Here and there [part 3]"
description: "Features two NZ Institute of Architecture Award winning homes in the 'small project' category and the 'international' division. Talks to Wellington architect Geoff Fletcher about his Raumati Beach bach design and Jeff Fearon about his New York apartment design."

Author: "Barrett, Pat"
Title: "Push into the Paske"
description: "Recounts a two-day tramp on untracked terrain from Lake Tennyson at the foot of the Crimea Range that traversed the Turk Ridge to the upper Wairau Valley and returned to the lake via the Paske Saddle in the Crimea Range."

Author: "Burgess, Malcolm"
Title: "Small and cheekily formed"
description: "Reviews two books published by the Wellington publishing collective Lawrence & Gibson. Talks about some of the unusual offerings from the boutique publisher."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Quake shakes foundations of couple's 28-year marriage"
description: "Quake shakes foundations of couple's 28-year marriage"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Grieving children learn mother alive"
description: "Grieving children learn mother alive"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Schoolboy's unknown fate torture for family"
description: "Schoolboy's unknown fate torture for family"

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Doctors counselled after 13 staff unaccounted for"
description: "Doctors counselled after 13 staff unaccounted for"

Author: "Eriksen, Alanah"
Title: "Inquest gives closure to mystery of lost father"
description: "Inquest gives closure to mystery of lost father"

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "Crane Brothers going for the Continental look"
description: "Crane Brothers going for the Continental look"

Author: "Vass, Beck"
Title: "Baby uppermost in office worker's mind as she lay in collapsed building"
description: "Baby uppermost in office worker's mind as she lay in collapsed building"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Defendant cries as he tells his family of sorrow over death"
description: "Defendant cries as he tells his family of sorrow over death"

Author: "McIntyre, Donna"
Title: "Agent's drive to offer his personal best"
description: "Agent's drive to offer his personal best"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Hard work pays off for teen star / by Aaron Goile"
description: "Hard work pays off for teen star / by Aaron Goile"

Title: "Soldier a 'Colourful character'"
description: "Soldier a 'Colourful character'"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Brand Perriam gets the village 'humming'"
description: "Visits Tarras 12 months after the small rural village embarked on a project to develop a series of upmarket shops.  Talks to the fashion designer at the centre of redevelopment efforts to make the village a unique destination for visitors, thus honouring the legacy of her late mother. Describes the shops on site. Discusses her career in fashion design, focusing on garments made from merino fibre."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Dangerously inclined"
description: "Investigates the growing practice of 'hill-bombing', in which skateboarders take to steep city streets without helmets, protective clothing, brakes or other safety gear. Informs that the practice is legal if practitioners follow road rules. Talks to the young civil servant about why he hill-bombs despite its hazards. Seeks comment from Elaine Kelly, who ran over the legs of a teenaged hill-bomber who she encountered on the wrong side of the road. Talks to Aramoana septugenarian Lex Pearce, who rang the 'Otago daily times' to report a 'near-miss' after a hill-bomber ran a red light and came towards his car. Includes statistics about skateboard crashes in Dunedin and NZ."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "The coal, hard facts"
description: "Talks to visiting New York-based scientist Dr James Hansen, known as the 'grandfather of climate change', who is in NZ to deliver a series of public lectures during May 2011. Overviews his distinguished career. Explains why the Earth has an 'energy imbalance' and how that affects global climate. Seeks comment from NZ climate scientist Dr Jim Salinger and Science Advisory Committee chief science adviser Prof Sir Peter Gluckman. Gives dates and venues where Dr Hansen is speaking. Lists facts about climate change."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Doubting the deniers"
description: "Talks to University of California professor of history and science studies Naomi Oreskes, co-author of the book 'Merchants of doubt'. Describes the influence of a small group of US-based scientists in denying harms caused by tobacco, acid rain, ozone depletion, DDT and global warming, thus obfuscating and delaying regulatory remedies to address these harms. Talks about the dangers of global warming. Informs that she visited NZ to deliver the Michael King Memorial Lecture, 14 May 2011 and is participating in the Auckland Writers and Readers Festival, 15 May 2011."

Author: "James, Bryan"
Title: "Drama set in siege of Leningrad; Tedious, poorly written, but sure to trigger a smile; Children's books"
description: "Drama set in siege of Leningrad; Tedious, poorly written, but sure to trigger a smile; Children's books"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Retailer had a real 'can do' attitude"
description: "Retailer had a real 'can do' attitude"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Teen murder still fascinates; Overcoming challenges"
description: "Speaks to Californian director Alexander Roman about his debut documentary about the murder of Honora Mary Parker by her daughter Pauline Yvonne Parker and friend Juliet Marion Hulme, Christchurch, 22 Jun 1954. Asks about his motivation for making the documentary and his views on the motivation of the then-teenaged girls to commit the murder. Describes some of the forensic evidence at the Supreme Court trial, 1954. Informs that he is undertaking a NZ-wide tour to promote the film. Describes some of the challenges he faced in making the documentary."

Author: "McKinlay, Tom"
Title: "Real lives realised"
description: "Talks to co-directors Andrea Bosshard and Shane Loader about the making of their new film 'Hook, line & sinker'. Includes comment from lead actor Rangimoana Taylor."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "The art of the newspaper"
description: "Interviews the 'Otago Daily Times' cartoonist/graphic artist about his work."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Residents continue to tough it out but now they need some answers"
description: "Looks at the situation of various families three months on from the Christchurch earthquake. Indicate they live in some of the worst hit areas in Christchurch, the eastern suburbs. Reports the residents are awaiting decisions from the Christchurch City Council and EQC (Earthquake Commission) with regard land and homes before they make firm decisions about their own plans. Notes what is working and what is not working in the eastern suburbs, how they are coping and what the residents want to happen next."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "It's May 25, 1861 : welcome to Christchurch"
description: "Celebrates Christchurch Press' 150th birthday on May 25 along with a full reprint of the papers edition for that day ."

Author: "Cunliffe, Simon"
Title: "Feeling the ache of infinite distance; Absconder"
description: "Pays tribute to the late University of Otago graduate, former poetry contributor and newly qualified journalist, who perished in the CTV building in the Christchurch earthquake, 22 Feb 2011. Seeks comment from Dr Jacob Edmond and Dr Emma Neale about his contributions to the English Department at the university. Republishes a poem he wrote for the 'Monday's Poem' column, including some commentary from his mother, Fran Brookbanks."

Title: "24 hours trapped beneath a desk"
description: "24 hours trapped beneath a desk"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Federated Farmers' president ready to go"
description: "Talks to the outgoing president of Federated Farmers about some of the highlights and challenges of his three-year tenure."

Author: "Bowron, Jane,"
Title: "Columnist back in her home city with Old Bucky"
description: "Tells of the moments immediately after the Christchurch earthquake (Old Bucky) and getting back to her own home to find it severely damaged. Reflects on living within the 'Red Zone' and on her decision to return to Christchurch to look after her ageing parents along with the force of nature."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Wage slaves"
description: "Examines the validity of NZ workers being paid 30% less than their counterparts in Australia, citing the film industry as an example of overseas companies seeing NZ as source of cheap labour. Lists average wages for OECD countries in five industries. Cites comments by The Icehouse business growth centre chief executive Andy Hamilton on the need to position the country's labour market more positively, explaining the reasons that American Jeff Donnelly moved to Auckland to develop his emagineIF web based product. Adds comments by Business NZ chief executive Phil O'Reilly that NZ should profit while it can from the low dollar making it a cheap and inviting for overseas  investors."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "True face of online predator"
description: "Talks to the woman dubbed the Facebook Predator about her reasons for faking her identity online to facilitate romantic relationships with young men. Discusses online personas, mental health issues, suicide attempts, excessive reliance on mobile phones, and warnings from a judge to stop using other people's identities."

description: "Loved ones remember a caring, 'true gentleman'"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Mystery and magic"
description: "Talks to the artist about his upcoming exhibition, 'Radiant matter part II', Dunedin Public Art Gallery, 28 May-21 Aug 2011. Describes the work he has been doing in Berlin, and responds to claims that his work is 'trickery' because of his decision to incorporate perfume, glass and witchcraft into his art."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Bush walk' by Wallace Crossman, Gallery on Blueskin, Dunedin, until 31 May 2011.  Reviews 'Strolling along the roof of Hell/Gawking at flowers' by Kirsten Ferguson, Inge Doesburg Gallery, Dunedin, until 28 May 2011. Reviews 'Actuations, akshuns, and live-works' by Adrian Hall, Andre Stitt and Alastair MacLennan, Dunedin School of Art Gallery."

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "How safe are your secrets?"
description: "Looks at the issues surrounding surveillance of work computers, which has now extended to home computers. Talks to Ron McQuilter, managing director of Paragon Investigations, NZ's leading industrial security company. Debates whether this activity is illegal or an invasion of privacy. States that fraud and intellectual property issues are the main computer security issues, with disaffected staff and even planted spies being a danger to many companies. Touches on the hazard of  using emails like conversations, and the risk of being hacked."

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "Attack of the secret stealers"
description: "Questions just how safe our government and business information is, and are we making it easy for fraudsters, given that supposedly secure government computer systems around the world are under attack. [Print exclusive]"

Title: "Beating ovarian cancer"
description: "Highlights the need for a heightened awareness of the dangers of ovarian cancer. Talks to Dr Ai Ling Tan, one of only five gynaecological oncologists in NZ, about the disease and its impact on NZ women. Spotlights the 'Beat' initiative, launched in Britain in 2008 and now recognised internationally Profiles the case of Lisa Finucane, who is living with ovarian cancer, and stresses the importance of seeing a doctor if symptoms are present and persist. Lists some ovarian cancer facts."

Title: "Frail mum tagged for removal by rest home"
description: "Frail mum tagged for removal by rest home"

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "[Budget 2011]"
description: "Reports on aspects of the Budget presented by Government, 19 May 2011. Sums up changes to the KiwiSaver and Working for Families schemes. Touches on the new Earthquake Kiwi Bond to help fund rebuilding in Christchurch, a rise in infrastructure spending, increased funding for dementia care, health funding, sale of state assets and debt reduction. Overviews changes to the student loan scheme, and increased funding for domestic medical students, community law centres and early childhood education. Includes reaction from residents in the region and from national commentators."

description: "Talks to the couple who decided to demolish their existing home and rebuild to take advantage of the harbour views on their property."

description: "Explains why the Supremem Court recently overturned the activist's conviction after she burned a NZ flag at an Anzac Day service. Describes how she came to feel like 'the most hated woman in the country'."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "Where everybody knows the words"
description: "Pays tribute to the declining art form of the TV theme. Notes several NZ theme tunes, such as those to 'Gloss', 'Close to home' and 'Country calendar', still opening the show after 30 years on television."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "TV themes a declining art form"
description: "Pays tribute to the declining art form of the TV theme. Notes several NZ theme tunes, such as those to 'Gloss', 'Close to home' and 'Country calendar', still opening the show after 30 years on television."

Title: "Nervous night with Sibelius"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's Thursday concert, which opened with Aullis Sallinen's 'Sunrise serenade'."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Full steam ahead : if you like lots of sugar"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Aunty Betty's 'Toffee & date steamed pudding'."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Speaking volumes"
description: "Reports on the opinion of speech teachers that the art of oral cmmunication is being killed off in school pupils by too much emphasis on written speeches."

Author: "Black, Joanne"

description: "Reports on the opinion of speech teachers that the art of oral cmmunication is being killed off in school pupils by too much emphasis on written speeches."

description: "Looks back on the life of the former top-ranking policeman turned private investigator. Talks about some of his notable cases."

description: "Talks to the All Blacks' first woman doctor about her role, attending Diocesan School as a boarder, and not being star struck."

Title: "Echoes from the silence beyond"
description: "The novelist remembers her father, Michael King, and explains why his name was not really King in this adapted version of the introduction to a new selection of his published and unpublished writing."

Author: "King, Rachael,"
Title: "The silence beyond"

description: "City's heritage another casualty of quake"

Title: "22/2, those we lost"
description: "Presents the released details by the coroner who confirmed the final names of those killed in the February 22 earthquake and police release details of where each person was killed."

Author: "Roberts, Gavin"
Title: "Motive for murder; On the trail of a killer fuelled by greed"
description: "Talks to Detective Chief Inspector Phil Chapman of the Grampian Police about what motivated Malcolm Webster to become a murder. Looks at the painstaking police work that exposed his plan. Lists the key events that resulted in Webster being found guilty of the murder of his first wife Claire Morris nearly 17 years after her death."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Churchman forthright and compassionate"
description: "Churchman forthright and compassionate"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Out of the ashes, a cave of light"
description: "Features the Architecture Workshop designed, award winning Waitomo Glowworm Caves Visitor Centre, which was commissioned after a fire destroyed the old visitor centre in December 2005. Talks about the design process."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Good reasons to tackle the stairs"
description: "Reviews 'Supersymmetry' by Shane Cotton at the Michael Lett Gallery (until 11 June), 'New work' by Andrew McLeod at the Ivan Anthony Gallery (until 28 May), 'A micronaut in the wide world: work' by Graham Percy at the Gus Fisher Gallery (until 25 June) and 'Mauri' by Te Kaha at the John Leech Gallery (until 28 May)."

Author: "Richter, Anke"
Title: "Auf the Richter scale"
description: "Reflects on cultural clashes after the German born author returned from a book tour of Germany and talks about how the Christchurch earthquake influenced her mental attitude and state. Describes how she managed the book tour while having left her family and devastated home and the people of Christchurch and Lyttelton back in NZ."

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Maestro points path for young choreographer"
description: "Speaks to the New Plymouth-raised choreographer about his new work for the Royal NZ Ballet's triple bill celebration of Stravinsky (Aotea Centre, 25-28 May; Napier Municipal Theatre, 23 May-1 June). Talks about his dance career."

Title: "Hall of Fame welcomes boatbuilder"
description: "Hall of Fame welcomes boatbuilder"

Author: "Shannon, Ady"
Title: "Frozen assets"
description: "Looks at the future of ski and alpine clubs in NZ and according to Anton Coberger ski clubs are "unique in the whole world of skiing". Notes the people who join ski clubs do it not to join just for the cheaper cost of skiing but for a particular experience. Discusses the issue of development of ski fields and facilities and factors that might affect the viability of ski/alpine clubs."

Author: "Taylor, Lindis"
Title: "Some 'Enchanted' evening"
description: "Reports on 'Enchanted Islands', the name given to this year's NZ Music Month 'Made in New Zealand' concert by the NZSO, including pieces by Ross Harris, Anthony Ritchie and Gareth Farr. Enthuses particularly about Lyell Cresswell's piano concerto."

Author: "Taylor, Lindis"
Title: "Made in New Zealand : Enchanted Islands"
description: "Reports on 'Enchanted Islands', the name given to this year's NZ Music Month 'Made in New Zealand' concert by the NZSO, including pieces by Ross Harris, Anthony Ritchie and Gareth Farr. Enthuses particularly about Lyell Cresswell's piano concerto."

Author: "Croot, James"
Title: "Truth and the Urewera 'anti-terror' raids"
description: "Truth and the Urewera 'anti-terror' raids"

Author: "Patrick, Martin"
Title: "Tender is the Night by Heather Galbraith"
description: "Reviews curator Heather Galbraith's ambitious new exhibition at Wellington's City Gallery, 'Tender is the night' (until 17 Jul 2011), featuring works by Liz Maw and Francis Upritchard."

Title: "Scientist helped treat the world to long-lasting timber"
description: "Presents an obituary for the Scion scientist."

Author: "Smith, Hannah"
Title: "Taking a second STAB"
description: "Reviews two Bats/STAB initiative plays, one at Downstage Theatre ('Death and dreamlife of elephants') and one at Circa ('The lead wait'), both until June 2011."

Author: "Smith, Hannah"
Title: "Death and dreamlife of elephants'; 'The lead wait'"
description: "Reviews two Bats/STAB initiative plays, one at Downstage Theatre ('Death and dreamlife of elephants') and one at Circa ('The lead wait'), both until June 2011."

Title: "Fast lane has room for a day job"
description: "Fast lane has room for a day job"

Author: "Stock, Mike"
Title: "From the rack to the track; Speed kings who ruled until revolution of factory racers"
description: "Looks back on the long-distance racing of standard road cars in the 1960s and 1970s, which drew thousands to the Pukekohe racetrack. Touches on the racing exploits of Timaru duo Ernie Sprague and Leo Leonard."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Mental as anything"
description: "Proposes that there are more than enough disorders in the new psychiatrists' manual to suggest most of us are 'bonkers'. Includes a link to the draft manual. Touches on some of the more curious disorders in the manual."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Rise of the apartment"
description: "Presents a personal view of apartment living in various locations throughout the world. Describes various types of apartment and their special design features."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "A symphony on war and culture"
description: "Talks to Berlin based Kiwi novelist Sarah Quigley about art in a time of war and reviews the author's novel 'The conductor'."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Risk & reward"
description: "Poses a question and answer regarding what is safe and unsafe for pregnant wome to eat. Includes a list of higher-risk foods to avoid when pregnant."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Food safety for pregnant women"
description: "Poses a question and answer regarding what is safe and unsafe for pregnant wome to eat. Includes a list of higher-risk foods to avoid when pregnant."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Shop till you drop"
description: "Visits some of the region's more unusual country shops, including Byrning Spears (Raglan), The Clock Shoppe of NZ (Tirau), EquipOutdoors (Whatawhata), Mercer Cheese (Mercer), Horopito Motors (aka Smash Palace) (Horopito) and Eclectic Culture Co. (Tutukaka)."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Something in the air"
description: "Demonstrates how the right plants can improve the air quality inside the home or office, increasing the levels of oxygen to the blood and therefore the brain. Advises on how best to look after your indoor plants."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Improving air quality in the home or office"
description: "Demonstrates how the right plants can improve the air quality inside the home or office, increasing the levels of oxygen to the blood and therefore the brain. Advises on how best to look after your indoor plants."

Title: "Youngster plans her own farewell"
description: "Youngster plans her own farewell"

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "World class"
description: "Reports Jamie Belich has been appointed the Beit Professorship of Commonwealth History, one of Oxford University's senior history posts. Indicates how 'The New Zealand Wars' and his other books have transformed NZers views' of pivotal military conflicts of our colonial history. Comments on the methodology used by Belich for writing 'global history', how NZ fits into his future and where he would like to direct his efforts."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Bringing Sam into focus"
description: "Talks to Sam Hunt and filmmaker Tim Rose about the documentary 'Sam Hunt : Purple balloons and other stories'."

Author: "Vance, Matt"
Title: "Fit for kings"
description: "Takes a look at the behaviour and habitat of the king penguin, which uses Macquarie Island, a long sliver of uplifted rock 1000km southwest of NZ, as a breeding ground."

Author: "Vance, Matt"
Title: "King penguins"
description: "Takes a look at the behaviour and habitat of the king penguin, which uses Macquarie Island, a long sliver of uplifted rock 1000km southwest of NZ, as a breeding ground."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Sounds of silence"
description: "Talks to the producer and composer of ambient electronic music about his multi-media live show for his 'Standing in silence' album."

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Longtime principal leaving to try something different"
description: "Longtime principal leaving to try something different"

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "Calvert's the queen of Oturehua"
description: "Profiles the Act MP, disclosing the properties she owns and the companies she has interests in. Focuses on her properties in Oturehua and the mutual feeling the locals have for her and her family."

Author: "McNeilly, Hamish"
Title: "'It just feels like one big nightmare'"
description: "'It just feels like one big nightmare'"

Title: "Teen victim chased accused, court told"
description: "Teen victim chased accused, court told"

Title: "Sewing machine mechanic makes a job of it"
description: "Sewing machine mechanic makes a job of it"

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Made the news as 'angry naked cop'"
description: "Made the news as 'angry naked cop'"

Author: "Gilkison, Laura"
Author (detailed): "Laura Gilkison, Eleanor Davie and Caroline Morton"
Title: "[Secondary scene : Gore High School]; A locked door and heavy curtain keep worlds apart; Raising the driving age to 16 will not reduce road toll; Landmarks; Practice pays"
description: "Showcases work from year 11 and 12 pupils from Gore High School. Includes a short story, an opinion piece about recent changes by Government to the driving age; a painting of Gore attractions entitled 'Landmarks' by Rachel Kelso; and a profile of the Gore High School cricket player."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Feeding frenzy"
description: "Notes as fishing and mining industries eye up the Kermadecs, environmentalists are in the process of trying to turn the surrounding waters into an ocean sanctuary. Reveals conservationists are trying to extend the existing marine reserve from its present 7450 square kilometres to 620,000 because of the uniqueness of the marine life in the surrounding sea and animal life on the islands. Looks at the Government's response to pressure from mining and fishing groups."

Author: "Walters, Laura"
Title: "Private dancers"
description: "Examines some of the lives of ballet dancers in order to get a better picture of what they have to do. Outlines the challenges, including costs, facing those who wish to become professional ballet dancers in NZ."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Perennial campaigner for community"
description: "Perennial campaigner for community"

Title: "Architect of city's Garden Tea House"
description: "Architect of city's Garden Tea House"

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "The secret history"
description: "Talks to award-winning novelist about her father, the author, biographer and historian. Discusses the contents of a book of his writings being published seven years after his death. Covers his family background and how it is portrayed in the book, the story behind his real name, his relationships with MaÃÑori kuia and writer Janet Frame, and the daytime visit to his house by a morepork in October 2003."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "The long way home"
description: "Speaks to the two Los Angeles-based actors about being NZers overseas and why they are lending their support to the 22 May 'Rise up Christchurch' telethon to raise funds for the New Zealand Government's Christchurch Earthquake Appeal. Talks about their acting careers."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Look what just dropped in ... : Unwanted guest takes over lounge"
description: "Look what just dropped in ... : Unwanted guest takes over lounge"

Author: "Brett, Cate"
Title: "Sticking together"
description: "Tells the story of the first 90 days since the 2011 Christchurch earthquake, as experienced by a Port Hills community. Describes the use of the internet to exchange information, the forming of groups to fill hillside cracks with bentonite under the guidance of resident Mara Apse, and the enjoyment of a community tango"

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "The reinvention of a superhero"
description: "Talks to the NZ cartoonist about his approach to producing a new 'Thor' comic book series for Marvel Comics, which have recently been collected into two graphic novels."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Hard lessons"
description: "Talks to Shirley Boys' High School principal, John Laurenson, about his school's having to relocate to Papanui High School. Notes his response to being too tough on his students. Finds out if the influx of 1500 boys has had any effect on Papanui's female students. Talks to a student and a teacher about the day to day reality of campus sharing. Relays the principal's dreams for rebuilding the school. Briefly discusses the issues around and the schools involved in sharing campuses in Christchurch."

Author: "Burton, David,"
Title: "Guts and glory"
description: "Follows the career of Justin North who left school in Blenheim at 15 to start a cooking course and subsequently had an apprenticeship at the Park Royal in Wellington (today the InterContinental) under Martin Brugger. From there he moved to Sydney and to Oxfordshire, England where he worked at Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons under the legendary French chef Raymond Blanc. Reports he now has a significant restaurant business in Australia."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Rise of the apartment"
description: "Presents a personal view of apartment living in various locations throughout the world. Describes various types of apartment and their special design features."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "'Irrepressible' , generous family man farewelled"
description: "'Irrepressible' , generous family man farewelled"

Author: "Bennett, Sarah,"
Title: "Melting moments"
description: "Relates her experience of walking on Franz Josef Glacier. Includes details about Franz Josef and Fox Glaciers."

Author: "Johnston, Alexa"
Title: "A celebration of domestic fortitude"
description: "A celebration of domestic fortitude"

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "A symphony on war and culture"
description: "Talks to Berlin based Kiwi novelst Sarah Quigley about art in a time of war and reviews the author's novel 'The conductor'."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "What's the big idea?"
description: "Talks to the sculptor and associate professor at University of Auckland's Elam School of Fine Arts about his installation named after John Keats' poem, On first looking into Chapman's Homer, soon to exhibit at the 54th Venice Biennale. Discusses  the artist's response to being passed over by Creative NZ  for a number of years and  now representing NZ overseas. Touches on his family life as the son of school teachers living around the Whanganui River. Queries the choice of bronze bulls and a piano with MaÃÑori carvings for the overseas art exhibition. Includes an extract from a book on his life by sister Cushla Parekowhai."

Author: "Francis, Clio"
Title: "A flame flickering to extinction"
description: "Reveals the new information about Lionel Terry, the man who shot and murdered an elderly Chinese man in Wellington's Chinatown now that his police file has been released after 100 years. Describes his family background which may have influenced his state of mind and the subsequent escapes he made from mental institutions in which he was held."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Recycling our weekly rubbish collections"
description: "Looks at the journey our recycled material goes on once it leaves the kerbside outside our house. Notes councils are required to review their Waste Management Minimisation Plans by next July. Includes statistics on how much recycling was put out for collection in the Wellington region and a percentage figure for Wellington City to show the proportion of paper, glass, plastic and tin. Notes the issue of contamination in the collection of material."

Author: "O'Brien, Gregory,"
Title: "Beyond the horizon"
description: "Reports on a trip to the Kermadec Islands on the patrol vessel HMNZS Otago with nine NZ artists, including the author. Describes the work of the Kermadec Initiative of Pew Environment Group, gives a brief history of the largest island, and notes the work of each artist, which will feature at the Tauranga Art Gallery, November 2011. Touches on the experience of a shark-free swim in warm waters beyond NZ territorial waters."

Author: "McIntyre, Donna"
Title: "Juggling act to keep show on the road"
description: "Juggling act to keep show on the road"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Filling family life with fun and good vibration"
description: "Filling family life with fun and good vibration"

Title: "Deep social conscience instilled by parents during days of Depression"
description: "Deep social conscience instilled by parents during days of Depression"

Author: "Forbes, Michael"
Title: "Tide turns for Manawatu River's murky waters"
description: "Observes that in 2009 the Manawatu River was described by the Cawthron Institute's report as the most polluted of 300 rivers in the Western World. Summarises the proposed action plans of environmentalists, industrialists, farmers, local governments and iwi to resolve a course of action to save the river. Includes a list of contributory factors that are affecting the quality of water in the Manawatu River."

Title: "A view of the universe"
description: "Interviews the poet, discussing why poetry should be read, why poets should study songwriters, why he still wears Foxton straights trousers, and how it is he can remember over 4000 poems."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Don't grin and beer it"
description: "Discusses coeliac disease, noting the low diagnostic rate for men in NZ. Reveals the typical diet of men in NZ may be making them ill. Describes the symptoms and effects of the disease, a permanent intolerance to gluten. Explains relief through a gluten-free diet, as described by sufferer Terry Hoskins. Notes the work being done on a drug that could desensitise coeliac patients to the effects of gluten."

Author: "Hart, Anna"
Title: "Punch drunk"
description: "Examines the screen portrayals of women acting violently, pondering whether recent YouTube postings of young women fighting are the sign of increased bloodlust in society or the desire to see gender stereotypes subverted. Lists statistics for female violence in NZ. Argues feminism is not to blame, mentioning other factors that might explain the phenomenon."

Title: "Child killer did a 'monstrous thing'"
description: "Child killer did a 'monstrous thing'"

Author: "Easton, Paul"
Title: "Hutt waterways clogged with ooze and toxic algae"
description: "Investigates the effects of a proposal by the Greater Wellington Council to take up to 17 million extra litres of water per day for three years from the Hutt River. Comments it may increase toxic algae bloom events and the river needs to be kept clean for future population growth. Mentions the $21million cleanup of Waiwhetu Stream to scrape the 'ooze' from the stream banks that contained traces of lead cooper, arsenic, zinc and mercury but the water quality remains poor. Indicates the possible sources of the pollutants into Waiwhetu Stream."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Protecting our resource"
description: "Reports the Government has announced measures to allieviate pollution of our waterways, NZs first national policy statement on fresh water, a tool to act as a guiding objective for regional councils determining policies and rules for their local areas. Indicates freshwater management is the biggest priority after climate change but getting a balance between environmental groups, recreational users, and dairy and agricultural industries has been a delicate issue."

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "A strong voice for our child victims"
description: "Talks to new Children's Commissioner, Russell Wills, about his strategies to prevent child abuse. Indicates his role, as Child Commissioner will be, monitoring Child, Youth and Family (CYF), receiving complaints about and from children and giving policy advice to ministers and the prime minister. Notes he will also work part-time as a practicing paediatrician at the Hawke's Bay Regional Hospital while being the children's commissioner. Outlines the progress made by health carers and CYF workers since the case of James Whakaruru and tells of his first job will be to work on Social Development Minister Paula Bennett's 'Children's Action Plan' to progress it to a Green and White Paper. Mentions other strategies making a tangible difference for children, the B4School check for four year olds started in 2008. Touches on the public perception of CYF and his desire to improve this."

description: "Reveals the slump in property values for wineries. Attributes the oversupply of grapes, failing prices of wine, and investor's over-exuberance of recent years to the fall in value of prime grape growing land. Gives an update on the commercial property development in the central business district of Hamilton."

Author (detailed): "John McKay, John Knight and Jo Appleyard"

description: "Highlights the UK High Court's decision in the case of 'Orient Express Hotels vs Generali Global Risk' over an insurance dispute arising from the hurricane damage to New Orleans in 2005 to explain the business interruption (BI) clause in an insurance policy."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Crisis, what crisis?"
description: "Covers the debate over the credibility of the 2011 Budget. Sums up the following areas of concern: doubt over revenue forecasts; cost of the Christchurch earthquake; lack of strategy; limited wage growth; unreliable overseas markets; national debt; household debt reduction; and a high NZ dollar. Looks at changes to Working for Families. Sums up the pros and cons of changes to the KiwiSaver scheme, citing comments by analysts Bernard Hickey, Mary Holm and Shamubeel Eaqub."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "2011 Budget - enough to avert economic crisis?"
description: "Covers the debate over the credibility of the 2011 Budget. Sums up the following areas of concern: doubt over revenue forecasts; cost of the Christchurch earthquake; lack of strategy; limited wage growth; unreliable overseas markets; national debt; household debt reduction; and a high NZ dollar. Looks at changes to Working for Families. Sums up the pros and cons of changes to the KiwiSaver scheme, citing comments by analysts Bernard Hickey, Mary Holm and Shamubeel Eaqub."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Giving Christchurch back its heart"
description: "Records the volume of suggestions for rebuilding Christchurch, including from such overseas organisations as the global conference movement TED. Contrasts this with the difficulties, particularly access rights, faced by CBD building owners. Talks to owners Dean Marshall and Lisle Hood about concerns over emotional and financial reserves, higher than anticipated insurance costs, more exacting building codes, and finding tenants. Cites a property developer's suggestions about using the opportunity to revive the CBD by avoiding malls and office 'parks', and issuing bonds to retail investors. Describes the comments of urban designer James Lunday on rebuilding an urban space that people want to live in."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Rebuilding Christchuch - the going gets tough"
description: "Records the volume of suggestions for rebuilding Christchurch, including from such overseas organisations as the global conference movement TED. Contrasts this with the difficulties, particularly access rights, faced by CBD building owners. Talks to owners Dean Marshall and Lisle Hood about concerns over emotional and financial reserves, higher than anticipated insurance costs, more exacting building codes, and finding tenants. Cites a property developer's suggestions about using the opportunity to revive the CBD by avoiding malls and office 'parks', and issuing bonds to retail investors. Describes the comments of urban designer James Lunday on rebuilding an urban space that people want to live in."

description: "Little girl the system won't help"

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Unleashing our potential within"
description: "Talks to Lower Hutt based FormwayDesign director Rick Wells about how 'design thinking' figured in their award-winning 'Be' chair, noting the potential of the business strategy to benefit NZ companies. Reviews the methods and impact of the Better by Design (BBD) programme run by NZ Trade & Enterprise (NZTE). Talks to BBD users Steve Tucker (Gallagher), Damien Camp (Pacific Aerospace), Bruce Moller (Howard Wright Cares), Miles Valentine (Zeacom), and Richard Shirtcliffe (Phil&Teds). Cites comments from NZTE chief executive Peter Chrisp about the limitations of agricultural commodities. Touches on other economic development schemes, Lean Business and Beachheads."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"

description: "Talks to Lower Hutt based FormwayDesign director Rick Wells about how 'design thinking' figured in their award-winning 'Be' chair, noting the potential of the business strategy to benefit NZ companies. description: "Chats with the Simon Morris and Phil O'Brien, hosts of Radio NZ holiday music show Matinee Idle (6 June) about how they derive their strange themes, their extensive use of Facebook to interact with their audience, and the role of technical assistant Kelle Howson. Backgrounds the  musical expertise of the hosts. Touches on Radio NZ audience reaction to the programme."

Author: "De Lacy, Hugh"
Title: "No more cheap oil"
description: "Talks to market experts about the current volatility in global oil prices and the possibility of NZ using its vast lignite coal deposits in Otago and Southland to become self-sufficient in transport fuels."

Title: "Matinee Idle - Phil O'Brien and Simon Morris"
description: "Chats with the Simon Morris and Phil O'Brien, hosts of Radio NZ holiday music show Matinee Idle (6 June) about how they derive their strange themes, their extensive use of Facebook to interact with their audience, and the role of technical assistant Kelle Howson. Backgrounds the  musical expertise of the hosts. Touches on Radio NZ audience reaction to the programme."

Title: "From shirtsleeves to shirtless"
description: "Looks at the various stages in the life cycle of a business."

Title: "Squaring the soul"
description: "Talks to writer Craig Sherborne about his latest work. Discusses how his family life has informed his poetry, memoirs and fiction. Informs of his understanding of 'truth', how William Shakespeare changed his life, the emotional release felt through writing, and what words he might consider having on his gravestone."

Author: "Lancashire, Rebecca"
Title: "Craig Sherborne"
description: "Talks to writer Craig Sherborne about his latest work. Discusses how his family life has informed his poetry, memoirs and fiction. Informs of his understanding of 'truth', how William Shakespeare changed his life, the emotional release felt through writing, and what words he might consider having on his gravestone."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Office vacancies rise, retail strong"
description: "Focuses on the commercial property market in the city. Talks about the Government strategy to reduce costs by consolidating state sector office employees into smaller and older premises (16 square metres per employee). Looks at what is behind the rise in office vacancies. Talks about some high profile buildings that have been recently placed on the market. Mentions some new stores that have opened in the central city."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Not quite the whole story"
description: "Reviews and comments on Pegasus Town Ltd v Draper and another [2011] NZCZ 140 where the purchasers applied to the High Court to confirm their right to cancel the agreement for the sale and purchase of a plot at the Pegasus Town and the Mapleham Golf Course property development and receive their deposit back under terms of the Contractual Remedies Act 1979 and breaches of the Fair Trading Act 1986 after an agent did not tell the purchasers that Transit NZ proposed to build a bypass close to the development when they were specifically asked by the purchasers if there were any proposals that might affect the development."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Animal magnetism"
description: "Reviews the exhibition 'Significant others' (NZ Portrait Gallery, Shed 11, Wellington) that mostly features animals wearing human accessories or in human poses. Talks to the UK born artist about her NZ upbringing and her fascination with how humans engage with animals."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Joanna Braithwaite"
description: "Reviews the exhibition 'Significant others' (NZ Portrait Gallery, Shed 11, Wellington) that mostly features animals wearing human accessories or in human poses. Talks to the UK born artist about her NZ upbringing and her fascination with how humans engage with animals."

description: "Reviews the Royal NZ Ballet performance, Stravinsky Selection, touring NZ until 9 June."

description: "Summarises and comments on the Commerce Committee's report on the proposed Insolvency Practitioners Bill."
