description: "Looks at the arguments for and against Auckland Council's decision to spend $3.5 million on two female Asian elephants for its zoo. Includes a short list of elephant facts and briefly profiles some of the zoo's past elephants."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Thinking digital"
description: "Reviews the latest and final album by Christchurch born musician Annabel Alpers, recording name Bachelorette, who now resides in New York. Explains why this is her last album."

Author: "Davison, Isaac"
Title: "Up the creek"
description: "Investigates what can be done to clean up Manukau's Puhinui Stream, which has the dubious distinction of being Auckland's dirtiest waterway. Includes a links to sites where you can find out how your own local stream ranks. Suggests cleaning up rural waterways can be a win-win situation for farmers."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Bachelorette"
description: "Reviews the latest and final album by Christchurch born musician Annabel Alpers, recording name Bachelorette, who now resides in New York. Explains why this is her last album."

description: "Talks to the MaÃÑori Party member and Member for Waiariki who was the catalyst for Hone Harawira's sacking from the party."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Gift of the jab"
description: "Untangles misconceptions about the annual influenza vaccine. Explains why vaccination does not always protect against the flu; whether one can get the flu from the vaccine;  whether one can still get the flu even if vaccinated before being infected with anything; and whether is is better to leave matters to chance and possibly build up resistance."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Omnibus Bill to tidy up Acts"
description: "Highlights the proposed changes to 20 Acts under the Statutes Amendment Bill (No 2)."

Title: "Flu vaccine - why a shot is a necessity"
description: "Untangles misconceptions about the annual influenza vaccine. Explains why vaccination does not always protect against the flu; whether one can get the flu from the vaccine;  whether one can still get the flu even if vaccinated before being infected with anything; and whether it is better to leave matters to chance and possibly build up resistance."

Title: "Business information galore"
description: "Highlights the various information on the Ministry of Economic Development website that provides practical resources and links to information to help business owners and managers start, manage, grow or exit their businesses, and deal with the day-to-day challenges they face."

Title: "Battler a man of great love and influence"
description: "Battler a man of great love and influence"

Title: "Brooke Howard-Smith"
description: "Talks to the 'Target' presenter and Christchurch telethon organiser about his lifestyle."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "In the can"
description: "Answers a question about the potential harm caused by chemicals leaching from tinned food. Explains the use of the industrial chemical bisphenol A (BPA) and concerns about its use in food packaging. Lists other chemicals that may leach into food, noting the results of Food Standards Australia and NZ (FSanz) surveys for the presence of these chemicals.  Gives tips to reduce the risk of consuming harmful chemicals."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Food packaging chemicals - is it dangerous?"
description: "Answers a question about the potential harm caused by chemicals leaching from tinned food. Explains the use of the industrial chemical bisphenol A (BPA) and concerns about its use in food packaging. Lists other chemicals that may leach into food, noting the results of Food Standards Australia and NZ (FSanz) surveys for the presence of these chemicals.  Gives tips to reduce the risk of consuming harmful chemicals."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Seizing the bull by the horns"
description: "Talks to the executive chairman of Hoyts and 1987 Rugby World Cup winning captain about his career and the direction the country needs to head in to succeed economically."

Title: "CTV boss among latest death list"
description: "CTV boss among latest death list"

Author: "Neems, Jeff"
Title: "A bridge between church and gays"
description: "A bridge between church and gays"

Title: "Hazy space obscures its artists"
description: "Critiques four exhibitions by local artists including Sam Mitchell and Liam Gerrard, shown at public art galleries around Auckland."

Author: "Dart William"
Title: "Celebrating the music of our own land"
description: "Reviews 'Enchanted islands', the NZ Music Month 2011 performance given by the NZSO."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "What lies beneath"
description: "Focuses on the renewed push to development NZ's petroleum resources. Talks to Hekia Parata, acting Minister of Energy and Resources, and to Greenpeace campaigner Simon Boxer about the Government's stance, potential accidents and the impact on the clean technology sector. Provides a map of NZ to show where petroleum exploration permits have been granted or are in the application stage."

Author: "Gregor, Kelly"
Title: "Kathmandu masters tough terrain"
description: "Investigates how the Kathmandu outdoor clothing and equipment company is expanding in a retail market where many others are struggling. Profiles Jan Cameron, the company's founder, who is now reported to be one of NZ's wealthiest women, and who was made a Companion of the NZ Order of Merit in 2010 for her services to philanthropy."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Boulevard of broken dreams"
description: "Wonders if the Christchurch earthquakes have driven away retailers from High Street, and what might entice them to return. Talks to business owners, shoppers, urban designers, and landlords about the heritage buildings, the fashion boutiques, the low rents and the mix of creative people that made the area special. Notes some owners have relocated out of Christchurch. Cites comments by  C1 Expresso cafe owner Steve Crofsky about the organic growth of the area."

Author: "Pickmere, Arnold,"
Title: "Fame elusive, but not acclaim"
description: "Pays tribute to the guitarist who has died aged 62."

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Victim's family back jetski pair"
description: "Victim's family back jetski pair"

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "NZ firms linked to money laundering; Web of intrigue"
description: "Presents an investigation into the creation of shell companies by Vicam (Auckland) Ltd, run through Vanuatu's Gt Group and operated by Geoffrey Taylor and his sons Ian and Michael, which have been linked to Russian crime, a Mexican drug cartel, Romanian extortion and North Korean arms smuggling."

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Competition winner will go to Paris in the longrun"
description: "Competition winner will go to Paris in the longrun"

Author: "Neems, Jeff"
Title: "On the porch with Sam"
description: "Interviews the Kaipara performance poet about his upcoming poetry collection. Talks about the appeal of Kaipara, despite the lightning strikes, and how it feeds the creative process.  Relays his views on the documentary 'Sam Hunt: Purple balloon and other stories' by Tim Rose. Explains why he has cut back on performing and why he is waiting for another dog to show up. Cites comments by two academics on the reasons for Hunt being NZ's best known poet."

Author: "Croot, James"
Title: "Screen shot"
description: "Gauges the effect of the Christchurch earthquakes on the city's cinemas. Seeks explanation for the differences in theatre-going between Wellington and Christchurch, noting the latter's lack of a suitable venue for film festivals or arthouse cinema. Talks to movie enthusiasts about the possibility of restoring the Odeon or the Isaac Theatre Royal.  Contains a short description of the Roxy Cinema in Miramar, restored to art deco opulence from its origins as the Capitol Theatre."

Author: "Heyns, Danielle"
Title: "From pastry cook to herd tester"
description: "From pastry cook to herd tester"

Author: "Croot, James"
Title: "A bit ragged round the edges"
description: "Reviews the documentary 'Sam Hunt: Purple balloons and other stories' directed by Tim Rose, sharing some of the film's biographical detail and people's comments on the performance poet."

Title: "Dairy expert aims for better farming"
description: "Dairy expert aims for better farming"

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "'I feel very guilty that I'm alive'"
description: "'I feel very guilty that I'm alive'"

Author: "Feek, Belinda"
Title: "Fall on rocks ends woman's dreams"
description: "Fall on rocks ends woman's dreams"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Raise high the roof, carpenters"
description: "Features buildings designed by the NZ Institute of Architects 2011 top award winner. Raises the topic of his distinctive roof structures, detailing the Waitomo Caves Gloworm Caves Visitor Centre, the Peregrine Winery building, and homes in Peka Peka, the Wairarapa and Wellington. Touches on the architect's career track."

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Rich rewards from historian"
description: "Reviews a book of selected writings by the late historian and author."

Author: "Hole, Henry"
Title: "The motorcycle diaries"
description: "Presents the British television presenter's diary about his two weeks on the road in NZ where he travelled from Auckland to Queenstown for the television series 'The world's greatest motorcycle rides'."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Toddler's last month's made special : parents"
description: "Talks to Nadia McKenzie and Tom Casey, parents of the 14-month-old boy who died on 31 Oct 2010 of infantile Krabbe disease, a rare metabolic disorder. Describes some of the special activities they undertook as a family during the remaining days of his life."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "'Bad luck' a prelude to murder; Scottish judge considers compensation for New Zealand victim"
description: "'Bad luck' a prelude to murder; Scottish judge considers compensation for New Zealand victim"

Author: "Wratten, Stephen D."
Title: "Wonderful weeds"
description: "Explains the Snap (shelter, nectar, alternative food and pollen) technique of weeding while also nurturing biological control agents and controlling pests."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Much left to do in commissioner's role"
description: "Talks to the departing Children's Commissioner about his two-year stint in the role. Comments on work still to be done to address physical and emotional abuse of children. Cites his views on aspects of his job, and touches on what he is planning to do next. Lists facts about the role."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Agricultural flying business on the rise"
description: "Talks to the former sheep and beef farmer who established the agricultural aviation business in 2000 with his wife, Elaine Neill. Describes his recent purchase of a Cresco top-dressing aeroplane, now the mainstay of the business."

Author: "Carvill, Olivia"
Title: "Children's plight a family concern"
description: "Children's plight a family concern"

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Colour of many coats"
description: "Talks to artist Paul Pachter and others involved in the Auckland Theatre Company's production of John Logan's 'Red', a play about the Russian-born American painter Mark Rothko. Notes that it will be preformed at the Maidment Theatre, Auckland, 2-25 June 2011."

Author: "Gray, Jamie"
Title: "FMA head not afraid to take hard line"
description: "Talks to the Palmerston North-born incoming head of the Financial Markets Authority (FMA) about his plans for the job. Overviews his career in Australia and NZ."

Author: "Feeney, Warren"
Title: "In the balance"
description: "Comments on the threat to the city's future as a place of art after the earthquake. Surveys the situation for artists in the city."

Author: "Todd, Rebecca"
Title: "Living and giving for those who died"
description: "Reports on a trip to Kobe, Japan,  to evaluate how its citizens coped with the 1995 Hanshin earthquake. Talks to Misako Matsuura and Kiyoshi Matusuura, whose son died in the quake, about the volunteer group Hands they formed for survivors and visitors to the city. Emphasises the importance of resettling people in community groups and of monitoring mental health. Discusses post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) with Japanese psychologist Tomoko Osawa who visited NZ after the 22 Feb Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Holmes, Stephanie"
Title: "All in a day's work"
description: "Talks to the photographer and judge of 'New Zealand's next top model' about his career, being a father and the third season of the reality show."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "No longer convenient; Land, lots of land"
description: "Chronicles the circumstances leading to the closure of the Dainty Dairy, now under threat of demolition. Talks to the Fiji-born former owner about her dream of a top-class education for her two children, her decision in 2007 to stop selling cigarettes at the dairy, her difficulties with getting repairs made to the building and her plans to introduce a new style of Indian food to Dunedin. Seeks comment from Alistair Broad, a partner in property owner Hills Creek Road Ltd., about its intention to sell the land on which the building is situated and difficulties with the Dunedin City Council, which must approve demolition."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Turning over a new file; An Amazonian effort"
description: "Talks to the woman whose memoirs is one of the few Dunedin-related books available on Amazon.com. Speaks to her daughter about the process of developing her memoirs as an e-book and selling it to the dotcom. Seeks comment from the former 'Otago daily times' editor who found the Amazon e-publishing process too problematic for his book on Judge Dudley Ward."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "The view from the cordon"
description: "Reflects on the sights seen on a three-hour remembrance walk around the cordon surrounding Christchurch's earthquake damaged CBD. Starts at the Colombo and St Asaph street intersection, noting the condition of various buildings, the signs people have put up, and the feelings this 'disaster tourism' evokes."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "More joy, less stress; What is TRE?"
description: "Talks to the British-born couple who practice a tension and trauma release process known as TRE (trauma release exercises), developed by Dr David Berceli, an international expert in recovery from trauma and natural disasters. Informs that she has set up TRE New Zealand and that the director of TRE Australia will be conducting three workshops in NZ during May. Describes how TRE has helped both of them in their own lives. Provides additional information about TRE."

Author: "Alexander, Mike"
Title: "Taking care of business"
description: "Talks to the founder of one of NZ's longest-surviving independent music labels."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Police, in numbers, reassure citizens on shattered streets of Christchurch"
description: "Investigates crime patterns emerging following the relatively law abiding days following the 22 Feb Christchurch earthquake. Accompanies two out-of-town police officers on a 'trust and reasssurance' patrol around the city. Talks to Superintendent Andy McGregor about policing immediately after the earthquake, the effects of alcohol, and the anticipated effects of stress and hardship in the long term."

Author: "Wyatt, Hamesh"
Title: "Poetry"
description: "Book reviews, including 'AUP new poets 4' by Harry Jones, Erin Scudder and Chris Tse."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Wife-killer threat to his new bride"
description: "Wife-killer threat to his new bride"

Author: "Dye, Stuart"
Title: "Crooked accountant gambles away $50m"
description: "Crooked accountant gambles away $50m"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Some like it loud"
description: "Profiles the Wellington-based heavy rock quartet. Talks to singer Matt Hyde about their self-titled debut album on its imprint Destroy Records."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Wedding bells ring for quake amputee"
description: "Wedding bells ring for quake amputee"

Title: "Beginner's guide to renovations"
description: "Highlights eight important steps to consider when renovating a house."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Words and picture"
description: "Talks to the poet whose life is the subject of a new feature-length documentary.  Mentions the imminent publication of his new collection 'Chords and other poems'."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Principal"
description: "Relates a typical day for the Kaikoura Primary School principal."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Niece turns detective to shed light on stellar career of 'princess'"
description: "Follows the search by Christchurch musician Angela Skerrett Tainui for information on her Stewart Island born great-aunt who never returned from a visit to Britain in 1910 and forged a career in Europe as singer Princess Iwa (Eva). Gives some details of the singer's life in Britain. Describes Tainui's creation of a CD, Whakamaharatanga o Iwa (Fondest memories of Iwa), including a rendition of Heine e heine, with the help of Invercargill mayor Tim Shadbolt, actor Sam Neill and wider family and community members."

Author: "Satterthwaite, Ian B."
Title: "Willis had self-discipline, drive and heart"
description: "Willis had self-discipline, drive and heart"

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Forest to the sea"
description: "Finds plenty to do and see in the warm and welcoming Bay of Islands. Includes traveller's tips."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Me, myself and I"
description: "Looks at why psychologists are telling people to spend more time alone and why 'alone' does not automatically equal 'lonely'. Talks to clinical psychologist Dr Susan Hayes about the benefits of time spent alone and to blogger Selina McEntee about her need for solitude and what 'alone' means to her."

Author: "Nicholson-Moon, Libby"
Title: "A dose of Waikato culture"
description: "Profiles two art exhibition spaces in Waikato: the Waitakaruru Arboretum and Sculpture Park in Tauwhare, and the Wallace Gallery in Morrinsville."

description: "Examines the inner workings of the 2011 'Cleo' magazine 'bachelor of the year' competition, which was won by radio promotions manager Nick Oswald."

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "Having a ball"
description: "Reports on the rise of interest in soccer since the All Whites' surprise World Cup success, with children and parents alike showing enthusiasm for the game. Includes links to details on how to find a club in your area."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Sitting pretty"
description: "Talks to Danielle Hayes, winner of last year's 'New Zealand's next top model', about her modelling career since winning the contest, and what the new 'wannabes' should expect."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "CD reviews"
description: "Reviews new releases by NZ acts."

Author: "Calder, Peter"
Title: "Diamond in the rough"
description: "Critiques the film 'Sam Hunt: Purple balloon and other stories', directed by Tim Rose."

Title: "Little gadget aiming for a big market"
description: "Little gadget aiming for a big market"

Title: "Woodcock milestone built on technique"
description: "Woodcock milestone built on technique"

Title: "Making the shoe fit for loyal customers"
description: "Making the shoe fit for loyal customers"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Real estate 'king' sells advice despite receivership"
description: "Real estate 'king' sells advice despite receivership"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "The $6M street"
description: "Looks at Cremorne Street of Herne Bay, Auckland where the average price of a house is $5.83 million and has taken over the name of Paritai Drive as the most expensive street in NZ. Comments on the owners of the properties in the street giving some detail as to their interests. Includes top streets in North Shore, Hamilton, Tauranga and Wellington."

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Pilot was to help in quake work"
description: "Pilot was to help in quake work"

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Bank got it wrong, says property firm owner"
description: "Bank got it wrong, says property firm owner"

Title: "Dutch-born Kiwi handed Unilever's toughest job"
description: "Dutch-born Kiwi handed Unilever's toughest job"

Author: "Graham, Jill"
Title: "Saturday night fever in the city"
description: "Chronicles what happens on a typical night when police are out on the beat in four cities, Auckland, Perth, San Francisco and Oslo. What's similar? What's different about policing in the cities? Describes what the director of the television documentary of '24 hours : Police' found with most of the call-outs related to alcohol fuelled anti-social behaviour."

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "They've survived from Beatles to Bieber but you can't beat short back and sides"
description: "They've survived from Beatles to Bieber but you can't beat short back and sides"

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "More to the spelling bee than words can tell"
description: "Meets this year's winner of the New Zealand Spelling Bee.  Reports on her preparation for the 84th annual Scripps National Spelling Bee in Washington, D.C.   Discusses the benefits and challenges of the competition with NZ event organiser Janet Lucas and judge Dianne Bardsley, especially in relation to the use of US word spellings and listening to the different vowel pronunciations in Kiwi and American accents.  Gets tips on being a good speller from Victoria University linguistics professor Laurie Bauer.   Briefly chats to NZ's first Scripps spelling bee contestant (in 2005), Charlotte Roose."

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Gruelling journey 'definitely a oncer'"
description: "Gruelling journey 'definitely a oncer'"

Author: "Jackson, Kerri"
Title: "Feast afloat"
description: "Describes the four day cruise experience of the author on the Pacific Pearl where the focus is on eating, drinking and learning to cook. Indicates the trip is hosted by Kiwi chef Anne Thorp who presents cooking demonstrations and with wine tasting classes hosted by NZ and Australia winemakers"

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "Lawyer's brilliance may never be repeated"
description: "Lawyer's brilliance may never be repeated"

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "A working life in print and great passion for softball"
description: "A working life in print and great passion for softball"

Author: "Bradley, Antonio"
Title: "Deputy commissioner lives the dream working to better Kiwis' quality of life"
description: "Deputy commissioner lives the dream working to better Kiwis' quality of life"

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Lord of the cringe"
description: "Observes the controversy over the proposed 'Wellywood' sign to be erected near Wellington Airport.   Listens to the arguments on both sides of the debate.  Looks at other branding campaigns from the past that have either divided or united communities."

Author: "Marriner, Chris"
Title: "Indulgence the only must-do"
description: "Follows the experience of the author who took up the opportunity of a ten day cruise on the 'Rhapsody of the Seas' of Melanesia which changes his view of 'cruising'."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Medical ethics : it's never black and white"
description: "Examines the ethical and legal dilemmas doctors face when deciding when is too young - or too old - to save a life, particularly in an age when technology increasingly blurs the lines between life and death.  Discusses the issues with Capital & Coast District Health Board (CCDHB) senior legal counsel Hiranthi Abeygoonesekera, CCDHB Clincal Ethics Advisory Group founder Dr Alastair Macdonald, intensive care specialist Dr Peter Hicks, and Ethics Committee on Assisted Reproductive Technology head Kate Davenport.  Highlights the case of King Country dairy farmer Allan Smith, who threatened court action to allow his unconventional vitamin C treatments to continue.  Mentions relevant legislation under the Bill of Rights Act and Crimes Act."

Title: "Starting small works for those who mean business"
description: "Meets the executive director of the Porirua Chamber of Commerce.  Chats to her about her career and about the advantages, opportunities, and challenges of heading the chamber for a small city."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Teen spirit"
description: "Speaks to the author and this year's winner of the New Zealand Post Children's Book Awards Young Adult Fiction award about the themes behind the books of her Taris trilogy, including 'The heart of danger' and 'Fierce September', and what have been her inspirations for writing throughout her life."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "What would you ask?"
description: "Reports on oral history projects that are helping ordinary people preserve family memories and bring the past to life.  Talks to Turnbull Library Oral History Centre curator Linda Evans and oral historians Judith Fyfe and Hugo Manson about the power and value of oral histories. Relays the answers of selected Wellingtonians to the query, if they could ask one question for posterity, what would it be and who would they ask? : sportswoman Paula Tesoriero / husband Chris Bishop; Wellington Girls head girl Katherine McIndoe / grandfather Alex Schwass; actress Chelsie Preston-Crayford / filmmaker mother Gaylene Preston; and playwright Dave Armstrong / parents Phil Armstrong and Betty Armstrong."

Author: "Galuszka, Jono"
Title: "What's brewing in the backyard; Crafty devils"
description: "Chats to expert home brewers about their craft and why its bad reputation is undeserved.  Showcases boutique Wellington brewery Tuatara."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "True to life"
description: "Backgrounds the winning short story of the inaugural The Long and Short of It short story competition, 'Clean hands save lives' by Kirsten McDougall.   Chats to the writer about the story.  Reproduces the story in full."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Jane Keller : singer and water baby"
description: "Jane Keller : singer and water baby"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Reaching for the skies"
description: "Features buildings designed by the NZ Institute of Architects 2011 top award winner. Raises the topic of his distinctive roof structures, detailing the Waitomo Caves Gloworm Caves Visitor Centre, the Peregrine Winery building, and homes in Peka Peka, the Wairarapa and Wellington. Touches on the architect's career track."

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Title: "Rich rewards from historian"
description: "Reviews a book of selected writings by the late historian and author."

Title: "Blue skies shining on me: Farrah's story"
description: "Blue skies shining on me: Farrah's story"

Title: "A land of opportunity: Keith and Irene's story"
description: "A land of opportunity: Keith and Irene's story"

description: "Vance recalls doing it tough in Derby"

description: "Killed NZ cameraman 'fully briefed' on stunt"

description: "Investigators identify likely site of 7-year-old air crash"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1861"
description: "Introduces the new paper, which published its first issue on 15 Nov 1861. Reflects on some significant events in that year, including the discovery of gold in the province. Comments on the 'disgraceful condition' of the city on the day of the election of the Dunedin Town Board, 30 Dec 1861. Reports in the 30 Dec edition on a 'most daring robbery under arms', Tokomariro, at the premises of Mr Reid."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1862"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1862. Describes a flood in Gabriel's Gully in early Jan 1862. Sums up a report from the Chief Commissioner of Police St John Branigan to His Honor on the Waipori goldfield. Reports on a significant find of gold by two miners, 16-21 Aug 1862. Mentions 'beneficial reforms' by Government to the goldfields, Feb 1862. Touches on other events during the year."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1863"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1863. Describes the fatal collision of two port steamers, the 'Pride of the Yarra' and the 'William Miskin' near Port Chalmers, Jul 1863. Reports on the successful navigation of the Molyneux River of the new stern-wheel ferry 'Tuapeka', under the command of Captain A Murray, Aug 1863. Relates accounts from coach passengers of deaths and suffering from a violent storm in the region, Aug 1863. Touches on other events during the year."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1864"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1864. Describes a Free School for established by local resident Mrs O'Rafferty for poor or neglected children. Reports on a fire on the evening of 2 Feb 1864 in the city that spread due to lack of water to fight it. Mentions events during the Boxing Day holiday, 26 Dec 1863. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Modern look at a notable"
description: "Features a rare solo exhibition of works by the late Dunedin-born artist, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin, for three weeks from 27 May 2011. Talks to Brett McDowell about the series of 11 works he has assembled for the exhibition."

Author: "Body, Ralph"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Ore struck : the use of gold in art and photography', various artists, Hocken Gallery, Dunedin, until 25 Jun 2011.  Reviews 'Palm-leaf art' by Gae Wilson, The Fix cafe, Dunedin, until 31 May 2011.  Reviews 'Fractus' by Jeena Shin, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 30 Oct 2011."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1865"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1865. Reports on the latest in a series of fires during Jan 1865, this time a significant blaze in the commercial centre in which people were injured, 24 Jan. Lauds the success of the first New Zealand Exhibition, opening on 12 Jan 1865. Reports on the election for the first Mayor of Dunedin, 22-24 Jan 1965, resulting in the election of Mr William Mason. Recounts the excitement of the return on 19 Oct of the West Coast Exploration Party, under the leadership of Mr Vincent Pyke. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Hartley, Simon"
Title: "Stalwart ends role as union executive"
description: "Profiles the long-time national president of the Rail and Maritime Transport Union, who decided not to stand for re-election for the position after 21 years' service. Talks about his involvement in the union movement over the past three decades."

Title: "High-flyer a man of many vocations"
description: "High-flyer a man of many vocations"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1866"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1866. Focuses on the work of the Otago Benevolent Institution. Reports on the increase in Chinese settlers in the region. Informs that a monument will be erected for deceased members of the police force. Comments that 1866 was a 'year of steady progress and prosperity'. Touches on other events during the year. Includes a drawing depicting the shipwreck of the 'General Grant' in the Auckland Islands, 14 May 1866."

description: "Man gets bubbly in Bluff after long run"

description: "A hand to hold, a shoulder to cry on"

Title: "Admired pair die in Aspiring air crash"
description: "Admired pair die in Aspiring air crash"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Licensed to kill"
description: "Looks at car crash statistics in NZ. Highlights the facts that teen drivers have a much higher chance of causing deaths and having a crash than older drivers. Talks to crash prevention educator Robert Isler who has long argued that although young drivers may quickly develop basic car-handling skills, they sorely lack other vital driving abilities."

Title: "Back from tragedy to chase dream"
description: "Back from tragedy to chase dream"

Title: "Broadcaster's work 'at highest level'"
description: "Broadcaster's work 'at highest level'"

Title: "Young drivers licensed to kill"

Title: "McLellan made his mark on racing in Southlnd"

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "[Neurosurgery campaign]; How the neurosurgery campaign developed; Surgeons protested decision; Delay oversight, Hundleby says; South 'used' to create a concerted public response"
description: "Focuses on correspondence released to the paper by the National Health Board, revealing some of the heretofore-unreported battles in the emotionally charged campaign to retain neurosurgery services in Dunedin. Backgrounds the campaign launched by the paper. Divulges the opposition by some surgeons to the two-site proposal by an expert panel. Cites comment from National Health Board deputy director Michael Hundleby that the five-month delay in releasing correspondence to the paper from Canterbury neurosurgeons was an oversight. Suggests that the Canterbury District Health Board did not receive a fair hearing during the debate over the location of South Island neurosurgery services. Briefly profiles four of the main players in the debate."

Author: "Harding, Evan"
Title: "Bellew back in saddle after amazing recovery"
description: "Bellew back in saddle after amazing recovery"

Title: "Invercargill loses a friendly face well respected in both racing and rugby"
description: "Invercargill loses a friendly face well respected in both racing and rugby"

Title: "Always destined for a life on the land"
description: "Always destined for a life on the land"

Title: "Battle of Britain pilot dies at 92"
description: "Battle of Britain pilot dies at 92"

Author: "Hotton, Mark"
Title: "Attention to detail key to success"
description: "Attention to detail key to success"

Author: "Dearnaley, Mathew"
Title: "Stuck in traffic"
description: "Names three transportation schemes promised by Auckland mayor Len Brown: a central rail loop, a second harbour crossing and airport trains. Examines each proposal for its history, details, feasibility and support from central Government, noting the most popular option among the city's ratepayers."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Love and the Larnachs; Owen Marshall fact file; Larnach speaks of love - an extract"
description: "Speaks to the writer about his new novel 'The Larnachs', inspired by the prominent 19th century Otago family. Informs that the novel is not solely concerned with the life of the Australian-born businessman, but focuses on the rumoured love affair between his third wife, Constance de Bathe Brandon, and his son Douglas Larnach. Includes facts about the author. Presents an extract from the novel."

Author: "McKinlay, Tom"
Title: "Trading-in the coal scuttle"
description: "Evaluates whether using coal to heat domestic buildings is a sustainable practice nowadays. Cites counterarguments from Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) critic Dr Geoff Bertram, a researcher at the Victoria University Institute of Policy Studies and co-author of a book on NZ's ETS. Seeks comment from University of Otago energy expert Prof Bob Lloyd."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "The practice of making no effort; From injury to discovery; Feldenkrais practitioners in the South"
description: "Participates in a Feldenkrais method session. Talks to Jane Gillespie of Utopia Dynamic Health about the practice of this movement education modality. Seeks additional comment from Dr Jon Shemmell of the University of Otago School of Physical Education about how the brain processes information and tasks. Briefly profiles Moshe Feldenkrais, the Russian-born Israeli physicist and engineer who developed the method in the 1960s. Provides information about four Feldenkrais practitioners in Dunedin and Queenstown."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Author (detailed): "Lawrence Jones, E.R. Nye and Caroline Hunter"
Title: "Rare early NZ fiction complements historical novels; History of combating disease; Facts, fictions and philosophies"
description: "Rare early NZ fiction complements historical novels; History of combating disease; Facts, fictions and philosophies"

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "McCaw's family history reveals a few secrets"
description: "McCaw's family history reveals a few secrets"

Author: "Morgan, Sam,"
Title: "The missing link"
description: "Argues that NZ needs more bandwidth and better connection to the rest of the world for further economic progress. Suggests that in order to compete with the rest of the world and also attract the world's best talent to come and live here NZ must commit to getting hyper-connected."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Jetpack v the Jetman"
description: "Compares and contrasts the Swiss and NZ inventors of machines enabling single user flight, and their inventions. Provides histories for both men and  machines. Talks to the Christchurch inventor about his secret torque neutral fan, and his plans to manufacture his jetpack as an alternative to the helicopter. Traces the history of the jetpack in literature and in film."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "A crafty calling"
description: "Comments on the resurgence of craft arts. Suggests that the recession has affected people's interest in learning handmade craft skills. Mentions also a large interest from the male population."

Author: "Hindmarsh, Gerard,"
Title: "Flock together"
description: "Discusses the spectacle of gathering spotted shags along Golden Bay's Tata Beach, which has scientists baffled by their behaviour."

Author: "McCrystal, John"
Title: "More than one man's castle"
description: "Speaks to the writer about his new novel 'The Larnachs', inspired by the prominent 19th century Otago family. Informs that the novel is not solely concerned with the life of the Australian-born businessman, but focuses on the rumoured love affair between his third wife, Constance de Bathe Brandon, and his son Douglas Larnach. Includes facts about the author. Presents an extract from the novel."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Conversations with ourselves"
description: "Talks to the Scottish born Aucklander and diagnosed schizophrenic about the voice dialogue workshops he runs at Western Springs Community Hall for the Hearing Voices Network. Details the techniques used at the workshops. Provides his personal experience of negotiating with his voices. Provides a history of the UK originated network and its presence in NZ."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Maggie Barry"
description: "Talks to the former television garden show host about her foray into politics as a National Party candidate. Discusses family, flowers, and personality, as they pertain to politics."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Parallel world born of surreal imagination"
description: "Reviews the Auckland exhibitions 'Snips & snails and puppy dog tails' by Mark Braunias, Bath St Gallery, to 18 Jun; 'Climate change' by Josephine Do, Orexart, to 11 June; and 'I'll follow you down the road' by Kate Newby, Hopkinson Cundy Gallery, to 18 June."

Author: "McNaught, Josie"
Title: "Venice show hits the bull's eye"
description: "Reports from the Venice Biennale on the sculptural installation, 'On first looking into Chapman's Homer' by NZ artist Michael Parekowhai. Assesses the venue. Looks back on the lessons NZ exhibitors have learned since participating in 2001. Ponders continued Government support for the event."

Author: "Slade, Maria"
Title: "Marketers peg Kiwi lifestyles; Classic suburban family still a winner"
description: "Looks at the latest version of Pacific Micromarketing's 'Mosaic', a population segmentation system that classifies every NZ home into one of 42 'tribes' by using 'geo-demographic profiling'. Talks to a data analyst Pierre Braganza about the accuracy of the description for his household."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Send in the crowds"
description: "Chats to the singer-songwriter about the process of making his soon-to-be-released album, his second as a soloist. Talks about the pleasures of touring."

Title: "A history of fun"
description: "Backgrounds the new eco-documentary by the adventurer, focusing on the contribution of NZ pioneers to the evolution of extreme sports. Talks to the filmmaker."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "I'm walking in light"
description: "Talks to the Queensland based NZ designers Paul Johnson and Gail Mason about their interactive Public Art Pencil installation in the Sydney Vivid Festival. Discusses their work since leaving NZ in 2001. Describes other light sculptures on display."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Two actors plus a cast of hundreds"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Theatre Company performance of John Logan's 'Red', Maidment Theatre, to 25 Jun 2011. Talks to director Oliver Driver about the messy props involved in portraying the artist Mark Rothko. Chats to Elliot Christensen-Yule playing opposite protagonist Michael Hurst about his acting background."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "A dogged fight"
description: "Investigates who is to blame for dog attacks after the recent mauling of two children in Masterton and Kawerau prompted calls for more efficient laws to protect the public. Looks at the inconsistency in how dog laws are applied in practice. Touches on some recent high profile dog attacks, including the mauling of Sharon Johnson by four English bulldogs in Kawerau. Provides tips on how to keep children safe with dogs and what to do if a dog attacks."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Pop with a hard edge"
description: "Talks to Aucklanders Damien Daniels and Sam Harvey about the influences behind their new self-titled debut EP."

Author: "Nash, Kieran"
Title: "Auckland, have a heart"
description: "Looks at the transformation of the city's CBD (central business district) into a people-friendly space."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Challenging job with simple message"
description: "Interviews the Dunedin Hospital nurse about her role as charge nurse manager of infection prevention and control."

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "Boxall will travel world for Whites"
description: "Boxall will travel world for Whites"

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "The best medicine"
description: "Joins in one of the 20 laughter yoga clubs in NZ, explaining the exercise's origins and the rationale behind its breathing techniques. Extols the health benefits of laughing."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1867"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1867. Reports on the worst fire to date in the city, 19 Apr 1867. Describes the wreck of the steamer 'South Australian', 4 Apr 1867. Reports on the release of trout ova from Tasmania to streams in Dunedin, 15 Sep 1867. Mentions the success of the release of wild rabbits into Southland, 15 Jul 1867. Touches on the opening of the Lyttelton Tunnel, 30 Oct 1867. Chronicles the formal opening of the Dunedin Water Works, opened 9 Dec 1867."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Whatever the weather"
description: "Informs of indoor sports arenas in Auckland for winter athletes wanting to do netball, cricket, soccer, cycling, snow sports, rockclimbing and golf."

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "What's eating you?"
description: "Asks six women and men about their eating habits, covering a variety of life situations from medical student, dancer and lap-band surgery patient, to actor, multi-sport athlete and musician."

Author: "Grimshaw, Charlotte"
Title: "Elegant treatment of real life scandal"
description: "Elegant treatment of real life scandal"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Brothers in arts"
description: "Speaks to the brothers about their current acting roles. Talks about working together on 'Sione's 2' and 'Shortland Street'. Notes that Pua stars in Silo Theatre's production of 'The brothers size' at the Herald Theatre (Auckland) until 18 June 2011 and Robbie plays Othello in the Peach Theatre Company production of 'Othello' at the Maidment Theatre (Auckland) from 22 July to 13 August 2011."

Author: "McCrystal, John"
Title: "Owen Marshall"
description: "Speaks to the writer about his new novel 'The Larnachs', inspired by the prominent 19th century Otago family. Informs that the novel is not solely concerned with the life of the Australian-born businessman, but focuses on the rumoured love affair between his third wife, Constance de Bathe Brandon, and his son Douglas Larnach. Includes facts about the author. Presents an extract from the novel."

Author: "Gracewood, Jolisa"
Title: "Caleb's crossing by Geraldine Brooks"
description: "Caleb's crossing by Geraldine Brooks"

Author: "Alley, Elizabeth"
Title: "The commonplace book : a writer's journey through quotations by Elizabeth Smither"
description: "The commonplace book : a writer's journey through quotations by Elizabeth Smither"

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "Fusing worlds"
description: "Reviews two art exhibitions held at Milford Galleries, Dunedin in June 2011 - Andy Leleisi'uao's paintings in his 'The world of Erodipolis' and Peata Larkin's 'Encoded Whare'."

Author: "Eggleton, David"
Title: "Andy Leleisi'uao and Peata Larkin : art exhibitions"
description: "Reviews two art exhibitions held at Milford Galleries, Dunedin in June 2011 - Andy Leleisi'uao's paintings in his 'The world of Erodipolis' and Peata Larkin's 'Encoded Whare'."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "A little learning"
description: "Reports back from some recent undercover research where 21 pharmacies and 21 health stores were visited to compare and contrast the sort of advice they covered. Asserts the need for more regulation of complementary and alternative medicines and those promoting them."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Medical research shows health store risks"
description: "Reports back from some recent undercover research where 21 pharmacies and 21 health stores were visited to compare and contrast the sort of advice they covered. Asserts the need for more regulation of complementary and alternative medicines and those promoting them."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "That leaky building"
description: "Reports on what is happening in Japan with the Fukushima nuclear power plant. Looks at the release of radionuclides into the ocean, there levels and how safe is it around the world. Ponders on the possible long-term health problems of the general public over there."

Author: "Hughes, Alistair"
Title: "The winter sky at night"
description: "Presents a guide to the star cluster called Matariki (the Pleiades star cluster or The Seven Sisters) and the winter night sky. Explains how to find Matariki. Talks about the Winter Solstice (shortest day), 21-22 June 2011, the total eclipse of the Moon on 16 June 2011, and MaÃÑori astronomy."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Japan's Fukushima plant : how dangerous is it?"
description: "Reports on what is happening in Japan with the Fukushima nuclear power plant. Looks at the release of radionuclides into the ocean, there levels and how safe is it around the world. Ponders on the possible long-term health problems of the general public over there."

Author: "Morgan, Sam,"
Title: "Broadband speed : why we need faster and better"
description: "Argues that NZ needs more bandwidth and better connection to the rest of the world for further economic progress. Suggests that in order to compete with the rest of the world and also attract the world's best talent to come and live here NZ must commit to getting hyper-connected."

Author: "Hindmarsh, Gerard,"
Title: "Golden Bay's shag assembly scene of natural spectacle"
description: "Discusses the spectacle of gathering spotted shags along Golden Bay's Tata Beach, which has scientists baffled by their behaviour."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Craft resurgence in economic recession"
description: "Comments on the resurgence of craft arts. Suggests that the recession has affected people's interest in learning handmade craft skills. Mentions also a large interest from the male population."

Author: "Bowron, Jane,"
Title: "Slick investigator sheds light on case"
description: "Reviews 'The investigator' and its investigation into the murder of Janelle Patton by NZer Glenn McNeill on Norfolk Island."

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "Christophers shows no signs of slowing down"
description: "Christophers shows no signs of slowing down"

Author: "Egan, Brendon"
Title: "De Bruin delighted by trans-Tasman MVP win"
description: "De Bruin delighted by trans-Tasman MVP win"

Title: "Extraordinary skills lies behind piano's voice"
description: "Extraordinary skills lies behind piano's voice"

Author: "Veltkamp Smith, Pat"
Title: "Elder twin loved life in Southland"
description: "Elder twin loved life in Southland"

Author: "Bradley, Antonio"
Title: "The jailer who fell from grace to a cell; Guarding against corruption in a challenging environment; Staying safe on the other side of bars"
description: "Follows the case of former Rimutaka Prison guard Johan Clarke, the first Corrections officer convicted of corruption in NZ. Looks at the role of the Professional Standards Unit, which investigates allegations of illegal or corrupt activity by Corrections staff. Lists the Rimutaka Prison guards who have been found guilty of a crime or are before the courts. Talks to Corrections Association president Bevan Hanlon about life behind bars for a prison officer and the prison officer education programme the union runs called 'Turning the screws on corruption'."

Title: "Lengthy journey leads to Gold Guitar win"
description: "Lengthy journey leads to Gold Guitar win"

Author: "Nathan, Hira"
Title: "Fighter putting best foot forward"
description: "Fighter putting best foot forward"

Author: "Venter, Nick"
Title: "How the Silver Fox turned gamekeeper"
description: "Talks to Radio NZ's new chairman about his varied career and the future of the public broadcasting organisation."

Author: "Adams, Daniel"
Title: "Wilson facing toughest battle; Civic break for Wilson as he fights cancer"
description: "Wilson facing toughest battle; Civic break for Wilson as he fights cancer"

Author: "Forbes, Michael"
Title: "Grieving family waits for answers"
description: "Grieving family waits for answers"

Author: "Leaman, Aaron"
Title: "Speedway star reunited with old friend"
description: "Speedway star reunited with old friend"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Scientist a champion of impoverished"
description: "Scientist a champion of impoverished"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Kiwi not out of the woods yet"
description: "Reports that, despite a massive boost to kiwi recovery funding and popularity in the past decade, kiwi numbers are still falling. Talks to Avi Holzapfel, kiwi recover group leader for the Conservation Department, about the recovery efforts and the work that will be needed in the years to come. Lists the threats to kiwi. Estimates the populations for each species (little spotted kiwi, great spotted kiwi, rowi, tokoeka and brown kiwi) in 2000 and 2010."

Author: "McNaughton, Iona,"
Title: "Mad about the Bard"
description: "Talks to the founder of the Sheilah Winn Shakespeare Festival about her ongoing enthusiasm for the 16th-century playwright."

Author: "Naden, Clare"
Title: "Intimate tale of the tragic Larnachs"
description: "Intimate tale of the tragic Larnachs"

Author: "Hallahan, Marnie"
Title: "Long-serving duo attend to many duties at hospital"
description: "Long-serving duo attend to many duties at hospital"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Green guerrillas"
description: "Focuses on the efforts of the region's councils and various volunteer groups to preserve and restore the city's town belt areas over the last twenty years. Speaks to Trelissick Park Group chairman Peter Reimann and founding member Frances Lee about the transformation of Ngaio's Trelissick Park from a mash of weeds, rubbish and rotten sewer pipes. Talks about the Greater Wellington Regional Council pest management strategy and the Wellington City Council's possum control programme. Follows Denton-Polhill Reserve (Aro Valley) volunteer Fraser MacMaster as he clears traps that are part of the City Council's plan to create a buffer zone around Karori's Zealandia sanctuary. Acknowledges that despite the successes, it is not all good news."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Wrapped in love"
description: "Explains why the author loves to knit and crochet, despite it being 'incredibly naff'."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Artistic insulations"
description: "Features two projects from Hamilton's MOAA Architects (Simon Harrison, Broke Cholmondeley-Smith, Time Horne and Nathan Edmonston), which go way beyond the building code requirements for insulation."

Author: "Lynch, Urban"
Title: "Bike trek"
description: "Relates the experience of a three-day trip mountain biking and walking through the North Island's Central Plateau (from Ohakune's Old Coach Road, to the Whanganui River via the Tongariro Crossing and the Bridge to Nowhere)."

Author: "Neems, Jeff"
Title: "The people's poet"
description: "Interviews the Kaipara performance poet about his upcoming poetry collection. Talks about the appeal of Kaipara despite the lightning strikes, and how it feeds the creative process. Relays his views on the documentary 'Sam Hunt: Purple balloon and other stories' by Tim Rose. Explains why he has cut back on performing and why he is waiting for another dog to show up."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1868"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1868. Reports on news of a tidal wave had struck part of the South in mid-Aug 1868.  Celebrates the opening of the bridge across the Molyneux River, Clutha Ferry, 9 Oct 1868. Commemorates the laying of the foundation stone at the First Church of Otago, Dunedin, 29 May 1868. Touches on other events during the year, including the opening of the Otago Museum on 15 Sep 1868, reported on in the 7 Oct 1868 issue, and the arrival from Melbourne of the fishing smack ' Redcliff' to trawl off the Otago Heads, 28 Jan 1868."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Pretty much perfect"
description: "Visits the national park with her sister and reports on its spectacular attractions. Provides facts about the history and current features of the park."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1869"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1869. Decries the 'disgraceful' condition of the (Dunedin) High School, 9 Jun 1869. Informs of the completion of the new distillery erected by Messrs C R Howden and Co, Cumberland Street, Dunedin, 29 Oct 1869.  Reports on an earthquake in the city, 20 Jun 1869. Notes the arrival in Dunedin of 74 Maori captured at Patea, tried in Wellington and sentenced to various terms of imprisonment at Dunedin Gaol, 18 Nov 1869. Includes a 1869 drawing of Dunedin by Samuel Calvert."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Waste ... not; If there is 'nothing' in the fridge - look again"
description: "Highlights the issue of food wastage. Speaks to Catherine Irvine, waste strategy manager at the Dunedin City Council (DCC), Dr Miranda Mirosa of the Food Waste Innovation research group at the University of Otago and Craig Nieper of Centre City New World, Dunedin about waste reduction strategies. Offers recipes for transforming leftovers into a delicious meal. Lists useful books and websites on the topic."

Author: "Delignieres, Marilou"
Author (detailed): "Marilou Delignieres, Rohan Brash and Ally Waser"
Title: "Secondary scene : Mount Aspiring College; Sleeping in is a prerogative of teenagers; The only side of this law is the wrong one; It's anything but a load of old rubbish"
description: "Features contributions from Mount Aspiring Students on the topics of the need for sleep and the dangers of sleep deprivation, the origins of Murphy's Law and the importance of recycling. Includes a visual art design poster by Samantha Stokes."

Title: "Europe out for now, says Carter"
description: "Europe out for now, says Carter"

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Secret snaps reveal elusive Fiordland moose; Moose let loose"
description: "Reveals four rare photographs of moose taken in Fiordland in 1953 by the Northland hunter. Talks to him about his decision to allow the photographs to be published for the first time. Seeks comment from Bull Creek resident Ken Tustin, who has spent years searching for the elusive descendants of the North American moose, released into Fiordland in 1910. Includes a timeline on the history of moose in NZ, compiled from information provided by Ken Tustin."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1870"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1870.  Chronicles arrests made after money and gold was stolen from the Clyde gaol, 31 Aug 1870. Reports on flood damage in the city, 21 May 1870. Announces the opening of the reading room at the Athenaeum, 9 May 1870.  Informs that the Legislature has drafted a Bill to prevent illicit distillation and vending of alcohol. Reports on a 'devastating' fire in Lyttelton occurring on 24-25 Oct 1870."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Show goes on, despite quake; The show goes on"
description: "Spotlights the planning of the play 'Five women wearing the same dress', a collaborative production between the Fortune Theatre and the Court Theatre. Talks to Fortune Theatre artistic director Lara Macgregor about the decision to move the production from Christchurch to Dunedin after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Informs of its season at the Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, 3-25 Jun 2011, followed by a run at the Aurora Theatre, Christchurch."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Intrinsic' by Karen Baddock and Sheryl McCammon, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.   Reviews 'The World of Erodipolis' by Andy Leleisi'uao, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 22 Jun 2011.  Reviews 'Nollywood' by Pieter Hugo, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 21 Aug 2011."

Author: "Marshall, Jonathan"
Title: "The tunnel's victims; Engineer a stickler for work safety; Source of deadly gas in tunnel still a mystery; Methane in pipes a deadly mixture"
description: "The tunnel's victims; Engineer a stickler for work safety; Source of deadly gas in tunnel still a mystery; Methane in pipes a deadly mixture"

Author: "Stevenson, Rebecca"
Title: "Rugby needs a revamp"
description: "Looks at how the financial failure of the provincial unions may force the NZ Rugby Union (NZRU) to overhaul its governance model to maintain its cash reserves. Explains that the NZRU has been running cumulative losses, which total to around $30 million over the past five years, by trying to prop up the provincial unions and community-level rugby."

Author: "Holmes, Stephanie"
Title: "'Who wants downtime?'"
description: "Talks to the iconic stage, film and television actor about his career, which has involved acting, writing, directing and teaching. Lists his career highlights, from his 1971 TV debut in 'Pukemanu' to a 2010/2011 role in the local television drama series 'Shortland Street'. Light-heartedly asks why someone of his calibre would take a role in 'Shortland Street'."

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "Inside K Unit"
description: "Tours the new Mt Eden Corrections Facility, the country's first privately run prison. Describes the various facilities for the inmates. Asks if they have it too good with a tasteful decor, pool and table tennis tables, and no formal uniform. Details the contract the UK-based company Serco has signed with the Department of Corrections to manage the prison."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1871"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1871.  Chronicles the effects of a destructive windstorm in the city, 23 Dec 1871. Reprints the 'memorial addressed by the ladies of Dunedin and the neighborhood to the Council of the Otago University', 21 Jul 1871, published in the 12 Aug 1871 edition, seeking admission of ladies to classes at the university. Presents an extract from the first Passing Notes column, 7 Aug 1871, on the subject of immigrants to the city. Touches on other events during the year. 651 Dunedin AND/OR   651 Otago"

Author: "Macdonald, Finlay"
Title: "Modern masterpiece"
description: "Tours the new $121 million Auckland City Art Gallery, ahead of its September 3 2011 opening. Talks to Chris Saines, the Auckland City Art Gallery director, about the decade-long refurbishment project."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Integrity, beauty and strength"
description: "Showcases the Clydesdale Horse Society of NZ, which is celebrating its centenary with its annual general meeting and other commemorative events, Dunedin, Jun 2011. Informs that the first council meeting of the society was held in Dunedin in Jun 1911. Talks to the society president, vice president and secretary about their families' century-long association with horses."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Future's Glowing"
description: "Talks to the former Stewart Island fisher about the development of the merino clothing business he owns and operates with his English-born wife."

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "Voyage to the land of milk and honey"
description: "Talks to the Chinese businessman, who divides his time between mainland China, Hong Kong and a home in Auckland, about Natural Dairy's unsuccessful 2010 bid to buy the 16 Crafar farms currently in receivership and his relationship with the Hong Kong-listed, Cayman Islands-registered company. Explains how he 'facilitated' the relationship between Natural Dairy and his business connections in China. Backgrounds Chen's relationship with NZ."

Author: "Fallow, Brian"
Title: "Working across frontiers between agencies"
description: "Talks to the outgoing secretary to the Treasury about his eight-year tenure there. Mentions that he is about to take up a two-year stint as an executive director of the World Bank, Washington DC."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Fragrance director"
description: "Explains what a typical day is like for the fragrance director of Flairoma."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1872"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1872.  Criticises the Corporation of Dunedin for neglecting the city's drains, 1 Aug 1972. Reprints two matrimonial advertisements and a reply published in the 'Tuapeka Times', June 1872. Reports on the first journey of the steam engine 'Josephine' on 10 Sep 1872. Sums up reports from Mr W. H. Pearson to His Honour the Superintendent on suitable spots on Stewart Island for the location of immigrants from the Orkney, Shetland and Western Islands of Scotland.  Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "Mother stoic over infant's death"
description: "Mother stoic over infant's death"

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "RisqueÃÅ business"
description: "Looks at what happens when someone wears the wrong thing to work. Talks to image consultant Jill Wilkinson and to NZ's 'best dressed businessman' in 2010, PricewaterhouseCoopers senior analyst Ben Ford, about what constitutes appropriate work wear."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Selling the family slither; Words of caution"
description: "Highlights the debate over whether to allow commercial trading of  NZ's native species such as the jewelled gecko, tuatara and weka. Talks to Massey University wildlife ecologist Dr Brendan Moyle about his views that some native species could be commercialised to extinguish smuggling, as Australia has done for crocodile trading. Speaks to English reptile shop owner Paul Thomson about the value of the jewelled gecko, should NZ legalise commercial trading. Seeks comment from former Act NZ MP Gerrard Eckhoff, who raised the idea of commercialising native species in 2000. Speaks to Christchurch weka breeder Roger Beattie, who was planning to test the ban by selling or giving away Chatham Island weka at the Hokitika Wildfoods Festival, Mar 2011. Cites the views of Minister of Conservation Kate Wilkinson, the Dept of Conservation, independent herpetologist Dr Marieke Lettink, and Carey Knox of the University of Otago."

Author: "Borrowdale, James"
Title: "The beat goes on"
description: "Talks to Adam McGrath of the alt-country band 'The Eastern' and folk-blues musician Delaney Davidson about why the reopening of Lyttelton's 'The Wunderbar' music venue is an important step in the city's recovery after the earthquake."

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Author (detailed): "Gavin McLean, Charmian Smith and Oliver Riddell"
Title: "Quality Larnach novel long awaited; Women's magazines repositories of advice; Shining a light on long-serving PM"
description: "Quality Larnach novel long awaited; Women's magazines repositories of advice; Shining a light on long-serving PM"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "A universal language"
description: "Talks to Hiliako Iaheto, leader of the Dunedin-based roots-reggae band, about its win at the 2011 Polynesian Blue Pacific Music Awards, May 2011. Notes that they are the first Dunedin band to be nominated for the event."

Author: "Williams, Gina"
Title: "Over and over"
description: "Talks to '100 days of design' importer Emma Rogan about why so many of the participants have found it difficult to stay committed for the whole project, which allowed anyone to enter and do anything creative they liked as long as the action was repeated 100 times."

Author: "Miller, Isaac Hindin"
Title: "Off like a shot"
description: "Talks to the Greymouth-raised, former part owner of Caffe L'Affare and current president of the NZ Coffee Roasters Association about his career and his plans to introduce premium coffee to China, starting with the establishment of hole-in-the-wall espresso bars in Shanghai. Touches on his art collection."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Larger than life Onslow great featured in notable matches at Athletic Park"
description: "Larger than life Onslow great featured in notable matches at Athletic Park"

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "Accidental actor's resonant voice and skills charmed generations"
description: "Accidental actor's resonant voice and skills charmed generations"

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "Departing expert reflects on a long taxing career"
description: "Departing expert reflects on a long taxing career"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Activist threw energies into her many cherished causes"
description: "Activist threw energies into her many cherished causes"

Author: "Wall, Michael"
Title: "Innovative architect won awards, friends and admiration"
description: "Innovative architect won awards, friends and admiration"

Title: "Kiwi survived being shot down by Germans"
description: "Kiwi survived being shot down by Germans"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Author (detailed): "John Gibb, Sally Rae and Ellie Constantine"
Title: "[Queen's Birthday honours]"
description: "Reports on the regional recipients of Queen's Birthday honours, 2011. Profiles the University of Otago biochemist who has been made a Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit; the former meat industry executive who is now an Officer of the New Zealand Order of Merit; and five individuals who received Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit honours. Briefly profiles seven Queen's Service Medal recipients. Lists all honours recipients in NZ."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1873"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1873. Reports on the formal opening of the Dunedin to Port Chalmers railway, 31 Dec 1872. Chronicles proceedings at the formation of the Early Settlers' Association, which met on 21 Feb 1873. Compliments the design of the new immigration barracks at Caversham, 25 Jun 1983. Reports on a 2 Aug 1873 meeting of influential Dunedin citizens favouring the formation of a new insurance company, the National Fire and Marine Insurance Company of New Zealand. Describes the opening of the new First Church of Dunedin, 23 Nov 1873."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Flamboyant former hacker to settle in 'paradise' New Zealand"
description: "Flamboyant former hacker to settle in 'paradise' New Zealand"

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Can't be sheepish with this funeral"
description: "Can't be sheepish with this funeral"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Family's bid to honour Sophie"
description: "Talks to the murder victim's parents, Gil and Lesley Elliott, about the launch of their book (co-authored with Bill O'Brien) and foundation ('The Sophie Elliot Foundation'), which will attempt to help other young women and restore Sophie's reputation after her killer (Clayton Weatherston) claimed during the murder trial that he had been provoked into the killing. Notes that the book was launched on what would have been Sophie's 26th birthday."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1874"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1874. Focuses on the stranding of the ship 'Surat' near Catlin's River, reported on 5 Jan 1874. Mentions the graduation of Mr A. W. Williamson, the first recipient of a Baccalaurate (B. A.) degree from the University of Otago, 24 Jun 1874. Reports on 2 Dec 1874 that legalisation of trout fishing in NZ on 1 Dec 1874. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Next Top Model zooms in on heritage at Waitangi"
description: "Reviews the first episode from cycle three of the reality TV programme."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Yahoo!, better email tools"
description: "Talks to Yahoo! New Zealand general manager Laura Maxwell-Hansen about the new beta version of Yahoo! Mail, to be launched globally in Oct 2011. Notes the six best features of the new version."

Author: "Gifford, Adam"
Title: "Tribe's rebuilder returns to the land"
description: "Pays tribute to the NgaÃÑti Paoa leader who helped to reassert the mana of the tribe."

Author: "Knowsley, Jo"
Title: "The not so secret lives of us"
description: "Documents that NZers are increasingly concerned about protecting their privacy. Talks to Privacy Commissioner Marie Shroff about the rise in complaints to her office, the new technology making people's details available, and the two main issues that concern her. Informs of the ongoing review of the Privacy Act 1993, noting public concern about the inability to access information from authorities. Describes the amount of information a private investigator amassed about the author, in one hour."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Meat takes minor place in kids' luncheon"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Hutton's 'Ham & chicken flavoured luncheon chub', which cannot be called 'luncheon sausage' because it does not contain at least 50 per cent meat."

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Lost no longer, the NZ pilot 'known unto God'"
description: "Details the 30 years of research by Dutch group, Stichting Missing Airmen Memorial Foundation, of the crash of a Wellington R1397 in Friesland 25 July 1941. Informs that they verified the crash site, identified the crew and  located the bomber  pilots' grave. Backgrounds the career of one of the pilots, a NZer listed as missing by the RAF for 70 years. Talks to Lund family members about the research and the find. Quotes the 31 July 1941 issue of Dutch newspaper, the Leeuwarder Courant, which preserves the words spoken by a German army priest over the mens' grave. Talks to Foundation  treasurer Douwe Drijver."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Youth unemployment hits crisis point in the north"
description: "Looks at the unemployment situation in Northland, which has the country's worst jobless statistics."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Youth in holding pattern as recession bites north"
description: "Visits the region to gain an insight into its dire youth unemployment situation, with statistics showing that only 52.5 per cent of its 18 to 24-year-olds are in employment. Talks to a number of local youth about their struggle to find work."

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "How to make child's play of cooking"
description: "Ponders the effect of TV cooking shows on children's interest and ability to cook.  Suggests ways to motivate children to cook, noting useful cookbooks oriented toward children. Includes a recipe for Vegan Chocolate Cake."

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "To the lighthouse"
description: "Describes a drive through Awhitu Peninsula to the Manukau Heads Lighthouse. Informs of some of the history of the area, including the fate of the HMS Orpheus, and of guided tours available."

Author: "Stone, Andrew"
Title: "Revealing Cook's guiding star"
description: "Talks to the maritime historian and author about her new book 'Tupaia : the remarkable story of Captain Cook's Polynesian navigator', which tells the story of Tupaia, a Tahitian navigator, high priest, artist and translator, who sailed with Captain James Cook and helped to defuse the landmark encounter between MaÃÑori and the crew of the 'Endeavour' on 9 October 1769. Talks about his life and achievements."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Metiria Turei"
description: "Talks to the Green Party co-leader, who came to politics through the unemployment rights movement, about her 2009 co-leadership battle with Sue Bradford, the possibility of the Greens entering into a confidence and supply agreement with the National Party, her time in street theatre, and her family. Mentions that she is a political Green, not a lifestyle Green."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Something bold, something new"
description: "Looks at the 'Tuakana-Teina project', a double-bill theatre collaboration that celebrates MaÃÑori play writing. Talks to Michael Rewiri-Thorsen about his debut play 'Strong hands', which will be preformed with Albert Belz's 'Te awarua' at the Auckland Town Hall, 15-17 June 2011."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1875"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1875. Reports on a fire at the Victoria Brewery, 15 Jan 1875, and at the Princess Theatre, 3 Aug 1875. Chronicles the opening of the Clutha Railway on 2 Sep 1875, which was celebrated with a public holiday in the city. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Webster, Sally"
Title: "Those were the days, my friends"
description: "Talks to documentary maker Julie Benjamin about 'Transparencies: Huia's Foster Bay in the 1950s & 60s by Gladys Cunningham (1902-98)', which stemmed from her doctoral thesis on the visual culture of the slide photographs taken by her late grandmother. Notes that the exhibition is on at the Lopdell House Gallery (Auckland) until 26 June 2011."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Lurking in the crisper drawer; Best before... but still good later"
description: "Presents ideas for using leftovers and reducing food waste. Talks to Prof Phil Bremer of the University of Otago food sciences department about how to interpret 'best-before' dates on perishable food items."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Telling detail puts climate danger in focus"
description: "Reviews 'Climate' by Michael Hall at Whitespace until 18 June, 'Home/school' by Edith Amituanai at the Anna Miles Gallery until 28 June, 'Dominion Road: the shifting urbanscape' by four Chinese photographers (King Tong Ho, Linda Ai, Ivan Liang and Shunmei Deng) at the Artstation until 18 June, 'Forest and bird' by John Lyall, with drawings by Claudia Pond Eyley, along with 'Attempts' by Paul Cullen at the Jane Sanders Gallery until 25 June, and 'Fertile grounds' by Pamela Wolfe at the Artis Gallery until 25 June."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "A race close to the champion's heart"
description: "A race close to the champion's heart"

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "Dream job could be capped only by World Cup win"
description: "Dream job could be capped only by World Cup win"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1876"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1876. Chronicles the wreck at the end of Dec 1875 of the steamer 'Lady of the Lake' in the 1 Jan 1876 edition. Reports that Mr Edward McGlashan has built a paper mill in the Woodhaugh Valley 7 Feb 1876. Commemorates the formal opening of the first section of the Peninsula and Ocean Beach Railway, 26 Oct 1876. Describes the effects of a sustained rainstorm in the region, 24 Jun 1876. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Campbell, Bill"
Title: "Leader in push to re-establish trams"
description: "Leader in push to re-establish trams"

Author: "Gardner, Chris"
Title: "Planning pays off for top Waikato sharemilking duo"
description: "Planning pays off for top Waikato sharemilking duo"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Worthy legal professional experienced and learned"
description: "Worthy legal professional experienced and learned"

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "'Have I met you somewhere before?'"
description: "'Have I met you somewhere before?'"

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Wedding film adds to celebration"
description: "Wedding film adds to celebration"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Visitors inspire Adams"

Talks to the Christchurch-raised Mozart Fellow at the University of Otago about the Mozart Clarinet Concerto, as well as the world premiere of his own work, 'Symphonic dances'."

Title: "Destiny Church lay hands on Maori MPs"
description: "Discusses the recent meeting of Maori MPs with the Destiny Church and looks back on the reaction to the relationship Don Brash had over his dealings with the Exclusive Brethren."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "God bless the voters"
description: "Discusses the recent meeting of Maori MPs with the Destiny Church and looks back on the reaction to the relationship Don Brash had over his dealings with the Exclusive Brethren."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "Grand designs"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-born costume designer, who won an Academy Award (Oscar) for her work on 'The return of the king' instalment of 'The Lord of the rings', about her career, including wanting to be a newspaper journalist, publishing the 'Chacha' style magazine, working on Ron Tapert's 'Hercules' and 'Xena', and her current work on 'Green Lantern' and 'Mr Pip'."

Title: "Rookie Squires in line for tough test"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
