Touches on a popular excursion train trip from Dunedin to Middlemarch, reported on 11 May 1891. Includes a photograph of the Otago rugby team of 1891."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Exciting time for meat industry"
description: "Profiles the Oamaru-born chief executive of the meat company. Overviews his career in the primary sector."

Author: "Meadows, Richard"
Title: "Bodle's bent could make NZ the top banana"
description: "Bodle's bent could make NZ the top banana"

Author: "Watson, Debbie"
Title: "What I do, checkout operator"
description: "Profiles checkout operator and supervisor at Te Awamutu's Pak'nSave and describes her routine as she progresses through the day."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Survivors of the exodus"
description: "Describes how life has been for Christchurch families who moved to Auckland following the 2010-2011 earthquakes, talking to Brian Haybittle who resettled his family to the North Shore. Estimates the net loss of population from Christchurch, providing a breakdown of numbers for different groups: school children, international and language students, university students, rest home residents, Housing NZ tenants, beneficiaries and superannuitants. Also gives figures and destinations for Christchurch residents who left NZ. Forecasts the numbers expected to move to Christchurch to participate in rebuilding the city."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Paralysed boxer tells his tragic story of hurt and helplessness; The communication gap; Mum fights to ensure a future"
description: "Explores the issue of protecting vulnerable disabled people when they are in the care of professionals paid to look after them. Communicates with tetraplegic boxer Peter Williams about abuse by a caregiver. Asks his wife Charmeyne Te Nana-Williams why she felt compelled to set up the What Ever It Takes Trust that provides a home-based model of caring. Talks to Complex Carers NZ chairwoman Jan Moss about the abuse of her Lennox Gastaut syndrome daughter Becky while in respite care. Documents other cases of disabled people injured while in institutional care. Notes the effect of many disabled persons living into adulthood due to medication.  Provides statistics for the numbers, cost, gender and pay of carers in NZ. Cites comments by Detective Sergeant Megan Goldie about the suspected underreporting of the sexual abuse of people with disabilities because of communication difficulties."

Author: "Colbert, Roy"
Title: "Brand new chapter"
description: "Describes how as a child he was a prolific reader but for some reason stopped and changed his attention to music as a teenager. Indicates being unable to read later because of a cataract and diabetic retinopathy, then rediscovering reading again after a cataract operation. Comments on the competition between Kindle Ebooks and the traditional paper book for the reader's attention."

Author: "Kamm, Rebecca"
Title: "Caught in the net"
description: "Indicates the power of the World Wide Web in the activity of social-media brand bashing whether good or bad and the ease with which people are able to inflict significant damage. Illustrates with several examples where the complainant uses the Internet to broadcast their views and how quickly it can escalate."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Music man"
description: "Talks to Ray Columbus about his newly released book and what it reveals about his personal life, career and the sort of upbringing he had as a child. Includes an extract of book 'Ray Columbus : the modfather'."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "A 20-year battle for custody"
description: "Anticipates Waitangi Tribunal recommendations for the Wai 262 Treaty of Waitangi claim lodged by six tribes in 1991 that seeks rights around indigenous flora and fauna and other taonga (treasures), such as traditional knowledge and intellectual property rights. Notes that only one of the original claimants is still alive. Lists examples of inappropriate use of MaÃÑori culture, flora and fauna. Cites comments by Moriori lawyer Maui Solomon about the MaÃÑori desire for people to understand the concepts of whakapapa (genealogy) and kaitiakitanga (guardianship). Considers the haka as a success story in this respect."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "Travelling taonga"
description: "Reports on the first ever exhibition of MaÃÑori artefacts (Te Ao MaÃÑori ) to opening in China on July 21 with an expected half million visitors in the biggest exhibition hall in the Shanghai Museum. Indicates the artefacts have been sourced from the Otago Museum and details how they selected the exhibits and what messages they wanted to create about MaÃÑori and their culture to the Chinese people."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Ray Avery"
description: "Interviews the UK-born scientific researcher about his streetkid past, his young family, his ability to charm people out of money, and his latest project. Asks how he feels to have been voted Most Trusted New Zealander."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Plenty of wit but unexpected depths too"
description: "Reviews 'Tenei au, tenei au' (This is me, this is me) by Kura Te Waru Rewiri and 'State-Space' by Caryline Boreham at Corban Arts Centre, to 17 Jul; the Glaister Ennor Art Awards at Orexart, to 25 Jun; 'Word' at the Gow Langsford Gallery, to 25 Jun; and 'Works' by Scott Eady at Wallace Arts Trust, to 17 Jul."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "'Someone will make money ... it might as well be me'"
description: "Talks to Matt Bowden (aka Starboy) about his involvement in the trade of what has been described as 'legal highs'.  Discusses the controversy surrounding the sale of 'Kronic', one brand of the 50 or so similar products on sale at present. Explains the nature of the Starboy image along with his career as a drug dealer and his lobbying for drug law reform."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "In-depth look at Britain's taonga Maori"
description: "In-depth look at Britain's taonga Maori"

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "US tour means Indian Ink's cup runneth over"
description: "Previews the Auckland staging of the latest work by the 15 year old Indian Ink theatre company, Maidment Theatre, 28 Jun to 16 Jul. Informs of the company's upcoming American tour, Aug-Nov 2011."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Cultural capitals forge ties that bind"
description: "Spotlights the NZ acts that will feature in the City of London Festival, 26 Jun to 16 Jul. Talks to festival director Ian Ritchie about his family connections to NZ. Discusses his selection of NZ acts which include the Royal New Zealand Ballet, the London MaÃÑori  group Ngati Ranana and pianist Stephen de Pledge."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Believe it or not"
description: "Discusses unorthodox faith systems with three Aucklanders. Talks to a woman who felt drawn to become a Druid after reading a book belonging to her father; a woman who adopted New Age beliefs after a divorce, cancer and the death of her fiance; and a woman who works as a crystal spiritualist."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Orchestral manoeuvres"
description: "Describes the experience of the photographer who knew nothing about orchestral music as she accompanied the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra on a recent overseas tour. Reports on the strategies she had to employ to and also on the reception the orchestra received."

Author: "Green, Paula,"
Title: "The choice between life and music"
description: "The choice between life and music"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Playing a wider field"
description: "Examines the proliferation of the number of sports played at a number of secondary schools along with the traditional emphasis on rugby and cricket and having good first XV and first XI teams. Argues it is better to cater for more sports in order to attract a greater number of pupils to become involved in physical activity. Contends that with pupils becoming involved in sports it helps in other areas of the pupil's life, particularly helps them improve their engagement in the education process. Talks to and canvasses the views of two directors of sport at two secondary schools, namely Mick Watson of Rangitoto College and John Hornal of Wellington College. Includes the example of Gordon Murie and how he managed to gain a US athletic scholarship."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "The time of our lives"
description: "Profiles Briony Ellis whose job it is to ensure visitors to the rugby world cup will have a positive NZ experience from September 9 through to October 23. Indicates she is helping a government appointed committee decide where to put $9.48 million from the Lottery Grants Board. Backgrounds her career in events management and describes her 'quintessential NZ experience'."

Author: "Berry, Michael"
Title: "Express GM retires but keeps the faith"
description: "Express GM retires but keeps the faith"

Author: "Wong, Simon"
Title: "Ralph still growing strong at 95 years old"
description: "Ralph still growing strong at 95 years old"

Author: "Butterfield, Tania"
Title: "Honour surprises biosecurity leader"
description: "Honour surprises biosecurity leader"

Title: "Rowing, wine enthusiast humbled to be on list"
description: "Rowing, wine enthusiast humbled to be on list"

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Active in the military and education fields"
description: "Talks to the departing chief executive of the polytechnic, who also served briefly as Director of Telford division, Lincoln University. Overviews his training and career, which included a stint as a high-ranking officer in the British military."

Author: "Berry, Michael"
Title: "Not taking the honour personally"
description: "Not taking the honour personally"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Cameraman clicks with the animals"
description: "Talks to the local resident who is one of the foremost natural history cameramen in the world. Discusses his career progression and his decision to set up the company Wildfilm New Zealand with his wife, sound recordist Christine Brown."

Author: "Conway, Matt"
Title: "Red cards at the ready"
description: "Reports on the key messages imparted to the Dunedin business community to brief them on rules governing marketing to patrons of the upcoming Rugby World Cup (RWC). Seeks comment from businesspeople and Dunedin City Council RWC co-ordinator Debra Simes about the legal obligations under the provisions of the Major Events Management Act 2007 (MEMA). Covers some of the main concerns, such as guerrilla or ambush marketing, and touches on some of the lessons learned from overseas experience that are incorporated into the MEMA."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "From the bottom up; Benefits of going back to community living"
description: "Talks to the Associate Professor at the University of Otago school of social work and community development about some of the issues with which he has been involved over the past 45 years, including child and family poverty and other social problems. Comments on work being done in communities to address social problems and bring about social change. Provides facts about his career. Speaks to Family Works community development team leader Melanie McNatty, one of his former students, about some of the grassroots initiatives in Northeast Valley, Dunedin."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1890"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1890. Comments in the 11 Apr 1890 edition on a letter published on 9 Apr 1890, concerning the danger posed by high sea levels to the Forbury flat area. Announces that the Sweating Commissioners have revised and adopted their draft report, 6 May 1890. Reports on the success of the New Zealand and South Seas Exhibition held during 1889 and 1890, which closed that day, 19 Apr 1890, and includes a photo of the construction of the venue. Mentions the commencement of malt vinegar production by aerated water and cordial manufacturers Messrs Thomson and Co, 3 Jun 1890. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Williams, Ian,"
Title: "Legal proceedings add to trauma"
description: "Legal proceedings add to trauma"

Title: "Still quite a lot to talk about"
description: "Interviews the speech communication teacher about her educational background and other aspects of her work, including changes to the job over the past 25 years."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1892"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1892. Reports on a visit by Native Minister Hon A. J. Cadman to Otakou on 8 Dec 1892 to discuss land claims with MaÃÑori. Describes a fire that gutted Cargill's Castle on 27 Feb 1892, and includes a more recent photo. Gives an account of a lecture by famous African explorer Mr H. M. Stanley, who arrived in Dunedin on 1 Feb 1892. Comments on varying reports about the severity of recent rainstorms on the region, 9 Feb 1892. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "It's law of the wild on the web"
description: "Talks to Yuval Ben-Itzhak, international technology officer for Internet and mobile security provider AVG, about new security threats on the Internet. Focuses on work being done to combat improvements to malware."

Author: "Yska, Redmer"
Title: "The tour files"
description: "Presents a chronological examination of previously classified police files to reveal the inside police view of the 56 day 1981 Springbok rugby tour. Describes the actions of the police and the protesters. Talks about the planning for the expected protests, the role of Police Commissioner Bob Walton, and the events that led to the cancellation of the game between Waikato and South Africa at Hamilton's Rugby Park on 25 July 1981. Looks at what the files reveal about the nature of the information that convinced police that Pat McQuarrie's plan to fly his plane into the grandstand at Rugby Park was a serious threat."

Author: "Yska, Redmer"
Title: "Springbok 1981 : the inside story"
description: "Presents a chronological examination of previously classified police files to reveal the inside police view of the 56 day 1981 Springbok rugby tour. Describes the actions of the police and the protesters. Talks about the planning for the expected protests, the role of Police Commissioner Bob Walton, and the events that led to the cancellation of the game between Waikato and South Africa at Hamilton's Rugby Park on 25 July 1981. Looks at what the files reveal about the nature of the information that convinced police that Pat McQuarrie's plan to fly his plane into the grandstand at Rugby Park was a serious threat."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Roger Porsolt"
description: "Profiles the Auckland-raised, Saint-Cloud-based pharmacological contract research company president who has recently been appointed adjunct professor of pharmacology at the University of Texas, San Antonio. Talks about his career. Notes that he is the son of architect Imric (Imi) Porsolt."

Author: "Riordan, Peter,"
Title: "Two wings of a nightingale by Jill Worrall"
description: "Two wings of a nightingale by Jill Worrall"

Author: "McCrystal, John"
Title: "Tara Arctic : a New Zealander's Epic Voyage by Grant Redvers"
description: "Tara Arctic : a New Zealander's Epic Voyage by Grant Redvers"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1893"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1893. Reports in the 12 Jun 1893 edition on the heaviest snowstorm yet recorded in the city. Comments on complaints from Canterbury farmers about the prevalence of sheep-stealing and stack-burning, 23 Feb 1893. Cites a report from the 'Lyttelton Times' about the sighting of icebergs over the past six weeks due to exceptionally cold temperatures and wind, as noted in the 10 Jan 1893 edition. Publishes an account in the 11 Jan 1893 edition from Melburnian Dr T. P. McInerney, who describes his involvement in a search party at Lake Te Anau and Milford Sound in a fruitless search for explorer Mr Quintin McKinnon, missing since 29 Nov 1892, as reported on 11 Jan 1893. Includes a photo of foresters felling a rimu tree in the Leith Valley during the 1890s."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Going gentle into that good night"
description: "Focuses on the normalising of conversations about end-of-life care for terminally ill patients. Looks at the importance of terminally ill patients planning for their future care, and death, while they are still able to articulate their wishes. Speaks to Dr Barry Snow, a neurologist and head of adult medicine at Auckland Hospital, about 'Advanced Care Planning', a new initiative for end-of-life care being introduced at a number of district health boards, Professor Rod MacDonald, director of palliative care at North Shore Hospital, about the findings of a recent survey into public perceptions of death and dying and of hospice and palliative care, and Hospice NZ chief executive officer Mary Schumacher about kick-starting a conversation about end-of-life care within the community and the 'good death' of her mother. Relates the experience of terminally ill cancer patient Russell Bradford. Talks about the three-year pilot project being run by Te Korowai Hauora o Hauraki, a tribally based MaÃÑori healthcare organisation, that aims to provide end-of-life care to MaÃÑori in their homes."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "End-of-life care"
description: "Focuses on the normalising of conversations about end-of-life care for terminally ill patients. Looks at the importance of terminally ill patients planning for their future care, and death, while they are still able to articulate their wishes. Speaks to Dr Barry Snow, a neurologist and head of adult medicine at Auckland Hospital, about 'Advanced Care Planning', a new initiative for end-of-life care being introduced at a number of district health boards, Professor Rod MacDonald, director of palliative care at North Shore Hospital, about the findings of a recent survey into public perceptions of death and dying and of hospice and palliative care, and Hospice NZ chief executive officer Mary Schumacher about kick-starting a conversation about end-of-life care within the community and the 'good death' of her mother. Relates the experience of terminally ill cancer patient Russell Bradford. Talks about the three-year pilot project being run by Te Korowai Hauora o Hauraki, a tribally based MaÃÑori healthcare organisation, that aims to provide end-of-life care to MaÃÑori in their homes."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Hard yards"
description: "Looks at the circumstances of three households, Brian Frisken's from Bexley, Tim Stephenson's from Kairaki Beach and Steve and Marie Davies' from Kaiapoi, after the Government announced its package for Canterbury homeowners with earthquake damaged land."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "The plight of Canterbury homeowners"
description: "Looks at the circumstances of three households, Brian Frisken's from Bexley, Tim Stephenson's from Kairaki Beach and Steve and Marie Davies' from Kaiapoi, after the Government announced its package for Canterbury homeowners with earthquake damaged land."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Taking a walk on the wild side"
description: "Accompanies the former army chef, now a successful restaurateur and author, on a walk through the Orokonui Sanctuary. Identifies, explains and demonstrates the use of medicinal plants and other traditional crops used by MaÃÑori. Includes a recipe for pikopiko takakau that he cooked on the day, and a recipe for kawakawa shortbread from his book."

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "New Zealand history books : 9 July"
description: "New Zealand history books : 9 July"

Author: "Amery, Mark"
Title: "Just what the doctor ordered"
description: "Speaks to the former GP (general practitioner) about his Whanganui photography gallery. Talks about why the town suits a photography gallery and the impact of the digital form on the medium."

Author: "Amery, Mark"
Title: "McNamara Gallery"
description: "Speaks to the former GP (general practitioner) about his Whanganui photography gallery. Talks about why the town suits a photography gallery and the impact of the digital form on the medium."

Author: "Wilkins, Alice"
Title: "Gamut of emotions in film-making frenzy; School shows again it can talk the talk; St Peter's pupils ensure Sudan's voice heard"
description: "Features contributions from two Year 13 pupils at St Peter's College, Gore. Gives an account of her participation with a friend in the V48 Hours Furious Filmmaking Competition, Dunedin, starting on 20 May 2011. Reports on the Annual Bishop's Shield public speaking competition for Otago and Southland students from Catholic schools, Verdon College, Invercargill, 8-10 Apr 2011. Describes the participation of a team of four Year 13 pupils from the college at the Otago/Southland regional Model United Nations Association (MUNA) competition, Logan Park High School, Dunedin, 7-8 May 2011. Informs that the team represented the viewpoint of Sudan in a series of debates."

Title: "Passion for Manawatu rewarded with honour"
description: "Passion for Manawatu rewarded with honour"

Author: "Weir, James"
Title: "Honour for 'grand old man of insurance business'"
description: "Honour for 'grand old man of insurance business'"

Author: "Torrie, Bronwyn"
Title: "Nun's faith in humanity still strong after years behind bars as a chaplain"
description: "Nun's faith in humanity still strong after years behind bars as a chaplain"

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Toddling into sunset not for Maraeroa couple"
description: "Toddling into sunset not for Maraeroa couple"

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Harbour Cone prospects"
description: "Details the possibilities being examined in the draft management plan for the publicly-owned block of property at Hereweka/Harbour Cone. Informs that the plan has been developed after extensive community consultation, and will soon go out for further public consultation."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "The city's hope on his shoulders"
description: "The city's hope on his shoulders"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Not dying for a puff"
description: "Speaks to Brent Caldwell, research fellow at the University of Otago, who is researching new forms and methods of nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) about the need for cigarette alternatives, such as e-cigarettes, to be more widely available."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Te Punga fostered NZ's probation service"
description: "Te Punga fostered NZ's probation service"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Nicotine replacement therapy"
description: "Speaks to Brent Caldwell, research fellow at the University of Otago, who is researching new forms and methods of nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) about the need for cigarette alternatives, such as e-cigarettes, to be more widely available."

Author: "West, Ian"
Title: "Academic pushed boundaries in science and art"
description: "Academic pushed boundaries in science and art"

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Making waves"
description: "Looks at whether microwave cooking has a detrimental effect on food."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Are microwaves safe?"
description: "Looks at whether microwave cooking has a detrimental effect on food."

Author: "Campbell, Phil"
Title: "Legendary pilot had a deadly eye for shooting down Zeros"
description: "Legendary pilot had a deadly eye for shooting down Zeros"

Author: "Shouler, Ingrid"
Title: "A writer defined by Scandinavian heritage"
description: "A writer defined by Scandinavian heritage"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "The dealing's done for singer known as Kenny the Busker"
description: "The dealing's done for singer known as Kenny the Busker"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1894"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1894. Reports on the results of a 21 Mar 1894 poll in the City of Dunedin district taken under the provisions of the Alcoholic Liquors Sale Control Act, to gauge support for the election of liquor licensing committees and for the 'continuance, reduction, or total prohibition of the existing licences', 22 Mar 1894. Publishes the text of a letter to the editor decrying the unkempt state and vandalism of tourist huts at the Sutherland Falls, 24 Jan 1894. Announces that the 14 Aug 1894 edition has been printed on the 'newest and most improved' rotary press, manufactured by Messrs Hoe and Co. Includes a photograph of volunteers at the Saddle Battery 7-inch gun practice, Port Chalmers, 1890s. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Left, right centre stage"
description: "Talks to Dunedin-raised director Patrick Davies about the upcoming production of the satire 'The Tutor' by Dave Armstrong, Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, 8-30 Jul 2011. Mentions some of the other plays that he will be directing during the year."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "To bee or not to bee"
description: "Looks at whether NZ can avoid colony collapse disorder (CCD). Speaks to Mark Goodwin, a bee specialist at Plant & Food Research, about the vital pollination role of the European honey bee (Apis mellifera). Touches on the impact of the varroa mite."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Colony collapse disorder : New Zealand under threat?"
description: "Looks at whether NZ can avoid colony collapse disorder (CCD). Speaks to Mark Goodwin, a bee specialist at Plant & Food Research, about the vital pollination role of the European honey bee (Apis mellifera). Touches on the impact of the varroa mite."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews a collection of antique watches and paintings by Bruce Hodgson, Tony Williams Workshop and Gallery, Dunedin, until 8 Jul 2011.  Reviews 'Eye of the ancestor' by Steev Peyroux and Nick Dryden, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Mitre' by Nigel Brown, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 20 Jul 2011."

Author: "Cooper, Michael,"
Title: "Storm in a wine glass"
description: "Looks at why a number of Australian wine shows, including the Royal Hobart Wine Show, no longer accept entries from NZ."

Author: "Cooper, Michael,"
Title: "Kiwi winemakers shut out of Australia"
description: "Looks at why a number of Australian wine shows, including the Royal Hobart Wine Show, no longer accept entries from NZ."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Blanc walls"
description: "Focuses on the vertical garden system patented by Frenchman Patrick Blanc. Takes inspiration for the home garden."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Vertical gardens in the home"
description: "Focuses on the vertical garden system patented by Frenchman Patrick Blanc. Takes inspiration for the home garden."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Colorectal cancer and your diet"
description: "Uncovers some statistics about colorectal cancer in NZ and recent research findings from the World Cancer Research Fund (WCRF) 2007 report. Suggests some dietary changes that can help prevent the risk of getting colorectal cancer."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "High street retailers suffering"
description: "Looks at recent trends in retail spending in NZ. Finds out the changing ways consumers are shopping and spending and the reasons behind these. Shop owners disclose how the recession and online shopping has affected sales."

Author: "Else, Anne"
Title: "Letters to Grace by Jean Garner and Kate Foster"
description: "Letters to Grace by Jean Garner and Kate Foster"

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "The Silence Beyond: selected writings by Michael King"
description: "The Silence Beyond: selected writings by Michael King"

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "John Hartstone's revolutionary dairy invention"
description: "Talks to Otorohanga Dairy Farmer John Hartstone and son, Tony. Tells the story of how he invented a meter that can accurately measure a cow's milk production and how this has revolutionised dairy farming all over the world."

Author: "Millen, Julia"
Title: "No simple passage by Jenny Robin Jones"
description: "No simple passage by Jenny Robin Jones"

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Why the hold-up on CO2 emissions?"
description: "Discusses why it's taking so long to do something serious about NZ's carbon emissions. Reveals some recent research on climate change."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Christchurch is struck again"
description: "Describes how the relentlessness of the Christchurch earthquakes and the frustration of waiting for insurance companies to make decisions are taking its toll on the residents there."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Our teen drinking culture"
description: "Asks teenagers in Wellington in school years 12 and 13 about their drinking habits. Discloses some facts from last year's Law Commission report about changes in teenage drinking behaviour. Ascertains some of the influences attributing to many teenagers deciding to drink excessively."

Author: "Vance, Matt"
Title: "A slow march"
description: "Recalls a visit to Ernest Shackleton's hut at Cape Royds. Talks about watching an AdeÃÅlie penguin head away from the open sea and head south towards the Transantarctic Mountains and almost certain death."

Author: "Vance, Matt"
Title: "Antarctic penguins choose certain death"
description: "Recalls a visit to Ernest Shackleton's hut at Cape Royds. Talks about watching an AdeÃÅlie penguin head away from the open sea and head south towards the Transantarctic Mountains and almost certain death."

Author: "Marshall, Jonathan"
Title: "Asset-rich beneficiary sparks probe"
description: "Asset-rich beneficiary sparks probe"

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "The bull in the assets to China shop - portfolio theory"
description: "Emphasises the need for the NZ sharemarket to retain ownership of the major power generators (Meridian, Genesis Energy, Mighty River Power, and Solid Energy). Discusses the possible use by the New Zealand Exchange of restricted and tracking shares as two options. Argues against the argument of the NZ Superannuation Fund not to invest more in NZ. Notes the strategy of China to limit sales to, and investments by, nonChinese."

Author: "De Lacy, Hugh"
Title: "Telco price war still on hold; The battle for lower rates; UFB roll-out under way"
description: "Investigates why mobile phone charges have not fallen despite the Commerce Commission cutting termination fees. Explains how mobile termination fees work. Gauges the effect of the increasing number of mobile virtual network operators (MVNO), predicting a more competitive telecommunications industry eventuating. Notes the issues surrounding the fixed line market, forecasting what will happen to the Telecom monopoly. Chronicles the decision process of the Commerce Commission in cutting termination rates. Previews the Government's implementation of an ultrafast broadband service."

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "Pilgrims flock to see long-dead French bishop"
description: "Pilgrims flock to see long-dead French bishop"

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Greens no longer one-trick pony"
description: "Overviews the increased emphasis of the Green Party in the run up to the 2011 election. Looks at the Party's social and economic policies and how it is positioning itself in respect to the policies of the National Party. Briefly considers the increased limitations that political parties are placing on access to party meetings."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Prostitution curbs targeted"
description: "Previews a submission by the Auckland Council later in 2011 on the Regulation of Prostitution in Specified Places Bill promoted by the Manukau City Council in Sep 2010. Informs of the ongoing select committee inquiry into boarding houses in tandem with the enactment of the Residential Tenancies Amendment Act in 2010."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "Crisis management"
description: "Explores this new field of enterprise, listing three common elements that contribute to a crisis. Looks at how the crises of Arnold Schwarzenegger and BP were managed. Considers also the system of risk management (risk assessment). Advises how companies should implement these two systems."

Author: "Hinton, Marc"
Title: "The Lochore legacy"
description: "Talks to the former All Blacks coach about his 1987 Rugby World Cup-winning team and the chances of the 2011 World Cup team."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Discount pricing"
description: "Examines the effect on markets of small changes in wine prices. Looks at the pricing strategies of Pernod Ricard and Indevin, noting which wine markets are growing. Summarises the effect of discount pricing on the wine industry."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Caution in most residential markets; More earthquake fallout"
description: "Advises of the prevailing mood reflected in sales volumes and prices in the residential real estate market, drawing on a joint BNZ and Real Estate Institute survey of licensed real estate agents nationwide.  Gauges the effect on insurance of the latest 13 Jun earthquake in Christchurch. Looks at the issue of what makes a building 'untenable', focusing on attempts by FM Custodians to cancel leases held by GP 96."

Title: "Freight forwarders pay cartel penalty"
description: "Summarises the Auckland High Court decision and penalties on three international freight forwarding companies (Bax, Schenker, Panalpina) for breaches of the Commerce Act. Backgrounds the operation of and agreements in the air freight forwarding industry."

Author: "Plumb, Simon"
Title: "NZ sport heroes risk dope shame; The phantom menace for top athletes; Australians extremely wary of sprinkles on top of the performance cake; Academy staff using deal to get subsidised supplements"
description: "Investigates whether NZ's elite athletes are being exposed to doping risks because of the way the NZ Academy of Sport (NZAS) is managing its Integria Healthcare sponsored supplements programme. Speaks to Dr Stephen Stannard, head of Massey University's School of Sport and Exercise, about his doping concerns. Reveals that athletes have been able to order hormonal and metabolic-altering supplements, which potentially contain substances that are on the World Anti-Doping Authority's (Wada) banned list, through the NZAS. Interviews NZAS North Island chief executive Peter Pfitzinger about the controversial programme. Speaks to Dr Louise Burke, head of the Australian Institute of Sport's (AIS) nutrition programme, about the AIS's endorsed supplement programme, which differs significantly from the NZAS's. Looks into the use of the Integria Healthcare supplements deal by NZAC staff to obtain subsidised supplements for personal use."

Author: "Reid, Nicholas,"
Title: "History through a new lens"
description: "Reviews 'New Zealand film: an illustrated history', edited by Diane Pivac with Frank Stark and Lawrence McDonald."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Little success with challenges to loan transactions"
description: "Summarises and comments on Levin and another v Rastkar [2011] NZCA 210, examining the question of whether a loan is a voidable transaction. Focuses on Section 292 of the Companies Act 2003 and its treatment of  voidable transactions and insolvent transactions."

Author: "Walker, Angela"
Title: "Date with a plate"
description: "Takes a culinary tour of the city to highlight some of the places and people involved in 2011's 'Wellington on a plate' festival."

Author: "Street, Daniel"
Title: "Watch your discovery obligations with documents"
description: "Backgrounds a recent US appeal court decision in which a firm destroyed documents unhelpful to its case. Warns NZ businesses that their discovery obligations may arise earlier than thought, advising the need for robust systems."

Author: "Townsend, Sarah"
Title: "Employment case sets new benchmark"
description: "Highlights an Employment Court decision in the case of Massey University v Wrigley. Advises of the impact on an employer's ability to withhold information, during restructuring and disciplinary processes, on the basis that it is sensitive or confidential."

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Court allows lovelorn teen to swim again"
description: "Court allows lovelorn teen to swim again"

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Drugs - the latest accessories for afterballs"
description: "Discusses drinking and drug taking behaviour at functions following annual high school balls, called the afterball or pre-afterball. Talks to Cade Pellett about security, alcohol and entertainment at the events organised by the company Afterglo he works for. Describes briefly afterball incidents from 2003 that involve high school students."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Selling God"
description: "Investigates the rise of religion as entertainment. Looks into the trend of young Christian churchgoers moving away from traditional worship and towards newer evangelical groups. Speaks to Stephen Garner, theology lecturer at the University of Auckland, and Kevin Ward, theology lecturer at Dunedin's Knox College and a Baptist preacher, about the marketing of the new churches and the rise of a new 'post-denominational' generation of worshipers who see themselves as merely Christian. Relates the experience of attending American revivalist preacher Greg Laurie's event, hosted by Harvest Church, at Auckland's Vector Arena. Talks to modernising church attendees about the trend."

Author: "Vance, Andrea"
Title: "A force to be reckoned with"
description: "Talks to the new Deputy Commissioner of Police about his career and some of his cases, including the kidnapping of Xin Xin Ma in 2008 and working as the NZ Police liaison officer in Bangkok at the time of the Boxing Day Tsunami in 2004."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "The roar deal of women"
description: "Examines gender equality and pay equity in the wake of comments by Employers and Manufacturers Association chief executive Alasdair Thompson about women's relative lack of productivity. Backgrounds the emergence of feminism. Talks to psychologist Verity Thom and union worker about entrenched inequalities and attitudes to women in the paid labour force. Talks to young feminists Nicole Skews (Wellington Young Feminist Collective) and Alana Marie Chang (Women's Rights Officer, Auckland University) about younger women's views of feminism and their desire for public safety. Interviews three women in their 20s, 40s, and 90s about their life choices and attitudes they have encountered. Includes side bar 'The long road', tracing the roots of feminism and women's rights."

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Hoping to advance Australia fair"
description: "Speaks to Auckland NZers about why they have moved or are planning to move with their families to Australia. Talks to Emma Rahui, Nicola O'Reilly, Chris Birch, and Sean Sweeney."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "Game on"
description: "Sets the political scene for the 2011 parliamentary elections. Talks to Victoria University of Wellington political scientist Jon Johansson, broadcaster Willie Jackson and Otago University political scientist Bryce Edwards about the position of the main parties."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "To catch a tagger"
description: "Meets the Hastings District Council's environment enhancement officer who helped track down one of NZ's most prolific graffiti vandals. Talks about how the tagger was caught and the council's graffiti vandalism strategy. Speaks to the vandal who faces a reparation bill of more than $100,000 after admitting to more than 500 tags."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Publican"
description: "Talks about running Westport's Cosmopolitan Hotel, which has been in the publican's family for four generations."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Golden boy"
description: "Interviews the TV3 news anchorman and '60 minutes' host about his childhood and career. Speaks to his mother, Lynda Wilkinson, about her eldest son. Talks about his relationship with his parents and reporting on devastating events."

Author: "Walker, James"
Title: "Beyond words"
description: "Muses about the use of text messages to conduct romantic relationships. Talks about the use of emoticons and waiting for a reply."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Visions of Avon's future"
description: "Looks at the argument to turn the city's earthquake devastated eastern residential areas around the Avon River into a park. Speaks to freelance writer Ashley Campbell about her idea for an 'Avon River Park' and to landscape architect Di Lucas about her approach to the idea. Talks about the social media debate it has inspired and the negative response from Earthquake Recovery minister Gerry Brownlee to the plans."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "A rattle along for Ngai Tahu's legacy"
description: "Focuses on the growing involvement of NgaÃÑi Tahu in the affairs of Canterbury. Reports that, with the scale of rebuilding being demanded in response to the Canterbury earthquakes, NgaÃÑi Tahu is set to become an even greater influence. Suggests that it is making some people nervous. Speaks to NgaÃÑi Tahu's kaiwhakahaere (tribe chairman) Mark Solomon about why forging a bicultural identity is important for the future of the region and the country as a whole, pointing out that demographic figures suggest NZ's future is 'increasingly brown'. Talks about the internal battles within its tribal ruling body Te RuÃÑnanga o NgaÃÑi Tahu (Tront) and its commercial operation NgaÃÑi Tahu Holdings. Looks at how NgaÃÑi Tahu is using its 1998 $170 million Treaty of Waitangi settlement to give its people a hand up, not a hand out, and how it has been driving the national agenda through pressure groups like the Iwi Leaders Forum, which represents the views of 57 iwi to Government. Speaks to Sacha McMeeking, the tribe's general manager of strategy and influence, about the letdown MaÃÑori are feeling over the way the Treaty of Waitangi has gone."

Author: "Sargent, Ewan"
Title: "Unleashing the water race"
description: "Looks back to 1968 to discover how the oldest deep bore farming irrigation pipe in Canterbury helped transform the region's land and economy. Talks to retired Pendarves farmer Brian Cameron about the bore, which struck water at 70 meters in December 1968, and the miraculous transformation of his farm. Visits the farm to discover if the pipe is still operational."

Author: "McManus, Jenni"
Title: "The state of the nation"
description: "Uncovers the top six issues for business in the lead-up to the 2011 parliamentary election. Talks to 40 unnamed businesspeople and sector leaders about how they rate the Government's performance during the past three years."

Author: "Hooton, Amanda"
Title: "After Everest"
description: "Joins Peter Hillary, son of Sir Edmund Hillary, for a trek through the Himalayas as part of the Australian Himalayan Foundation's (AHF) inaugural 'Chairman's trek'. Talks about the work of the AHF, which aims to support the people of the Himalayas through education, health and environmental programmes, the desire to conquer mountains, Sir Edmond Hillary's humanitarian work in Nepal, the death of Peter Hillary's mother, Louise, and teenage sister, Belinda, in an airplane crash in 1975, and Peter's strained relationship with his father's original NZ-based Himalayan Trust."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Dick Quax"
description: "Talks to the world champion runner turned Auckland city councillor about his political views, running, his Dutch heritage, and his moustache."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Baby's funeral on hold for police inquiry"
description: "Baby's funeral on hold for police inquiry"

Author: "Agnew, Margaret"
Title: "Romancing the paranormal"
description: "Speaks to the award-winning supernatural/paranormal romance writer about her international success, the stigma attached to romance novels, and her working style and inspiration. Talks about why her work is classified as 'international' fiction in NZ. Mentions her use of social media."

Author: "Gorman, Paul,"
Title: "Let it snow, let it snow, let it snow"
description: "Recalls childhood memories of British winters. Compares winters in Britain, Christchurch, Wellington and Dunedin. Pines for snow."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "NZ's honourable masterchef - it's Dame Alison Holst"
description: "NZ's honourable masterchef - it's Dame Alison Holst"

Author: "Morris, Bruce"
Title: "Leak crisis will hit every pocket"
description: "Informs of changes in council rating values of houses with monolithic cladding because of buyers perceiving them as linked to leaky homes. Notes the changes will take effect in Auckland this year. Speaks to homeowners and industry commentators about the effect of buyer resistance on the sale of Mediterranean style houses."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Michael Hill ... knight ; Michael Hill ... knight, and man with a mission"
description: "Michael Hill ... knight ; Michael Hill ... knight, and man with a mission"

Title: "Neck break no hurdle for glam jockey Laura"
description: "Neck break no hurdle for glam jockey Laura"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Insider art"
description: "Visits 'Gesamtkunsthandwerk', a collaborative installation of handcrafted interior objects by artist Francis Upritchard, furniture maker Martino Gamper and jeweller Karl Fritsch, at the Hamish McKay Gallery in Wellington. Talks to Karl Fritsch about the inspiration behind the work and to Francis Upritchard about her thoughts on interiors. Notes that the exhibition can be viewed until 9 July."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Modfather comes clean"
description: "Reviews 'Ray Columbus: the Modfather - the life and times of a rock 'n'roll pioneer' by Ray Columbus with Margie Thomson."

Author: "Thompson, Wayne"
Title: "Local govt stalwart a believer in service"
description: "Local govt stalwart a believer in service"

Author: "Fraser, Kate"
Title: "Where housework and asylums meet"
description: "Where housework and asylums meet"

Author: "Pearce, Bob"
Title: "Golfing legend greets honour with a plea"
description: "Golfing legend greets honour with a plea"

Author: "Hannan, Hayley"
Title: "Sir Peter Blake Leadership Awards"
description: "Honours the winners of the annual Sir Peter Blake Leadership Awards. Profiles the winner of the special award, student Sam Johnson, who organised the Student Volunteer Army clean up team following earthquakes in Christchurch; supreme award winner, public servant Dame Margaret Bazley; and 6 emerging leaders selected as showing great potential. Lists all supreme award winners since 2005."

Title: "Great end to glorious Christmas"
description: "Great end to glorious Christmas"

Author: "Simei-Barton, Paul"
Title: "Modern tale truthfully painted in ancient Indian ink"
description: "Reviews the latest work by the 15 year old Indian Ink theatre company, Maidment Theatre, to 16 Jul."

Title: "Knighthoods for educationist and judge"
description: "Knighthoods for educationist and judge"

Author: "Stone, Andrew"
Title: "Knight of old school can still cause a stir"
description: "Speaks to the former All Black and headmaster of Auckland Grammar about his views on education, race, and rugby. Informs of the recent release of his biography."

Author: "Fletcher, Hamish"
Title: "30th birthday caps big year for McCaw"
description: "30th birthday caps big year for McCaw"

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Out in force on the mean streets"
description: "Reports on a day in the lives of a police team patrolling Otara. Describes their relationship-based methods of dealing with crime. Talks to one of the members about the benefits of working successfully with a local liquor store. Differentiates community constables from neighbourhood policing teams. Lists the four priorities for police and locals in the Ferguson Road area of Otara, known as the Otara triangle."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Building bridges across the gender pay gap"
description: "Looks at reasons behind gender-related pay inequality. Cites the work of economist Enrico Moretti about women taking more sick days because of their periods and about his suggestion of how to redress the pay gap. Talks to Equal Employment Opportunities commissioner Dr Judy McGregor about the potential effect of removing confidentiality around pay agreements."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Climbing life's ladders"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Theatre Company commissioned play inspired by the memoirs of Lady [Mary] Ann Martin, wife of NZ's first Chief Justice Sir William Martin. Talks about the set design by Tony Rabbit, the portrayal of the protagonist by Laurel Devenie, and writing of the script by Arthur Meek. Backgrounds Ann Martin's career, her liberal thinking and her book 'Our Maoris'. Seeks comments from historian Megan Hutching about the need to study and publicise early pioneer women such as Martin who arrived in NZ aged 24."

Author: "Burgess, Dave"
Title: "Basin flyover start set for 2014"
description: "Reports on the plans for the next stage of the Ngauranga to Airport Corridor Plan, which include a $75 million flyover and a second Mount Victoria tunnel."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Harbour lets out secrets of its living waters"
description: "Talks to producer and director Cheryl Cameron about her 'Living waters' project, a series of 12 documentaries that will show the importance of the harbour and catchment of the wider region."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Reality bites"
description: "Talks to four NZ winners of the reality television shows Mitre 10 Dream Home (2008), NZ Idol (2004), British Masterchef (2009), and Who wants to be a millionaire? (2003), to find out if winning has changed their lives."

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Te reo : a taonga with a future or a kete-case?"
description: "Looks at what can be done to bring more te reo and tikanga into mainstream schooling. Points to renewed warnings about the long-term health of te reo from the Waitangi Tribunal, with current trends indicating that the te reo-speaking portion of the MaÃÑori population will decline further. Speaks to Rongotai College music teacher Greg Crayford about how he incorporates te reo and tikanga into his lessons and to Rawiri Wright, the new tumauaki (principal) at Seatoun's MaÃÑori language immersion school Te Kura Kaupapa MaÃÑori o Nga Mokopuna, about his determination to progress MaÃÑori through te reo. Talks about the shortage of MaÃÑori-speaking teachers, the recent report released by the MaÃÑori Youth Council that recommended the Government require all secondary school teachers to complete a level one te reo and tikanga course at a tertiary institution, the current situation for secondary teachers and the reaction to the Government's proposed voluntary programme called 'Tataiako'. Speaks to Te Kura Kaupapa MaÃÑori o Nga Mokopuna teacher Barbara Zerzouri, who has a limited knowledge of te reo, about why it is necessary for all teachers to have knowledge of the language. Touches on the objectives of 2011's 'MaÃÑori language week'. Points to some figures to address for MaÃÑori pupils."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1895"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1895. Reports that the 'notorious baby-farmer' was found guilty at a trial in Invercargill, 22 Jun 1895. Informs that she received a death sentence and was hanged for murdering infant Dorothy Edith Carter, who she had received for adoption on 2 May 1895. Overviews the proceedings of a 'statutory meeting of delegates from local authorities within the Dunedin district' to decide on the day of a half-holiday, as reported in the 16 Jan 1895 edition. Recounts several chats between a reporter and the American writer Mark Twain while en route to Dunedin aboard the Union liner 'Meraroa', as published on 6 Nov 1895. Mentions upcoming appearances by Mark Twain in Dunedin, Timaru and Oamaru, 8-11 Nov 1895. Includes a photo taken in 1895 of the Mountaineer Hotel, Queenstown."

Author: "Newton, Kate"
Title: "How measles beats NZ's defences"
description: "Reports on how NZ's relatively low immunisation rates have put NZers at risk. Speaks to Auckland medical officer Richard Hoskins about his exasperation surrounding the latest outbreak of measles, which has infected dozens of people after an unimmunised child (a pupil at Oratia District School in West Auckland) brought the disease back from overseas, Oratia mother Sherry Tosh, whose three unimmunised children have all caught measles during the outbreak, about her decision not to immunise her children and the community philosophy that has played a part in the low take-up of immunisation among Oratia children, and to Immunisation Advisory Centre director Nikki Turner who suggests people have lost their collective memory about the potential seriousness of measles. Points out that conscious opposition to immunisation is not the only explanation. Highlights research published by the Health Ministry this year that identifies five different groups among parents who do not, or will not, have their children immunised. Touches on the symptoms, complications and treatment of measles."

Author: "McManus, Jenni"
Title: "The state of the nation"
description: "Uncovers the top six issues for business in the lead-up to the 2011 parliamentary election. Talks to 40 unnamed businesspeople and sector leaders about how they rate the Government's performance during the past three years."

Author: "Keown, Jenny"
Title: "Wood's allure leaving steel and block behind"
description: "Reports on the growing battle in the building materials sector, concrete, steel, timber and brick, over what is seen as Government favouritism towards timber for the rebuild of the earthquake-devastated city."

Author: "Keown, Jenny"
Title: "Wood's allure leaving steel and block behind"
description: "Reports on the growing battle in the building materials sector, concrete, steel, timber and brick, over what is seen as Government favouritism towards timber for the rebuild of the earthquake-devastated city."

Author: "Hooton, Amanda"
Title: "After Everest"
description: "Joins Peter Hillary, son of Sir Edmund Hillary, for a trek through the Himalayas as part of the Australian Himalayan Foundation's (AHF) inaugural 'Chairman's trek'. Talks about the work of the AHF, which aims to support the people of the Himalayas through education, health and environmental programmes, the desire to conquer mountains, Sir Edmond Hillary's humanitarian work in Nepal, the death of Peter Hillary's mother, Louise, and teenage sister, Belinda, in an airplane crash in 1975, and Peter's strained relationship with his father's original NZ-based Himalayan Trust."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "Dysfunction or show of 'co-operative spirit'?"
description: "Comments on a rather fractious meeting of the Dunedin City Council, 27 Jun 2011. Seeks views of the councillors after the meeting about the acrimonious exchanges during the debate on agenda topics."

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Lignite proposal raises local concern"
description: "Investigates proposals by state-owned enterprise Solid Energy and the L&M Group to mite lignite (brown coal) in Otago and Southland, with the intention of converting it to diesel and converting raw lignite to briquettes. Reports on disquiet about the proposal at a residents' meeting with Solid Energy, May 2011. Cites views of Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment Dr Jan Wright, Coal Research Ltd chief executive Dr Rob Whitney and environmental organisations."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Asian trade central to innovative biotech firm"
description: "Showcases the developer, a Dunedin-based private biotechnology company that develops functional food ingredients. Talks to managing director and chief executive Charles Williams, pharmacologist Dr Andrew Sansom and microbiologist/biochemist Dr Ralph Jack about some of the projects on which they are working and its trade networks. Informs of recent awards garnered by the company."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Last of their kind"
description: "Focuses on the uncertain future of many religious orders in NZ. Reports that, with few young women joining the sisterhood, nuns are literally dying out. Speaks to sisters Rae Berry, the former congregational leader of Wellington's Home of Compassion in Island Bay, and Helen O'Sullivan, of Our Lady of the Missions in Petone, about why young women no longer recognise or respond to a 'call' as women did 50 years ago, and to Sister Josephine Kane, congregations leader of Our Lady of the Missions, about the future of religious orders. Talks about the work of the Home of Compassion sisters."

Author: "Scherer, Karyn"
Title: "Banter belies firm bid to book success"
description: "Speaks to the couple who have just bought the iconic book chain. Overviews their other retail holdings. Focuses on their plans to revive the business, and also reveals plans for the Borders chain of stores in NZ.  Seeks comment from the man hired by the couple as managing director of their latest business venture."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1896"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1896. Relates details of an explosion at the Brunner mine, 26 Mar 1896, resulting in the deaths of at least five miners and the entombment of 60 men. Reveals 'extreme hardship' stemming from a Government decision to lay off 50 percent of married men employed on the Central Otago railway line, 17 Jan 1896. Informs in the 3 Jan 1896 edition that a large proportion of passengers became seasick during the annual New Year's excursion to Oamaru about the Union Steam Ship Company ship 'Wakatipu'. Reports on 3 Feb 1896 that the Bishop of Dunedin (the Right Rev Dr Nevill) opened St Hilda's Collegiate School for girls, 1 Feb 1896. Touches on other events during the year. Includes a photograph of High Street, Dunedin, taken in the 1890s."

Author: "Van Delden, Aaron"
Title: "More than words"
description: "Looks at what can be done to ensure MaÃÑori remains a fluent and thriving language. Visits Wellington's Te Puna Reo o Nga Kakano early childhood education centre where English and MaÃÑori have equal value. Talks about the concerns expressed by the Waitangi Tribunal for te reo and the failure to train enough teachers fluent in MaÃÑori to meet a predictable demand for MaÃÑori-medium education. Speaks to Winifred Bauer, a teaching fellow at Victoria University of Wellington's School of MaÃÑori Studies, about the problems faced by the language and her push to re-establish dominantly MaÃÑori-speaking communities. Talks to a number of Te Puna Reo o Nga Kakano staff members."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Insider art"
description: "Visits 'Gesamtkunsthandwerk', a collaborative installation of handcrafted interior objects by artist Francis Upritchard, furniture maker Martino Gamper and jeweller Karl Fritsch, at the Hamish McKay Gallery in Wellington. Talks to Karl Fritsch about the inspiration behind the work and to Francis Upritchard about her thoughts on interiors. Notes that the exhibition can be viewed until 9 July."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Playing the game"
description: "Examines whether enrolling young children in structured sporting competition is beneficial to becoming a successful athlete later in life. Cites results of surveys from Sparc and Sport Otago. Seeks views of  associate professor Dr Chris Button and Motohide Miyahara of the University of Otago School of Physical Education about physical and psychological aspects of sport for children. Speaks to several parents who also coach children's sport about the skills they teach."

Author: "Rutherford, Jack"
Title: "The Playfair St gang and the Corsty boys"
description: "Recalls his upbringing in the South Dunedin suburb of Caversham. Focuses on 'the great battle of Corstorphine Rd' in 1943 or 1944, between two gangs of 'raggamuffin boys' to establish territory."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Author (detailed): "Lawrence Jones, Janice Murphy and Gavin McLean"
Title: "That such a book could come out of Geraldine!; Tale of island life and porkers a real corker; Putting the treaty in context of its time"
description: "That such a book could come out of Geraldine!; Tale of island life and porkers a real corker; Putting the treaty in context of its time"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Learning how the natural world works"
description: "Interviews the geologist at the University of Otago about her work."

Author: "Barrett, Pat"
Title: "Proceed with caution"
description: "Describes a one-day tramp to the Pfeifer Biv (hut) on the northern boundary of Arthur's Pass National Park, returning back out to the lower Deception River via Tutu Stream/Creek."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Modfather comes clean"
description: "Reviews 'Ray Columbus: the Modfather - the life and times of a rock 'n'roll pioneer' by Ray Columbus with Margie Thomson."

Author: "Twose, Helen"
Title: "High point in cruel year for Barnett"
description: "High point in cruel year for Barnett"

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Community champion stunned by recognition"
description: "Community champion stunned by recognition"

Title: "Weta lends a hand to support monks"
description: "Weta lends a hand to support monks"

Title: "Shot son's flight spurred by big-quake prediction"
description: "Shot son's flight spurred by big-quake prediction"

Title: "Boycot call leads to likely censure"
description: "Boycot call leads to likely censure"

Author: "Hallahan, Marnie"
Title: "Cycling couple taking the long route home"
description: "Cycling couple taking the long route home"

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Rattling around India the way to go"
description: "Rattling around India the way to go"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Hotchin's gamble : 'Looney Tunes' scheme promised 160% interest"
description: "Hotchin's gamble : 'Looney Tunes' scheme promised 160% interest"

Author: "Davidson, Martin"
Title: "Gym bunny Weepu eager for return to help ailing Hurricanes"
description: "Gym bunny Weepu eager for return to help ailing Hurricanes"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1897"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1897. Chronicles celebrations in Dunedin on 22 Jun 1897 to commemorate the 60-year reign of the 'illustrious Sovereign Queen Victoria', as reported in the 23 Jun 1897 edition. Sums up a report by Mr Hawkins, S.M. on the operation of liquor prohibition in Clutha, 22 Dec 1897. Cites comments from a paper presented by Mr Bathgate at a 12 Jul 1897 meeting of the Otago Institute, focusing on the introduction of pests into the colony, as reported on 24 Jul 1897. Reprints a 25 Aug 1897 report from Juneau, Alaska on the aftermath of the discovery of gold in the Klondyke, as printed in the 16 Oct 1897 edition. Includes a photograph of Buckingham St, Arrowtown, taken in 1897."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Wrongfully convicted man talks of 'living hell'"
description: "Wrongfully convicted man talks of 'living hell'"

Title: "Partners sell Kiwi expertise to Asia"
description: "Partners sell Kiwi expertise to Asia"

Title: "Quake's shock brings web team back to basics"
description: "Quake's shock brings web team back to basics"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1898"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1898. Focuses on aspects of the Cobb and Co coach route through the Otago goldfields, as reported on 4 Jan 1898. Includes a photograph taken in 2007 of a replica Cobb and Co coach. Comments on the confusion caused by the interchangeable use of the names 'Molyneux' and 'Clutha' to refer to the Clutha River. 21 Sep 1898. Praises the mayor of Dunedin for introducing a system by which the Dunedin Town Hall clock will 'be a reliable indication in future of New Zealand mean time'. Comments on the presence of tramps in NZ, particularly on arterial roads in the North Island, 10 Mar 1898. Touches on other events during the year, including the suicide of the Tuapeka MP at the Parliamentary Buildings, Wellington, 12 Oct 1898."

Author: "Cleaver, Dylan"
Title: "Messam's form a gem amid chiefs' muck"
description: "Messam's form a gem amid chiefs' muck"

Author: "McIntyre, Donna"
Title: "Nerves of steel a must for jumpy tourist"
description: "Nerves of steel a must for jumpy tourist"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1899"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1899. Sums up proceedings of a 28 Feb 1899 meeting at the Dunedin Town Hall to explore the feasibility of forming 'a society for the protection of women and children', reported on 1 Mar 1899. Informs of one of the worst railway accidents to date in NZ, 11 Mar 1899, when a Christchurch-bound train carrying Islington Freezing Works employees and their families crashed at Rakaia, as reported in the 13 Mar 1899 edition. Presents a report by the special commissioner of his visit to gold dredging centres, printed in the 20 Jun 1899 edition. Anticipates the spread of the use of telephones, 19 Jan 1899.  Touches on other events during the year. Includes a photograph of Dunedin taken at the turn of the century."

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Top school hits out at transfers to competitor"
description: "Top school hits out at transfers to competitor"

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Dying migrant's kids kept out of class"
description: "Dying migrant's kids kept out of class"

Author: "Parsons-King, Amy"
Title: "Boutique on safer ground"
description: "Talks to the fashion designer who has relocated her boutique to her hometown after her business was destroyed in the Christchurch earthquake, 22 Feb 2011. Remarks on the tragedy of that day, which also claimed the life of her friend, Jillian Murphy, who was with her in the shop. Discusses her upbringing and career to date, and some of the labels she carries."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "NZ cocaine accused given medical tests"
description: "NZ cocaine accused given medical tests"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Power to the social media"
description: "Discusses the power of protest campaigns through social media such as Facebook and Twitter. Talks to booksellers who have been influenced by social media campaigns."

Title: "Queenstown horse trainer acquitted of murder in UK"
description: "Queenstown horse trainer acquitted of murder in UK"

Author: "Tahana, Yvonne"
Title: "Whanau honour rough, tough exploits of fighting Johnsons"
description: "Whanau honour rough, tough exploits of fighting Johnsons"

Author: "Pryor, Nicole"
Title: "The human touch"
description: "Backgrounds Dame Jane Goodall's career as a primatologist and anthropologist. Discusses her current role and work as a UN Messenger for Peace."

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "Gill sure of cracking Olympic mark again"
description: "Gill sure of cracking Olympic mark again"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "CTV worker uncomfortable in 'building that creaked'"
description: "CTV worker uncomfortable in 'building that creaked'"

Author: "Tattersfield, Brad"
Title: "Hillary's legacy"
description: "Visits Khumbu, the Everest region of Nepal, where Sir Edmund Hilary (and later the Himalayan Trust) built 27 schools. Reports on the Khumjung School 50th anniversary celebrations and talks to Sir Ed's son, Peter and Lady Hillary about the community environmental work that is being maintained there. Discusses their dilemmas over the future role and direction of the Himalayan Trust."

Author: "Harvey, Siobhan,"
Title: "The confidence builder"
description: "Talks to author Laurence Fearnley about her writing and her inspiration to create her current novel. Reviews the best-selling NZ Post Book Award shortlisted novel The hut builder."

Author: "McCracken, Heather"
Title: "Driver's face struck by freak flying rock"
description: "Driver's face struck by freak flying rock"

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Raising high the roof"
description: "Profiles John Hovell, a kowhaiwhai artist, and a NZ Post Book Awards non-fiction finalist. Reviews his book 'The passing world : the passage of life, John Hovell and the art of kowhaiwhai'."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "Three branches of one entity"
description: "Profiles musical group the Saguaro Trio, who are due to make their first NZ tour July 20-August 10, 2011."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "'Coca-Cola in the legs'"
description: "Explains the affliction of restless leg syndrome (RLS), a common movement disorder. Talks to a severe sufferer about her condition and how she deals with it. Informs of the different types of RLS and the medication available for these."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Booze ruse?"
description: "Comments on the findings of two recent studies reported in the British Medical Journal to reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease. Queries the claim that alcohol in moderation is beneficial to health. Looks at the government's stance on alcohol reform."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "Casting their net"
description: "Introduces the latest technology in television, internet-enabled TV. Focuses on its features and how this will change peoples' internet and TV viewing experiences."

Author: "Gay, Edward"
Title: "Drink-driving lawyer named at sentencing"
description: "Drink-driving lawyer named at sentencing"

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Accused Kiwi : My day from hell"
description: "Accused Kiwi : My day from hell"

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Out of the closet and onto the street : 25 years of gay rights"
description: "Looks at the response to the introduction of the Homosexual Law Reform Bill in 1986. Talks to those who helped change the law, to obtain what they see as a basic human right for themselves and for others. Looks at life as a gay person then and now. Includes David Hindley, Bill Logan, Wellington Central MP Grant Robertson, Des Smith and John Jolliff."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Flight instructor and highly rated pupil killed"
description: "Flight instructor and highly rated pupil killed"

Author: "Davidson, Martin"
Title: "Hammett wards off cold on and off the field"
description: "Hammett wards off cold on and off the field"

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "Perfect match or poles apart?; Tale of two cities an often-harmonious one"
description: "Looks at the history of the relationship between the two cities and the issues involved amalgamating them in light of a new amalgamation bid by Hastings Mayor Lawrence Yule. Discusses the economic benefits of such a move."

Author: "Gray, Wynne"
Title: "Younger Braid steps into brother's boots"
description: "Younger Braid steps into brother's boots"

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Home waits for Happy Feet"
description: "Reports on the progress of the male emperor penguin washed up at Peka Peka beach two weeks ago. Tells of the harsh Antarctic winter conditions he will find when he is returned and the way penguins huddle together to keep warm."

Author: "Gray, Wynne"
Title: "Kaitangata Claw lending a helping hand to Highlanders"
description: "Kaitangata Claw lending a helping hand to Highlanders"

Author: "Andersen, Thelma"
Title: "Big strong man central to early days of skiing on Ruapehu"
description: "Big strong man central to early days of skiing on Ruapehu"

Author: "Torrie, Bronwyn"
Title: "Jaywalking capital : running for their lives; Mean streets : why are Wellington pedestrians so reckless when crossing the road?"
description: "Highlights how Wellington has the country's worst rates of pedestrians being injured in crashes, yet jaywalkers continue to risk their lives crossing inner city streets. Looks at how people cross the road and what needs to be done to keep Wellingtonians safe in the Central Business District (CBD). Highlights the deaths of Corinne Bongiovanni (2004) and Venessa Green (2011). Lists the accidents between pedestrians and vehicles from 2006 to 2011. Outlines the rules around where and how you cross the road."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1900"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1900. Presents extracts from letters from Major Robin and Trooper Ellis, both serving in the South African War in Arundel, South Africa, dated 20 Dec and 22 Dec 1899 respectively, published on 27 Jan 1900. Comments on the 'display of enthusiasm and patriotism' by Dunedin residents in farewelling members of the fourth New Zealand Contingent and the fifth Otago and Southland contingent to depart for the Boer War, published on 26 Mar 1900. Reports on an application to the City Council to erect public water closets in the centre of town, 18 May 1900. Describes celebrations to mark the new century, 2 Jan 1900. Touches on other events during the year. Includes a photograph taken in 1900 of the Maryhill Tce extension of the Mornington tram line, Dunedin."

Author: "Impey, Brent"
Title: "High time this Kiwi legend was honoured in his own land"
description: "Asserts that the Dunedin-born, Palmerston North-raised late ophthalmologist has not received the recognition he deserves in NZ. Touches on the many accolades he received in Australia, where he is considered a national hero. Overviews his work in Aboriginal communities in Australia and in other developing countries to restore sight to people who had easily treatable eye diseases. Describes the role and activities of the Fred Hollows Foundation NZ."

Author: "Bradley, Antonio"
Title: "A life lived dangerously"
description: "Reports on the life of the Kiwi extreme sportsman who was determined to follow his dreams and lead a life of high octane adventure. Tells of his return to thrillseeking and how he lost his life base jumping in Norway."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Infinitely nuanced; Fresh drops for 'Rain'"
description: "Features the upcoming exhibition 'Ralph Hotere : Zero to infinity', Hocken Gallery, Dunedin, 9 Jul-1 Oct 2011. Talks to pictorial collections curator Natalie Poland about the exhibition, which includes about 50 of his works and recognises his 80th birthday on 11 Aug 2011. Touches on  the restoration of his artwork 'Rain', comprising three large banners."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Translation : New works in glass' by Luke Jacomb, Otago Museum, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Preoccupied, part 1' by Ross Gray, Monumental gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Watercolours' by Bruce Hodgson, Tony Williams Studio, Dunedin, until 8 Jul 2011."

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "Entrepreneur  says Tokoroa 'untapped goldmine'"
description: "Entrepreneur  says Tokoroa 'untapped goldmine'"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Brotherly love brings touch pair together"
description: "Brotherly love brings touch pair together"

Author: "Rotherham, Fiona"
Title: "Gibbs calls in experts as farewell gift"
description: "Gibbs calls in experts as farewell gift"

Author: "Murphy, Janice"
Title: "Compost club grew naturally"
description: "Backgrounds the genesis of the organic movement in NZ. Chronicles the contribution of the dentist who co-founded the Humic Compost Club in May 1941 (later the Organic Compost Society and the Soil Association of New Zealand). Mentions other events, individuals and organisations that contributed to the growth of organics."

Title: "'Silly old lady' in drug nightmare"
description: "'Silly old lady' in drug nightmare"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1901"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1901. Focuses on the reaction of Dunedin residents to news of the death of Queen Victoria, as reported on 24 Jan 1901. Captures the mood of the public on 28 Jan 1901 when the Royal message was read by his Worship the mayor of Dunedin, proclaiming Edward VII as King of Great Britain and Ireland and Emperor of India, as reported on 29 Jan 1901. Comments on 'the prevalence of sly grog-selling in the Clutha district' and a subsequent sting by authorities on 9 Jan 1901, reported on 15 Jan 1901. Touches on other events during the year. Includes a photograph of the Otago section of the Sixth Contingent, on their way to serve in the Boer War."

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Family doctor served a lifetime in community"
description: "Family doctor served a lifetime in community"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Referee bans basketballer's hair braid 'weapon'"
description: "Referee bans basketballer's hair braid 'weapon'"

Author: "McGechan, Andy,"
Title: "Motorcross champion back on world circuit"
description: "Motorcross champion back on world circuit"

Author: "Harris, Catherine"
Title: "Property under pressure"
description: "Looks at the ongoing relationship between renting and owning property and the factors that could put a squeeze on the rental market. Highlights the state of the property and rental markets."

Author: "Geenty, Mark"
Title: "Erakovic happy to be back in the money"
description: "Talks to the tennis player about her career, her family, and life on the tennis circuit after reaching the doubles semi-finals at Wimbledon this year. Includes a fact file on her career results."

Author: "Long, David"
Title: "Williams back from injury for Blues"
description: "Williams back from injury for Blues"

Author: "Lowe, Robert"
Title: "Victory set to open floodgates : Kiw driver's maturing"
description: "Victory set to open floodgates : Kiw driver's maturing"

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Sutton 'happy to front up'; Christchurch gets its man"
description: "Sutton 'happy to front up'; Christchurch gets its man"

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Secrets of success"
description: "Profiles the career of the 30-year-old businesswoman and how she was able to earn enough over a year to retire with a sustainable income."

Title: "Couple badly hurt during knife attack"
description: "Couple badly hurt during knife attack"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Kiwi among the last of Churchill's 'few'"
description: "Kiwi among the last of Churchill's 'few'"

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Ready to rock"
description: "Follows a mash-up of Wellington schoolkids from the birth of their band 'Si Senor' to contesting for a spot in the Wellington Smokefreerockquest."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "The cost of cuts"
description: "Investigates who the winners and losers are in the new preschool funding shift. Talks to Cannons Creek principal Ruth O'Neill, Gill Dodson of Moira Gallagher Kindergarten in Cannons Creek, and Pipitea Creche in Thorndon about the negative effects it will have on themselves and the community around them."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Blue chip papers lay bare the money woe"
description: "Reviews documents investigated by the Serious Fraud Office in connection with the insolvency of the Blue Chip finance companies. Informs that the documents were obtained through an Official Information Act request. Reveals what the papers show about the expense claims and dealings by founder Mark Bryers."

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Shared goal beats out school rivalry"
description: "Shared goal beats out school rivalry"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Struck-off GP denies guilt, snubs hearing"
description: "Struck-off GP denies guilt, snubs hearing"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "First-home buyers : why the time is right; home sweet home"
description: "Overviews the Auckland property market. Outlines the reasons why now is a good time for prospective home buyers and why these buyers should not procrastinate. Names the suburbs becoming most popular among home buyers. Explains the mortgage brokering company that helps a certain profile of buyer to purchase homes that need doing up.
