Describes the experience of first time home buyers Kate Sutherland and John Sutherland, noting the price they payed and the area in Auckland they chose."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Angry Ali short on words"
description: "Interviews the former All Black rugby player about his book, its ghost writer, and his views on the game. Reveals why the interview does not go smoothly."

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "Good for body and sole"
description: "Assesses a session of Chinese reflexology from a Bliss Reflexology therapist. Talks to Reflexology New Zealand vice president Vivienne Batchelor about the different kinds of reflexology and why some can cause discomfort. Lists reflexology providers and websites."

Author: "Cleaver, Dylan"
Title: "Against all odds, team carry the torch for their city; The final crusade"
description: "Looks at how the team reconfigured their 2011 Super 15 rugby season after the 22 February earthquake devastated Christchurch and their home ground, AMI Stadium. Speaks to a number of the team's players and staff members about their experiences. Notes that their 2011 record stands at 14-4 before playing in the Super 15 final against the Queensland Reds. Lists the distance travelled by the team, who did not play one game at their home ground during the 2011 season."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "First Bach-inspired concert chases away chills of winter"
description: "Reviews the first of the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's 'Inspired by Bach' concerts, which is part of the 'Splendour' series."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "By gum, no sugar but plenty of sweeteners"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Mentos 'Aqua kiss 3D sugarfree' chewing gum."

Author: "Williams, Bronwyn"
Title: "Heel appeal"
description: "Asks why people find high heels so enduringly alluring despite the health risks of wearing them. Looks at the history of shoes with a heightened heel. Talks to the experts Kathryn Wilson (shoe designer), Michiko Hylands (style director for TVNZ) and Fiona Hawtin (editor of Fashion Quarterly magazine) about the good and bad points of wearing them."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Wild at heart"
description: "Talks to the businessman and hunter about his new book and his outdoor clothing company 'Swazi'."

Author: "Palmer, Rebecca"
Title: "Wild at heart"
description: "Talks to the businessman and hunter about his new book and his outdoor clothing company 'Swazi'."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Dane Holland : ballet dancer, landscape artist"
description: "Dane Holland : ballet dancer, landscape artist"

Author: "Bennett, Sarah,"
Title: "Second nature"
description: "Recounts her tramp starting at Pinchgut Track, the steep shortcut up Mt Robert in Nelson Lakes National Park, then the Robert Ridge route to the new Angelus Hut. Tells of her experience acting as a tour guide to a German couple who come to tramp during the NZ summer."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Meurant hid clown-bashing cop; Team of '81 coming 'to reconcile'"
description: "Talks to former Red Squad commander Ross Meurant about the story behind the internal police investigation into the attack of three Springbok Tour protesters dressed as clowns by Red Squad members outside Eden Park on 12 Sep 1981. Briefly looks at the planned 'Reconciliation Tour' of 1981 Springbok players and fans to the 2011 Rugby World Cup in NZ to mark the 30th anniversary of the controversial rugby tour."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "The rugby tour that split us into a nation of two halves"
description: "Interviews two pivotal figures from opposite sides of the 1981 Springbok rugby tour conflict on the eve of its 30th anniversary. Talks about the actions and tactics of the Red Squad with Ross Meurant, who was second in charge the crack police team. Speaks to activist John Minto about his experience as an anti-tour protester and the impact of the anti-tour movement on NZ and South Africa."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "A poor state of health"
description: "Reports that lower socio-economic groups are getting sicker and dying younger. Speaks to Dr Don Simmers, who heads the NZ Medical Association's health equity subcommittee, about the effects of inequality he has seen since moving from wealthy Queenstown to the low-income Wellington suburb of Newtown in 2002, and to Tony Blakely of Otago University's health inequalities research programme about the four main reasons low-income families suffer from poor health. Looks at the example of the Lam Sam family from Auckland's Mangere."

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "Do you recognise this building? Clue : you are in Cashel Mall; Huge task ahead in central city; Tall buildings begin to disappear from city"
description: "Reports on the progress of the inner city demolition of earthquake-shattered buildings in central Christchurch. Lists the various buildings due for demolition."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "A tax for people in glass houses"
description: "Examines the history of attempts to introduce and issues associated with a capital gains tax in NZ and its predicted effect on house prices. Notes that the Tax Working Group recommended a land tax but questioned its 'political sustainability'. Comments on the amount of revenue expected to be collected from such a tax and how it may be applied."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Diane Robertson"
description: "Speaks to the Auckland City Missioner about her fundraising ability, the use of 'Kenneth' the wooden robot as the mission's 2011 winter appeal gimmick, and her troubled early family life."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry"
Title: "Bathed in ancestral light"
description: "Talks to the photographer about her new exhibition and book, 'Fiona Pardington: pressure of sunlight falling' edited by Kriselle Baker and Elizabeth Rankin, which examines the historic practice of taking casts of people's heads to study their brains. Explains that some were her NgaÃÑi Tahu tipuna. Notes that the exhibition, a collaboration with her brother Neil Pardington, is on at the Govett-Brewster Art Gallery, New Plymouth, to 28 August 2011."

Author: "Gamble, Warren"
Title: "Tale of two cities - the broken, and the shaken"
description: "Compares the effects of the earthquakes in the east of Christchurch, where there is major damage, and the west, where it is shaken but still functioning. Talks to a resident from Aranui and one from Bishopdale about the different levels of house and property damage they are experiencing."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Dream-like visions that glow in the dark"
description: "Reviews 'This has to do with me' by Liz Maw at the Ivan Anthony Gallery (until 23 Jul), 'Torn up phrases' by Seraphine Pick at the Michael Lett Gallery (until 13 Aug), 'Camouflage' by Philippa Blair at the Warwick Henderson Gallery (until 16 Jul)."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Whodunit?; Pointing the finger"
description: "Reports on what the royal commission of inquiry into the Pike River disaster might find when it starts on Monday. Outlines the makeup of the commission. Raises the issues of the cause of the explosion, the general safety of the mine's design, the hazard management practices, mining industry regulation and policy, and the rescue response."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Relates what is involved in palaeontology and what activities James Crampton is associated with as a programme leader at GNS Science in the field of palaeontology. Notes he is presently leading a team researching climate change and is doing a consultancy for the hydrocarbon industry."

Author: "Reid, Graham,"
Title: "Keen eyes catch moments"
description: "Reviews 'Two walk in Edinburgh', with photographs by Mari Mahr and poems by Gregory O'Brien, and 'Devonport: a diary' by Bill Direen."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "Boyle's overseas plunge pays off; Shanghai success can put Baker on road to London Olympics; Mental focus key to sink or swim"
description: "Boyle's overseas plunge pays off; Shanghai success can put Baker on road to London Olympics; Mental focus key to sink or swim"

Author: "Gaynor, Brian"
Title: "Put in the 10,000 hours, gain the rewards"
description: "Backgrounds the story of the beverage company, co-founded by Stefan Lepionka and Marc Ellis. Reflects on its $129 million takeover offer from Japan's Asahi."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "The power of black"
description: "Investigates the use of the colour black as a symbol of NZ's national identity. Outlines where black or dark colours have been used in NZ art, clothing, sporting gear and music scene. Obtains comments from Doris de Pont who is curating an exhibition about the use of black in fashion called  'Black in fashion'. Documents the comments from a number of All Blacks who describe the psychological aspects of wearing black on the rugby field."

Author: "Bond, Sarah"
Title: "All at sea on Catlins coastline"
description: "Investigates a few of the shipwreck sites off the Catlins coast. Talks to Owaka resident and author Mike McPhee about the shipwrecks of the SS South Australian, the Burmah, the Surat, the SS Otago, the SS Manuka, and the SS Tararua."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Farmers' new top dog"
description: "Profiles the new president of Federated Farmers. Outlines the strengths he brings to the role, including having worked in the banking world before coming to farming seven years ago. Discusses what he sees as the key issues to be worked on during the next three years of his presidency, including the Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS)."

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "Toasting the French"
description: "Looks at where to find a taste of French culture in the city, including language lessons, playgroups, cinema, books, music and products. Notes some 2011 Bastille Day celebrations around the city."

Author: "Mahoney, Jim"
Title: "A way with words"
description: "Describes the author's experience of being a first year reo MaÃÑori student and arriving for a weekend of language immersion at Tahuwhakatiki Marae in Tauranga . Comments on the opportunities to learn Te reo MaÃÑori and the possibilities of Te reo MaÃÑori remaining as a live language. Outlines the programme followed during the weekend and the inspiration and confidence he gained from the immersion weekend."

Author: "Fitchett, Stan"
Title: "Housing on the state"
description: "Argues that NZ should look to the past, when state houses were built and financed by the Reserve Bank, for answers to the housing crisis of Christchurch today."

Author: "Crean, MIke"
Title: "Farming family leave indelible mark"
description: "Profiles the Elworthy family of South Canterbury."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Despicable me"
description: "Talks to Simon Baron-Cohen, a British brain researcher, about empathy, the measurement of it and his new book entitled 'Zero degrees of empathy'. Discusses details of the 'empathy test' and the resultant EQ (empathy quotient) given after completing the test. Gives the EQ scores of four NZers who have taken the empathy test. Examines the relationship between classes of people who have low EQ scores and social scenarios where low and high degrees of empathy can be appropriate."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Act of faith"
description: "Speaks to the California-based actor about his latest coup, a new role on the hit United States show 'Sons of anarchy'. Looks back on his career, which has included stints as a musician, radio personality, dancer and stand-up comedian. Talks about how his parents, actors Liddy Holloway and Bryan Tobeck, helped set him on his acting path."

Author: "Crean, MIke"
Title: "Scientist found his Maori roots; Forest researcher had quirky, impish spirit"
description: "Scientist found his Maori roots; Forest researcher had quirky, impish spirit"

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Romance meets sci-fi"
description: "Talks to the paranormal romance author about how she began writing as a teenager, and her 'Psy-changeling' series, including her latest novel 'Kiss of snow'."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "'I've got farming in my blood'"
description: "Talks to the head of Federated Farmers, Bruce Wills, who describes his childhood, education, a 20 year career in banking, and his eventual return to the family farm Trellinoe, 45 km north of Napier. Indicates he sees one of his roles is to bridge the gap between farmers and urban NZ while being committed to sustainable farming."

Author: "McDonald, Liz"
Title: "Property players"
description: "Looks at how some property owners were dealt a better hand than others in terms of how the Christchurch earthquakes affected their properties. Describes some of the different outcomes people are faced with including the consequences of having or not having replacement insurance, having undamaged buildings available to tenants, and the suggestion of moving the central business district."

Author: "Geenty, Mark"
Title: "Kiwi tennis player 'rocks' back into tour"
description: "Talks to the tennis player about her career, her family, and life on the tennis circuit after reaching the doubles semi-finals at Wimbledon this year. Includes a fact file on her career results."

Author: "Holmes, Stephanie"
Title: "Hearts and minds"
description: "Talks to the actors about playing the characters in the new local comedy drama Nothing trivial."

Author: "Smythe, Michael,"
Title: "No. 8-wire respect drives Kiwi design"
description: "Extracts from the new book 'New Zealand by design : a history of NZ product design by Michael Smythe published by Godwit."

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "Judge's early treaty error reverberates to this day"
description: "Judge's early treaty error reverberates to this day"

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "Diluted BLIS stakes for first-wave investors"
description: "Reports on technology start-up BLIS Technologies continuing to burn cash as it seeks to develop and market bacteria developed by Otago University. Looks at the dilution of the shares of initial investors as new capital is sought."

Author: "Hattaway, Peter"
Title: "Shaky finances"
description: "Gives a precis of recent NZ financial history, noting the collapse of many finance companies and the earthquakes in Christchurch. Looks at indications of debt in Christchuch becoming harder to collect, credit agencies taking a softer approach, and trends showing that credit card debt is becoming more of a burden for the middle class and that consumers are cutting back on it. Discusses the state of NZ finances and legal powers for debt collection"

Author: "Oliver, Annie"
Title: "Real wheels; In defence of high-country farmers"
description: "Real wheels; In defence of high-country farmers"

Author: "Kitty, Robyn"
Title: "Building on water"
description: "Talks to landscape architect Di Lucas, about ROC (Renew Our City), and her firm notion of how post-earthquake Christchurch should be."

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "First aider tipping right royal crush"
description: "First aider tipping right royal crush"

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Selling the silver"
description: "Looks at National and Labour making the partial sale of state assets a major election issue. Looks at National indicating that it would consider reelection in Nov 2011 as a mandate for such sales, and at the statements of parties and politicians."

Author: "Morgan, Jon"
Title: "Family farming taking new directions"
description: "Family farming taking new directions"

Author: "Madgin, Diana"
Title: "Violent blow to oasis of calm"
description: "Talks to Barry Gadsby, the owner of one of architect Peter Beaven's designed apartments in Cornwall St, St Albans, about his courtyard garden, a destination for hundreds of tourists over the years. Outlines the damage done to it by the Christchurch earthquakes."

Author: "Forbes, Michael"
Title: "Riding the roller coaster of loss"
description: "Riding the roller coaster of loss"

Author: "Hattaway, Peter."
Title: "Aussie rules in need of change"
description: "Identifies high bank fees for telegraphic transfers as a problem for NZ debtors living in Australia seeking to make regular repayments of debt, advocating that the NZ Government pressure Australia into changing banking regulations on opening accounts. Notes two other disparaties in trans-Tasman law, an inability to register NZ consumer debtors on the Australian Veda Advantage database and the lack of a unifying number for businesses in NZ similar to the Australian ABN. Shows how trading rules in NZ allow for confusion over entities and debts owed."

Title: "Rail trail used in marketing"
description: "Looks at hotels and residental property owners in Alexandria and Patearoa using the Central Otago Rail Trail as a a marketing attraction for buyers, discussing an anticipated rise in popularity and opportunities for entrepreneurs."

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "Tracey jumped at business opportunity"
description: "Tracey jumped at business opportunity"

Author: "Keown, Jenny"
Title: "Polling students and finding a mouth-watering niche pays off"
description: "Polling students and finding a mouth-watering niche pays off"

Author: "Street, Daniel"
Title: "Loose lips sink ships : limits on information exchange"
description: "Discusses legal risks in information exchange between competitors, looking at proposed Australian reforms (the Competition and Consumer Amendment Bill), the current NZ position on such exchanges, and gives advice for ensuring safe information exchanges of commercially sensitive information."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Will the new Unit Title Act clear up confusion?"
description: "Looks at a recent Court of Appeal case involving the old Unit Titles Act (Jewett Investments Ltd v Body Corporate 204096 [2011] NZCA 232), discussing what provisions cover bodies corporate in the new Act, the circumstances of the case which involved a levy on unit owners to cover remedial work to the exterior of a leaky apartment complex, and the fiduciary duty of the body corporate."

Author: "Holland, Daniel"
Title: "Residents play waiting game for new park"
description: "Residents play waiting game for new park"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Scholarship helps aspiring student"
description: "Scholarship helps aspiring student"

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "Nearby food and fun deals on your phone"
description: "Nearby food and fun deals on your phone"

Author: "Boyes, Nicola"
Title: "Retailer mulling over new form of survival"
description: "Retailer mulling over new form of survival"

Author: "Tutty, Kevin"
Title: "NZ title Perry's reward for hard work"
description: "NZ title Perry's reward for hard work"

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Author (detailed): "Nikki Preston, Belinda Feek and Nicola Brennan-Tupara"
Title: "Mother cries for injured child; Baby's family struggle to cope"
description: "Mother cries for injured child; Baby's family struggle to cope"

Author: "Feek, Belinda"
Title: "Suspect has short fuse, says friends"
description: "Suspect has short fuse, says friends"

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "Hoist saved meat worker from death"
description: "Hoist saved meat worker from death"

Title: "Fear over prisoner's release for work"
description: "Fear over prisoner's release for work"

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Title: "Upbeat Wilson back on feet after big cancer op"
description: "Upbeat Wilson back on feet after big cancer op"

Title: "Stipe Williamson loving his work"
description: "Stipe Williamson loving his work"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "McVean has the round of her life in Leipzig"
description: "McVean has the round of her life in Leipzig"

Author: "Ibbotson, Lucy"
Title: "Tough wee Matilda progressing nicely"
description: "Talks to the award-winning singer about the improving health of her baby, three-month-old Matilda, who was born with a giant omphalocele, a rare condition requiring several major operations. Describes the support she and her husband have received from family, community and fans around the world."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Young coffee devotee enjoys sweet success"
description: "Talks to the young bachelor of commerce student at Aoraki Polytechnic about her use of social networking, particularly Twitter, to establish the Italian-made Bezzera coffee machine brand in NZ. Mentions that she was living in Christchurch until the earthquakes, and provided eyewitness accounts for overseas news networks because of her social networking profile."

Title: "War service origin of Kiwi values"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Christchurch-born fruiterer who was active in the NZ Chinese community. Overviews his upbringing, his service as a pilot in World War 2, pastimes and his community endeavours and achievements."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1902"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1902. Announces the discovery of a 'valuable deposit of genuine rock phosphate' in Clarendon, 23 Jun 1902.  Includes a photograph of examination of the deposit by a group of professors from the University of Otago. Reports on the opening of the Dunedin Law Courts, 24 Jun 1902, and includes a photograph taken just prior to the opening. Warns of the dangers of ptomaine poisoning, and reports on instances in England and NZ, 13 Sep 1902. Describes the laying of the cable from Bluff to Stewart Island, 11 Jun 1902, by the steamer 'Tutanekai', witnessed by guests aboard the 'Theresa Ward', as reported on 12 Jun 1902."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Making bee lines; Parasites and pestilence ..."
description: "Talks to the local author who has written a follow-up novel to 'Sting', his successful fiction debut with a honey bee as its protagonist. Discusses his love of science fiction and how he incorporates his knowledge of bees and beekeeping into both novels. Draws attention to the threats facing honey bees worldwide."

Author: "Adams, Geoff"
Title: "Larger-than-life ladies' man; Paintings missing"
description: "Backgrounds the 19th-century Supreme Court judge who is the subject of his book. Focuses on his marital life and extramarital affairs, including the affair that took place between the judge and the writer in the house he owns today. Mentions their marriage on 6 Jan 1902. Describes his upbringing, education, political life and business dealings. Touches on her fame as an author, citing her novel 'Philiberta' and the epic poem 'Guinevere in the South'. Mentions that four paintings by the Dutch-born painter Petrus Van der Velden were donated to the Dunedin Public Art Gallery after the judge died, but three paintings are missing from its collection."

Author: "James, Bryan"
Author (detailed): "Bryan James, Peter Dowden and Hamesh Wyatt"
Title: "Remarkable mentor captured well; Author let down by production as 'Paradise' lost; Poetry"
description: "Remarkable mentor captured well; Author let down by production as 'Paradise' lost; Poetry"

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Known and unknown"
description: "Talks to the former member of the Mint Chicks about his new band, which has just released its self-titled debut album in the US, where he has lived since 2007 after moving from Auckland to Portland, Oregon. Describes why the quartet split up and the genesis of the new album."

Author: "Bruce, David"
Title: "Cleaning up in business"
description: "Interviews the duo who have developed a business making soap."

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Grappling with earthquake mayhem"
description: "Profiles the Dunedin-educated chairwoman of the NZ Historic Places Trust board. Talks to her about her education and career as a lawyer and judge. Describes the challenges facing the Trust in dealing with the effects of the Christchurch earthquakes on heritage buildings in the area, and comments on the need for more 'heritage artisans' to take charge of the architectural restoration of historic buildings. Cites other remarks she made to members of the University Club before the 13 Jun 2011 aftershocks in Christchurch."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Are older workers youth job threat?"
description: "Examines whether younger workers are being disadvantaged by the growing trend for older people to remain in the workforce. Seeks views of BNZ economist Stephen Toplis and Social Development, Employment and Youth Affairs Minister Paula Bennett. Cites results of a recent survey by finance and accounting recruiter Robert Half New Zealand, indicating a slowdown in hiring in these sectors, and seeks further elucidation of the results from general manager Megan Alexander. Overviews job trends in Australia."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1903"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1903. Chronicles the inauguration on 16 Dec 1903 of the electrification of tramways in the city and suburbs, as reported on 17 Dec 1903. Reports on the effects of a heavy snowfall over a weekend beginning on 10 Jul 1903, as reported on 13 Jul 1903. Includes updates from the editions published from 16-18 Jul 1903. Cites two incidents reported in the 'Mataura Ensign' of sheep and horses being struck by lightning, as reported on 8 Dec 1903. Lauds the performance of soprano Madame Melba at His Majesty's Theatre, Dunedin, 18 Feb 1903, as reported on 19 Feb 1903. Includes a photograph of the head of the Kawarau river at Frankton, Lake Wakatipu."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1904"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1904. Sums up a presentation by Minister of Health Sir J. G. Ward to the Australian Association for the Advancement of Science Congress, 8 Jan 1904, regarding the prevention and cure of consumption, as reported on 12 Jan 1904. Congratulates the residents of Caversham for voting on 5 Aug 1904 to amalgamate with the city, as reported on 6 Aug 1904. Deplores the increasing use of obscene language by young men on public streets, 5 Jul 1904.  Describes an explosion on 29 Jan 1904 at a quarry at Harrington Point, resulting in the death of 'Otago Daily Times' and 'Otago Witness' journalist Mr Francis Antonio Joseph and injuring several other well-known city residents, as reported on 30 Jan 1904. Includes a photograph of the Northeast Valley, looking towards Dunedin, taken in 1904."

Author: "Peat, Neville"
Title: "Where the river runs clear and clean; Where the river runs clear, clean and potable"
description: "Describes a six-day group rafting trip on the Clarence River, Canterbury, with head guide Bridget Jessep. Remarks on the exceptional water quality and potability, the scenery and its geological setting. Provides information about the Clarence River Rafting commercial operation."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "Another Kiwi packed in to 'Rafters'"
description: "Talks to the former Aucklander about her current role as Loretta Schembri on Australian drama series 'Packed to the Rafters', which screens on TV One. Overviews her career and comments on her character."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Drug dealer's double life exposed"
description: "Drug dealer's double life exposed"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Mourners hear of crash girl's travel and archaeology dreams"
description: "Mourners hear of crash girl's travel and archaeology dreams"

Author: "Fisher, Amanda"
Title: "Hard lessons for shaky schools"
description: "Reveals that some 24 Wellington schools are potentially earthquake prone, listing the schools named by the City Council. Seeks comments from principals about the Council's findings. Discusses how the level of risk is assessed. Looks at the costs of strengthening the school buildings. Notes briefly the effects of pupil relocation resulting from the 22 Feb 2011 Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Author (detailed): "Jared Savage, Andrew Koubaridis and Edward Gay"
Title: "Friends tell of confessions; Then he said 'I've killed Carmen'"
description: "Reveals details from the police case against murder-accused Brad Callaghan. Includes extracts from the statement of 'Witness 70' about an alleged attempt to dispose of Carmen Thomas' remains at sea."

Title: "Turn to mush : The Aucklander who moved to Alaska to race dogs"
description: "Turn to mush : The Aucklander who moved to Alaska to race dogs"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Designer drugs a cat-and-mouse game"
description: "Outlines the arguments behind the 'Kronic' debate. Looks at why the Government does not ban synthetic cannabis."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Kiwi voice counts, says Greenpeace chief"
description: "Conveys the views of Greenpeace International executive director Kumi Naidoo on NZ's moves to address climate change, including the Pure Advantage initiative by businesses. Discusses expectations that NZ will attend the UN climate talks in Durban 2011 and laments the effect on NZ's reputation for environmental integrity of proposed fossil fuel exploration. Touches on plans to launch a third Rainbow Warrior vessel and mentions the upcoming activities of the other Warrior vessels."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Pic-and-mix Bach easy to digest"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's second 'Inspired by Bach' Thursday concert."

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "Highly skilled neurologist committed to public health system"
description: "Highly skilled neurologist committed to public health system"

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "Colourful executive brought a bag of tricks to advertising industry"
description: "Colourful executive brought a bag of tricks to advertising industry"

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Taking stock for winter's comfort foods"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Continental's chicken 'stock pot'."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1905"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1905. Reports on festivities to mark the merging of the borough of South Dunedin with the city, effective from midnight on 31 Mar 1905, as reported on 1 Apr 1905. Announces the end of the Boer War, as reported on 3 Jun 1905. Remarks on the unveiling of the memorial to the late Queen Victoria, Dunedin, 23 Mar 1905, as reported on the following day. Includes a photograph of the unveiling ceremony. Comments on the disappointment of NZers to the news that Wales had inflicted the first defeat on the NZ rugby team during its British tour, 16 Dec 1905, as reported in the 18 Dec 1905 edition. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Smith, Bevan"
Title: "Swede success"
description: "Showcases the swede. Touches on cooking tips and its enduring popularity. Includes five recipes."

Author: "Kearns, Brendan"
Author (detailed): "Brendan Kearns, Giles Graham and Louis Graham"
Title: "Till killing do brothers part; Alcohol's appalling toll; Autumn (a better beauty)"
description: "Features a short story, a poem and a song, respectively, from the pupils at Maniototo Area School. Includes a painting by Tamara Hawkins that draws on her Pacifica and MaÃÑori heritage."

Author: "Barclay, Chris"
Title: "Meteoric rise to Kiwis stuns Storm winger"
description: "Meteoric rise to Kiwis stuns Storm winger"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1906"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1906. Relays the news from New York of the destructive San Francisco earthquake, as reported on 20 Apr 1906, and mentions responses by NZ and Dunedin. Comments on proposals before the Postmaster-General to install wireless telegraphy in the colony, 17 Jan 1906. Announces the opening on 21 Oct 1906 of the Dunedin Railway Station, as reported on 22 Oct 1906. Includes two photographs of the main hall and exterior of the station. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "The climate dissenter"
description: "Speaks to Christopher De Freitas, an Associate Professor in the School of Environment at the University of Auckland, about why he will not accept that extreme weather events are linked to human-induced climate change (global warming). Reveals that he does not present both sides of the climate change debate in the introductory Geography 101 course he teaches. Attempts to explain the climate scientist's view on climate change. Speaks to Professor Martin Manning, the director of Victoria University of Wellington's NZ Climate Change Research Institute, about the Associate Professor's view point and course structure."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Conducting 'a good fit'"
description: "Chats to Australian conductor Dane Lam about his guest appearance with the Southern Sinfonia, Dunedin, 16 Jul 2011. Comments on the works that will be played."

Author: "Torrie, Bronwyn"
Title: "The ripple effect; trying to salvage something good out of broken lives"
description: "Informs of a DVD aimed at educating young drivers which will feature in an upcoming Drive Safe programme in high schools. Reflects on the incident sparking the safety message, discussing the effect on family, friends, and community of the car accident on Grays Road that killed 18 year olds Nathan Laurenson and Udo Fourie in 2009. Follows up on the life of another of the accident's victims, Phillipa Jonassen. Discusses the dangerous stretch of road between Pauatahanui and Plimmerton with local resident Dion Taylor and Porirua City Council technical services manager Geoff Marshall."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Poisons' by Martin Sullivan, Temple Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Poisons' by Anet Neutze, Glue Gallery, Dunedin. Reviews 'My little empire' by Peter Lewis, None Gallery, Dunedin."

Author: "Nixon, Tina"
Title: "Great loss to Te Anau community"
description: "Great loss to Te Anau community"

Title: "Never doubt a Franks would step into his father's shoes"
description: "Never doubt a Franks would step into his father's shoes"

Title: "Community stalwart back in the spotlight"
description: "Community stalwart back in the spotlight"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1907"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1907. Sums up an address by Dr Truby King to a large gathering of women at the Dunedin Town Hall, 14 May 1907, entitled 'The Promotion of health among women and children', as reported on 15 May 1907. Reports on celebrations pertaining to the 26 Sep 1907 proclamation by His Majesty, King Edward VII, designating NZ as a Dominion, as reported in the 27 Sep 1907 edition. Includes a photograph of the unfurling of the flag on Dominion Day, Dunedin. Comments on the returns from gold dredging during the past 12 months, 1 Jan 1907. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Starting a new story"
description: "Talks to the Sudanese refugee who has received an Arts Access Aotearoa award (the 2011 Big 'A' Winton and Margaret Bear Young Artist Award) for his writing and music about how his experience of war affects his writing. Mentions his works Unknown journey and Beyond the dark journey."

Title: "Defender of nation and his ancestors"
description: "Defender of nation and his ancestors"

description: "Reports on the effects of long hours of sitting on people's weight and related health problems such as blood clots. Explains what happens physiologically when people sit (or stand) for long periods. Mentions the long term effects of childhood fitness habits. Talks to a graphic designer who always stands while she works. Offers advice about how to break prolonged sitting or standing. Informs of medical, ergonomic, and official positions on workplace posture."

Title: "With such good companionship, 60 years of marriage feel much shorter"
description: "With such good companionship, 60 years of marriage feel much shorter"

Title: "Helen Kelly"
description: "Talks to the president of the Council of Trade Unions about her temper, her family (including her father, union leader Pat Kelly) and her work."

Title: "Impressive sailing earns selection"
description: "Impressive sailing earns selection"

description: "Retired businessman had passion for the sea"

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Let's get physical"
description: "Reports on the Peach Theatre Company's collaborative version of Shakespeare's 'Othello'. Talks to choreographer Douglas Wright, director Jesse Peach and members of the cast, including Robbie Magasiva who stars as Othello, about the production. Notes that the production is on at the Maidment Theatre in Auckland from 22 Jul to 13 Aug 2011."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Memories of past still have plenty of appeal"
description: "Reviews a retrospective show of the work of Sir Peter Siddell at Lopdell House (to 21 Aug), 'Collateral: printmaking as social commentary' curated by Elizabeth Rankin at the Gus Fisher Gallery (to 20 Aug), and sculpture and painting by Judy Darragh at Two Rooms (to 22 Jul)."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Old sails"
description: "Details the rescue and restoration of derelict wooden yachts Lizzie and Loloma by the Wellington Classic Yacht Trust. Talks to Gavin Pascoe and Phillipa Durkin about the attraction of fixing and sailing these old boats."

Author: "Chapman-Smith, Ben"
Title: "Taryn's volunteer efforts earn recognition in youth awards"
description: "Taryn's volunteer efforts earn recognition in youth awards"

Author: "Guerin, Michael"
Title: "Top trainer moving to Australia"
description: "Top trainer moving to Australia"

Author: "McCarthy, Angela"
Title: "Interpreting is rewarding and challenging"
description: "Interpreting is rewarding and challenging"

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "On guard around the world"
description: "Shares the work and social experiences of New Zealand Defence Force personnel stationed on peacekeeping operations in the Pacific, the Middle East,  Africa, and Southeast Asia."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Past deadlines"
description: "Talks to the former journalist  about his time with Associated Press and Radio New Zealand, his most memorable overseas assignments and some of his major NZ stories, from the Rainbow Warrior incident to the woolly sheep Shrek. Touches on his childhood, career and his Wairarapa olive grove."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Grieving family struggle to cope"
description: "Grieving family struggle to cope"

Author: "Hughes, Alistair"
Title: "Crate expectations"
description: "Presents the experience of the author (and that of his wife, Rose Hughes) of living in a shipping container while waiting to build a house in South Wairarapa. Discusses their plans to build an eco-home. Notes the author will be blogging the entire building experience."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "Tora on two wheels"
description: "Follows the author on his trip over the Wairarapa's first mountainbike track, ToraTora. Describes the development of the privately owned 3-4 grade trail by land owners Tom Elworthy and Kathryn Elworthy. Explains the origin of the track's name."

Author: "Gregor, Kelly"
Title: "Hotchin: I didn't show due care"
description: "Hotchin: I didn't show due care"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Singer resigns after admitting abuse"
description: "Singer resigns after admitting abuse"

Title: "Battle of Britain veteran dies at 92"
description: "Battle of Britain veteran dies at 92"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Haunted by death of partner and baby"
description: "Haunted by death of partner and baby"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Youth spared prison over crash into cop"
description: "Youth spared prison over crash into cop"

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "To buy or not to buy"
description: "Examines house purchasing in light of cautious optimism regarding economic recovery. Expresses surprise that lower house prices are now regarded positively and queries whether houses will always make a capital gain. Cites the comments of financial experts on the reaction of banks and the movement of interest rates, noting the constant background factor of global debt crises. Debates the pros and cons of renting and purchasing. Seeks comment and cautions from University of Auckland finance lecturer Mary Holm on whether now is a good time to invest in property. Includes observations by US crime writer Michael Connelly about continued financial crime in the wake of the subprime mortgage market collapse."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Is now a good time to buy property?"
description: "Examines house purchasing in light of cautious optimism regarding economic recovery. Expresses surprise that lower house prices are now regarded positively and queries whether houses will always make a capital gain. Cites the comments of financial experts on the reaction of banks and the movement of interest rates, noting the constant background factor of global debt crises. Debates the pros and cons of renting and purchasing. Seeks comment and cautions from University of Auckland finance lecturer Mary Holm on whether now is a good time to invest in property. Includes observations by US crime writer Michael Connelly about continued financial crime in the wake of the subprime mortgage market collapse."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "End of a dynasty?"
description: "Chronicles the implosion of Rupert Murdoch's media dynasty News Corp following recent scandals. Cites insights by the media mogul's biographer Michael Wolff. Details the involvement of News Corps in NZ media. Examines Murdoch's influence on British politics and politicians."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "The decline of the Murdoch empire"
description: "Chronicles the implosion of Rupert Murdoch's media dynasty News Corp following recent scandals. Cites insights by the media mogul's biographer Michael Wolff. Details the involvement of News Corps in NZ media. Examines Murdoch's influence on British politics and politicians."

Title: "Fresh mindset helps build better homes"
description: "Fresh mindset helps build better homes"

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Scaling Mt Fashion"
description: "Talks to the NZ born fashion director of the UK Daily Telegraph about her recent media award and  how she views fashion shows and fashion celebrities. Discusses her exotic tastes and her plans to study in her imminent retirement. Harks back to her journalistic beginnings at the Manawatu Standard."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Hilary Alexander"
description: "Talks to the NZ born fashion director of the UK Daily Telegraph about her recent media award and  how she views fashion shows and fashion celebrities. Discusses her exotic tastes and her plans to study in her imminent retirement. Harks back to her journalistic beginnings at the Manawatu Standard."

Author: "Tolerton, Jane"
Title: "Sawdust & solutions"
description: "Highlights the growth of community men's sheds in NZ, the hosting of a national conference by Henley Men's Shed, and the consequent formation of the Menzsheds organisation. Reports on the differing reasons that men come to and stay at the sheds, noting the camaraderie and health benefits that result from communal woodworking. Talks to the men who brought the movement from Australia to NZ. Speaks with shed members about their reasons for joining. Documents the history of community sheds."

Author: "Tolerton, Jane"
Title: "Blokes and sheds - reviving the male community"
description: "Highlights the growth of community men's sheds in NZ, the hosting of a national conference by Henley Men's Shed, and the consequent formation of the Menzsheds organisation. Reports on the differing reasons that men come to and stay at the sheds, noting the camaraderie and health benefits that result from communal woodworking. Talks to the men who brought the movement from Australia to NZ. Speaks with shed members about their reasons for joining. Documents the history of community sheds."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "'It's knocking up against great'"
description: "Sits in on an Auckland book group to hear their opinions on the finalists in the fiction section of the NZ Post Book Awards due for announcement on 27 Jul 2011."

Author: "Eriksen, Alanah"
Title: "Facebook tribute pages to dead student defaced"
description: "Facebook tribute pages to dead student defaced"

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Armour-plated mod"
description: "Reviews 'Ray Columbus: the Modfather - the life and times of a rock 'n' roll pioneer' by Ray Columbus with Margie Thomson."

Author: "Hay, Natasha"
Title: "Jesse's whirl"
description: "Talks to the former actor/reporter now producer/director about the ambitious projects and talented actors he works with. Discusses financing large projects, and his career plans. Seeks comments from a former English teacher to explain the director's success. Previews his upcoming stagings of Othello, Maidment Theatre, 22 Jul to 13 Aug, and The wizard of Oz, Civic, 10-18 Sep."

Author: "Smith, Hannah"
Title: "Root bound"
description: "Reviews 'An oak tree', written by Tim Crouch and directed by Andrew Foster at Circa Two, Wellington, until  30 Jul 2011."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Sounds annoying"
description: "Informs of research into the sound generated by wind farms and into turbine designs that may produce less noise. Reports on health problems that may be caused by wind turbine noise, and looks at why the constancy of the sound may be more serious than just being annoying."

Author: "Young, Audrey"
Title: "Pacific party sets tone for better relations"
description: "Looks at some of the recent efforts by the United States to reengage with the Pacific and NZ. Suggests that NZ's Pacific role is growing in value. Highlights a recent party held at the NZ Embassy in Washington DC, dubbed 'Pacific Night', that brought together State Department officials and the Pacific ambassadors posted to Washington DC and the United Nations (UN) to discuss some of the challenges facing the Pacific."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Engaged to rugby"
description: "Speaks to Dr Jennifer Curtin and Dr Greg Ryan about rugby's place in NZ society, which will be the focus of Auckland University's winter lecture series, 19 Jul to 23 Aug 2011. Talks about the passion for the game and the place of women in rugby."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Cow of a problem"
description: "Looks at the creation of such food innovations as hyperallergenic foods that can cause severe allergic reactions, focusing on dairy proteins in the Fonterra flavoured water product, 'Whole Water'. Notes the recent loss of funding for food allergy research, such as that conducted on the Fonterra product by University of Auckland specialist Dr Rohan Ameratunga."

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Trade chief on a tough mission"
description: "Speaks to the NZ Trade and Enterprise chief executive about the challenge of increasing NZ's export earnings and the agency's internal issues. Talks about a State Services Commission performance review that rated the agency poorly on aspects such as culture and values, engagement with ministers, leadership, governance and financial efficiency. Briefly compares NZ exports to those of Denmark, highlighting the Scandinavian country's diversification."

Author: "Johnson, Glen"
Title: "Human traffic"
description: "Follows a group of people smugglers taking refugee Ethiopians and Somalis on boats from Djibouti across the Gulf of Aden to (hopefully) a better life in South Yemen or Saudi Arabia.   Notes the market for human trafficking in the region and the level of corruption involved.   Speaks to a human trafficker about the operation.  Observes the ill treatment of the refugees."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Public puffers under pressure"
description: "Acknowledges the growing anti-smoking sentiment amongst legislators and society in general.  Mentions the Government's commitment to a smokefree NZ by 2025 but notes the recent failed attempt to implement a smokefree zone in the Auckland CDB.  Points to the passing of the Smokefree Environments (Controls and Enforcement) Amendment Bill.  Looks at antismoking efforts overseas.  Chats to smokers about their habit."

Author: "Gillies, Abby"
Title: "Dark disorder that preys on perfection"
description: "Chronicles the teenager's battle with anorexia beginning at age 11.  Chats to her and her father about the ordeal.  Acknowledges the incidence of the disorder in NZ.  Highlights the treatment services provided by Thrive, launched last year by Challenge Trust as the first dedicated eating disorders service in NZ."

Author: "Alderson, Andrew"
Title: "A simple matter of medals"
description: "Overviews NZ's best chances for medals at the 2012 London Olympics in the areas of rowing, track & field, triathlon, equestrian, cycling, and sailing."

Author: "Paul, Gregor,"
Title: "Black oops - what on earth were they thinking?"
description: "Sets out his top 10 All Black selection flops in recent years."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "Pike River safety failures aired"
description: "Reviews safety failures identified by mining inspectors and geologists during the first week of evidence heard by the royal commission of inquiry into the deaths of 29 mine workers after an explosion at the Pike River Coal mine in Nov 2011. Informs of the content and timing of the next phases of the inquiry. Details the failure to construct emergency exits."

Author: "Grunwell, Rachel"
Title: "The reno game"
description: "Recounts her experience of renovating a ramshackle Auckland villa bought on TradeMe.  Points out lessons learnt and gives some money saving tips and tricks."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Cover charge"
description: "Looks at pressures on the insurance industry of continuing earthquakes in the Christchurch area. Talks to Insurance Council chief executive Chris Ryan about the tensions between the reinsurers who insure the insurance companies and those involved in rebuilding the city. Describes the implications for commercial insurance in the future. Looks at legal issues arising around commercial leases and residential insurance."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "A valuable record of times past"
description: "Uncovers the legacy of news reports and photographs collected by the English born journalist of some fifty years of European settlement history in the North Canterbury and Christchurch areas. Reveals other family antiquities in the collection now held by collector Robin Rapely."

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Te reo : 'key to opening doors'"
description: "Backgrounds the Government's move to increase the use of te reo MaÃÑori into classrooms through the voluntary programme Tataiako. Speaks to Rongotai College music teacher Greg Crayford about the effect of using te reo on his students. Relays the Waitangi Tribunal views on why the language is in decline. Seeks the views of teacher representatives and academics on the programme. Supplies statistics on numbers of MaÃÑori speakers, MaÃÑori educational achievement, and teachers of te reo MaÃÑori."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Leading light of television journalism"
description: "Leading light of television journalism"

Title: "Skilled wartime pilot was calm in crisis"
description: "Skilled wartime pilot was calm in crisis"

Author: "McFadden, Suzanne"
Title: "The kids are all right"
description: "Speaks to six immigrant children about fitting in to their new country. Talks about why their parents came to NZ, school life, making friends, and the difference between NZ and their native countries."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Sitting targets"
description: "Reports on the effects of long hours of sitting on people's weight and related health problems such as blood clots. Explains what happens physiologically when people sit (or stand) for long periods. Mentions the long term effects of childhood fitness habits. Talks to a graphic designer who always stands while she works. Offers advice about how to break prolonged sitting or standing. Informs of medical, ergonomic, and official positions on workplace posture."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Framed"
description: "Looks at the top entries in the eighth annual 'Auckland photo day', NZ's largest photo competition, which took place on 11 Jun 2011."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "On guard around the world"
description: "Shares the work and social experiences of New Zealand Defence Force personnel stationed on peacekeeping operations in the Pacific, the Middle East,  Africa, and Southeast Asia."

Author: "Hill, David"
Title: "Big dreams hijacked by life's traps"
description: "Big dreams hijacked by life's traps"

Author: "Croot, James"
Title: "Pursuit of the trivial"
description: "Talks to screenwriter Gavin Strawhan about his latest television 13-part comedy drama 'Nothing trivial' to screen on TV One. Explains how he and Rachel Lang hit on the idea of writing about pub quizzes. Describes their writing partnership and touches on other shows he has written."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Survivor's emotions swing from euphoria to guilt"
description: "Survivor's emotions swing from euphoria to guilt"

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "The bigger picture"
description: "Reviews the book 'New Zealand : an illustrated history', edited by Diane Pivac with Frank Stark and Lawrence McDonald."

Author: "Hughes, Alistair"
Title: "Crate expectations"
description: "Presents the experience of the author (and that of his wife, Rose Hughes) of living in a shipping container while waiting to build a house in South Wairarapa. Discusses their plans to build an eco-home. Notes the author will be blogging the entire building experience."

Author: "Williams, Bronwyn"
Title: "Heel appeal"
description: "Asks why people find high heels so enduringly alluring despite the health risks of wearing them. Looks at the history of shoes with a heightened heel. Talks to the experts Kathryn Wilson (shoe designer), Michiko Hylands (style director for TVNZ) and Fiona Hawtin (editor of Fashion Quarterly magazine) about the good and bad points of wearing them."

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "Pair share their love of a coffee in the garden"
description: "Pair share their love of a coffee in the garden"

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Alcohol industry's unhealthy influence"
description: "Comments on the findings of two recent studies reported in the British Medical Journal to reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease. Queries the claim that alcohol in moderation is beneficial to health. Looks at the government's stance on alcohol reform."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "Internet on the TV"
description: "Introduces the latest technology in television, internet-enabled TV. Focuses on its features and how this will change peoples' internet and TV viewing experiences."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Restless leg syndrome"
description: "Explains the affliction of restless leg syndrome (RLS), a common movement disorder. Talks to a severe sufferer about her condition and how she deals with it. Informs of the different types of RLS and the medication available for these."

Author: "Harvey, Siobhan,"
Title: "Laurence Fearnley"
description: "Talks to author Laurence Fearnley about her writing and her inspiration to create her current novel. Reviews the best-selling NZ Post Book Award shortlisted novel The hut builder."

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Tantalising docos at the NZ Film Festival"
description: "Tantalising docos at the NZ Film Festival"

Author: "Tattersfield, Brad"
Title: "Sir Ed Hillary's legacy"
description: "Visits Khumbu, the Everest region of Nepal, where Sir Edmund Hilary (and later the Himalayan Trust) built 27 schools. Reports on the Khumjung School 50th anniversary celebrations and talks to Sir Ed's son, Peter and Lady Hillary about the community environmental work that is being maintained there. Discusses their dilemmas over the future role and direction of the Himalayan Trust."

Author: "Pryor, Nicole"
Title: "Dame Jane Goodall"
description: "Backgrounds Dame Jane Goodall's career as a primatologist and anthropologist. Discusses her current role and work as a UN Messenger for Peace."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Social media campaigns - legitimate protest?"
description: "Discusses the power of protest campaigns through social media such as Facebook and Twitter. Talks to booksellers who have been influenced by social media campaigns."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "John Hovell interview"
description: "Profiles John Hovell, a kowhaiwhai artist, and a NZ Post Book Awards non-fiction finalist. Reviews his book 'The passing world : the passage of life, John Hovell and the art of kowhaiwhai'."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Stress - cause, effect, and management"
description: "Speaks to local GPs in Christchurch about the increases in anxiety / stress related illnesses due to the earthquakes. Discusses research about how the immune system and nervous system can be affected by stress. Talks to professor Andrew Hill, head of Auckland's South Auckland Clinical School about his findings from a study about relaxation after surgery and its affect on recovery rates. Gives advice on beating stress."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "The Saguaro Trio"
description: "Profiles musical group the Saguaro Trio, who are due to make their first NZ tour July 20-August 10, 2011."

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Cowards left my girl to die, says mother"
description: "Cowards left my girl to die, says mother"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Young boffin just as happy on farm"
description: "Young boffin just as happy on farm"

Title: "Zest for life 'Jambassador' role"
description: "Zest for life 'Jambassador' role"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Wind farms an audible annoyance"
description: "Informs of research into the sound generated by wind farms and into turbine designs that may produce less noise. Reports on health problems that may be caused by wind turbine noise, and looks at why the constancy of the sound may be more serious than just being annoying."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "New Zealand Post Book awards 2011- Listener judging panel"
description: "Sits in on an Auckland book group to hear their opinions on the finalists in the fiction section of the NZ Post Book Awards due for announcement on 27Jul 2011."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Ray Columbus: the Modfather by Ray Columbus with Margie Thomson review"
description: "Reviews 'Ray Columbus: the Modfather - the life and times of a rock 'n' roll pioneer' by Ray Columbus with Margie Thomson."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Hyper-allergenic foods risk to lives"
description: "Looks at the creation of such food innovations as hyperallergenic foods that can cause severe allergic reactions, focusing on dairy proteins in the Fonterra flavoured water product, 'Whole Water'. Notes the recent loss of funding for food allergy research, such as that conducted on the Fonterra product by University of Auckland specialist Dr Rohan Ameratunga."

Author: "O'Brien, Louise"
Title: "The Trouble with Fire by Fiona Kidman review"
description: "The Trouble with Fire by Fiona Kidman review"

Author: "Quigley, Sarah"
Title: "The hill of wool by Jenny Bornholdt"
description: "The hill of wool by Jenny Bornholdt"

Author: "Marquet, Sarah"
Title: "Nicole is a business owner at 17; Filling gap in market"
description: "Meets two teenaged women who are already running their own businesses: the Shark and Taties fish, chip and ice cream shop and Cheri Formal Wear, respectively,"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Gran's makes tracks around the world"
description: "Talks to Jim Reay, accountant and chief executive of the firm that manufactures foot powders, about its global growth since the firm's inception in the 1980s. Discusses some of its overseas markets."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1908"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1908. Reports on the 'chaos' in the district caused by an 'almost continuous downpour during the last fortnight', 9 Jul 1908. Provides brief updates on 19 Jul 1908 and 29 Aug 1908. Comments on progress being made on establishing a free public library in the city, 3 Dec 1908. Touches on other events during the year. Includes a photograph of nurses shovelling snow outside Naseby Hospital."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Revolutionised NZ theatre"
description: "Pays tribute to the late co-founder of the Globe Theatre, Dunedin. Informs that she and her late husband revolutionised NZ theatre by establishing the first purpose-built theatre run by professional directors. Mentions her upbringing in the Waikato and traces her career."

Author: "Cryer, Max"
Title: "Huge contribution to NZ entertainment"
description: "Pays tribute to the late English-born musician and conductor. Traces his career in television with the BBC and TVNZ."

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "New OUSA president to be prisoner of beliefs"
description: "Profiles the new president of the Otago University Students Association (OUSA), who won a landslide victory in Jun 2011 despite being a political novice. Talks about his plans to spend 48 hours in prison as part of an ongoing OUSA campaign against the Education (Freedom of Association) Amendment Bill, a private member's Bill sponsored by retired Act MP Heather Roy that would make university student association membership voluntary."

Author: "Conway, Matt"
Title: "Trails and tribulations; Gorge trail misgivings"
description: "Focuses on delays and impediments to the completion of the Roxburgh Gorge Trail, a 34-kilometre cycle trail from Alexandra to the Roxburgh dam and part of the NZ Cycle Trail. Talks to Roxburgh Gorge Trail Trust (RGT Trust) chair Stephen Jeffery and Clutha Gold Trail chairman Rod Peirce about the perceived tourism benefits to the region, and a recent proposal to include a cycling-boating combination trail to overcome problems with obtaining access through privately owned and leased properties. Talks to some of those who will be affected, including retired schooteachers Ruth Huwes and Colin Huwes, who have built a guest retreat on the Clutha River banks and are opposed to the trails. Seeks views of other local residents including Lake Roxburgh Lodge owners Kim Winterbottom and Phil Winterbottom, who favour the trail to revitalise the area. Includes an extensive timeline of events on both cycle trails from 2006 to the present."

Author: "Vine, Geoffrey"
Title: "Church historian shies from analysing rich seam at which core samples hint;"
description: "Church historian shies from analysing rich seam at which core samples hint;"

Author: "Scherer, Jule"
Title: "Right here quite soon"
description: "Talks to drummer Hamish Gee of the quartet about their new top-charting album and tour. Discusses the controversy over the decision of Rugby World Cup (RWC) 2011 organisers to use their version of the Jesus Jones song 'Right here right now' as the official RWC song. Mentions local touring dates."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Emerging from the shadows"
description: "Talks to Lubin Raines, frontman for the Auckland-based quintet about the process of recording their debut eponymous album. Mentions a local touring date."

Title: "Dance, then, wherever you may be"
description: "Interviews the owner and principal of the RASA School of Dance about her work."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1909"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1909. Reports in the 27 Apr 1909 edition on the arrest of the Victoria-born woman who carried out a series of petty crimes under the name of Percy Carol Redwood and Leonard Percival Carol Redwood. Describes the wedding of Leonard Percival Carol Redwood to Miss Ottaway, and her subsequent arrest.  Briefly reports on 24 Jun 1909 of the completion of Knox College. Describes a gathering of British warships in Otago Harbour, 4 Jan 1909. Sums up proceedings of a public meeting in Christchurch to discuss the growing difficulty of obtaining suitable girls for employment as domestic servants, 1 Apr 1909.  Includes a photograph of men packing peaches in Roxburgh."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Wills promises more collaborative approach; Maxwell maximising role as executive; Jeanette maximising meat sector executive role"
description: "Talks to the newly elected national president of Federated Farmers, succeeding Don Nicolson.  Discusses the high level of interest in the position, his background in banking and farming, and the challenges of the role. Mentions the other board members who were elected. Speaks to the mid-Canterbury farmer who was recently elected as the national meat and fibre chairwoman of Federated Farmers, the first woman to be elected to the national board. Overviews her career."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Interest in merino born in childhood"
description: "Profiles the woman who has built a successful career as a merino sheep breeder. Mentions the influence of her upbringing on the remote Halfway Bay Station near Lake Wakatipu. Overviews her career in the industry in Australia and NZ. Describes a trip to a merino stud and other properties in South Africa, Sep 2010, aimed at increasing productivity."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1910"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1910. Comments, in the 11 Feb 1910 edition, on the government announcement to remove the searchlight that forms part of the defence works at Taiaroa Heads and move it to Auckland or Wellington. Focuses on the aftermath of the sinking of the steamer 'S.S. Waikare' at Dusky Sound, 4 Jan 1910, as reported on 5, 8-9 and 20 Jan 1910. Includes a photograph of some of the passengers shortly after the vessel was beached. Sums up a presentation by Dr Slaughter on the science of eugenics, Victoria University of Wellington, reported on 6 Jan 1910. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Who's pulling the strings?"
description: "Talks to public lawyer Mai Chen about the mistrust between government and business that fuels lobbying. Defines the term 'lobbyist' and  why it has come into disrepute, sparking Green MP Sue Kedgley to propose a Lobbyist Code of Conduct Bill. Talks to lobbyists Mark Unsworth and Barrie Saunders about ethics and why they have lobbied for such groups as Philip Morris tobacco. Relays the views of former Finance Minister Michael Cullen on being lobbied and whether financial corruption exists in NZ.  Lists some of the people and groups who are lobbying. Solicits comments from investigative journalist Nicky Hager about four techniques used by lobbyists."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Taking risks and turning up; Taking risks and turning up every day : Joel Tobeck's long road to success"
description: "Speaks to the California-based actor about his latest coup, a new role on the hit United States show 'Sons of anarchy'. Looks back on his career, which has included stints as a musician, radio personality, dancer and stand-up comedian. Talks about how his parents, actors Liddy Holloway and Bryan Tobeck, helped set him on his acting path."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "A big dose of love and kindness"
description: "Visits children's hospice Rainbow Place in Hamilton, describing its flexible care for children who are dying or dealing with the death of others.  Notes this type of service is new in NZ and that the hospice has recently been reviewed. Talks to a Te Aroha family about assistance they receive from the hospice with their sick child. Speaks with hospice nurse Gail Sargent and manager Penny Parsons about their roles at the institution."

Author: "Broatch, Mark"
Title: "How to write a book"
description: "Asks whether creative writing can be taught and if writing groups are helpful, canvassing the view of industry experts Harriet Allan and Susanna Andrew; academics Emily Perkins, Bill Manhire and Fay Weldon; and authors Owen Marshall, Carl Nixon, Craig Cliff, David Baddiel, Charlotte Grimshaw and Joy Cowley."

Author: "Matthews, Lee"
Title: "Candidate's rural roots run deep"
description: "Candidate's rural roots run deep"

Author: "White, Tina"
Title: "The man who gave us rugby --- as we know it"
description: "The man who gave us rugby --- as we know it"

Author: "Matthews , Lee"
Title: "Feilding farewells everyone's Uncle Jimmy"
description: "Feilding farewells everyone's Uncle Jimmy"

Author: "Matthews , Lee"
Title: "Former principal was 'people person'"
description: "Former principal was 'people person'"

Author: "Bidwell, Hamish"
Title: "In plain English, moving south was a shock"
description: "In plain English, moving south was a shock"

Author: "Fensome, Alex"
Title: "Boat-sinking mystery to be remembered"
description: "Boat-sinking mystery to be remembered"

Author: "Wright, Don"
Title: "Price's other life at the track"
description: "Price's other life at the track"

Title: "Veteran survived torpedo attack"
description: "Veteran survived torpedo attack"

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "The art of healing"
description: "Describes the results of an agreement between the Dept of Corrections and Mairangi Arts Centre to set up an art rehabilitation programme for prisoners in the Ngawha and Auckland prisons. Hears from ex prisoner and carving tutor Matt Beazley about his criminal background, and how prison helped him to discover his talent for carving and teaching. Notes the role of prisons in inmates' learning about MaÃÑori culture. Talks to NZ's most prolific and successful producer of prison art about his source of inspiration and his future plans. Touches on public reaction to exhibitions of prisoner art."

Author: "Mackrell, Judith"
Title: "A leap into the unknown"
description: "Presents an interview with the new US director of the Royal New Zealand Ballet (RNZB). Asks the New York City Ballet dancer and choreographer what he knows about NZ, his reasons for coming here with his ballerina fiancee Gillian Murphy, and his plans for RNZB productions. Gives an assessement of the state of the ballet company, its identity and repertory. Talks to an expatriate NZ choreographer about his reasons for leaving NZ. (This interview was printed originally in the Guardian News & Media.)"

Author: "White, Helen Watson"
Title: "Incendiary tales capture reality"
description: "Incendiary tales capture reality"

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "In honour"
description: "Talks to Rob Tuwhare about the launch of a new book featuring his father's poems, including some never before published. Notes the aim of the Hone Tuwhare Charitable Trust to create a writers' residence at the poet's crib at Kaka Point, south Otago. Touches on the MaÃÑori translations contained in the upcoming book.  Contains a sidebar featuring two poems: 'Sun-rise' and 'Sensual nourishment'."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Best boy"
description: "Talks to the Aucklander about what is involed in his job as second in charge of lighting on film and TV sets, how he entered the industry and his future plans."

Author: "Greive, Duncan"
Title: "Fashion forwards"
description: "Talks to three young men who used the New Zealand Fashion Week in Sep 2010 as a springboard into furthering their careers in the fashion industry. Profiles stylist Nicholas Parnell, fashion designer intern Damon Woolf,  and jeweller Nick Klarwill."

Author: "Boyes, Nicola"
Title: "Prolife foods buys Donovans Chocolates"
description: "Prolife foods buys Donovans Chocolates"

Title: "Jury is still out in Tongan ferry trial"
description: "Jury is still out in Tongan ferry trial"

Title: "Duncan milks it for all it's worth"
description: "Duncan milks it for all it's worth"

Title: "Brother and sisters make water their home"
description: "Brother and sisters make water their home"

Title: "We're right up there with the best"
description: "We're right up there with the best"

Title: "Firefighter modest over Icepak role"
description: "Firefighter modest over Icepak role"

Title: "Family proud of good Samaritan's posthumous award"
description: "Family proud of good Samaritan's posthumous award"

Title: "Night-time mountain dash saves his friend"
description: "Night-time mountain dash saves his friend"

Title: "Chords & other poems by Sam Hunt"
description: "Chords & other poems by Sam Hunt"

Author: "Smith, Hannah"
Title: "An Oak Tree by Tim Crouch review"
description: "Reviews 'An oak tree', written by Tim Crouch and directed by Andrew Foster at Circa Two, Wellington, until  30 Jul 2011."

Author: "Reid, Nicholas,"
Title: "The movie may be slightly different"
description: "The movie may be slightly different"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1911"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1911. Reports in the 10 Feb 1911 edition about a successful aeroplane flight at Papakura on 9 Feb 1911 by Aucklander Mr V. Walsh,  in a plane planned and built in Auckland by his brother, Mr Leo. Walsh. Recounts the details of a fire in the 1 Jul 1911 edition at the R. Hudson and Co. biscuit and confectionery manufacturer, Castle Street, Dunedin, 30 Jun 1911, which nearly destroyed the factory. Announces the death of the nonagenarian showman who was known for his display of white rats in various shows in the Dominion, 14 Jul 1911. Provides further information about the former able seaman from the 'Oamaru Mail', published in the 21 Jul 1911 edition. Celebrates the 51st year of existence of the 'Otago Daily Times', 15 Nov 1911, and reflects on its first 50 years. Includes a photograph of a Buick car owned by Mr J. Mills that became caught in a tree at Hangman's Gully, near Dunedin."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Home truths"
description: "Looks at the effect of the recent Christchurch earthquakes on home insurance premiums and reinsurance. Supplies figures on the insurance cost of recent natural disasters. Looks at increases in contracting with international reinsurers and why some reinsurers are withdrawing from the market. Asks if NZ households may eventually be without comprehensive protection or be refused insurance on the basis of house inspections. Gives tips on what to look for when buying insurance and outlines the key issues arising from claims in Christchurch. Touches on how insurance company AMI has fared in the wake of the recent earthquakes."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1912"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1912. Focuses on the sinking of the 'Titanic', as reported on 17 Apr 1912, and updated on 19 and 20 Apr 1912. Includes a photograph of the newspaper depicting the sinking on 18 Apr 1912. Reprints a letter to the editor from 'A Lover of the Land', providing an economic justification for why 'men gravitate to the town' rather than seeking work in the country, 20 Apr 1912. Reports on the visit of South Pole explorer Captain Roald Amundsen to present his lecture on 'How I reached the Pole', His Majesty's Theatre, Dunedin, 20 Apr 1912."

Author: "Cannan, Dave"
Title: "Successful retailer and racing owner"
description: "Successful retailer and racing owner"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Man of many talents - and generous to boot"
description: "Man of many talents - and generous to boot"

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "Senseless sentencing"
description: "Laments the lack of drug or alcohol counselling or rehabilitation in NZ prisons despite the percentage of prisoners whose crimes are related to drug and alcohol problems. Talks to Wellington drug and alcohol counsellor Roger Brooking about the vicious cycle many offenders are caught in, discussing the book he has written on the failure of the court and prison system to deal with recidivism. Presents political views on the building of prisons, noting the amount currently spent on rehabilitation. Looks at the increasing cost and effectiveness of incarcerating people. Notes the effect of the Sensible Sentencing Trust's penal populism and contrasts it to the approach taken in Finland. Presents Brooking's ideas for changes to the penal policy and prisons."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "The cello connection"
description: "Talks to the William Evans executant lecturer in cello at the University of Otago about the group 'Cellists of Otago', which presents its next concert at Marama Hall, 27 Jul 2011. Discusses the camaraderie amongst cellists and overviews the history of cello choirs in Dunedin."

Title: "Birthing payouts become saw point"
description: "Birthing payouts become saw point"

Author: "Body, Ralph"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'NUZ : Spirit of ewe' by Sarah Lucas, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until 2 Oct 2011. Reviews 'New ceramic works' by Liz Fea, Blue Black and Robert Rapson, Quadrant Gallery, Dunedin, until 30 Jul 2011.  Reviews 'Remix' by Tony de Latour, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin."

Title: "Exporter makes most of Wanaka lifestyle"
description: "Exporter makes most of Wanaka lifestyle"

description: "Evans after cash boost to compete"

Title: "Art display a dream coming to fruition"

Title: "Family's questions go unanswered at inquest"

Title: "Boss was always one of the boys in the shed"
description: "Boss was always one of the boys in the shed"

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Poor things"
description: "Talks to British health inequality expert Sir Michael Marmot who has been speaking to NZers about why the poor die sooner than the rich. Outlines the health problems and statistics of the poor in NZ, looking at the factors in poor health. Relays Marmot's suggestion that we look at social causes rather than individual choices and emphasises the effect of people having  no sense of control over their lives. Scans the six point plan on health inequality drawn up by Marmot, and notes some of the points in a 10 point plan drawn up by NZ medical and academic organisations."

Author: "Hepburn, Steve"
Title: "Regrets, but Soakai looks forward to new life"
description: "Regrets, but Soakai looks forward to new life"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1913"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1913. Focuses on the death of Captain Scott and three others of his party after reaching the South Pole on 18 Jan 1913, as reported in the 12 Feb 1912 edition. Reprints some of a telegram received in Wellington relaying the sad news, and informs that it explains the actions of Lieutenant Pennell and Dr Atkinson, who came ashore on 10 Feb 1913 from the 'Terra Nova' to send the telegram to Wellington, as reported in the 11 Feb 1912 edition. Includes a photograph of Captain Scott and the polar party at the South Pole in Jan 1912. Reports on the wreck of the S.S. 'Tyrone' at Wahine Point, 27 Sep 1913, as reported in the 29 Sep 1913 edition. Touches on other events during the year."

Title: "Ice and sport of curling played a big part in his life"

description: "Fine Otago sporting all-rounder"

Title: "Fugitive excelled in adopted land"
description: "Fugitive excelled in adopted land"

Author: "Casinader, Jehan"
Title: "Escaping poverty's grip"
description: "Looks at the effect of NZ funding on impoverished areas of Sri Lanka. Describes the Batticaloa region of Sri Lanka where harvests were damaged by floods in Jan 2011, and where some ChildFund projects depend wholly on NZ funds. Chronicles some of the improvements in housing and education enabled by the financial assistance."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Clean sweep for five generations"
description: "Clean sweep for five generations"

Title: "Otago graduate became leading neuroanatomist of his generation"
description: "Otago graduate became leading neuroanatomist of his generation"
