Title: "'Nothing' proves hard for family to take"
description: "'Nothing' proves hard for family to take"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Life-changer"
description: "Talks to Ann Andrews about her experience of Parkinson's disease, from diagnosis at age 59 to her decision to write a book aimed at those with the disease who still have some control over their body. Relays her recommendation for speech therapy, and conveys her practical and realistic approach to life."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Colostrum conundrum"
description: "Defines bovine colostrum and looks at the evidence for its health benefits. Explains the role of immunoglobulin (IgG) and touches on dose levels, industry standards, and the scant research done to date."

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Small-town man with a big heart"
description: "Small-town man with a big heart"

Title: "Welcome to the Anthropocene"
description: "Informs of the suggestion to use the term Anthropocene instead of Holocene to refer to the epoch that began 12,000 years ago. Talks to palaeontologist Hamish Campbell about what Anthropocene fossils might be found in NZ in 10,000 years' time and what is the most profound impact of humans on the planet."

Title: "Duck season opens with fatal shooting"

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Hot spots in a cold market"
description: "Discusses the current property market, and buyers and sellers changing behaviours since the market peaked 3 years ago. States some statistics from Quotable Value research concerning how long houses are owned before they are sold. Comments on the Auckland house market trends around the suburbs and other parts of the country."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Syndications on comeback trail"
description: "Talks to Mark Winter, director of Oyster Group about property syndications on supermarket outlets."

Title: "Wine land mortgagee sales flood market"
description: "Reports on the increased numbers of wine properties on the market with new mortgagee offerings and the lack of buyers."

Title: "Nathans' verdict sends 'clear signal'"
description: "Reports on the High Court case against three directors of Nathans Finance NZ Ltd. Comments on the implications set from the High Court's verdict connected with section 58 of the Securities Act."

Title: "New era of professionalism for financial advisers"
description: "Comments on the new rules administered by the Financial Markets Authority (FMA) as from 1 July, 2011. Talks to FMA chief executive Sean Hughes about the importance of the new rules to restore investor confidence in the financial markets. Briefly outlines the three types of advisers the new rules provide for."

Author: "Nash, Kieran"
Title: "A town for sale : why does no one want to live here?"
description: "Profiles the town of Ohura, a small settlement of 165 people at the last census count, and where the Ruapehu District Council is putting up abandoned land and property for tender. Gives details of the reasons people have departed from Ohura.  Indicates this has much to do with the closing of the local coal mines and the buying out of small farms in the area. Includes comments from local people as to why they live on Ohura."

Title: "Tireless worker for Hakataramea"
description: "Tireless worker for Hakataramea"

Title: "Victims fight the system"
description: "Looks at the issue of formal victim-impact statements made by parents of murder victims and the ability of the court to censor them. Includes the views of some families who have lost a child through murder."

Author: "Wade, Amelia"
Title: "Veteran writer's winning book an absolute treasure, say judges"
description: "Veteran writer's winning book an absolute treasure, say judges"

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Winter veges real savers"
description: "Argues it is best to buy seasonal vegetables rather than buy vegetable fruit and vegetables out of season which inevitably means they are more expensive. Notes which vegetables and fruits are best sellers at present. Recommends in season vegetables by name."

Author: "Johannsen, Dana"
Title: "George holds off decision on future until after world champs"
description: "George holds off decision on future until after world champs"

Title: "Johnson in hunt for Olympic spot"
description: "Johnson in hunt for Olympic spot"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Kiwi Atlantic rower holds hopes of nation in his hands"
description: "Reports although NZers have claimed the trans-Atlantic race crown in its first three guises they have since slipped off the pace. NZ has not been on the leader board since 2003 but notes 45 year-old Noel Watkins and Kevin Kean are hoping to change that. Describes the challenges of crossing oceans indicating it tests the bounds of human limits, mentally and physically."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "The dawning of the age of Anthropocene"
description: "Informs of the suggestion to use the term Anthropocene instead of Holocene to refer to the epoch that began 12,000 years ago. Talks to palaeontologist Hamish Campbell about what Anthropocene fossils might be found in NZ in 10,000 years' time and what is the most profound impact of humans on the planet."

Author: "Sell, Bronwyn"
Title: "My happy place : Duncan Loney"
description: "Relates the experience of Duncan Loney, CEO and chairman of Bakels and a judge in the 15th annual Bakels NZ Supreme Pie Awards as to what makes a good pie. Notes that the final winner is chosen from eleven pies that can be difficult to judge as the pies can have various different contents."

Author: "Bowron, Jane,"
Title: "What was I thinking : a memoir by Paul Henry"
description: "What was I thinking : a memoir by Paul Henry"

Author: "Lomas, David"
Title: "Problems with our justice system"
description: "Laments the lack of drug or alcohol counselling or rehabilitation in NZ prisons despite the percentage of prisoners whose crimes are related to drug and alcohol problems. Talks to Wellington drug and alcohol counsellor Roger Brooking about the vicious cycle many offenders are caught in, discussing the book he has written on the failure of the court and prison system to deal with recidivism. Presents political views on the building of prisons, noting the amount currently spent on rehabilitation. Looks at the increasing cost and effectiveness of incarcerating people. Notes the effect of the Sensible Sentencing Trust's penal populism and contrasts it to the approach taken in Finland. Presents Brooking's ideas for changes to the penal policy and prisons."

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "Good taste in one place"
description: "Relates what has been added to Auckland's Food Show. Indicates there are going to be one hour long master classes, watching food demonstrations in a theatre and names three exhibitions relating to cheese, savour recipes and pasta."

Author: "Casinader, Jehan"
Title: "Sri Lanka - poverty in Batticaloa"
description: "Looks at the effect of NZ funding on impoverished areas of Sri Lanka. Describes the Batticaloa region of Sri Lanka where harvests were damaged by floods in Jan 2011, and where some ChildFund projects depend wholly on NZ funds. Chronicles some of the improvements in housing and education enabled by the financial assistance."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Peak season"
description: "Looks at two ski fields, Mt. Ruapehu and Coronet Peak to find out what is on offer at each place. Includes a schedule of competitions when some of NZ's and the world's best skiers will be training and competing on Coronet Peak."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Search for All Black's pregnant relative"
description: "Search for All Black's pregnant relative"

Author: "Davison, Isaac"
Title: "Healthier kids for 20c a day"
description: "Notes a Waikato project, 'Project Energize', involving 44,000 children in 244 schools has managed a 3 percent drop in obesity since 2005. Reveals the project involved 27 'energizers' and a dietician who worked along side teachers and students in encouraging physical activity and healthy diets. Estimates the economic savings of the programme and the improvement in behaviour and learning of the pupils."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "'Devil' facing jail after jury hands guilty verdict to P boss"
description: "'Devil' facing jail after jury hands guilty verdict to P boss"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "All pain, no gain for hip patients"
description: "Looks at the situation where a particular artificial hip, the ASR system (Articular Surface Replacement) produced by medical device maker DePuy has been recalled in August 2010. Notes "criticism of the ASR includes that its design did not allow a practical margin for input error, that it risked 'edge loading', that the cup was too thin and susceptible to losing shape, and that clearance between ball and cup was too small." Recounts the history of ASR joint use and events leading up to its eventual recall. Includes Medsafe's response to the question as to whether the ASR devices were safe."

description: "Looks into the fatal shooting of Antony Ratahi who held his ex-girlfriend, Marcelle Beer hostage in the Opunake Hotel. Raises the question about the effectiveness of legal orders meant to protect vulnerable women. Notes the difficulty of policing protection and trespass orders particularly with a determined offender. Talks to Marcelle Beer describing the events leading up to her being taken hostage. Gains opinion of how dangerous it is for women in violent relationships and discusses issues with protection and trespass orders. Includes a list of profiles for offenders from the Shine Anti-domestic Abuse Agency."

Title: "Some things have got to change"
description: "Talks to Shane Bosher, Silo Theatre artistic director, after he arrived back in NZ after immersing himself in the theatre world in New York for a month. Notes he travelled to New York, funded by a grant from Creative NZ to gain inspiration and ideas on how to change Silo Theatre so it can become a viable proposition. Goes on to discuss the issues associated with sources of funding for the Silo Theatre and how they calculate what amount is given and the possibility and difficulties of corporate funding. Comments on the need to consider real estate, the theatre having a permanent home."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "When truth is stranger than fiction"
description: "Reviews the play 'I love you, Bro" performed at the Herald Theatre, July 28-August 20. Talks about the plot being hardly believable but is based on fact and perhaps happening in the real world more often than we think. Notes the plot is based on a 14 year-old boy who was convicted of inciting someone to murder him."

Title: "Pure abstration has its assertive place"
description: "Reviews 'Paintings and paperworks' by Leigh Martin at Fox/Jensen Gallery to August 13; 'Day Tripped' by Marie Le Lievre at Antoinette Godkin Gallery to July 30; 'Remembering John Mulgan' by Stanley Palmer at Melanie Roger Gallery to July 30; 'Landscapes' by Steve Woodward, 'Birds' by Grant Whibley at Whitespace to July 30."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "Architect's body of work honoured"
description: "Architect's body of work honoured"

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "A break in service"
description: "Looks at the level of service in the hospitality industry with the prospect of the Rugby World Cup soon to start. Indicates Professor Nigel Hemmington, who is dean of Auckland University of Technology's Faculty of Applied Humanities (the faculty that runs the Hospitality and Tourism School) suggests service staff should see themselves as 'experience creators', 'personal gastronomic consultants' and asserts staff are central to the provision of good service. Outlines the attributes of ideal service and comments on the practice of tipping."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry"
Title: "A law unto herself"
description: "Talks to Nadine Loren, a lawyer, turned actress, turned singer/songwriter about making it in California. Notes who Nadine Lorine is mixing with in the music industry in Los Angeles. Details her other careers leading up to singing and song writing and notes how her first attempt at recording her singing came about."

Author: "Kenworthy, Andy"
Title: "Stepping out"
description: "Asserts that barefoot or 'natural' running has become a global trend and indicates it has strongly affected the running shoe industry. Evaluates whether running barefoot is more injurious to your body than running with taylor made running shoes. Investigates the use of 'minimal shoes' and how these can be used in limited circumstances."

Title: "Your pass to the red zone"
description: "Presents an aerial view of the central business district (CBD) red zone of the earthquake damaged city. Includes some ground level images. Notes that the photographs were taken on 8 Jul 2011."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Final deadline for newspaper home"
description: "Presents a brief history of the earthquake damaged 'The Press' building on Cathedral Square, home of the newspaper from 1909 to 2011, as its demolition begins. Recalls memories of the building as experienced by the reporter over the last 43 years."

Title: "Seeing the future in clear water"
description: "Seeing the future in clear water"

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Brain boxes"
description: "Follows a group of bright secondary school pupils (brainiacs) at a medical school quiz about brains. Describes how they progress through the elimination process towards qualifying for the world championships to be held in Florence. Notes the background of the students participating in the quiz.  Reveals Byung-Cheio Cho (Auckland Grammar) being the eventual individual winner, along with Fuma Naito (Westlake Boys), Kaustubha Ghate (Auckland Grammar) in second and third place respectively. Auckland Grammar collecting the team accolade."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Fracking : yes or no?"
description: "Reports that the controversial mining practice of fracking, which may trigger earthquakes and contaminate drinking water, could get the go-ahead in Canterbury. Speaks to Dr Paul White, senior groundwater scientist for GNS Science, Green Party environment spokesperson David Clendon, and West Coast-based geologist Dr Murry Cave, of Western Exploration, about the possible impact of the process on the region, and to L&M Energy managing director Kent Anson about the company's applications. Explains how fracking works. Briefly outlines some overseas fracking issues, including an Australian senate inquiry into its use in the coalmines of New South Wales and Queensland."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "It's all arranged"
description: "Talks to two Sikh couples in the Waikato who are in arranged marriages. Describes the modern day process of arranging marriage. Conveys the couples' feelings about arranged versus 'love' marriages. Introduces the uncle of the two husbands, Harkrishen Kung, who received a Queen's Service Medal in 2011 for his work in Indian community. Gives approximate statistics for arranged marriages in NZ, noting the recent creation of a culturally arranged marriage visa. Touches on reports by the Shakti Commmunity Council of NZ cases of women in forced marriages."

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Carrying on calmly even when pigs fly"
description: "Talks to the new chief sensor about how he deals with watching objectionable material. Gives details about his educational and career background and lists his personal interests. Cites comments from ex work colleagues about his sense of humour, his insatiable appetite for learning and his suitability for the job. Mentions his collection of flying pigs."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Taking a hard look at what we breathe in"
description: "Reports on ongoing research by the National Institute of Water and Atmosphere (Niwa) into traffic related air pollution and its health risks for children. Talks to Niwa scientist Dr Ian Longely about the method of collecting roadside samples, noting several Auckland and Hamilton sites that have breached World Health Organisation guidelines. Lists and describes the main roadside air contaminants."

Author: "Gray, Wynne"
Title: "All Black captain to stick with the jersey"
description: "All Black captain to stick with the jersey"

Author: "Haywood, David"
Title: "On your bike"
description: "Argues that the post-earthquake rebuilding period is the time to create a high-quality cycling infrastructure in Christchurch. Points to the successful Copenhagen method of encouraging people to commute by bicycle, which is usually known as 'Copenhagenisation'. Calculates how many litres of petrol would be saved in the city if people cycled at the same rate as those of Copenhagen. Considers the effects of cycling on public health. Touches on the results of an economic study in Portland, Oregon, after it underwent a Copenhagenisation in 2008. Looks at what needs to be done in the city to create a cycle network that appeals to commuters."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Life spent in the service of job, family, friends and the Ories"
description: "Life spent in the service of job, family, friends and the Ories"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "A tireless worker on behalf of women"
description: "A tireless worker on behalf of women"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "LWR stalwart built Canterbury brand worldwide"
description: "LWR stalwart built Canterbury brand worldwide"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Waging war on and off the pitch; time lessens anger on both sides of wire"
description: "Profiles ten NZers who were involved in the anti apartheid protests during the Springboks 1981 tour of NZ. Details the roles they played, how they now view the event, and what they are doing now.  Talks to lawyer Rob Moodie, Unite Union head John Minto, student Lisa Sacksen,  Graham Atkin, builder Marx Jones, Wellington city councillor Ray Ahipene-Mercer, Allan Hewson, detective Grant O'Fee, former MP Ross Meurant, and radio commentator Brendan Telfer."

Author: "Barlow, Jack"
Title: "Captain of beleagured Springboks looks back at 1981"
description: "Talks to then South African Springbok captain Wynand Claassen about the 1981 rugby tour of NZ, relaying how he felt as he and his team huddled in the Hamilton changing room while protestors stormed the rugby field. Assesses how it influenced his thinking on apartheid."

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "Keeping calm and carrying on"
description: "Looks at the process of recovery from the Canterbury earthquakes for the region's manufacturing sector. Speaks to a number of local manufacturers and industry leaders, including John Walley, chief executive of the NZ Manufactures and Exporters Association, about some of the issues facing the sector, such as staff retention and the high value of the NZ dollar, and the rebuild process."

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "Lowering the Kiwi flag in Afghanistan"
description: "Reports on the legacy of the New Zealand Defence Force in Afghanistan following the official handover in Bamiyan province to local police. Lists the NZers killed. Talks to Colonel Richard Hall, former commander of the Provincial Reconstruction Team in Bamiyan, about NZ's mission in that area. Describes how the gradual handover will occur. Touches on the controversy surrounding the activities of the NZ Special Air Service (SAS) in that country."

Title: "Recycled polystyrene put to use"
description: "Affirms the use of recycled products in the foundation of a council owned Wellington housing development in Newtown. Touches on seismic implications of combining polystyrene to concrete."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Puppet love"
description: "Introduces the puppet theatre duo of UK born Annie Forbes and NZer Tim Denton, touching on their theatrical careers in NZ before moving to Australia. Notes they will peform as Bernie and Elton in Boxes at Capital E, Civic Square, until 30 July."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Portraits of the artists"
description: "Talks to nine of the 675 artists showing their work at the New Zealand Art Show. Discusses art background, type of art and prices with sculptor Mark Newnham, landscape artist Catherine Roberts, chain artist Duncan Leask, sculptor Antoinette Ratcliffe, mixed media artist Dan Campion, 16 year old Jessica Williams, 13 year old Eva Malthus, oil painter Dave Sotogi, Annie Hayward and art teacher Karla Vink."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Shooting stars"
description: "Talks to New Zealand Art Show director Carla Russell about exhibiting artists whose work has appreciated over the years and anticipates her picks for the 2011 show."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Working wonders"
description: "Profiles the work of Sue Bowerman, whose Bowerman School of Design in Newtown helps unemployed people back into the workforce. Backgrounds her beginnings as the first female traffic officer in Wellington. Notes her school's success rate, her ability to instil confidence in job seekers, and her unconventional life."

Author: "Gardner, Chris"
Title: "Centre stage for wool at fieldays"
description: "Centre stage for wool at fieldays"

Author: "Lammers, Coen"
Title: "Good sports"
description: "Investigates how academics and development coaches are trying to convince parents to keep youth sport competition in perspective. Talks to a number of sports academics and administrators, including Bob Bigelow, a former NBA basketball player and one of the most influential sports educators in the world, about the arguments surrounding competition and participation in youth sport."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Tour rage leaves a distant legacy"
description: "Reflects on the 1981 Springbok tour of NZ. Notes the upcoming television drama Rage by Tom Scott, as well as earlier media accounts of the tour. Quotes from books depicting the anti-tour movement in Christchurch by Geoff Chapple and Juliet Morris. Comments on the unusual social collaborations and divisions, often within churches, that formed as a result of people's views of apartheid. Mentions contrasting views of tour supporters in Timaru and Oamaru. Gives a detailed account of the 15 Aug 1981protest march in Christchurch. Relays the views of Blue Squad policeman Pete Carrington on how police felt about their role. Touches on how protests continued even after the Springboks left Christchurch."

Title: "Veteran crooner in chart-topper shock"
description: "Veteran crooner in chart-topper shock"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Snow recalled"
description: "Presents a photographic recall of heavy snow in the city. Includes dates, comments and the duration and depth of the snowfalls."

Author: "Krause, Nick"
Title: "Golden couple"
description: "Speaks to two of the latest laureates to join the Fairfax Business Hall of Fame about their retail empire, which includes the recently acquired 59 Whitcoulls and five Borders stores, and their values. Outlines why Whitcoulls failed under its former owner, Australian private equity-backed REDGroup."

Author: "McGechan, Andy,"
Title: "Bike-length win makes Stroud 'King'"
description: "Bike-length win makes Stroud 'King'"

Author: "Akoorie, Natalie"
Title: "Wrongly injected toddler fights leukaemia"
description: "Wrongly injected toddler fights leukaemia"

Title: "Raglan's 'Billy the Kid' outguns the best in history"
description: "Raglan's 'Billy the Kid' outguns the best in history"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Principal to get fingers greasy"
description: "Principal to get fingers greasy"

Author: "Leaman, Aaron"
Title: "Break-ins for sex: key thrown away"
description: "Break-ins for sex: key thrown away"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Editor met challenges of the times"
description: "Editor met challenges of the times"

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "State of the art"
description: "Asks Jennifer Buckley, director of the 2011 Auckland Art Fair, and Carla Russell, executive director of the 2011 New Zealand Art Show in Wellington, for the inside information on their respective events. Talks to arts critic John Hurrell and arts commentator and writer Hamish Keith about the merits of the two events, one that caters for affordable and emerging art and one for the established and elite."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Secrets to success"
description: "Reports on plans by 30 Christchurch companies to form a hi tech cluster (EPIC, or Enterprise Precinct and Innovation Campus) in the central business district. Cites comments by scientist Sir Paul Callaghan lamenting NZ's place in many OECD rankings, its lack of broad based spending on research and development (R&D), and its dependence on extractive industries. Explains why we should imitate France and why the tourism and wine industries are lowering national productivity. Talks to YikeBike creator Grant Ryan about his vision for the EPIC project and why international talent should be encouraged to come to NZ. Lists NZ's top ten technology companies."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Less is moor for old troupers"
description: "Talks to the actors about their participation in the Peach Theatre Company's production of 'Othello' at the Maidment Theatre, Auckland until 13 Aug 2011."

Author: "Vennell, Jock"
Title: "Perhaps NZ's greatest soldier"
description: "Explains the author's enthusiasm for a largely forgotten NZ World War I general, and why he decided to write the general's biography. Touches on how he went about research for the book."

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "'No one expected it to happen'; Return to Rugby Park"
description: "Speaks to the captain of the 1981 Springboks about his memories of the infamous 1981 South African rugby tour of NZ. Talks about his childhood dream of playing the All Blacks, having to sleep in the function room of the Athletic Park grandstand the night before the team played the All Blacks, and his reunion tour to the 2011 Rugby World Cup in NZ where he will finally set foot on Hamilton's Rugby Park."

Author: "Monin, Lydia"
Title: "In pursuit of the scoop - at any cost"
description: "Traces the history of the Scottish born journalist, recalling his his visit to Christchurch and Westland in 1883. Details his daring exploits and his use of bribery to scoop the story of the survivors of the 'Cospatrick', which was destroyed by fire on its way to NZ in the 1870s."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Scientist-teacher with down-to-earth nature"
description: "Scientist-teacher with down-to-earth nature"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Trailblazer for women in politics"
description: "Trailblazer for women in politics"

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Commercial zone : to extend or not to extend?; Wanaka town centre commercial : what's their future?"
description: "Examines some of the issues regarding development of the town centre. Seeks comment from Wanaka Community Board chariman Lyal Cocks, Sustainable Wanaka Charitable Trust member John Beattie, Paterson Pitts principal planner Robin Patterson, several local residents and Central Property valuer Ian Weir. Assesses the future of seven commercial properties."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Fusing science with wellbeing"
description: "Talks to the scientist and businesswoman about the line of holistic skin-care products she produces. Discusses her decision to move with her family from South Africa to Dunedin, and notes that the company will be moving from Port Chalmers to Dunedin on 1 Aug 2011."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Stop the merry-go-round - I want to get off"
description: "Traces the author's decision to stop drinking alcohol. Reveals her use of the Hello Sunday Morning (HSM) movement started by Australian advertising employee Chris Raine, noting the movement will be launched in NZ in August 2011. Describes the experience of other HSM followers in Christchurch, talking to radio producer James Irwin about what he likes about website."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1914"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1914. Comments on Great Britain's declaration of war on Germany, as reported in the 6 Aug 1914 edition. Reports on a parade and march through Dunedin by the Otago and Southland section of the NZ Expeditionary Force on 29 Aug, published on 31 Aug 1914. Includes several photographs of the parade proceedings. Highlights the contribution of Otago women to the war effort, 26 Aug 1914. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "The odd couple"
description: "Talks to the successful running coach and his new champion pupil about their bond."

Author: "Wade, Amelia"
Title: "Woman killed - cops despair; Cops in despair after woman killed"
description: "Woman killed - cops despair; Cops in despair after woman killed"

Author: "Dillion, Mike"
Title: "Collett off to top start in Sydney"
description: "Collett off to top start in Sydney"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Bright sparks - dim future?"
description: "Points out the obstacles to marketing technological inventions in NZ, noting this country's low ranking in the World Economic Forum innovation index. Profiles inventors who have perserved and describes their inventions. Notes the launch of the Kiwi Innovation Network that aims to help universities and CRIs collaborate on commercialising research. Talks to scientist Sir Paul Callaghan about the need for NZ to spend more on basic science and research and development."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Golden man of athletics"
description: "Pays tribute to the late middle- and long-distance runner and coach. Mentions his upbringing and education in Dunedin, and his marriage in 1948 to the late athlete. Focuses on his win in the six-mile event at the Empire Games, Auckland, 1950, and mentions his participation in the 1948 London Olympics."

Author: "Bearup, Greg"
Title: "Don't worry, be sad"
description: "Asks, with 'happiness' no longer just a feeling but an industry, if humans are designed to be predominantly happy. Speaks to Joe Forgas, Scientia Professor of Psychology at the University of New South Wales, who explains why being sad can actually be good for us. Talks about some of the experiments conducted by Forges and his colleagues in which they induced a positive or negative mood in participants and then assessed its effect on their memory, judgement and behaviour."

Title: "Wartime heroism not widely known"
description: "Eulogises the Queensland-born man who was a highly decorated war hero in World War 2 and the Korean War. Details his wartime service and discusses his family life in the South Island after the war."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Grin and share it"
description: "Looks at examples of co-housing or common-ownership properties in Christchurch, Colorado and California. Describes the Clifton Hill development, the work of architect Roger Buck. Extols the benefits of shared facilities and communal resources. Suggests this type of housing may suit earthquake damaged Christchurch."

Title: "Commitment to family, community shaped by hard early years"
description: "Pays tribute to the late community and Scout leader. Describes his upbringing, marriage and family life, as well as his contribution to the community."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Horologist"
description: "Explains what a typical day is like for the watchmaker and restorer. Talks about his business and working with is son, Rowan."

Author: "Green, Sue"
Title: "Secret road to success"
description: "Reviews the first book by the NZ author originally from Whanganui, now living in Perth."

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Pupils' spine-tingling farewell"
description: "Pupils' spine-tingling farewell"

Author: "Wratten, Stephen D."
Title: "Working worms"
description: "Explains the difference between the tiger worm (Eisenia fetida) and the red wriggler (Lumbricus rubellus), informing of the best way to encourage worms in compost heaps and how to build a worm farm."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Looking at the pluses; Counting for something; Wonder of numbers; Game for the young"
description: "Talks to mathematicians Prof Iain Raeburn of the University of Otago, retired University of Otago Prof Derek Holton, Aucklander Pip Arnold and Otago Mathematics Association president John Major about the influence of mathematics on society, and reasons why it is important to teach maths at school. Discusses their personal passion for mathematics. Informs of the NZ Association Association of Mathematics Teachers annual conference, 'Mathematical Journeys 2011', Dunedin, Jul 2011. Speaks to Cheviot-based author Tony Burnett about the power of mathematical equations. Seeks comment from Prof Derek Holton about mathematical ability relative to age."

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "Rugby chicks"
description: "Speaks to Dr Jennifer Curtin, a lecturer at the University of Auckland's political studies department, about her research into women's engagement with rugby in NZ. Talks about the attempt to assemble a women's side by a Mrs Nita Webbe in 1891 and why women came to embrace the national sport."

Title: "Well being"
description: "Refers to Professor Martin Seligman's recently published book "Flourish : a visionary new understanding of happiness and well-being". Features ten steps to happiness, discussing the merits of each."

Title: "10 ways of well-being"
description: "Refers to Professor Martin Seligman's recently published book "Flourish : a visionary new understanding of happiness and well-being". Features ten steps to happiness, discussing the merits of each."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "The art of giving"
description: "Talks to philanthropist Sir James Wallace about the lack of young people supporting the arts. Considers different ways to enlist financial engagement into NZ art."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "New Zealand's lack of art patrons"
description: "Talks to philanthropist Sir James Wallace about the lack of young people supporting the arts. Considers different ways to enlist financial engagement into NZ art."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Wind of change"
description: "Talks to UK Secretary of State for Work and Pensions Iain Duncan Smith, who explains a proposed change to the welfare system there. Compares the proposed reforms with those put forward in NZ by the Welfare Working Group"

Author: "Gardner, Chris"
Title: "Hi-tech future comes to Waikato"
description: "Hi-tech future comes to Waikato"

Author: "Colbert, Roy"
Title: "Seriously sick humour"
description: "Tells how personal anecdotes about life as a type-one diabetic might finally launch the author's long-desired stand-up comedy career."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Ian Duncan Smith's benefit overhaul"
description: "Talks to UK Secretary of State for Work and Pensions Iain Duncan Smith, who explains a proposed change to the welfare system there. Compares the proposed reforms with those put forward in NZ by the Welfare Working Group"

Author: "Macfie, Rebecca"
Title: "'High-level risk' to workers"
description: "Reports on the findings found at the two weeks of hearings in the Greymouth District Court, part of phase one of the Royal Commission of Inquiry into the Pike River Mine disaster."

Author: "Amyes, Peter"
Title: "A piper at the front [part 1]"
description: "The executive officer with the 4th Otago and Southland Battalion writes about his experiences as part of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in Bamiyan Province, Afghanistan, serving as a liaison officer on the US Task Force Patriot for the NZ Provincial Reconstruction Team. Describes conditions there and comments that he has brought his bagpipes with him. Provides facts about his career and life, information about the role of the ISAF and NZ's role in Afghanistan."

Author: "Nicholson-Moon, Libby"
Title: "A show of hands"
description: "Points out craft work is experiencing a revival. Indicates how the reader can join in, listing various craft markets in the Auckland area, craft stores (physical and online) and places where craft work is taught. Includes a section for crafting applicable to children."

Author: "Macfie, Rebecca"
Title: "Pike River Mine Inquiry's grim findings"
description: "Reports on the findings found at the two weeks of hearings in the Greymouth District Court, part of phase one of the Royal Commission of Inquiry into the Pike River Mine disaster."

Author: "Quilliam, Rebecca"
Title: "Empathy, both zen and now"
description: "Talks to the author about his new book, based on his experiences of living in Japan for three years beginning in Jul 2001. Comments on the devastating earthquake and tsunami there, 11 Mar 2011."

Author: "Stevenson, Rebecca"
Title: "'Aha' moment that led from Fimo beads to fine art jewels"
description: "'Aha' moment that led from Fimo beads to fine art jewels"

Title: "Crash almost cost Williams victory chance"
description: "Crash almost cost Williams victory chance"

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "Brothers at ease with their music"
description: "Talks to the NZ-born Samoan brothers about their new album, released after a seven-year hiatus during which they raised their families."

Title: "Ski mum back on track after fall"
description: "Ski mum back on track after fall"

description: "Aldridge takes out top ND award"

Author: "Grant, Nick"
Title: "'Tis neither here nor there"
description: "Reviews Othello, by William Shakespeare, directed by Jesse Peach, with the Peach Theatre Company at the Maidment Theatre, Auckland, until August 13, 2011."

Title: "Working to provide essential support"
description: "Interviews the service leader, emergency management for the Southern District Health Board about the nature of his work."

Title: "Ninth title but Stroud wants more"
description: "Ninth title but Stroud wants more"

Author: "Grant, Nick"
Title: "Peach Theatre Company's Othello"
description: "Reviews Othello, by William Shakespeare, directed by Jesse Peach, with the Peach Theatre Company at the Maidment Theatre, Auckland, until August 13, 2011."

Author: "Evans, Ryan"
Title: "Race almost a lifelong cycle for Bev"
description: "Race almost a lifelong cycle for Bev"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "'Regent is such a great asset'"
description: "Talks to the Dunedin-born director of the New Zealand International Film Festival about his career. Touches on highlights of the 2011 festival, and praises the Regent Theatre as a venue."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1915"
description: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1915  Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1915.  Reports in the 10 Feb 1915 edition that the liner 'Tokomaru', bound to Harve and London from NZ, was torpedoed by a German submarine, and includes an account from Captain Greene. Urges young men from Otago to enlist for military service, 1 Apr 1915. Presents a series of updates from the 'Evening Standard', London, regarding the performance of Anzac troops in the Dardanelles, 2 May 1915. Includes a map of the Dardanelles, published on 4 Mar 1915."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Up, up & away"
description: "Discusses complementary and alternative therapies for depression. Suggests that doctors would like to prescribe them but need more evidence of there worth."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Alternative therapies for depression"
description: "Discusses complementary and alternative therapies for depression. Suggests that doctors would like to prescribe them but need more evidence of there worth."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "The snacking debate"
description: "Addresses the question of how important is it to have snacks, or is three meals a day sufficient? Gives advice on how to eat snacks and what the healthy versions should be."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Set to defend title; try a few other challenges"
description: "Talks to the baker at the Soul Food Organic Store about her training programme to defend her title at the 18th Peak to Peak multisport race, Queenstown, 6 Aug 2011. Presents facts about the race."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "'On a par with Galileo'"
description: "Profiles the late evolutionary biologist Allan Wilson, who spent 35 years at the University of California, from where he used new biochemistry techniques to challenge current thinking on humanity and race. Talks to professor Charles Daugherty and also Rebecca Cann about his work."

Title: "Former Olympian, 86, missing in microlight"
description: "Former Olympian, 86, missing in microlight"

Author: "Carson, Jonathan"
Title: "Boxer fights for a less shakey future"
description: "Boxer fights for a less shakey future"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1916"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1916. Reports in the 4 Apr 1916 edition on the arrest of the Maori Prophet Rua at his Urewera bush stronghold at Maungapohatu, 3 Apr 1916. Relays information from His Excellency the Governor that Australasian troops have arrived in France, and reports on heavy losses at Gallipoli, 9 May 1916. Cites information from a Dunedin doctor about an outbreak of venereal disease in the city following the return of servicemen, 25 May 1916. Publishes a statement in the 2 Aug 1916 edition reminding eligible servicemen that the Military Service Act is now in operation. Criticises the circumstances behind the formation of a new political Labour Party, 13 Jul 1916. Includes a photograph of Major-general Andrew Russell inspecting troops of the NZ Division before the Battle of the Somme, 1916."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Look & learn"
description: "Summarises the themes and gardens to be on display at this years forthcoming annual garden festival in Taranaki (October 28-November 6 2011)."

Author: "Boyes, Nicola"
Title: "Candlemaker gets glowing reports"
description: "Candlemaker gets glowing reports"

Author: "Munro, Bruce"
Title: "Scenic coast to contrasting coast"
description: "Chronicles highlights of his recent journey on the TranzAlpine train from Christchurch to Greymouth. Mentions special fares currently on offer."

Author: "Rodley, Aidan"
Title: "Winning feeling all in the family for Colletts"
description: "Winning feeling all in the family for Colletts"

Author: "Evans, Ryan"
Title: "Langman aims to put Magic back on track"
description: "Langman aims to put Magic back on track"

Author: "Parry, Gordon"
Title: "Woman heads club as times change"
description: "Reports on the impending election of the first woman president of the club. Describes her distinguished career as a Red Cross nurse and industry leader. Traces the history of the club, the membership of which was limited to men between 1858 and 2000."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1917"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1917. Comments in the 19 Sep 1917 edition on the explosion and sinking of the steamer 'Port Kembla' off the NZ coast on 18 Sep 1917, most probably by an act of sabotage. Reports on the overthrow of the Provisional Government in Russia, 10 Oct 1917. Recounts the heroic efforts of NZ soldiers at Passchendaele in the 27 Oct 1917 issue. Includes a photograph of soldiers working to free a field gun from the mud in Passchendaele. Reports in the 3 Dec 1917 issue on the effect of the new liquor law mandating the closing of hotel bars at six-o'clock in the evening."

Author: "Risk, Louise"
Title: "Chippie keen to wrap up Kiwi takeaway title"
description: "Chippie keen to wrap up Kiwi takeaway title"

Title: "Millionaires make peace in luxury home rent quarrel"
description: "Millionaires make peace in luxury home rent quarrel"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "More than a meal, a tradition; Technique gets tastier results from roast"
description: "Recalls the Sunday roast lunches served at her childhood home. Informs of the second annual Selaks' New Zealand Roast Day, 7 Aug 2011, aimed at reviving the tradition. Discusses the origins of the Sunday roast and its role in bringing families together. Offers advice for preparing a joint of meat, the gravy and serving the leftovers."

Title: "Elderly man with horror burns still critically ill"
description: "Elderly man with horror burns still critically ill"

Author: "Mosley, Sarah"
Author (detailed): "Sarah Mosley, Pierre Wong and Olivia Sanders"
Title: "[Secondary scene]; Madly politically correct; Morality or the law : a dilemma; The English language, but not as we know it"
description: "Offers essays by three Year 13 students at South Otago High School, commenting on political correctness, drink driving and changes to and the future of the English language, respectively. Includes 'The Last patron', a painting on a suitcase by Natasha Cameron."

Title: "Land of rising sun rules one of our favourite sons"
description: "Land of rising sun rules one of our favourite sons"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1918"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1918. Relays news from Mr Percival Phillips, London, chronicling the defeat of the Germans at Le Quesnoy, France, in the 8 Nov 1917 edition. Announces the end of the war and presents news from London, Wellington and Dunedin, 13 Nov 1918. Includes a photograph of a crowd gathered outside of the Dunedin Town Hall for the official announcement of the signing of the armistice with Germany. Reports on the influenza epidemic in the 14 Nov 1918 edition, with a further update on 27 Nov 1918."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Compelled to write"
description: "Talks to the 2011 Burns Fellow at the University of Otago about the influences on her writing and why she became a writer. Describes her upbringing in Oamaru, her education, career path and other accomplishments. Talks about her soon-to-be-published book, 'The Broken book'."

Author: "Dignan,  James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'New works' by Helen Back, Laila Ataya and Anna Majboroda, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Works on paper', various artists, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 15 Aug 2011.  Reviews 'Preoccupied, part one' by Ross Gray, Monumental Gallery, Dunedin."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1919"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1919. Celebrates the return to Dunedin of soldiers aboard the troop-ship 'Hororata' on 18 Mar 1919, reported on 17 Mar 1919. Reprints information obtained from Captain Hall Thompson, published in the 'Lyttelton Times', regarding minesweeping operations off the coasts of NZ, 24 May 1919. Sums up remarks made on 23 May 1919 by the Rev A. Cameron, Chancellor of the Otago University Council, to the Minister of Education, regarding inadequate accommodation for some University departments, published on 24 May 1919. Relates an unconfirmed rumour in London that the Germans had sunk most of their own  fleet at Scapa Flow, Germany, as reported on 23 Jun 1919.  Includes an historical photograph of a bad stretch of road between Stuarts and Takahopa, in the Catlins."

description: "Defines bovine colostrum and looks at the evidence for its health benefits. Explains the role of immunoglobulin (IgG) and touches on dose levels, industry standards, and the scant research done to date."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Positive about Parkinson's"
description: "Talks to Ann Andrews about her experience of Parkinson's disease, from diagnosis at age 59 to her decision to write a book aimed at those with the disease who still have some control over their body. Relays her recommendation for speech therapy, and conveys her practical and realistic approach to life."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Life-span discrepancies between rich and poor"
description: "Talks to British health inequality expert Sir Michael Marmot who has been speaking to NZers about why the poor die sooner than the rich. Outlines the health problems and statistics of the poor in NZ, looking at the factors in poor health. Relays Marmot's suggestion that we look at social causes rather than individual choices and emphasises the effect of people having  no sense of control over their lives. Scans the six point plan on health inequality drawn up by Marmot, and notes some of the points in a 10 point plan drawn up by NZ medical and academic organisations."

Reveals that the cats were secretly declawed when he was previously in charge. Outlines his troubled relationship with the park and his mother. Talks to zoo consultant Tim Husband about how to make the attraction a going concern."

Title: "Fish tastes like it's smoked, but it isn't"

Points out that jack mackerel, the main ingredient, is one of the worst fish to buy on Forest and Bird's 'Best fish guide', which ranks the ecological sustainability of seafood from NZ's commercial fisheries."

Title: "Internet pirates laugh at new laugh; Catch me if you can"

Author: "Davison, Isaac"
Title: "Under the foreign knife; Getting hip in India"
description: "Looks into the boom in medical tourism. Speaks to Paul McGowan, owner of Auckland-based company Stunning Makeovers, about why his customers travel overseas for cosmetic surgery and to Professor Michael Hall, from the University of Canterbury, about the potential economic and public health impacts of medical tourism, including the spreading of new pathogens. Highlights the experience of a West Coast woman, Karen Dickson, who travelled to India for a hip resurfacing operation."

Title: "Hannah Tamaki"
description: "Talks to the wife of the Destiny Church head about her bid for the presidency of the MaÃÑori Women's Welfare League, her relationship with her husband and the church."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "From shark aggression to butterfly beauty"
description: "Reviews 'Falling on grass' by Gretchen Albrecht at the Sue Crockford Gallery (to 13 Aug 2011), 'Harmonic assembly' by Michael Smither at Artis Gallery (to 14 Aug), and 'Radiant matter' by Dane Mitchell at Artspace (to 20 Aug)."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Dancers show ingenuity and flair"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-raised choreographer, and former Royal NZ Ballet (RNZB) principal member, about his career, the RNZB's 2004 tour of Britain, and the appointment of American Ethan Stiefel as the RNZB's new director."

Author: "Hyland, Adrian"
Title: "Hard work and dedication the key [part 2]"
description: "Visits Hamilton Boys' High School, national schoolboy rugby champions in 2008 and 2009. Talks to Jackson Willison, a former Hamilton Boys' High School 1st XV fullback and current Chiefs player, and Nigel Hotham, deputy headmaster and 1st Xv coach at the school, about the depth of talent in NZ and at the school. Lists the former Hamilton Boys' High School students who have become All Blacks."

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Guru swayed by wool power"
description: "Describes the friendship and business relationship between Californian alternative medicine pioneer Deepak Chopra and Icebreaker founder Jeremy Moon. Notes that Moon and Renata Black, who has a NZ background, have both contributed chapters to Chopra's latest book 'The soul leadership'."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Party chat to girl turns deadly"
description: "Party chat to girl turns deadly"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "What happens to our students?"
description: "Informs of the launch by University of Otago's National Centre for Lifecourse Research of a longitudinal study on what happens to students once they graduate. Looks at the current options of pursuing further study and seeking work overseas, providing statistics. Assesses the job markets in Australia and the UK, noting the degrees that are the most marketable.  Gauges the effect of older employees staying longer in the labour market. Indicates what employers seek in recruits. Asks Victoria University law and accounting student Owen Gibson how he outmanoeuvred 100 applicants to land a job for 2012."

Author: "Gray, Jamie"
Title: "All systems are go for high-tech exec"
description: "Speaks to the new ASB Bank chief executive, arguably the most powerful woman in corporate NZ, about a range of banking related issues, including the explosion in digital technology. Talks about her career."

Author: "Smith, Jacqueline"
Title: "She ain't heavy ..."
description: "Talks to The Sami Sisters about their debut album and their music background."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "A world of images"
description: "Talks to the Riversdale-raised, award-winning self-taught wildlife and adventure photographer about his career and travels, including keeping safe while shooting bears during the salmon run in Alaska. Includes his tips on how to make a photograph perfect."

Talks to the women about the challenges of wearing headscarves in public and forging a new Muslim-Kiwi culture. Provides statistics on NZ's Muslim population."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Ready, able and needing to work"
description: "Examines the effects of national unemployment now at 155,000. Visits Waipukurau and talks to one of 306 Ovation meatworks employees who recently lost his job about his predicament, his options and his political views. Cites the comments of a budget adviser about what can be expected as redundancy money runs out. Provides social statistics for the town."

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "Back on struggle street for granny"
description: "Talks to an almost 60 year old Blenheim woman who was recently made redundant about looking after aging parents, having to go doorknocking to find work, and which party she may vote for. Provides social statistics for the Marlborough electorate."

Author: "Hubbard, Anthony"
Title: "'Double whammy was a big shock'"
description: "Talks to a Wellington couple who lost their public service jobs within months of each other. Discusses the health issues they face, their financial position and their view that bureaucratic gaps will be filled by highly paid consultants. Provides social statistics for the Wellington electorate."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Te Hana - the answer"
description: "Describes the response of the northern Auckland town of Te Hana to its high unemployment and serious social problems.  Profiles the work of the Te Hana Community Charitable Development Trust, focusing on the establishment of a MaÃÑori tourism centre and community education centre."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Skin in the game"
description: "Interviews writer Tim Firth about the NZ staging of his movie Calendar Girls about a group of British women who pose nude to raise community funds. Talks to Colin McColl who is directing the theatre version. Also interviews actress Theresa Healey on nudity and her role in the play. Includes a series of photographs depicting NZ versions of nude fundraising calendars. Informs the play will be presented by the Auckland Theatre Company in Auckland 10-20 Aug, in Hamilton 26-27 Aug, and in Tauranga 1-3 Sep."

Author: "Spencer, Ruth"
Title: "It's just a stage we're going through"
description: "Laments the use of American accents in NZ theatre productions but notes the fashion may be in decline. Dissects the accents used in two recent NZ productions."

Author: "Rice, Rebecca"
Title: "A Pacific state of mind"
description: "Previews the Oceania: early encounters exhibition at Te Papa and the Oceania: imagining the Pacific exhibition at City Gallery, 6 Aug to 6 Nov 2011. Discusses the project's them of how encounters have impacted on different cultures. Notes the exhibitions are part of the Real New Zealand festival."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Punch lines"
description: "Meets comedian Dai Henwood at a gym boxing ring to discuss his credentials for the presentation role in the television programme 'Rocked the nation 3: 100 sporting moments.'"

Title: "King says she still has plenty of time on her side"

Title: "Triple Crown second leg just a buoy away"
description: "Triple Crown second leg just a buoy away"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Making coffee his business"
description: "Talks to the owner of one of NZ's first coffee specialist companies. Discusses his strong familial links with the South Island and traces his career in the coffee business, beginning with serving coffees from a barrow at Victoria Park Market, Auckland. Informs that he was visiting Dunedin for the official opening of the company roastery there."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1920"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1920.  Comments on the final ratification of the Peace Treaty between the Allies and Germany, 10 Jan 1920, as reported on 15 Jan 1920. Reports on the visit of the Prince of Wales to Dunedin, 25 May 1920.  Remarks, in the 29 May 1920 edition, on recent recommendations by grand juries to allow flogging as a deterrent to crime."

Author: "Stirling, John"
Title: "The embodiment of farming's fighting spirit"
description: "Pays tribute to the late farming sector leader. Recalls a fiery speech he gave as part of a group of protesters when the then Prime Minister David Lange visited Invermay to open the new agricultural research centre, 15 Apr 1986. Discusses his contribution to Federated Farmers and other governance activities and describes his entry into farming in 1956."

Title: "Remembered for her many inspiring attributes"
description: "Celebrates the life of the Edinburgh-born regional executive chef at the Southern District Health Board. Chronicles her upbringing, career and personal interests, and her spirited approach to battling cancer."

Author: "Jaquiery, Stephen"
Title: "Isolation second nature; Happy in a small tin shed; How friendly is too friendly?"
description: "Reports on his recent visit to small Codfish Island, west of Stewart Island, an offshore bird sanctuary administered by the Department of Conservation. Meets the kakapo ranger and takes to her about her nine-year career with DoC, working in isolated offshore reserves. Provides facts about kakapo. Talks to two Rio Tinto Alcan employees Dave Rosanowski and Alistair Wilson about their volunteer work on the island. Relates his experiences with kakapo chick Solstice One."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Echoes of a lost past"
description: "Reports on his attendance at the opening of 'Te Ao Maori : Maori Treasures from the Otago Museum', Shanghai Museum, China. Notes that the exhibition of artefacts took over a decade to prepare and that these artefacts might help to solve an ancient riddle involving the disappearance of the Yue people of southern China. Cites comments from Shanghai Museum vice-drector Prof Chen Kelun and from some of the NZ delegation. Presents his impressions of Shanghai, Dunedin's sister city. Includes facts about Shanghai and the Otago Museum delegation to the exhibition."

Author: "Parsons-King, Amy"
Title: "Not yet a cultural norm"
description: "Investigates reasons why NZ's rate of breastfeeding, although comparatively high in relation to other OECD nations, has not increased in the past decade. Seeks comment from Dunedin La Leche League leader Anne Devereux and Dunedin Plunket Family Centre community Karitane worker Jill Moore.  Provides information about services available to breastfeeding mothers."

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "A treasure trove of memories; Man v mangrove in a tale full of gloom"
description: "A treasure trove of memories; Man v mangrove in a tale full of gloom"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Album for all ages"
description: "Talks to bass player John Dodd of the veteran Dunedin quartet about the making of their new album. Touches on their previous two albums and their various  projects. Informs of their concert at the Crown Mills Function Centre, Dunedin, 6 Aug 2011."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "A festival of fanzines"
description: "Anticipates the inaugural Dunedin Zinefest, None and Glue galleries, 6 Aug 2011. Talks to Dunedin graphic artist Carmen Norgate about her motivation for organising the festival, and to the guest speaker who lectures at the Massey University School of Fine Arts."

Title: "Skifield manager's job is a lifestyle"
description: "Interviews the services manager for the Cardrona Alpine Resort about her work and career."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "The princess industrial complex"
description: "Speaks to American Peggy Orenstein, author of 'Cinderella ate my daughter', about whether 'the princess industrial complex', which encourages materialism, selfishness and everything pink, is creating long-term problems around sexual identity and stereotyping, and to Victoria University psychologist Sue Jackson about how NZ children cope with being targeted with innocent, passive fairy princesses on the one hand and the sexually suggestive culture of scantily clad music stars on the other. Points out that boys are not immune to the problems of gender-modelling. Looks at how fairy stories have traditionally been used to deliver messages. Talks to Frances Jones about why her three-year-old daughter, Samara Gethen, loves everything pink and girlie."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Tell take bit"
description: "Speaks to Law commissioner John Burrows about the power of the Privacy Act in the rapidly changing digital age. Talks about the proposed recommendations of the Law Commission's review of the Act, which includes making blagging (impersonating someone to get information from a third party) illegal."

Author: "Walters, Laura"
Title: "Putting the brakes on teen carnage; First step in push to make young people safer"
description: "Highlights changes effective from 1 Aug 2011 to raise the learner driving licence age to 16, as part of a three-pronged approach to reduce high teenage road fatality rates. Seeks comment from Minister of Transport Steven Joyce about the rationale for the changes, which will include a reduction in the blood alcohol limit for drivers under 20 beginning on 1 Aug 2011, and a strengthening of restricted licence tests in Feb 2012. Speaks to NZ Transport Authority (NZTA) spokesman Andy Knackstedt about the new restricted licence test, and to national manager of road policing Superintendent Paula Rose about the responsibility of parents in educating children about road safety. Talks to a 14-year-old boy and two 15-year-old girls about their reaction to the changes."

Title: "Killer Clown Fiends get 18 years in prison"
description: "Reports on the sentencing of the pair for the murder of Aucklander Dean Browne in Wellington on 21 Jan 2010."

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "The Gis is good to go this weekend"
description: "The Gis is good to go this weekend"

Author: "Schrader, Ben"
Title: "Lie of the land; 'For me, it's freedom'"
description: "Challenges the old clicheÃÅ that the countryside is the backbone of NZ. Argues that from the earliest days of European settlement the reality has been a flight from the lonely countryside to the towns. Notes that for MaÃÑori the shift to the cities happened much later. Looks at what drove the escape from the countryside. Asks why NZers still look backwards so longingly. Looks into the modern rural lifestyle, where the isolation is lessening."

Author: "Johnston, Kirsty"
Title: "Pair sought in case of missing model"
description: "Reports that Sydney police have posted computer-generated images of two men suspected in the disappearance of the aspiring NZ model from Whatakane on 6 Apr 1980. Reviews the circumstances of her disappearance, talks to her then partner and brother, and notes that the case is still open. Mentions the possible link to the disappearance of another NZer, Marion Sandford, in Sydney under similar circumstances in 1980."

Title: "Home detention for cannabis-growing jail boss with stress; Support for prison staff"
description: "Reports on the conviction of a Rimutaka prison manager on serious drug charges. Reveals that he was suffering from stress after discovering several prisoners who had committed suicide. Lists types of support available to Corrections employees who witness traumatic events."

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Family planning pioneer faced public backlash"
description: "Family planning pioneer faced public backlash"

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Sirocco will blow you away"
description: "Features Sirocco, a 14-year-old endangered parrot who became a global celebrity after appearing in a BBC internet clip in 2009. Talks to Kakapo Recovery Programme manager Deidre Vercoe Scott about the behaviour of male kakapo. Informs that he will be touring for the Rugby World Cup, residing in temporary accommodation at the Zealandia sanctuary in Karori and the Orokonui Sanctuary near Dunedin. Lists items in his diet and his life as a 'nocturnal ambassador'. Mentions other NZ animal celebrities."

Author: "Doesburg, Anthony"
Title: "Sounds of the future"
description: "Looks into the impending transformation of the analogue radio by 21st-century digital technology. Describes some of the usability features. Observes the successful uptake of digital radio in Australia. Considers some of the hurdles for digital radio in NZ. Mentions a trial covering parts of Wellington and Auckland."

Author: "Chapman, Kate"
Title: "A trailblazer for Maori and women in Parliament"
description: "Pays tribute to the late former MP for Southern Maori. Traces her parliamentary career, noting her achievements as a pioneer for women and champion of Maori culture."

Author: "Walsh, John,"
Title: "A design of delight"
description: "Reviews 'New Zealand by design: a history of New Zealand product design', which sets out to answer the question: 'Is it yet possible to distinguish the essence of NZ product design?'"

Author: "MacLennan, Catriona"
Title: "Judge hailed for his mana, compassion"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Chief District Court Judge. Chronicles his career achievements, particularly in the area of addressing family violence and restorative justice, and notes his long-standing commitment to the naval reserve."

Author: "Dunmore, John,"
Title: "The go-between"
description: "Reviews 'Tupaia: the remarkable story of Captain Cook's Polynesian navigator'. Explains Tupaia's place in Pacific history."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "'It's too hard to think of children being hurt by people who love them'"
description: "Interviews the young soprano about her career and personal interests."

Title: "Provocative portrait of a perplexing personality"
description: "Provocative portrait of a perplexing personality"

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Back to the drawing board"
description: "Highlights some of the projects for the twice-postponed sixth Scape Christchurch Biennial of Art in Public Space, which will be held in Christchurch and Auckland, until Nov 30 2011. Talks about why the project of Mexico-born artist Hector Zamora will be relocated to the Auckland waterfront."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Amen to diversity"
description: "Previews the photography exhibition 'Men of Newtown' by Kent Blechynden, Baobab Cafe, Newtown, from 1 Aug 2011. Talks to him, to Father Des Britten and to several of the colourful local residents featured in the exhibition, two of whom are transitioning from men to women."

Author: "Wood, Stacey"
Title: "Homeowners in a rates fix; Homeowners in a fix over rising interest rates; Case study : the first time home buyers"
description: "Assesses the current situation for mortgage borrowers, noting the mixed signals coming from Reserve Bank Governor Alan Bollard as to whether to move to a fixed or floating rate. Seeks comment from economists, mortgage brokers and others including Retirement Commissioner Diana Crossan. Includes a graph illustrating savings to be made by switching from a floating to a fixed interest rate. Speaks to Lower Hutt resident Rachel Heffernan, who has recently moved into her first home with partner Jamie Cameron."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "Hot baroque licks"
description: "Talks to the musician, part of the Australasian Latitude 37 chamber music trio, about his enthusiasm for the baroque period and its parallels with standard jazz performance. Notes that the trio will be on tour 14 Aug to 3 Sep 2011."

Author: "Gardner, Chris"
Title: "Farmer acts to beat bankruptcy; Lime and fewer cows put farm back on track; Argiculture consultant's pasture knowledge 'uncomplicated'"
description: "Farmer acts to beat bankruptcy; Lime and fewer cows put farm back on track; Argiculture consultant's pasture knowledge 'uncomplicated'"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The unreal buzz"
description: "Looks at what can be done when tinnitus (unwanted phantom sounds in the brain) gets too much."

Title: "Relishing life in the 'reel' world"
description: "Interviews the preservation manager at the NZ Film Archive about her work. Discusses the progression of her career there over the past 10 years from receptionist to her current role. Touches on her trip to Europe to participate in the International Federation of Film Archives summer school programme, Bologna, Italy, 2009."

Author: "Balham, Diana"
Title: "The waetman cometh"
description: "Relates the experience of travelling in Vanuatu. Talks about visiting Pentecost Island, including the village of Pangi to observe the ancient tradition of land-diving (Nangol), and the use of Bislama, one of several pidgin languages spoken in the Pacific."

Author: "Galuszka, Jono"
Title: "The brew testament"
description: "Talks to the bartender at the Malthouse about his Beer Diary blog and other aspects of being a 'beer geek'. Talks about his experiences working at Beervana, an annual festival for beer aficionados, Westpac Stadium, Wellington, 5-6 Aug 2011."

Author: "Marquet, Sarah"
Title: "Couple of 92-year-olds 'the complete package'"
description: "Couple of 92-year-olds 'the complete package'"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Jeweller settles for simple country life"
description: "Jeweller settles for simple country life"

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Bright sparks - dim future?"
description: "Points out the obstacles to marketing technological inventions in NZ, noting this country's low ranking in the World Economic Forum innovation index. Profiles inventors who have perserved and describes their inventions. Notes the launch of the Kiwi Innovation Network that aims to help universities and CRIs collaborate on commercialising research. Talks to scientist Sir Paul Callaghan about the need for NZ to spend more on basic science and research and development."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Stop the merry-go-round - I want to get off"
description: "Traces the author's decision to stop drinking alcohol. Reveals her use of the Hello Sunday Morning (HSM) movement started by Australian advertising employee Chris Raine, noting the movement will be launched in NZ in August 2011. Describes the experience of other HSM followers in Christchurch, talking to radio producer James Irwin about what he likes about website."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Conquering Karori"
description: "Talks to Jan Heynes, co-editor (with Judith Burch) of 'Karori & its people', produced by the Karori Historical Society. Discusses the early settlement of the once heavily forested suburb and some of its most famous residents, including her great-grandfather, John Kirkcaldie; her grandfather, Sydney Kirkcaldie, and Katherine Mansfield (then Kathleen Beauchamp). Mentions the Karori Lunatic Asylum, NZ's first asylum."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Grin and share it"
description: "Looks at examples of co-housing or common-ownership properties in Christchurch, Colorado and California. Describes the Clifton Hill development, the work of architect Roger Buck. Extols the benefits of shared facilities and communal resources. Suggests this type of housing may suit earthquake damaged Christchurch."

Author: "Barrett, Pat"
Title: "A valley to savour"
description: "Shares his experience of making a complete descent of the Wills River from the divide to the road over two days. Provides information about the route."

Author: "Green, Sue"
Title: "Secret road to success"
description: "Reviews the first book by the NZ author originally from Whanganui, now living in Perth."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1921"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1921.  Reports in the 12 Apr 1921 edition on the adoption of a programme to provide for Jewish settlement in Palestine, and publishes the text of a statement from representatives of all Jewish emigration bureaus in Central Europe. Chronicles the forced landing on the South Dunedin foreshore of the Avro aeroplane and the assistance provided to passengers and crew by the launch 'Elsie' and another boat, reported in the 3 Jun 1921 edition. Notes key aspects of a report to the Minister of Public Health regarding the administration of the Division of Dental Hygiene, published on 13 May 1921. Mentions on 30 May 1921 that some very large potatoes have been grown in the region. Includes a photograph of the new club premises of the Returned Soldiers' Association in Dunedin, published in the 'Otago Witness' on 25 May 1921."

Author: "Forde, Marg"
Title: "Farm award winners prove neighbour wrong years on; Building a business for next generations"
description: "Farm award winners prove neighbour wrong years on; Building a business for next generations"

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "How to remember our dark days?"
description: "Explores options for how the city can mark and remember its recent earthquakes by looking at some of the memorials created across the world in response to great tragedies."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Ticket fees 'averaged' out; $28m revenue expected from exclusive contract"
description: "Investigates ticket pricing for the upcoming Rugby World Cup, focusing on the role of travel agents. Reveals details of the hidden administrative fees charged by the company that has been granted an exclusive contract by Rugby World Cup Ltd to offer travel and hospitality packages. Seeks comment from 'Otago Daily Times' sales and marketing executive Paul Dwyer to an 'invitation to tender' document offered to travel agents by the company. Provides facts about the England-headquartered company and the revenue it is expected to glean from their exclusive contract."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1922"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1922. Comments in the 22 Apr 1922 edition on the manufacture of imitation Flanders poppies to mark the sacrifice of NZ soldiers during World War 1 and to provide funds for unemployed returned soldiers in the region. Reports in the 6 Jan 1922 edition on a breakthrough in cancer treatment at London Hospital by using X-rays. Describes and comments on the provisions of the Meat Export Control Bill, introduced in the House of Representatives, 3 Feb 1922. Touches on other events during the year. Includes a photograph of Dunedin in 1922."

Title: "Award for coach who overcame setbacks"

Title: "Career, family convince Scott to return to Dunedin"
description: "Career, family convince Scott to return to Dunedin"

Title: "Jackson ready for 100th club match"
description: "Jackson ready for 100th club match"
