Title: "Suspended McDonald true to his Lady"
description: "Suspended McDonald true to his Lady"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Brave firefight heroes earn rewards; Gallant soldier in lethal danger hundreds of times"
description: "Brave firefight heroes earn rewards; Gallant soldier in lethal danger hundreds of times"

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Dreams of a phoenix in the ashes"
description: "Discovers the complicated life of the bankrupt self-made multimillionaire property tycoon and former owner of the Wellington Phoenix football (soccer) club."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Good for dodgy tums : but still processed"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Sanitarium's 'So good' regular soy milk."

Author: "McAllister, Janet"
Title: "Porter's merry dance has enough fun to sink a ship"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Music Theatre's production of Cole Porter's 'Anything goes', at the Civic Theatre to 22 Oct 2011."

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Family call for hearing over death"
description: "Family call for hearing over death"

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Title: "Body believed to be missing fisherman"
description: "Body believed to be missing fisherman"

Author: "Cuming, Angela"
Title: "Museum misplaces family heirloom clock"
description: "Museum misplaces family heirloom clock"

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Mother's vigilance saves son from killer bug"
description: "Focuses on the recent outbreak of meningococcal C in the region and the mass vaccination of local high school students and others between their first and 20th birthdays. Relates the experience of Brett Crossley-Coe who spent 24 hours in the intensive care unit of Whangarei Hospital after he contracted meningococcal C. Talks about the deaths of three other Northlanders from meningococcal disease this year."

Author: "Cuming, Angela"
Title: "Back to the boards for farm girl"
description: "Back to the boards for farm girl"

Author: "Migone, Paloma"
Title: "Education leaders fine-tuning to govt baton"
description: "Education leaders fine-tuning to govt baton"

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Morgan's big idea"
description: "Talks to the economist and philanthropist about his proposal to revolutionise NZ's tax and welfare system, as outlined in the new book he co-authored with Susan Guthrie."

Author: "Pickering, Helen"
Title: "Successful struggle out of Depression poverty; A remarkable life"
description: "Successful struggle out of Depression poverty; A remarkable life"

Author: "Sharpe, Marty"
Title: "Youth psych unit could have saved teen - mother"
description: "Youth psych unit could have saved teen - mother"

Author: "Clarkson, Anne"
Title: "Father sent to prison for sexual abuse"
description: "Father sent to prison for sexual abuse"

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Andrew Mehrtens"
description: "Talks to the former All Black about his career and his character."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Crook - a full life lived in art"
description: "Crook - a full life lived in art"

Title: "Insane man's murder charges dropped"
description: "Insane man's murder charges dropped"

Title: "Redeemed guilty of manslaughter"
description: "Redeemed guilty of manslaughter"

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "'Impolite' style captures troubador's [troubadour's] verse"
description: "Reviews 'Rugby, rhyming and here' by Dick Frizzell at the Gow Langsford Gallery (to 12 Oct), 'Test transmission' by Tobias Kasper, Patricia Dauder and General Idea at Artspace (to 8 Oct), and an installation by Jack Hadley that can also be viewed at Artspace."

Author: "Simpson, Peter,"
Title: "Capturing real life in our capital city"
description: "Capturing real life in our capital city"

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Why your records may need a makeover"
description: "Offers some advice on keeping financial documents organised. Talks about documents that can be useful to keep, including notes of telephone conversations."

Author: "Johannsen, Dana"
Title: "Defender rockets right into test side"
description: "Defender rockets right into test side"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Rock throws weight behind Manu Samoa"
description: "Rock throws weight behind Manu Samoa"

Author: "Hannan, Hayley"
Title: "Cup star checks out future Auckland base"
description: "Cup star checks out future Auckland base"

Author: "McGechan, Andy,"
Title: "Little brother already making his mark in road-racing world"
description: "Little brother already making his mark in road-racing world"

Author: "Wade, Amelia"
Title: "Wallaby star drops in on favourite Kiwi teacher"
description: "Wallaby star drops in on favourite Kiwi teacher"

Author: "Thompson, Eric"
Title: "Kiwi rookie rejoins Indycar big boys"
description: "Kiwi rookie rejoins Indycar big boys"

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Title: "Decision took convoluted path"
description: "Backgrounds the debate by Dunedin City Council councillors over the controversial public art piece 'Rugby Haka Peepshow' by Ngai Tahu artist Rachael Rakena, on display in the Octagon, Dunedin. Reviews council minutes of non-public meetings revealing the depth of the disagreement. Informs that it was meant to resemble a deodorant container manufactured by a Rugby World Cup sponsor, but instead has been lambasted by art critics for looking like a 'black penis'. Seeks views of the artist and Cr Bill Acklin, chairman of the art in public places subcommittee of the council."

Author: "Calder, Peter"
Title: "Sounds of silence"
description: "Talks to the director about the inspiration behind his, and Samoa's, first feature film, 'O le Tulafale' ('The Orator')."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Safety study recommends proactive prevention"
description: "Sums up key findings of a campus safety audit of NZ universities and polytechnics conducted by the NZ union of Students' Associations (NZUSA). Focuses on the revelation that the University of Otago is only one of two tertiary institutions that do not collate records of the extent of reported sexual harassment and sexual assault on campus. Seeks comment from University of Otago spokeswoman Megan McPherson."

Author: "Hembry, Owen"
Title: "Leaving Fonterra in 'sweet spot'"
description: "Talks to the Canadian-born outgoing chief executive of the multinational dairy farmer cooperative about his eight-year tenure. Lists some of the highs and lows during his leadership of NZ's largest company. Briefly comments on the qualities of his replacement, Netherlands-born Theo Spierings, and reveals that he is a rugby fan and former player."

Author: "Macdonald, Iain"
Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1968"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1968. Focuses on the 10 Apr sinking of the inter-island ferry 'Wahine', in which at least 42 people perished (11 Apr), which includes a personal account from 'Otago Daily Times' reporter and ferry passenger Iain Macdonald. Publishes three photographs of the tragedy. Announces that Comalco will link with its Japanese partners to build an aluminium smelter at Bluff to process alumina shipped from Australia (9 Jul). Touches on other events during the year."

Title: "Awarded a QSM for her community work"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Maniototo community volunteer. Overviews her upbringing and contribution to community life."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "'King of Rodeo' may never be bettered"
description: "Pays tribute to the late champion horseman and Otago rodeo identity. Talks to his wife, Christine Bain, and others about his contribution to the sport."

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "Built and fostered NZ-Asia trade links"
description: "Built and fostered NZ-Asia trade links"

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Exhausting some options"
description: "Focuses on the new law that will change exhaust emissions rules for imported vehicles from 1 Jan 2012. Cites concerns expressed by used car dealer Neil Cottle, who claims that the new rules will make it unaffordable for many NZers to purchase imported Japanese cars. Seeks response from the office of Transport Minister Stephen Joyce to these concerns. Asks air-quality scientist Dr Gavin Fisher about the effect of the new legislation on human health. Talks to freelance motoring writer Sam Stevens and an unnamed former car dealer about the likely response of motorists to the changes. Lists harmful substances contained in vehicle emissions and their effects on health."

Author: "Amyes, Peter"
Title: "Life and death in Bamiyan [part 3]"
description: "The executive officer with the 4th Otago and Southland Battalion continues his chronicle of his experiences as part of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in Bamiyan Province, Afghanistan, serving as a liaison officer on the US Task Force Patriot for the NZ Provincial Reconstruction Team. Comments on counterinsurgency operations and transition of responsibility for security, governance and development to the Afghan people. Describes his participation in a ceremony at one of the main bases to farewell three US personnel who lost their lives in the province. Discusses the activities of the US Dept of Agriculture (USDA) and an Agricultural Development Team (ADT) to assist local farmers. Includes facts about Bamiyan province. Mentions his performance on the bagpipes for a change of command ceremony, Jul 2011."

Author: "McNeilly, Hamish"
Title: "Let's go surfing now ..."
description: "Reports on his surfing lesson at St Clair Beach, Dunedin, by an instructor at the Esplanade Surf School. Talks to owner Steve Bennett, who opened the school 13 years ago. Provides information about the school and surfing lessons for individuals or groups."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Joint decisions"
description: "Focuses on osteoarthritis. Suggests that the condition will become an epidemic with the aging baby boomer population. Explains that osteoarthritis is a result of wear and tear of joint cartilage, which distinguishes it from rheumatoid arthritis where joints are damaged through a malfunction in the body's immune system. Speaks to Massey University senior lecturer in equine surgery Fred Pauwels about why new arthritis treatments are often tested on horses and the advantages veterinary sciences may have over human medicine for the treatment of the condition, Massey University senior lecturer in small-animal surgery Andrew Worth about the effect of oral supplementation of joint nutrients and the use of stem cell therapy, and to Arthritis NZ chief executive Sandra Kirby about the need for suffers to be more proactive. Outlines some measures to encourage joint health. Talks about the growing body of robust science behind a number of nutraceuticals, complementary medicine and supplement treatments."

Author: "Dowden, Peter"
Title: "'Litany of lies' returned to the spotlight; 3am decision leads to new life"
description: "'Litany of lies' returned to the spotlight; 3am decision leads to new life"

Author: "Phelps, James"
Title: "It only took 300 stitches"
description: "Highlights the injuries that the rugby league back-rower has sustained while playing at the Warriors."

Title: "Making elite athletes feel at home"
description: "Provides a behind-the-scenes glimpse of what is involved in hosting hotel guests and athletes participating in the Rugby World Cup. Talks to Penny Clark, general manager of the Goldridge Resort, Queenstown, about the nutrition, security and other  challenges of looking after elite athletes. Seeks comments from others in the hotel industry, including hotel porter Jamie Cant, who is serving as a liaison between the InterContinental Wellington and one of the sports teams."

Author: "Fisher David"
Title: "Patient goes on rampage after release; 'Each time he came out he was worse than before'"
description: "Investigates the various admissions and releases preceeding an assault involving a patient released days earlier from the Te Whetu Tawera mental health unit. Talks to family members who question the procedures followed by the unit which, although a recent inquiry found it functioning to a high standard, has been under pressure for bed space and is cutting numbers."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "But will they vote?"
description: "Focuses on voter-participation. Reports on a falling voter turnout around the world, particularly among the young. Examines the situation in NZ. Speaks to Dr Jennifer Curtin, from the Political Studies Department at the University of Auckland, who suggests that a low voting rate among the young does not mean they are not politically engaged. Includes enrolment information for the Nov 2011 general election."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "The ref, the tweet and the angry star"
description: "Talks to the Samoan player about his tweets and his opinions concerning the strong anti-All Black feeling among the Samoan team and his attitude to the NZ and International Rugby Boards and their treatment of them."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Dunedin 'tough place to grow up'"
description: "Talks to the prominent lawyer about her upbringing in Dunedin. Touches on her training at the University of Otago law school and the racial discrimination experienced by her Taiwanese immigrant family. Comments on her reputation for taking on 'last resort' cases."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Light fantastic"
description: "Speaks to the ceramicist, who creates floral-inspired light fittings fashioned from petals of porcelain, about the international success of his work and his business. Talks about Northland's French-owned halloysite clay mines. Explains that local potters have little access to the clay that was once very important to local pottery icon Crown Lynn."

Author: "Powley, Kathryn"
Title: "Would you make the call?"
description: "Presents the results and question scenarios of a survey asking whether people would alert authorities to suspected and clear-cut cases of child abuse."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1969"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1969. Focuses on the successful landing on the moon by the US craft Eagle and the moon walk by astronauts Neil Armstrong and Edwin Aldrin, as part of the Apollo mission (22 Jul). Describes efforts by officials to declare the Woodstock music festival site a disaster area due to overcrowding, mud, sickness and adverse drug reactions (18 Aug). Includes photographs of both events. Announces the signing of an agreement between the NZ Government and Comalco Industries of Australia to build a $100 million aluminium smelter at Bluff (6 Sep). Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Four-letter word costs $2m"
description: "Outlines the legal proceedings in an ongoing court case over an alleged obscenity in which the defendant refuses to accept a discharge without conviction."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Battle for the nude"
description: "Speaks to the Gisborne-born artist about her use of the nude to explore social mores, her career, and her forthcoming exhibition based on DH Lawrence's 'Lady Chatterley's lover' (Janes Sanders Art Agent, Auckland, 19 Oct to 19 Nov 2011)."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Urewera crying"
description: "Reviews the Atamira Dance Company's performance of Maaka Pepene's 'Te Houhi' (Q Theatre, Auckland, 21-25 Sep 2011)."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Kiwis have eye for deal : our shoppers are world-class bargin hunters"
description: "Reports how NZ shoppers are the most price-conscious in the developed world with more than half the supermarket items scanned through the country's checkouts everyday being on special."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1970"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1970. Reports on a purchasing spree by Dominion Breweries Ltd to gain control of more than half of the hotels in Otago and Southland (5 Jun). Expresses concern for the safety of a missing couple whose starving baby was found in their blood-splattered farmhouse in Pukekawa, north of Auckland (23 Jun). Includes a photograph of the couple of their wedding day. Reports on a demonstration at the University of Otago to protest against American military intervention in Cambodia (8 May). Talks to Dunedin breeder Mr E. C. S. Falconer, Wingatui trainer Bob Heasley (formerly of Dunedin), and Wingatui jockey Ernie J. (Midge) Didham about the performance of grey gelding Baghdad Note in winning the Melbourne Cup (4 Nov). Includes a photograph of the horse and jockey during the race. Laments the decision by Government to abolish the school cadet military training scheme in secondary schools (17 Jun)."

Author: "Preston, John"
Title: "Monogamy - are we cut out for it?; Affairs of the heart"
description: "Looks at the arguments for and against monogamy. Includes the philosophy of America's leading relationships columnist Dan Savage, recent research into the genetic component at the Karolinska Institute in Sweden, examples from history, and Andrew Marshall, author of 'How can I ever trust you again? From infidelity to recovery in seven steps'. Talks to NZ sexologist, Dr Michelle Mars, who recommends bored couples consider having a "respectful" affair to liven things up."

Author: "Fisher David"
Title: "Unsung bravery in hushed-up war"
description: "Talks to the former SAS (Special Air Service) trooper Roger Cole about being one of nine men (including Corporal Talaiasi Labalaba and Sekonaia Takavesi from Fiji) in the 1972 Battle of Mirbat who fought off an attack of 400 enemy Russian and Chinese communist rebel soldiers in the Sultanate of Oman. Highlights his plans for a quiet life in NZ."

Author: "Kara, Scott"
Title: "'Razor' star a cut above; 'Razor' star a cut above most actresses"
description: "Talks to the NZ actress about her delight in playing the role of Kate Leigh in the latest series of the Australian drama 'Underbelly : Razor', based on the book 'Razor' by Larry Writer. Discusses the real-life Kate Leigh, who became infamous as the 'queen bee' of the Sydney crime scene during the late 1920s and early 1930s. Informs that 'Underbelly : Razor' premieres 28 Sep 2011 on TV3, and also features NZ actress Chelsie Preston Crayford as brothel owner Tilly Devine."

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "When teen activist felt strong arm of law"
description: "Uses a photograph to recall the moment when an Auckland teenager found himself in the news after a scuffle with a police officer during an anti-war protest in Auckland's Queen St. Highlights other protests he has been involved in subsequently."

Author: "Pickering, Helen"
Title: "Hubbard backed region he loved and its people"
description: "Hubbard backed region he loved and its people"

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "In the dark"
description: "Describes the Pike River Mine rescue operation, as revealed in phase two of the Royal Commission of Inquiry into the 2010 explosion that resulted in the death of 29 miners. Talks about the criticism directed at those in control of the rescue operation because of their lack of mining knowledge and the way information about the operation was conveyed."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "The writer's voice"
description: "Speaks to the writer about his new book. Talks about how the accusation of plagiarism surrounding 'The Trowenna Sea' impacted on the work."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "When is a noise annoying?"
description: "Attempts to identify what makes noise annoying. Talks about the findings of a recent study about the most annoying or distracting sound. Speaks to David Welch, of the audiology department at the University of Auckland, about the influence of the sociopsychological state of the person listening to the sound."

Author: "Bridgeman, Shelley"
Title: "Annabel's grand plan"
description: "Talks to the television cook about the international success of her book sales and television show 'The Free Range Cook'. Discusses her concerted plan to make unpretentious cooking from seasonal ingredients accessible to home cooks everywhere. Highlights the beginnings of her cooking career, her single-minded drive to immerse herself in the world of cooking, and her years living along the Whanganui River."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Social worker has 'feeling of achievement'"
description: "Observes National Social Workers Day (28 Sep) by taking a tour of Puketai Care and Protection Residence, a Child Youth and Family Facility that has been operating in Andersons Bay for the past 21 years. Speaks to the social worker about his experiences over the past seven years at the facility, and the services it provides to young people to help them re-engage with their community."

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "Uncles on hand if Fern needs tips"
description: "Uncles on hand if Fern needs tips"

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "Kight all but set to move north"
description: "Kight all but set to move north"

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Something to chew on"
description: "Answers a question about the nutritional value or benefits of eating whole grains and seeds, given that they are not digested. Talks about the weight-loss benefits of chewing food more."

Author: "Alderson, Andrew"
Title: "Smith ponders NY tactics"
description: "Talks to the promising marathoner about her tactics in next months New York Marathon. Includes biographical material."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1971"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1971. Reports on a narrow escape by a 16-year-old Dunedin surfer Barry Watkins, who was being attacked by a shark when a wave swept him ashore onto St Clair Beach (31 Mar). Announces that Radio Otago Ltd has been granted the first private radio broadcasting warrant to be issued outside of the Auckland province (5 May). Describes disruptions by anti-war protesters to an Auckland parade honouring returned soldiers from Vietnam (13 May). Reports on clashes between anti-war protesters and police outside of the Dunedin Town Hall, coinciding with the arrival of Prime Minister Sir Keith Holyoake to a National Party conference, and includes a photograph of the protest (31 Jul). Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Paul, Gregor,"
Title: "Who said the Moa's extinct?"
description: "Looks back at the halfback's career and his resurgence in form that lead to his playing for Tonga in the World Cup."

Author: "Paul, Gregor,"
Title: "Legacy nothing without the cup"
description: "Looks back at the coaching career of the All Blacks coach."

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "NZ's best NRL grand final moments"
description: "Lists the ten best NRL grand final moments involving NZ players."

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Teacher's big heart earns top marks"
description: "Teacher's big heart earns top marks"

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "Shorts signify free passage"
description: "Spotlights the Waitaki Golden Oldies Rugby Festival, Centennial Park, Oamaru, 30 Sep-1 Oct 2011. Talks to the oldest player registered for the tournament about his past and present playing days. Gives the rules of the tournament and provides facts about the festival, which has 700 confirmed visitors from NZ and abroad."

Author: "Robinson, Victoria"
Title: "Go the mighty Edna : in a VIP seat"
description: "Go the mighty Edna : in a VIP seat"

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "MMP : keep it or dump it?"
description: "Discusses the flaws in the MMP (mixed member proportional) voting system. Explains the lack of public awareness of the upcoming referendum on MMP. Outlines the four alternatives: first-past-the-post (FPP); preferential voting (PV); single transferable vote (STV); and supplementary member (SM)."

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "Vidiri prayinng for life-saving kidney"
description: "Vidiri prayinng for life-saving kidney"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1972"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1972.  Reports on the deaths of nine Israeli hostages seized by Arab guerrillas in the Olympic Village, Munich, Germany (7 Sep). Sums up proceedings of a 7 Nov special discussion on 'The Restructuring of the Church for the Contemporary World', Dunedin Presbytery (8 Nov). Announces that the official opening of the albatross colony at Taiaroa Head will take place on 25 Feb (31 Jan).  Reports on rescue efforts of families and livestock from rapidly rising floodwaters in the Lower Clutha area (14 Jun). Includes a photograph of a University of Otago student protest against a policy banning male and female students from sharing the same accommodation."

Author: "Smithies, Grant"
Title: "Fade to black"
description: "Marks the passing of the non-commercial digital television channel TVNZ 7, with the National government cutting funding. Notes negative reactions from his readers, and describes the NZ-produced chat show 'Talk Talk'. Comments on the cultural impact of losing a channel airing such shows, with for-profit channels preferring overseas and reality programming."

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "Meet Pete, laundry expert to the stars"
description: "Meet Pete, laundry expert to the stars"

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "The challenge for Goff"
description: "Speaks with Labour leader Phil Goff about the upcoming general elections and the four defining issues for his election campaign. Covers asset sales; whether wages have kept up the cost of living; economic growth; and opportunities for young people. Mentions his proposed capital gains tax (CGT)."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Stranger than fiction"
description: "Talks to the 'Otago Daily Times' journalist and playwright about his most recent play 'The Truth Game', Fortune Theatre, opening 7 Oct 2011. Overviews his career in the newspaper industry and how it has influenced the themes of his play, which takes place in a newspaper newsroom."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Prints and paintings' by Anna Reid, The Fix gallery, Dunedin, until Oct 2011.  Reviews 'Haka 2011' by David Teata, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Bushman/Folk artist' by Dick Lyne, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin.  Includes illustrations  Art Exhibitions  Reviews  Jopp,"

Author: "Hattaway, Peter"
Title: "A matter of will-power?"
description: "Discusses what credit staff can do to help financially distressed customers better manage their finances."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "The Jesus bird"
description: "Describes how the New Zealand storm petrel has been rediscovered, more than 150 years after being considered extinct. Speculates on how the seabird, which lives almost its entire life at sea, remained unnoticed, and relates how Hawkes-bay birder Ian Saville photographed a petrel in 2003, further sightings, and the Department of Conservation response to these and to DNA evidence from captures, noting funding difficulties. Looks at the search for the birds' breeding ground. Describes the New Zealand storm petrel and storm petrels in general. Briefly mentions similar rediscoveries of the takahe and the Chatham Island taiko."

Author: "Castle, Tim,"
Title: "Keeping our athletes dope-free"
description: "Provides context around the findings in the author's report to Sparc on the NZ Academy of Sport's nutrition supplements programme."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1973"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1973. Reports that the Prime Minister, the Rt Hon N . E. Kirk, has ordered a postponement of the Springbok rugby tour for the year (11 Apr). Cites reaction by the Minister of Immigration, the Hon F. M. Colman, to being chosen to represent NZ on an official protest towards French nuclear testing at Mururoa atoll, aboard the frigate HMNZS 'Otago' (26 Jun). Includes a photograph of Prime Minister Norman Kirk farewelling the frigate from the Auckland Naval Base. Sums up Government-ordered controls on petrol consumption following the failure of voluntary fuel cuts (4 Dec). Announces the appointment of six Guardians of lakes Manapouri and Te Anau (12 Feb).  Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Let's dance"
description: "Examines the 'Ka Mate' haka, describing its history, association with rugby, a new documentary on the dance, controversies on its use by foreigners and Kiwis, and some reactions to its use on the sports field. Gives the lyrics (in Maori)."

Author: "Lawton, Aaron"
Title: "Kiwi Kieran owes it all to Stacey"
description: "Kiwi Kieran owes it all to Stacey"

Title: "Tighter trustee rules - and more to come"
description: "Highlights the new provisions relating to Trustees of debt securities, KiwiSaver schemes and unit trusts. Mentions the moves to impose an express standard of care on trustees and to limit trustee indemnities through the draft Financial Markets Conduct Bill (FMCB)."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Kawerau, close up"
description: "Looks at the North Island town, halfway between Whakatane and Rotorua, describing media publicity over the town's social ills and the WoodFest forestry festival which has been timed to use a Rugby World Cup (RWC) theme. Portrays WoodFest and the Woodskills exhibition, and how Kawerau residents are marking the RWC."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Saviours of the sea"
description: "Profiles Brook Rapson and Murray Phipps-Black, members of the Worser Bay Surf Lifesaving Club, who launched a rescue effort for the Dominion Post commuter ferry as it was in trouble in Wellington Harbour, 2 Mar 2011. Describes the event, and portrays the Worser Bay Surf Lifesaving Club."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "Under the mountain"
description: "Previews the 2011 Taranaki Garden Spectacular (28 Oct to 6 Nov). Visits six of the 45 gardens on the visiting list, including Tikorangi (The Jury Garden), Woodleigh, Merleswood, Te Kainga Marire, Tupare, and Pukeiti."

Author: "Wright, Michael"
Title: "Couple at 'end of tether' after insurance drama"
description: "Talks to St Martins couple Barry Chapman and Carole Chapman about their dealings with Tower Insurance following disagreement over whether their house could be rebuilt following damage in the Christchurch earthquakes."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "A link to days past; Restoration reveals house's history"
description: "Reveals the origins of the 19th century former toll house in Clarendon. Informs that the house was recently registered as a category 1 historic place after being restored by a community trust, with help from the NZ Lotteries Grants Board. Chronicles the history of toll houses in NZ, particularly in Otago."

Author: "Wood, Andrew Paul,"
Title: "Dance full of energy"
description: "Reviews 'The body festival' performed by the Southern Lights Dance Company, 30 Sep to 1 Oct 2011, Geo Dome, Christchurch."

Author: "Greenhill, Marc"
Title: "Step inside the offices to find out that the grass is greener at Google"
description: "Reveals the results of a survey in Australia and NZ  that shows Google topping a list of  most preferred employers. Follows the career paths of NZers Ben Mallthus, Richard North and Jack Turner, who work for Google in Sydney, New York, and Tokyo, respectively. Touches on the much touted perks of working for the search engine company."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Pragmatic approach favoured"
description: "Reports on the case of 'Magsons Hardware Ltd t/a Mitre 10 Mega v Bogiatto' [2011] (NZCA 378) over the objection of a scheme, by property developer Robert Cummins, to satisfy creditors debts under the Insolvency Act 2006 which MH believed the proposal terms were not reasonable or calculated to benefit the general body of creditors."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Life's too short"
description: "Talks to the Shortland Street actor and her husband about their shoestring budget theatre company Basement Theatre."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Rising from the rubble"
description: "Traces the steps that Perpetual Trust has taken to recover from the deaths of 10 employees in the 22 Feb earthquake, talking to CEO Patrick Middleton. Announces the company has opened a new office in Addington, Christchurch, after its premises in the PGC building were destroyed. Relays the surviving employees' experiences of the earthquake and their post-quake recovery."

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "Drawing on talent"
description: "Speaks to the illustrator and author about his career. Mentions his latest children's book, a Kiwi reworking of 'Old MacDonald's farm'."

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Gallantry awards for troops caught in Bamiyan ambush"
description: "Tells the stories of the three soldiers caught in the ambush that killed Lieutenant Tim O'Donnell on patrol in Afghanistan and a fourth who works neutralising explosive devices. Describes the four levels of NZ Gallantry Awards. Includes biographical information on the four soldiers."

Author: "Chapman, Kate"
Title: "No regrets despite bold splits"
description: "Reflects on the politician's career prior to his imminent retirement, discussing how he now feels about leaving the Labour Party in 1989 and the Alliance Party in 2002.  Touches on his relationship with former Prime Minister Helen Clark. Mentions his retirement plans. Contains a chronological file of the major events in his political career."

Author: "Oram, Rod"
Title: "Foreign cash must fuel growth"
description: "Critically examines the draft economic strategy of the Auckland Council contained in its recently released draft Auckland Plan. Describes the strategy's choice of sectors to focus on, questions the assumptions on growth rates and constraints made by the strategy, and mentions weaknesses on environmental goals and engagement with businesses. Looks at issues associated with seeking foreign direct investment (FDI) to support such growth."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Bedeans celebrate rich history"
description: "Scrutinises the 100 year history of the Christchurch college, noting the Oct 2011 release of a book on its history. Recalls some scandals, comments on teachers and sports results. Presents a medley of impressions of the school from the viewpoint of the author, and ex-boarder from the 1960s"

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "[70th anniversary celebrations]"
description: "Spends the night on the Te Mana frigate and meets some of the crew who are preparing for the 70th anniversary celebrations of the Royal NZ Navy."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "What I do : soldier"
description: "The artillery acting battery commander describes a typical day and life as a soldier."

Author: "McKenzie-McLean, Jo"
Title: "The woe of hair today but gone tomorrow"
description: "Investigates the phenomenon of hair loss among Canterbury residents following the earthquakes in Christchurch. Presents facts on the condition known as alopecia. Talks to Gendi Roberts, Ashleigh Calvert and Janine Antram about coping with hair loss. Talks to Ms Antram about her wig provider business and the possible causes of alopecia. Mentions a service payment available for people who need wigs and hairpieces."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Get into the grove"
description: "Examines the NZ olive oil industry, talking to some of the growers about its potential. Talks to Odell Sugrue of Tauherenikau and Chris Price and Steven Price of Masterton, noting the low margins of the industry and the quality advantage of locally-grown extra virgin olive oil over supermarket products."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Marketing minefield for agents"
description: "Discusses two recent complaints involving the advertising of properties as 'home and income' with reference to rentable 'granny flats'. Reveals that information provided through the Land Information Memorandum (LIM) should contain the conditions of sale."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "The big ideas man"
description: "Speaks to the PQ Blackwell publisher, who outgrew dyslexia, about becoming a global publishing powerhouse. Talks about his career, including working in the warehouse of his parent's publishing company, Moa, after he dropped out of school in the sixth form, publishing the new biography of veteran South African activist and retired Anglican bishop Desmond Tutu, 'Tutu : the authorised portrait', and the challenge publishing faces with digital books."

Author: "Walters, Laura"
Title: "Should we keep taking the tablets?"
description: "Reports on the environmental dilemma faced by councils and schools in terms of trying to save paper by using travel-sized touch-screen tablets at the expense of the pollution electronic waste can generate. Looks at the current state of electronic waste recycling."

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "In Hillary's footsteps"
description: "Focuses on the life-changing experiences for the NZ doctors and nurses who carried on Sir Edmund Hillary's legacy in Nepal, as expressed in the new book 'Himalayan hospitals : Sir Edmund Hillary's Everest legacy'."

Title: "Like being shot with arrow, says reporter"
description: "Like being shot with arrow, says reporter"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "'I'm going back home to my people'"
description: "Profiles the veteran MaÃÑori language sports broadcaster. Talks about his career. Includes a mini MaÃÑori language sports dictionary."

Author: "Anderson, Ian"
Title: "Magic teen defender catches Ferns' cap"
description: "Magic teen defender catches Ferns' cap"

Author: "Pegden, Evan"
Title: "'Pinch-yourself stuff' puts Larkin on top of slalom world"
description: "'Pinch-yourself stuff' puts Larkin on top of slalom world"

Author: "Johnstone, Duncan"
Title: "Kirwin eyes 'best job in the world'"
description: "Kirwin eyes 'best job in the world'"

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Town planner"
description: "Explains the town planner's role as a senior monitoring and enforcement officer in the resource consents team of Porirua City Council."

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Incensed 'in-laws' bash up Lisa Lewis"
description: "Incensed 'in-laws' bash up Lisa Lewis"

Author: "Stack, Greg"
Title: "Sci-fi film project goes global after birth in garage"
description: "Sci-fi film project goes global after birth in garage"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "'Jelous rage' motive for brutal attack, court told"
description: "'Jelous rage' motive for brutal attack, court told"

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "He'll be engraving 'New Zealand' of course ..."
description: "He'll be engraving 'New Zealand' of course ..."

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Flag duties bring family full circle"
description: "Flag duties bring family full circle"

Author: "Francis, Clio"
Title: "Last gathering for oldtimer who lived and died alone"
description: "Last gathering for oldtimer who lived and died alone"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Lisa loses two teeth in assault"
description: "Lisa loses two teeth in assault"

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Farm pair hope third call on service is last"
description: "Farm pair hope third call on service is last"

Author: "Filipe, Katarina"
Title: "Fans see red over missing McCaw"
description: "Fans see red over missing McCaw"

Author: "Feek, Belinda"
Title: "Popular pupil was lying on road when car hit him"
description: "Popular pupil was lying on road when car hit him"

Author: "Pegden, Evan"
Title: "Breakthrough victory confidence boost for Cusdin"
description: "Breakthrough victory confidence boost for Cusdin"

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "'Cold case' arrest - police tell of accused's visit to family"
description: "'Cold case' arrest - police tell of accused's visit to family"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Murdered man's mother rejects killer's wish for forgiveness"
description: "Murdered man's mother rejects killer's wish for forgiveness"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Top NZ sprinter became a dinkum Aussie"
description: "Top NZ sprinter became a dinkum Aussie"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Businessman made most of opportunities"
description: "Businessman made most of opportunities"

Author: "Robinson, James"
Title: "The Fortune 500 Kiwis"
description: "Profiles six expatriate NZers working for Fortune 500 companies in the United States: Craig Nevill-Manning (software engineer, Google), Sarah Robb O'Hagan (president, Pepsi-Co), Shane Grant (brand director, Coca-Cola), Glenn Renwick (president, Progressive Insurance), Leo Lonergan (chief procurement officer, Chevron), and John Bedbrook (research and development vice-president, Chevron). Talks to KEA Global chief executive Sue Watson about the organisation's aim to maximise the benefit of this overseas human resource base."

Author: "Campbell, Gerard"
Title: "World authority on footrot"
description: "Chats with Lincoln University associate professor Jon Hickford about his work as a gene scientist and footrot expert at the university's Gene Marker Laboratory. Touches on his role as president of the New Zealand Institute of Agricultural and Horticultural Science, and the best aspect of his job."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Ka Mate - hot property"
description: "Talks to director Wiremu Grace about the documentary 'Ka Mate: the haka, the legend' screening on MaÃÑori Television on 1 Oct 2011. Discusses the story of the haka's originating with Te Rauparaha hiding from his pursuers, the subsequent fortunes of the Ngati Toa, and the emergence of haka as a rugby game ritual."

Author: "Law, Tina"
Title: "Having a ball"
description: "Follows the preparations for the school ball of 17 year old Riccarton High School students Jacinda Harkess and Corrina Lloyd. Describes the costs, the costumes and the pre-ball preening. Contrasts how some Christchurch Boys' High School students prepare for the event. Shares the school ball experience of Cantabrian Simon Barnett, Julie Seymour and Jo Kane."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "Teasing out honey's flavours"
description: "Visits the beekeepers at Horsham Downs, Hamilton, testing and talking about their Sweetree honey brand and how trees and the bees decide the flavour."

Author: "Napier, Liam"
Title: "Pacific Islanders unleash Tuilagi on Namibia as they eye vital opening win : man mountain big weapon"
description: "Pacific Islanders unleash Tuilagi on Namibia as they eye vital opening win : man mountain big weapon"

Author: "Cooke, Michelle"
Title: "Nephew accidental bullseye for his truck-driving uncle"
description: "Nephew accidental bullseye for his truck-driving uncle"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Isaiah proves ability runs in his family"
description: "Isaiah proves ability runs in his family"

Author: "Carson, Jonathan"
Title: "Young kickboxers ready for a rampage"
description: "Young kickboxers ready for a rampage"

Author: "Hinton, Marc"
Title: "Captain marvel : Ritchie joins the legends"
description: "Captain marvel : Ritchie joins the legends"

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Witi Ihimaera interview"
description: "Speaks to the writer about his new book. Talks about how the accusation of plagiarism surrounding 'The Trowenna Sea' impacted on the work."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Pike River phase two Royal Commission"
description: "Describes the Pike River Mine rescue operation, as revealed in phase two of the Royal Commission of Inquiry into the 2010 explosion that resulted in the death of 29 miners. Talks about the criticism directed at those in control of the rescue operation because of their lack of mining knowledge and the way information about the operation was conveyed."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Jeremy Cole interview"
description: "Speaks to the ceramicist, who creates floral-inspired light fittings fashioned from petals of porcelain, about the international success of his work and his business. Talks about Northland's French-owned halloysite clay mines. Explains that local potters have little access to the clay that was once very important to local pottery icon Crown Lynn."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Young voters decrease"
description: "Focuses on voter-participation. Reports on a falling voter turnout around the world, particularly among the young. Examines the situation in NZ. Speaks to Dr Jennifer Curtin, from the Political Studies Department at the University of Auckland, who suggests that a low voting rate among the young does not mean they are not politically engaged. Includes enrolment information for the Nov 2011 general election."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Osteoarthritis : a discussion"
description: "Focuses on osteoarthritis. Suggests that the condition will become an epidemic with the aging baby boomer population. Explains that osteoarthritis is a result of wear and tear of joint cartilage, which distinguishes it from rheumatoid arthritis where joints are damaged through a malfunction in the body's immune system. Speaks to Massey University senior lecturer in equine surgery Fred Pauwels about why new arthritis treatments are often tested on horses and the advantages veterinary sciences may have over human medicine for the treatment of the condition, Massey University senior lecturer in small-animal surgery Andrew Worth about the effect of oral supplementation of joint nutrients and the use of stem cell therapy, and to Arthritis NZ chief executive Sandra Kirby about the need for suffers to be more proactive. Outlines some measures to encourage joint health. Talks about the growing body of robust science behind a number of nutraceuticals, complementary medicine and supplement treatments."

Title: "A leap of faith into Ethiopian New Year"
description: "Presents a photo montage and a description of the tradition followed by Wellington's Ethiopian community as they celebrate Meskai, the first big celebration of the new year."

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "Physio devoted his life to patients - famous and ordinary"
description: "Physio devoted his life to patients - famous and ordinary"

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Getting to grips with bullying : efforts to tackle bullying in our schools; The victim : abuse, exclusion knock student's confidence; The reformed bully : former bully now agent of Peace; The victim - a generation later : boy suffered nightmares"
description: "Highlights the different kinds of bullying there are. Outlines the situations when the police can become involved. Talks to clinical psychologist Karen Nimmo about the symptoms that can develop later in life from being bullied as a teenager. Highlights the 2009 report from the Office of the Children's Commissioner detailing the lack of consistency in schools' responses to bullying. Presents the teacher's point of view and the kinds of things they are doing and programmes available. Talks to Peer Support national chairman Peter Allen about his organisation and his own experiences in the field. Tells the personal points of view of Julia Holden, who was a victim, Jonnie Black, who is a reformed bully, and Guy Hollister, who remembers being a student with a teacher who mistreated him because he wore glasses and was left handed which encouraged other pupils to bully him. Outlines the Ombudsman's recommendations for schools."

Author: "Chapman, Kate"
Title: "Man of many parties goes; Douglas recalls 'giants' encountered during his political career"
description: "Looks back on the political career of the former Labour deputy prime minister as he prepares to bow out of politics. Lists the important dates and milestones in his career. Highlights some of the comments made by the ACT member of parliament in his valedictory speech."

Author: "Krause, Nick"
Title: "Legal eagles soar to $1b : but most have mortgages"
description: "Reports on the uneven impact the economic downturn is having on lawyers. Looks at the way earnings are split in large law firms. Discusses the kind of work that has fallen off due to the global recession."

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Warriors rookie the new superstar"
description: "Profiles the halfback. Highlights the last-minute try he helped set up against the Melbourne Storm to get the Warriors into their second NRL grand final."

Title: "Coffee-to-accountancy change was all due to attitude"
description: "Profiles the Vietnamese migrant's rise from working as a barrista in Vietnam, to working in a Lower Hutt bakery (while studying part-time for her diploma in business and then a bachelor of business studies majoring in accounting), to working at Summerset, the company responsible for 13 retirement villages throughout the country."

Author: "Pegden, Evan"
Title: "Muliaina makes last stand for No 15 jersey"
description: "Muliaina makes last stand for No 15 jersey"

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Young rugby player just waiting in the wings"
description: "Young rugby player just waiting in the wings"

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Fans flock to get up close with All Blacks"
description: "Fans flock to get up close with All Blacks"

Author: "Hallahan, Marnie"
Title: "Proud Josh carries flag for his family"
description: "Proud Josh carries flag for his family"

Title: "Jury finds man guilty of triple manslaughter"
description: "Jury finds man guilty of triple manslaughter"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1974"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1974. Focuses on the resignation of US President Richard Nixon as a result of the Watergate corruption scandal (10 Aug). Reports that the Government has approved plans for a $340 million scheme to install six hydro-electricity dams on the Clutha and Kawarau rivers (25 May). Announces the death of the Prime Minister, the Rt Hon Norman Eric Kirk (2 Sep). Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Love of music greatest legacy"
description: "Pays tribute to the late music teacher. Overviews her career and seeks comments from her son, Jeff Gunn, colleagues and friends."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Everybody's gone fishing; Looking after the fish together"
description: "Focuses on the joys, challenges and responsibilities of coastal fishing. Talks to the former Dunedin resident and Wellington surfcasting champion about his forthcoming book 'Fishing the remote coast : land-based fishing experiences in New Zealand'. Stresses the importance of respecting fishery limits and taking safety precautions when fishing from the rocks or beach. Seeks comments from chef, author and television host Al Brown and veteran fisher Ted Young. Speaks to Chris Hepburn, postdoctoral fellow at the University of Otago marine science department, about the role of marine reserves in fisheries management."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Divided rulers; The price of democracy"
description: "Looks at the limited powers of local councils to discipline their members when relationships among councillors become disharmonious. Backgrounds the fractious debate being played out in the media between Dunedin City Council (DCC) councillors Lee Vandervis and Bill Acklin over the 'Haka Peepshow' public art work in the Octagon. Talks to former Dunedin resident Michael Willis, who is involved in returning democracy to the small New South Wales city of Shellharbour after Australia's Minister for Local Government sacked the council and replaced it with a commissioner. Overviews the provisions of the Local Government Act 2002. Seeks comments from Cr Acklin, DCC governance manager Sandy Graham, Dunedin sculptor Stuart Griffiths and Southern District Health Board member and former Central Otago mayor Malcolm Macpherson. Talks to Victoria University Faculty of Law senior lecturer Dean Knight about the 'vexed issue' of handling the behaviour of councillors."

Author: "Vine, Gillian"
Title: "Juggling with vegetables and products; Adventure out back door; A footnote to turbulent times; A growing appreciation; Male condition examined in short story collections"
description: "Juggling with vegetables and products; Adventure out back door; A footnote to turbulent times; A growing appreciation; Male condition examined in short story collections"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Auteur comes home"
description: "Talks to the Samoan-born writer and director of 'The Orator (O le Tulafale)', about the making of the film, shot in several villages on the island of Upolu, and featuring a largely untrained cast."

Author: "Robinson, James"
Title: "The Fortune 500 Kiwis"
description: "Profiles six expatriate NZers working for Fortune 500 companies in the United States: Craig Nevill-Manning (software engineer, Google), Sarah Robb O'Hagan (president, Pepsi-Co), Shane Grant (brand director, Coca-Cola), Glenn Renwick (president, Progressive Insurance), Leo Lonergan (chief procurement officer, Chevron), and John Bedbrook (research and development vice-president, Chevron). Talks to KEA Global chief executive Sue Watson about the organisation's aim to maximise the benefit of this overseas human resource base."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Ka Mate - hot property"
description: "Talks to director Wiremu Grace about the documentary 'Ka Mate: the haka, the legend' screening on MaÃÑori Television on 1 Oct 2011. Discusses the story of the haka's originating with Te Rauparaha hiding from his pursuers, the subsequent fortunes of the Ngati Toa, and the emergence of haka as a rugby game ritual."

Title: "Helping to give community a voice"
description: "Interviews the community liaison and morning-show host for Otago Access Radio about his job."

Author: "Frances, Helen"
Title: "Tale of two bridges"
description: "Tells the history of two footbridges in New Plymouth: The Poet's Bridge in Pukekura Park and Te Rewa Rewa Bridge spanning the Waiwhakaiho River, providing pedestrian and cycle access."

Author: "Adams, Richard"
Title: "Big water : little kayak"
description: "Tells of his solo adventure kayaking down the Whanganui River over two days."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Commuting from Dunedin to Japan"
description: "Talks to the Hastings-raised former All Black, now a partner in the Luna Bar and Restaurant. Talks about his fight with bone cancer when he was a teenager, his playing days and his coaching experience. Informs that he is the coaching co-ordinator for Japanese club NEC Green Rockets, where he spends half the year."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1975"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1975. Reports on a 'rocket war' in which University of Otago students set off salvoes of rockets near campus in the lead-up to Guy Fawkes' Day (1 Nov). Describes the effects of a cold snap in Britain (5 Jun). Informs that Dunedin businessman Stuart Clark has bought the historic Savoy Restaurant, thus saving it from closure (9 Aug). Includes a photograph of the restaurant, circa 1970. Announces that a new geriatric home-hospital complex for the Little Sisters of the Poor will be built at Brockville (10 Jun). Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Fashion designer's business on a roll"
description: "Talks to the Canterbury-raised fashion designer, who is a member of the Dunedin Derby Gallow Lasses roller derby team in her spare time."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1976"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1976.  Gives details of four Housing Corporation of NZ land development projects that will yield 600 sections for new houses in Dunedin and Mosgiel (9 Mar). Announces the commencement of the Maniototo irrigation scheme (27 Oct). Reports that C. and A. Odlin Ltd plans to export wood chips from Port Chalmers to Japan (23 Jan). Reports that 101 hostages held at Entebbe airport, Uganda, were freed by Israeli commandos (5 Jul). Announces that railcar service in Otago will cease (5 May). Includes a photograph of Dunedin Railway Station in the early 1970s. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Social media force in elections"
description: "Comments on the use of social networks by politicians in NZ and overseas. Expresses hope that NZ politicians will make more use of social networks during the forthcoming election campaign."

Author: "Gillespie, Kiri"
Title: "'They came around corner, spun out and boom, hit me'"
description: "'They came around corner, spun out and boom, hit me'"

Author: "Rodley, Aidan"
Title: "Russell quietly sneaks back into the saddle"
description: "Russell quietly sneaks back into the saddle"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Taking a Taupo tiger by the tail : in sync with lake : Taupo farmers test options; Commitment to the lake"
description: "Taking a Taupo tiger by the tail : in sync with lake : Taupo farmers test options; Commitment to the lake"

Author: "Dunmore, John,"
Title: "Bligh : William Bligh in the South Seas"
description: "Bligh : William Bligh in the South Seas"

Author: "O'Brien, Louise"
Title: "The kindness of your nature by Linda Olsson review"
description: "The kindness of your nature by Linda Olsson review"

Author: "Morgan, Jon"
Title: "Flying the flag for dairy farms"
description: "Flying the flag for dairy farms"

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Kimble Bent by Chris Grosz review"
description: "Kimble Bent by Chris Grosz review"

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Te Houhi review"
description: "Reviews the Atamira Dance Company's performance of Maaka Pepene's 'Te Houhi' (Q Theatre, Auckland, 21-25 Sep 2011)."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Jan Nigro interview"
description: "Speaks to the Gisborne-born artist about her use of the nude to explore social mores, her career, and her forthcoming exhibition based on DH Lawrence's 'Lady Chatterley's lover' (Janes Sanders Art Agent, Auckland, 19 Oct to 19 Nov 2011)."

Author: "Jervis, Adrienne"
Title: "Cestnut supporters hungry for growth"
description: "Cestnut supporters hungry for growth"

Author: "Risk, Louise"
Title: "Squeals, smiles, flashes as All Blacks do rounds"
description: "Squeals, smiles, flashes as All Blacks do rounds"

Author: "Priest, Ceana"
Title: "He's ditched the catwalk to become a model pig farmer"
description: "He's ditched the catwalk to become a model pig farmer"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Call for harsher penalties for child porn crimes"
description: "Call for harsher penalties for child porn crimes"

Title: "'Love triangle' makes for an exciting World Cup"
description: "'Love triangle' makes for an exciting World Cup"

Author: "Tocker, Ali"
Title: "Natural skincare poised for export"
description: "Natural skincare poised for export"

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Masticating good for health"
description: "Answers a question about the nutritional value or benefits of eating whole grains and seeds, given that they are not digested. Talks about the weight-loss benefits of chewing food more."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Annoying noises and your mental state"
description: "Attempts to identify what makes noise annoying. Talks about the findings of a recent study about the most annoying or distracting sound. Speaks to David Welch, of the audiology department at the University of Auckland, about the influence of the sociopsychological state of the person listening to the sound."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "The view is worth the climb and Pajama Club review"
description: "The view is worth the climb and Pajama Club review"

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Bad-taste bash caps bucket list"
description: "Bad-taste bash caps bucket list"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Danger under the streets"
description: "Raises questions about how the 4 Jun 2011 Onehunga water main gas explosion, which killed Watercare Services Network Analyst Philomen Gulland and maimed her colleague Ian Winson, could have occurred. Presents a breakdown of the accident to explain how the explosion happened."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Analyst's plea : shun China's cash; Our man of the world"
description: "Spotlights the concerns of the leading United States analyst on the Asia-Pacific region about China's recent expansionist foreign policy. Speaks to the retired American diplomat about his high profile career and his enduring bond with NZ."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "A fresh approach; Chef's fresh approach appeals"
description: "Talks to the couple, who own and operate the award-winning Riverstone Kitchen near Oamaru, about their first recipe book. Discusses his training and their passion for local, seasonal food served at their country restaurant. Includes recipes for shaved fennel, baby peas and goat's curd on ciabatta, seared scallops with potato gnocchi, crisp sage and capers, and potato gnocchi."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1977"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1977. Reports on a major fire at the premises of the John Edmond Ltd hardware store in Dunedin, which injured an employee (19 Nov). Includes a photograph of fire crews at the burning building.  Chronicles the inauguration of the container service at Port Chalmers, and talks to John Taylor, container operations manager for Japan Lines (31 Jan). Reports on the opening of the Tekapo power canal on 15 May (16 May). Describes the 'festive air' aboard the first commercial return flight from Christchurch to Antarctica via an Air New Zealand DC10, 15 Feb, as reported on 16 Feb."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Sweet but very short on the real thing"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Woolworths Homebrand 'Chocolate flavoured topping'."

Author: "Timmo, Caitlin"
Author (detailed): "Caitlin Timmo, Alicia King and Theanne Bulatao"
Title: "The padlocked chest; The puddle; Get behind me, mirror"
description: "Features two short stories and a short essay from three Waikati Girls' High School pupils. Includes a photograph entitled 'Picture of torment' by Eilis Gallagher, part of her portfolio for NCEA level 3 art."

Title: "Top surgeon with the common touch"
description: "Top surgeon with the common touch"

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Rollicking romp fires the imagination"
description: "Reviews the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's 'Choral Masterpieces'"

Author: "Bayer, Kurt"
Title: "NZ's oldest driver ('I don't go slow') dies at 105"
description: "NZ's oldest driver ('I don't go slow') dies at 105"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1978"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1978. Cites comment from Mr J. R. Harrison, chairman of the Goverment caucus committee on drug abuse, regarding the surprisingly large extent of drug abuse in NZ (16 Feb). Seeks comment from top police officials to charges that NZ Police over-reacted in ending the occupancy of Bastion Point by MaÃÑori land protesters (26 May). Sums up several measures in the Budget to assist farmers (2 Jun). Reports that two escaped circus lions were shot in Lawrence after a lioness clawed a small boy (31 Mar). Includes a photograph of the Star Fountain, Dunedin, after detergent was added to the water by vandals (Mar 1978)."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Picture perfect"
description: "Talks to the former Aucklander about his photography and design career. Concentrates on his new life as owner of 'The Picture Lounge', a new photography gallery in Wanaka."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Back in black', featuring works by Len Lye, Colin McCahon, Ralph Hotere and Lisa Reihana, Dunedin Public Art Gallery, until Jan 2012.  Reviews 'The Mountains to the sea' by Norman Sinclair, Green Island Gallery.  Reviews 'Magnolia fever' by Jacque Ruston, Port Royale Cafe, Dunedin."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "What's eating Tainui?"
description: "Reports on disputes within the country's richest iwi. Speaks to Tukoroirangi (Tuku) Morgan, the chair of the tribe's executive board Te Arataura, and Tania Martin, the first woman to chair the Tainu Parliament Te Kauhanganui, about the conflict that began when Martin questioned spending by Te Arataura."

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Trial run to catch a killer"
description: "Reports on the launch of a four-year pilot bowel cancer screening programme that aims to reduce bowel cancer deaths by offering two-yearly screenings to more than 130,000 people in the Waitemata District Health Board area in Auckland. Notes that the Government will use the results to decide on a national screening programme. Speaks to bowel cancer survivor Peter Krijger about his experience. Touches on the results of a Health Ministry audit that found many public hospital endoscopy service are using methods that put patients at unnecessary risk."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Shane Cortese"
description: "Speaks to the actor/entertainer about his career and his self-marketing through selling stories about events in his life to the women's magazines."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Magic mushrooms and pounding hooves"
description: "Reviews 'Phantasma' by Fiona Pardington and 'Paper, scissors, Rock' by Stephen Bambury at Two Rooms (to 22 Oct), 'Six petrol stations and a garden' at the Anna Miles Gallery (to 22 Oct), 'What I am looking at' by Marie Shannon, at the Sue Crockford Gallery (to 15 Oct), 'Selections' by Clinton Watkins at Starkwhite (to 22 Oct), and 'Seven nights' by Julian Hooper at the Ivan Anthony Gallery (to 22 Oct)."

Author: "McAllister, Janet"
Title: "Canvas that can breathe and move on its own"
description: "Reviews the NZ Body Art Showcase at Auckland's Aotea Centre (1 Oct 2011)."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Out of the drawer and on to the stage"
description: "Talks to the playwright about her debut work 'E Ono Tama'i Pato', which will be a centrepiece in the Southside Arts Festival's theatre section on 2 Nov 2011. Touches on some other works at the festival. Notes that the festival will be held at various South Auckland venues from 14 Oct to 6 Nov."

Author: "Fletcher, Hamish"
Title: "Davidson involved from the start"
description: "Davidson involved from the start"

Author: "Jenkin, Lydia"
Title: "Leaps in the dark"
description: "Talks to the indie-pop duo about their debut album."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "A portrait of the artist as a clever Dick"
description: "Attempts to figure out the man behind the multi-media brand (artist, illustrator, wine label, T-shirt designer). Talks about his career and why he is occasionally labelled an adman. Touches on his new book 'Its all about the image'."

Author: "Lang, Sarah"
Title: "A weighty issue"
description: "Recounts the author's decade-long, all-consuming obsession with body image and her journey of disordered eating, which saw her become anorexic at 18 and overweight a few years later. Talks about her recovery with the help of EDEN, a small not-for-profit organisation that works on disordered-eating prevention, early intervention, advocacy and information provision as well as campaigning for change at a societal level."

Author: "Hill, David"
Title: "A whimsical return to country of heart"
description: "A whimsical return to country of heart"

Title: "Scientist returns to face murder-bid trial"
description: "Scientist returns to face murder-bid trial"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Teething troubles"
description: "Focuses on the risks assoicated with dental tourism, which sees tourists get their dental work done in developing countries for noticeably less than they would expect to pay in NZ. Speaks to a number of experts, including Donald Schwass, a senior lecturer in the Department of Oral Rehabilitation at the University of Otago School of Dentistry, about the risks of getting dental work done overseas, and to David Crum, chief executive of the NZ Dental Association, about why dental fees are high in NZ. Talks to two dental tourists about their experiences. Spotlights the death of Melanie Heremaia after she had root canal surgery performed in Noumea. Outlines the normal NZ fees for some common treatments, as stated on the NZ Dental Association website."

Title: "Cusdin wins open with birdie finish"
description: "Cusdin wins open with birdie finish"

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "The pursuit of happiness"
description: "Gauges the happiness of NZers, talking to Dunedin psychologist Chris Skellett about his book 'When happiness is not enough'. Discusses the Government of Bhutan's use of the Gross National Happiness (GNH) index Bhutan with Auckland University Business School lecturer Dr Ross McDonald. Talks to Auckland University of Technology psychology lecturer Charmaine Bright about her research into helping children and teenagers become happier. Includes tips for happiness. Features the OECD 2009 'better-life' index correlating GDP with happiness levels."

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Car stolen just as brother faces bone-marrow transplant"
description: "Car stolen just as brother faces bone-marrow transplant"

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Sex clinics treating more youngsters"
description: "Reports on the content of the sex education of school children, noting some parents find it too graphic. Talks to a sexual health physician about the growing number of under 14 year olds contracting sexually transmitted infections (STI). Documents the uptake of the human papillomavirus (HPV) immunisation among NZ teenage girls. Presents statistics on sexually transmitted infections, 2001-2010. Canvasses  the views of a group of teenagers on STIs, condom use and sexual health checks."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Sick, but rugby great joins the fun"
description: "Sick, but rugby great joins the fun"

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Kiwi woman kept as sex slave in Philippines"
description: "Kiwi woman kept as sex slave in Philippines"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Ex-NZ telco chief shot dead in US"
description: "Ex-NZ telco chief shot dead in US"

Author: "Robinson, Victoria"
Title: "Murder-accused appointed litigation guarding of son"
description: "Murder-accused appointed litigation guarding of son"

Author: "Johnson, Verity"
Title: "Star-struck by a giant of literature"
description: "Star-struck by a giant of literature"

Author: "Cooper, Tracey"
Title: "Moa juggles motherhood, music and watching the world cup"
description: "Moa juggles motherhood, music and watching the world cup"

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "The last wish"
description: "Focuses on euthanasia. Considers the trauma of helping a sick person to kill themselves. Speaks to Yoka De Houwer, who has been diagnosed with leptomeningeal melanomatosis, and her partner Don Grant about the plans they have made for Yoka to control her own death, retired doctor Peter Hinds about the need for a law change, Dr Else Borst-Eilers, the architect of the Netherland's physician-assisted suicide law, about legalising euthanasia, and Lesely Martin who served half of her 15-month jail term for giving her mother, Joy, a fatal morphine overdose in 1999. Outlines the political position on the issue in NZ and overseas. Recalls the 2007 assisted suicide of Audrey Wallis with the help of American Susan Wilson."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Spooky business"
description: "Backgrounds the 1984 murder of the author's aunt near Shrewsbury in Shropshire, England. Speaks to the retired Royal Navy commander who claims to have found evidence that she was murdered by secret services desperate to cover up Falklands War crimes, as outlined in the book he has written with his wife Kate Dewes."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Black on white"
description: "Considers what the recently discovered Captain Robert Scott photographs reveal about the man and the fateful 1910-1913 Terra Nova expedition, as illustrated in 'The lost photographs of Captain Scott : unseen images from the legendary Antarctic expedition'."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "Key's magnetism spells foreseeable result"
description: "Reviews the last three years of the National led government. Rates and ranks the top performers in the National Party and the Labour Party, lists the lowest performers and mentions those who are leaving who may not be missed."

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "'Utmost respect' for Maori king's father"
description: "'Utmost respect' for Maori king's father"

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "In the poo ; The estuary a toilet bowl again"
description: "Investigates the condition of the Avon-Heathcote Estuary following the Christchurch earthquakes. Describes the research being carried out on the water and algae at the estuary. Remarks on the resilience of the locals and researchers to the smell and contamination. Gives a short history of wastewater treatment in Christchurch. Informs of the amount of untreated sewage and wastewater that has entered the area's rivers, estuary and sea. Gauges the effect of the Christchurch earthquakes on estuarine health, noting the role played by liquefaction. Presents an environmental forecast for the area."

Author: "Le Cocq, Jonathan"
Title: "Singing words"
description: "Reviews three concerts that remembered the recent earthquakes, 'Christchurch sings' (4 Sep), 'Christchurch memorial' (25 Sep) and 'NZSO odes to joy' (27 Sep), which were part of the Christchurch Arts Festival (12 Aug to 2 Oct)."

Author: "Brennan-Tupara, Nicola"
Title: "Still on the run after a decade"
description: "Still on the run after a decade"

Author: "Brennan-Tupara, Nicola"
Title: "Car-jacking victim's life still flies headlong to uncertainty"
description: "Car-jacking victim's life still flies headlong to uncertainty"

Author: "Beale, Kristin"
Title: "Confident chippie set to wow at nationals"
description: "Confident chippie set to wow at nationals"

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Ranger never alone as chopper rescue drama unfolds"
description: "Ranger never alone as chopper rescue drama unfolds"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Education Ministry 'fix-it' man was widely respected"
description: "Education Ministry 'fix-it' man was widely respected"

Author: "Grant, Nick"
Title: "Delicious dread"
description: "Reviews The Rebel Alliance production of Albert Belz' 'Yours truly' at Auckland's Basement Theatre (to 22 Oct 2011)."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Life force"
description: "Reviews the opening works of the 2011 Tempo Dance Festival at Auckland's Q Theatre 30 Sep to 8 Oct."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Futureproofed"
description: "Talks about designing houses with possible future disabilities associated with aging in mind. Highlights the premise of the Lifemark programme, which provides an independent seal of approval for residential housing that is usable, adaptable, accessible and inclusive. Speaks to Wellington architect Ron Pynenberg who has been promoting accessible residential design since the 1970s."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "The wild blue yonder"
description: "Focuses on the proposed Square Kilometre Array (SKA) radio telescope and the Australia-NZ bid to host it. Speaks to Melanie Johnston-Hollitt, chairwoman of the NZ SKA Research and Development Consortium, about the project that will construct the world's most powerful telescope. Explains that the telescope will consist of thousands of antennas that could stretch from Western Australian to NZ."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Game on"
description: "Offers some advice on the start of the new vegetable growing season, which traditionally beings at Labour Day weekend, including using seed-raising trays to start crops, transplanting seedlings, and making pots out of newspaper."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Gas-laden basin a big bonanza?"
description: "Informs of the corporate interest in the hydrocarbon potential of the Canterbury basin. Talks to spokesperson for the Texas oil company Anadarko Alan Seay about its drilling plans. Names the other oil and gas companies interested in obtaining permits for the area. Discusses the Government's goal to increase exploration and production investment, citing the comments of Energy Minister Gerry Brownlee on the size and exploration potential of NZ's large exclusive economic zone (EEZ). Looks at the content of the proposed EEZ and Contintental Shelf (Environmental Effects) Bill aimed at managing the effects of offshore exploration activities. Reports criticism of the new Environmental Protection Agency and its ability to mitigate any drilling related disasters. Explains the role of the Ministry for the Environment and Maritime New Zealand in policing NZ's EEZ. Relays the reaction to offshore exploration of Christchurch mayor Bob Parker and conveys his focus on promoting energy efficiency through the Christchurch Agency for Energy (CAfE)."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Peace activist target of 'official' hit squad"
description: "Announces the launch of 'A thorn in their side: the Hilda Murrell murder', a book that questions the death of the British rose grower and anti-nuclear campaigner. Talks to her nephew, former Royal Navy commander Rob Green, and his wife, peace campaigner Kate Dewes, about the surveillance and burglaries they experience in NZ. Tells the story of Rob's aunt, the investigation of her murder in Shropshire, and the suspicion of MI5 involvement."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 1979"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 1979. Reports on a large and destructive mudslide in Abbotsford (9 Aug), and includes a photograph. Details the loss of an Air NZ jet with 257 people on board during a scenic flight to Antarctica (29 Nov), and provides an update (30 Nov) and a photograph of the wreckage of the DC10 on the slope of Mt Erebus. Reports that a NZ detective would be flying to Britain to help investigate the death of Aucklander Christopher Martin (Marty) Johnstone, aka 'Mr Asia', murdered in a 'drug-world feud' by Aucklander Alexander James Sinclair, aka Terence John Clark (5 Nov). Includes a photograph of the alleged murderer."

Title: "'Leave my Quade alone' ... granny backs enemy no. 1"
description: "'Leave my Quade alone' ... granny backs enemy no. 1"

Author: "Shiels, Rosa"
Title: "On the coach"
description: "Talks to the Black Caps coach ahead of the team's Zimbabwe and Australia tours. Discusses his early days at West Melton school, coaching the Indian national cricket squad, his coaching style and his love of music. Lists the Black Caps international schedule for 2011."

description: "Praise for the first All Black centurian"

Title: "Big plans for microscopic fibres"
description: "Talks to Iain Hosie, technical director at Revolution Fibres, Auckland. Discusses their product - air filters specifically designed for homes and offices. Highlights the company's use of innovative electro-spinning technology, which creates nano-fibre (the basis of the filters) from a variety of materials, including collagen extracted from hoki fish skin."

Title: "Huntly Hurricane keeps eye firmly focused on NRL prize"

description: "Profiles the Christchurch man who has motor neurone disease (MND). Describes Solomon Grundy, the online giftstore he has established with wife Zara Fraser that specialises in gifts for the dying. Portrays the family's experience of his dying and his own open  approach to death. Provides a fact file on MND."

description: "Checks out the occupation of Graham Flanagan, a  prosthetic limb maker at the Burwood New Zealand Artificial Limb Centre. Chats about the rewards and technicalities of the job."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "Labour leadership big unknown"
description: "Takes an overview of the top performers within the NZ Parliament over the past three years and speculates as to who will win the election and who will be offered what cabinet postings if National were to win the benches. Includes a scoring of the politicians."

Title: "Parliament's heavy hitter bids adieu"
