Briefly describes the cases of seven NZers who have been detained overseas. Talks to Deborah Geels of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade about the types of requests received from NZers travellers in trouble, and the level of assistance available."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Tennis club manager & coach"
description: "Tennis club manager & coach"

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Protest movement"
description: "Profiles the NZ born dancer, describing her theatrical work that protests stereotypes of MaÃÑori and New Zealand identity.  Briefly describes her upbringing in Auckland and Northland, and her career. Discusses her US dance awards, international residencies, and whether her work translates to overseas audiences. Comments on the conservative nature of the NZ dance scene, racism in NZ, and the interests of her students at the Manukau Institute of Technology."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Under the covers"
description: "Visits the Frankfurt Book Fair, noting ambivalence about the future of the book among publishers. Reports on the trend to regard books as interactive objects, and tries out a book soundtrack designed by NZ company, Booktrack. Talks to Fergus Barrowman of Victoria University Press about e-book sales.  Anticipates the books that readers will be looking out for in 2012."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Face value"
description: "Discusses the MaÃÑori moko (tattoo), talking to University of Waikato professor and author of a book on the subject, Ngahuia Te Awekotuku, about people's reactions to tattoos. Touches on associations of moko with fear, strength and identity.  Briefly follows the history of the moko in MaÃÑori society. Previews the television documentary 'Allan Baldwin: In frame', directed by Te Arepa Kahi and showing on MaÃÑori Television, Oct 2011, which showcases the work of the amateur photographer and his portrayal of tattooed MaÃÑori women (kuia)."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Seeds of hope"
description: "Investigates the effect of pseudomonas syringae pv actinidiae (Psa) on Bay of Plenty Hort16a (gold) kiwifruit orchards. Talks to scientists and industry experts about the Plant and Food Research experiments aimed at finding resistant cultivars and NZ research projects on Psa in Italy.  Focuses on the Te Puke orchard where the disease was first identified, noting the extent of Psa's appearance in other orchards. Describes the measures currently being taken to contain the disease. Explains the role of the newly established Kiwifruit Vine Health (KVH).  Defines the kiwifruit vine disease.  Touches on a possible solution using bacteriophage (phage) in drain water.  Summarises key facts about the NZ kiwifruit industry. Illustrates the infection zones and high risk areas in the Bay of Plenty.  Speculates on how the Psa may have arrived in NZ, reflecting grower anger at a possible biosecurity lapse."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "'Leadership is a life sentence'"
description: "Profiles the former prime minister, describing how she changed the look of politics in NZ in 1987, and following up on her health and business activities since that time. Charts her role in women's health campaigns, consultancy, private business, and directorship. Touches on the careers of her family."

Author: "Carville, Olivia"
Title: "Air force accused of cruelty to grieving family"
description: "Speaks to the family of the airman, who died when the Iroquois helicopter he was flying in crashed on the way to a flypast at the 2010 Anzac Day Dawn Service in Wellington, about their treatment by the air force. Presents a timeline of events since the crash."

Author: "Scott, Alan"
Title: "Outstanding theatre"
description: "Reviews 'Who's afraid of Virginia Woolf' by Edward Albee at Christchurch's Elmwood Auditorium (2-8 Nov)."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"

Author: "McCrone, John"

Talks about the recognised sequence of psychological stages that follow a natural disaster like an earthquake. Speaks to Professor Bruce Glavovic of the Massey University Joint Centre for Disaster Research and Christchurch Mayor Bob Parker about the mental recovery process, and to a number of residents, including Don Elder, Solid Energy chief executive and spokesman for the Christchurch Business Leaders' Group, about their experiences."

Briefly reports on the announcement of the official launch date of MaÃÑori Television (2 Feb), blasting the opening of the new Frasers underground gold mine at Macraes (16 Aug), and the passing of the 'Civil Union Act' (11 Dec)."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Letters from the past"
description: "Focuses on the 'Dot's Little Folk' column in the 'Otago witness', which provides an unparalleled insight into childhood and teenage life a century ago. Speaks to historian and writer Keith Scott about some of the letters he came across during his research for 'Dear Dot, I must tell you : a personal history of young New Zealanders'."

Author: "Bennett, Adam"
Title: "Jockeying for position"
description: "Assesses how the minor parties (Greens, United Future, Act, Maori, Mana) are pushing their political agendas leading up to the election. Lists the election records from previous years for each one. Highlights some of the comments each of the party leaders have made on different aspects of their campaigns."

Author: "Bennett, Adam"
Title: "Greens buoyed by prospect of having 15 MPs; Party will dedicate 1pc of budget to conservation"
description: "Introduces the new candidates of the Green Party who will enter parliament if the party attains its target of ten percent of the vote. Includes Hollie [Holly] Walker, Julie Anne Genter, James Shaw, Jan Logie, Denise Roche, Steffan Browning, and Mojo Mathers. States how the Greens would more than double the Department of Conservation's budget over the next six years."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Ticks and crosses : the MMP debate"
description: "Focuses on the 2011 referendum to decide on the voting system to elect Parliament. Looks at the MMP (Mixed Member Proportional) debate. Speaks to Jordan Williams, spokesman for Vote For Change, which is endorsing Supplementary Member (SM) as its preferred replacement for MMP, Dunedin-based MMP activist Philip Temple, and University of Otago political scientist Bryce Edwards. Outlines the referendum options."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Title: "Ihimaera's latest not what it first seems"
description: "Ihimaera's latest not what it first seems"

Author: "Masters Catherine"
Title: "Chickens feel joy too, says expert"
description: "Reports from the 'Great Debate', held at the end of the 22nd annual Companion Animal Conference, on how science now shows that animals have rich emotional and cognitive lives and therefore ought to be accorded the kind of considerations that we accord our own species. Highlights the emotions of chickens and how we make them feel by breeding them the way we do for food."

Author: "Lundy, Sharon"
Title: "Kiwi honeymooners die in motorcycle crash on treacherous Nepal road"
description: "Includes biographical information."

Author: "Baillie, Russell"
Title: "Music become a habit"
description: "Reflects on the Flying Nun record label as it celebrates its 30th anniversary this month. Speaks to a selection of musicians from the independent label's first generation, including Shayne Carter, Graeme Downes, Robert Scott, Denise Roughan and Kaye Woodward."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Author (detailed): "Simon Collins, Jarrod Booker and Yvonne Tahana"
Title: "The haves and the have-nots"
description: "Talks to people from a cross-section of NZ society about how they are feeling going into the election and compares their opinions to the fourth pre-election face-to-face "mood of the nation" Herald survey. Comments cover the state of the economy, the gap between rich and poor, spending, the reccession, the two main party leaders (Key and Goff), and whether people are voting for the same party as last time or are changing allegiances and why."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "The lovely bones"
description: "Reports on the story of the SS Ventnor which was en route from Otago in 1902 when it sank in the Hokianga Harbour with the bones of 499 Chinese miners bound for ancestral graves in Canton on board. Visits a rehearsal to meet the cast and see how martial arts are being incorporated into the play about it written by playwright Renee Liang."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2005"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 2005. Reports and comments on the decision to dump Dunedin-based list MP Katherine Rich from her welfare portfolio (2 Feb), floods in central Dunedin (8 Feb), a blaze at the Bracken Court building in central Dunedin (21 Jul), and the flooding of New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina (2 Sep)."

Author: "Gifford, Adam"
Title: "An awfully big adventure"
description: "Talks to the writer in contemporary art about her career, the Semiotext(e) magazine, the scandal over her 1997 novel 'I Love Dick', and her latest collection of essays 'Where Art Belongs'."

Author: "Rose, Mike"
Title: "Top Olympic coach named Sailor of the Year"
description: "Announces the top Yachting NZ awards for 2011. Profiles Grant Beck, the most successful NZ Olympic coach of all time, who has had his name inscribed on the Sir Bernard Ferguson Trophy as the 2011 Singapore Airlines Sailor of the Year. Profiles Peter Burling, the Young Sailor of the Year. Highlights Leonard Takahashi-Fry, who won the 2011 Emerging Talent Award, and Bob McDavitt, who won the 2011 Coach/Official of the Year award."

Author: "Thornton, Peter"
Title: "Just another of life's challenges"
description: "Profiles the bladder cancer survivor who has challenged himself by entering the State New Zealand Ocean Swim Series."

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "A legend goes back to the basics"
description: "Talks to Martin Crowe about his return to cricket at age 49."

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "Warriors want Leuluai to return to his beginnings"
description: "Warriors want Leuluai to return to his beginnings"

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Sharing the love"
description: "Looks back on her career leading up to the release of her fourth album 'Belle' and her attitude towards her music. Discusses the input of producer Kody Neilson. Talks to Trevor Reekie about her "take it or leave it" philosophy towards her music she has had from the beginning of her career and the unique musical path she has followed."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "I, Tintin"
description: "Recounts the author's childhood memories of reading Tintin. Discusses the appeal of Tintin as literature. Looks at the influence of film on the author Herge. Highlights previous film adaptations of his works. Muses on how film-makers, no matter how faithful they are to the source material, cannot hope to match the memories and character voices of the reader."

Author: "Corner, Lena"
Title: "Tell me about it"
description: "Shares therapist tips and techniques for coaxing children and loved ones to open up and confide their true feelings."

Author: "Bradley, Grant"
Title: "NZ food boss has recipe for success"
description: "Looks at the merger of three businesses into a single entity. Profiles the new NZ manageing director."

Author: "Drinnan, John"
Title: "Creative boss' move reflects rise of quirky DDB"
description: "Profiles DDB NZ's creative boss and looks at the success of the company he works for."

Author: "Holm, Mary"
Title: "Buskers dance to the taxman's tune"
description: "Answers a question from a reader asking if her 16-year-old daughter, who is a casual busker, should be paying tax."

Author: "Warner, Kirsten"
Title: "Dig deep"
description: "Reports on the growing trend of community gardens in Auckland. Visits the former women's bowling club at Stadium Rd in South Auckland, the Devonport Community Garden, the Sanctuary at Unitec in Mt Albert, and the Ranui community garden. Highlights the 'Garden To Table' programme. Includes addresses and websites for those interested in getting involved."

Title: "Nun but the best"
description: "Gathers musicians whose music history with Flying Nun goes back to the early period of the label and asks them to share their thoughts on this month's 30th anniversary. Includes Shayne Carter, Graeme Downes, Robert Scott, Denise Roughan and Kaye Woodward."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2006"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 2006. Reports and comments on icebergs making their way up the Otago coast (no date), police reporting that the city was awash with ecstasy (24 Aug), criticism for the plans to build a multimillion-dollar stadium in the city (27 Sep), and Cadbury Confectionary announcing a $20 million manufacturing investment at its Dunedin plant (30 Nov). Briefly reports on the Southern Trust pledging $1 million towards building a pest-proof fence around the Orokonui Ecosanctuary (12 Apr), $3.7 million taxpayer dollars for the city's Chinese Garden (31 May), and plans for a cockle operation for Otago Harbour (20 Nov)."

Author: "Tolerton, Jane"
Title: "Who's afraid of the kitchen?"
description: "Looks at how Alison Holst is shocked by the ignorance of people and their inability to cook and eat nutritiously. Traces her life growing up in Dunedin, her career as a cook, television personality and campaigner for low-cost, healthy food. Touches on her dismay at the lack of basic cooking skills taught  in the school curriculum. Provides tips on how to teach people the fundamentals of cooking. Discusses her published books and her major influence on popularising new ingredients to a New Zealand audience."

Author: "Tolerton, Jane"
Title: "Alison Holst interview"
description: "Looks at how Alison Holst is shocked by the ignorance of people and their inability to cook and eat nutritiously. Traces her life growing up in Dunedin, her career as a cook, television personality and campaigner for low-cost, healthy food. Touches on her dismay at the lack of basic cooking skills taught  in the school curriculum. Provides tips on how to teach people the fundamentals of cooking. Discusses her published books and her major influence on popularising new ingredients to a New Zealand audience."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "The young & the jobless"
description: "Acknowledges that the rate of youth unemployment and disengagement from education in NZ is one of the highest in the OECD. Looks at schemes to target 'NEETS' (Not in Education, Not in Employment) and help transition students into industry and a career path. Discusses election policies by National and Labour to reduce youth employment. Examines how Otorohanga has maintained close to zero registered unemployment through its employment programmes. Features how a disaffected youth Josh Campbell has managed to stay off the dole."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "The job crisis for young New Zealanders / by Joanne Black"
description: "Acknowledges that the rate of youth unemployment and disengagement from education in NZ is one of the highest in the OECD. Looks at schemes to target 'NEETS' (Not in Education, Not in Employment) and help transition students into industry and a career path. Discusses election policies by National and Labour to reduce youth employment. Examines how Otorohanga has maintained close to zero registered unemployment through its employment programmes. Features how a disaffected youth Josh Campbell has managed to stay off the dole."

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "The century that was"
description: "Reviews 'New Zealand in the twentieth century, the nation, the people' by Auckland University of Technology historian Paul Moon."

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "New Zealand in the twentieth century review"
description: "Reviews 'New Zealand in the twentieth century, the nation, the people' by Auckland University of Technology historian Paul Moon."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Last request"
description: "Announces that scientist Sean Davison is to be sentenced for procuring and inciting attempted suicide for his cancer-ravaged mother, Patricia Davison. Talks to his siblings about their feelings about this momentous decision."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Sean Davison interview"
description: "Announces that scientist Sean Davison is to be sentenced for procuring and inciting attempted suicide for his cancer-ravaged mother, Patricia Davison. Talks to his siblings about their feelings about this momentous decision."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Wide awake"
description: "Reviews the performance of The Sleeping Beauty conducted by the Royal New Zealand Ballet until December 8th."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Sleeping beauty review"
description: "Reviews the performance of The Sleeping Beauty conducted by the Royal New Zealand Ballet until December 8th."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Paws for effect"
description: "Looks at how specifically trained dogs are transforming the lives of people with conditions ranging from epilepsy to autism. Highlights the importance that Molly the Labrador has made on the life of epilepsy sufferer Kiri Lee."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Epilepsy assists dogs"
description: "Looks at how specifically trained dogs are transforming the lives of people with conditions ranging from epilepsy to autism. Highlights the importance that Molly the Labrador has made on the life of epilepsy sufferer Kiri Lee."

Author: "Wright, Matthew,"
Title: "Filling the void"
description: "Reviews the biography of Major-General Sir Andrew Russell by Jock Vennell."

Author: "Wright, Matthew,"
Title: "The forgotten general review"
description: "Reviews the biography of Major-General Sir Andrew Russell by Jock Vennell."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Road to salon success not always rosy"
description: "Road to salon success not always rosy"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2007"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 2007. Announces the resignation of Dunedin South MP David Benson-Pope (28 Jul). Informs of the damage wreaked by severe winter cold, noting the damage sustained in Queenstown from frozen pipes (19 Jul). Reports on the release on bail of David Bain whose conviction of murdering his Dundedin family in 1994 was overturned one week earlier (16 May). Relays the decision by the Dunedin City Council to forgo upgrading the Carisbrook Stadium and to build a new multi-purpose stadium near Logan Park. Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Forensic skills help net fishing offender"
description: "Describes how a unique forensic analysis method developed by Dunedin scientists of the Iso-trace Research Unit helped identify a Tauranga commercial fisher who dumped illegally a catch of snapper in Aug 2009. Details the 'fingerprinting' process. Mentions the effect of the television show 'CSI' in contributing to a rise in students wanting to study forensics and analytical science at the University of Otago."

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Beach rubbish makes vacuum cleaner"
description: "Draws attention to a vacuum cleaner made by Electrolux of plastic retrieved from beach cleanups and designed by Laurie Foon of Starfish clothing label. Cites the description by Electrolux employee Julian Huitfeldt of the company's Vac from the Sea initiative. Mentions why the appliance was donated to the Rudolf Steiner School in Dunedin."

Author: "Dodgshun, Joe"
Title: "NZ leader up in the air"
description: "Announces that new adventure aviation safety standards came into effect today. Backgrounds and explains the new standards, presenting the contrasting views on the new rules of Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) general manager John Lanham and Queestown tandem hang gliding operator Shai Lanuel of Sky-Trek."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2008"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 2008. Reports on the closure of the Fisher & Paykel Appliances Mosgiel plant and the Tamahine Knitwear plant, noting the worldwide closures that F&P will implement (18 Apr). Reports on a fire lit deliberately that destroyed the 130 year old Stavely Building at the corner of Bond and Jetty streets, Dunedin (31 Mar). Measures the effect on the NZ stockmarket and investors of the inability of US politicians to reach a deal on rescuing the financial system (1 Oct). Announces the result of a campaign to raise funds to return day respite care to the Otago Community Hospice  in 2012 (23 Dec). Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "People 'like to laugh'"
description: "Talks to playwright Roger Hall about his latest play opening at the Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, 18 Nov to 17 Dec, 2011.  Confirms how he feels before every opening and how his other plays are faring overseas. Reveals the inspiration for his new play and its link to Russian folk dancing. Discusses the 72 year old's opinion on writing comedy. Anticipates his plans for a play on grandparenting that includes songs by UK songwriter Peter Skellern."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews ' ... or I'll dress you in mourning', by Flynn Morris-Clarke, None Gallery, until 13 Nov. Reviews 'dot it down' by Annie Nevin, John Z. Robinson and Robert West, Moray Gallery, until 19 Nov. Reviews 'New works', by Jim Cooper, at the Brett McDowell Gallery."

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "Back from the grave... and racing"
description: "Notes a recent surge in the polls for Winston Peters, potentially putting NZ First above the 5% threshold going into the election. Gives comments from supporters on why they support the long-time political survivor and relays his comments on politics and his critics. Outlines the Owen Glenn affair, and lists likely NZ First MPs should it get in."

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Mourners hear of MP's great passions"
description: "Mourners hear of MP's great passions"

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Chemical cocktail lurks inside cosmic ice pops"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Zooper Duper Flavoured Ice freezable flavoured ice-blocks, noting that many of the artificial colours used have been banned overseas."

Author: "Llewellyn-Smith, Juia"
Title: "Who wants to live forever?; Genetic tweak gives ageing mechanism the flick"
description: "Looks at the anti-ageing industry, with scientists, gerontologists and authors overseas believing that the human lifespan can be dramatically increased. Gives comments from Dr Marios Kyriazis of the British Longevity Society, Aubrey de Grey of the Methuselah Foundation and others discussing the rise in life-spans and potential for dramatic increases, and the social and personal effects of extended lifespans. Looks at author Dr Jeffry Life, using hormone injections and lifestyle management to maintain an excellent physical condition despite being 72. Describes the experiments of Darren Baker of the Mayo Clinic, using genetic engineering and drugs to selectively kill off ageing body cells in mice with progeria."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "New Londeners salute their taniwha of the Thames"
description: "Portrays the London-based Shaky Isles Theatre group as they rehearse 'Taniwha Thames', a production exploring the sense of dislocation felt by expat Kiwis and other nationals in London."

Author: "Lundy, Sharon"
Title: "Resolved to carry on Kerr's mission"
description: "Resolved to carry on Kerr's mission"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Suspended cop on full pay for almost 2 years"
description: "Suspended cop on full pay for almost 2 years"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Doctor's illness highlights struggle"
description: "Doctor's illness highlights struggle"

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Effective subtlety and some flourishing of wit"
description: "Reviews 'City of rivers/River of trees' by Joanna Pegler at Anna Miles Gallery ( to 19 Nov), 'The Dragon, the purple forbidden enclosure' by Dane Mitchell and 'In a forest' by Ann Shelton at Starkwhite (to 29 Nov), 'Moving on looking by' by John Ward Knox and 'True time lurk' by Gerogie Hill at Ivan Anthony Gallery (to 19 Nov), and 'Sudden gestures or noises' by Ed Atkins, Sean Grattan and Charlie Sofo are Artspace (to 26 Nov)."

Author: "Wells, Peter,"
Title: "Missionary position"
description: "Comments on working with artist Gavin Hurley to create the cover for his latest work, a biography of William Colenso."

Author: "Gaynor, Brian"
Title: "Costing the benefits shows we're sinking"
description: "Argues that government benefits, such as NZ Superannuation, are unsustainable. Discusses abuse of welfare schemes by individuals using family trusts to shield income and assets and means testing for the NZ Super. Examines the most recent Government financial statement, commenting on expenditure and whether this is sustainable for the future."

Author: "Dearnaley, Mathew"
Title: "Friends and foes unite to praise MP who fought for education"
description: "Friends and foes unite to praise MP who fought for education"

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Political tinkering a hurdle for savers"
description: "Looks at the policies of Labour, National and the Green Party with regard to KiwiSaver. Discusses with industry figures the scheme."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Plenty to consider when buying that car"
description: "Gives advice for buying a second-hand car. Looks at how to protect against fraud, undisclosed debts on vehicles, or mechanical problems when buying privately on Trade Me. Looks at the difference in consumer rights between buying through car sales and buying at auction, noting that the Consumer Guarantees Act might not apply to the latter. Looks at protecting yourself from problems with car dealers."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Hunt for deadly predator"
description: "Details the high priority hunt for a pregnant stoat on the Kapiti Coast island, warning of the potential devastation to endangered birds, such as the spotted kiwi, posed by predator.  Describes the trapping tunnels and traps being used in the exercise, noting the 'coordinated incidents management system' (CIMS) being followed. Reveals the cost of the Department of Conservation pest control work, naming corporations and organisations that are also providing financial support.  Chronicles the history of Kapiti Island from its earthquake related origins to its eradication of invasive species, and the re-entry by stoats."

Author: "Shearer, Brent"
Title: "Digging finds huge hole in asset-sale case"
description: "Criticises proposals by the National Government for state-owned enterprise asset sales if it is re-elected. Analyses the financial cost of selling off share-holdings in Meridian, Mighty River Power, Genesis Energy, Solid Energy and Air New Zealand, finding the Government's economic case unconvincing.  Suggests that the management and the financial  sector will gain the most from the sales."

Author: "Dobson, Liz"
Title: "Seven steps to happy travels"
description: "Gives advice for essential mechanical maintenance before taking your vehicle on any long holiday trips."

Author: "Santamaria, Alexia"
Title: "Toy stories"
description: "Looks at the world of adult toy collectors, talking to a few collectors, describing model railway and other clubs in the Auckland area, and portraying the Auckland Collectors fair. Gives contact details to several clubs."

Author: "Easton, Paul"
Title: "Kiwi airman refused to bow to Nazis"
description: "Previews a film describing the role played by a NZ squadron leader in saving the lives of 168 prisoners from the German Buchenwald prisoner of war camp during World War II. Notes the calls by Wellington mayor Celia Wade-Brown for recognition of the act of bravery and the hero's reaction to this. Touches on the family link that film director Mike Dorsey has with the concentration camp. Provides some details on Buchenwald."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "A dalliance with the Duke"
description: "Visits Russell in the Bay of Islands, describing staying at the historic Duke of Marlborough pub, sampling the local oysters, and taking in the other attractions of the township."

Author: "Levy, Danya"
Title: "The battle for Ohariu"
description: "Reports on a public meeting in the Ohariu electorate, noting that voting there will decide the future of the UnitedFuture Party. Comments on audience reaction to candidates contesting the seat: Charles Chauvel (Labour Party), Katrina Shanks (National Party) and Peter Dunne (UnitedFuture Party). Notes the potential  split facing National if supporters vote for Ms Shanks. Canvasses the views of three Ohariu voters."

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "Artistry in the eye of the beholder"
description: "Describes visiting the Kid's Trail with her family, part of the outdoor Sculpture in the Gardens at the Auckland Botanic Gardens (to 12 Feb 2012). Describes several of the attractions, noting their appeal to children."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Why was accused on bail? Death of a Schoolgirl"
description: "Why was accused on bail? Death of a Schoolgirl"

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Counting the beat"
description: "Chronicles the 46 year career of retiring police inspector Greg Gilpin. Describes his experiences during the sinking of the Wahine (1968), the Springbok tour (1981), as well as his policing of other protests and concerts and security planning for such overseas dignitaries as Queen Elizabeth II and US President Lyndon Johnson.  Discusses policing in the mid-1960s, 'shadow patrols' of gangs in the 1970s, and some of his narrow escapes.  Notes the similar career path followed by his son, Sam Gilpin.  Provides a short file of his career, cases, and awards."

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "Anyone for tennis?"
description: "Looks at some of the tennis clubs around Auckland suitable for a family, talking to staff and members from the Mt Albert Tennis Club, Pt Chevalier Tennis Club, Glendowie Tennis Club, Sunnyhills Tennis Club and Blockhouse Bay Tennis Club. Gives advice on costs for family memberships and where to find more information."

Title: "Politician and principal was passionate about education"
description: "Politician and principal was passionate about education"

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Thirsty work"
description: "Examines the need to drink adequate amounts of water if exercising and attempting to get fit. Gives advice on amounts to drink during exercise."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Hard-working builder took key role in big city projects"
description: "Hard-working builder took key role in big city projects"

Author: "Harrington, Suzanne"
Title: "Crazy about therapy"
description: "Discusses the role of therapy (psychotherapy) and her personal experience of it. Suggests that therapy should be considered as preventative maintenance rather than as crisis management, serving as active care of mental health. Describes her own history with therapists, the role of a good therapist, and what she finds useful about therapy, noting the possibility of lying to and manipulating therapists and the problem of choosing the right therapist."

Author: "Walker, Zoe"
Title: "NZ model learns Victoria's Secret"
description: "NZ model learns Victoria's Secret"

Author: "Holst, Alison,"
Title: "Kitchen unconfidential"
description: "Shares some defining moments in her life and career, and gives some of the associated recipes (Mum's date scones, Dad's rabbit (or chicken) casserole, ginger fudge, apple crumble. hash browns, lamb satay, golden fruit cake)."

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Title: "11/11/11 - a date even he can't forget ..."
description: "11/11/11 - a date even he can't forget ..."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Boy wonder"
description: "Profiles the subject of a television documentary, screening on MaÃÑori Television 12 Nov 2011, whose entire schooling has been in te reo MaÃÑori until he began studying law and politics in the summer programme at Yale University. Backgrounds his family and education, his experience at Yale, and immigration and financial issues faced along the way."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "An evil fascination"
description: "Revisits the killing of Honorah (Rieper) Parker by her daughter Pauline Parker and Juliet Hulme in Christchurch 1954, talking to lawyer Peter Graham who has written a book about the incident. Discusses the new sources he tracked down and relays the results of contact with the two women now living in the UK. Outlines how the plot to kill unfolded, with reference to Pauline's diary. Sets out the girls' friendship,  family backgrounds, the criminal investigation, and the lives both women have led since release from prison."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "Master of reinvention"
description: "Catches up with the chef, TV presenter, and author to talk about her new book about and personal transformations. Touches on family relationships, her entry into the culinary world, and her latest television series about culinary adventures in the French Languedoc-Roussillon region. Briefly mentions a fling in France that is written up in her book."

Author: "Walker, Janie"
Title: "The hunt for Kapiti kiwi"
description: "Describes a bird spotting trip on Kapiti Island guided by Minnie Barrett of Kapiti Island Nature Tours, Waioura Bay. Lists the birds the author saw and those she did not. Gives details for joining the tour."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Uphill battle [part 3]"
description: "Talks to architect John Mills about the four-storey house he designed to fit a difficult vertical site in Hataitai and the NZ Institute of Architects (NZIA) award he won for it. Details the engineering features and exposed structural design of the concrete house."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Delicate preparation to disaster"
description: "Delicate preparation to disaster"

Author: "Stylianou, Georgina"
Title: "Couple warm hearts of show crowd"
description: "Presents a series of photos from different events on the final day of the Canterbury A & P Show. Highlights the wedding between Jemma and Adam Chambers who won a wedding package and exchanged vows on the Village Green at 11:11am on the 11/11/11."

Author: "Mathewson, Nicole"
Title: "Police handler : brave dog saved my life; Successors to Gage born into police force"
description: "Talks to Christchurch police dog handler Bruce Lamb who was shot and wounded by Christopher Smith as he carried out a drug warrant at Buccleugh St, Phillipstown. Recounts the incident where his dog Gage died taking the second bullet meant for him. Discusses his rehabilitation from a shattered jaw and his career as a dog handler. Highlights the results of an appeal to raise funds for new police dogs including a photo of police dog Venus with a batch of new puppies."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Provincial Labour swims against the tide; The battleground seats"
description: "Looks at how high poll ratings and John Key's personal popularity could see National victories in Labour-held seats that would not normally be considered vulnerable. Outlines the Labour seats that could be won by National. Includes New Plymouth, Waimakariri, Rimutaka, West Coast-Tasman, Auckland Central, Te Atatu, Palmerston North and Te Tai Tonga."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Murder most foul; Sensational murder revisited"
description: "Talks to author Peter Graham about his book which re-tells the story of Christchurch's Pauline Parker-Juliet Hulme murder case. Discusses his professional relationship with Brian McClelland, junior counsel to Hulme during the trial. Looks at the various plays, movies and documentaries that have been produced over the years. Confirms the identities the two women took on after the event. Suggests reasons why the event is still of interest to people. Highlights the diary of Parker and the actual killing of the mother, Honorah Parker."

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Naked, drunk Zac assaults men in bar"
description: "Naked, drunk Zac assaults men in bar"

Author: "Higson, Charlie"
Title: "Rebellion 2.0"
description: "Discusses the role of computer games in the culture of 'the digital generation'. Suggests that games have taken on many of the elements of TV, films, music and books, and are taking over their role for the generation bought up with them. Describes the GameCity prize (Nottingham, UK), which is awarded to games showing the potential for computer games, describes the winning game, and muses on the difference between books and games."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Budding MPs out chasing votes"
description: "Follows two likely new Christchurch MPs on the campaign trail - Megan Woods, Labour's Wigram candidate and Eugenie Sage, the Green's candidate for Selwyn. Profiles each electorate and looks at the issues important to each."

Author: "Reid, Graham,"
Title: "Essays of a life and its legacy"
description: "Essays of a life and its legacy"

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Aussies arrive on staff search"
description: "Covers the Oz Jobs Expo careers exhibition held in Auckland, noting the participation of Australian companies, government departments, local councils and health boards. Talks to producer Jason Clayton about last year's exhibition and the numbers of people hired as a result and the increased number of visitors this year. Mentions the Australian states that NZers tend not to target from lack of knowledge. Interviews NZ passengers boarding a flight to the Gold Coast this week about their reasons for living in or moving to Australia."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Fishing for riled voters"
description: "Talks to Doug Stevens, Nzfishing.com blogger and United Future No.2 list candidate, and Tony Orman from the Council of Outdoor Recreation Association, about how the outdoor fraternity (hunters and anglers) feel their traditional pastimes are under threat from tourism and commercialisation. Looks at how the attitude towards the Kiwi ideal of outdoor pursuits is changing. Examines the ballot-box potential for some of the minor parties who are supportive of this group of people."

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "Film advantages add up"
description: "Highlights the advantages for international brands filming television commercials in NZ, noting the recent example of a big-brand advertisement shot in Queenstown. Touches on the spin-offs for NZ, citing the experience of Shortland Street actor Jason Fitch and his appearance in overseas TV advertisments in the last decade."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Kiwi's desert battle exploits overlooked"
description: "Reports on why Peter Cox, whose father Brian Cox fought at Sidi Rezegh in World War Two, believes the battle deserves much more recognition for what the NZ soldiers achieved there. Tells the story of the capture of Sidi Rezegh, a key element in the Allies' Operation Crusader in Libya during Nov and Dec 1941, in which the NZ Division was involved and the casualties that resulted."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Danger zone"
description: "Warns of the risks to young NZers who take up employment in countries that are dangerous or lack safety standards. Cites a recent plane crash in Papua New Guinea (PNG) involving NZ and Australian employees, the 20th fatal crash there in nine years. Talks to Paul Crook and Christine Crook about the lack of an investigation into the helicopter crash in PNG that killed their son Richard Crook in 2008. Describes other cases of  NZ travellers and workers dying overseas. Talks to Auckland-based recruitment specialist Paul Brophy about the realities of working in PNG. Chats with 22 year old James Featherstone about his job flying tourists to resorts in Namibia, and with helicopter pilot Alan Tull about his work in Alaska, Australia and PNG."

Author: "Stewart, Tamlyn"
Title: "Good report for Kiwi carbon scheme"
description: "Joins a conference of specialists and officials to find out how NZ measures up in terms of the emissions trading schemes being developed around the world."

Author: "Hunter, Tim"
Title: "A real trade deal - or will pigs fly?"
description: "Reports on the expected outcome of the Trans-Pacific Partnership Proposal being negotiated in Honolulu."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Pours for thought"
description: "Looks at the growing desire for the craft or batch-brewed beer market within NZ. Talks to various people within the industry about how they got started."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "No secrets"
description: "Catches up with the chef, TV presenter, and author to talk about her new book about and personal transformations. Touches on family relationships, her entry into the culinary world, and her latest television series about culinary adventures in the French Languedoc-Roussillon region. Briefly mentions a fling in France that is written up in her book."

Author: "Anderson, Natalie"
Title: "Books of love"
description: "Talks to NZ author Robyn Donald, who has published 85 romance novels, about her career and the challenges of writing romantic works."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "I want it now"
description: "Talks to some Kiwis about some of the backstage demands they have received from both local and international musicians."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Strip-club cash battle highlights the importance of making a will"
description: "Focuses on the case of an Auckland strip club owner dying without leaving a will and the resulting legal dispute between family and a police officer he had befriended. Cites comments from Public Trust managing director Richard Calvert on the increasing number of wills being contested and the legislative intricacies of bequeathing goods."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Uphill battle [part 3]"
description: "Talks to architect John Mills about the four-storey house he designed to fit a difficult vertical site in Hataitai and the NZ Institute of Architects (NZIA) award he won for it. Details the engineering features and exposed structural design of the concrete house."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "My robot"
description: "Looks at the array of services offered to retirement home residents at Selwyn Village by robots or mechanised healthcare assistants. Cites the case study of 88 year old Noel Tubman. Notes these machines are a conjoint scientific collaboration between NZ UniServices and Korean electronic companies. Stresses this technological innovation is an additional resource and should not be viewed as a replacement for nursing input."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Delicate preparation to disaster"
description: "Delicate preparation to disaster"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Robots the future of healthcare assistance"
description: "Looks at the array of services offered to retirement home residents at Selwyn Village by robots or mechanised healthcare assistants. Cites the case study of 88 year old Noel Tubman. Notes these machines are a conjoint scientific collaboration between NZ UniServices and Korean electronic companies. Stresses this technological innovation is an additional resource and should not be viewed as a replacement for nursing input."

Author: "Kilty, Robyn"
Title: "Nature runs wild"
description: "Talks about how a lack of human intervention due to the Christchurch earthquakes has not stopped her garden from flourishing. Notes the various roadside wild plants that she sees around Flaxmere and Hawarden."

Author: "Woodham, Kerre"
Title: "Comfort zone for nice guy"
description: "Interviews the Labour Party leader Phil Goff and his wife Mary Goff at their 20 hectare Clevedon working farm. Talks about their roles on the farm, the couple's 40 year relationship and retirement."

Author: "Priestly, Rebecca"
Title: "Rena : the fallout"
description: "Discusses how the stranding of the oil tanker Rena on the Astrolabe Reef has been the worst maritime and environmental disaster to date. Outlines salvage initiatives from government agencies, NGOs and other local community organisations to reduce the effects of pollution on bird and mammal species."

Author: "Priestly, Rebecca"
Title: "Measuring the fallout of Rena"
description: "Discusses how the stranding of the oil tanker Rena on the Astrolabe Reef has been the worst maritime and environmental disaster to date. Outlines salvage initiatives from government agencies, NGOs and other local community organisations to reduce the effects of pollution on bird and mammal species."

Author: "Liptrot, Meg"
Title: "Learn ley of the land"
description: "Recommends the use of herbal leys to support fruit tree health. Names the types of supportive plants that are good for fruit trees, especially apple trees."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Late male"
description: "Lists reasons why men tend to enjoy a shorter lifespan than women due to poorer dietary habits and physical inactivity. Suggests ways to lower their higher cardiovascular and cancer rates by incorporating more vegetables and fruit into the diet."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Shorter male lifespan preventable"
description: "Lists reasons why men tend to enjoy a shorter lifespan than women due to poorer dietary habits and physical inactivity. Suggests ways to lower their higher cardiovascular and cancer rates by incorporating more vegetables and fruit into the diet."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Shape up or ship out"
description: "Explains that company directors are under the spotlight in the wake of losses by corporate investors. Touches on trials and charges involving National Finance, Nathans Finance and Bridgecorp.  Talks to Institute of Directors chief executive Ralph Chivers about director responsibility and independence, and the implications of the new Financial Markets Authority Act.  Touches on director fees and gender balance concerns. Cites comments by Shareholders Association John Hawkins and Financial Markets Authority (FMA) chief executive Sean Hughes on the requirements of directorship roles in NZ and the regulatory powers of the FMA which is replacing the Securities Commission."

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "Coal miner has twin attractions for investors"
description: "Describes the challenges facing the Government's decision to sell off shares to the state-owned power company. Summarises the reasons the company will attract investors, focusing on its conventional mining resources and its potential use of frontier technology to access lignite deposits in Southland."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Another look at building quality"
description: "Lists and discusses end of session Bills before Parliament that are of particular interest to business interests. Focuses on the proposed Building Amendment Bill (No 4) that is aimed at greater protection for consumers and a greater responsibility on builder performance. Touches on the Financial Markets Conduct Bill, the Companies and Limited Partnerships Amendment Bill and the Commerce (Cartels and other Matters) Amendment Bill."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Reaching for the stars"
description: "Explains the technique of top grafting as a means for winemakers to respond to market demand for different grape varieties. Notes the   limitations on winemakers in France and Italy. Traces wine drinking styles in NZ. Acknowledges how well new varieties do in NZ."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Retirement operators keeping active"
description: "Looks at  Summerset Group and Metlifecare putting themselves up for stock exchange listings, predicated on the level of interest in retirement property investment. Details the financial positions and plans of each company. Contains an article on the plans of Kiwi golfer Sir Bob Charles for one of his Canterbury farms."

Author: "Bowen, Matt"
Title: "Drive, vision mark of one of Waikato's 'finest citizens'"
description: "Drive, vision mark of one of Waikato's 'finest citizens'"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Multi-choice for talented student"
description: "Multi-choice for talented student"

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Development goes awry"
description: "Reviews and comments on Cyndicate Property Group Ltd v Zheng and others [2011] NZCA 502, concerning the building of a residential property development north of Hamilton by CPG. Examines what can happen when purchasers buy property off plans and later want to rescind the sales agreement."

Author: "Ensor, Blair"
Title: "Tears for optimist who cared about NZ"
description: "Tears for optimist who cared about NZ"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Family shocked police had not checked on intoxicated driver"
description: "Family shocked police had not checked on intoxicated driver"

Author: "Anderson, Ian"
Title: "Rookie talent comes back from injury for new start : picked up by Knights"
description: "Rookie talent comes back from injury for new start : picked up by Knights"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "A significant once-in-a-lifetime date"
description: "A significant once-in-a-lifetime date"

Author: "Cuming, Angela"
Title: "Lewis in dock over assault charge"
description: "Lewis in dock over assault charge"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Former bank manager pleads guilty to 25 charges"
description: "Former bank manager pleads guilty to 25 charges"

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "Who wants to be New Zealand's Prime Minister?"
description: "Who wants to be New Zealand's Prime Minister?"

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Popular Matukituki Valley farmer farewelled"
description: "Popular Matukituki Valley farmer farewelled"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Hunter and hero loved Coromandel hills"
description: "Hunter and hero loved Coromandel hills"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2009"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 2009. Reports and comments on the jailing for fraud of former Otago District Health Board chief information officer Michael Swann and business associate Kerry Harford (12 Mar); the start of construction of the Awatea Street stadium (25 Apr); public reaction to a toga parade by Otago University students (26 Feb); the reaction of Gil Elliott to the jail sentence of Clayton Weatherston, who killed Sophie Elliott in 2008 (16 Sep); and the damage and death caused by a tsunami in south east Samoa."

Author: "Vine, Gillian"
Title: "Victorian villa the sum of its parts"
description: "Showcases Burnside, a villa built in North Otago by John Forrester Reid around 1896. Describes the house interior guided by Alison Albiston and Bruce Albiston, owners and proprietors of the bed and breakfast since 1974. Provides contact details for would be guests."

Author: "Hill, Marika"
Title: "Tears before joy for 'mate of the nation'"
description: "Tears before joy for 'mate of the nation'"

Author: "Steward, Ian"
Title: "Fine wine consultant faces fraud charges"
description: "Fine wine consultant faces fraud charges"

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Wicket-taking Wagner's eligibility wait winds down"
description: "Wicket-taking Wagner's eligibility wait winds down"

Author: "Lichter, Barry"
Title: "No fear in Terror's strong heart; NZ Cup winner gets late call to miracle mile"
description: "Speaks to the team behind the 2011 NZ Trotting Cup winner Terror To Love. Talks about Paul and Chantelle Court's move to Canada to start a new stable. Explains why Terror To Love missed out on an automatic invitation to run in the New South Wales Harness Racing Club's Miracle Mile."

Author: "Corbett, John"
Title: "French polish"
description: "Visits the French collectivity. Highlights its attractions and where to stay, eat and drink."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Real world work-out"
description: "Talks to the fitness guru about how her recovery from severe burnout and depression led to a change in outlook and a new book. Includes her top wellbeing tips."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Midnight oil pays off for student"
description: "Midnight oil pays off for student"

Author: "Field, Michael,"
Title: "Scientist reveals texture of lost Pacific paradise"
description: "Scientist reveals texture of lost Pacific paradise"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Colour amid the beige; The firebrand; The multimillionaire; The drug crusader; The bad boy; The survivors; The leaky mayor"
description: "Meets the more colourful and unpredictable 2011 general election candidates, including Sue Bradford (Mana Party), Colin Craig (Conservative Party), Jeff Lye (Aotearoa Legalise Cannabis Party), Hone Harawira (Mana Party), Pita Sharples and Tariana Turia (MaÃÑori Party), and Andrew Williams (New Zealand First)."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "'I can't believe it's 10 years ...'"
description: "Speaks to the widow of Sir Peter Blake about her new account of his life and death."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Tannery worker"
description: "Explains what a typical day is like for the G L Bowron tannery worker."

Author: "Monk, Felicity"
Title: "On a high note"
description: "Speaks to singer about her 2009 'breakdown' and her recent collaboration with Italian composer Ennio Morricone."

Author: "Colbert, Roy"
Title: "Shots of a lifetime"
description: "Talks about the author's life with type 1 diabetes, which he was diagnosed with as a 12-year-old in 1961."

Author: "Hunt, Elle"
Title: "Minority report"
description: "Meets some female pioneers in the gaming industry, including Frances Valintine, co-founder and chief executive of Auckland's Media Design School, and Microsoft Studio's Tracy Sellar."

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "Breaking down bloodstock barriers in the Waikato"
description: "Breaking down bloodstock barriers in the Waikato"

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Elephant in the room"
description: "Posits the idea we need politicians who are able to make the hard decisions in times of financial turmoil and asks the question whether John Key is the person to take NZ through the crisis. Describes the present global financial meltdown and compares it with NZs predicament. Outlines what the National Government have done to alleviate the economic crisis and three economists evaluate its performance. Includes Labour Party's "10 vital statistics that all show New Zealand has gone backwards under John Key" and National's rebuttals."

Author: "Woodcock, Fred"
Title: "Martin joins illustrious NZ club : long-serving bowler relieved at breakthrough"
description: "Martin joins illustrious NZ club : long-serving bowler relieved at breakthrough"

Author: "Geenty, Mark"
Title: "Fast bowler keen to mix it with batsmen : first-class cricket runs in the veins for Kuggeleijn"
description: "Fast bowler keen to mix it with batsmen : first-class cricket runs in the veins for Kuggeleijn"

Author: "Anderson, Ian"
Title: "Selection 'surprise' for spinner"
description: "Selection 'surprise' for spinner"

Author: "MacFie,  Rebecca"
Title: "Bipolar creatures?"
description: "Looks at the book, 'So brilliantly clever' which is a comprehensive account of the murder, the backgrounds of the two families, the increasingly strange and delusional fantasy worlds of the two girls, the trial itself and the present day identities of the two women."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Professor No Nonsense"
description: "Talks to Michael Corballis about his book 'Pieces of mind : 21 short walks around the human brain'."

Author: "Tutty, Kevin"
Title: "Tour of Southland winner inspired by Armstrong book"
description: "Tour of Southland winner inspired by Armstrong book"

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Just say mo!"
description: "Notes in November each year Movember occurs (the growing of facial hair). Asks whether Kiwi men have the potential to become world beard and moustache growing champions? Details the World Beard and Moustache Championships held every two years since 2005 and the various classes (Sideburns, Freestyle, Dali Moustache ... ). Comments on the history of facial hair and suggests reasons for the present decline in popularity."

Author: "Shaw, Peter,"
Title: "A life displaced"
description: "Recalls the time Georg Tintner came to NZ in January 1940 and his involvment in the NZ classical music scene. Discusses the biography 'Out of time' written by Tanya Buchdahl Tintner."

Author: "Grant, Nick"
Title: "Pantiless pantomime"
description: "Theatre review of Tartuffe, adapted by Louise Fox, directed by Shane Bosher, Silo Theatre at Q, Auckland until November 26."

Author: "Byrt, Anthony"
Title: "All at sea"
description: "Reviews Kermadec at the Tauranga Art Gallery, November 19-February 5, 2012."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Fever in the house"
description: "Notes the incidence of rheumatic fever in NZ and the serious damage it can do to the patient's heart. Notes the incidence of rheumatic fever is not only a socio-economic issue but an ethnic issue. Describes the conditions under which rheumatic fever thrives and the solutions to its prevention."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Blues in a minor key"
description: "Looks at the probability of National wining at the next election with it leading the polls by a considerable margin in the lead-up and the country's fascination with the Prime minister John Key. Looks at the consequences if Labour were to win at the next election."

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "Getting the message"
description: "Relates the author's experience when trying to deregister himself from Facebook. Indicates he is also considering putting LinkedIn on warning to isolate himself from its intrusiveness."

Author: "Dinsdale, Mike"
Title: "Nine months' work taken from former Otago dental school head"
description: "Nine months' work taken from former Otago dental school head"

Author: "Neilson, Penny"
Title: "Fairy tale in all its splendour"
description: "Reviews 'The sleeping beauty' performed by the Royal New Zealand Ballet, Regent Theatre, 13 Nov, 2011."

Author: "Caldwell, Olivia"
Title: "Free-falling for an entire minute"
description: "Free-falling for an entire minute"

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2011"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in early 2011. Covers the aftermath of the Christchurch 22 Feb earthquake, giving updates for 19 Mar and 14 Jun (23 Feb); the earthquake and tsunami on Japan's northeast coast, including a 16 Mar update on the nuclear radiation leaking from a Fukushima atomic power plant (12 Mar); and the wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton at Westminster Abbey, UK, (30 Apr). Includes brief articles on the death of Osama bin Laden, a windstorm in Dunedin and the opening of the Forsyth Barr Stadium in Dunedin."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Exchange fires up merino enthusiasts"
description: "Talks to Dave Anderson and Jayne Rive, the first recipients of the New Zealand-South Africa agricultural exchange funded by the Gordon McMaster Trust and facilitated by the Otago Merino Association. Discusses their trip to South Africa and the talents of their main host, award-winning farmer and Mega Merino stud owner Andries Pienaar."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Artistic response to rural return"
description: "Artistic response to rural return"

Author: "Harris, Anthony"
Title: "Artistic pattern caused by beetle"
description: "Describes a pattern inside a piece of macrocarpa bark made by the larvae of the cypress bark beetle Phloeosinus cupressi. Details the hatching and physical characteristics, native habitat and range of the beetle."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Water turns valley into 'power house'"
description: "Focuses on the benefits of irrigation to fostering diversity for businesses in North Otago. Talks to the operations manager for the Upper Waitaki Community Irrigation Company, the cropping manager from Hilderthorpe and the farmer from cropping company Mitchell and Webster, Justin Watt of Waitaki Orchards and the dairy farmer who relies solely on irrigation farming."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2010"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in 2010. Features the successful community campaign to retain a neurosurgery service in Dunedin, with enhanced service provision, and includes an editorial on the subject (11 Nov). Provides an account of an explosion at the Pike River coal mine on 19 Nov (20 Nov), and updates the situation as of 30 Nov. Reports that South Canterbury Finance has gone into receivership (1 Sep). Touches on other events during the year."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Epidemic of measles reflects 'sad' progress"
description: "Overviews the response of health officials to what has become a nationwide epidemic of measles. Asks whether NZ can meet its target to eliminate measles by 2012."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Long and low [part 2]"
description: "Visits the NZ Institute of Architecture award-winning Clearwater golf resort house of Christchurch's Wilson and Hill Architects."

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Advocate for farming, conservation"
description: "Pays tribute to the late high-country farmer and conservationist who was the third generation of his family to farm Mt Aspiring Station. Traces his contribution to agriculture and discusses his upbringing and community interests."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "King's High knight a top adviser"
description: "Pays tribute to the late economist, academic and adviser to successive NZ governments over the past 50 years. Talks to friends and associates about his time at King's High School, and his many and varied accomplishments."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Respected as inspirational athletics coach"
description: "Pays tribute to the late athlete, coach and sports administrator who was killed in the Christchurch earthquake, 22 Feb 2011. Talks to associates about the impact of his loss to athletics."

Title: "Formidable knowledge of education systems"
description: "Pays tribute to the late National MP, focusing on his accomplishments during a 32-year career in the education sector."

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Brave boy battles back after rare stroke"
description: "Brave boy battles back after rare stroke"

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "A soaring visionary'; 'Citizen scientist' a man of mystery; Man with a soaring vision"
description: "Backgrounds the life of the late agricultural science teacher who became an expert on and protector of seabirds at Taiaroa Head, as told in the new biography by the Dunedin writer. Talks to the author about some of the mysteries he researched in writing the biography of the 'citizen scientist', including the disappearance of the Hector Medal he received in 1953, and why he married his wife Agnes Richdale in Timaru."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Memorials of hope and anger"
description: "Talks to relatives of miners who died in the Pike River mine explosion about their feelings and attitudes in light of the one year anniversary of the event. Includes Rachelle Weaver (partner of Josh Ufer), Sonya Rockhouse (mother of Ben Rockhouse), Anna Osborne (wife of Milton Osborne) and Dean Dunbar (father of Joseph Dunbar)."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Yum, but why not go for the real thing?"
description: "Decodes the contents label on 'Sipahh - milk flavouring straws'."

Author: "McNeilly, Hamish"
Title: "Property guru to protester"
description: "Talks to the former Auckland millionaire property investor who has 'detached' from his previous life and is now part of the Occupy Dunedin protest. Overviews his career and comments on the global 'Occupy' movement."

Author: "Amyes, Peter"
Title: "The atmosphere of the theatre; Afghanistan reflections [part 4]"
description: "The executive officer with the 4th Otago and Southland Battalion concludes his chronicle of his experiences as part of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in Bamiyan Province, Afghanistan, serving as a liaison officer on the US Task Force Patriot for the NZ Provincial Reconstruction Team. Relates his experiences of four days in the Pul-e-Alam combat outpost (a small base on a battlefield in the capital of Logar province). Reflects on his time in Afghanistan and offers his assessment of what will be needed to secure its future."

Author: "Young, Audrey"
Title: "'Who wants a PM who's down in the mouth?"
description: "Puts a series of questions to Primer Minister John Key and opposition Labour leader Phil Goff. Includes questions to John Key about 'Teapotgate', asset sales and NZ's credit rating downwards."

Author: "Scanlon, Lee"
Title: "Having a baby - priceless"
description: "Talks to the mother of two who suffers from the rare blood condition neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia (NAIT), which caused the loss of her third child, Carter McKessar, before reaching full term. Focuses on the grueling treatment she is undergoing to successfully carry another child."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Title: "Why Frame spared the 'verbal DDT'"
description: "Book review of 'Janet Frame : in her own words', edited and selected by Denis Harold and Pamela Gordon."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Hayley Holt"
description: "Talks to the sports reporter about her upcoming boxing bouts, her role in a male-dominated sports world and as a good looking celebrity."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry"
Title: "A desirable neighbourhood"
description: "Talks to sculptor John Radford about the development of his ongoing suburb in miniature project called 'Graft', developed as a response to the effects of urban redevelopment."

Author: "Richardson, Daniel"
Title: "Boult swings into spotlight"
description: "Profiles the left-arm bowler who has been selected for the NZ squad to play Australia."

Author: "Gray, Wynne"
Title: "Remembering that remarkable event"
description: "Presents some of the highs and lows from the 2011 Rugby World Cup."

Author: "Johannsen, Dana"
Title: "His and hers"
description: "Talks to the triathlete couple about their dual ambitions."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "A natural partnership"
description: "Showcases the postgraduate diploma in natural history film-making and communication, launched in 2001 as a collaboration between the University of Otago and Natural History New Zealand (NHNZ). Talks to Lloyd Davis, communication director of the Centre for Science at the university, about the secrets of its success. Seeks comments from a graduate of the programme who is now an NHNZ employee. Informs of celebrations marking the first decade of the venture."

Author: "McFadden, Suzanne"
Title: "Eyes of the community"
description: "Browses a book on the first decade of the 21st century as seen through the eyes of the Herald's photographers."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "'Belle' her ball but others invited"
description: "Talks to the singer-songwriter about the process of recording her new fourth album, released after a five-year 'housewife vortex' hiatus following the birth of her son Joseph. Includes facts about her career and lists gig dates in Dunedin and Invercargill."

Author: "McCrystal, John"
Title: "Taking stock of life's relevance"
description: "Taking stock of life's relevance"

Author: "Shepherd, Roger"
Title: "Playing favourites [part 1]"
description: "Chooses five of his favourite albums from the record label he founded 30 years ago."

Author: "Master, Farida"
Title: "Santa's real-life helpers"
description: "Talks to Ian, Karen, Clare, Merran and Hamish Gibson who, as a family, have been involved in the annual Farmers Auckland Christmas parade for many years."

Author: "Wright, Danielle"
Title: "Along for the ride"
description: "Lists the best places in Auckland to learn to ride a bike on bike trails. Highlights the equipment needed, the best way to learn to ride a pedal bike, and various cycle safety courses."

Title: "Goff argues for capital gains tax and retirement age pushed to 67"
description: "Provides the Labour Party leader's answers to questions from journalists and readers."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Going to the dogs is healthy"
description: "Discusses how dog owners are healthier - both mentally and physically - than people without canine companions."

Author: "Jenkin, Lydia"
Title: "Spreading his wings"
description: "Profiles the career of the singer-songwriter and highlights his latest album release 'Hope Holiday'."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "Mine's depths of despair"
description: "Focuses on the first anniversary of the Pike River coalmine explosion, which killed 29 miners on Nov 19 2010. Explores how the families of the miners and the West Coast community are coping."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "Home bodies; Struggle to tackle property addiction"
description: "Looks at how successful NZ politicians have been in trying to end NZ's addiction to property. Discusses how only Labour has made the housing love affair a big issue this election and what this lack of major party policies means in economic circles. Highlights the property and housing policies of National, Labour and Greens."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "Survivors still in the job; Tapu imposed after dreadful slaughter"
description: "Reports on the two men who survived the Pike River coal mine explosion one year on from the 19 Nov 2010 disaster. Reflects on the tapu that was placed on the mine's site after a large-scale massacre between the NgaÃÑi Tahu hapu and a raiding party of North Island MaÃÑori about 200 years ago."

Author: "Smith, Bevan"
Title: "Kohlrabi creations"
description: "Advises on the uses of kohlrabi, and offers three recipes for the brassica."

Title: "Death in a coalmine"
description: "Looks back on the 19 Nov 2010 explosion at the Pike River Mine that killed 29 miners. Presents a timeline of the day. Illustrates the last known positions of where the miners and contractors were working. Includes photographs of all 29 men who remain in the mine."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "Scars of disaster linger"
description: "Speaks to the widow of a miner killed in an explosion at a mine near the Australian township of Moura in 1994 about her experience and her recommendations for the families of the miners who died in the Pike River coalmine explosion on 19 Nov 2010. Briefly talks to one of the survivors of the 1994 Moura mine explosion. Outlines the key information revealed so far at the Royal Commission of Inquiry into the Pike River coalmine disaster."

Author: "Redding, Melanie"
Author (detailed): "Melanie Redding, Natasha Kumar and Sarah Graham"
Title: "The five words that hurt more than any punishment; Same hardened soldier, but fighting a different battle; Rush to the Razorback; [Secondary scene]"
description: "Presents three essays from students at Columba College, and a photograph by  Year 13 pupil Flavia Wilson for her NCEA level 3 photography portfolio."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "Coast fights for its lost men"
description: "Focuses on the recovery of the bodies of the 29 miners and contractors who died at the Pike River coalmine after an explosion on 19 Nov 2010. Speaks to Grey District mayor Tony Kokshoorn and Bernie Monk, spokesman for some of the Pike families, about the importance of recovering the bodies. Highlights concerns about NZ's deregulated mining laws."

Title: "Special anniversary edition; 150 years Otago Daily Times 1861-2011"
description: "Commemorates the 150th anniversary of the oldest daily newspaper in NZ, first published as a four-page tabloid on 15 Nov 1861. Presents a summary of local, regional, national, business, sports, entertainment, and world news and feature articles published during that time. Includes comments from the chairman/managing director of Allied Press Ltd and current editor Murray Kirkness, and congratulatory messages from politicians, dignitaries and business leaders. Reproduces features on NZ's involvement in World War II, the building of the Clyde dam on Lake Dunstan, cartoons and cartoonists, and the history of rabbits and rabbit control in NZ. Traces the history of the paper, focusing on the contribution of the visionary Englishman who was the first editor of the paper, and profiles his successors. Includes a timeline of significant events in its history. Reproduces the first edition of the paper.  Profiles the current directors of Allied Press Ltd. Includes a reproduction of a woodblock of Dunedin in the 1870s, and a photograph of Dunedin in 2011."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Forthright judge who rose above adversity"
description: "Presents an obituary for the long-time Christchurch District Court Judge."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "A new note"
description: "Talks to the Christchurch-raised, London-based soprano about her development as a singer and performer since achieving international success as a teenager. Informs that she is performing in 10 cities this month for her first NZ tour in four years. Touches on her charity work in NZ and overseas."

Author: "Gibson, Eloise"
Title: "Saving us from super suffering"
description: "Investigates whether people should be forced to save for their retirement with compulsory KiwiSaver contributions. Speaks to Workplace Savings NZ head Bruce Kerr and Investment Savings and Insurance Association chief Peter Neilson about the issue. Lists the changes to KiwiSaver over its four-year lifespan. Highlights the KiwiSaver policies of the various political parties."

Reports on the US assault on Iraq in order to topple dictator Saddam Hussein (21 Mar); the passage of legislation to decriminalise prostitution (26 Jun); the assertion by Government that no one owns the foreshore and seabed (19 Aug); and the proposal to build the single biggest residential and commercial development yet seen in the Queenstown-Lakes District, at Jacks Point (21 Aug)."

description: "Looks at the future of softball and baseball in NZ.  Speaks to former Black Sox star and former US professional baseball player Travis Williams, now a softball coach at Florida State University. Informs that baseball has made great progress in 2011 in moving onto the international stage. Seeks comment from (US) Major League Baseball (MLB) Australia and Oceana director Tom Nicholson, Softball New Zealand chairman Rex Capill and Auckland Baseball Association president Chris Akeroyd. Reports on an embarrassing oversight by Black Sox management in naming three baseball players to the national softball squad, in an inadvertent contravention of the rules."

description: "Interviews the expatriate NZer about why she moved to Korcula, Croatia. Offers information about the city."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Boost your mental muscle"
description: "Focuses on a new approach, being used by both companies and public agencies, of applying behavioural science to persuade people to change certain behaviours or overcome barriers. Speaks to David Thomason, planning director at advertising agency DraftFCB, and Niki HarreÃÅ, associate professor of psychology at the University of Auckland, about the approach that is not without controversy. Highlights psychologist Robert Cialdini's list of factors that cause or inhibit people's responses to various persuasive techniques. Talks about psychologist Roy Baumeister's new book 'Willpower', which shows that self-control, rather than self-esteem, is the clearest determinant for success over a person's lifetime. Considers the problem of procrastination. Offers remedies for chronic procrastinators from business and psychology research Piers Steel. Spotlights the Electricity Authority's 'What's my number?' campaign, which persuaded people to save on their power bills by switching companies."
