Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Ready for the hard decisions?"
description: "Speaks to Labour Party leader Phil Goff about a number of policy issues ahead of the 2011 general election."

Author: "Coddington, Deborah"
Title: "Whanau focus fuels final charge"
description: "Joins the MaÃÑori Party co-leader and her family for dinner ahead of the 2011 general election."

Author: "Chapman, Grant"
Title: "How to make a 1280km bike ride seem easy"
description: "Speaks to the cyclist about his experience competing in the 5000-kilometre Race Across America (RAAM)."

Author: "Burgess, Michael"
Title: "Let's do the twist"
description: "Relates the experience of attending yoga classes every day for a month at the Auckland Yoga Academy."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Good garden health"
description: "Offers advice on keeping garden diseases and unwanted bugs to a minimum without spraying."

Author: "Oram, Rod"
Title: "X marks the spot"
description: "Comments on the upcoming general election, focusing on the economic policies of the parties and the referendum on whether to retain MMP. Asserts that MMP is the best system on offer for providing stable coalition governments and providing a broad representation of the electorate."

Author: "Reed, Megan Nicol"
Title: "By the vote divided"
description: "Comments on changes to the political affliations in her electorate and the political views within her family."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Radio producer"
description: "Talks to the producer of 'Mike Hosking Breakfast' on NewstalkZB."

Author: "Rapley, Kristina"
Title: "Playing restaurants"
description: "Illuminates the phenomenon of 'underground dining', a hybrid between a dinner party and a restaurant. Talks to three foodies who host dinner parties at their home for invited strangers and charge a set price for a meal. Seeks comment from chef and veteran restaurateur Tony Astle, and quotes from a new book by British food blogger Kerstin Rogers, who opened one of Britain first supper clubs in 2009."

Author: "Leith, William"
Title: "Mo' better men"
description: "Comments on the 'Movember' men's health awareness campaign, and the mixed messages men receive about their identity in the modern world. Muses about the effect of social changes on traditional male-dominated society."

Author: "Robinson, Michelle"
Title: "Mystery surrounds death of rookie security guard"
description: "Mystery surrounds death of rookie security guard"

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "Pine-bark extract helps brain function"
description: "Pine-bark extract helps brain function"

Author: "Napier, Liam"
Title: "Bad boy Luke : I tried to break Chase's leg"
description: "Bad boy Luke : I tried to break Chase's leg"

Author: "Plumb, Simon"
Title: "'No stopping me now', says Hewitt of winning run"
description: "'No stopping me now', says Hewitt of winning run"

Title: "All Black helped to hold Ranfurly Shield"
description: "Pays tribute to the late sportsman and physical education teacher. Relates his experiences as a flight lieutenant with the Royal New Zealand Air Force during World War II and as a Squadron Leader and unit commander of the No 5 Dunedin Air Training Corps. Recalls his exploits as an Otago rugby union representative and as an All Black."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Stayed competitive beyond 80"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Otago-raised late footballer and veteran squash player."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Major talent for electronics"
description: "Pays tribute to the Wellington-born late senior electronics technician. Describes his contribution to introducing and maintaining key research equipment at the University of Otago Medical School during his long career there. Talks to colleagues about his work and other interests."

Title: "Focus on family, home and foster care"
description: "Pays tribute to the late foster parent to more than 60 children. Talks to family and colleagues about her contributions to the community, along with her late husband Ivan Blackwood."

Author: "Jaquiery, Stephen"
Title: "Joining the hunt"
description: "Accompanies a group of new hunters on the Hunter National Training Scheme (HUNTS) course run by the Association to promote safe hunting practices. Talks to three course participants, the HUNTS national co-ordinator and tutor, Glen Dene Station owner Richard Burdon and voluntary HUNTS tutor Gerald Telfor about their experiences of the course."

Author: "Hamlin, Robert"
Title: "Cruel toll from 'Dunedin' loss"
description: "Reports on the sinking of the British light cruiser HMS 'Dunedin',  torpedoed in the south Atlantic on 24 Nov 1941 with the loss of more than 400 crew. Traces its connections to NZ and chronicles the day in which it was sunk."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "From Scotland to the world"
description: "Talks to visiting historian and author Prof Tom Devine about the history of Scotland and his latest book 'To the ends of the earth : Scotland's global disapora'. Informs that he will deliver a public address titled 'The Death and reinvention of Scotland', Otago Settlers Museum, Dunedin, 19 Nov 2011.  Lists other free events during his visit, part of the Scottish Festival, 19-30 Nob 2011."

Author: "Leigh, Edith"
Title: "Nana knew best"
description: "Talks to the author and grandmother about tips for raising babies, as detailed in her new book 'Mother's little helper : the old-fashioned guide to raising your baby chemical-free'.  Includes recipes for making your own baby bath wash, rice jelly, spray cleaner and a spicy winter warming oat bath (for mum)."

Author: "Vine, Geoffrey"
Title: "Colenso work sets standard for NZ writing"
description: "Colenso work sets standard for NZ writing"

Author: "Shepherd, Roger"
Title: "Playing favourites [part 2]"
description: "Chooses five more of his favourite albums from the record label he founded 30 years ago."

Author: "Marquet, Sarah"
Title: "Country girl to big city businesswoman"
description: "Catches up with the former Black Sticks hockey player from Ranfurly, now a businesswoman, fashion designer, wife of the Team New Zealand skipper and mother of four."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Savouring Nelson, the land of milk and honey"
description: "Visits the city for the New Zealand Guild of Food Writers conference. Talks to some of the artisan food producers in the region, and notes products available at the Saturday Nelson market and the Wednesday afternoon farmers' market."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Women exercise right to disagree"
description: "Revisits Auckland voters who were canvassed for their political views before the 2011 election to see how they actually voted."

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "Kiwi pop star up for eight awards"
description: "Kiwi pop star up for eight awards"

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Pure New Zealand mainly a myth"
description: "Alerts consumers to package labeling on frozen vegetables, noting that only one brand uses only NZ vegetables while others use imported ingredients. Includes a note from Oritain director Helen Darling on false country-of-origin labelling, or 'food fraud'."

Author: "Shepheard, Nicola"
Title: "The angry campaigner"
description: "Talks to the NZ born forensic scientist following his sentence to home detention for helping his terminally ill mother, Patricia Davison, die. Chronicles the events that led to the trial, including the reaction of family members, the support of his South African university colleagues, and his memoir detailing the last days of his mother's life. Describes how he will spend the five month's detention, his possible contribution to the Innocence Project of NZ, and his support for legalised assisted dying."

Author: "Janes, Robyn"
Title: "Legend's message lives on 10 years after jungle tragedy"
description: "Reflects on the author's visit to the NZ sailor and adventurer aboard his exploration yacht Seamaster in the Brazilian Amazon in 2001. Details his death on the yacht by pirates. Talks to his widow Lady Pippa Blake about her book 'Pippa Blake, journey: a private view on the 10th anniversary of Sir Peter Blake's death'."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Signs and symbols : decoding mediaeval and Renaissance iconography', Reed Galllery, Dunedin City Library, until 20 Jan 2012.  Reviews 'Laurence Aberhart', Brett McDowell Galllery, Dunedin.  Reviews '2011 City of Dunedin Art Awards', various artists, Otago Art Society Galllery, Dunedin Railway Station, until 11 Dec 2011."

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "Tree's demise Hobbit-sized crisis"
description: "Talks to Sir Peter Jackson about a century-old giant beech tree that was going to be used in a scene for 'The Hobbit' until it was blown down in a storm in Oct 2011. Mentions the solution to the problem and reports on the filming of a scene on the remote Arcadia Station, near Queenstown. Informs that 'The Hobbit' will be released in two parts in Dec 2012 and Dec 2013. Summarises the plot of the films."

Author: "Akoorie, Natalie"
Title: "Mother, son die in crash with log truck"
description: "Mother, son die in crash with log truck"

Author: "Liptrot, Meg"
Title: "A drip savvy set-up"
description: "Advocates three options for watering a home garden, describing each system. Supplies tips on water management for gardens, trees and lawns."

Title: "Court told how Kiwi murdered girlfriend"
description: "Court told how Kiwi murdered girlfriend"

Author: "Jackson, Kerri"
Title: "In his father's wake"
description: "Talks to the son of the NZ sailor and environmentalist about the production of a two hour television documentary on the life and career of his father that is an expanded version of the original film directed by Mark Albiston. Discusses his Sydney-Auckland rowing venture to raise money for a project off Borneo, and his studies for a masters degree in science communication in natural history film making at Otago University."

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Author (detailed): "Andrew Koubaridis, Jared Savage and Anna Leask"
Title: "Mate gave up killer; Killer hid his dark secret behind mask of deception; A woman in pain behind the smiles"
description: "Reveals how Brad Callaghan tried to conceal the murder of his former partner. Talks about his 25 Nov 2011 guilty plea. Looks back on the Carmen Thomas murder case. Reflects on the life of Carmen Thomas."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Quick, easy, natural - this one's a winner"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Frescarini Bambini 'cheese and vegetable mini ravioli'."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Valuations get hammered"
description: "Reports on the Auckland Council's revised property valuations. Spends a day at the Barfoot and Thompson auction rooms to put them to the test."

Author: "Dart, William"
Title: "Full house for Dvorak and Brahms as APO rounds off season"
description: "Reviews the Grand Finale of the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra's 2011 main series."

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Pensioner's dream of a lifetime comes true"
description: "Pensioner's dream of a lifetime comes true"

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "School in cyberspace; Hey look, my teacher's on YouTube"
description: "Reports on Microsoft's 'Partners in Learning Forum' in the United States. Talks about how the delivery of education is becoming increasingly technology driven. Shares the views of American educator, speaker, author and blogger Will Richardson on the fundamental change in the way education is delivered. Spotlights the innovative teaching methods of science teacher Chris Clay."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Pike River : failures on all fronts"
description: "Looks at what has been heard so far at the Royal Commission of Inquiry into the Pike River Mine disaster."

Author: "Johnston, Martin"
Title: "Check-up that saved my life"
description: "Reports on the academic and clinical wrangle surrounding the creation of a screening programme based on the prostate specific antigen (PSA) blood test. Talks to a prostate cancer survivor about his diagnosis."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Barry Holland"
description: "Speaks to the Newstalk ZB host about his radio career on the eve of his retirement."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Scientist aims for bird-free fly zones"
description: "Talks to the agricultural senior scientist from AgResearch about his work to develop Jackal AR601, an unpalatable form of grass to discourage birds from grazing at airports, thus decreasing the chances of bird strike. Describes the chemical composition of endophytes, which produce alkaloids that resist insect pests and produces a toxin (ergovaline) that deters birds. Talks about the next steps in his research, and divulges that he has been a pilot for several decades."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Twiss victorious in winged works"
description: "Reviews 'The restoration of victory' by Greer Twiss at Whitespace (to 4 Dec) and 'Ordinary mysteries' by Peter Wichman at Orexart (to 3 Dec)."

Author: "Wade, Amelia"
Title: "Theft of prized dance outfit devastates 10-year-old girl"
description: "Theft of prized dance outfit devastates 10-year-old girl"

Author: "Binning, Elizabeth"
Title: "Parents fear future without special unit"
description: "Parents fear future without special unit"

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Patchwork of village conversations"
description: "Investigates whether the Christchurch City Council is listening to local communities such as Sumner and Lyttelton in its handling of suburb earthquake recovery plans. Seeks comment from Jenny Ridgen, the city council planner responsible for the suburban centres programme, about the council's master plans for Sydenham and Lyttelton. Talks to local residents of Lyttelton and Sumner about  their frustrations with the slow pace of the recovery."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Godley's legacy lives on"
description: "Illuminates the life of the Dublin-born founder of Canterbury who died on 17 Nov 1861. Traces his time in the district from Aug 1850 and Dec 1852, when he returned to Ireland. Mentions the letters written by her wife to her mother, which provided 'vivid portraits of an emerging New Zealand society.'"

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Getting into the swing"
description: "Reviews the city's newest playgrounds, as tested with two children aged 10 and 9."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Knocking it back"
description: "Discusses the health effects of drinking alcohol including the cancer risks. Speaks to Professor Jennie Connor, Head of preventive and social medicine at the University of Otago who says that many people are putting themselves at risk unknowingly."

Author: "Samson, Alan"
Title: "Memories of an idyllic childhood"
description: "Reflects on his upbringing in the suburb of Brooklands during the 1960s. Comments on the Government decision to designate the community as being in the 'red zone', which will wipe the village from the map."

Author: "McGechan, Andy,"
Title: "Off-road ace Davis says: I'm back for my title"
description: "Off-road ace Davis says: I'm back for my title"

Author: "Ogilvie, Gordon"
Title: "New details help pin down Richard Pearse"
description: "Details new evidence discovered by Christchurch historian John Wilson at the Wigram Air Force Museum library about a Utility Plane invented by the aviation pioneer to aid the Allied war effort during World War II. Explains that this new evidence has changed his mind about the dating and performance of two of his Waitohi aircraft."

Author: "Smellie, Pattrick"
Title: "Trouble in Euroland"
description: "Discusses Europe's economic crisis and how it might eventually affect NZ. Considers a number of possible future scenarios including what could happen if Greece, Italy and / or others leave the Euro."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "F1 or bust"
description: "Speaks to the youngest NZ Grand Prix champion about his focus on motor racing, almost failing his driver's licence test, dropping out of school, and receiving assistance from Formula 1 (F1) star Mark Webber."

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "Helping Chch rise up; Busy building a vision for Christchurch, project by project"
description: "Talks to the man who is emerging as a rebuild entrepreneur for the region through the business owned by his family trust. Discusses the challenges and opportunities that have come after the Canterbury and Christchurch earthquakes.  Focuses on the Re:Start retail project in Cashel Mall, Christchurch, constructed from shipping containers, and other construction projects and priorities in the city. Seeks comment from Registered Master Builders chief executive Warwick Quinn."

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "The key is to find a way to be competitive"
description: "Interviews the Swedish-born, Christchurch-raised new chief executive of the Employers and Manufacturers Association (Northern)."

Author: "Little, Jennifer"
Title: "Tar and feathers"
description: "Reports on the work of Massey University's Oiled Wildlife Response Unit after the grounding of the cargo vessel Rena on the Astrolabe Reef on 5 Oct 2011. Focuses on the recovery process for rescued little blue penguins (Eudyptula minor)."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Houses in the sand"
description: "Talks with architect Eric Cesal who works for Architecture for Humanity and is looking to help solve the big housing problems in Haiti. Discusses his view of how innovative architects need to be. Ponders why his profession becomes heavily unemployed during recessions."

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "The 50 best children's books of 2011"
description: "Breifly reviews 50 best children's books from 2011."

Author: "Akoorie, Natalie"
Title: "Driver, 17, jailed 3 years for car death"
description: "Driver, 17, jailed 3 years for car death"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Sophie's mum feels for Christie's family"
description: "Sophie's mum feels for Christie's family"

Title: "Double loss for town's fire brigade"
description: "Double loss for town's fire brigade"

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "'Oh my gosh, oh my gosh'"
description: "Reviews Gerard Smyth's on-the-ground documentary from the first large earthquake 4 Sep 2010 through to 22 Feb 2011, along with the aftermath."

Author: "Byrt, Anthony"
Title: "When Gretchen met Eve"
description: "Reviews the exhibition 'Making arrangements' by abstract painter Gretchen Albrecht and sculptor Eve Armstrong, held at Michael Lett, Auckland, until December 23, 2011."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Youngsters who shared JJ house taken into care by CYF"
description: "Youngsters who shared JJ house taken into care by CYF"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Out of left field"
description: "Explains hemineglect, a condition in which the brain seems to divide the world in two and then ignore one of the halves. Informs of how it often affects people who have had strokes or brain injuries."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Danger of the dance"
description: "Speaks to the NZ writer about her new memoir that celebrates her passion for tango. Talks about the origins of the dance and its recent global resurgence."

Author: "Fox, Andrea"
Title: "Chateau Gallagher revealing its splendour"
description: "Chateau Gallagher revealing its splendour"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "WWII vet who met Rommel lived to 103"
description: "WWII vet who met Rommel lived to 103"

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Home again"
description: "Focuses on the reopening of the venerable department store in City Mall, renovated as part of the central city Re:Start retail project after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks to managing director Mary Devine, who started in her position shortly before the Feb earthquake, about the extraordinary challenges they faced to overhaul the business. Overviews the benefits of the refit and describes changes to the store and the retail precinct. Mentions the impact on staff."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "What's in a song"
description: "Talks to the elder Finn brother about the stories behind his hit songs 'I see red' (1978), 'I hope I never' (1980), 'Fraction too much friction' (1983), 'Weather with you' (1991), 'It's only natural' (1991), 'Persuasion' (1993) and 'The saw and the tree' (2008)."

Author: "Gates, Charlie"
Title: "Raw catharsis"
description: "Reviews the full-length documentary film directed by Gerald Smyth."

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Our Kiwis who cannot come home"
description: "Talks to NZers who have settled in Australia, discussing their reasons for wanting, and being unable, to return to NZ. Documents the  numbers of NZers in Australia. Relays politician responses to the issue, noting the comments on the economic divide in NZ by a Human Development Reports published by the United Nations Development Program."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "His place"
description: "Talks to the author of the book about 'man caves', written with Matt Elliott. Focuses on the uses of some of the NZ man caves he visited to research his book. Describes how he has renovated his former shed into 'The reggae lounge'."

Author: "Madgin, Diana"
Title: "Digging deep"
description: "Meets the people behind the Kaiapoi Community Garden, one of two finalists for the Best Community Garden of the Year award, presented by the 'New Zealand Gardener' magazine. Speaks to the co-ordinator of the garden, who was appointed to her position from funds provided by the Ministry of Social Development after the Sep 2010 earthquake."

Author: "Gibson, Eloise"
Title: "Not so smart, perhaps"
description: "Attempts to ascertain which are the best deals offered by the main suppliers of smart phones (Telecom, Vodafone and 2¬∞. Notes it is difficult when the contracts vary between the number and cost of sending messages, making a call and cost of uploading and downloading data."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "The wildest weather in the solar system"
description: "Highlights the opening of the international space show, 'Wildest weather in the solar system' which will premier at the Carter Observatory next week."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Warning that NZ could become climate haven"
description: "Presents the findings of a summary for policy makers of a special report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change which looks at how adaptation can help manage the risks of extreme events in a changing climate. Looks at the specific effects of climate change on NZ and the Pacific Region vis-aÃÄ-vis the rest of the world. Includes strategies to manage the risks of climate change and looks at disaster trends."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Boards' aim a high-trust, low-bureaucracy alliance"
description: "Overviews the South Island regional health services plan, to be delivered through an alliance of the South Island district health boards. Lists the problems that the plan is aiming to solve."

Author: "Morton, Frances"
Title: "Running for their lives"
description: "Catches up with a team of NZers who will run the New York Marathon as part of the Achilles team that helps disabled athletes participate in mainstream events. Talks to the founder of Achilles International American Dick Traum about his link with NZ.  Chats to athletes Tawera Nikau and his running buddy Frank Bunce, Dave MacCalman, and Rosa Carter-Holt about their running experiences."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Under attack; Battling immunisation ignorance"
description: "Asks how three vaccine-preventable diseases have been able to take hold in NZ again. Looks at the history of outbreaks of whooping cough (pertussis), measles and meningococcal C. Looks at public health strategies to contain the spread of these diseases in the areas where it is emerging."

Author: "Neale, Imogen"
Title: "On the beat, back at school"
description: "Reveals the pilot project that has seen police based in schools in order to break down barriers, reducing gang influence and improving relationships between schools, communities and police."

Author: "Milne, Jonathan"
Title: "Red or white and green for dinner at Turei's place"
description: "Visits the Green Party co-leader to discuss her nonvegetarian lifestyle, her beginnings in the McGillicuddy Serious Party, and her career  and family."

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "High currency nobbling high-tech exporter"
description: "Comments on the impact of the volatile and high exchange rate on exporters, focusing on the technology company that makes crystal oscillators."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Music was the abiding passion of renowned dtrumpet player : a life story"
description: "Music was the abiding passion of renowned dtrumpet player : a life story"

Author: "Napier, Liam"
Title: "Docherty looks for improved form in Auckland"
description: "Docherty looks for improved form in Auckland"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Watling batting for Black Caps test spot"
description: "Watling batting for Black Caps test spot"

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Webber set to play on world stage"
description: "Webber set to play on world stage"

Author: "Johnstone, Duncan"
Title: "'Beaver' in Bath gives the new lodgings a plug"
description: "'Beaver' in Bath gives the new lodgings a plug"

Author: "Boland, Mary Jane"
Title: "Mercy mission or attempted murder?"
description: "Relays the author's experience of giving evidence in the Dunedin High Court at the trial of the Auckland scientist charged with inciting and procuring the suicide of his mother Patricia Davison. Focuses on the book written about the event and the controversy over the information edited from it."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Art's pulse"
description: "Profiles the exhibition 'Prospect' by talking to the curator, Kate Montgomery, senior curator at City Gallery, Wellington, where the art is purportedly at the cutting edge of NZ art. The exhibition is part of a series of showings initiated by Paula Savage which started in 2001 that allow established artists or artists with future promise to showcase their work. Notes Montogomery has chosen a 'distilled' selection from fifteen artists."

Author: "MacIntyre, Dave"
Title: "Voyage into the legal system"
description: "Investigates the aftermath of the grounding of the container ship 'Rena', focusing on the legal implications of the disaster, and what lessons NZ can learn from it. Backgrounds the known facts of the grounding of the vessel on Astrolabe Reef, en route to the port of Tauranga, 5 Oct 2011.  Seeks comment from Auckland barrister Chris Patterson and University of Auckland Faculty of Law Associate Professor Paul Myburgh about the legal battles ahead, and the compensation limits NZ can claim under NZ and international law."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "High notes"
description: "Talks to the elder Finn brother about the stories behind his hit songs 'I see red' (1978), 'I hope I never' (1980), 'Fraction too much friction' (1983), 'Weather with you' (1991), 'It's only natural' (1991), 'Persuasion' (1993) and 'The saw and the tree' (2008)."

Author: "McMillan, Neale"
Title: "Nearly past the post"
description: "Comments on the final week of the general election campaign. Assesses what the various parties should do if a coalition government becomes a reality."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Dazzling by design"
description: "Presents the exhibition of Kristian Fredrikson's ballet costumes, noting many were made on a shoestring budget."

Author: "Power, J. F."
Title: "A history of Greek debt"
description: "Focuses on the debt crisis in Greece. Comments on new developments in the NZ banking sector, notably the emergence of building society Heartland NZ and the new co-operative bank PSIS."

Author: "Corry, Lucy"
Title: "Whats cooking?"
description: "Talks to Dame Alison Holst about her cooking, writing, television career as a prelude to her just-published memoir, 'A homegrown cook'."

Author: "Hattaway, Peter"
Title: "Slow-moving train wrecks"
description: "Offers advice on credit management, using the example of a young woman who sought his advice on how to reduce bad debts and take a hard line with customers and companies who owe large amounts of money. Outlines the five basic goals in credit negotiation with these sorts of customers. Touches on the European credit crisis."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "His place"
description: "Talks to the author of the book about 'man caves', written with Matt Elliott. Focuses on the uses of some of the NZ man caves he visited to research his book. Describes how he has renovated his former shed into 'The reggae lounge'."

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Go with the flow"
description: "Speaks to the professional whitewater kayaker about his lifestyle that involves travelling the world."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Indulge : Myele Manzanza, drummer, philosopher"
description: "Profiles Myele Manzanza, member of the Electric Wire Hustle band"

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "'Modest' spring in house market; Dispute over wine stock"
description: "Focuses on current conditions in the NZ housing market. Reports on the High Court decision to determine who owned the unbottled wine stocks associated with the liquidated companies Matakana Estate and Goldridge Estate."

Author: "Crichton, Fraser"
Title: "A brutal challenge"
description: "Describes the Taurarua Mountain Race and the terrain which starts in Kaitoke and follows the 35 kilometres of Southern Crossing all the way to Otaki Forks."

Author: "White, Ross"
Title: "Who could have predicted it?"
description: "Recalls some of the optimistic and sometimes fantastical predictions made in the 1950s and 1960s about the future benefits of scientific innovation to society. Comments on those predictions that have come to pass, and some technological innovations not predicted in the 1960s."

Author: "Towner, Rob"
Title: "Who faces the music?"
description: "Overviews the new Internet copyright infringement scheme introduced by the Act as of 1 Sep 2011. Advises on how the new regime affects employers, and offers tips on Internet use policies and what to do if an employer is issued with a detection notice."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Politicians, corruption and possibly surprising definitions"
description: "Reports and comments on the case of Field v The Queen [2011] NZSC 129, concerning the case of former MP Taito Philip Field and his dealings with some Thai tradespeople. Touches on the current election campaign rules of engagement."

Title: "FMA reviewing alternative performance measures"
description: "Reports that the Financial Markets Authority (FMA) will be issuing draft guidance for public consultation in 2012 on the use of alternative performance measures (APMs) by financial markets issuers. Cites comments by Elaine Campbell, head of compliance monitoring at the FMA. Lists key proposals expected to be contained in the draft regulatory guidance."

Title: "Phone card company makes the wrong call"
description: "Reports on the case of Compass Communications Ltd v Commerce Commission, High Court, Auckland, Cunningham J, in which the phone card company was found guilty and fined on five charges of breaching the Act through its marketing of five prepaid phone cards between 1 Nov 2008 and 30 Jun 2009. Provides additional background about the company and Section 11 of the Act."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "A wicked game"
description: "Speaks to the Australian actor about his 56th feature film, 'Rest for the wicked', working on 'Goodbye pork pie', and his fears for NZ and the world."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "In search of a scratchie"
description: "Focuses on the production of Instant Kiwi scratchcards. Speaks to Kevin Downs, marketing manager for Scientific Games, about their printing by the American company at a factory in Sydney, Australia, and Jamie Bickford, Interbrand's NZ managing director, about their creative journey. Talk about scratchcard security flaws, Instant Kiwi problem gambling, and making sure scratchcards are not too attractive to children."

Title: "Death of a village"
description: "Focuses on the red zoning of Brooklands. Speaks to residents about the decision that will condemn the whole seaside lifestyle village, which is located 10 minutes north of Christchurch. Reports on the angry discussion at the first public meeting after the decision was announcement"

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Off the ropes"
description: "Speaks to the event promoters, who combined under the Mammoth Events banner last year, about their event management careers and the relaunch of the Fight for Life celebrity boxing event."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Burger crew"
description: "Explains what a typical day is like working as a fulltime crew member at Riccarton McDonald's."

description: "Family struggle to get Emily home"

Author: "Bayer, Kurt"
Title: "Mum's long wait ends in elation"
description: "Reports on the reunion of the former Dunedin woman with her estranged son after more than three decades. Talks to her about her brief marriage to American serviceman Mark Shaefer and their move to the US, and how she was forced to leave her two young children behind in the US when the marriage ended acrimoniously 35 years ago. Speaks to her son about his plans to apply for NZ citizenship."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "'Just have fun', runner advises"
description: "Focuses on the friendship that developed between the former Wanaka resident and the student who teamed up to run the length of NZ to raise money for the Stroke Foundation. Talks to the pair about their love of adventure and some of the challenges they faced along the way, and their future plans. Mentions some of the people who have inspired them after having had strokes."

Title: "Architect served community in many ways"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Auckland-born architect and dedicated family man.  Traces his many contributions to the community and region."

Title: "Institute stalwart was well loved"
description: "Pays tribute to the late community volunteer who was active in a wide variety of organisations. Talks to her daughter, Verna Eason, and long-time friend Frances Maslin about her life."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Selectors dealt bitter blow to Jowett"
description: "Pays tribute to 'Otago's greatest sprinter', who died recently at his home in Brisbane. Describes the unfortunate decision of the NZ Olympic Games selectors to omit him from the squad for the 1956 Melbourne games because he had become an Australian citizen. Recalls his exploits on the track and his passion for rugby union."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Not lost in the hills; Last but by no means least ..."
description: "Showcases the Silver Peaks forest and hill country just outside Dunedin. Talks to Mountain Safety Council bushcraft instructor Sam Beamish, Bill Wheeler of the Dept of Conservation and Dunedin search and rescue co-ordinator Police Senior Sergeant Brian Benn about its reputation as a place where trampers can get lost.  Offers '16 easy lessons on how to avoid becoming one of the lost tribe of the Silver Peaks'. Provides additional information to help trampers prepare for the 'devil's staircase', the final stage of the 9km walking track."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Putting the past in order"
description: "Meets the woman who has transformed the small West Taieri cemetery from 'an overgrown paddock to a picturesque property' beginning in 1993. Describes the process of obtaining approval from the Dunedin City Council and securing grants. Informs that two of her sons, Peter Lawlor and John Lawlor, are buried there."

Title: "Cyclist expects 'world of hurt' as he circles Lake Taupo 10 times for dad"
description: "Cyclist expects 'world of hurt' as he circles Lake Taupo 10 times for dad"

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Rakatahi achieving great things"
description: "Showcases the annual Mana Pounamu awards, a Kai Tahu initiative celebrating MaÃÑori achievement in Otago secondary schools, recently held for the 11th time. Talks to four young MaÃÑori who are past winners about how the awards are helping to counter negative perceptions about MaÃÑori, and describes their current activities. Seeks comment from University of Otago acting director of MaÃÑori development Janine Kapa, whose  mother, Alva Kapa, initiated the awards; and Dr Kyhla Russell , Otago Polytechnic kaitohutohu (senior manager MaÃÑori."

Canvasses views of local residents, new Northland District Commander Superitendent Russell Le Prou and Far North District Council spokesman Richard Edmondson as to the possible causes of the fire, and their anger that an arsonist might be living among them."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "The night they killed a Kiwi hero"
description: "Recalls the legacy left by the late NZ yachtsman and environmentalist after he was murdered by pirates in Brazil while undertaking a mission aboard the 'Seamaster' to stop overfishing on the Rio Negro 10 years ago. Talks to his friend, who was aboard the 'Seamaster' during the attack, about his experience that night and recalls other environmental expeditions with Blakexpeditions. Describes the fate of the six Brazilian robbers who attacked the boat. Interviews his widow, who is in NZ for a special announcement by the Sir Peter Blake Trust on the 10th anniversary of his death (6 Dec 2011), and to launch 'The Legacy', the book she has written about their life together. Provides facts about the work of the Trust. Informs of the current activities of 'Seamaster', now named 'Tara'. Gives details about the 10th anniversary tribute, Karanga Plaza, Viaduct Harbour, Auckland, 6 Dec 2011."

Author: "Watt, Lawrence"
Title: "Enemy at our door"
description: "Chronicles NZ's reaction to the invasion of Pearl Harbour by the Japanese on 7 Dec 1941, focusing on the threat of Japanese invasion of NZ shores. Summarises the attack on Pearl Harbour, including a timeline of events. Talks to the former Sacred Heart College, Ponsonby pupil who was summoned to report to the Avondale racecourse on 11 Dec 1941, and joined the Schoolboy Company that was part of the First Auckland Regiment. Chronicles the response of the government, led by Prime Minister Peter Fraser, and the Auckland City Council. Speculates on what might have happened if the Battle of Midway had been won by Japan rather than the US in Jun 1942."

Informs that she has been nominated for the nationwide Lecturer of the Year Award, and describes why she likes her job and NZ."

Visits the Scandrett Homestead, built in 1885 by Irish settler George Scandrett."

Includes family camping tips from Nick Montague-Brown of Outdoor Action, and her own advice."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "What's best for the breast?"
description: "Examines the debate surrounding the use of thermography in detecting breast cancer. Highlights the experience of thermogram convert Bobbie Gillespie, talking to her about her concerns surrounding the radiation associated with mammograms. Speaks to Jamie Newman, who was involved in marketing for Clinical Thermography, and Dr Mike Godfrey, who largely pioneered thermography in NZ, about the clinical value of the procedure, and to Cancer Society screening and early detection adviser Sarah Penno and breast surgeon Dr Belinda Scott about the need for women to be fully informed about the possible benefits and potential harms associated with thermography. Talks about the increased scrutiny mammography has been coming under."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "The secret life of the mall"
description: "Reveals the subtle (and not-so-subtle) ways in which shoppers are encouraged to part with their cash when visiting the shopping mall. Describes behavioural experiments on how the brain works to either delay or satisfy the urge for instant gratification, which may account for why some people are more likely to splurge than save. Seeks comment from Dr Denise Conroy of the University of Auckland Business School on these results and changes to society that have increased the impulse to spend. Traces the origins of the shopping mall, designed and built in Minneapolis, Minnesota in 1956 by Austrian immigrant Victor Gruen. Mentions some overseas research into modify the gratification impulse, and offers some practical strategies for making more rational spending decisions."

description: "Long lost siblings have 65 years to catch up on"

Title: "Young Nats in mood to paint town blue"
description: "Young Nats in mood to paint town blue"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Weatherman forecasts serious work"
description: "Weatherman forecasts serious work"

Author: "Thompson, Wayne"
Title: "Improving child literacy among main aims"
description: "Improving child literacy among main aims"

Author: "Gillies, Abby"
Title: "Mum arrested for attacking bully"
description: "Mum arrested for attacking bully"

Author: "Shanks, Amy"
Title: "Car crash survivor singing her way to good health"
description: "Car crash survivor singing her way to good health"

Title: "Police probe after girl given rubber fetus"
description: "Police probe after girl given rubber fetus"

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The altruism anomaly"
description: "Spotlights some insights on the role and origins of kindness."

Author: "Levy, Danya"
Title: "Giving up the good life to 'fix NZ'"
description: "Talks to Winston Peters about his return to Parliament and New Zealand First after winning eight list  seats in the House of Representatives at the 2011 election. Chronicles his career since April 1993"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Suffer the children"
description: "Looks into the leap in reported child abuse cases. Speaks to child advocates, including Children's Commissioner Dr Russell Wills, about why they are pleased with the results and the reasons for abuse. Lists the victims of child abuse who have died in the past five years."

Author: "Nichols, Lane"
Title: "A life dedicated to an ancient tradition"
description: "Talks to master carver, Dr. Takirirangi Smith, on how he became a carver and the works he has completed."

Title: "Speedy youngsters stars of school sport"
description: "Names and briefly profiles the 10 leading achievers in secondary school sport. Names the next 10 achievers, high achievers and teams that excelled during 2011."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "School's greenies impress with vibrant garden"
description: "Charts the progress of Hutt Intermediate School since starting a recycling system five years ago. Notes an award has been won for their recycling system which has grown incrementally each year with a new greenhouse and an automatic watering system planned for this year."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Artificial cherries unwelcome in Xmas fruit mix"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Tasti 'Fruit mix'."

Author: "Rogers, Claire"
Title: "How to avoid the mobile phone from hell"
description: "Analyses the various plans offered by the various mobile telephone companies, Vodafone, 2Degrees and Telecom and tries to compare the cost of the services provided."

Author: "Cleaver, Dylan"
Title: "New Zealander of the Year; True grit; McCaw : I can play better, I've still got plenty to offer"
description: "Looks back on the Rugby World Cup-winning captain's 2011. Lists the other finalists and the past winners of the newspaper's 'New Zealander of the Year' award. Speaks to the All Black captain about his future playing career."

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "Supermarket wars; The front line in supermarket wars"
description: "Analyses the way supermarkets are designed to entice people who enter their premises to convert them into a buyer. Demonstrates how layout, product placement, cooking aromas, colour of products and decor and signage in a supermarket is designed to persuade the shopper to buy their products."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Getting into the spirit"
description: "Talks to Dunedin actress Terry MacTavish about her role as Madame Arcati in the Noel Coward comedy 'Blythe spirit', Globe Theatre, Dunedin, 8-17 Dec 2011. Backgrounds the play and its initial reception when it was first staged in Britain in 1941. Seeks comment from Rosemary Beresford, secretary of Friends of the Globe, about aspects of its work to restore the historic buildings. Mentions claims that the theatre harbours ghosts."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Gretchen Hawkesby"
description: "Interviews the chair of the Friends of Starship. Talks to her about her charity work and her family, including her step-father Graeme Hart (NZ's richest man)."

Author: "Strachan, Franky"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews '(Un)common ground', works by Olav Nielsen, Peter Cleverley, Sam Bennett and Claire Beynon, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Traverse; Surveying significant NZ glass', various artists, Milford Galleries Dunedin, until 10 Dec 2011.  Reviews 'Extended moment', solargraphy by Chris Reid, Monumental Gallery, Dunedin."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Champ by chance"
description: "Talks a mother of three and a proponent and active participant of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.  Notes although she has only been practising since last July she has recently won the women under 56kg class in the Pan Pacific Games in Melbourne. Explains the basics of the discipline and the commitment involved to make progress."

Author: "Dale, Richard,"
Title: "The legacies of history"
description: "Visits the second Asia Pacific Breweries Foundation Signature Art Prize exhibition at the Singapore Art Museum (to 4 Mar 2012), which includes 'The last cannibal supper' by NZ-Samoan photographer Greg Semu."

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Party-loving Kiwi on run"
description: "Announces how the police in Australia are searching for the Queensland Health employer after millions of dollars disappeared from the health body."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Nonsense and sensibility"
description: "Talks to the actor about his performance of Lewis Carroll's 'The Hunting of the Snark : an agony in 8 fits', Allen Hall, Dunedin, 1 Dec 2011. Informs that he has performed the poetic piece over 500 times without tiring of it, and discusses modifications he has made. Mentions that the performance will be followed by the South Island premiere of 'New treaty militia' by Auckland-based dance artist and choreographer Cat Ruka, with Josh Rutter."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Enigmatic explorations on show"
description: "Reviews 'RootMeanSquare' by Eugene Hansen and collaborators at Te Tuhi (to 29 Jan 2012), 'Being there, where?' by Des Helmore at Jane Sanders Art (to 23 Dec 2011), 'Voices of Mimesis' by Geoff Thornley at the Fox/Jensen Gallery (to 23 Dec), and 'Floating' by Sarah Hillary at the Anna Miles Gallery (to 22 Dec)."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Side seam', works of sewing and embroidery by Inge Doesburg, Lynn Kelly, Kathryn Madill, Mary McFarlane, Victoria McIntosh, Marion Mewburn, Jenna Packer and Elfi Spiewack, Inge Doesburg Gallery, Dunedin, until 9 Dec 2011.  Reviews 'Tiefschwarz/New works' by Sam Foley and Ben Ho, The Artist's Room, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Memory and Fabric/Walk/A Collection of still life' by Rose McLeod, Kate Fitzharris and Nicola Hansby, Blue Oyster Gallery, Dunedin, until 23 Dec 2011."

Author: "Whyte, Raewyn"
Title: "Ballet greats honour teacher's 60-year career"
description: "Ballet greats honour teacher's 60-year career"

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Gender-bending jobs"
description: "Talks to a number of people who have chosen a career not normally associated with their gender. Gains comments and views from Dale Imray, a male nurse, Shelley Weaver, a plumber, Alex Hansen, Lieutenant in the NZ Royal Navy, Timmy Potter, an early childhood teacher and Annie Lynch, an auto-electrician."

Author: "Wynn, Kirsty"
Title: "Teen drink alarm : tiny girl's party birth : teen mum says avoid alcohol after girl born 13 weeks early"
description: "Talks to mother Kataraina Hape and father Michael Williams about how she gave birth to her premature daughter after drinking alcohol the evening before. Highlights the negative effects that drinking alcohol can have on a pregnancy. Compares baby Williams to the average baby."

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "Brickie bucks the trend en route to New Zealand team for London"
description: "Brickie bucks the trend en route to New Zealand team for London"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Pinot pioneer"
description: "Profiles Neil McCallum, original owner of Dry River winery, and one of the first to establish a vineyard in the Wairarapa."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Father, son recover after kidney surgery"
description: "Talks to the snowboarding instructor about his experience of donating a kidney to his father on 7 Nov 2011. Seeks comment from Kidney Health New Zealand education manager Carmel Gregan-Ford. Provides facts about kidney disease and treatment costs."

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Freight's main man"
description: "Speaks to the Mainfreight managing director about his career and the freight company. Explains why he was named as the newspaper's 2011 'Business Leader of the Year'."

Author: "Fisher David"
Title: "Sperm-donor father kept his wife in the dark"
description: "Reports how American politician Bill Johnson, who has spent most of this year in Christchurch helping run the earthquake recovery, has been meeting women online who want help to get pregnant, without telling his wife or the individual women concerned about what he was doing. Looks at the concerns raised by his actions as a sperm donor in the fertility medicine community, whose guidelines recommend donations are made in the regulated environment of a fertility clinic, and that no man provide sperm donations to more than four families. Highlights the complexity of fertility law. Talks to his wife, Kathy Johnson, about her reaction to the news."

Author: "Marquet, Sarah"
Title: "Terrain presents challenges, but trail trust upbeat"
description: "Participates in a expedition down the Clutha River organised by the Roxburgh Gorge Cycle Trail Trust to check out the trail route, the terrain, the history of the trail and the progress being made by the Trust towards constructing the first 10 kilometres of the trail. Talks to Barrie Wills and Stephen Jeffery of the Trust and project manager Tim Dennis about archaeological and other features of the trail. Presents a timeline of progress, noting some access disputes are yet to be resolved."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Carter's wedding a perfect 10; Honeymoon tip : 6 weeks in Africa"
description: "Reports on the wedding ceremony of Dan Carter and Honor Dillon at the Lake Timara Lodge, west of Blenheim. Includes sketches of the wedding dress."

Author: "Weekes, John"
Title: "From Fur Patrol to celebrity photoshoots"
description: "From Fur Patrol to celebrity photoshoots"

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Demand likely to be high for assets; Education of shareholders essential; Demand for state assets likely to be high"
description: "Examines the Government proposal to partially sell off four of NZ's energy producers through a mixed ownership model (MOM). Talks to brokers about the process, focusing on the first two of the state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to be part-listed on the market sometime in 2012. Emphasises the importance of educating shareholders about the advantages of retaining shares in the energy companies to be partially sold down. Seeks comment from Dunedin professional director Stuart McLauchlan about the impact no the NZX of the partial sale and sharemarket listing of major SOEs."

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "Kimbra's love on the run"
description: "Talks to the award-winning chanteuse about her relationship with Melbourne singer-guitarist Josh Moriarty from Miami Horror."

Author: "Gorrell Anstiss, Celeste"
Title: "Fashion fanatics take higher risk"
description: "Highlights the various injuries that can be sustained from wearing high-heel shoes, especially ultra-high-heel shoes with a thick platform underneath. Includes a list of recommendations for women who really must wear heels."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "Hall of fame : theatre of infamy"
description: "Looks back on the history of the Auckland Town Hall to mark the centenary of its opening."

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "GP's partner hails fugitive's capture"
description: "Talks to Sandi Bell, the partner of David Higgins, who was killed by a hit-and-run driver in Vancouver in 2006, about the news that the driver, Xiao Zhang, has been remanded in jail awaiting trial on 33 fresh charges after serving half his sentence and being released."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Industrious deputy mayor vital and dynamic"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Queenstown Borough Council deputy mayor, teacher and environmental champion. Speaks to former mayor Warren Cooper about her 'greenie' leanings, and to her daughters Andrea Chambers and Kate Pavletich about her life and strongly held principles."

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Mum's tax-fraud charge"
description: "Reports on a group responsible for a $1.16 million fraud against Inland Revenue. Highlights the leader of the group and the way they perpetrated the fraud - collecting taxpayer information, applying for refunds, and receiving a percentage of them."

Author: "Weekes, John"
Title: "Brave teen put body on line"
description: "Talks to the recipient of a Community Hero award for his efforts in wedging himself between his severely injured aunt and a collapsed chimney after the Feb 22 Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "An unhappy yarn"
description: "Talks to the manager of NZ's last woollen and worsted yarn mill about its imminent closure if a deal is not reached by Christmas to sell its machines to its customers. Asks him what went wrong after the mill reopened in Jan 2000. Traces the history of the mill."

Author: "Chapman-Smith, Ben"
Title: "Coastal clash : when the developers move in"
description: "Reports on the differing points of view regarding the ongoing development proposals by developer John Darby of Te Arai beach, a stretch of coastline between Pakiri and Mangawhai, that is home to the NZ fairy tern."

Author: "Lloyd, Kelvin"
Title: "Not just for the birds"
description: "Describes some of the exotic and native vegetation at the Orokonui Sanctuary, and highlights work being undertaken by volunteers."

Author: "Schouten, Hank,"
Title: "A step into another era"
description: "Celebrates the restoration of the Salamanca Road Chevening four-storey apartment block built by Fletcher in 1929. Talks to the owner and historian about refurbishing the building in the style of late 1920s and 1930s and bringing it up to 100% of the earthquake code. Provides a brief history of the building and explains why the current owner was determined to save it."

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "Tragic murder of trio leaves scars on RSA; Triple killer could spend life in jail"
description: "Talks to family members of those murdered at the Panmure RSA ten years ago. Reflects on the elements of chance that occurred on the day in terms of who was there and who was not. Catches up with survivor Susan Couch about her legal battle to sue the Department of Corrections and the extent of her injuries. Wonders at the future of the Panmure Returned and Services' Association as membership has fallen due to the perceived stigma of the club. Highlights the Court of Appeal raising the notion of William Bell remaining behind bars for the rest of his life. Mentions an attack on him while in jail by Dean Joseph Shepherd. Talks to his mother about the reasons she does not visit him in jail."

Author: "Harker, Caroline"
Title: "A bird in the hand"
description: "Features a Department of Conservation (DoC) project in association with Peregrine Wines and the Fiordland Conservation Trust to transport rare mohua from Landsborough Valley, South Westland to Resolution Island, Fiordland. Speaks to DoC scientist Colin O'Donnell and Peregine Wines director Greg Hay about the aims of the project."

Author: "Chug, Kiran"
Title: "Marine biodiversity, ecosystems under threat"
description: "Summarises the main points of a talk by National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research scientist Dr Carolyn Lundquist at the International Congress for Conservation Biology, held in Auckland, about the projected impact of climate change on NZ's 3.5 million square kilometre marine environment. Discusses species migration, mass mortalities, ocean acidity, and coastline change. Briefly mentions the content of an international scientific review, presented at the conference, on current knowledge about the effect of climate change on biodiversity."

Author: "Dowden, Peter"
Author (detailed): "Peter Dowden, Charmian Smith and Hamesh Wyatt"
Title: "Before Christchurch, there was Wellington's quake; Engaging story of food and life; Collection proof poet can get better with age"
description: "Before Christchurch, there was Wellington's quake; Engaging story of food and life; Collection proof poet can get better with age"

Author: "Forbes, Michael"
Title: "NZ idle"
description: "Reports on a NZ-Australian research paper on the sedentary behaviour of young NZers published by the University of Auckland, Dec 2011. Notes that 'physical inactivity' is now a new branch of exercise science research because of the lack of activity in the general population. Presents figures for activity differences by age, gender and ethnicity."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "More than just a game; Game as anything"
description: "Talks to the former Wellingtonian, now resident in Denmark and lecturing at the University of Copenhagen Centre for Video Games Research, about his new book. Discusses his 'total obsession' for playing, designing, and blogging about video games, and his research into the philosophy of 'video-game values'; that is, how human values are reflected in the games we play. Sums up key findings of the research report 'Digital New Zealand 2012', undertaken by Bond University, Queensland. Reveals results of the Pricewaterhouse Coopers report 'New Zealand Entertainment & Media Outlook, 2011-2015', regarding the value of the NZ games industry to the economy."

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Flying live grizzly all in day's work"
description: "Interviews the helicopter pilot for HeliSouth about the nature of his work."

Author: "Preston, John"
Title: "Is your desk a death trap?"
description: "Examines the work of British scientist James Levine on non-exercise activity thermogenesis (NEAT), which measures how much people move during their waking hours. Presents the results of international research showing a correlation between inactivity and health problems.  Describes the treadmill desk, or Walkstation, devised by Levine, as well as his concept of walking meetings designed to help people exercise while they work. Gives technical details and prices for the Walkstation."

Author: "Kavanagh, Jeff"
Title: "It's all downhill from here"
description: "Reports on his recent half-day mountain-biking trip to the summit of Crown Peak, with a guide from heli-biking company Fat Tyre."

Author: "Irvine, Denise"
Title: "A second bite at success"
description: "Features the Putaruru hunter and chef who was a finalist on the 'MasterChef' television cooking programme. Describes how he has teamed up with locals Tracy Thompson and Stephen Thompson, who took over the lease of the 1954 built Putaruru Hotel with plans to refurbish and revitalise the business starting with the Master's Table restaurant featuring the local chef. Notes the restaurant is already earning a reputation."

Author: "Kay, Martin"
Title: "Divisive politician aided Maori causes"
description: "Divisive politician aided Maori causes"

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Fair buff of the turkey egg"
description: "Explains the story behind a photo of two-year-old Kent Matheson in 1975 helping dish out feed for the turkeys on his parents farm at Paparimu and why he recalls sanding freshly-laid turkey eggs."

Author: "Dungey, Kim"
Title: "Streetscape re-created"
description: "Reports on a project being undertaken by plasterer and conservator Daniel Pollard to re-create the lost Victorian facade of the three-storey former Standard Fire and Marine Insurance Company on Princes St. Talks to Daniel Pollard about its history and his search for a photograph of the building before 1969 to assist in recreating the decorative mouldings. Informs that current owners Ted Daniels and Wayne Marsh have secured a grant from the Dunedin Heritage Fund for the project."

Title: "Midwife with a caring heart who reached out to all people"
description: "Midwife with a caring heart who reached out to all people"

Author: "Alderson, Andrew"
Title: "Breaking all the rules"
description: "Describes, through a series of illustrations, the unorthodox yet successful batting strokes of the middle order all-rounder."

Author: "Pullar-Strecker, Tom"
Title: "Net-a-porter"
description: "Checks out software that gives consumers an opportunity to view online how clothes might look on them, speaking to its inventor, Wellington based US mathematician Sebastian Marino.  Explains how the web shopping system would work. Describes how the business, 77 Pieces, evolved and touches on Marino's work in the film industry."

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "Timeless art"
description: "Talks to the Danish born Wellington based jeweller about her craft, and why she decided to add a charity donation to the sales of her jewellery based on the motifs of love, compassion and eternity. Touches on her family and career and explains the difference between a goldsmith and a silversmith."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "The quiet revolution"
description: "Concerns the future of the Wellington department store given recent falling sales revenues, noting shareholder pressure to split the company's retail and property businesses. Looks at how overseas department stores have either closed or revamped their operations. Talks to managing director John Milford about plans to sell online and what traditional aspects of the store will remain. Speaks to doorman Tom Neve about customers and manners, and canvasses other staff about their ideas on marketing. Presents a timeline of the store's history."

Author: "Saker, John"
Title: "Dollar Bill"
description: "Profiles the US born billionaire who recently purchased the luxury lodge Wharekauhau. Lists NZ wineries he has purchased and explains why he is buying into the wine industry when many are selling. Describes his career in insurance and his interest in wines that led to his entering the business. Introduces his family, and discusses how he has been influenced by his education at the West Point army academy."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Different by design"
description: "Describes some of the speculative designs made by Victoria University School of Design students that were exhibited at an evening hosted by patent attorneys A J Park, in Nov 2011. Remarks that many of the works are enabled by new and emerging technology, but that many never become commercially viable. Also looks at graduate student awards from the Dowse. Highlights, among other designs,  a scarf that changes colour, a prototype herb oil distillation apparatus, an award winning humane possum trap, and a prizewinning bamboo tea set."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Going green"
description: "Showcases the Great Start Taita garden established by volunteer and 'NZ Gardener' of the year nominee Julia Milne. Details her gardening workshops, her community garden, and her use of recycled materials and sustainable gardening techniques. Describes a 'lasagna' garden made in community garden volunteer Ringi Hetaraka's backyard."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Lofty dreams"
description: "Showcases the work of the Victoria University architecture student who won the 2011Graphisoft Student Design Award. Details the work,  'Transcendent site', describing how the designer was inspired by the township of historic West Coast mining settlement of Denniston."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Race against time"
description: "Relates the case of a 23 year old man who died of necrotising fasciitis, Royden Regler, noting the details of Regler's medical treatment by GP, ambulance staff, and doctors at hospital. Gives the findings of an investigation into Regler's medical care and reports on the symptoms and increasing occurrence of the disease. Talks to Regler's parents about the effect of their son's death on them and their efforts to raise awareness about necrotising fasciitis."

Author: "Laugesen, Murray"
Title: "The will to quit"
description: "Suggests that products such as cheaper low nicotine cigarettes, electronic cigarettes, and cigarettes with nicotine content printed on the packet would help smokers stop smoking and reduce the amount of harm to smokers' health. Points out the strength of a tobacco addiction and that low nicotine and electronic cigarettes have been shown in studies that they can help smokers quit. Advises that exempting low nicotine cigarettes from tax rises and legalising electronic cigarettes would provide another aid for smokers to quit."

Author: "Hughes, Alistair"
Title: "Weapons of grass destruction"
description: "Takes a light hearted analysis of the relationship between the domestic lawn, lawn mowers and those who mow."

Author: "Zwartz, Hannah"
Title: "Out of the woods"
description: "Explains how to construct a hugelkultur garden, a permacultural technique that uses rotting logs to create fertile mounds for growing plants. Notes the system is being used at Te Rito gardens in Porirua."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Summer living"
description: "Briefly describes the recently published book, Summer houses, that features 23 home from Northland down to Central Otago which have been design to embrace outdoor living and maximise the connection between indoor and outdoor."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Beautiful buildings are 'humane'"
description: "Beautiful buildings are 'humane'"

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Author (detailed): "Trevor Agnew, Philip Matthews and Bob Docherty"
Title: "The best books of 2011"
description: "Selects and reviews fiction and non-fiction books considered to be the best published in 2011 for children, teenagers and adults."

Author: "Harker, Caroline"
Title: "Flight to Fiordland"
description: "Recounts the journey made by the Department of Conservation with 43 mohua (yellowheads) to Resolution Island where they will be released as part of a programme to ensure their survival."

Author: "Fenwick, Mary"
Title: "Flight of the female kiwi"
description: "Talks to NZ businesswomen in the UK about their experiences in business, noting that being foreign appears to counteract the disadvantages of being a woman in business. Highlights the NZ Business Women's Network (NZBWN), founded by London-based Kiwi Bronwen Horton. Relates how the NZBWN was founded and the value of having a broad range of businesswomen and professionals included in the group. Looks at UK Government efforts to push for more diversity in British businesses, noting that Kiwi women could be well placed to benefit from this."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Passing this way"
description: "Highlights the transit of Venus across the sun which will occur in June 2012 and be viewable in NZ, noting that this is the last transit of Venus until 2117. Recounts the history of observations of the transit of Venus, related from a book by Australian astronomer Nick Lomb, 'Transit of Venus', including James Cook's observations in Tahiti. Points out the historical significance of observing the transit of Venus for calculating the distance of the Earth from the sun. Advises on when the transit will be observable and how to view the transit safely, noting some of the events occurring to celebrate the transit."

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "PGC building's susceptibility known; disregarding it cost 18 lives in quake"
description: "Examines the findings so far of the Canterbury earthquakes royal commission into the structure of the Pyne Gould Corporation building which collapsed partially in the Feb 2011 earthquake. Outlines strengthening measures carried out since 1966, reports from individual occupants on the building's status after the September 2010 earthquake, and points out differing interpretations of the term earthquake 'safe'. Presents a visual sequence of the building's collapse."

Author: "Anderson, Charles"
Title: "Long journey ends for Kiwi paratrooper"
description: "Long journey ends for Kiwi paratrooper"

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "Getting it White is David's focus"
description: "Getting it White is David's focus"

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "Taking stock of a life in saleyards"
description: "Chats to the stock agent at Canterbury Agricultural Park about his 50 years working in the stock and station industry. Reflects on changes in the industry, the highlights of his career, memorable characters he worked with, and the ups and downs of lamb prices."

Author: "Donaldson, Michael"
Title: "How to feel like a celebrity"
description: "Relates the experience of spending the weekend at the Millbrook Resort Hotel and Spa."

Title: "Gender-bending jobs"
description: "Talks to a number of people who have chosen a career not normally associated with their gender. Gains comments and views from Dale Imray, a male nurse, Shelley Weaver, a plumber, Alex Hansen, Lieutenant in the NZ Royal Navy, Timmy Potter, an early childhood teacher and Annie Lynch, an auto-electrician."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Lighting up"
description: "Talks to two households where Christmas decorations are taken to extraordinary lengths. Describes the effort put in by Stan and Connie Callaghan, Glastonbury Drive, Burwood and Cherie and Dayton Atkinson, North Parade, Richmond."

Author: "Croot, James"
Title: "Getting jiggy"
description: "Investigates the popularity of Irish dancing since Riverdance and Lord of the Dance. Talks to John Carey, an eight-times world champion, one of the first non-Irish members of Riverdance and key choreographer on the original Lord of the Dance, who will be in NZ in July to judge the national championships."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Teachers unsung heroes"
description: "Acknowledges the part played by Christchurch teachers in the aftermath of the Feb 22 2011 earthquake. Looks at the uncertainty schools and teachers face in the face of dropping rolls and damaged school buildings. Speaks to New Zealand Principals Association Peter Simpson about other issues facing schools: primary school league tables, competition in a co-operative profession, charter schools, widening gaps in student ability, and lack of consultation with government officials."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Summer sounds"
description: "Takes a look at what sounds the author considers reminiscent of the season of summer and describes the familiar noise that would come from a cricket team, cricket ground and radio commentaries."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Summer living"
description: "Briefly describes the recently published book, Summer houses, that features 23 home from Northland down to Central Otago which have been design to embrace outdoor living and maximise the connection between indoor and outdoor."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Road trip littered with errors and ego"
description: "Road trip littered with errors and ego"

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Keynote speaker"
description: "Explains what a typical day is like for the Covert Entertainment director and Mind Warriors International co-director."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Lego man puts blocks in place"
description: "Presents divergent opinions on the performance and design of the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA). Talks to Cera chief executive Roger Sutton about the perceptions, his views of the organisation's structure and powers,  the people he has chosen for his management team, and the pace at which the group is proceeding. Focuses on general manager of operations Warwick Isaacs, who is responsible for signing off the demolition of Christchurch buildings. Chronicles the history of the organisation since the Sep 2010 earthquake."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Killers on the loose"
description: "Seeks reasons for the high numbers of vaccine-preventable diseases currently prevalent in NZ. Looks at problems in immunisation levels and programmes in NZ. Provides medical facts about whooping cough, meningococcal disease and measles. Gives statistics for whooping cough in South Island communities."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Motor sports writer helped youngsters"
description: "Motor sports writer helped youngsters"

Author: "Agnew, Trevor"
Author (detailed): "Trevor Agnew, Philip Matthews and Bob Docherty"
Title: "The best books of 2011"
description: "Selects and reviews fiction and non-fiction books considered to be the best published in 2011 for children, teenagers and adults."

Author: "Saker, John"
Title: "Dollar Bill"
description: "Profiles the US born billionaire who recently purchased the luxury lodge Wharekauhau. Lists NZ wineries he has purchased and explains why he is buying into the wine industry when many are selling. Describes his career in insurance and his interest in wines that led to his entering the business. Introduces his family, and discusses how he has been influenced by his education at the West Point army academy."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "City of dreams"
description: "Showcases the work of the Victoria University architecture student who won the 2011Graphisoft Student Design Award. Details the work,  'Transcendent site', describing how the designer was inspired by the township of historic West Coast mining settlement of Denniston."

Author: "Peka, June"
Title: "Rock star"
description: "Instructs on how to make a rocklike container out of polystyrene, using it for an easily moved rock garden."

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "Damn the dam?; Battle rages over valley's future; Before and after"
description: "Puts forward the pros and cons of building a dam on the Nevis River and chronicles the events from the 1960s when Otago Central Electric Power Board started investigating feasibility of a hydro scheme in Nevis Valley."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "A religious divide"
description: "Reports on the resignation of the Dean of Christ Church Cathedral Peter Beck and the suggestion that he fell out with Bishop Victoria Matthews over the future of the cathedral, which was severely damaged in the Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks about the break down in relations between church leaders and the Christchurch City Council heritage staff over the building. Presents a brief history of the cathedral."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "The great education experiment"
description: "Reports on the reaction to the Act Party's charter school education policy, which is based around a controversial American model that dispenses with central regulation."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Curtain to rise at new theatre"
description: "Reports Christchurch's Court Theatre will begin a new life in a new location in Bernard Street, Addington after the old theatre in the Christchurch Arts Centre was destroyed in the February 22, 2011 earthquake."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Excessive chat, not much voice?"
description: "Charts the progress of a community forum, a cross-section of Christchurch people, set up by Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee as his official sounding board, one of three checks and balances on his ministerial powers."

Author: "Gamble, Warren"
Title: "Winston's men ready to rumble"
description: "Profiles two of Canterbury's newest members of parliament, Dennis O'Rourke and Richard Prosser, members of NZ First and how they got into politics and some details of what they have experienced in life."

Author: "Plumb, Simon"
Title: "Adams flies Bird's Nest as London calls"
description: "Catches up with the Olympic shot-put champion. Talks about training in Switzerland under veteran coach Jean-Pierre Egger, the increased pressure of being number one, and her aims for 2012."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "Bookseller yearns to be back"
description: "Talks to owner of Smith's Bookshop, Barry Hancox about his plans to restart his business as soon as is practicable. Smith's Bookshop had become a Christchurch institution but was destroyed in February's earthquake where it had been trading and the business had been going since 1894."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Ensuring dogs have not had their day"
description: "Talks to Francine Murray, the president of Malvern Collie Club, one of 20 dog trial clubs in Canterbury and 90 in NZ. Laments the decline in the number of working sheep dogs which parallels the decline of the number of sheep being farmed. Comments on how long the Malvern Collie Club has been in existence and the special relationship built up between shepherds and their dogs."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "'I was a roughneck by occupation and by behaviour'"
description: "Speaks to the former lawyer and ACT party law and order spokesman about how his life has unravelled in the past 14 months. Talks about the relentless media attention, the fake passport scandal, his drinking, his Tonga assault conviction, and the ACT party. Presents a brief overview of his life."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Back on track"
description: "Profiles the policewoman and triathlete. Speaks to the Rotorua-raised Te Puke station commander about the horrific injuries she suffered in a car crash on 22 Dec 2010 and her rehabilitation."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Wedding singer"
description: "Explains what it is like working as a wedding singer."

Author: "McMillan, Heather"
Title: "Starter's chance"
description: "Offers a guide to surviving the first day in a new job."

Author: "Smithies, Grant"
Title: "The dubstep divide"
description: "Looks at how dubstep (a genre of electronic dance music born in South London) has caught on in heartland NZ."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "Boot put into orthotics system"
description: "Talks to the man who designed his own orthopaedic shoe to adapt to his club foot, after waiting for a year for a new shoe through the public health system. Asks a representative of the Southern District Health Board why they have changed their shoe contract from Orthotics Otago to Christchurch firm Orthotics Centre Ltd. Seeks comment  from Nigel McKinlay of Dunedin firm McKinlays Footwear about his criticisms of the tender process."

Author: "Hartley, Simon"
Title: "Heli-hunting group speaks out"
description: "Investigates the potential financial impact to tourism if a Dept of Conservation (DoC) proposal to ban heli-hunting is accepted by Parliament. Backgrounds the practice of heli-hunting ('aerially assisted trophy hunting'), and the deal engineered by United Future leader Peter Dunne to outlaw the practice on DoC land by 2013. Speaks to Dunedin-based Queen's Counsel Colin Withall, representing the South Island Wild Animal Recovery Operations Association, about its opposition to the proposal. Defends the practice. Mentions the stance of other hunting organisations on the proposal to ban heli-hunting."

Title: "Controversial former MP prompted party legislation"
description: "Presents an obituary for the former MP whose decision to resign from the Alliance Party and establish her own political party prompted the passage of the Electoral (Integrity) Amendment Act 2011, also known as the 'waka-jumping' legislation."

Title: "Doc ranger could fix anything"
