description: "Pays tribute to the Dept of Conservation (DoC) ranger who died in a helicopter crash when he and pilot John 'Prickles' de Ridder were attempting to rescue residents of Karikari Peninsula during a devastating fire in Dec 2011. Cites comments from friend and fellow DoC ranger Trevor Bullock and brother Alan Macrae about his qualities and abilities."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Doctor gave many their start in life"
description: "Pays tribute to the late professor of obstetrics and gynaecology at Otago Medical School. Overviews his career and service during World War II, and cites comments from colleagues about his contribution to clinical practice and the community."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Independent thinking; Not the first ..."
description: "Talks to the Auckland-born new list MP for New Zealand First. Discusses the irony of representing a party whose philosophies run counter to the separatist policies championed by the South Island party he formerly convened. Mentions that one of the co-founders of the 'Otago Daily Times' lost his job for advocating South Island independence in the 19th century."

Author: "Hattaway, Peter"
Title: "Positive changes to credit code"
description: "Explains changes being made to the Credit Reporting Privacy Code 2004. Backgrounds changes behind the reporting of positive (comprehensive) consumer data, including information on 24 month payment history. Presents a case study from the privacy commissioner. Lists constraints to the three main constraints on access to credit data. Notes two issues that still require resolution before the amendments come into force 1 Apr 2012."

Author: "Dwyer, Denis"
Title: "The green pioneers"
description: "Illuminates the inventions of five South Island men who pioneered 'green' energy production in the early 20th century."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Unlikely new label sure to raise baa"
description: "Details the purchase and operation of a 40 hectare vineyard at Maraekakaho by Taizo Osawa, describing the reasons for a label name change from 'Flying mouton'. Notes the difficulty of marketing Ozawa Wines in Japan."

Author: "Sydney, Grahame,"
Title: "A claim on history"
description: "Reveals the story of the little-known man who discovered gold in the Manuherikia Valley in 1861 as part of a small party assembled by local entrepreneur and businessman John 'Johnny' Jones. Quotes from a letter he wrote to his boss, Mr John Jones Esq that was published in the 14 Dec 1861 edition of the 'Otago Witness' outlining the find. Explains that the signature on the letter was shown as 'A. G. Reyman', but might be A. G. Peyman, and that this group of prospectors were actually the first reported discoverers of payable gold in Central Otago, nine months before the arrival of Hartley and Reilly. Details the letter written from Gabriel Read to Provincial Superintendent Major Richardson on 23 May 1861, detailing the discovery of gold in Gabriel's Gully, and the find by the Jones-Peyman party."

Author: "Robinson, Andrew"
Title: "All aboard for excellent Otago railway books"
description: "Book reviews of 'Taieri Gorge Railway : a photo guide' by Antony Hamel, and 'The Taieri Gorge Railway : guide to the Taieri Gorge & Seasider rail trips' by Gerald Cunningham."

Title: "Finding the right address"
description: "Sets out the AS NZS 4819-2011 standard that clarifies the way street names and numbering are used. Gives definitions for six road types."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Back-breaking but also rewarding"
description: "Interviews the shearer, who is also a member of the NZ shearing team, about his work."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Delivering on irrigation promises"
description: "Describes a decision by an independent commissioner panel that denied water consents to three farming groups wanting to establish cubicle dairy farming in the Upper Waitaki catchment."

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Perils of personal guarantees"
description: "Recaps the decision in Herron v Westpac New Zealand Ltd [2011] NZCA 544, discussing the responsibilities of wives and husbands who personally guarantee their spouse's business."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "Inside the stadium"
description: "Showcases the newly opened stadium that replaced Carisbrook stadium. Includes a timeline from 2004 until the stadium opened on Aug 2011. Describes attempts to stop the new stadium from being built and the polarised opinion of the public towards its construction. Seeks comment from University of Otago Assoc Prof Charles Pigden about some of the conspiracy theories that have arisen about the stadium. Highlights the new four-level building within the stadium that will be used by students and high-performance athletes. Talks to the Dunedin businessman and former city councillor about his vision for the project and refutes some of the stories that he personally profited from the purchase of land for the stadium. Speaks to the Welshman who was hired to manage the facility.  Talks to the former president of the 'Stop the Stadium' group about her continued opposition to the decisions to build it. Tours the building and reports on  some of its lesser-known features."

Title: "Cybercrime a rising threat to business"
description: "Discusses the results of a 2011 PwC Global Economic Crime Survey that shows the level of fraud in NZ, the significance of cybercrime, and levels of corruption and bribery. Shows the NZ sectors with the most fraud and the top four types on economic crime reported."

Title: "What's a reasonable fee for KiwiSaver, asks FMA"
description: "Advises and comments on draft guidelines issued by the Financial Markets Authority to assist KiwiSaver managers and trustees on what constitutes minimum standards for fees that will enable investors to compare schemes. Outlines the elements that performance fees are expected to contain."

Author: "Kavanagh, Jeff"
Title: "Trailing around in Central"
description: "Reports on his experience of cycling along some tracks in Central Otago that are not part of the Central Otago Rail Trail."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Campaign trail test for Tom Tom"
description: "Reports on his experience of using the TomTom Go Live 2050 navigation system in Te Awamutu, Wellington and Auckland."

Author: "Meikle, Hayden"
Title: "All I want for Christmas is ..."
description: "Briefly reviews five video games : 'Need for speed : The Run', 'The Sims 3 : Pets', 'Rayman Origins', 'Saints Row : The Third', and 'Halo : Combat Evolved Anniversary'."

Author: "McLay, Susan"
Title: "Not exactly a land of milk and honey; Arrival in New Zealand a dramatic experience"
description: "Presents two essays by pupils at The Catlins Area School, based on the arrival of their ancestors to Otago aboard the immigrant ships the 'Arima' and the 'Surat', respectively. Includes two paintings from year 11 student Emily Brain."

Author: "Ongley, Albertine"
Title: "Sad that clothes are no longer made to last; Stitches sewn through time"
description: "Showcases contributions from Columba College students, focusing on 150 years of fashion. Presents an editorial about changes to fashion standards, and calls for a return to tradition in NZers' formal attire. Overviews fashion in the Otago region in the past 150 years. Includes a timeline from 1885 to the present."

Author: "Sprosen, Bailey"
Title: "Gift of old homestead keeps on giving; Having no technology a significant part of trip; Tititea memory poem; Aspiring memory poem"
description: "Showcases contributions from Dunstan High School students, focusing on Tititea Lodge, Mt Aspiring. Traces the history of the lodge and describes the 40-year relationship between the high school and the Aspinall family of Mt Aspiring Station, Wanaka. Includes essays from year 10 pupils about the significance of Tititea Lodge to the school. Presents excerpts from 'The Gift', a book compiled for the 40th anniversary of the gift by the Aspinall family to the school. Includes two poems, including 'Titirea memory poem' by year 10 student Thomas Gibbons."

Title: "Kidicorp now biggest childcare operator"
description: "Sets out a recent deal in which leases by Australian childcare corporation Australian Education Trust were assigned as part of a deal involving the acquisition of business assets of up to 123 ABC Learning centres by Kidicorp. Backgrounds the sale of the NZ ABC subsidiary to Kidicorp, noting the extent of that company's childcare operations in NZ."

Title: "Otago is No 1"
description: "Showcases contributions from Kaikorai Valley College pupils focusing on various record-breaking people, places and events in Otago history."

Author: "Edmunds-Scott, Ethan"
Author (detailed): "Ethan Edmunds-Scott, Fergus Cook and Cat Marnane"
Title: "First mayor a colourful character; Origin of Cromwell; Women's natures origin of place names"
description: "Presents two essays and a personal reflection by pupils at Cromwell College, focusing on the origin and place names of the town and describing the influence of its first mayor."

Author: "Doyle, Imogen"
Title: "Kavanagh result of mergers; Bishops' legacy; All affected by Spanish flu"
description: "Presents writings by pupils at Dunedin's only Catholic secondary school.  Focuses on the history of Catholic education in Otago, tracing the contribution of various bishops. Chronicles mergers to the secondary school, and briefly describes the Catholic primary schools in the region. Traces the impact of Spanish flu on workplaces and schools in the region during 1918."

Author: "Mieklejohn, Will"
Author (detailed): "Will Mieklejohn, Cameron Reddington and Nathaniel Parsons"
Title: "'The Flat' led Dunedin's early days; South Dunedin : a salubrious meadow; Tussle against the sea long-running"
description: "Showcases contributions from King's High School students, focusing on town planning in southern Dunedin. Chronicles the development of 'The Flat' in the suburb of Caversham, founded by the wealthy pioneer settler. Describes the reclamation of South Dunedin for settlement. Traces changes to the sea wall at St Clair beach."

Author: "Duncan, Hope"
Title: "Dances and live gigs; Dunedin's sound; A round of applause for the Regent"
description: "Showcases contributions from two Logan Park High School students, focusing on the history of entertainment and music in Dunedin. Speaks with three residents of the Frances Hodgkins rest home about their memories of dances, music and other entertainment, and overviews changes to musical styles in the past 150 years. Touches on the 'Dunedin sound' era. Traces the history of the venerable Dunedin theatre."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Out of left field"
description: "Chronicles Labour leader David Shearer's life to date. Talks to a number of people who have known him over the years. Mentions his different roles as a foreign aid worker and how he met his wife."

Author: "Migone, Paloma"
Title: "How safe are our streets?"
description: "Retraces the recent fatal violent street attack on journalist Phillip Cottrell in the early hours on a Saturday morning in Wellington. Looks at the city's crime rates and discusses how safe Wellington is in comparison to other places."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "School's out for Prue, 17 years on"
description: "Visits Prue Kelly, Principal at Wellington High School who talks about the school, her thoughts on education and schools, and her plans to retire."

Author: "Bowen, Matt"
Title: "Find inspires study of NZ orchid"
description: "Find inspires study of NZ orchid"

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Deep water"
description: "Explores why seven out of ten Kiwi kids can't swim. Covers drowning statistics, school pool closures, lack of public pools, the high cost of private swimming lessons, and teachers avoiding the risks of taking children to the beach."

Author: "Carson, Jonathan"
Title: "Riff Raff creator about to become a real Kiwi"
description: "Riff Raff creator about to become a real Kiwi"

Title: "Motive a mystery for victim's father"
description: "Motive a mystery for victim's father"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Water speedster can't wait for classic battle"
description: "Water speedster can't wait for classic battle"

Author: "Pegden, Evan"
Title: "Bradley blasts out of deepest bunker"
description: "Bradley blasts out of deepest bunker"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Former Whitikahu School pupil shares her memoriesc/ by Karla Akuhata"
description: "Former Whitikahu School pupil shares her memoriesc/ by Karla Akuhata"

Author: "Burke, Roy"
Title: "Tireless basketball servant; devoted father"
description: "Tireless basketball servant; devoted father"

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Flesh-eating disease on the rise"
description: "Relates the case of a 23 year old man who died of necrotising fasciitis, Royden Regler, noting the details of Regler's medical treatment by GP, ambulance staff, and doctors at hospital. Gives the findings of an investigation into Regler's medical care and reports on the symptoms and increasing occurrence of the disease. Talks to Regler's parents about the effect of their son's death on them and their efforts to raise awareness about necrotising fasciitis."

Author: "Goile, Aaron"
Title: "Elite junior takes world spotlight in her stride"
description: "Elite junior takes world spotlight in her stride"

Author: "Geenty, Mark"
Title: "Former paceman finds broadcasting spin-off across Tasman"
description: "Former paceman finds broadcasting spin-off across Tasman"

Title: "High school for girls led the way"
description: "Chronicles the history of the oldest state school, including a timeline of significant changes in its 140-year history. Profiles four influential former pupils."

Author: "Aden, Mona"
Title: "Parihaka the birthplace of passive resistance of colonisation; Symbols of resistance; Pacifist prophets great leaders; Resistance reported; Maori prisoners won respect in Dunedin"
description: "Features contributions from Queen's High School students, focusing on aspects of the Parihaka passive resistance movement in Taranaki following the unjust confiscation of MaÃÑori land by the government in the 18th and 19th centuries. Describes the pacifist actions taken by Parihaka pa leaders Te Whiti o Rongomai and Tohu Kakahi to fight for MaÃÑori unity and independence. Explains the significance of the white feathers worn by Parihaka residents. Traces the history of the town, the differing interpretations of who owned the land, MaÃÑori resistance to land confiscation and the armed invasion of the township by government forces on 5 Nov 1881. Looks at the coverage of the invasion by the 'Otago Daily Times'. Describes the treatment of Parihaka residents who were imprisoned in the Dunedin jail, and the respect they gained from Dunedin citizens."

Author: "Curran, Katya"
Title: "From ballot box to main stage"
description: "The St Hilda's Collegiate year 13 pupil traces the history of women's suffrage in NZ, including the role played by women in local and national government."

Author: "Kakkaart, Nerilee"
Title: "District changes but people still friendly"
description: "Presents a history of the district, as chronicled by the two pupils at South Otago High School. Chronicles changes in population and industry."

Author: "Russell, Nicola"
Title: "Social media outbursts grab public attention"
description: "Reviews the year's social faux pas made by various people on Twitter and Facebook. Talks to Hayden Raw, digital director of a social media advisory team, about what people need to be aware of when using such media."

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "With a rattle, the long wait is over"
description: "Relives the drama of NZ's win over Australia in the second test at Hobart, the first test victory against them for 18 years."

Author: "Stanley, Ben"
Title: "With a rattle, the long wait is over"
description: "Relives the drama of NZ's cricket win over Australia in the second test at Hobart, the first test victory against them for 18 years."

Title: "Victorian past the way ahead"
description: "Presents a contribution from the history department at St Kevin's College, focusing on how modern Oamaru is 'looking to the past to preserve its future'. Overviews the development of the town during the 19th century, and work being undertaken to preserve historic buildings. Describes activities aimed at keeping the Victorian past alive, including the development of 'Steampunk' culture."

Author: "Marlow, Tayla"
Title: "From Clydesdales to tractors; The timeline of farming machinery; Changing chores; Women have always had a vital role on farms"
description: "Presents contributions from St Peter's College pupils, focusing on the development of farming in Southland and Otago. Includes a timeline of the development of farming machinery, changes to the lives of children on farms, and the contribution of women to the success of farms."

Author: "Long, David"
Title: "Sparc won't play ball over top-end funding; Kiwi Olympic hope fights for London berth"
description: "Reports on how NZ Tennis is struggling with its aim to develop its juniors into top-class players due to a lack of funding. Looks at the programmes that are being run now and where money needs to be invested - at the high-performance level. Talks to Marina Erakovic about her desire to go to the London Olympics and the odds of it happening due to the NZ Olympic Committee's criteria."

Author: "Hinton, Marc"
Title: "Sidekick slips in as supremo"
description: "Reports on the first day on the job for the new All Blacks coach. Evaluates his ability to handle the pressures involved in the head role after serving as an assistant coach."

Author: "Haslemore, Keegan"
Title: "Upham won an early VC; The bravest of the brave; From humble beginnings to a great wartime heroine"
description: "Presents three reports from Taieri College students. Traces the life of the World War 2 soldier and the woman who became a key figure in the resistance movement.  Describes the role of the Anzacs in World War 1 and the abysmal battleground conditions they endured."

Author: "McDonnell, Nadia"
Title: "'Amazing' return after surviving grenade blast"
description: "Presents a report from the Year 12 pupil at Tokomairiro High School. Profiles the World War 2 soldier and his service in the desert in Cairo, Egypt. Describes the injury he sustained in battle and reflects on other wartime experiences."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Camp mother"
description: "Talks to Barbara Stuart about the Cable Bay Holiday Park she runs with her husband Ian."

Author: "Ellisse, Rosalie"
Title: "A miner's guide; Gold-mining in Otago; Royal Hotel owner : Andrew Morrison; An interview with Chinese miner Oon Ho"
description: "Features the history of gold mining in Otago, as researched and written by the Waitaki Girls' High School Year 12 pupil. Explains the system of 'Miner's Right' and other aspects of mining from the point of view of a cook aboard the ship 'Maori'.  Presents an imagined reflection of a miner born in India. 'Interviews' the owner of the Royal Hotel and a miner born in China."

Author: "Fenwick, Mary"
Title: "Kiwi women succeed in the UK"
description: "Talks to NZ businesswomen in the UK about their experiences in business, noting that being foreign appears to counteract the disadvantages of being a woman in business. Highlights the NZ Business Women's Network (NZBWN), founded by London-based Kiwi Bronwen Horton. Relates how the NZBWN was founded and the value of having a broad range of businesswomen and professionals included in the group. Looks at UK Government efforts to push for more diversity in British businesses, noting that Kiwi women could be well placed to benefit from this."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Home : Mary 'Bubs' Johnson"
description: "Talks briefly to Mary Johnson about living in the Selwyn Village retirement home. Includes biographical information."

Author: "Laugesen, Murray"
Title: "Smokers need more help to quit"
description: "Suggests that products such as cheaper low nicotine cigarettes, electronic cigarettes, and cigarettes with nicotine content printed on the packet would help smokers stop smoking and reduce the amount of harm to smokers' health. Points out the strength of a tobacco addiction and that low nicotine and electronic cigarettes have been shown in studies that they can help smokers quit. Advises that exempting low nicotine cigarettes from tax rises and legalising electronic cigarettes would provide another aid for smokers to quit."

Author: "Laurenson, Caitlin"
Author (detailed): "Caitlin Laurenson, Hannah Le Sueur and Natalya van den Boom"
Title: "Faith and passion see her through; You're already perfect; It's time to banish cruelty as entertainment"
description: "Presents three perspectives on the topic of tolerance and intolerance, written by students at Wakatipu High School. Talks to the founder of Orphans Aid International Charitable Trust.  Decries the role of the media in presenting unrealistic portrayals of the 'perfect' body, focusing on its effects on teenagers. Observes that the media and society profit from making fun of people (Schadenfreude), and challenges people to think before mocking others."

Author: "McCarthy, Noelle"
Title: "Lost in transit"
description: "Presents six stories about what happens when love and travel collide. Includes stories from Noelle McCarthy, Anna Hart, James Walker, Duncan Greive, Sonja Matla and Kim Knight about holiday romances that they themselves or people they know have experienced."

Author: "Byrt, Anthony"
Title: "Photographic books : December 2011"
description: "Photographic books : December 2011"

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Twelve minutes of love : a tango love story"
description: "Twelve minutes of love : a tango love story"

Author: "Smylie, Calida"
Title: "Dog power"
description: "Talks to Jolyon and Toni Harris, about NZ's vibrant dog-sledding scene, and Bob Storey about sled dog racing overseas."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Observing the transit of Venus"
description: "Highlights the transit of Venus across the sun which will occur in June 2012 and be viewable in NZ, noting that this is the last transit of Venus until 2117. Recounts the history of observations of the transit of Venus, related from a book by Australian astronomer Nick Lomb, 'Transit of Venus', including James Cook's observations in Tahiti. Points out the historical significance of observing the transit of Venus for calculating the distance of the Earth from the sun. Advises on when the transit will be observable and how to view the transit safely, noting some of the events occurring to celebrate the transit."

Author: "Broatch, Mark"
Title: "Second helpings"
description: "Spends a day on the set of the sequel to 'Sione's Wedding'. Talks to the actors and director about working on the movie."

Author: "Smith, Bevan"
Title: "Tastes of summer"
description: "Offers recipes for Christmas treats : roast almond nougat, Christmas cookies, mini Christmas puddings and strawberry and yoghurt popsicles."

Author: "Diamond, Paul"
Title: "My language, my inspiration review"
description: "My language, my inspiration review"

Author: "Palmer, Geoff"
Title: "Speaking in tongues"
description: "Explains text-speak and other online language. Includes emoticons, leet speak, contractions and acronyms."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "Season's eatings; How to burn a christmas cake"
description: "Looks at the history of the Christmas cake. Retells the author's experience attempting a home baker's festive recipe."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "The dirt-track genius"
description: "Profiles the man behind the creation of the world's most high tech inventions through his company Buckley Systems Ltd, which produces machines that are used to prepare 90 percent of the world's silicon chips."

Author: "Entwisle, Peter"
Title: "Mystery and masque; An exhibition deserving more than a glance"
description: "Reviews the exhibition 'Ladies and gentlemen : at a glance', Dunedin Public Art Gallery (DPAG), 17 Dec 2011 to 2 Jan 2012. Focuses on the 17th century portrait 'Lady Boudergem', depicting Amalia von Solms-Braunfels, painted by an unknown artist who was in the circle of Dutch artist Paulus Moreelse. Includes information about some other portraits in the exhibition, and comments on the strengths of the DPAG collection."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'The Phaedra chain', works by Jason Greig, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Sand and surf - a journey to the South Coast', works by Darren Tautari, Green Island Gallery, Green Island.  Reviews 'Dunedin by numbers pt. 1/Building something real', photographs by Richard Munro/Murray Eskdale, Mint Gallery, Dunedin, until 31 Dec 2011."

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "That was the year that was"
description: "Talks with John Campbell about the news stories which defined 2011."

Author: "Stock, Rob"
Title: "Insurance landscape rocked"
description: "Writes how household cover in NZ has changed forever after the sequence of earthquakes in Christchurch in the past 15 months."

Author: "Ninness, Greg"
Title: "Experts share leaky home knowledge"
description: "Writes about a NZ manual that will assist those affected by the leaky homes saga."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "'We want our leaders to be extraordinary and ordinary and like John Key [Shearer] is that'"
description: "Talks to the Mt Albert MP and new leader of the Labour Party. Discusses his childhood in Papatoetoe, and outlines his overseas career working for various international agencies in Somalia, Iraq and the Middle East.  Talks about his bent towards casual dress and short meetings, and describes his family and finances. Supplies a timeline of the highlights of his life and career."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "From Gorge River to civilisation"
description: "Talks to the ski patroller about his job crewing a Russian icebreaker making tourist trips to Antarctica. Explains how his childhood at the remote Gorge River, South Westland, has helped in his career. Touches on how he deals with crowds and civilisation. Explains how he will help his sister Robin Long, who is following in his footsteps by leaving home to spend Year 13 at Mt Aspiring College. Notes the book his father wrote about the family's unconventional life at Gorge River."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Powering up"
description: "Discusses Christchurch in terms of its most influential people, suggesting that power struggles have been affected by the 2010 and 2011 earthquakes. Briefly profiles the following twelve people, describing their roles in the rebuilding of Christchurch following the earthquakes: Gerry Brownlee, Roger Sutton, Tony Marryatt, Bob Parker, Mark Solomon, Andrew Holden, Dame Margaret Bazley, Don Elder, Peter Townsend, David Meates, Bruce Irvine, and Rod Carr."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Dean silent on split as he looks ahead"
description: "Talks to the soon-to-be former Dean of Christ Church Cathedral about the effect of the Feb 2011 earthquake on the cathedral and his relationship with the Bishop (Victoria Matthews). Discusses his Yorkshire background, his career as an Anglican priest and his views on 'churchiness'. Follows his work in various NZ locations, and briefly covers his decision to stand for the city council's Burwood-Pegasus seat."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "A bolt into the blue"
description: "Looks at the achievements of the first person to become airborne (in a glider) in Christchurch, on 23 December 1912. Details the construction of the glider and subsequent aircraft he built. Follows his career and contribution to NZ aviation, including raising the profile of early aviator and Timaru (Waitohi) farmer Richard Pearse. Mentions the acceptance by Sir Richard Bolt in Nov 2011 of a specially struck Walsh Centennial Medal celebrating his father's achievements."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Little railway runs out of steam"
description: "Visits the West Melton property to view The Big Little Railway, a 240mm railway track that is the only one in the South Island. Talks to its builder about his lifelong hobby and his reluctance at now having to look for a buyer for the miniature railway."

Author: "Harris, Catherine"
Title: "Merry click-mas"
description: "Looks at the growing trend in NZ of online shopping, or cyber shopping, at Christmas, comparing it with overseas trends and noting the impact on retailers.  Talks to online retailing site managers about their turnover in December.  Lists the ten most searched items on Trade Me in the first week of December.  Advises on the dos and don'ts of shopping online for Christmas gifts."

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Deep water"
description: "Explores why seven out of ten Kiwi kids are unable to swim. Covers drowning statistics, school pool closures, lack of public pools, the high cost of private swimming lessons, and teachers avoiding the risks of taking children to the beach."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Space innovators"
description: "Focuses on house size, citing the comments of Melbourne architect Stuart Harrison from his book on maximising living space in NZ and Australia, 'Forty-six square metres of land doesn't normally become a house'.  Informs of the area of the average new house in NZ. Describes an award winning house built on 46sqm of land in Sydney, a 115sqm South Auckland house designed by owner/architect Michael O'Sullivan, and the former home of architect Chris Kelly in Wellington."

Author: "Barnett, Sarah"
Title: "Coming ready or not"
description: "Reports on the rising number of premature births and the pressure on neonatal units. Questions how much effort should be made to save very premature babies, when many suffer ongoing health problems. Relates the author's experience of the premature birth of her daughter, Maggie. Speaks to Dr Malcolm Battin, the clinical director of the Auckland New Born Intensive Care Unit (Nicu), about the reasons for premature births and the design of modern neonatal units, which try to create a comfortable family environment. Talks about the support for families of preemies. Speaks to Michael Meads, head of the Neonatal Trust, about the support the charity provides to families of Nicu patients and graduates."

Author: "Wratten, Stephen D."
Title: "Hands off the trigger"
description: "Balances the overuse of pesticides in home gardens with suggestions about how 'good' insects can eradicate pests. Describes the helpful predator-prey relationship of wasps and aphids, explaining why planting flowers near vegetables is good gardening."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "A shot in the arm"
description: "Reports on a new blood transfusion technique for extreme trauma cases. Speaks to Auckland City Hospital anaesthetist Dr Kerry Gunn about the technique that was first used in the United States defence forces' surgical wards in Iraq. Explains how the massive transfusion technique works. Touches on the stories of two patients, Philippa Dyer and Cynthia Sandford, who have benefited from the technique."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "New blood transfusion technique saves lives"
description: "Reports on a new blood transfusion technique for extreme trauma cases. Speaks to Auckland City Hospital anaesthetist Dr Kerry Gunn about the technique that was first used in the United States defence forces' surgical wards in Iraq. Explains how the massive transfusion technique works. Touches on the stories of two patients, Philippa Dyer and Cynthia Sandford, who have benefited from the technique."

Author: "Reid, Nicholas,"
Title: "Church historicals : December 2011"
description: "Church historicals : December 2011"

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Blistering barnacles of despair"
description: "Blistering barnacles of despair"

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Melancholia and The adventures of Tintin review"
description: "Melancholia and The adventures of Tintin review"

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "A taonga changes hands"
description: "Speaks to New Zealand Symphony Orchestra (NZSO) chief executive Peter Walls about why he is stepping down from the role after nine years, the frequent criticism of the NZSO's repertoire, promotion and cost, and his successor as chief executive, Chris Blake. Talks about Blake's career."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Peace on Earth"
description: "Asks four earth scientists for their picks of seismically calm summer holiday destinations in NZ."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "A holiday in seismically calm Oamaru"
description: "Asks four earth scientists for their picks of seismically calm summer holiday destinations in NZ."

Author: "Gillies, Abby"
Title: "Attacked girl's mum faces court"
description: "Attacked girl's mum faces court"

Author: "Macbrayne, Rosaleen"
Title: "Accused tells of 'adored' wife's trauma"
description: "Accused tells of 'adored' wife's trauma"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Businessman accepts blame for deadly crash"
description: "Businessman accepts blame for deadly crash"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Whanau thanks readers for helping bring body home"
description: "Whanau thanks readers for helping bring body home"

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Solemn farewell for slain security guard"
description: "Solemn farewell for slain security guard"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Tauranga leaky home: Fix in two weeks or go"
description: "Tauranga leaky home: Fix in two weeks or go"

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Accident and fall theories in teen's death"
description: "Accident and fall theories in teen's death"

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Title: "Fatal slip puzzles woman's family"
description: "Fatal slip puzzles woman's family"

Author: "Tan, Lincoln"
Title: "Husband can stay but wife must go"
description: "Husband can stay but wife must go"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "Daughter upset at 'sloppy' care"
description: "Daughter upset at 'sloppy' care"

Author: "Maddaford, Terry"
Title: "The Shaw thing: Brad carries his family's legacy"
description: "The Shaw thing: Brad carries his family's legacy"

Title: "Friends devastated by loss of freediver"
description: "Friends devastated by loss of freediver"

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Student rallied thousands for quake clean-up army"
description: "Student rallied thousands for quake clean-up army"

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "They fled to Otago after Japan disaster"
description: "They fled to Otago after Japan disaster"

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Residents shocked by rates decision"
description: "Relays the reaction of Tokoiti residents to the Clutha District Council's decision on the cost of new sewerage systems in Benhar and Tokoiti. Cites Council chief executive Charles Hakkaart on the costs of and tenders for the systems, and available payment postponements."

Title: "Man bailed to camping ground tent site"
description: "Man bailed to camping ground tent site"

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Historic 'magazine' restored"
description: "Records the restoration of the stone building known as 'the magazine' by the Wanaka and Districts Lions Clubs. Backgrounds its role in the building of the Haast Pass road some 50 years ago. Details the restoration process."

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Otago team wins top science prize"
description: "Announces the award of a Prime Minister's science prize to the Centre for Chemical and Physical Oceanography based at the Univeristy of Otago. Names the recipients and details the Centre's research into evaluating ways to reduce greenhouse gases. Lists other Prime Minister's science prize winners."

Title: "Retiring nurse sees changes in caring"
description: "Retiring nurse sees changes in caring"

Author: "Jaquiery, Stephen"
Title: "Forward-thinking vet's career spanned 54 years"
description: "Forward-thinking vet's career spanned 54 years"

Title: "Sister showed love through teaching"
description: "Sister showed love through teaching"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Enticing a dollar"
description: "Examines shopping habits and consumerism at the department store, the shopping mall and the supermarket, drawing on observations outlined in the book by Auckland sociologist Nick Perry."

Author: "McKay, Ian"
Title: "Inadvertent victims"
description: "Recounts the history of the 1941 torpedoing of the Italian operated, Dutch built 'Jason' in an Italian port. Details the incident, noting that some 500 of the 2000-odd Commonwealth prisoners on board were New Zealanders. Mentions the fate of other NZ prisoners of war who were transported on prison ships."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "How Labour voters got the blues"
description: "Examines the voting result in Dunedin South and suggests reasons for the seat's swing from Labour to National, drawing on comments from University of Otago political scientist Dr Bryce Edwards and former Dunedin political commentator Chris Trotter. Summarises the results  of 18 Dunedin South polling places with comparisons to results in the 2008 election.  Lists the official vote count for parties and candidates."

Author: "Vine, Gillian"
Title: "From Hartwell to here"
description: "Visits Hartwell House, Buckinghamshire, to retrace the steps of the writer and editor of 'Star Garden Book' who trained in horticulture at Hartwell before emigrating to NZ in 1872. Details the house's history, and chats to the head gardener Richard Jones."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Folk music rises up for all"
description: "Talks to the Canadian born, Dunedin based author and photographer about the book she wrote on folk music and folk musicians in the South Island. Chats about her interviewing techniques, how she chose her subjects, folk music in NZ, and the Whare Flat Folk Festival that has been held annually since 1975. Gives details for the festival."

Author: "Marquet, Sarah"
Title: "Pipeline proposal chosen by board"
description: "Outlines the Roxburgh Community Board decision on the town's water supply upgrade, describing submissions made to the Board and the estimated cost of the chosen option and its effects on future water rates."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Born with grease under fingernails"
description: "Profiles the Winton farmer who collects vintage tractors. Describes his extensive collection, his shortage of storage space and his family's reaction to his hobby."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Rover's return"
description: "Explores the popularity of dogs as pets. Looks at numbers and costs of dogs in NZ. Overviews books about dogs, theories about their domestication and origin, and debates about breeding and the canine talent for (human) manipulation. Covers the plusses and minuses of being a dog, looking at their exercise, food and welfare needs. Touches on the success Christchurch dog food company K9 Natural. Describes the author's experience of training a misbehaving collie. Looks at police dog training and recommends training trips."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Dogs in New Zealand"
description: "Explores the popularity of dogs as pets. Looks at numbers and costs of dogs in NZ. Overviews books about dogs, theories about their domestication and origin, and debates about breeding and the canine talent for (human) manipulation. Covers the plusses and minuses of being a dog, looking at their exercise, food and welfare needs. Touches on the success Christchurch dog food company K9 Natural. Describes the author's experience of training a misbehaving collie. Looks at police dog training and recommends training trips."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Island time"
description: "Explains why Samoa put its clocks forward on 29 Dec 2011 to place it west of the international dateline, reversing the decision of 1892. Outlines the views of US science writer James Gleick on the fact that time is a mental concept. Touches on the history of 'standard' or 'railroad' time. Notes the decision on time made by neighbouring American Samoa."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Samoa's clock change"
description: "Explains why Samoa put its clocks forward on 29 Dec 2011 to place it west of the international dateline, reversing the decision of 1892. Outlines the views of US science writer James Gleick on the fact that time is a mental concept. Touches on the history of 'standard' or 'railroad' time. Notes the decision on time made by neighbouring American Samoa."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "There's the rub"
description: "Presents new ideas about hand drying and hand washing, citing research by University of Auckland researcher Dr Tom Miller on the benefits of simply rubbing one's hands together. Advises on the efficacy of soap and related antibacterial soap products."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Please rub your hands"
description: "Presents new ideas about hand drying and hand washing, citing research by University of Auckland researcher Dr Tom Miller on the benefits of simply rubbing one's hands together. Advises on the efficacy of soap and related antibacterial soap products."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Now hear this"
description: "Reports on the prevalence of hearing loss. Touches on possible links with cardiovascular disease. Advises on improving vascular health by including fish in one's diet."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "How fish could save your hearing"
description: "Reports on the prevalence of hearing loss. Touches on possible links with cardiovascular disease. Advises on improving vascular health by including fish in one's diet."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Who were our local heroes?"
description: "Spotlights the local heroes that have helped and made a difference to earthquake ravaged Christchurch during the past year."

Author: "Souter, Fenella"
Title: "Divine intervention?"
description: "Discusses the accuracy (or otherwise) of the 25th December as the birth date of Jesus Christ. Questions also whether Bethlehem is the correct place of birth. Compares the two nativity stories in New Testament gospels Matthew and Luke. Looks at Christmas traditions throughout the centuries, including the history of Christmas in NZ and the use of 'Xmas'."

Title: "A word in your ear"
description: "Asks the following NZers what they were doing at age 20 and what advice they would give that younger self: food writer Annabel Langbein, Labour MP David Cunliffe (48), satirist John Clarke (63), broadcaster Mike Hosking, broadcaster Paul Holmes (61), Christchurch mayor Bob Parker (58), chef and food writer Alison Holst (73), musician Dave Dobbyn (54), photographer Marti Friedlander (83), playwright Roger Hall (72), MP and former broadcaster Maggie Barry (52), artist Dick Frizzell (68), scientist Sir Ray Avery (64), film-maker Vincent Ward (55), former All Black captain Sean Fitzpatrick (48), and novelist Lloyd Jones (56)."

Title: "NZ figures give advice"
description: "Asks the following NZers what they were doing at age 20 and what advice they would give that younger self: food writer Annabel Langbein, Labour MP David Cunliffe (48), satirist John Clarke (63), broadcaster Mike Hosking, broadcaster Paul Holmes (61), Christchurch mayor Bob Parker (58), chef and food writer Alison Holst (73), musician Dave Dobbyn (54), photographer Marti Friedlander (83), playwright Roger Hall (72), MP and former broadcaster Maggie Barry (52), artist Dick Frizzell (68), scientist Sir Ray Avery (64), film-maker Vincent Ward (55), former All Black captain Sean Fitzpatrick (48), and novelist Lloyd Jones (56)."

Author: "Bensen, Nigel"
Title: "The South firmly in focus"
description: "Conveys the attractions of NZ and the South Island in particular as becoming increasingly popular as a filming location for the motion picture industry. Spotlights a number of international films that have been made here. Talks to Film Otago Southland executive manager Kevin Jennings, who stresses the assets of the areas south of Waitaki."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "The e-book case"
description: "Highlights the use of electronic book readers in NZ, noting publishers and types of publications that now cater to the demand for e-books. Contrasts print and e-book publishing in terms of digital additions, costs, royalties, and print runs. Outlines the role of Digital Publishing New Zealand in promoting NZ e-books. Notes the effect of online books on bookshops, public libraries, readers with print disabilities, and piracy. Relays a variety of predictions about whether the physical book will survive its electronic counterpart."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "E-books changes reading"
description: "Highlights the use of electronic book readers in NZ, noting publishers and types of publications that now cater to the demand for e-books. Contrasts print and e-book publishing in terms of digital additions, costs, royalties, and print runs. Outlines the role of Digital Publishing New Zealand in promoting NZ e-books. Notes the effect of online books on bookshops, public libraries, readers with print disabilities, and piracy. Relays a variety of predictions about whether the physical book will survive its electronic counterpart."

Author: "Hathaway, Jude"
Title: "Wedding gown spectacular"
description: "Reports on the "Unveiled : 200 years of wedding fashion" exhibition currently showing at Te Papa in Wellington until April 22, 2012. Describes some of the diverse wedding gowns on show and their history."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Weighty problem"
description: "Overviews ways of reducing body weight. Discusses and explains three diets that either focus on deprivation or protein, or on protein plus foods low on the glycaemic index. Recommends the best method to prevent weight gain and regain. Examines the protein-leverage hypothesis of Massey University nutritional ecology professor David Raubenheimer, noting its explanation of obesity. Describes the pan-European Diet, Obesity and Genes study (Diogenes), and sets out Ministry of Health dietary recommendations. Expands on the role of eating behaviours in weight loss. Provides a list of foods that are protein rich."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Losing weight in 2012"
description: "Overviews ways of reducing body weight. Discusses and explains three diets that either focus on deprivation or protein, or on protein plus foods low on the glycaemic index. Recommends the best method to prevent weight gain and regain. Examines the protein-leverage hypothesis of Massey University nutritional ecology professor David Raubenheimer, noting its explanation of obesity. Describes the pan-European Diet, Obesity and Genes study (Diogenes), and sets out Ministry of Health dietary recommendations. Expands on the role of eating behaviours in weight loss. Provides a list of foods that are protein rich."

Author: "White, David"
Title: "Shear power"
description: "Presents a photo essay of a shearing gang at work in a southern Waikato woolshed."

Author: "Cohen, David"
Title: "It's all about The Correspondent"
description: "It's all about The Correspondent"

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "Children and young adult books : January 2012"
description: "Children and young adult books : January 2012"

Author: "Byrt, Anthony"
Title: "Caught between worlds"
description: "Reviews 'Breath: the fleeting intensity of life', a programme of video, photography and art by film-maker and artist Vincent Ward, Govett-Brewster Art Gallery, New Plymouth, until 26 Feb 2012."

Author: "Byrt, Anthony"
Title: "Vincent Ward review"
description: "Reviews 'Breath: the fleeting intensity of life', a programme of video, photography and art by film-maker and artist Vincent Ward, Govett-Brewster Art Gallery, New Plymouth, until 26 Feb 2012."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Black magic"
description: "Reviews the two latest releases from Whirimako Black, one a jazz album and the other (Te More) a collaboration with MaÃÑori instrument expert Richard Nunn."

Author: "Bollinger, Nick,"
Title: "Whirimako Black review"
description: "Reviews the two latest releases from Whirimako Black, one a jazz album and the other (Te More) a collaboration with MaÃÑori instrument expert Richard Nunn."

Author: "Oxenbridge, Faith"
Title: "Hall's well ..."
description: "Reviews the latest Roger Hall play, directed by Ross Gumbley and showing at the Court Theatre, Christchurch, until 28 Jan 2012."

Author: "Oxenbridge, Faith"
Title: "A shortcut to Happiness review"
description: "Reviews the latest Roger Hall play, directed by Ross Gumbley and showing at the Court Theatre, Christchurch, until 28 Jan 2012."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Winds of change"
description: "Points out the importance of fuel at the Ross Island bases. Describes how Scott Base and McMurdo Station now collaborate on fuel generation and consumption, noting the fuel savings resulting from the wind turbines installed by Meridian Energy in 2010.  Mentions the failure and dismantling of a nuclear power station installed by the US in 1962. Looks at other types of energy generation and fuels used in Antarctica."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "Three sisters at Scott Base"
description: "Points out the importance of fuel at the Ross Island bases. Describes how Scott Base and McMurdo Station now collaborate on fuel generation and consumption, noting the fuel savings resulting from the wind turbines installed by Meridian Energy in 2010.  Mentions the failure and dismantling of a nuclear power station installed by the US in 1962. Looks at other types of energy generation and fuels used in Antarctica."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "A first-aid guide to summer pests"
description: "Provides tips on how to avoid, and treat stings and bites from, jellyfish, mosquitoes, wasps and spiders."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Big plans for St Paul's spaces"
description: "Talks to George Chittenden the new director of music at St Paul's Cathedral, Dunedin who wants the cathedral to become known as a centre for musical excellence. Backgrounds his credentials. Mentions the quality of the choir and organ. Discusses his love for cathedral music."

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Research creating, recalling memories"
description: "Concerns a longitudinal study headed by Dr Fiona Jack (University of Otago) that investigates the long-term memory of children aged 2 to 4. Mentions the case of a 63 year old who can remember events from before he could walk."

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "Glowing report for Otago Polytechnic"
description: "Reports on and gives details of an audit by the New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA) of the educational performance of the Dunedin polytechnic."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Stories shared, tears shed for 'Dougs'"
description: "Stories shared, tears shed for 'Dougs'"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Pigeons move up pecking order"
description: "Introduces the work of University of Otago postdoctoral fellow in psychology Dr Damian Scarf on the ability of pigeons to learn abstract rules. Notes his paper on the numerical abilities of the birds has been published in 'Science', and suggests why it has attracted international attention."

Author: "Campbell, Bill"
Title: "Settlement marks 175 years"
description: "Announces the anniversary of the seaside settlement by whalers in 1836, noting it was originally a MaÃÑori settlement. Presents brief historical details of the area. Lists the events that will mark the occasion."

Author: "Hartley, Simon"
Title: "'Key attributes' keep Scott's star rising"
description: "'Key attributes' keep Scott's star rising"

Author: "Beech, James"
Title: "Helped preserve species, landscapes"
description: "Helped preserve species, landscapes"

Author: "Entwisle, Peter"
Title: "Cargill Monument often misunderstood"
description: "Chronicles the history of the Cargill Monument, located in the Exchange and currently undergoing restoration. Comments on the controversial structure and touches on the life of the Mancunian architect, Charles Swyer."

Author: "Leigh, Edith"
Title: "A long way from home [part 1]"
description: "Meets the Dutch immigrants who now live on an isolated farm in the Tokomairiro Plains. Talks to them about why they decided to move to NZ and embark on a life in the country."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "2011 was an engaging year for Menzies"
description: "2011 was an engaging year for Menzies"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Pastime grew into obsession"
description: "Talks to the woman about her love of quilting. Advises on what makes a good quilter, latest trends and provides tips for new quilters."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Even the bad times are good"
description: "Overviews how the Otago region fared in 2011, looking for signs of progress in categories ranging from buildings and communication to tourism and transport."

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Sense of humour 'essential'"
description: "Talks to the registered nurse who is the wife of former All Black, Highlander and Blues prop Kees Meeuws. Describes the pleasures and pressures of being married to a prominent sportsman."

Author: "Gates, Charlie"
Title: "Title familiar to ex-principal; WOW! WearableArt founder humbled by her new prefix; 'Accidental' success owed to Dunedin; Third knight for the Todds in Sir John; Top businesswoman was high school drop-out; Do-anything dame revels in philanthropy"
description: "Talks to Sir Graham Henry and Dame Suzie Moncrieff about their reactions to their honours. Lists the recipients of the various New Year Honours for 2012. Describes each of the various NZ honours. Looks briefly at the career and works of artist Ralph Hotere (Member of the Order of NZ). Highlights the work of Mike Ardagh (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit), Verna McFelin (Member of the NZ Order of Merit), Barry Maister (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit), Max Smith (Member of the NZ Order of Merit), Malcolm Farry (Companion of the NZ Order of Merit), Peter Radich (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit) and Paul Woodgate (Member of the NZ Order of Merit), and the honours they received. Profiles the business careers of Animation Research founder Ian Taylor (Companion of the NZ Order of Merit), former head of Todd Motors Sir John Todd, businesswoman Diane Foreman (Companion of the NZ Order of Merit), and philanthropist Rosanne Meo (Dame Companion of the NZ Order of Merit). Lists the various business leaders also recognised."

Title: "Prescient, of course, but Nostradamus we're not"
description: "Members of the Press Gallery look back over their political predictions for 2011 and mark their efforts at soothsaying."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Thriving in the heat of the kitchen; Life after MasterChef 'an interesting roller coaster'"
description: "Speaks to the contestants from series two and series one, respectively, of the television programme New Zealand MasterChef. Discovers how their lives have changed since coming to national prominence. Includes his recipes for onion jam and bloke's sausage roll, and her recipe for chicken picnic pie."

Author: "Palenski, Ron"
Title: "The king of fullbacks"
description: "Profiles the former All Black fullback who revolutionised his position and is considered one of the best fullbacks NZ has produced."

Author: "Leigh, Edith"
Title: "Good news for the planet"
description: "Talks to University of Auckland Associate Professor Niki Harre about her book that inspires people to live a sustainable and enjoyable life by focusing on good news. Gives an example of how changing the wording in a message to hotel guests changed the guests' behaviour. Focuses on the issue of climate change and sustainable living."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "What a year that was : 2011 in review; Year leaves its mark on everyone; Unravelling of a national tragedy"
description: "Reflects on the previous year and looks forward to what Christchurch can expect in 2012. Includes a timeline of events and a list of notable deaths. Describes how the Pike River coalmine tragedy has unfolded in the various court hearings of the Royal Commission over the past 13 months."

Author: "Fridd, John"
Title: "Wanaka's section of new trail ready to ride [part 1]"
description: "Showcases the Wanaka section of the 3000-kilometre Te Araroa trail, also known as The Long Pathway. Provides details about the local section, which runs from Lake Hawea to Glendhu Bay via Wanaka."

Author: "Bathurst, Bella"
Title: "Shackleton's second self"
description: "Follows in the footsteps of Ernest Shackleton's right-hand man, Frank Wild, on a cruise ship towards Antarctica. Relates, briefly, the history of the two men."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Sweet sounds of music"
description: "Showcases the top artists and albums in NZ music in 2011, focusing on Six60, The Naked and the Famous, rapper David Dallas, Koile, Pajama Club, Bic Runga, Gin Wigmore, Hollie Fullbrook, Beastwars, David Kilgour and John Egenes. Presents the Recording Industry of New Zealand's top selling albums, singles, NZ artist singles, and NZ artist albums."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "Cup's Christchurch ties"
description: "Writes about the historical ties Christchurch has with the Davis Cup, starting with the 1911 grand final at Lancaster Park between Australasia and the United States, on New Years day exactly 100 years ago. Describes subsequent competitions and ties and highlights the efforts of some of our tennis elite. Looks at the likelihood of Christchurch hosting further ties."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Idyllic camping spot has many fans"
description: "Spotlights Burton Creek near Clyde. Talks to regulars about the attractions of the popular camping, swimming, fishing and picnic spot."

Author: "Gray, Jamie"
Title: "Primary producers on crest of a wave"
description: "Examines the performance and prospects of NZ's primary industries. Seeks comment from economists and spokespeople for primary producers."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Title: "Tackling the monster without : 'Landfall' on quakes"
description: "Reviews the issue themed 'Christchurch and beyond', noting the ongoing editorship of David Eggleton."

Author: "McNeilly, Hamish"
Title: "Rogues' gallery source of fascination"
description: "Reveals facts about the 'mugshot' collection at the NZ Police Museum. Reviews 51 mugshots of Otago-area prisoners from 1886-1890. Seeks comment from Police Museum interpretation and experience officer Naias Mingo. Provides further information about the use of mugshots in NZ and overseas."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Songwriter tries a little teamwork"
description: "Songwriter tries a little teamwork"

Author: "Hearn, T. J."
Title: "More than a tale of a sea crossing"
description: "More than a tale of a sea crossing"

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Home where the heart is"
description: "Showcases the South Otago home of the couple. Traces the history of the property and her family's connection to the area. Describes the construction of the eco-friendly home, custom designed by Dunedin architect Ian Butcher."

Author: "Seconi, Adrian"
Title: "NZ cricket's great pioneering leader"
description: "Chronicles the life and career of the early 20th century NZ cricket representative."

Author: "Fridd, John"
Title: "Leisurely Taieri circuit perfect outing for novices [part 2]"
description: "Features the Taieri Tour, a 23-kilometre mountain bike trail starting and ending in Mosgiel that is suitable for beginners."

Author: "Crean, MIke"
Title: "MND fought to the last moment"
description: "Describes the positive way that the husband and father of three dealt with the effects of motor neurone disease."

Author: "Ford, Greg"
Title: "Our amazing year : 2011"
description: "Looks back on the last 12 months of sport and gives verdicts on what amazed, stirred and annoyed."

Author: "De Reus, Helena"
Title: "Tiny town with a quiet family-oriented feel"
description: "Spotlights Pounawea, a tranquil but popular holiday spot located between the estuaries of the Catlins and Owaka rivers. Talks to holidaymakers Kerren Crawford and her daughter Alex Crawford about its charms."

Author: "Cronshaw, Tim"
Title: "A year to celebrate - despite the sorrow"
description: "Looks back at what turned out to be a good year for farmers and farming."

Title: "12:30 in Otago; 'Big boy' not roughing it this year; Octagon the (hot) spot; Unbroken by broncs, bulls; 'Just the best place to go on holiday'; US student doing the 'touristy things' [part 1]"
description: "Speaks to five people, including US tourist Allison Maffitt, about what they were doing when visited by 'Otago Daily Times' reporters at 12.30 pm on 27 Dec 2011. Asks what brought them to their particular location."

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Mainfreight's main man has got the goods"
description: "Speaks to the Mainfreight managing director about his career and the freight company. Explains why he was named as the newspaper's 2011 'Business Leader of the Year'."

Author: "Hooton, Amanda"
Title: "Plug me in; me, myself and wi-fi"
description: "Narrates the author's attempt to download apps to the office iPad, despite her confession to being a Luddite."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "A recipe for a more satisfying life [part 2]"
description: "Talks to the former Dunedin teacher about her decision to return to a life in rural Otago. Discusses the origins of Inch Valley Preserves, the business she runs with her husband, Jim Hinkley, from their historic home near Palmerston."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Businesses grit teeth, fight on"
description: "Reflects on a tragic and unforgettable 2011 for Canterbury businesses."

Author: "Agnew, Margaret"
Title: "Joining the Serkis"
description: "Speaks with actor Andy Serkis about his role in the latest Peter Jackson-directed movie, his stint as director on 'The Hobbit', and the 'performance capture' technology in which he is regarded to be an expert. Features comments by Peter Jackson, Steven Spielberg, and Andy Serkis on the latter's portrayal of Captain Haddock."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "The intricate icing on the cake"
description: "Talks to the locksmith about her passion for decorating cakes. Includes advice for would-be cake decorators."

Author: "Kay, Martin"
Title: "Leader fought for New Zealand and for Maori"
description: "Leader fought for New Zealand and for Maori"

Author: "Gibb, John"
Title: "Spouse's support essential factor in success"
description: "Talks to the couple, both of whom hold high-profile positions, about the importance of providing support to each other."

Author: "Lovell-Smith, Mary"
Title: "A different kind of garden"
description: "Looks at how various Christchurch home gardens are faring after the earthquakes."

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "A tireless advocate for many Wellington causes"
description: "A tireless advocate for many Wellington causes"

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Nothing trivial at pub quizzes; Questions that make you go hmmm!?!"
description: "Showcases the pub quiz, which is enjoying a resurgence after the screening of the NZ-made television series on TV One. Talks to the owner of the Bog Irish Bar about his experiences as a quizmaster, and his advice to participants."

Author: "Tuckett, Graeme"
Title: "Latest film technology succeeds in bringing Tintin to life"
description: "Latest film technology succeeds in bringing Tintin to life"

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Second time the charm; The thrill of the chase addictive; Tips for bargain hunting; What's on offer in Dunedin?"
description: "Explores the state of the second-hand trade business in Dunedin. Talks to the proprietors of several second-hand goods stores about some of the trends they have noticed. Speaks to the woman about her passion for collecting, and shares her tips for bargain-hunting, recommended stores in Dunedin, and small towns to visit for second-hand shopping. Lists additional bargain-hunting tips and briefly describes various types of second-hand stores in the city."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "The first golden age of NZ rowing"
description: "Examines the careers of NZ's first rowing three world champions."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Feather in his cap"
description: "Talks to the so-called 'Duckman' about how he came to rescue and care for injured water fowl, especially ducks."

Author: "Fridd, John"
Title: "From new settlement to abandoned gold-era settlement [part 3]"
description: "Provides details of the mountain bike trail between the Pisa Moorings settlement and Bannockburn, via Lowburn and Cromwell."

Author: "Loughrey, David"
Title: "Dwelling + ticket office + clinic = crib"
description: "Visits the Harwood, Otago Peninsula crib owned by the couple. Describes its previous incarnation as the dental nurses' clinic at Musselburgh School, where she worked as a teacher. Informs that the former St Clair Salt Water Pool ticket office is also on the property, which he built when he was a builder and joiner. Talks about the improvements they have made to the property."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Food for thought"
description: "Talks to Robyn Langlands about how she found a way to avoid food waste and feed hungry people by setting up Kaibosh Food Rescue, a non-profit charity redistributing surplus food from businesses to charities."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Purakaunui family tree; The name game"
description: "Speaks to distant relatives Nicola Taylor of Purakaunui and Paraparaumu retiree John McLachlan, who collaborated to produce a DVD about the tranquil seaside settlement that is their spiritual home. Informs that several hundred NZers, including several prominent people, are descended from the Englishman who settled in Otago in 1838 and married Motoitoi, the daughter of a Kai Tahu chief.  Describes the decision to make the DVD and some of the themes that it covers. Informs that Nicola Taylor is campaigning to ensure that the name of the settlement  is spelled properly as 'PuÃÑraÃÑkaunui; rather than 'Purakanui', after a ruling by the NZ Geographic Board. Explains the meaning of the word."

Author: "Souter, Fenella"
Title: "Divine intervention?"
description: "Discusses the accuracy (or otherwise) of the 25th December as the birth date of Jesus Christ. Questions also whether Bethlehem is the correct place of birth. Compares the two nativity stories in New Testament gospels Matthew and Luke. Looks at Christmas traditions throughout the centuries, including the history of Christmas in NZ and the use of 'Xmas'."

Title: "Remembering the first New Zealand Christmas"
description: "Describes the events leading to the celebration of Christmas and the spread of Christianity through the Roman world and into Asia and northern Europe. Notes the first Christmas in NZ was celebrated in 1814 by the Rev. Samuel Marsden of the Church Mission Society. Backgrounds the introduction of Christianity to MaÃÑori and asks readers to reconsider the Christmas story. Includes signatures of 25 Auckland church leaders."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "Indulge : Gina Moss"
description: "Talks to the publisher, puppeteer and artistic liasion director at the New Zealand International Arts Festival about the shows in France that inspired her to pursue puppetry and theatre."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "New Year's revolution"
description: "Talks to Wellington GP Cathy Stephenson about the unexpected ripple effects that resolving to buy only secondhand clothes from op shops for a year created for her and her children. Looks at how many clothes end up in landfills."

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Adan Tijerina : Vector Orchestra general manager, painting supervisor"
description: "Adan Tijerina : Vector Orchestra general manager, painting supervisor"

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "They let her down"
description: "Summarises Mel Smith's (former Ombudsman) report sent to the Government outlining the abuse perpetrated by the mother of a little young girl and why and how the agencies vested with the authority to protect the girl had failed to do so. Includes the 9 year-old child's teacher's abridged email sent to John Key after resigning."

Author: "Gadd, David"
Author (detailed): "David Gadd, James Weir and Neil Reid"
Title: "Father Des wrestles with his titles : Hotere joins list of greatest living NZers; Honours list; NZ honours; Hotere's seductive artworks 'feed the soul'; Wilde still has plenty to accomplish; 'Gosh, I have done a lot really'; Todd family gains its third knight"
description: "Talks to the Reverend Canon Father Sir Des Britten about his being made a Knight Companion of the NZ Order of Merit and profiles his career. Highlights some of the people awarded New Year Honours. Lists the recipients of the various New Year Honours for 2012. Describes each of the various NZ honours. Profiles artist Ralph Hotere who has been made a Member of the Order of NZ. Talks to Fran Wilde (Companion of the NZ Order of Merit), Roger Gascoigne (Member of the NZ Order of Merit), Sir John Todd, Sir Graham Henry and Dame Suzie Moncrieff about receiving their Honours. Profiles, briefly, Professor Peter Hughes (Companion of the NZ Order of Merit), artist Piera McArthur (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit, coroner Garry Evans (Queen's Service Order), scientist David Wratt (Queen's Service Order) and former Education Ministry head Karen Sewell (Queen's Service Order)."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Keeping the customers happy"
description: "Talks to the proprietors of the popular family-owned Italian restaurant Etrusco, in Moray Place, Dunedin. Discusses their decision to move from Alexandra to Dunedin and open the restaurant in Dec 1994. Talks to him about how NZ cuisine has evolved since he arrived from Australia in the early 1980s. Emphasises the importance of family and informs that their two sons Rion Gianone and Zane Gianone have entered the business. Seeks comment from barrister and satisfied customer Anita Chan."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Confessed killer moves near mother of victim"
description: "Confessed killer moves near mother of victim"

Author: "Koubaridis, Andrew"
Title: "Police probe high-flyer's death"
description: "Police probe high-flyer's death"

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Power to the people"
description: "Meets the couple who generate most of their own electricity for their 'smile-shaped', super-insulated home on the Otago Peninsula, designed by Dunedin architectural designer Biz Boyle. Focuses on its environmentally friendly features, including photovoltaic electricity generation panels."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Muddy waters"
description: "Examines the issues associated with the plans for fish farms in the Hauraki Gulf and Bay of Islands, including recreational and environmental. Looks at the recent law change which has freed up large areas for aquaculture along large parts of NZs coastline and research about the effects of fish farming on the environment."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "No end to tale-spinner' stories"
description: "No end to tale-spinner' stories"

Author: "O'Sullivan, Fran"
Title: "Shearer's message just what Kiwis needed"
description: "Takes up David Shearer's view that a beautiful NZ is not enough to keep young NZders home to build a career, nor is it enough to attract talented overseas people here. Comments on David Shearer's predisposition to support 'innovative government policies and work in a bi-partisan fashion'. Notes the continuing earthquakes in Christchurch will affect the government's ability to plan for economic development and the euro crisis is not having a positive affect either."

Title: "Political pundits win a few, lose a few"
description: "Members of the Press Gallery look back over their political predictions for 2011 and mark their efforts at soothsaying."

Author: "Meikle, Hayden"
Title: "Queen of the court"
description: "Profiles the life and career of the English-born woman considered to be NZ's first great female sports star, and possibly still the best women's tennis player NZ has produced."

Author: "Powley, Kathryn"
Title: "Destiny's dozen"
description: "Nominates 12 NZers who are set to make a mark in 2012: basketballer Steve Adams, musician Lydia Cole, Detective Inspector Mark Loper, fashion designer Ingrid Starnes, Lion Emergency Power Generator inventor Same Mackwell, netballer Layla Cullen, rower Joseph Sullivan, NZ First MP Tracey Martin, actor Milo Cawthorne, gym owner Selena Short, co-founder of audio company Serato AJ Bertenshaw, and model Olivia Lefebre. Spotlights some trends to follow in 2012."

Author: "Fridd, John"
Title: "Wanaka well endowed with fantastic cycling tracks [part 4]"
description: "Provides details of two mountain bike trails : the Deans Bank Track and the Upper Clutha River Track from Albert Town to Luggate."

Author: "Cudby, Kevin"
Title: "Classic ocean adventure lives on in Global competition"
description: "Reports on the Global Ocean Race (GOR) as two Kiwi yachts race from Cape Town towards Wellington on the second leg of the race. Looks at the conception of the GOR, how the Class40 yachts handle the conditions and the growth of short-handed ocean racing."

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Seaside community offers peace and simplicity of life"
description: "Visits Shag Point, a small seaside retreat in East Otago north of Palmerston.  Talks to Jim Russell and his wife June Russell about their experiences living there for the past decade. Comments on the geological and archaeological features of the area."

Author: "Gibson, Anne"
Title: "Home truths for housing plan; urban sprawl not the answer for Auckland, says councillor"
description: "Looks at housing availability and affordability in Auckland. Follows the search of former Tauranga and drama teacher Vanessa Byrnes and her family for a home in Pt Chevalier, Westmere, Ponsonby and Mt Eden.  Looks at the results of a Productivity Commission report calling for land at Auckland's outskirts to be opened up for construction, noting this contradicts the Auckland Council's plans to limit urban growth.  Provides contrasting responses to the report by several councillors. Compares building costs for Auckland, Melbourne and the Gold Coast."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Ten years of talk"
description: "Describes some of the interviews carried out by the author over the last ten years."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Demolition derby"
description: "Details the demolition of buildings in Christchurch's central business district. Talks to engineering experts about the lessons learned from the collapse of CBD buildings during the Christchurch earthquakes. Focuses on soil composition, adequacy of engineering standards, and the danger of poorly designed reinforced concrete buildings. Registers criticism of the Canterbury Earthquakes Royal Commission membership and some of its findings so far on the collapse of the Pyne Gould Corporation (PGC) building."

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "Battle-hardened in the Mogadishu madness"
description: "Talks to people who were co-workers of the new Labour Party leader during his time as a humanitarian aid worker in Somalia, Israel, and Iraq. Relays their views of his working and personal style."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Dave Dobbyn"
description: "Interviews the singer and entertainer, talking about his optimism and his interest in telling and listening to stories. Covers his 'niceness', his Christian approach to life, and his family life and career. Tries to discuss the Greatest Hits Summer Tour he will feature in."

Author: "Rix, Joanna"
Title: "Picture imperfect"
description: "Reflects on the differences between her life as the day editor of a Johannesburg newspaper in South Africa and her role now as a full time mother in Johnsonville, Wellington. Highlights some of the social differences between daily life in the two cities. Uses a series of photographs to allude to her feelings of loss towards the life she has left behind."

Author: "Hutching, Megan"
Title: "Lifelong battler for a more just world left worthy memorial"
description: "Lifelong battler for a more just world left worthy memorial"

Author: "Crossley, Jazial"
Author (detailed): "Jazial Crossley, Alan Wood and Jonathan Millmow"
Title: "Gong for icecream queen : Foreman becomes companion NZOM; Do-anything Dame revels in philanthrophy; Love of Dunedin turned rock 'n' roller frontman into TV entrepreneur; Roll of honour - business leaders recognised; Sistema Plastics founder honoured; Coaching is where Kenny made his mark"
description: "Profiles the business careers of Animation Research founder Ian Taylor (Companion of The NZ Order of Merit), businesswoman Diane Foreman (Companion of The NZ Order of Merit), and philanthropist Rosanne Meo (Dame Companion of The NZ Order of Merit). Highlights other business leaders also recognised - John Anderson (Member of the NZ Order of Merit), Howard Wright (Member of the NZ Order of Merit), Hugh Green (Queen's Service Medal), Brendan Lindsay (NZ Order of Merit), Richard Izard (Companion of the NZ Order of Merit), Richard Waddell (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit), John Hynds (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit), and David Jones (Member of the NZ Order of Merit). Profiles the boxing and training career of Chris Kenny (Officer of the NZ Order of Merit)."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Artists' gloom and doom part of gallery splendour"
description: "Reviews the collection of the reopened Auckland Art Gallery, focusing on works inspired by history, literature and tragedy."

Author: "Worthington, Sam"
Title: "'Most-hyped' talent takes 2.15m to US"
description: "Looks at the prospects over in the United States for the 18-year-old basketballer from Wellington."

Author: "Hurley, Bevan"
Title: "Big"
description: "Reports on the controversial broadcaster's move to breakfast television in Australia. Backgrounds his broadcasting career."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Music career at crossroads"
description: "Speaks to the country singer about her debut album. Charts her career to date and talks to her about her desire to increase the profile and popularity of country music in NZ."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Champions of our rare dolphins"
description: "Focuses on the plight of the endangered species Hector's dolphins and the North Island sub-species, Maui's dolphin. Talks to the University of Otago marine biologists who have been advocating for the protection of the dolphins since the 1980s, and have become increasingly involved in political lobbying to achieve this aim. Lists facts about both types of dolphin."

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Only in Japan"
description: "Profiles the Japanese music label Wonderful Noise, launched by Kenji Sakajiri, which has 11 NZ acts on its roster. Explains the role of Andy Mitchell in the label's origin. Talks to producer and drummer Julien Dyne (Opensouls, Ladi6) about how the label is promoting NZ music in Japan and in clubs elsewhere overseas."

Author: "Taylor, Cliff"
Title: "Making sense in a hearing world"
description: "Reports on the division within the deaf community about the use of cochlear implants. Speaks to former cricketer Lance Cairns and student Josh Foreman about how the implant has transformed their lives, and to Deaf Aotearoa president Kellye Bensley about the implant versus sign language issue. Spotlights the Gilby family from Auckland. Talk to the mother, Shona Gilby, about the decision to get cochlear implants for two of their children."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Scrapbooks full of memories"
description: "Talks to the craftswoman from Scrapbook Paradise. Includes tips for beginners."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "A labour of love"
