description: "Spotlights the Roslyn-based pizza and pasta restaurant Zucchini Bros, owned and operated by the couple for the past 17 years. Talks to them about the origins of the business and the challenges they faced in pursuing their dream."

Author: "Leigh, Edith"
Title: "Living a good life off the grid"
description: "Meets the family who are living off the national grid and generating their own electricity at their Whare Flat home. Discusses the economic savings gained from reducing their carbon footprint, and describes the systems they have put in place over the past several years."

Author: "Love, Tony"
Title: "Skelton brothers had winning touch"
description: "Profiles one of NZ's greatest jockeys, one of five brothers who distinguished themselves in thoroughbred racing. Overviews highlights of his career, and informs that his brother, Bob Skelton, is also a member of the New Zealand Sports Hall of Fame."

Author: "Oakley, Maggie"
Title: "Up close and personal with Otago's wonderful wildlife [part 1]"
description: "Spotlights a sea kayaking route from Taiaroa Head to Warrington Beach, or vice versa. Provides important safety and other facts about sea kayaking."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "Peter Walls interview"
description: "Speaks to New Zealand Symphony Orchestra (NZSO) chief executive Peter Walls about why he is stepping down from the role after nine years, the frequent criticism of the NZSO's repertoire, promotion and cost, and his successor as chief executive, Chris Blake. Talks about Blake's career."

Author: "Barnett, Sarah"
Title: "Premature births on the rise"
description: "Reports on the rising number of premature births and the pressure on neonatal units. Questions how much effort should be made to save very premature babies, when many suffer ongoing health problems. Relates the author's experience of the premature birth of her daughter, Maggie. Speaks to Dr Malcolm Battin, the clinical director of the Auckland New Born Intensive Care Unit (Nicu), about the reasons for premature births and the design of modern neonatal units, which try to create a comfortable family environment. Talks about the support for families of preemies. Speaks to Michael Meads, head of the Neonatal Trust, about the support the charity provides to families of Nicu patients and graduates."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Top honour for artist; Staff, partners, wife credited; Achievements the work of many, recipient says; [New year 2012 NZ honours]"
description: "Reports that three local residents have been recognised in the New Year's honours for 2012. Profiles the artist who was made a Member of the Order of New Zealand, and the managing director of Taylormade Media and the chairman of the Carisbrook Stadium Trust, both of whom have been made Companions of the NZ Order of Merit."

Title: "Former Children's Commissioner honoured; Recognition for 'absolute highlight' of career; [New year 2012 NZ honours]"
description: "Profiles 12 recipients of various honours in the New Year 2012 NZ Honours list, all of whom reside in Otago and Southland or have ties there."

Author: "Brown, Michael"
Title: "Henry a new knight this morning; [New year 2012 NZ honours]"
description: "Profiles the former coach of the All Blacks, who was knighted in the New Year's honours."

Title: "New Year's honours list; [New year 2012 NZ honours]"
description: "Presents the list of award recipients for New Year 2012. Includes information about the seniority of various NZ honours."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Hillside a world away from worry"
description: "Highlights the Waipori Falls village, talking to Christchurch residents Jon Barfoot and Lynette Barfoot about their holiday home there. Describes the origin of the 33 house settlement and lists activities and sights to see in the area."

Author: "Caldwell, Olivia"
Title: "Kinloch's magic keeps drawing visitors back"
description: "Showcases the holiday town at the head of Lake Wakatipu. Speaks to Kinloch Lodge owners John Glover and Toni Glover about the popularity of the area and the many activities available.  Seeks comment from former Queenstown residents Garry Ferris and Kiri Ferris about why they keep returning to the area for holidays. Lists facts about Kinloch."

Author: "Dodgshun, Joe"
Title: "Small crowd enjoys 'outstanding event'"
description: "Reviews the turnout and success of the first time EarthTonz New Years Eve music festival held in Gibbston Valley. Asks festival producer Dan Allen if the concert will be held again"

Author: "Why, Loveday,"
Title: "Katy's Christmas, from NZ to England"
description: "Katy's Christmas, from NZ to England"

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Jade succeeding with push into great unknown"
description: "Spotlights the winner of the 'Otago Daily Times' Southern Business of the Year. Talks to its managing director Craig Richardson about the challenges of carrying out its three-year plan after the Christchurch earthquakes, and its successes, including the establishment of an office in San Francisco."

Title: "'Proud Kiwi' bashed to death in US"
description: "'Proud Kiwi' bashed to death in US"

Author: "Dodgshun, Joe"
Title: "Wholehearted supporter of sport and theatre"
description: "Pays tribute to the late electrician who was a 'tireless volunteer' for sports and theatre in Wakatipu."

Title: "Dedicated sister served the deaf"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Dominican nun and sister who will be remembered for her work with deaf people."

Title: "Exhibition visit inspired religious vocation"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Naseby-born Catholic nun."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "From city to country"
description: "Reports on the move by the Auckland corporate couple to a 20 hectare farmlet at the Kilmog, north of Dunedin. Describes life on the farm with their two children, mentioning the realities of working with animals and how losing a job at Kiwirail's Hillside workshop has led to plans to set up a consultancy business."

Author: "Page, Craig"
Title: "Tough, intent, making giant world strides"
description: "Tough, intent, making giant world strides"

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Perfect place to escape to with children"
description: "Highlights Camp Sutton, located on the site of the Sutton School which closed in 1958. Talks to John Fitzwilliam of Dunedin about the facilities and fun to be had while holidaying at the school, now redeveloped by the Otago Youth Adventure Trust. Lists the activities and sights in the area, including the only inland salt lake in NZ."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Circus students put through hoops"
description: "Circus students put through hoops"

Author: "Stone, Andrew"
Title: "Ten big ideas for 2012"
description: "Surveys some different areas of development research that may or may not come to fruition in the future. Laboratory grown meat, robot teachers, homes that run on their own waste and independent floating platforms that house cities and which are proposed to be free from the taxman and have their own laws are being given serious thought, energy and finance."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Green Christmas presents"
description: "Suggests 13 garden related ideas for Christmas gifts. Offers tips for giving a plant as a gift."

Author: "Warner, Kirsten"
Title: "Uphill climb"
description: "Looks at the progress the national cycleway trail is making in the Far North. Discusses the issues relating to its progress, or lack of it, indicating obtaining access to private land, ascertaining title of ownership and convincing some people the cycle trail is a beneficial project are the main impediments to further development. Talks to Mita Harris who is the Far North District Council's cycle trail representative on the Hokianga."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Olympic Games dream just a heartbeat away"
description: "Profiles the triathlete. Discusses the challenges she has faced this year after unsuccessful heart surgery to correct arrthymia. Overviews her career to date and informs that she is seeking further surgery before preparing for the final Olympic qualifying race in Sydney, Apr 2012."

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Keeping the balls in the air"
description: "Speaks to Dave Matika and Ruth Matika and Richard Fyfe and Alix Lucas-Fyfe who live and work in Dunedin, asking how they manage the quality of working and family life."

Author: "Goodwin, Eileen"
Title: "Longtime resident never left home"
description: "Longtime resident never left home"

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "Taking on a tall order [part 3]"
description: "Speaks to the couple about their successful search for a patch of rural land in Otago as a retreat from urban life. Describes the process of transforming a challenging plot of land at Ardgowan, near Oamaru, into an award-winning, environmentally friendly property. Mentions their future plans to move into semi-retirement there."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Dominant ocean swimmer for decade"
description: "Profiles the fireman and swimming coach who set marathon ocean swimming records in the 1980s."

Author: "Fletcher, Hamish"
Title: "Meo led way for women in business"
description: "Meo led way for women in business"

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Title: "Historic caves have story to tell"
description: "Explores three historic caves in the area, all of which are firmly locked. Talks to art historian Peter Entwisle about the origins of each cave, believed to have been powder storehouses for large public works projects in the 1860s and 1870s. Seeks  comment from Otakau runanga chairman Edward Ellison and historian Bill Dacker about the Shore St cave, constructed by MaÃÑori prisoners taken from Taranaki for forced labour in Dunedin from 1869 to 1881. Includes speculation about the cave doors, interiors and usage."

Author: "Fletcher, Hamish"
Title: "Beating the odds in male-dominated field"
description: "Beating the odds in male-dominated field"

Author: "Pattison, Catherine"
Title: "Offbeat early years an ideal grounding; Annabel Langbein's veges on the barbecue; Annabel Langbein's sweet little tartlets"
description: "Talks to the best-selling cookbook author, an erstwhile Wanaka resident, about her teenage 'hippy' years on the Whanganui River and Gisborne, and how these experiences have influenced her cooking style. Informs that the second series of her popular show begins filming in Jan 2012. Includes two recipes."

Title: "Tech founder started early on path to success"
description: "Tech founder started early on path to success"

Author: "Ibadulla, Khalid"
Title: "Cricket set-up flawed"
description: "Expounds upon the shortcomings of the professional cricket structure in NZ."

Author: "O'Dowd, Sue"
Title: "Brothers increase family's footprint on landscape"
description: "Brothers increase family's footprint on landscape"

Author: "Oakley, Maggie"
Title: "Day trip offers a tantalising introduction to Big Eddy [part 2]"
description: "Details a sea kayaking return route in relatively sheltered waters from Cornish Head, Waikouaiti to Warrington Beach, which she calls the 'Big Eddy'. Provides important safety and other facts about the route."

Author: "Leigh, Edith"
Title: "Where bad horses go good"
description: "Meets a young horse rider who trains horses on her parents' Springbank Farm. Discusses her success in training and selling horses bound for the meatworks, focusing on her competition jumper Jemima Puddleduck (Ducky). Touches on the influence of her mother who also rides and runs a horse riding school."

Author: "Searle, Jamie"
Title: "Bellew back on track after year on sidelines"
description: "Bellew back on track after year on sidelines"

Author: "Carson, Jonathan"
Title: "Noel putting pedal to the metal"
description: "Noel putting pedal to the metal"

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Title: "Lovely spot, isolated but close to town"
description: "Talks to Alexandra resident Carolyn O'Brien about the small home at Long Beach that is the holiday getaway for the eight members of her family. Seeks comment from Long Beach Amenities Society president Edna Wheeler about the lure of the settlement for holiday makers and the holiday programme offered by the Society."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "12:30 in Otago"
description: "Speaks to a range of people, including a family from Adelaide and an English couple on their 10th trip to NZ, about what they were doing when visited by 'Otago Daily Times' reporters at 12.30 pm on 3 Jan 2012. Asks what brought them to their particular location."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Canterbury campers glad to escape shakes"
description: "Talks to campers at Lake Hawea Holiday Park about its particular charm, why they come to the camping ground and what activities they involve themselves in while there."

Author: "Roxburgh, Tracey"
Title: "And they're off and racing for 50 years"
description: "Reflects on the Glenorchy Races that have been running for the past 50 years at a location near the head of Lake Wakatipu. Indicates it has been an annual event at New Year and describes the community's involvement in organising the race day and how fundraising activities have helped to support the local community."

Author: "Pattison, Catherine"
Title: "Earthy feel makes dirt top choice"
description: "Talks to two brothers, Jimmy and Mike Cotter about constructing and living in houses made of earth. Notes Jimmy has made a living out of building rammed-earth houses and reveals his own home is built of rammed-earth and reveals the source and characteristics of the materials needed to build the house. Refers to some of the projects he has been involved in and some of the features that need to be considered before a rammed-earth structure is constructed."

Author: "Frost, Anna"
Title: "Surf to skyline on Karetai Track [part 3]"
description: "Describes one of the author's favourite runs, Karetai from Tomahawk Beach, listing its level of difficulty, walk time, best thing about the track and a precaution."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Fitter engineered a life on the stage"
description: "Meets the Nelson-born fitter and turner who is also an actor, entertainer and producer. Overviews his television and stage career and describes his experience of producing the 'Big Night In' community concert in Dunedin. Talks about his plans to repeat the event."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Worming his way to a new lifestyle; What is worm farming? [part 4]"
description: "Talks to the former deer farmer about what prompted him to leave his farm near Gore to start a new venture as a worm farmer in Central Otago. Provides information from the Waitaki Resource Recovery Trust about how worm composting works and its benefits to home gardeners."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Something in the water?"
description: "Seeks comment from musicians and music teachers about why Dunedin has consistently produced so many talented singers."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "When reality becomes surreality"
description: "Comments on the preponderance of reality television programmes on NZ screens, which he considers has moved beyond reality to surreality. Asks University of Otago senior lecturer Brett Nicholls about factors underlying the trend."

Author: "Frost, Anna"
Title: "Flagstaff run varied and interesting, but not for the faint-hearted [part 2]"
description: "Highlights one of the author's favourite runs, a return trip from Woodhaugh Gardens to Flagstaff Summit. Describes its level of difficulty, walk time, best thing about the track and a precaution."

Title: "Professorships for 14 university academics showing 'excellence'; Female dentistry professor a first"
description: "Professorships for 14 university academics showing 'excellence'; Female dentistry professor a first"

description: "Adept with needles of all sorts"

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Family fortunes"
description: "Explores the effect that siblings can have on each other. Discusses and cites comments from family experts on self beliefs as influenced by one's siblings, differential treatment by parents, attention to firstborns, sibling rivalry, favouritism, and the effect of older sibling responsibility and socialisation. Notes differences on the influence of sisters versus brothers. Gives the examples of an elderly woman who was bullied by older sisters, and the teenage siblings of Wellington (Nick Fenton, Jessie Fenton and Katie Fenton) who describe what they have learned from each other."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "The sibling effect"
description: "Explores the effect that siblings can have on each other. Discusses and cites comments from family experts on self beliefs as influenced by one's siblings, differential treatment by parents, attention to firstborns, sibling rivalry, favouritism, and the effect of older sibling responsibility and socialisation. Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Fracture friction"
description: "Discusses the exploration of oil and gas using fracking.  Defines the process, explaining why it is regarded as unconventional.  Sets out its contribution to the US energy industry. Explains the reasons for controversy over the practice in the US and Australia. Differentiates the chemicals used by exploration companies in NZ.  Provides an illustration of the engineering method used in NZ.  Talks to L&M Energy managing director Kent Anson about the company's applications to mine coal seam gas in Canterbury. Documents the resistance by Taranaki farmers Sarah Robert and David Morrison to fracking by Canadian based Tag Oil. Talks to American geophysicist Michael Hasting about links between fracking and earthquakes and asks if the procedure should be used in Canterbury.  Reports on groundwater contamination close to the Kapuni gas fields, where gas is extracted by Shell Todd Oil Services.  Relays concerns voiced by individuals and groups in NZ, and passes on the warning from the spokesman of Apache, a US based company operating on the North Island East Coast."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Fracking New Zealand"
description: "Discusses the exploration of oil and gas using fracking.  Defines the process, explaining why it is regarded as unconventional.  Sets out its contribution to the US energy industry. Explains the reasons for controversy over the practice in the US and Australia. Differentiates the chemicals used by exploration companies in NZ.   Provides an illustration of the engineering method used in NZ.  Talks to L&M Energy managing director Kent Anson about the company's applications to mine coal seam gas in Canterbury. Documents the resistance by Taranaki farmers Sarah Robert and David Morrison to fracking by Canadian based Tag Oil. Talks to American geophysicist Michael Hasting about links between fracking and earthquakes and asks if the procedure should be used in Canterbury.  Reports on groundwater contamination close to the Kapuni gas fields, where gas is extracted by Shell Todd Oil Services.  Relays concerns voiced by individuals and groups in NZ, and passes on the warning from the spokesman of Apache, a US based company operating on the North Island East Coast."

Title: "Not taking a back seat"
description: "Interviews the host of the TVNZ 7 political series 'Back Benches'. Talks about his routine in the Backbencher Pub with sidekick Damian Christie, explaining how producer Maryanne Ahern helps keep his routine 'real'. Discusses the influence of his Fijian Methodist minister father, his experience of the bone wearing Gaucher's disease, and the expansion of his career. Notes venues and dates of the Back Benches summer tour."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "In paradise at Danseys"
description: "Showcases the holiday park, operated by the pastor and his wife who moved from Maryland, USA, in 2008 to buy the property. Talks to them about the attractions of the area and the park, which sits beside the Maerewhenua River. Seeks comment from visitors to the holiday park and provides facts about it."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Eager emus, odd dogs all part of the job"
description: "Talks to Roz McDonald, animal control and education officer for the Dunedin City Council (DCC), about the nature of her work. Describes some of the more unusual situations she has experienced. Includes animal control statistics compiled by the DCC."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "To insure or not to insure?"
description: "Delves into the philosophy of the insurance industry, focusing on its importance and some of its shortcomings in the wake of the Christchurch earthquakes. Seeks comment from Waitaki District Council strategy group manager Richard Mabon, who provided a report to the council about its insurance options. Talks to Oamaru Whitestone Civic Trust chairman Phil Hope and Vicar Tim Hurd of St Luke's Anglican Church, Oamaru, about the options they have investigated for the properties in their care."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "More about passion than posturing"
description: "More about passion than posturing"

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "'Secret weapon' mayoress a 'doer'"
description: "Talks to the mayor of Central Otago and his wife about their marriage and their life in the region. Describes her role as mayoress and overviews her career. Touches on leisure activities they share."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Earthquakes teach unexpected lessons; Loath to move back to centre"
description: "Talks to the businessman and former clinical psychologist, co-owner of four gift stores in Christchurch with partner Anita Cessford, about the impact of the Christchurch earthquakes on the retail chain and the lessons they have learned. Discusses the earthquake on Boxing Day 2010 that led to the City Mall store in the CBD being 'red-stickered', which in hindsight was a 'fortunate' occurrence. Describes the effects of the earthquakes on staff and his own experiences with bureaucracy and insurance companies. Explains the decision not to reopen shops in the central city."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Straw house proves worth"
description: "Meets the couple, who left their home in Titirangi, Auckland to settle in Central Otago. Features their straw bale house and asks them why they chose to build this sort of home."

Author: "Frost, Anna"
Title: "Boardwalk with a spectacular view [part 4]"
description: "Describes another of the author's favourite runs, from Leith Saddle Track to Swampy Summit. Advises on its level of difficulty, walk time, best thing about the track and a precaution."

Author: "Ibbotson, Lucy"
Title: "A little peace and quiet at Kidds Bush"
description: "Showcases Kidds Bush Reserve on the northwest shore of Lake Hawea, administered by the Dept of Conservation (DoC). Speaks to several campers about the secluded surroundings. Discusses issues that have arisen due to antisocial activities of visitors, and speaks to summer warden Danny Steel about his role in maintaining order."

Author: "Fox, Rebecca"
Title: "Orokonui ponders winter cuts; Orokonui Ecosanctuary wildlife; Kiwi getting ready to breed"
description: "Talks to Neville Peat, chairman of the Otago Natural History Trust, about the financial position of the ecosanctuary, including visitor patterns and whether to reduce winter opening hours. Speaks to general manager Chris Baillie about how the birds are faring. Informs that 16 Haast tokoeka kiwi have begun preparations for breeding, just months after having been released on the site as juveniles."

Author: "Lewis, John"
Title: "Wide commercial interests"
description: "Pays tribute to the late businessman and seafarer who served as a member of the Otago Harbour Board and the NZ Ports Authority, and who established Cooltainer Services Ltd."

Author: "Somerville, Philip,"
Title: "Shy bride blossomed in new land"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Otago Polytechnic Italian language tutor and translator. Describes her arrival in NZ in 1946 as a war bride-to-be, and describes the story of her romance with the late Gordon Johnston."

Author: "Sinclair, Kay"
Title: "Zesty painter had eye for the unusual and a great sense of humour"
description: "Pays tribute to the late painter and plant nursery owner. Praises her ingenuity and discusses her passions for gardening, building and home remodelling."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "NZ breast-screening slated; Advertising to target Maori, Pacific women"
description: "Focuses on the results of a 'highly critical' independent report of the breast screening service. Highlights a 'systems failure' in 2009 that led to a delay in notifying 10,000 women that they were due for a routine mammogram. Explains that a second review has been undertaken following concerns about the sustainability of the service. Seeks comment from University of Otago Assoc Prof Brian Cox, a cancer researcher and screening specialist, about the importance of timely screening mammograms. Informs that new breast-screening television commercials will be aired in Feb 2012, aimed at Maori and Pacific women."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Runner smarter for years in US"
description: "Speaks to the NZ champion runner who has returned to Dunedin after spending three years at Purdue University, Indiana, USA. Informs that he was the first cross-country runner in the history of the university to become an academic All-American. Comments on some of the things he learned about training during his time there."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Olives heart of family's new lifestyle [part 5]"
description: "Meets the couple who 'walked out on their life' in South Otago 18 years ago to embark on a new life growing olives. Recounts their introduction to the industry and describes the process of harvesting their award-winning 'Poverty Gully' oil, named for the tailrace during the Central Otago gold rush."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "Nautical ghosts inhabit coast"
description: "Chronicles two maritime tragedies in Dunedin : the sinking of the 'Pride of the Yarra' on 4 Jul 1863 after a collision with the paddle boat 'Favourite', resulting in the loss of 13 people; and the grounding of the steamer 'SS Victory' on 3 Jul 1861. Informs that the wreck of the steamer can be viewed at Victory Beach on the Otago Peninsula."

description: "Explores the spire of Knox Church, as well as the clock towers of the Dunedin Railway Station, the University of Otago Registry Building (also known as the Clocktower Building) and the Dunedin Municipal Chambers. Presents facts about the design of each one."

description: "Eulogises the England-born musician. Describes meeting him in Christchurch some 15 years prior and recalls some of his anecdotes. Discusses the unpublished book he wrote about Buster Keaton, 'The Little iron man'."

description: "Lauds the return of the 2005 documentary 'New Zild : the story of New Zealand English', Heartland, 15 Jan 2012. Backgrounds the Origins of New Zealand English (ONZE) Project, based at the Dept of Linguistics, University of Canterbury."

Reviews his recently published book "Thinking, fast and slow". Mentions Britain's "nudge unit" where people are persuaded to make their own choices but may be swayed by a 'nudge'. Lists some of the most common thinking biases."

description: "Talks to actor Michael C. Hall about his cancer treatment, losing his dad at age 11 and whether his serial-killing TV character is an avenging superhero or just evil personified."

Author: "Harvey, Siobhan,"
Title: "Tina Makereti interview"
description: "Talks to author of Once upon a time in Aotearoa, Tina Makereti about her heritage and why she wrote the book."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Fine-dining finance"
description: "Visits the Roxy in downtown Auckland to see why fine-dining meals cost so much."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Insurance assessor"
description: "Explains what it is like working as a motor vehicle assessor for IAG."

Author: "Smith, Tony"
Title: "Captain Benji takes it on the chin"
description: "Captain Benji takes it on the chin"

Author: "Woodcock, Fred"
Title: "Running to work, now Olympic marathons"
description: "Running to work, now Olympic marathons"

Title: "Mitchell off to impressive start"
description: "Mitchell off to impressive start"

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Carbon countdown"
description: "Evaluates NZ's record of per capita carbon emissions and assesses criticism, by such groups as Climate Action Tracker, of its contribution to global warming. Covers the outcome of international meetings on climate change in Copenhagen (2009), Cancun (2010), and Durban (2011). Cites comments from Auckland University of Technology law lecturer Vernon Rive about the slow pace of international agreements. Describes how capsicum grower Hamish Alexander (Southern Paprika) won carbon credits and what he does with them. Tracks how countries have handled their committment to the Kyoto Protocol agreement. Explains NZ's 'cap and trade' system and asks industry experts whether it is working.  Relays why NZ has a high per capita emissions record, focusing on the contribution of primary industry. Notes complications in using forestry for carbon credits. Questions whether Government actions have encouraged NZ industry to pay to pollute rather than limit their carbon emissions. Illustrates projected carbon emissions to 2035, and emissions by country."

Author: "Cooke, Michelle"
Title: "Sex, conditions safer but prostitute stigma remains"
description: "Reflects on how the public stigma of sex workers has changed over the last nine years since NZ decriminalised prostitution under the Prostitution Reform Act 2003. Reports that NZ legislation is a model for other countries to follow. Talks to Ms Brennan, manager of a number of brothels about how relationships and trust with the police has improved since the reform."

Author: "Rutherford, Hamish"
Title: "The battle on the high street"
description: "Investigates the increasing popularity of online shopping. Talks to a number of high street retailers about the challenge of attracting customers away from the internet. Considers the views of an internet shopper and a customer who prefers to browse and purchase in the shops."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Cook Strait ferry captain spent nearly half a century at sea : a life story"
description: "Pays tribute to Cook Strait ferry captain Lawrie Collins. Outlines his life and career."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "2012 will test Govt economic prowess"
description: "Looks ahead to the main issues facing NZ's largest political parties this year. Elaborates on underlying economic problems that the National Party will need to tackle, including unemployment, food prices, the global financial crisis and welfare. Describes the fallout for the Labour Party from its heavy defeat in the 2011 election, looking at its need to revisit policies and party 'branding'."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "Mighty Mitre miracle?"
description: "Highlights the earthquake-damaged Mitre Hotel in Lyttelton, noting its uncertain future. Documents the immediate actions to save the concrete art deco style building by owner Tony Ward following the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks to publicans Irene Sheenan and Neville Sheenan about the pub's friendly community atmosphere, its social club and its place in the town's social life. Solicits comments from regular patron Bryan Koskela about his history with the pub. Recounts the connection between the Mitre and the Antarctic expeditions of Robert Scott and Ernest Shackleton."

Author: "Dastgheib, Shabnam"
Title: "The great exodus"
description: "Notes the record number of NZers who moved to Australia in 2011.  Briefly touches on the reasons for moving of Paul Weeks, Rupert Deans, Justin Brosnan, Marika Oles, Marcel Oles, Adam Jobbins, Taylor Maxwell, Sean Bolt, Clinton Jowett, Scott Brodie and Janna Forrester."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Brilliant doctor found success in Baltimore"
description: "Brilliant doctor found success in Baltimore"

Author: "Garden, Eoin,"
Title: "Crusading for change in the meat industry"
description: "Crusading for change in the meat industry"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "A howling success"
description: "Reflects with John Shrapnell why he first started the Wadestown Residents' Association 40 years ago and how it has developed and continues to make a difference in the community."

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Bare facts"
description: "Investigates the growing trend of barefoot running and minimalist shoes and asks whether we are replacing one marketing ploy with another. Consults a researcher into the facts around running injuries and whether sports shoes make a difference. Talks to a number of barefoot runners who advocate the benefits."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Cera leads the way to recovery"
description: "Talks to Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA) economic recovery general manager Steve Wakefield. Names and backgrounds the business and government members of his team, and lists and discusses the team's economic priorities for 2012. Remarks on the level of international and local interest in investing in the Christchurch CBD, and on the decision of two Government departments to locate out of the CBD."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Novel approach"
description: "Visits Wai-te-ata Press at Victoria University. Talks to Dr Sydney Shep, lecturer in print culture and publisher of Wai-te-ata Press. Discusses current trends in printed books in light of e-books becoming popular."

Title: "Inspired business edge in NZ meat industry"
description: "Inspired business edge in NZ meat industry"

Title: "Active in sport, commerce, community"
description: "Active in sport, commerce, community"

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "High notes"
description: "Profiles the suggested up-and-coming musicians for 2012. Includes electric pop musician Ruby Frost, singer/guitarist/loop-pedal master Aaron Tokona, producer/composer/multi-instrumentalist Riki Gooch, folk-pop singer Amiria Grenell, and composer/violinist Alex Taylor."

Title: "Schoolboy love of photography led to police career"
description: "Schoolboy love of photography led to police career"

Author: "Wratten, Stephen D."
Title: "Man over-broad!"
description: "Advises on how to make use of an over abundance of broad beans, providing a recipe for a bean paste and explaining how to use the uprooted plants."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Unobtrusive flair"
description: "Visits the 2011NZIA award winning house below Te Mata Peak of Kathryn Ingram and Trevor Taylor. Describes the black cedar pavilion house designed by architect Simon Clarkson, including the subdivision in which it is located."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "A whole lot of trouble"
description: "Speaks to Queensland cattle farmer Sid Plant about his experience living next door to an "open-cut" coal mine, and Chincilla (Queensland) newspaper reporter Tegan Plant about the impact of new mines on small towns. Talks to Solid Energy's general manager of lignite conservation Greg Visser about the likely impact of the state-owned enterprise's proposed Eastern Southland lignite mine."

Author: "Riddell, Oliver"
Title: "Giving full justice to the soldiers"
description: "Giving full justice to the soldiers"

Author: "Wyatt, Hamesh"
Title: "Unabashedly weird, surprisingly wise"
description: "Unabashedly weird, surprisingly wise"

Author: "McLean, Gavin"
Title: "Time to address the bias in New Zealand history"
description: "Time to address the bias in New Zealand history"

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Bare facts"
description: "Investigates the growing trend of barefoot running and minimalist shoes and asks whether people are replacing one marketing ploy with another. Consults a researcher into the facts around running injuries and whether sports shoes make a difference. Talks to a number of barefoot runners who advocate the benefits."

Author: "McBride, Kerry"
Title: "Homicide inquiry begins after journalist's death"
description: "Homicide inquiry begins after journalist's death"

Author: "Gorman, Paul,"
Title: "Captioned coverage to keep deaf MP in debates"
description: "Captioned coverage to keep deaf MP in debates"

Author: "Rodley, Aidan"
Title: "Win helps Waddell exorcise ghosts of his past"
description: "Win helps Waddell exorcise ghosts of his past"

Title: "McVean proves top of the class with a winning day at the show"
description: "McVean proves top of the class with a winning day at the show"

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "Unnatural disaster"
description: "Comments on the Auckland Draft Plan and its use of 'housing intensification', expressing concern on the effects of housing for higher density population on his suburb of Freemans Bay and other Auckland suburbs."

Author: "Ralston, Bill"
Title: "Save our suburbs"
description: "Comments on the Auckland Draft Plan and its use of 'housing intensification', expressing concern on the effects of housing for higher density population on his suburb of Freemans Bay and other Auckland suburbs."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Trees in trouble"
description: "Looks at threats to global forests, discussing the impact of human encroachment and the effects of climate change on trees, including altered weather and insect pests such as the mountain pine beetle. Reports on rates of deforestation and the significance of forests in storing or emitting carbon. Discusses deforestation in specific regions - Oceania, South America, Africa, North and Central America, Europe, and Asia."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Word forestry in trouble"
description: "Looks at threats to global forests, discussing the impact of human encroachment and the effects of climate change on trees, including altered weather and insect pests such as the mountain pine beetle. Reports on rates of deforestation and the significance of forests in storing or emitting carbon. Discusses deforestation in specific regions - Oceania, South America, Africa, North and Central America, Europe, and Asia."

Author: "Greer, Germaine,"
Title: "Kauri killer; The plant destroyer"
description: "Reports on the plant pathogen Phytophthora taxon Agathis (PTA) and its attack on the NZ kauri tree. Notes the discovery of PTA, 100% lethal and confined solely to kauri trees, in 2006, and its spread to various locations around the North Island. Describes the kauri. Looks at the spread of Phytophthora species, and research into fungal imbalances in regenerating forests and why oomycetes might turn pathogenic. Notes steps that might have to be taken to stop the spread of PTA. Gives a history for Phtophthora, describing what an oomycete is, the historical and economic costs of Phytophthora infestations (including European potato collapses), and looks at how Phytophthora cinnamomi (cinnamon fungus) has destroyed trees in NZ and Australia."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Farmers are doin' it for themselves"
description: "Looks at farmers who, following a stewardship ethic, are protecting or establishing areas of native trees and encouraging wildlife. Notes the treeless nature of the Canterbury plains at first European settlement, the introduction of exotics such as macrocarpa (monterey cypress) and pine with settlement, their more recent removal, and replanting with natives. Gives comments by botanist John Dawson on re-establishment of native bush by farmers or community growths, the natural cycle for regenerating forest, and the slow growth rates of NZ native trees. Notes the use of covenants on private land with the QEII National Trust to preserve special features of natural and cultural heritage and looks at the reasons for a shift towards conservationist tendencies in the newer generation of farmers."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Going native"
description: "Talks to Alana Scott of the South Waikato, discussing the recreation of natural biodiversity in a project on her family's farm near Tirau. Looks at how Scott put together student volunteers through the Students in Free Enterprise and replanted native vegetation around a natural peat lake as a trial project, and discusses financing and the desire of farmers for more restorative projects."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Recreating natural biodiversity in Waikato"
description: "Talks to Alana Scott of the South Waikato, discussing the recreation of natural biodiversity in a project on her family's farm near Tirau. Looks at how Scott put together student volunteers through the Students in Free Enterprise and replanted native vegetation around a natural peat lake as a trial project, and discusses financing and the desire of farmers for more restorative projects."

Author: "Falloon, Pip"
Title: "So glad to be here"
description: "Shares her story of having had emergency neurosurgery at Dunedin Hospital in Sep 2009 after suffering a brain aneurysm. Emphasises the importance of retaining a neurosurgery service in Dunedin."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Capturing Burns; For Laura, in drink; My squeeze"
description: "Reports on the annual poetry competition to commemorate the birth of Scottish poet Robert Burns. Talks to Fiona Farrell, who was one of the competition judges as well as the University of Otago Burns Fellow for 2011. Includes the poems 'For Laura, in drink' by Wellingtonian Sandra Jones and 'My squeeze' by Dunedin poet Lynne Hill, both of which were winning entries in the competition. Names the other winning entries."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Comments on four pieces of public art in Dunedin : 'Holding time' by Ernie Maluschnig, Owheo Building, Otago Polytechnic; 'Eleven bronze rods supporting albatross wingspan' by John Middleditch, University College building; 'Musa' by Peter Nicholls and 'PH revisited (Lucille)' by Neil Frazer, both at the University of Otago Central Library."

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Killer case"
description: "Discusses the 'West Memphis Three' American murder case, and the investigation funded by Sir Peter Jackson which led to the three convicted men (Damien Echols, Jason Baldwin, Jessie Misskelley) being freed. Notes that Jackson is premiering a new documentary about the case at the Sundance Film Festival. Looks at various films that have been made about the case, the different perspectives given, and the contested evidence that convicted the men."

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "The freeing of the West Memphis Three"
description: "Discusses the 'West Memphis Three' American murder case, and the investigation funded by Sir Peter Jackson which led to the three convicted men (Damien Echols, Jason Baldwin, Jessie Misskelley) being freed. Notes that Jackson is premiering a new documentary about the case at the Sundance Film Festival. Looks at various films that have been made about the case, the different perspectives given, and the contested evidence that convicted the men."

Author: "Carey, Peta"
Title: "Shedding new light"
description: "Looks at the work of the late NZ professor Kevin Sharpe and his wife, American Leslie Van Gelder, in exploring features of the cave paintings in France.  Describes their theories of flutings found in the Rouffignac cave system, Dordogne region, as being the result of play and finger painting by family units, including children. Backgrounds archaeologists Van Gelder and Sharpe, and gives Van Gelder's comments describing their research and conclusions, including the presence and importance of children, women as cave art painters, and linking signature flutings ('tectiforms') to individuals."

Author: "Carey, Peta"
Title: "Flutings inside Rouffignac cave shed new light"
description: "Looks at the work of the late NZ professor Kevin Sharpe and his wife, American Leslie Van Gelder, in exploring features of the cave paintings in France.  Describes their theories of flutings found in the Rouffignac cave system, Dordogne region, as being the result of play and finger painting by family units, including children. Backgrounds archaeologists Van Gelder and Sharpe, and gives Van Gelder's comments describing their research and conclusions, including the presence and importance of children, women as cave art painters, and linking signature flutings ('tectiforms') to individuals."

Author: "Somerset, Guy"
Title: "No static at all"
description: "Interviews art curator Justin Paton as he heads off to the French Riviera to work on a new book as the recipient of the 2012 Katherine Mansfield Menton Fellowship. Discusses the plans for the book, centered around the theme of 'home', and gives his comments on Christchurch, the role of the curator, and 'artspeak' and communicating with the public. Backgrounds the development of his interest in art."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Glowing report"
description: "Discusses the work of microbiologist Siouxsie Wiles (University of Auckland) in using bioluminescent bacteria to trace the impact of drugs in vivo. Recounts her efforts to reduce the use of and minimise the effect of animal testing, noting her developing a way to infect mice wthout injection and to use ham in testing instead of dead animals."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Feed your head"
description: "Looks at recent research suggesting that age-related declines in mental processing skills may start from as early as the forties. Discusses ways to stave off dementia, noting that risk factors include lifestyle factors such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol levels, diabetes and obesity. Looks at links between reduced cognitive decline and fish consumption, omega-3 fats, and B vitamin supplements. Advocates a heart-healthy diet as also reducing the risk of dementia and decline."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "What's in store"
description: "Discusses the explosion in the creation of data, and how companies such as Google, Amazon etc are meeting their need for digital storage. Looks at the use of cloud computing, solid-state drives, and possible future technologies such as IBM's 'racetrack memory'."

Author: "Birss, Neill"
Title: "One option as world gas boom begins"
description: "Looks at increasing interest in natural gas exploration and exploitation in NZ. Looks at the use of LPG in NZ, and discusses L&M Energy led by Australian businessman Geoffrey Loudon, their exploration rights and exploitation activity in NZ, the market opportunities to exploit liquified coal-seam gas (CSG), and their financial position."

Author: "De Lacy, Hugh"
Title: "Europe debt crisis hangs over NZ"
description: "Talks to Westpac chief economist Dominick Stephen giving his comments on a coming European recession, its impact on NZ banks and interest rates, the timing of any interest rate changes, demand from overseas for NZ exports, and the domestic construction sector. Talks to BNZ chief economist Tony Alexander giving his comments on the construction sector, interest rates, the effects of a European recession, and consumer and business confidence. Looks at export revenues and prospects, including record primary exports for 2011/2012, signs of weakness, problems with the US and European economies, and NZ's competitive advantage for primary product exports. Discusses trends in the Chinese economy."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Power of money put to test"
description: "Reports on how the piracy-accused founder of Megaupload.com, who is fighting extradition to the United States, was able to gain NZ residency despite having convictions."

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "36 years later, hunt for strangler goes on"
description: "36 years later, hunt for strangler goes on"

Author: "nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Kids' tea an alternative to caffeine, sports drinks"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of 'Bell for kids' banana flavoured tea."

Author: "Power, J F"
Title: "Your finest five minutes"
description: "Discusses planning and giving speeches for managers and business owners, laying out steps and principles to keep them short and effective."

Author: "Saunders, Peter Lionel,"
Title: "Keeping the market at bay"
description: "Notes the availability of many vineyards and wineries in the Bordeaux area of France and discusses the possibility of sales within the NZ wine industry.  Notes recent examples (Daniel Schuster vineyard, Muddy Water vineyard) and looks at trends affecting interest in the business."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Battlefield of the future"
description: "Reports on how the internet is changing the nature of conflict between nations with the growing use of the cyber realm in espionage. Looks back on the 2010 Stuxnet computer worm. Notes that some evidence suggests that it was an American-Israeli project. Talks about NZ's response to the threat of cyber attacks. Speaks to Otago University associate professor Dr Hank Wolfe, a specialist in cyber security, cyber forensics and cryptology, about the issue."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "A whale of a custody tale"
description: "Speaks to the whale scientist about her part in a court case seeking the release of five captive orcas from the United States marine park SeaWorld. Talks, briefly, about the behaviour of orca."

Author: "Hutching, Chris"
Title: "Steady flow of overseas investment deals; Charges focus on property deals"
description: "Looks at some recent property deals featuring overseas investors. Notes Swiss cement maker Holcim acquiring land near the Port of Timaru; a UK-based company investing in an airport and housing development on Waiheke Island; Australian liquid terminal operator Marstel Terminals acquiring land in the Wynyard Quarter, Auckland; sales of land and wineries to overseas wine investors; and the development by a US group of a health resort at Wyuna Preserve, Queenstown. Looks at fraud-related charges laid against five defendents involved with South Canterbury Finance (SCF) including Peter Symes, noting some unusual activities associated with the finance company's last days."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Tony Herlihy"
description: "Interviews the top reinsman (harness racing driver) and trainer about his life."

Title: "Bigger reforms of RMA"
description: "Looks at possible Phase Two reforms of sections 6 and 7 of the Act by the National government, discussing a push to unitary district plans, and changes to the RMA planning process."

Author: "Jewell, Stephen"
Title: "Rage against the machines"
description: "Speaks to the author about the sequel to his novel 'Death of a superhero'."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Young energy meets meditative maturity"
description: "Reviews the double exhibition at the University of Auckland's Gus Fisher Gallery, 'Hutton and cotton, the McGregor Museum Revisited' by Christine Hellyar and works by Reuben Paterson, including 'Bottled lightning'. Notes that the exhibition is on until 3 Mar 2012."

Author: "Rattue, Chris"
Title: "Dean hell-bent on Olympic reprise"
description: "Dean hell-bent on Olympic reprise"

Author: "Fletcher, Richard"
Title: "Declaratory judgements and their relevance"
description: "Looks at two cases in 2011 where the Act was used in court cases. Lays out the powers granted to courts by the Act, and looks at how it applied before the Court of Appeal and Supreme Court with regards an application from people leasing land from the Cornwall Park Trust Board, Auckland, and from cameraman Bradley Ambrose with regards a taped conversation between John Key and John Banks."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Shearer seems to have lead, but Cunliffe's no quitter"
description: "Shearer seems to have lead, but Cunliffe's no quitter"

Author: "Twentyman, Maryanne"
Title: "Cancer survivor has a lot of living left to do"
description: "Cancer survivor has a lot of living left to do"

Title: "Dropout finishes law degree 39 years on"
description: "Dropout finishes law degree 39 years on"

Title: "Injured man feels sorry for liquor thieves"
description: "Injured man feels sorry for liquor thieves"

Author: "Perrott, Alan"
Title: "Cheap and cheerful"
description: "Recounts a day spent at the Mercy Hospice Shop in Ponsonby. Speaks to the store's manager, Maria Baird. Talks about how charity shops have attempted to modernise as demand for their services grows."

Author: "Gardner, Chris"
Title: "Trailblazing Airtourer on public display"
description: "Trailblazing Airtourer on public display"

Title: "Carmen blazed a trail so bright lit up her world"

Title: "Like father, like son: Bracewell in family business; All in the family for New Zealand cricketing dynasty"

Title: "Lawson back on a roll after spate of major setbacks"
description: "Lawson back on a roll after spate of major setbacks"

Title: "Gudsell left high and dry with no ticket to ride"
description: "Gudsell left high and dry with no ticket to ride"

Author: "Robson, Toby"
Title: "New All Blacks coach plans to run the scrum"
description: "New All Blacks coach plans to run the scrum"

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Crims heading home"
description: "Notes Australian authorities will be deporting Australian based Kiwis who have serious criminal convictions back to NZ. Reports NZ and Australia are engaged in talks over better information sharing with regards the criminal history of individuals."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Fish bag sales"
description: "Recounts how buyers of women's handbags have been finding unpleasant odours emanating from them. Investigates the cause and possible solutions to the problem."

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "100% impure"
description: "Recounts anecdotal evidence of the increasing problem of rubbish being thrown into or ending up in the sea and spoiling the environment and endangering aquatic wildlife. Promotes a campaign to clean up beaches in and around Auckland with Herald on Sunday teaming up with Sustainable Coastlines."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Are we just making big asses of our Kiwi selves?"
description: "Outlines what Internet users are using the Internet for. Focuses on what they are selling online, from tattoo space on their body, unwanted engagement rings, GPS co-ordinates of good fishing spots, etc. Includes comments from those who are involved in selling these commodities on TradeMe and their reasons why."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Critics weigh in on fads"
description: "Comments on health aspects of some diets and whether or not they are a sustainable way to reduce body weight and whether they encourage healthy eating."

Author: "Fisher, David"
Title: "Kim Dotcommando : life's no game"
description: "Backgrounds the business activities and lifestyle of Kim Dotcom (Kimble Schmitz) and tries to explain his arrest by NZ Police at the advice of the FBI."

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Food, glorious food : but at what price"
description: "Investigates the price of food in NZ compared with some other places in the world."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Sea change"
description: "Describes the author's attempt to navigate Auckland Harbour by ferry."

Author: "Romanos, Joseph"
Title: "Retiring Marks an exceptional Kiwi professional"
description: "Retiring Marks an exceptional Kiwi professional"

Author: "Crayton-Brown, Kimberley"
Title: "'Big team' in effort to improve literacy"
description: "'Big team' in effort to improve literacy"

Author: "Edens, John"
Title: "QSM for advocate of child-focused learning"
description: "QSM for advocate of child-focused learning"

Author: "Crayton-Brown, Kimberley"
Title: "Rural nurses keep remote regions covered"
description: "Rural nurses keep remote regions covered"

Author: "Baker, Che"
Title: "'Proud' of honour for public sector work with children"
description: "'Proud' of honour for public sector work with children"

Title: "Not for profit, but very rewarding"
description: "Not for profit, but very rewarding"

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "The disruptive network"
description: "Examines the impact of the Internet on society.  Talks to author John Naughton about the struggle for control over the Internet as a disruptive technology, comparing digital disruptors such as Steve Jobs and Mark Zuckerberg to earlier figures such as film mogul Adolph Zukor. Looks at Kim Dotcom and Megaupload. Discusses the Internet as enabling surprising innovation, comparing this to the invention of the printing press by Gutenberg. Looks at digital utopians and dystopians, and at the US Stop Online Piracy Act and Protect Intellectual Property Act (SOPA and PIPA) as waging an unwinnable war. Describes the messages in Naughton's new book, and gives his comments on how the Internet might be affecting the actual brains of individuals. Notes changes bought on by moveable-type printing, invented by Gutenberg in 1455. Gives a timeline for the development of the Internet since the ARPANET was commission in 1969. Looks at some Kiwi entrepreneurs involved in developing apps for smartphones (Polar Bear Farm, Layton Duncan, Ponoko, David ten Have, Booktrack, Derek Handley). Looks at how Kiwis are using the net. Discusses resistance to SOPA and PIPA, and to the section 92A amendment to the NZ Copyright Act, looking at international trade agreements such as the Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement putting pressure on governments to crack down on piracy and file-sharing."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "The man in the middle"
description: "Interviews the new Labour Party leader, David Shearer . Discusses rexamination of Labour policy to restore its electoral credibility in 2014, as well as changes to party candidates and organisation. Notes a review to be performed by an outsider. Discusses the historical and current role of Labour's six affiliate unions, looking at Shearer's and Jim Anderton's views on changes to be made to the party."

Title: "Longer jail term for sex offender"
description: "Longer jail term for sex offender"

Author: "Bryant, Grant"
Title: "Family and friends grieve for popular Wanaka man"
description: "Family and friends grieve for popular Wanaka man"

Title: "Southland racing great Ridley dies"

description: "Talks to Helen May of the University of Otago College of Education, author of a new overview on a century of NZ junior-school education. Looks at the ready adoption of new ideas such as the ideas of John Dewey or the Montessori method by early infant mistresses and notes specific champions of play-based childhood education. Mentions changes due to the influence of the 'new right' since the 1980s. Discusses the revised 2007 curriculum Te Whaariki, giving May's comments on National Standards and the principles of early childhood education."

Notes the belief system of Warato'o they follow."

Title: "The heart-healthy way to avoid dementia"
description: "Looks at recent research suggesting that age-related declines in mental processing skills may start from as early as the forties. Discusses ways to stave off dementia, noting that risk factors include lifestyle factors such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol levels, diabetes and obesity. Looks at links between reduced cognitive decline and fish consumption, omega-3 fats, and B vitamin supplements. Advocates a heart-healthy diet as also reducing the risk of dementia and decline."

Discusses the plans for the book, centered around the theme of 'home', and gives his comments on Christchurch, the role of the curator, and 'artspeak' and communicating with the public. Seeks comment from Carnival Australia, part of the group that owns the 'Costa Concordia', about its policies for operating cruise ships in NZ. Talks to Port Otago maine services manager Captain Hugh Marshall about piloting cruise vessels in NZ. Touches on the strange behaviour of the 'Costa Concordia' captain, the incident database maintained by the International Marine Organisation and the worst civilian maritime disaster in NZ."

description: "Travels on board a foreign charter vessel (FCV) chartered by the Sealord Group to investigate the issues involved in the foreign charter fishing operations around NZ. Includes the make-up of the crews as compared to the flags the ships sail under, and the condition of some of the boats."

Title: "Who's who in the Dotcom crash; New-age pirates set sail for battle in cyberspace"
description: "Presents a tongue-in-cheek recap of the various people associated with Kim Dotcom both before and after his arrest as a shareholder of the Megaupload website which was allegedly robbing copyright holders of earnings. Talks to members of the NZ branch of the Pirate Party (set up to defend online freedom), a lawyer and various other users of downloading websites about their philosophies and attitudes towards illegally downloading music, television or films."

Title: "Bringing down powers that be"
description: "Investigates the crisis that is ripping apart the Christchurch City Council (CCC). Speaks to protest organiser Peter Lynch, the Reverend Mike Coleman, leader of the Wider Earthquake Communities' Action Network (WeCan), former developer Hugh Pavletich, and Christchurch Mayor Bob Parker about the issues that have led to a public protest outside the council offices and the demand for emergency mid-term local government elections in the city. Talks about the controversy around CCC chief executive Tony Marryatt's $68,000 pay rise."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Lessons for the whole family [part 2]"
description: "Explores the role of communication between parents and children, and between parents and school personnel. Talks to registered psychologist Dr Roseanna Bourke, academic group director of educational psychology at Victoria University of Wellington, about the importance of emphasising fun in learning, and celebrating all aspects of a child's learning. Seeks comment from Clyde School principal Doug White about the crucial relationship between parents and schools."

Title: "Coach's vision of commitment"
description: "Talks to the Auckland Blue's coach Pat Lam about his aims for the season and his key players."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Let the children play"
description: "Speaks to three Christchurch families about the changes in the behaviour of their children after the 22 Feb earthquake and the ongoing aftershocks, and to child and family psychologist Melanie Patterson about the Journey of Hope programme that is designed to create more resilient children. Provides tips for how to deal with mild anxiety in children."

Author: "Boock, Richard"
Title: "Let them grunt and let us roar"
description: "Looks at the issue of women tennis players grunting during games. Reflects on the game's tradition of playing in silence and looks at how crowd and player behaviour and dress have changed over the years, both in tennis and cricket."

Author: "Hughes, Alistair"
Title: "The crate escape"
description: "Reports on the progress made by the author and his wife on their plans to build an eco-home in the South Wairarapa while they live in a shipping container. Describes how the couple finally get to move into their new home."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Calligrapher"
description: "Talks to Jan Leonard about her calligraphy work."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Home"
description: "Talks to Gillian McGrath, retired school teacher and artist."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The detoxification mystification"
description: "Discusses the claims of detoxification treatments in alternative medicine, showing that these are pseudoscience. Looks at blogger Michael Edmonds and his campaign against these claims, including complaints to the Advertising Standards Authority."

Author: "Waugh, Richard"
Title: "Missing plane remains a mystery 50 years on"
description: "Retells the story of the missing de Havilland Dragonfly ZK-AFB which disappeared without trace during a routine southern South Island flight on February 12, 1962. Includes information about the searches and passengers."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "Where is the digital revolution taking us?"
description: "Examines the impact of the Internet on society.  Talks to author John Naughton about the struggle for control over the Internet as a disruptive technology, comparing digital disruptors such as Steve Jobs and Mark Zuckerberg to earlier figures such as film mogul Adolph Zukor. Looks at Kim Dotcom and Megaupload. Discusses the Internet as enabling surprising innovation, comparing this to the invention of the printing press by Gutenberg. Looks at digital utopians and dystopians, and at the US Stop Online Piracy Act and Protect Intellectual Property Act (SOPA and PIPA) as waging an unwinnable war. Describes the messages in Naughton's new book, and gives his comments on how the Internet might be affecting the actual brains of individuals. Notes changes bought on by moveable-type printing, invented by Gutenberg in 1455. Gives a timeline for the development of the Internet since the ARPANET was commission in 1969. Looks at some Kiwi entrepreneurs involved in developing apps for smartphones (Polar Bear Farm, Layton Duncan, Ponoko, David ten Have, Booktrack, Derek Handley). Looks at how Kiwis are using the net. Discusses resistance to SOPA and PIPA, and to the section 92A amendment to the NZ Copyright Act, looking at international trade agreements such as the Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement putting pressure on governments to crack down on piracy and file-sharing."

Author: "Priestley, Rebecca,"
Title: "How safe are airport body scanners?"
description: "Discusses radiation from airport body scanners, such as those used by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) in the USA. Notes the difference between millimetre wave scanners (non-ionising) and x-ray backscatter scanning units. Looks at the low level of ionising radiation from the latter as compared to other sources, but noting concerns over this energy being targeted at the skin alone."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "To build a country"
description: "Talks to four Kiwis about their experiences helping forge the world's youngest nation - South Sudan. Includes Sister Margaret Scott training teachers for the government schools, Major Chris Fitzwater limiting the violence in the troubled state of Jongeli, Rebecca Hamilton as special correspondent on Sudan for the Washington Post, and Glenys Checchi who works as a nurse for the Red Cross."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "The researched child in early education"
description: "Talks to Helen May of the University of Otago College of Education, author of a new overview on a century of NZ junior-school education. Looks at the ready adoption of new ideas such as the ideas of John Dewey or the Montessori method by early infant mistresses and notes specific champions of play-based childhood education. Mentions changes due to the influence of the 'new right' since the 1980s. Discusses the revised 2007 curriculum Te Whaariki, giving May's comments on National Standards and the principles of early childhood education."

Author: "Kirk, Stacey"
Title: "Order of St John award 'humbling'"
description: "Order of St John award 'humbling'"

Author: "Oram, Rod"
Title: "Anger in a city dispossessed"
description: "Outlines some of the issues that are causing public outrage in the people of Christchurch."

Title: "Job leads to a number of projects"
description: "Job leads to a number of projects"

Author: "Spencer, Ruth"
Title: "The state of play; What's coming in 2012"
description: "Investigates the different ways theatres around NZ are looking to diversify both audience and performance style. Includes The Shed (the Court's brand new Christchurch premises), the Auckland Theatre Company, Wellington's Downstage and BATS. Highlights the mix of strong NZ theatre productions, old favourites reinvigorated and new additions that are coming in 2012."

Title: "'You're in the world of reality'"
description: "Interviews Stephen Bain, the director of the 'New Performance Festival' running for the first time in Auckland. Talks about breaking down barriers between artists and audiences, the balance between risk and getting bums on seats, and the purpose of performance as opposed to film."

Author: "Groser, Tim,"
Title: "Davos outgrows its European roots"
description: "The Minister of Trade reports on his attendance at the World Economic Forum, Davos, Switzerland, Jan 2012. Presents his impressions of the forum and its implications and lessons for NZ."

Title: "All Black helped to hold Ranfurly Shield"
description: "All Black helped to hold Ranfurly Shield"

Title: "Selectors dealt bitter blow to Jowett"
description: "Selectors dealt bitter blow to Jowett"

description: "Architect served community in many ways"

Author: "Miller, Tim"
Title: "50 years in 'a good wee place to live'"
description: "50 years in 'a good wee place to live'"

Author: "Reid, Nicolas"
Title: "Happy birthday, Charles Dickens"
description: "Looks at why the author is still worth celebrating 200 years on."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Still too little time to improve golf"
description: "Still too little time to improve golf"

Author: "Evans, Patrick"
Title: "'Bugger this nib - I haven't another'"
description: "'Bugger this nib - I haven't another'"

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "The man beneath the hat"
description: "Talks to Wilson Dixon, the alter ego of Kiwi comic Jesse Griffin, about his career and his documentary 'Wilson Dixon: The New Zealand Tour'. Highlights what is known about Jesse Griffin."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Respected as inspirational athletics coach"
description: "Respected as inspirational athletics coach"

Author: "Wynn, Kirsty"
Title: "Dad's second tragedy as young son loses battle"
description: "Dad's second tragedy as young son loses battle"

Title: "Formidable knowledge of education systems"
description: "Formidable knowledge of education systems"

Author: "Mead, Kate"
Title: "Try, try and try again"
description: "Talks to Olympic cyclist Alison Shanks about how competing in the Sanitarium Weet-Bix Kids TRYathlon as a child was the first step on her athletic career. Gives five TRYathlon training tips for kids."

Author: "Rudd, Allison"
Title: "King's High Knight a top advisor"
description: "King's High Knight a top advisor"

Author: "Wallace, Neal"
Title: "Advocate for farming , conservation"
description: "Advocate for farming , conservation"

Author: "Marquet, Sarah"
Title: "Joyful meeting ends family's 30-year search"
description: "Joyful meeting ends family's 30-year search"

Author: "Meikle, Hayden"
Title: "No 1 : Danyon Loader wins two olympic swimming gold medals (1996)"
description: "No 1 : Danyon Loader wins two olympic swimming gold medals (1996)"

Author: "Bills, Peter"
Title: "Effervescent Kiwi soloist grabs life by its Violin strings"
description: "Effervescent Kiwi soloist grabs life by its Violin strings"

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Land grab : all white by us?"
description: "Investigates the perceived double standards of NZers around the sale of land to overseas investors. Points to xenophobic fears about the sale of land to Asian investors. Visits Gulf Harbour, located on the end of the Whangaparaoa Peninsula, to talk to locals about an application by Asian investors to buy 32ha of the housing development. Talks about the recent public outcry surrounding the German-born internet mogul Kim Dotcom, who was granted NZ residency but was deemed to be of insufficient character to buy sensitive land in NZ, the purchase of the Crafar farms by the Shanghai-based Pengxin group, and the sale of Wairarapa farmland to Hollywood film director James Cameron. Lists the amount of land sold to foreign investors between 2007 and 2011. Notes that British and Australian investors are by far the biggest purchasers."

Author: "Carroll, Joanne"
Title: "Peters' new kid plunges into fray"
description: "Speaks to NZ First's new Member of Parliament (MP) about her role in the party and the support of her family."

Author: "Grant, Nick"
Title: "Let's see some dancing"
description: "Television programme preview/review."

Author: "Theunissen, Matthew"
Title: "I hope my son jumped from balloon"
description: "I hope my son jumped from balloon"

description: "Right-to-die scientist remains unrepentant"

Author: "Kerr, Florence"
Title: "Discovery offers hope in cold case"
description: "Discovery offers hope in cold case"

Author: "Anderson, Charles"
Title: "Overstayers fear for their Kiwi kids"
description: "Overstayers fear for their Kiwi kids"

Author: "Robinson, Michelle"
Title: "Catching malaria comes with the job"
description: "Catching malaria comes with the job"

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Her own tune"
description: "Speaks to the composer about her new opera 'Hohepa', which tells the true story of Hohepa Te Umuroa, and her involvement with Witi Ihimaera and his controversial novel 'The Trowenna Sea', which examined the same subject. Reflects on her career."

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Glenn Greenwald interview"
description: "Talks to American political blogger Glenn Greenwald, discussing the inequal application of justice in the USA. Backgrounds Greenwald and his role as a critic of US authoritarianism. Looks at moves by the National Government to a more punitive justice system, giving Greenwald's warnings about these mirroring American issues."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "... but there's a catch"
description: "Focuses on Forest and Bird's 2012-2013 'Best fish guide', which ranks NZ's 130 commercially fished species according to their ecological sustainability. Speaks to television fishing host Graeme Sinclair, Seafood Industry Council chief executive Peter Bodeker, chef Martin Bosley, and Forest and Bird's marine conservation advocate Katrina Subedar about the need for the guide."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "A clean bill of wealth"
description: "Focuses on the potential value of the cleantech sector for the NZ economy. Looks at the government's response to the cleantech revolution. Highlights the concern that NZ risks further damaging its clean-green image if it does not move quickly to exploit its cleantech advantages. Speaks to a number of people associated with the sector, including Simon Boxer, Greenpeace NZ's cleantech expert, Duncan Stewart, executive officer of the business lobby group Pure Advantage, and to cleantech sceptic Sir Paul Callaghan about the potential of the sector in NZ. Spotlights the success of Lanzatech, which conceived a way of turning the waste gas emerging from factories into useable fuel. Notes the failure of other cleantech companies."

Author: "Dudding, Adam"
Title: "Old school"
description: "Speaks to the Auckland Grammar headmaster about his career, the prestigious state school for boys, and his misgivings about NCEA."

Author: "Neale, Imogen"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Explains what the stud master's role involves. Talks about working at Woodlands, a standardbred horse stud in Clevedon."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "The rhythm method"
description: "Ponders the link between music and sex. Speaks to Dimmer frontman Shayne Carter about what makes truly sexy songs, University of New South Wales evolution biologist Rob Brooks about the notion of music as a sexual display, and University of Otago senior music lecturer Robert Burns, about the physiology of songs that make people feel confident, attractive and sexy. Nominates the sexiest songs of all time."

Title: "'Monster' killer's sentence little comfort for victim's father"
description: "'Monster' killer's sentence little comfort for victim's father"

Author: "Morton, Jamie"
Title: "'An easy-going man with a kind heart'"
description: "'An easy-going man with a kind heart'"

Title: "A small man with a huge personality"

Title: "Provocative artist who made his mark"
description: "Provocative artist who made his mark"
