Title: "Blanket Man 'lived life his way'; Homeless man divided the capital with his behaviour"
description: "Blanket Man 'lived life his way'; Homeless man divided the capital with his behaviour"

Author: "Richardson, Daniel"
Title: "Patient Brownlie looks to have makings of solid test player"
description: "Patient Brownlie looks to have makings of solid test player"

Author: "Hannan, Hayley"
Title: "Tears for father who lived - and died - for his children"
description: "Tears for father who lived - and died - for his children"

Title: "Balloon pilot family man who loved life"
description: "Balloon pilot family man who loved life"

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Retiree pots to holes-in-one in hour"
description: "Retiree pots to holes-in-one in hour"

Author: "Nichols, Lane"
Title: "Cinema under siege"
description: "Uncovers the challenges being faced at cinemas and the DVD rental businesses amid the rise in digital movie downloading and illegal piracy. Shows the decline in cinema attendance and renting of DVDs."

Author: "Van den Bergh, Roeland"
Title: "Fyfe can write his own ticket"
description: "Looks back at the achievements and profile of Air New Zealand chief executive Rob Fyfe as he announces his departure from the company after 7 years. Notes the current and financial outlook for the airline."

Author: "Borrowdale, James"
Title: "Out in the cold"
description: "Visits Scott Base in Antarctica and speaks to a number of people with different jobs there. Reveals interesting similarities in the personalities of all the workers."

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Challenge of the unknown"
description: "Talks to a number of up-and-coming NZ scientists about their work - Natalie Plank, a nanoscientist, Christopher Hann, a mathematician, Rose Turnbull, a geologist, Bridget Stocker, a chemist, and Andrew Clarkson, a stroke researcher."

Author: "Cornwell, Jane"
Title: "Donation Manu'asi interview"
description: "Portrays the Solomon Islands collective, currently touring major music festivals of the world. Looks at their bamboo pan-pipe music and goals of supporting their Are'are people and the Solomons and bringing attention to issues affecting them, and how the Strummerville charity (founded by Clash frontman Joe Strummer) bought them to world attention. Notes the belief system of Warato'o they follow."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "The key to ending colic"
description: "Looks at the causes of colic in newborn babies, discussing research on the effects of foods in the mother's diet. Examines molecules known as FODMAPs (Fermentable Oligosaccharides, Disaccharides, Monosaccharides and Polyols) in the diet and at a pilot study on the effects of a low-FODMAP diet for breastfeeding mothers."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "Cultivating success by dint of sheer effort"
description: "Talks to the owner of Joe's Vegie Stall, south of Oamaru, about some of his experiences of running his family business for nearly 40 years. Touches on his arrival in NZ from China as a four-year-old, the hardships and discrimination faced by Chinese workers in NZ, and the dedication of the family to their customers."

Author: "Campbell, Bill"
Title: "Switch from music to church pivotal decision"
description: "Pays tribute to the late Welsh-born Anglican priest who became the first woman in the world to be ordained as a priest by a woman bishop, Penny Jamieson."

Author: "Ibbotson, Lucy"
Title: "'Lively and curious spirit' a life force in Hawea"
description: "Pays tribute to the late London-born 'pioneering high-country farmer, political activist, hostess extraordinaire, voracious reader, animal lover, author and endless worrier'."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Suckers for punishment; A footnote"
description: "Focuses on the physical and other demands on athletes participating in the NZ Masters Games, as well as what motivates people including himself to take part. Talks to Graeme Harvey of the Otago Sports Injury Clinic and physiotherapist Graeme Moginie of Back in Motion about injuries to older athletes, and how to avoid them. Speaks to Ken Hodge of the University of Otago School of Physical Education about his research into what motivates Masters Games athletes. Informs that the 2012 NZ Masters Games run from 4-12 Feb 2012, Dunedin. Touches on injury claims to ACC."

Author: "Masters, Catherine"
Title: "Advocating for orca"
description: "Speaks to the whale scientist about her part in a court case seeking the release of five captive orcas from the United States marine park SeaWorld. Talks, briefly, about the behaviour of orca."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Getting out of your depth"
description: "Focuses on the physiological and psychological challenges of open-water swimming. Talks to Wanaka swim coach Fi Hezinger about learning to acclimatise to the cold and stay calm. Cites US research into deaths at US triathlon events."

Author: "Cook, Marjorie"
Title: "Good material but poor delivery; Making wearable art in front of telly"
description: "Good material but poor delivery; Making wearable art in front of telly"

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "Going with the buzz"
description: "Talks to the lead guitarist about his busy life as frontman for AHoriBuzz and as half of Cairo Knife Fight with drummer-singer Nick Gaffaney. Informs that AHoriBuzz is performing at the Rippon Festival, Wanaka, 4 Feb 2012 and Cairo Knife Fight is playing at the University of Otago Orientation, Forsyth Barr Stadium, Dunedin, 24 Feb 2012. Touches on the challenges of having bipolar disorder."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Eating without the animals; Without the animals"
description: "Talks to the chef about her decision to become vegan and some of the benefits of a vegan diet. Informs that she and her husband run 'The Joyful Vegan' caravan at the Otago Farmers Market. Provides facts about veganism. Includes recipes for The Joyful Vegan's coriander cream and gluten-free brownies."

Author: "Sutton, Jessica"
Title: "Doctor lived life with a passion"
description: "Doctor lived life with a passion"

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Year of good Fortune"
description: "Talks to Lara MacGregor, artistic director of the theatre, about its programme for 2012. Comments on the management and financial challenges of the past year."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'The Surreal, 2012', various artists, Milford Galleries Dunedin.  Reviews 'The Cure for capitalism' by Mike Armstrong, Monumental Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews '867 hours underground' by Scott Flanagan, Blue Oyster Gallery, Dunedin, until 3 Mar 2012."

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "Food flies when diner angers chef"
description: "Food flies when diner angers chef"

description: "'Stowaway' on yacht for ceremony"

Title: "Singapore fugitive has skipped NZ, says father"
description: "Singapore fugitive has skipped NZ, says father"

Author: "McCarthy, David"
Title: "Avid harness horseman's last drive"
description: "Avid harness horseman's last drive"

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Soldier remained a private man all his life"
description: "Soldier remained a private man all his life"

Author: "Powley, Kathryn"
Title: "Natural born killjoys; Postcode lottery of childbirth"
description: "Investigates the social pressure placed on new parents to conform to all things natural, including 'natural' childbirth and breastfeeding. Speaks to a number of new parents about their experiences. Talks, briefly, about the use of painkillers during childbirth at hospitals in the Auckland region."

Author: "Mann, Charley"
Title: "Family vow to make waterways safe : no signs to warn of death trap, says dad; Change of plans ends in tragedy for young woman"
description: "Family vow to make waterways safe : no signs to warn of death trap, says dad; Change of plans ends in tragedy for young woman"

Title: "Machete attacker shows 'no remorse'"
description: "Machete attacker shows 'no remorse'"

Author: "Johns, Geraldine"
Title: "The case against Robin Bain"
description: "Reports on the murder allegations against Robin Bain in the new book 'Trial by ambush : the prosecutions of David Bain'."

Author: "Veltkamp-Smith, Pat"
Title: "Determined advocate for mental health issues"
description: "Determined advocate for mental health issues"

Author: "Edmunds, Susan"
Title: "Retirement : a big burden on economic horizon"
description: "Explores the impact of the huge increase in life expectancy on the retirement age of 65. Talks to two men in their 60s about their experiences.  Speaks to Martin Connolly, Professor of Geriatric Medicine at the University of Auckland, about the gains in life expectancy, and Retirement Commissioner Diana Crossan about the growing burden of superannuation for the Government. Highlights the Treasury recommendation of raising the pension age to cope with the forecast growth in NZ Super payments. Provides a composite of two fictional 65-year-old men, one in 1962 and the other in 2012, to demonstrate how 65 can no longer be viewed as 'old'."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Healthy pregnancy diet"
description: "Advises eating healthily when pregnant or when wanting to conceive. Notes the association of obesity with stillbirth. Introduces a study on men's dietary habits and fertility."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Laughing for health"
description: "Explores the health benefits of laughing, and its use in conversation and as a social lubricant. Describes a laughing epidemic and notes research on humour."

Author: "Preston, Nikki"
Title: "Tragedy ends the dreams for Gremz"
description: "Tragedy ends the dreams for Gremz"

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Emily's family finding summer hard without her"
description: "Emily's family finding summer hard without her"

Author: "Bills, Peter"
Title: "Dame with real streak of altruism"
description: "Dame with real streak of altruism"

Author: "Fletcher, Hamish"
Title: "Cashed-up Glenn has no plans to reture"
description: "Cashed-up Glenn has no plans to reture"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Father determined to keep killer inside"
description: "Father determined to keep killer inside"

Author: "Lundy, Sharon"
Title: "Lost keys led to death - police"
description: "Lost keys led to death - police"

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Bridging Auckland's wealth gap"
description: "Looks at what can be done to tackle the increase in inequality in the city. Explains, briefly, the driving forces behind the growing rich-poor divide. Spotlights the experiences of one struggling family and one comfortably-off family."

Author: "Davison, Isaac"
Title: "Forecaster with sunny disposition calls it quits"
description: "Forecaster with sunny disposition calls it quits"

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "A good way to introduce tofu to your children"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Bean Supreme 'Marinated tofu'."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Author (detailed): "Jarrod Booker, Anna Leask and Vaimoana Tapaleao"
Title: "Life without mother; Survivors' tales of hope and despair"
description: "Revisits 21 people who lived through the earthquake. Talks about their experiences and how they have come to terms with their losses nearly one year on. Speaks to Srecko "Alec" Cvetanov, Cindy Gibb, Betty McGrail, Mark Maynard, Bonnie Singh, Doreen Tomlin, Emily Cooper, Chris Greenslade, Simon Nicol, Michael Willetts, Aaron Frazer, Raemon Greenwood, Summer Olliver, Anne Malcolm, Karen Bishop, Tony McCormick, Graham Richardson, Amy Cooney, Maurice Gardiner, Jayden Andrews-Howland and Brent Cairns."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Shona Laing"
description: "Interviews the singer about her life. Talks about her younger, angry self."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Accidental effects tempered with realism"
description: "Reviews 'New year new work' by various artists at the Gow Langsford Gallery (to 18 Feb) and two new temporary exhibitions at the Pah Homestead, 'Trick i-ey'e' by Richard Linton (to 15 Mar) and 'Retrospect', a contemporary jewellery show curated by Jo Mears (to 15 Apr)."

Author: "Gray, Jamie"
Author (detailed): "Jamie Gray, Liam Dann and Fran O'Sullivan"
Title: "Life of a visionary; Infratil giant came from small beginnings; Thinker ready for challenge of change; Man who lit up room great loss"
description: "Looks back on the career of the founder of infrastructure investment company Infratil. Talks about the success of the company. Pays tribute to the businessman and philanthropist."

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Rebuild starts early for retailers"
description: "Looks at how some earthquake-hit retailers have coped after the earthquake. Speaks to Dee Dickison of Toi Toi and Colin Johnson of Johnson's Grocery about their move to Re:Start Mall in the central city. Highlights the booming hospitality industry in the suburbs."

Author: "McFadden, Suzanne"
Title: "Tressed to impress"
description: "Investigates why hairdressing is recession-proof. Speaks to a number of salon owners, including Servilles founder Paul Serville, and Hue founder Jenny Aitken, about the impact of the recession on their businesses."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "A Dickens treasury; A modern sort of Victorian; Dickens : a modern sort of Victorian"
description: "Focuses on celebrations for the 200th anniversary of the birth of 19th century UK author Charles Dickens. Informs that Dunedin has the 'largest and best Charles Dickens collection held by a public institution in the southern hemisphere'. Talks to Anthony Tedeschi, rare books librarian at the Dunedin Public Library, about the Dickens collection established by A. H. Reed, and to Lynda Cullen, co-curator with Anthony Tedeschi of the 'Haunts of Dickens' exhibition of paintings at the Dunedin Public Art Gallery, 4 Feb-May 2012. Lists other events, including the 'Dickens England' exhibition, University of Otago Central Library, Sep 2012. Talks to University of Otago associate professor Wendy Parkins about the enduring appeal of Dickens, and the resurgence in his popularity after falling out of favour in the early 20th century."

Author: "Jopp, Julie"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Summer hits', various artists, Wanaka Fine Art Gallery.  Reviews 'Artist in the Terminal', a selection of works by Fiona Stirling, Dunedin International Airport, until 28 Feb 2012.  Reviews 'Artyfacts' by Burns Pollock, the Forrester Gallery, Oamaru."

Author: "Wichtel, Diana"
Title: "Latta day saint"
description: "Talks to TV psychologist Nigel Latta about his upcoming new series."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "Pay dirt"
description: "Highlights the top salaries of some chief executives and directors and suggests they are excessive and greedy. Mentions recent protests against corporate pay such as the $68,000 pay rise awarded to city council chief executive in Christchurch. Discusses the unfair distribution of wealth. Spotlights pay rates in various occupations and how they have increased in recent years. Questions the worth of expensive CEOs."

Author: "Hall, David"
Title: "Manner of speaking"
description: "Debates the right to freedom of speech with the right to freedom from harm. Defines the meaning of freedom from harm - taken from the Human Rights Act. Considers the USA First Amendment. Revisits media controversies that have tested free speech such as Paul Henry's comments about Indians, and Michael Law's swipes at journalists."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Home stretch; Way to go"
description: "Investigates the factors influencing the price of houses and the price of land. Looks at the development of prefabricated housing using computer technology a system used in many overseas countries in order to build quality dwellings at a reasonable cost. Includes how Rod Gibson developed the idea of Habode, a fixed price prefabricated house designed in NZ."

Author: "Carville, Olivia"
Title: "Plucky mother intent on recovery"
description: "Speaks to the earthquake survivor about her recovery from multiple injuries caused by being crushed beneath the rubble of the City Mall."

Author: "Rae, Fiona,"
Title: "Interview : Jay Ryan"
description: "Interviews actor Jay Ryan who talks about his busy last 12 months. Reveals the TV series he is currently involved in and his part in Terra Nova."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Balancing act"
description: "Surveys the statistics associated with child abuse and notes the release of the Green Paper concerning child abuse which is aimed at evaluating the effectiveness of current support programmes. Discusses the detail of possible changes to government policy regarding looking after children and keeping them safe and secure. Includes a discussion of information sharing between agencies about families/children that come to their attention."

Author: "Morris, Paula"
Title: "The Martin papers"
description: "Discusses the writing and of Martin Amis: the biography with the author Richard Bradford. Reveals how Bradford was originally commissioned to write the book but later the work became unauthorised."

Author: "Black, Joanne"
Title: "Changing our approach to child abuse"
description: "Surveys the statistics associated with child abuse and notes the release of the Green Paper concerning child abuse which is aimed at evaluating the effectiveness of current support programmes. Discusses the detail of possible changes to government policy regarding looking after children and keeping them safe and secure. Includes a discussion of information sharing between agencies about families/children that come to their attention."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Shake-up heading in EQC's direction; Quakes blow benchmark"
description: "Speaks to Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee and EQC (Earthquake Commission) chief executive Ian Simpson about how an upcoming review of the scheme will affect the insurance cover of householders. Talks to Ian Simpson about why the Canterbury earthquakes have not changed the commission's view of its worse-case scenario for Wellington in relation to how much money it will need in reserves."

Author: "Carville, Olivia"
Title: "Quake survivor shows the miracle of the body"
description: "Speaks to the earthquake survivor about her recovery from multiple injuries caused by being crushed beneath the rubble of the City Mall."

Author: "Keith, Hamish,"
Title: "Cultural curmudgeon"
description: "Comments on the seemingly ruthless demolition decisions of local heritage villas in Auckland by its council."

Author: "Duff, Michelle"
Title: "Lloyd Morrison 1957-2012; Leader of the pack; A 'marvellous friend' in a time of need; Key recalls a patriot who always spoke his mind; Morrison's great sense of fun drew people to him; Latest types of treatment tried in the US"
description: "Presents a tribute to the Palmerston North-born businessman and philanthropist who died of acute myeloid leukaemia. Traces his many and varied achievements in the social, cultural and business arenas, and notes his passion for NZ and its national identity. Cites comments from his brother Rob Morrison, business colleagues, Deputy Prime Minister Bill English and Wellington Phoenix coach Ricki Herbert. Speaks to Perise Filiga, whose son Kurt Filiga died of the same form of cancer, about the support that Lloyd Morrison provided in helping him to make the award-winning documentary 'Kurt E : in my blood'. Cites remarks from Prime Minister John Key. Describes his toughness and his reputation as a 'Renaissance man', and overviews his career. Tells of his treatment and last days as a patient at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Centre in Seattle, Washington."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Under pressure"
description: "Talks to some experts about the guidelines for assessing blood pressure. Explains how the guidelines, in relation to cardiovascular risk, involve a number of factors and so can vary from individual to individual."

Author: "Morgan, Gareth"
Title: "Antarctica's future"
description: "Highlights the issues facing the South Pole with the advent of increasing 'geopolitical, climatic and commercial pressures' facing the region in general and in particular its wildlife. Indicates Antarctica NZ, National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research (NIWA), Department of Conservation and other agencies involvement. Summaries the issues as the consequences of decreasing biodiversity, the impact of climate change and the race for resources. Describes the activities that are presently engaged in that will affect Antarctica's future."

Author: "Morgan, Gareth"
Title: "Gareth Morgan : the challenge of Antarctica"
description: "Highlights the issues facing the South Pole with the advent of increasing 'geopolitical, climatic and commercial pressures' facing the region in general and in particular its wildlife. Indicates Antarctica NZ, National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research (NIWA), Department of Conservation and other agencies involvement. Summaries the issues as the consequences of decreasing biodiversity, the impact of climate change and the race for resources. Describes the activities that are presently engaged in that will affect Antarctica's future."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Read the label, if you can"
description: "Calls for nutritional information to be available at fast food outlets on the menu boards or in brochures on the counter so that customers can make healthy choices before they purchase."

Author: "Levy, Danya"
Title: "Will bill make our food safer or be another form of control?"
description: "Focuses on the Food Bill, in genesis for nearly a decade and now before the Primary Production Select Committee. Reports that the Bill has attracted 40,000 people to join an online campaign opposing it. Seeks response from Food Safety Minister Kate Wilkinson about some of its more controversial provisions regarding farmers' markets, home production and other aspects of small-scale production. Cites views of NZ First, former Green Party MP Sue Kedgley, the Labour Party and Organic New Zealand editor Philippa Jamieson.  Talks to freelance journalist and organic farmer Guy Ralls about fears about the reach of the Codex Alimentarius global food standards into NZ standards. Lists facts about the Bill regarding who it applies to and instances where it doesn't apply."

Author: "Sargent, Ewan"
Title: "The moment our city fell apart"
description: "Recalls the moment the earthquake struck. Provides recollections of what people felt and saw when the earthquake struck, as recorded in newspapers and online."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Rippling aftershocks; Evaluating the EQC one year on; Wellington quake would spark 150,000 claims"
description: "Speaks to Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee and EQC (Earthquake Commission) chief executive Ian Simpson about how an upcoming review of the scheme will affect the insurance cover of householders. Talks to Ian Simpson about why the Canterbury earthquakes have not changed the commission's view of its worse-case scenario for Wellington in relation to how much money it will need in reserves."

Author: "Easton, B. H."
Title: "Reality check"
description: "Debates what the future may hold for the South Island and the North Island emphasising that viable industrial growth depends on the clustering together of industries."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Hope for red-zone gardens"
description: "Speaks to the writer and garden guide about her idea to preserve the residential gardens near the Avon River as part of a historical trail. Highlights the eight sites on the 'Lower Avon Heritage Recovery Trail'."

Title: "High-flying businessman was a cheerleader for his country"
description: "Eulogises the Palmerston North-born businessman who founded Wellington investment company Infratil. Traces his achievements in the business sector and comments on his contribution as a 'cheerleader for New Zealand enterprise, culture and national identity'."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Love's lexicon richly loaded"
description: "Investigates the language of love around the world. Talks about the social construction of emotions."

Author: "Daly, Michael"
Title: "The most dominant city"
description: "Reports on the growing dominance of the city and the top half of the North Island. Notes the recent nominal arrival of the city's 1.5 millionth resident. Highlights concerns about the risks posed by the size of the city compared with the population of the rest of the country. Talks about the Government's role in the city's fast growth."

Author: "Biss, Roderick"
Title: "The Everest of chamber music"
description: "Previews the coming tour of NZ  by the New Zealand String Quartet to celebrate their 25th anniversary by playing all of Beethoven's string quartets."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Last bow for champion of NZ Opera troupe"
description: "Pays tribute to the baritone singer and former Dean of Music at the University of Adelaide."

Author: "Gibson, Eloise"
Title: "Made in NZ to win Chinese hearts; NZ overlooks China's revival"
description: "Investigates the increasing popularity of NZ-made products with consumers in China. Talks to BNZ chief economist Tony Alexander about the value of China and Hong Kong as an export destination for premium NZ products, noting that non-bulk primary producers are not yet tapping into this potential market. Cites his remarks to the Asian Financial Forum. Seeks comment from NZ Hong Kong trade commissioner Sharon-May McCrostie and trade consultant Arran Boote about Hong Kong as a gateway to mainland China. Speaks to David Yu, the Taiwanese NZ founder of two gaming store chains, about the changes to Chinese company registration rules that now impose stricter requirements. Talks to Pitango Soups export manager Ian Pascoe about its experiences and plans to tap new Chinese markets. Lists facts about NZ's trade with China."

Author: "Hay, Natasha"
Title: "Beyond the fringe"
description: "Talks to Stephen Bain about performance art and the New Performance Festival."

Title: "'Real Kiwi bloke' took opera to the provinces"
description: "Pays tribute to the baritone singer and former Dean of Music at the University of Adelaide."

Author: "Hay, Natasha"
Title: "New Performance Festival at the Edge"
description: "Talks to Stephen Bain about performance art and the New Performance Festival."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "Remember the future"
description: "Explains and discusses the theory of how memory works. Talks to Donna Rose Addis, who heads the Memory Lab in the University of Auckland's psychology department about the function of the hippocampus in memory."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The memory future roadmap"
description: "Explains and discusses the theory of how memory works. Talks to Donna Rose Addis, who heads the Memory Lab in the University of Auckland's psychology department about the function of the hippocampus in memory."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Jovial van driver who had a thirst for knowledge and a love of opera"
description: "Pays tribute to the Taihape-born singing truck and van driver for Mainfreight Chemcouriers who met the Spanish tenor Jose Carreras in 2003. Comments on his passion for opera, his family life and his reputation as a 'consummate people person'."

Author: "Gibson, Eloise"
Title: "Made in NZ to win Chinese hearts; NZ overlooks China's revival"
description: "Investigates the increasingly popularity of NZ-made products with consumers in China. Talks to BNZ chief economist Tony Alexander about the value of China and Hong Kong as an export destination for premium NZ products, noting that non-bulk primary producers are not yet tapping into this potential market. Cites his remarks to the Asian Financial Forum. Seeks comment from NZ Hong Kong trade commissioner Sharon-May McCrostie and trade consultant Arran Boote about Hong Kong as a gateway to mainland China. Speaks to David Yu, the Taiwanese NZ founder of two gaming store chains, about the changes to Chinese company registration rules that now impose stricter requirements. Talks to Pitango Soups export manager Ian Pascoe about its experiences and plans to tap new Chinese markets. Lists facts about NZ's trade with China."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Behind the Fringe"
description: "Talks to the Hawke's Bay-raised new producer of the NZ Fringe Festival.  Talks about her background and experience, and comments on her status as a relatively new entrant to the Wellington arts and culture scene."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "One box to beat them all"
description: "Describes his solution to the problem of being able to view the Internet on a second generation television and concludes at the moment the answer is Boxee that acts as an Internet gateway and media server in one."

Author: "Griffin, Peter"
Title: "Boxee brings the web"
description: "Describes his solution to the problem of being able to view the Internet on a second generation television and concludes at the moment the answer is Boxee that acts as an Internet gateway and media server in one."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Beauty and the bloke; Acting ambitions prompt operation"
description: "Reports on the increasing number of NZ men seeking plastic surgery and their reluctance to talk publicly about it. Speaks to a number of plastic surgeons, including Chris McEwan, the Ministry of Health's elective prioritisation clinical adviser, about the increase in male cosmetic surgery patients and their motivation. Spotlights the cosmetic surgery experience of 44-year-old Australian James Corcoran."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Going hard  for gold"
description: "Speaks to four emerging young professional sportspeople : the professional mountainbiker, the laser radial Olympic sailor, the reserve player for English Premier League team Blackburn Rovers and the Silver Ferns netball player."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Beauty and the bloke; Acting ambitions prompt trip to operating theatre; Surgery fixes 'the turkey thing under the neck'"
description: "Reports on the increasing number of NZ men seeking plastic surgery and their reluctance to talk publicly about it. Speaks to a number of plastic surgeons, including Chris McEwan, the Ministry of Health's elective prioritisation clinical adviser, about the increase in male cosmetic surgery patients and their motivation. Spotlights the cosmetic surgery experience of 44-year-old Australian James Corcoran."

Author: "Du Fresne, Karl"
Title: "Illustrious career; Salient who's who"
description: "Anticipates the upcoming reunion of contributors to and editors of the Victoria University student newspaper 'Salient'. Traces the history of the publication and meets some of its former and current contributors. Provides a list of editors and contributors who have become prominent in NZ and overseas."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "After hours"
description: "Visits the collection of the Pat Cotter Medical Trust at Hillmorton Hospital. Speaks to the retired Runanga-born surgeon about the collection of medical equipment and oddities."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Driver, 13, responsible for girl's death : coroner"
description: "Driver, 13, responsible for girl's death : coroner"

Author: "Savage, Jared"
Title: "Judge gives false-passport man a second chance"
description: "Judge gives false-passport man a second chance"

Title: "Daughters honour dead parents' memory"
description: "Daughters honour dead parents' memory"

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Adrift in limbo land"
description: "Looks at what life is like for those living in the city's red and orange zones nearly one year on from the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Speaks to Jackie Lilburne and Jane Diver from Retreat Road and Steve Pounsford from Halley Place about their experiences."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "Okains Bay proud of its past"
description: "Recounts a visit to the small community and the Okains Bay MaÃÑori and Colonial Museum. Speaks to the museum's founder, Murray Thacker."

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Dotcom's lavish life of parties and luxury"
description: "Dotcom's lavish life of parties and luxury"

Author: "Youde, Kate"
Title: "Around the world : ahead of schedule"
description: "Around the world : ahead of schedule"

Author: "Moore, Bill"
Title: "The vote : to merge or not to merge?; Both mayors to vie for top job"
description: "Reports on the Local Government Commission's position in the long-running debate about merging the Nelson City Council and Tasman District Council. Outlines the commission's recommendations to the new Nelson Tasman District Council if the merger goes ahead. Explains, briefly, that positions of Nelson mayor Aldo Miccio and Tasman mayor Richard Kempthorne."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "World records fall in Snell's stride"
description: "Looks back on Peter Snell's world record 800m race at Lancaster Park on 3 Feb 1962."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Life of a merchant sailor"
description: "Looks back on the life of the former British Merchant Navy sailor."

Author: "Van Den Bergh, Roeland"
Title: "Air NZ's Fyfe can 'write his own ticket'"
description: "Looks back at the achievements and profile of Air New Zealand chief executive Rob Fyfe as he announces his departure from the company after 7 years. Notes the current and financial outlook for the airline."

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "Airport build a boost for city"
description: "Speaks to Christchurch International Airport chief executive Jim Boult, who is also chairman of the Christchurch and Canterbury Tourism partnership, about the role of the airport in the region. Reports on the progress of the Christchurch International Airport's domestic terminal rebuild."

Author: "Smith, Tony"
Title: "Peerless Snell's Christchurch records still stand"
description: "Looks back on the feats of the middle-distance runner. Talks about his double world record 800m race at Lancaster Park on 3 Feb 1962."

Author: "Borrowdale, James"
Title: "Out in the cold"
description: "Visits Scott Base in Antarctica and speaks to a number of people with different jobs there. Reveals interesting similarities in the personalities of all the workers."

Author: "Enting, Carolyn"
Title: "Ageing with attitude"
description: "Speaks to four older style doyennes, including 90-year-old New York socialite Iris Apfel, about their personal styles."

Author: "MacDonald, Nikki"
Title: "Challenge of the unknown"
description: "Talks to a number of up-and-coming NZ scientists about their work - Natalie Plank, a nanoscientist, Christopher Hann, a mathematician, Rose Turnbull, a geologist, Bridget Stocker, a chemist, and Andrew Clarkson, a stroke researcher."

Author: "Anderson, Charles"
Title: "Whiz-kid sees hi-tech future for education"
description: "Whiz-kid sees hi-tech future for education"

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Battle of the planets"
description: "Investigates the row over the research that lead to the discovery of an Earth-like planet, OGLE-2005-BLG-169Lb, in 2006. Speaks to Masters student Stephen Swaving about why he quit the three-person University of Auckland research team that worked on a computer analysis of the discovery and the fallout from his allegations. Talks to University of Auckland Associate Professor Phil Yock about the claims that his research team manipulated results around the discovery. Backgrounds York's career, spotlighting his history of conflict at the University of Auckland. Explains, briefly, how microlensing works."

Title: "Theft of precious jacket leaves ice hockey rep 'violated'"
description: "Theft of precious jacket leaves ice hockey rep 'violated'"

Title: "Bound to succeed"
description: "Looks back on the history of the outdoor education organisation as it celebrates 50 years in NZ. Talks about how the organisation has attempted to adapt to the increasingly diverse needs of NZers."

Author: "Mackie, Emma"
Title: "Call of the sea"
description: "Speaks to some Project Jonah marine mammal medics about why they are willing to help rescue beached whales. Lists some facts about whale strandings in NZ. Outlines some dos and don'ts for saving stranded whales."

Author: "Newman, Georgina"
Title: "Bankers give small loans a bad name; Experts back microfinance"
description: "Looks at how NZ-funded microfinance project VisionFund Mongolia has helped Mongolians in extreme poverty. Talks, briefly, about ASB Bank director Jon Hartley's Bankers With Vision organisation. Outlines World Vision's NZ microfinance operation."

Author: "Leggat, David"
Title: "Selection doors open as Wright goes to Wells"
description: "Selection doors open as Wright goes to Wells"

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "What I do"
description: "Explains what it is like working as a caretaker at Otaki College."

Author: "Dickison, Michael"
Title: "Visa process keeps body in mortuary for weeks"
description: "Visa process keeps body in mortuary for weeks"

Title: "Bodies removed from air-crash site"
description: "Bodies removed from air-crash site"

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Endless love"
description: "Shares two stories of couples who were reunited after many years apart: 'Gwenda' and 'John' (originally from Greytown) and Greville Bartlett and Carmela Shortridge (originally from Whangarei)."

Author: "Murray, Sarah"
Title: "Old comfort"
description: "Looks at why some adults still sleep with soft toys. Speaks to fashion designer Emily Miller-Sharma and corporate acquisition manager Jodie Fitzgerald about their attachement to their childhood soft toys, and Auckland Dolls Hospital store manager about the wide variety of people who have their toys mended."

Title: "No one wants to be blamed: victim"
description: "No one wants to be blamed: victim"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Dad lay dying just kilometres from home"
description: "Dad lay dying just kilometres from home"

Title: "Coma soldier 'responding to whanau'"
description: "Coma soldier 'responding to whanau'"

Author: "Tapaleao, Vaimoana"
Title: "Soldier's worsening health sparks hospital transfer"
description: "Soldier's worsening health sparks hospital transfer"

Author: "Rae, Sally"
Title: "Property management traps aplenty; Property manager issues concern"
description: "Focuses on the dearth of regulations in the property management industry. Speaks to chartered accountant Averil Rodgers of Dunedin firm Keogh McCormack regarding its concerns about the lack of accountability in the industry and the implications for landlords and tenants. Seeks comment from other property managers."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Sins of the father"
description: "Focuses on the new book 'Trial by ambush : the prosecutions of David Bain', which sets out the case that the father committed the murders of five members of his family before committing suicide on 20 Jun 1994. Reports on the current review of the evidence by retired Canadian supreme court judge Ian Binnie to determine whether David Bain should be awarded compensation for wrongful conviction and imprisonment for 13 years. Provides a timeline of significant events in the trials of David Bain."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Not much chattering"
description: "Reports on comments made by some NZ academics about issues such as the Occupy movement, the trend in NZ and globally towards increasing income inequality, the financial crisis and the economy.  Cites research by Victoria University Management School senior lecturer Todd Bridgman about the relative lack of comment by universities on the global financial crisis. Comments on the attitudes of the public towards intellectuals and the media, and the need for more informed debate on the economy and more scrutiny of the causes and effects of the current financial crisis."

Title: "Stimulating physical, mental challenge"
description: "Interviews the conductor about the nature of his work. Comments on the skills required and recalls the most interesting/unusual concert he conducted."

Author: "Hyndman, Gwyneth"
Title: "Southern family mourn would-be missionary son"
description: "Southern family mourn would-be missionary son"

Author: "Harding, Evan"
Title: "Foveaux victim 'had a lot of character'"
description: "Foveaux victim 'had a lot of character'"

Title: "Taxi driver, 87, plans semi-retirement move"
description: "Taxi driver, 87, plans semi-retirement move"

Title: "'Ultimate endorsement' for Hotere"
description: "'Ultimate endorsement' for Hotere"

Author: "Leask, Anna,"
Title: "Christie's parents launching campaign to change bail law"
description: "Christie's parents launching campaign to change bail law"

Author: "Laxon, Andrew"
Title: "Five schools targeted in crackdown"
description: "Reports on a crackdown on the practices of a number of schools for foreign students, including immigration breaches, student cheating and reporting dubious qualifications. Outlines the findings of the NZ Qualifications Authority (NZQA) reports on Oxford International Academy, Ellipse Institute, St George Institute of Learning, Tasman International Academies."

Author: "Nissen, Wendyl"
Title: "Extra effort produces tasty, cruelty-free bangers"
description: "Analyses the ingredients of Heller's free farmed 'Country pork' sausages."

Author: "Taylor, Phil,"
Title: "Crash course"
description: "Looks at the issue of cyclist safety on Auckland's Tamaki Drive. Reviews the circumstances that led to the 2010 death of cyclist Jane Bishop at the Kelly Tarlton bend. Speaks to engineer and transport planner Bevan Woodward and Cycle Action Auckland spokeswoman Barbara Cuthbert about the issue. Lists the leading causes of Tamaki Drive crashes involving cyclists from 2003 to 2011."

Author: "Hewitson, Michele"
Title: "Rosanne Meo"
description: "Speaks to the high-profile businesswoman about the driving forces in her career and her family."

Author: "Marks, Kathy"
Title: "Turmoil for family as Kiwi pronounced dead after 32 years"
description: "Turmoil for family as Kiwi pronounced dead after 32 years"

Author: "Larsen, David"
Title: "Just use your imagination"
description: "Speaks to the Nelson-raised Weta Workshop artist about his career and the touring exhibition 'White cloud worlds - NZ science fiction and fantasy art'."

Author: "Rae, Bernadette"
Title: "Mau spreads it wings at home"
description: "Speaks to the choreographer about his aims and his 'Birds with skymirrors', which will be preformed at the 2012 NZ International Arts Festival (29 Feb and 1 Mar)."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Broom strokes worthy of marvel"
description: "Reviews 'By the river' by Elliot Collins at the Tim Melville Gallery (to 10 Mar), 'Tuileries' by Selina Foote at Sue Crockford's gallery (to 3 Mar) and 'Mt Maunganui paper suite' by John Blackburn at Artis Gallery (to 27 Feb)."

Author: "Gaynor, Brian"
Title: "Oz deal brings Chandler closer to home; Mega-rich NZer still taking risks"
description: "Tells the story of the Chandler family's business success. Reports on the investment by Richard Chandler in a Tasmanian forestry company."

Author: "Clark, David"
Title: "In search of a more equal society"
description: "Provides an edited transcript of the maiden speech in Parliament by the Dunedin North MP for the Labour Party."

Author: "Finch, Ged"
Author (detailed): "Ged Finch, Lewis Holvey and Madeline Dykes"

description: "Presents an essay on communication, a poem about war and a short story about an imaginary kingdom written by Dunstan High School pupils. Includes the artwork 'Tree of Life' by Year 13 art pupil Nadine Ward."

Author: "Bradley, Grant"
Title: "Rewards and risks in quest for oil; Heatley says oil search sensible"
description: "Reports on the uncertainty on the East Coast and other regions about the economic benefits of oil and gas exploration."

Author: "Smith, Charmian"
Title: "Holiday high jinks at Fortune"
description: "Talks to Wellington-based director Conrad Newport about the themes of the production 'The Motor Camp' by Dave Armstrong, Fortune Theatre, Dunedin, opening 18 Feb 2012."

Author: "Strachan, Franky"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Loosely based on a series of events that never actually happened', embroidered works by Jay Hutchinson, A Gallery, Dunedin, 18 Feb to 3 Mar 2012.  Reviews 'All along the clock tower' by Manu Berry and Jared Hunter Mason, The Artist's Room, Dunedin, from 18 Feb 2012.  Reviews 'Small summer paintings' by Angela Burns, Moray Gallery, Dunedin, until 25 Feb 2012."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry"
Title: "Family drama"
description: "Speaks to three well-known performers and their daughters about the qualities required to perform and why the children followed their parents into the profession."

Title: "Stepping back in time"
description: "Explores the history behind some of the city's street and suburb names."

Title: "Coroner ideas get lost or ignored"
description: "Reveals the findings of an investigation into coroners' recommendations for road improvements at fatal crash scenes."

Title: "Disgraced agent's drink-drive history"
description: "Disgraced agent's drink-drive history"

Author: "Blackstock, Russell"
Title: "Dead speedflyer a 'meticulous' pilot"
description: "Dead speedflyer a 'meticulous' pilot"

Author: "Phare, Jane"
Title: "Gossip girl"
description: "Speaks to the former 'Herald on Sunday' gossip columnist about her time on the gossip scene. Talks about the reaction to her 'Spy' column."

Author: "Morris, Chris"
Title: "Knox students petition faculties over changes; Hall's traditions help create student 'family'"
description: "Reports on the outcry from students and alumni over plans by the Presbyterian Church and the University of Otago to discontinue some college traditions such as initiation ceremonies and elitist symbols and to tighten rules regarding alcohol use. Talks to a second-year female student about the 'rites of passage'."

Author: "Johnson, Chloe"
Title: "Unkind to animals"
description: "Investigates the legal position of animals that are alleged to have been neglected or abused. Points out that the rights of the owners are protected but not those of their animals. Spotlights a number of cases, including that of 21 horses, five dogs, and two llamas the High Court has recently ordered to be returned to their owner, Anne Power, eight years after they were seized by the SPCA. Speaks to Auckland SPCA executive director Bob Kerridge about the slow process of animal welfare prosecutions under the Animal Welfare Act."

Author: "Lang, Sarah"
Title: "Pressure cooker"
description: "Speaks to the chef about his work and the third season of the television programme."

Author: "South, Gill"
Title: "Creative Sundays"
description: "Speaks to a number of people about their creative pastimes: flower arranging, quilting, knitting and sewing, scrapbooking, and preserving and cooking."

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Rates revolt; Roads, rates and rubbish"
description: "Announces a central government plan for the reform of local authorities, with the principle aim being to restrict the range of council activities, their ability to borrow, and their ability to keep raising rates. Speaks to Local Government Minister Nick Smith about why there is a need for reform of the sector and the restructuring process. Talks to Far North Mayor Wayne Brown and former Waitakere Mayor Bob Harvey about the reforms. Spotlights some councils with financial issues. Speaks to David Shand, who headed a wide-ranging 2007 rates inquiry, about the need for reform of local authorities. Highlights the findings from the Shand report."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Postcards from Christchurch"
description: "Considers the city's recovery one year after the devastating 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Tells the recovery stories of a number of residents: red-zoners Jenny and Allan Faulkner, and Regan and John Helsloot, community builder Marnie Kent, business owner Ange Leonard, artistic director Ross Gumbley, heritage owner and entrepreneur Alan Slade, and kiosk owner Ian Carter."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Christchurch one year on"
description: "Considers the city's recovery one year after the devastating 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Tells the recovery stories of a number of residents: red-zoners Jenny and Allan Faulkner, and Regan and John Helsloot, community builder Marnie Kent, business owner Ange Leonard, artistic director Ross Gumbley, heritage owner and entrepreneur Alan Slade, and kiosk owner Ian Carter."

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Report unflattering on NZ social policy; Report card"
description: "Examines the findings of the 'State of the Nation' report released by the Salvation Army on 16 Feb 2012, focusing on its findings on child poverty, neglect and abuse. Seeks comment from Dunedin Salvation Army Major Glenn Anderson. Includes the report card on six child health and welfare issues."

Author: "Crysell, Mark"
Title: "'I feel terribly, terribly badly'"
description: "Catches up with CTV building survivor one year on from the devastating 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks about his Japanese students who died when the building collapsed and the impact on their hometown, Toyama."

Author: "McKenzie, Hamish"
Title: "Homeward bound"
description: "Speaks to TVNZ's United States correspondent about how his 11 years in New York have changed him."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Karam tells one-sided story"
description: "Reviews the author's opinions about the Bain murder case in the light of Joe Karam's second book 'Trial by ambush' (2012), the first being 'David and Goliath' (1997). Notes pieces of evidence not commented on by Karam and presents different contexts and views for key pieces of evidence within the latest book."

Author: "Sisterson, Craig"
Title: "Out of exile"
description: "Speaks to the crime writer about his new novel, which has brought back Detective Sergeant Tito Ihaka after a 15-year hiatus."

Author: "Torrie, Bronwyn"
Title: "Transmission Gully process climbs paperwork mountain"
description: "Reviews the progress made so far by the Transmission Gully Board of Inquiry after one week of sitting. Notes those experts and organisation who have given evidence in the first week. Outlines the merits and negatives of the highway project presented thus far."

Author: "Alley, Elizabeth"
Title: "Red letter day"
description: "Considers the insight the new book of letters, which were selected and edited by Sarah Shieff, has provided into the life of the writer."

Author: "Horsley, Francesca"
Title: "Thinking with the body"
description: "Speaks to choreographer Lemi Ponifasio about the inspiration behind 'Birds with skymirrors', which will be preformed at the 2012 NZ International Arts Festival (29 Feb and 1 Mar)."

Author: "Oxenbridge, Faith"
Title: "Send in the Sondheim"
description: "Reviews the production of 'Side by side by Sondheim', at Court One, Christchurch (until 3 Mar)."

Author: "Stewart, Matt"
Title: "Fish : green protein or ecofriendly red herring?"
description: "Reports on the views of Professor Ray Hilborn, an American fisheries expert, about seeking alternative sources of protein to that which is sourced from the land. Presents Ray Hilborn's findings in a paper investigating the environmental cost of NZ food production. Also presents contrary findings contained in Forest & Birds's publication 'Best fish guide'. Discusses the 'ecofriendliness' of both land based and ocean sourced protein."

Author: "White, Margo"
Title: "The straight dope"
description: "Speaks to Katie Brennan from Victoria University of Wellington's School of Psychology, about why nicotine is not responsible for cigarette smoking addiction."

Author: "White, Xanthe"
Title: "Treasured tubers"
description: "Considers the work of plant collectors and breeders. Spotlights Keith Hammett's work with dahlias."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Inside CTV's collapse; 'A miracle has happened and I have not survived to abandon my dreams. More than ever it was a time to live now';"
description: "Describes the time leading up to, during and a short time after the February 22, 2011 Christchurch earthquake by some of those who worked in the Canterbury Television building."

Author: "Carville, Olivia"
Title: "Memories not as painful as vicious grief subsides; Dad and boys keep ech other going after mum lost"
description: "Speaks to two men, Steve Brown and Brett Chamber who lost their partners in the Pyne Gould Corporation building. Talks about how they are coping with the loss of their partner, the things they remember and how they just deal with one day at a time."

Author: "Donoghue, Tim"
Title: "Red Fred a unique character : a life story"
description: "Red Fred a unique character : a life story"

Author: "Kitchin, Peter"
Title: "58 years at the helm of 'Lands for bags'"
description: "58 years at the helm of 'Lands for bags'"

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Knockout director"
description: "Profiles Sara Brodie, theatre director, lists the works she has been involved with. Notes how her father inadvertently began her interest in theatre at the age of four."

Title: "'Proud' Ko claims Aust amateur title"
description: "'Proud' Ko claims Aust amateur title"

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "A world of her own"
description: "Talks to Lynley Dodd prior to her vist to Wellington for the Writers and Readers Week about the fame of the brand 'Hairy Maclary'. Describes some of the sources of inspiration that goes into writing her books and why they have been so popular."

Title: "Swim-school owner follows his dream to set up vienyard"
description: "Swim-school owner follows his dream to set up vienyard"

description: "Beach resort buzz has fresh Brunton just raring to go"

description: "Writer finds wood tells stories of its own"

Title: "Teenager dies after getting stuck in waterfall"
description: "Teenager dies after getting stuck in waterfall"

Author: "Kidd, Rob"
Title: "Tireless volunteer remained selfless till the end"
description: "Tireless volunteer remained selfless till the end"

Author: "Searle, Jamie"
Title: "Seven the lucky number for Christchurch's Pitman"
description: "Seven the lucky number for Christchurch's Pitman"

Author: "Long, David"
Title: "Cramp puts paid to Jones' hope of Classic success"
description: "Cramp puts paid to Jones' hope of Classic success"

Author: "Cardy, Tom"
Title: "Creative forces"
description: "Talks to up and coming artists, Lauren Gibson (actor), Shane McGrath (artist), T.J. McDonald (comedian) and Sacha Copland (choreographer and dancer) and discusses their potential and direction."

Author: "Hooton, Amanda"
Title: "Mother load"
description: "Looks at the pressure put on women about motherhood. Ascertains the views of French philosopher, Elisabeth Badinter, who has recently written 'Le conflit : la femme et la mere' (in English, 'The conflict : woman and mother'). Discussion focuses on the diet of women while pregnant, the diet of new born babies, and the working mum versus stay at home mum dilemma."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Welcome mat"
description: "Previews this year's NZ House & Garden Tours when homes and gardens will open their doors to the public. Notes homes and gardens will be open on the Kapiti Coast, Queenstown Lakes, Auckland and Canterbury to raise funds for the Cancer Society."

Author: "Barnett, Shaun"
Title: "The good old days"
description: "Describes the tramp and the hut, Old Manson Hut, Jason Roxburgh and Bruce Postill stayed in while tramping in the Kaweka Range, Hawke's Bay. Notes the hut's history, mentions it is constructed in the 'old style' which gives it much of its character."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Time traveller's wife"
description: "Recounts Christine Murray's experience of being inside the PGC building in Christchurch when the February 22 earthquake struck, how she was help out of the building and how her husband Stephen, eventually managed to locate her at Christchurch Hospital. Describes the museum they run and own (The Time Machine) which has items of popular culture memorabilia and nostalgia."

Author: "Agnew, Margaret"
Title: "Coming of age"
description: "Talks to Sarah Aspinall about how she and her husband, Martin became cheesemongers (French, affineurs). Describes how they do not make the cheese but buy cheese from the cheesemaker in order to store and mature the cheese in a controlled environment to bring the cheese to it's full potential. Indicates the French call it affinage, the skill of ripening and maturing cheese before selling it at its best."

Author: "Fitzsimons, Tom"
Title: "A world of her own"
description: "Talks to Lynley Dodd prior to her vist to Wellington for the Writers and Readers Week about the fame of the brand 'Hairy Maclary'. Describes some of the sources of inspiration that goes into writing her books and why they have been so popular."

Author: "Catherall, Sarah"
Title: "Welcome mat"
description: "Previews this year's NZ House & Garden Tours when homes and gardens will open their doors to the public. Notes homes and gardens will be open on the Kapiti Coast, Queenstown Lakes, Auckland and Canterbury to raise funds for the Cancer Society."

Author: "Wratten, Stephen D."
Title: "Audacious aubergine"
description: "Reveals the source of the author's eggplants when he is unable to grow his own, Ron Brooks, Opawa Market who happens to grow them hydroponically."

Author: "Madgin, Diana"
Title: "Fantastic clematis"
description: "Describes Alister Keay's interest in clematis which started in 1950 when he was apprenticed to the Christchurch Botanic gardens and under the tutelage of Huia Gilpin. Notes his interest was further fuelled by a Mr. W.S. Callick, a clematis hobbyist. Reveals how he expanded the number of clematis varieties by travelling between England, The Netherlands and NZ."

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "He was God's little ray of sunshine; The brave companion of a man who was doomed to die"
description: "Follows the experience of attempting to extricate Carey Bird from the much damaged Pyne Gould Corporation building after the Christchurch February earthquake. Tony McCormick who work in the PricewaterhouseCoopers building at the time of the February 22, 2011 Christchurch earthquake and finds himself helping out in that attempt."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Miracle under rubble; 'Oh my God, you are alive'"
description: "Describes the time leading up to, during and a short time after the February 22, 2011 Christchurch earthquake by some of those who worked in the Canterbury Television building."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "Cathedral was heart of the city"
description: "Assesses the importance of Christchurch Cathedral, gives its history and significance. Explains some of the stained glass designs and some of the other features within the cathedral."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Still less than convincing"
description: "Reviews the author's opinions about the Bain murder case in the light of Joe Karam's second book 'Trial by ambush' (2012), the first being 'David and Goliath' (1997). Notes pieces of evidence not commented on by Karam and presents different contexts and views for key pieces of evidence within the latest book."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Still waters that once ran deep"
description: "Talks of the time when Saltwater Creek, North Canterbury (in between Waikuku and Leithfield on Highway 1) was a township. Mentions Saltwater Creek was a port, at which formerly small vessels loaded and discharged cargo in the 1850s and 1860s. Backgrounds the families that were well known in the area and indicates the route of the railway, which ran through Sefton, sounded the death knell for Saltwater Creek."

Author: "Crean, Mike"
Title: "Pioneering work with dam a lasting legacy"
description: "Pioneering work with dam a lasting legacy"

Author: "Clifton, Jane,"
Title: "Tackling our rising rates"
description: "Announces a central government plan for the reform of local authorities, with the principle aim being to restrict the range of council activities, their ability to borrow, and their ability to keep raising rates. Speaks to Local Government Minister Nick Smith about why there is a need for reform of the sector and the restructuring process. Talks to Far North Mayor Wayne Brown and former Waitakere Mayor Bob Harvey about the reforms. Spotlights some councils with financial issues. Speaks to David Shand, who headed a wide-ranging 2007 rates inquiry, about the need for reform of local authorities. Highlights the findings from the Shand report."

Title: "David Horsley : the face on the Listener cover"
description: "Catches up with CTV building survivor one year on from the devastating 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks about his Japanese students who died when the building collapsed and the impact on their hometown, Toyama."

Title: "Paraplegic quake surviviors' lives tougher to rebuild"
description: "Paraplegic quake surviviors' lives tougher to rebuild"

Author: "Hueber, Andre"
Title: "Former POW returning to Japan for apology"
description: "Talks to the only survivor of a group of 76 Australian nurses who were prisoners of war for 18 months in Yokohama, Japan, beginning in Jul 1942. Recounts how they survived by 'living on their wits'. Informs that she is returning to Japan to receive an official apology from the government for her treatment."

Author: "Van Kempen, Lynda"
Title: "Gold festivities panning out to be year-long party; All trails lead to Cromwell as cavalcade turns 20; Events planned to mark the anniversary"
description: "Focuses on celebrations to mark the 150th anniversary of the Dunstan gold rush, including the annual Otago Goldfields Cavalcade. Backgrounds the events surrounding the discovery of gold in Aug 1862. Lists events from Feb 2012 through Mar 2013."

Author: "Smith, Nick"
Title: "Green business growing strong"
description: "Features the natural laundry and dish-cleaning products company. Chronicles the merger of the two family businesses started by the late entrepreneur in 1964, and talks to director Jamie Peters about its recent expansion into Australia and Asia."

Author: "Cannan, Dave"
Title: "Talented rose grower respected in community"
description: "Pays tribute to the late champion rose exhibitor who moved with his wife, Valerie Paul, from the Auckland region to Otago to enjoy the 'pace of life'. Traces his family background, life as a cattle breeder and keen sportsman, and his love of breeding roses."

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Picking up the pieces"
description: "Visits Christchurch a year after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake to report on the progress of the recovery effort. Talks to digger driver Craig Bugden about his work to demolish about 100 homes over the past year. Speaks to business administrator Diane Hale-Fielding, one of the few remaining residents in the suburb of Pacific Park, Bexley, about her experiences of the 4 Sep 2010  and the 22 Feb 2011 earthquakes. Presents his impressions of the desolation of the central business district. Seeks comment from Warwick Isaacs and Roger Sutton of the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA), landscape architect Di Lucas and Christchurch Central City Business Association manager Paul Lonsdale about opportunities presented by the rebuilding process. Talks to chef Karl Lau about the uncertainty he faces with his bed and breakfast establishment."

Author: "Newman, Sue"
Title: "'Normal' not the same as safe"
description: "Assesses the 'Is your drinking okay?' programme developed by the Alcohol Advisory Council of New Zealand (ALAC), aimed at helping people to understand the amount of alcohol they consume, why they consume it, the benefits, downsides and other risks. Reports on how she fared in assessing her own drinking patterns."

Author: "Williams, Ian,"
Title: "Survivors' perspective of Feb 22 quake poignant; Dark online elements of plot fail to quite hit spot"
description: "Survivors' perspective of Feb 22 quake poignant; Dark online elements of plot fail to quite hit spot"

Title: "The art of the unexpected"
description: "Anticipates the 2012 Dunedin Fringe Festival, various venues, 15-25 Mar 2012. Talks to director Paul Smith about some of the highlights of the largest festival yet, and lists his 'strategy for fun'."

Author: "Haggart, Matthew"
Title: "No point sweating the small stuff when in uncharted territory"
description: "Meets the Christchurch-raised events director for the Otago University Students' Association (OUSA). Comments on her role overseeing her first Orientation, or the '2012 Orientadium', which she describes as the 'biggest O-week in New Zealand ever', and the added challenges of being six months pregnant. Overviews her past employment experience in the UK and NZ."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "A messy existence"
description: "Talks to the psychologist, formerly of Dunedin, about his new television show aimed at exploring adult psychology, Sundays, TV One."

Author: "Meikle, Hayden"
Title: "'Final Fantasy' fun not fab"
description: "Reviews the game 'Final Fantasy XIII-2' from Square Enix, created for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360."

Author: "Somerville, Shona"
Title: "Stumping the Hump"
description: "Reports on their experience of completing the 'Stump the Hump' 24-hour challenge to walk the difficult 55km Hump Ridge Track near Tuatapere. Provides facts about the participants and the challenge."

Title: "Is nicotine getting a bad rap?"

Author: "Bayer, Kurt"
Title: "It was a miracle : survivor; Selfless actions saved 4 lives; [Christchurch - a year on]"
description: "Talks to the mother who was trapped after the CTV building collapsed in the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake about her 'miracle' rescue. Speaks to her rescuer, who she nominated for a Christchurch Earthquake Award for his valour, about rescuing her and three other people."

Author: "King, Caroline"
Title: "Saved woman's identity mystery to rescuer; [Christchurch - a year on]"
description: "Speaks to the North Canterbury contractor who rescued a woman from the CTV building after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Recounts how he nearly lost his own life when the earthquake struck while he was working on the Trinity Presbyterian Church, which had been damaged in the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake."

Title: "Sixty years of 'just plain luck'"
description: "Sixty years of 'just plain luck'"

Title: "Artist's world of inspiration; Hodgkins Fellow's world of inspiration"
description: "Speaks to the 2011 Frances Hodgkins Fellow about her experience at the University of Otago over the past year, after having spent the previous year on a 'pilgrimage' in Europe. Discusses the effect of these influences on her work, as well as the influence of Oriental art and miniatures that her father had collected and a two-month residency in Korea. Informs of her exhibition of gouaches, 'All things to all men', Hocken Gallery, Dunedin, 25 Feb-14 Apr 2012."

Author: "Dignan, James"
Title: "Art seen"
description: "Reviews 'Five new works, five old works' by Martin Thompson, Brett McDowell Gallery, Dunedin.  Reviews 'Debut', photography by Anneloes Douglas, Mint Gallery, Dunedin, until 1 Mar 2012.  Reviews 'Seeking sanctuary' by Clare Reilly, Gallery on Blueskin, Dunedin."

Title: "Following family's female tradition"
description: "Following family's female tradition"

description: "Centenarian looks back on 'wonderful life'"

Title: "Backing up mayor suits him fine"
description: "Backing up mayor suits him fine"

description: "Camp caretaker comfortable on site"

Title: "Ultimate satisfaction using traditional methods"
description: "Ultimate satisfaction using traditional methods"

Author: "Akuhata, Karla"
Title: "Gay teen wins scholarship for theatre studies"
description: "Gay teen wins scholarship for theatre studies"

Author: "Harvey, Sarah"
Title: "Parents prop up schools to the tune of $250m"
description: "Looks at the increasing amount of donations being given by school childrens' parents. Notes the donations are increasingly going to pay for the technology used in the classroom."

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "We'll close more buildings, say quake engineers"
description: "Reports building engineers are being more cautious in their inspection of damaged buildings in Christchurch in the light of information coming out of the royal commission. Comments on the time frame within which the engineers are having to make decisions about a building's structural integrity and the implications of being very conservative on the Christchurch rebuild."

Author: "Plumb, Simon"
Title: "Hill's crown jewel"
description: "Talks to Michael Hill about his strategy of creating a NZ golf tournament that will attract some of the best golfers in the world, NZ PGA Pro-Am Championship. Mentions the connections Hill has to potentially facilitate the success of this project, chairman of the Masters media committee Craig Heatley and John Hart, former All Blacks coach and NZ Warriors executive."

Author: "Hinton, Marc"
Title: "On a wing and a prayer"
description: "Talks to Russell Coutts about how the America's Cup is going to be a success despite the previous difficulties the competition has experienced. Promotes the San Francisco as a venue for its closeness of match racing to shore, a defined sailing course, nearly guaranteed winds and multi-hulled sailing boats. Comments on his relationship with Larry Ellison and the changes they have made to the racing of America's Cup.  Includes a chronicle of Coutt's sailing career."

Author: "Knight, Kim,"
Title: "What I do : James Taylor"
description: "Talks about the elements that need to be considered when framing an art work. Notes some past practices have affected the integrity of the artwork and briefly follows his career in picture framing."

Author: "Vance, Andrea"
Title: "Fears of pillage if ocean treasure chest unlocked"
description: "Overviews the legislation introduced in Jun 2011 to regulate activities associated with offshore drilling, seabed mining, marine farming and other exploitation of NZ's offshore resources. Lists the details of the legislation. Quotes estimates of the value of the oil and gas industries to NZ's economy. Speaks to Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment Dr Jan Wright about the 'serious flaws' she sees in the Bill. Cites concerns of environmentalists and MaÃÑori groups, as well as the views of the mineral, oil and gas industries."

Author: "Woulfe, Catherine"
Title: "Drive time"
description: "Talks to sexual-anthropologist Dr. Bella Ellwood-Clayton about women's sexual drive and discusses whether what is considered a low libido is a social construct but falls within the normal range of female desire. Examines some issues highlighted in the book with Mary Hodson a sex therapist and regional director of Sex Therapy New Zealand."

Author: "Cowlishaw, Shane"
Title: "U-turn : new give way laws aimed at saving lives; Drivers ready for change but panelbeaters lie in wait"
description: "Focuses on the new give way rules that will come into effect on 25 Mar 2012, aimed at reducing crashes at intersections. Speaks to Jenny Adair and her son Kelvin Adair, who were severely injured in 2009 when their car was hit by another vehicle at an intersection. Backgrounds the long-awaited changes and seeks comment from the Automobile Association (AA), the NZ Transport Agency (NZTA)  and the Wellington City Council about implementation issues, and touches on the likelihood of extra work for panel beaters. Speaks to two former Wellingtonians about their experiences of driving in Melbourne, and why the new NZ rule is better and will bring NZ in line with driving rules in the rest of the world. Talks to driving instructors and to now-retired NZTA senior traffic engineer Bob Gibson about their support of the new rule. Provides illustrations of the current rule and the new rule."

Author: "O'Callaghan, Jody"
Title: "Fat chance"
description: "Relates the stories of two women who had bariatric surgery in South Korea after having been rejected for taxpayer-funded obesity surgery in NZ. Provides facts about bariatric surgery. Includes comment from Whanganui surgeon Clive Solomon and Associate Health Minister Tariana Turia. Cites findings of an academic review by University of Otago graduate Dr Shuichi Suetani and seeks comment from the Ministry of Health about its policy on bariatric surgery."

Author: "McLeod, Rosemary"
Title: "The end of the affair"
description: "Asks the question 'Did women's liberation kill romantic love?'."

Author: "O'Callaghan, Jody"
Title: "He breathes life into aliens and monsters"
description: "Interviews the animation supervisor with Weta Digital about his work and leisure activities. Informs that he and three colleagues have been nominated for an Academy Award for visual effects for their work on the film 'The Rise of the Planet of the Apes'."

Author: "Watson, Mike"
Title: "Steam power station boss loved 'bubbling, gurgling baby'"
description: "Steam power station boss loved 'bubbling, gurgling baby'"

Author: "Gibson, Eloise"
Title: "Top models"
description: "Examines the used car market, focusing on the factors that make a car popular and when to buy or sell. Seeks advice from Hamish Wilson of Consumer.org.nz, Ian Stronach of the MTA, Todd Hunter of Turners auction house and Terry Williams-King of Autotrader. Lists the five most popular cars by make and/or make and model in several categories, based on information from the Consumer NZ survey 2011."

Author: "Kilgallon, Steve"
Title: "Street legal"
description: "Investigates NZ's growing homeless population and represents the opinions of various people involved in looking after the homeless particularly their view of the Government's response to this problem. Canvases the views of the Minister for Housing New Zealand."

Author: "Dekker, Diana"
Title: "Trash or treasure?"
description: "Talks to the artist about the sculptures she fashions from rubbish, much of which she collects from the Southern Landfill recycling centre where she works part time. Overviews her career and talks about her newly installed sculptures outside of Te Papa."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Hammer time"
description: "Profiles the Canterbury-raised coach of the Wellington Hurricanes. Talks about his playing career in Canterbury and as an All Black, and seeks comment from his older sister, Shelly Sydney. Comments on why he has come back for another season with the Hurricanes despite a disappointing season last year."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "Settling down"
description: "Meets the Waikato-raised human rights lawyer who has returned to NZ after a decade in working in conflict zones in the Gaza Strip, East Timor and Afghanistan. Talks about some of the complex situations she faced and the role of yoga and meditation in coping with an acute stress condition. Provides publishing details of the book she has written."

Author: "Cooper, Tracey"
Title: "Now that's a country tour"
description: "Speaks to the guitarist who featured in the 1980s television show 'That's Country'. Talks about his decision not to participate in the 13-centre reunion tour and recalls some of the highlights of the TV show. Seeks comment from Ray Columbus and others about his abilities as an entertainer. Provides details about the 'That's Country' tour."

Author: "Packer, Ann,"
Title: "Open to friends"
description: "Talks to David and Jeremy, owners of a 1904 Mt Victoria villa, who will be opening their home to the 'Friends of the Festival' fundraising tours for a record 11th (and last) time. Describes the process of renovating the home and some of the celebrities and other influential people who have visited over the years."

Author: "Bennett, Sarah,"
Title: "All downhill on old pack track"
description: "Reports on her experience of riding the Rameka Track, a 20-kilometre mountain bike trail. Backgrounds Project Rameka, developed by Wellingtonians Jonathan Kennett and Bronwen Wall."

Author: "Macdonald, Nikki"
Title: "Odd bods make the call"
description: "Speaks to the German-born author about the plot of her latest novel and the background research she undertook in Yorkshire, England."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"

description: "Talks to Conrad Coleman about his passion for ocean sailing and who is presently sailing in the Global Ocean Race. Reluctantly recalls an incident when off the coast of the South Island his co-skipper was washed over-board by a large wave without a life jacket."

Author: "Steward, Ian"
Title: "Food miles"
description: "Describes the author's trip from Christchurch to Queestown. Highlights some of the pleasurable stops they had along the way."

description: "Comments on the seemingly ruthless demolition decisions of local heritage villas in Auckland by its council."

description: "Dear Dot I must tell you by Keith Scott review"

Title: "Interview : Nigel Latta"
description: "Talks to TV psychologist Nigel Latta about his upcoming new series."

Title: "Interview : Jeremy Waldron"
description: "Debates the right to freedom of speech with the right to freedom from harm. Defines the meaning of freedom from harm - taken from the Human Rights Act. Considers the USA First Amendment. Revisits media controversies that have tested free speech such as Paul Henry's comments about Indians, and Michael Law's swipes at journalists."

Title: "Interview : Richard Bradford"
description: "Discusses the writing and of Martin Amis: the biography with the author Richard Bradford. Reveals how Bradford was originally commissioned to write the book but later the work became unauthorised."

Title: "Kosher Kiwis"
description: "Reflects on the contribution of the Jewish community to NZ which has largely been invisible. Traces their history from their first arrival in and throughout NZ. Notes the marked change in the number of Jews in NZ with the rise of Nazism in Germany and the reception they received. Notes the impact of mid-20th century Jewish refugees has been vast. Edited extract of 'Jewish lives in New Zealand : a history' edited by Leonard Bell and Diana Morrow."

Author: "Laugesen, Ruth"
Title: "The overpaid executive"
description: "Highlights the top salaries of some chief executives and directors and suggests they are excessive and greedy. Mentions recent protests against corporate pay such as the $68,000 pay rise awarded to city council chief executive in Christchurch. Discusses the unfair distribution of wealth. Spotlights pay rates in various occupations and how they have increased in recent years. Questions the worth of expensive CEOs."

Author: "Bowden, Jennifer"
Title: "Restaurants should provide nutrition information"
description: "Calls for nutritional information to be available at fast food outlets on the menu boards or in brochures on the counter so that customers can make healthy choices before they purchase."

description: "Debates what the future may hold for the South Island and the North Island emphasising that viable industrial growth depends on the clustering together of industries."

description: "In the absence of heroes by Anthony McCarten review"

Notes they are charged with participation in an organised criminal group."

Talks about the current row over the CCC leadership. Speaks to CCC CEO Tony Marryatt about the ongoing agitation against his reappointment."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Rate of departure abates; Life becomes normal but effects are lasting; Family ties convince couple to stay; [Christchurch - a year on]"
description: "Examines life in the city one year after the devastating earthquake on 22 Feb 2011. Provides statistics showing that the rate of departure from the city has slowed. Talks to two families about their respective decisions to leave and remain in Christchurch."

Title: "The voice of cricket in Canterbury and more"
description: "Pays tribute to the cricket commentator."
