description: "Friend and supporter of the Laura Fergusson Trust"

Title: "Top models : what used car should I buy?"
description: "Examines the used car market, focusing on the factors that make a car popular and when to buy or sell. Seeks advice from Hamish Wilson of Consumer.org.nz, Ian Stronach of the MTA, Todd Hunter of Turners auction house and Terry Williams-King of Autotrader. Lists the five most popular cars by make and/or make and model in several categories, based on information from the Consumer NZ survey 2011."

Author: "Reid, Neil"

description: "Talks to the former Olympian about the how organisers of homegrown adventure sports are getting bogged down by ever-increasing bureaucracy and red tape. Includes biographical information."

Title: "Smart thinking on how to engage students; Iced tea aids burger victory, Students encouraged to seek help early; New store gives students flying start; [Orientation 2012]"
description: "Focuses on various aspects of Orientation Week, University of Otago, Dunedin, Feb 2012. Talks to the association dean, education at the College of Education about his work to help develop 'bite-sized M-learning' (mobile learning) video clips that can be played on smartphones and other mobile devices. Provides other facts about the growth in mobile learning (M-learning). Talks to the winner of the 'Fresher of the Year' contest run by the Otago University Students Association (OUSA).  Speaks to OUSA student support centre manager Matt Tucker, who encourages students to seek help early if they have any problems, and describes the role and activities of the centre. Informs that a new Student Flights Dunedin store is opening, backed by Flight Centre (NZ)."

Author: "Lawton, Aaron"
Title: "NZC looks at big restructuring to domestic game"
description: "Discusses the current and possible future structure of domestic cricket in NZ."

Author: "Napier, Liam"
Title: "Empire building"
description: "Looks at the success of the Crusaders over the last 16 years and how they have gone about securing players from others provinces. Lists the imported players since 1996. Highlights the overall statistics of the team. Discusses some of the current players and the difference between last year and this year with reference to the effects of the earthquakes."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Mother's worry realised in son's death"
description: "Mother's worry realised in son's death"

Author: "Woodcock, Fred"
Title: "Little Miss Sunshine"
description: "Talks to golfer Lydia Ko, two days out from the start of the NZ Women's Open, about her new prominence after becoming the youngest winner of a professional tournament. Reflects back on her career so far, including when she started golf and her relationship with coach Guy Wilson."

Author: "Roy, Eleanor Ainge"
Title: "Through a soldier's eyes"
description: "Visits NZ's official war artist at his workshop at Shelly Bay in Wellington. Talks about his path into the army, his artistic career, his life in the army as a war artist, and his deployments overseas. Highlights his painting technique."

Author: "Berry, Michael"
Title: "City's rebirth begins; Building foundations over top : developer"
description: "Reports on why few commercial landowners are rebuilding in the city at present. Speaks to a number landowners, including developer Richard Diver, preschool teacher Joanna Beadle, Ferry Oak Properties Richard Peebles, and Edgeware SuperValue owner Stephen Anderson, about their frustrations and plans, and to Christchurch City Council earthquake building services manager Ethan Stetson about why some commercial building consents have been delayed. Talks to Consortium Construction foreman Shayne Chilton and Ferry Oak Properties developer Richard Peebles about the heavily strengthened and reinforced foundations for the new building on the corner of Moorhouse Avenue and Montreal Street."

Author: "Palmer, Geoff"
Title: "Search me"
description: "Explains some of the different search techniques to use to find exactly what you want on internet search engines."

Title: "Just like honey"
description: "Meets the winners of Cuisine's 2012 Artisan Awards, including J Friend and Co who took out the top award for its pohutukawa honey."

Author: "Cropp, Amanda,"
Title: "Canterbury quake : one year on; My year of living warily"
description: "Writes of life in post-earthquake Christchurch and Sumner and the emotional aspects of earthquake recovery. Looks at some of the events and government processes that have become part of the 'anger and depression' recovery stage. Discusses the importance of recognising the gains along with the pains. Includes part of a timeline of events."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Canterbury quake : one year on; Staying alive"
description: "Meets manager James Meharry and partner Karyn South, owners of the radio station RDU98.5FM in Christchurch. Talks about their experiences in the Feb 2011 earthquake and how they turned a horse truck into a mobile radio station and got their business back up and running. Includes part of a timeline of events."

Author: "Gilchrist, Shane"
Title: "A matter of degrees"
description: "Talks to the University of Canterbury bachelor of arts (BA) graduate, now a teacher at Rongotai College, about her new book for undergraduates to advise on the benefits of studying for a BA degree. Lists some of her pieces of advice. Cites statistics about the cost and monetary value of gaining a tertiary qualification."

Title: "Orchids' naming not quite 'done thing'"
description: "Orchids' naming not quite 'done thing'"

Author: "Cairns, Lois"

description: "Talks to David and Jeanette Beaumont, who lost their adopted son Matt when the CTV building collapsed, about their last memories of him. Includes part of a timeline of events."

description: "Meets the couple who have established a protected block of native bush on their sheep farm in the Otago Peninsula, after seeing an advertisement several years ago from the Dunedin City Council (DCC) that it would help fund biodiversity projects on private land. Pays a visit to Nick Scott and Stephanie Scott, who have fenced some of their Merton farm for planting of native species this autumn. Seeks comment from DCC senior planner Debbie Hogan about the importance of the Dunedin Biodiversity Fund to biodiversity protection, and lists facts about the fund."

description: "Describes the sound that accompanied the Christchurch earthquakes and the above-ground results of the shockwaves colliding. Explains what Christchurch sounds like now with the various rebuilding work that is being done. Includes part of a timeline of events."

Discussion focuses on the diet of women while pregnant, the diet of new born babies, and the working mum versus stay at home mum dilemma."

Refers to the findings of Hillel Alpert in the journal 'Tobacco control'. Speaks to Karen Evison, the Health Ministry's head of tobacco control, and University of Auckland Associate Professor Chris Bullen, about the effectiveness of NRT. Title: "Oil & gas may save the day; Methanex 1 out of mothballs"
description: "Writes how, with the economy under serious attack, we need to look to our best prospects and the potential for oil and gas exploration and development is hard to ignore. Looks at the high potential value and the Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) legislation. Title: "Mike Puru"
description: "Speaks to the Edge morning radio jock about his life and career. Talks about why he invited Prime Minister John Key to his same-sex engagement party."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Sex in the suburbs"
description: "Focuses on public concern about suburban brothels, especially Soobs (small owner-operated brothels where no more than four people work). Highlights the example of Firecats Escorts in Brown Street, Ponsonby, Auckland. Points to issues with the way councils and other agencies have dealt with the Prostitution Reform Act, which made it clear that councils could use bylaws and land zoning controls to guide the location of brothels."

Author: "Cumming, Geoffrey"
Title: "Hauraki pains"
description: "Reports on the attempt to fix colonial injustices for Hauraki MaÃÑori (NgaÃÑi Tai ki Tamaki, Ngti Hako, NgaÃÑti Hei, NgaÃÑti Maru, NgaÃÑti Paoa, NgaÃÑti Porou ki Hauraki, NgaÃÑti Pukenga, NgaÃÑti Rahiri Tumutumu, NgaÃÑti Tamatera, NgaÃÑti Tara Tokanui, NgaÃÑti Whanaunga, and Te Patukirikiri). Gives an insight into the margarnalisation of Hauraki iwi, as detailed in a 2006 report from the Waitangi Tribunal. Lists what Hauraki iwi want from their Treaty of Waitangi claim."

Author: "Cheng, Derek"
Title: "Party political broadcaster"
description: "Profiles the National Party staffer who also sits on the board of NZ On Air. Points to concerns about a conflict of interest."

Author: "McNamara, T. J."
Title: "Careful avoidance of pleasure can cause pain"
description: "Reviews 'So tired' by Campbell Patterson and 'Balls deep' by Imogen Taylor at the Michael Lett Galleries (to 26 Feb), 'Paintings' by Lisa Rayner at Whitespace (until 11 Feb), 'Point of reference' by Tracey Walker at Sanderson Contemporary Art (until 5 Feb), and 'Central Otago' by Grahame Sydney at Artis (until 5 Feb)."

Author: "Christian, Dionne"
Title: "Camping, the great leveller"
description: "Speaks to writer Dave Armstrong about his latest play, 'The motor camp', which is founded partly on his own memories of camping. Talks about the Auckland Theatre Company's version at Maidment Theatre, 9 February to 3 March."

Author: "Johannsen, Dana"
Title: "Skeleton silver caps 10 years of effort"
description: "Skeleton silver caps 10 years of effort"

Author: "Adams, Christopher"
Title: "Derailing the world's corporate gravy train; Kiwis eye UK bid to rein in pay"
description: "Points to super-sized executive salaries, bonuses and golden handshakes being questioned across the western world. Looks at the situation in NZ. Talks about the New Zealand Shareholders' Association's interest in the progress of proposed regulations put forward by the British Government to rain in excessive executive pay."

Author: "Clement, Diana"
Title: "Way to grow"
description: "Spotlights 10 major ecosystem restoration projects currently underway in the city."

Author: "Dixon, Greg"
Title: "Looking for Guyon"
description: "Speaks to the investigative journalist about why he left politics and TVNZ for TV3. Talks about his career and life, including his upcoming marriage to Emma Wehipeihana."

Author: "Hill, Rebecca Barry"
Title: "Dancing downunder"
description: "Speaks to the new artistic director of the Royal New Zealand Ballet (RNZB). Talks about his career and what he will bring to the RNZB position."

Author: "Robinson, Michelle"
Title: "Quake turmoil for anxious migrants"
description: "Quake turmoil for anxious migrants"

Author: "Reid, Neil"
Title: "Ailing mum the focus for rugby's newest knight"
description: "Ailing mum the focus for rugby's newest knight"

Author: "Russell, Nicola"
Title: "Plenty of heart"
description: "Speaks to the Heart Attack Alley frontwoman about the blues stomp band and her music."
